description: An ANC supporter who was shot by a named Special Constable at Rocky Hill disco hall in Jansenville, Cape, on 23 June 1990, during a stayaway in the area. He died the following day in Livingstone hospital, Port Elizabeth.

name: Bafikile Beauty Gubhela
description: Her home was burnt down by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1993 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Siphosenkosi Gudasi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Dassenhoek, Pinetown, Natal, on 14 November 1991.

name: Sishiqi Miles Gudle
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted and detained for three months at Bizana, Transkei, in June 1960 during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Mabandla Amos Dube
description: A student at Esikhawini who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 1 April 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Students from tertiary institutions were being targeted by IFP members.

name: Mabandla Amos Dube
description: A student at Esikhawini who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 1 April 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Students from tertiary institutions were being targeted by IFP members.

name: Irene Madomizana Gule
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by IFP supporters at Umlazi, Durban, on 30 April 1992, during political conflict in the area. Her husband and two year old son were both shot and injured in the attack.

name: Isaac Gule
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters at Umlazi, Durban, on 30 April 1992, during political conflict in the area. His wife was shot dead and his two year old son shot and injured in the attack.

name: Nkosinathi Emmanuel Gule
description: His home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, in 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Petros Mafika Gule
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Anna Gumbi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Gezephi Gumbi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Josephine Gumbi
description: Her house was destroyed in an arson attack in March 1992 in the Empevu area, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Khalelani Doris Gumbi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Munto Herbert Gumbi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death and had his body set alight by IFP supporters at Amanzimtoti, Natal, on 15 August 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Nkululeko Rodderick Zi Gumbi
description: Was abducted by unidentified persons and later decapitated in Umlazi, Durban, on 5 March 1992, allegedly because he refused to join the ANC.

name: Nokwazi Freida Gumbi
description: An ANC supporter who was injured when AWB members detonated a car bomb in Bree Street, Johannesburg, on 24 April 1994, in an effort to disrupt the electoral process. Seven people were killed and thirteen injured in the blast. Two perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342). See right-wing attacks.

name: Nomacala Rosy Gumbi
description: An ANC member and chairperson of a Soweto street committee since 1978 who was arrested in Diepkloof, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 15 October 1986 during the state of emergency and detained for fourteen days without charge in Sun City prison.

name: Ntombizethu Verah Zethu Gumbi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 2 August 1992 when armed men wearing balaclavas attacked several homes in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Peterson Maviyo Gumbi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by two IFP supporters at Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 January 1993, in political conflict in the area.

name: Phumlani Brian Gumbi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in a drive-by shooting at Ladysmith, Natal, on 8 March 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sibongile Anna Gumbi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Agrineth Gugu Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 11 September 1992 when armed gunmen attacked a number of homes believed to belong to ANC supporters at Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Six people were killed and several houses burnt down. At least four of those killed were from the Gumede family. Surviving members of the family believe it was targeted because one member refused to participate in an IFP night camp.

name: Alfred Dumile Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by an IFP supporter on 16 April 1994 and died the following day in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Alfred Dumile Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by an IFP supporter on 16 April 1994 and died the following day in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Alvinia Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Anthony George Gumede
description: Was shot and severely injured in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 5 July 1993 when IFP supporters allegedly attacked a funeral procession, during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Bafana Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death when his home was attacked by named IFP supporters in Ekwazini, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 8 July 1990. Other family members were injured in the attack and at least one other person was killed.

name: Bantu Hamilton Gumede
description: Was one of eight passengers shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Six other passengers were shot dead. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Beauty Jabu Gumede
description: Her home was burnt down by IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 23 January 1991 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bhekani Simon Gumede
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, in June 1991, during ongoing political conflict. The perpetrators opened fire on a group of people as they were talking with a well-known ANC supporter.

name: Bhekitshe Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by named IFP supporters posing as policemen and was later shot, hacked, and burnt to death on 6 August 1990 in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. Conditions at Ndwedwe during this period were marked by severe intimidation, politically motivated killings and arson attacks, which caused families to flee the area in large numbers.

name: Bhekizenzo Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters in Manzimnyama, KwaMbonambi, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 9 July 1993.

name: David Fixon Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Dinwabembona Mnyakamelwa Gumede
description: Was one of six passengers shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Eight other passengers were injured. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Doris Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 5 September 1992.

name: Gcina Shepherd Gumede
description: Was stabbed and severely injured by named ANC supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 28 January 1990 in intensifying conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Gertrude Gumede
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack in Eshowe, Natal, on 29 December 1993, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Gleynroux Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was paralysed after being shot in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 11 May 1992 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Hlebani Thembisile Gumede
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Hlengiwe Bawinile Gumede
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1993, in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Hlengiwe Cihi Gumede
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters before the April 1994 elections.

name: Hlengiwe Cihi Gumede
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters before the April 1994 elections.

name: James Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by named IFP supporters at Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 May 1991. Three people died in the attack, and another was injured.

name: Jane Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by named IFP supporters at Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 May 1991. Three people died in the attack, and another was injured.

name: Jeanette Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters at Umlazi, Durban, on 2 February 1991.

name: Jimson Mfukeni Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 11 September 1992 when armed gunmen attacked a number of homes believed to belong to ANC supporters at Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Six people were killed and several houses burnt down. At least four of those killed were from the Gumede family. The family believes that it was targeted because a member refused to participate in an IFP night camp.

name: Joseph Khetheyakhe Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bhobhoyi, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 December 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Joyce Jabu Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 11 September 1992 when armed gunmen attacked a number of homes believed to belong to ANC supporters at Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Six people were killed and several houses burnt down. At least four of those killed were from the Gumede family. The family believes that it was targeted because a member refused to participate in an IFP night camp.

name: Justice Mandla Gumede
description: Was one of eight passengers shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Six other passengers were shot dead. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Khethiwe Gumede
description: Her house was burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1993 in intensifying conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Khulekani Cyril Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and stabbed to death by other ANC supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 December 1993 during a serious internal feud in the organisation.

name: Leah Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down and her property stolen by IFP supporters in Ogunjini, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 May 1993.

name: Mandlakayise Joe Gumede
description: Was shot and injured and had his house burnt down by named IFP supporters at Groutville, Stanger, Natal, on 25 April 1994, two days before the April 1994 elections. Mr Gumede, who had recently arrived in the area, was targeted because he was thought to be an ANC supporter.

name: Mandlakayise Joe Gumede
description: Was shot and injured and had his house burnt down by named IFP supporters at Groutville, Stanger, Natal, on 25 April 1994, two days before the April 1994 elections. Mr Gumede, who had recently arrived in the area, was targeted because he was thought to be an ANC supporter.

name: Mandlenkosi Gumede
description: An ANC supportern who died of severe burn wounds after his house was petrol-bombed by named ANC supporters in Adams Mission, near Durban, on 22 March 1990. Mr Gumede had reportedly been labelled an IFP supporter and a witchdoctor.

name: Dingaan Fini
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by another named ANC supporter at Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 October 1992, because he was believed to be an IFP sympathiser. His wife was injured in the attack, and his daughter burnt to death.

name: Mantombi Dludla
description: Was shot dead and her body burnt by IFP supporters in Emakwanyaneni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 12 February 1994 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Three other family members were also shot dead and their bodies burnt in the attack.

name: Mandla Mkhonyiseni Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death by named IFP supporters in Nhlangakazi forest, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 31 December 1993. Conditions at Ndwedwe in this period were marked by severe intimidation, politically motivated killings and arson attacks, causing families to flee the area in large numbers.

name: Phumzile Fini
description: An ANC supporter whodied fro m gunshot wounds and burns sustained in an arson attack on her home by named ANC supporters at Ngwelezane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 October 1992. Ms Fini’s family members were believed to be IFP supporters.

name: Mandlakayise Ahazie Dube
description: Was shot dead on his way to work near Eshowe, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mandlakayise Ahazie Dube
description: Was shot dead on his way to work near Eshowe, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Gordon Gobodo
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned and fatally stabbed, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Vosloorus, Transvaal, in August 1991.

name: Kwenza Robert Dumakude
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP members outside his home near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 September 1992. Mr Dumakude’s wife was also stabbed and injured in the attack.

name: Mhlaliseni Gerald Dludla
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 14 March 1992 when IFP supporters carried out attacks in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, following a mass IFP funeral. The local chief allegedly refused permission for the family to bury him in the area.

name: Mbokode Bhekizwe Dube
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Msawenkosi Dludla
description: An ANC supporter whose house was petrol-bombed by IFP supporters in Emakwanyaneni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 12 February 1994. Four family members were shot dead and their bodies burnt in the attack.

name: Delani Richard Gcaba
description: Was one of six passengers shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Eight other passengers were injured. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Ntombizini Beauty Dumakude
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured by IFP supporters at her home in Empangeni, Natal, on 25 September 1992. Ms Dumakude’s husband was killed in the attack.

name: Mgcineni Dube
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 May 1994, in political conflict following the first democratic election in April 1994.

name: Mgcineni Dube
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 May 1994, in political conflict following the first democratic election in April 1994.

name: Manozi Bukisiwe Gumede
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 October 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ntombifuthi Dludla
description: Was shot dead and her body burnt by IFP supporters in Emakwanyaneni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 12 February 1994 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Three other family members were also shot dead and their bodies burnt in the attack.

name: Ntombini Dludla
description: Was shot dead and her body burnt by IFP supporters in Emakwanyaneni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 12 February 1994 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Three other family members were also shot dead and their bodies burnt in the attack.

name: Rebecca Fini
description: An ANC supporter who was injured in an attack on her home by a named ANC supporter in Empangeni, Natal, on 31 October 1992. The family was allegedly suspected of supporting the IFP.

name: Mirriam Khumbuleni Dube
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Maqhawe Gordon Gumza Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on two occasions by other ANC supporters, in Pietermaritzburg, first in 1991, and then in 1993, allegedly during the course of serious internal conflict in the organisation.

name: Sanele Emmanuel Dludla
description: Was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 5 May 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Simon Gcaba
description: An ANC supporter who had his home and possessions burnt in an arson attack by IFP supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, in April 1991.

name: Nozipho Daphney Gabela
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thokozani Petros Dludla
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters near Estcourt, Natal, in 1992.

name: Mqashelwa William Dube
description: His house was burnt down by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 31 March 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mbongani Vincent Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 26 July 1993 in Umlazi, Durban, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nozipho Daphney Gabela
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Msizi Harrison Dube
description: An ANC supporter and Joint Rent Action Committee (JORAC) member who was shot dead by named perpetrators while returning home from a meeting in Lamontville, Durban, on 25 April 1983 during a bus boycott. The perpetrators were convicted and sentenced for this crime.

name: Zakhele Jerome Gcaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by unidentified persons in a pre-dawn attack on a home in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 April 1993. See Murchison attacks.

name: Msombuluko Dube
description: His house was vandalised and his possessions stolen at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 April 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Mr Dube had already lost one house in an earlier arson attack.

name: Dilizumbondo Petros Mansuet Dlulisa
description: His house and belongings were destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Ixopo, Natal, during July 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Zeblon Veni Gcaba
description: Was stabbed and injured by named IFP supporters in Bhomela, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 December 1990. Allegedly he did not attend IFP meetings and was thought to be an ANC supporter.

name: Sibonelo Cyril Gabela
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mbongeni Gumede
description: A counsellor to a local IFP-supporting chief who was shot and killed by an ANC member on 29 February 1992 in Mtunzini, Natal. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1997/0037).

name: Mtholeni Zeblon Dube
description: Was shot and killed on 19 May 1993 when the vehicle in which he was travelling was ambushed at the Mangezi Reserve, near the University of Zululand at Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mbongeni Gumede
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead at his home by a named ANC supporter at Mkolokohlo Reserve, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 February 1992.

name: Mzungezeni Dube
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and beaten to death by fellow IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 17 April 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Dube was suspected of having ANC sympathies.

name: Mzungezeni Dube
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and beaten to death by fellow IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 17 April 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Dube was suspected of having ANC sympathies.

name: Xolisile Precious Dlungwane (Nzimande)
description: Was severely injured when named IFP supporters attacked her home on 8 March 1991 at Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal. The attackers were looking for her uncle, an ANC supporter. One family member was killed in the attack; two others were severely injured. The perpetrators were sentenced to fifteen years’ imprisonment.

name: Mduduzi Gumede
description: Was stabbed and shot dead by named IFP supporters at his home at Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 February 1991. His family members were known to be ANC members.

name: Anna Mildred Dlungwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at her home in Umzinto, Natal, on 17 June 1992 by IFP supporters posing as policemen.

name: Grace Goji
description: Her home was burnt down in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Durban in 1991.

name: Nobantu Elsie Dumela
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home and belongings in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 15 June 1993.

name: Ntombizanele Mavis Gongwane
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in December 1993, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sifiso Goqo
description: Was killed by IFP supporters in Greytown, Natal, on 25 June 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. He was with two friends when they were attacked, allegedly in a dispute over territorial control in the area.

name: Wellington Mongezi Govana
description: A supporter of Witdoeke vigilante leader Johnson Ngxobongwana who lost his home when it was burnt down in Crossroads, Cape Town, in 1990, by supporters of Jeffrey Nongwe, a former Witdoek member who had changed allegiance to the ANC.

name: Siphiyo Johannes Gqadu
description: An ANC supporter who was detained and tortured, together with another ANC supporter, in Bethulie, Orange Free State, in October 1990. Both were charged with intimidation for allegedly forcing the children of police and government employees to leave school. They were both acquitted of the charges.

name: Nomasomi Gqirana (Nanze)
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack by named perpetrators in Stutterheim, Cape, on 29 September 1992 during political conflict over the reimposition of the headman system.

name: Mongameli Gqirana
description: An ANC member from Port Elizabeth who was imprisoned for fifteen years on Robben Island in 1963. In February 1983 he disappeared during a trip to Maseru, Lesotho.

name: Frederick Bafana Makara Gqola
description: An ANC member in the Transkei who was imprisoned for nine years on Robben Island, Cape Town, from 17 December 1964. He was again detained and tortured in 1980 and 1986. On 27 January 1987, Mr Gqola was detained on suspicion of harbouring ANC operatives and was tortured by Transkei police while in detention at the Norwood security offices in Umtata.

name: Frederick Bafana Makara Gqola
description: An ANC member in the Transkei who was imprisoned for nine years on Robben Island, Cape Town, from 17 December 1964. He was again detained and tortured in 1980 and 1986. On 27 January 1987, Mr Gqola was detained on suspicion of harbouring ANC operatives and was tortured by Transkei police while in detention at the Norwood security offices in Umtata.

name: Esther Esi Grant
description: Was forced out of her home in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 15 March 1992, during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Evictions of residents from their homes was a tactic used by both parties during the political violence which engulfed the Transvaal in the early 1990s.

name: Khanyile Catherine Greave
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death on 4 December 1991 when IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers attacked ANC supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Ngenzeleni Agnes Dube
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nombulelo Dumela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 1 May 1992.

name: Zanele Pretty Dlungwane
description: Was stabbed and severely injured when her home was attacked by named IFP supporters at Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 March 1991. The perpetrators were allegedly looking for her uncle, an ANC supporter. One member of the family was killed and others severely injured in the attack. The perpetrators were arrested and sentenced to fifteen years’ imprisonment.

name: Thandekile Emgard Gabela
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an attack by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Melusi Cyril Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1989. He had allegedly argued with the named son of a councillor and was later that day abducted and beaten up in the soccer field. He has never been seen again.

name: Nombuso Goodness Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and sexually abused by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 March 1994. Conditions at Ndwedwe in this period were marked by severe intimidation, politically motivated killings and arson attacks, causing families to flee the area in large numbers.

name: Zanele Doris Gabela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on 18 August 1992 at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg.

name: Zebron Gabela
description: Was shot dead and burnt when IFP supporters attacked his home at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 December 1992. Four other members of the family, which supported the ANC, were killed in the attack.

name: Nonkanyiso Jennet Dube
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mhlushwa Gumede
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed, hacked, shot and left for dead on 5 September 1990 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Eston, near Hammarsdale, Natal. On 28 January 1993, he was shot dead in political conflict in the same area.

name: Mhlushwa Gumede
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed, hacked, shot and left for dead on 5 September 1990 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Eston, near Hammarsdale, Natal. On 28 January 1993, he was shot dead in political conflict in the same area.

name: Zinhle Gabela
description: Was shot dead and burnt when IFP supporters attacked her home at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 December 1992. Four other members of the family, which supported the ANC, were killed in the attack.

name: Nokwazi Rose Gcabashe
description: Her home at KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal was burnt down by IFP supporters on 14 November 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Twenty one houses belonging to ANC supporters were burnt down in the attack.

name: Ntontoza Elias Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 8 September 1993 during ongoing political violence in the area.

name: Olpha Ningi Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was forced by IFP supporters to leave her home at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during 1991, in intensifying political conflict in the area. She subsequently lost all her possessions.

name: Brenda Gabo
description: Was one of four people abducted from home and severely assaulted with sjamboks and iron bars by a large crowd of ANC supporters at a sports stadium in Daveyton, Transvaal, on 21 March 1992. Ms Gabo was suspected of collaborating with police. Two of the victims were burnt to death. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/048).

name: Pelapi Merry Dube
description: His house was destroyed in an arson attack near Eshowe, Natal, on 26 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Pelapi Merry Dube
description: His house was destroyed in an arson attack near Eshowe, Natal, on 26 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Michael Gumede
description: His home was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in October 1988, during intense political conflict in the area. Mr Gumede was targeted allegedly because his children were linked to the ANC.

name: Phendu Annah Dube
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 27 January 1993. Conditions at Ndwedwe in this period were marked by severe intimidation, politically motivated killings and arson attacks, causing families to flee the area in large numbers.

name: Qomeleni Hellen Dube
description: Her house in Greytown, Natal was burnt down by IFP supporters on 25 June 1991, allegedly because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Sizwe Reginald Gcabashe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and hacked to death, and his body mutilated, by IFP supporters in Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, in 1993. This occurred in a period in which local councillors were allegedly coercing all young people to join the IFP, and killing those who refused.

name: Harrison Thobani ‘Themba’ Fakazi
description: He has not been seen since he returned from military training abroad in March 1991 to attend his father’s funeral in Umlazi, Durban. His name appears on the list of ANC people who died in exile.

name: Mkhonodaka Gumede
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by named ANC supporters in Mtunzini, Natal, on 29 February 1992. Mr Gumede was a chief chancellor at Makholokholo Reserve and allegedly gave instructions to IFP members to kill and destroy ANC members. The perpetrator applied for amnesty.

name: Rosalia Dube
description: Was beaten with a gun by members of the ANC breakaway gang known as the Amavaravara gang, at KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, in April 1992. Gang members were allegedly looking for her sons who had remained loyal to the ANC.

name: Thobeka Deborah Gcagciso
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Somerset East, Cape, in 1985 on a charge of stone-throwing. She was pregnant at the time of her arrest.

name: Lizwi Stanley Gcaleka
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Umvoti, near Stanger, Natal, on 9 April 1994, in political conflict during the run up to the first democratic election on 27 April.

name: Mongezi Dunga
description: Was one of four people abducted from home and severely assaulted with sjamboks and iron bars by a large crowd of ANC supporters at a sports stadium in Daveyton, Transvaal, on 21 March 1992. Mr Dunga was suspected of collaborating with police. Two of the victims were burnt to death. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/048).

name: Solomon Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at his home in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 3 February 1991.

name: Charles Flemmer
description: Was shot and fatally stabbed in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 12 October 1993 after he was abducted and taken to Madala hostel during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters

name: Lahliwe Gagile
description: Her house and possessions were burnt in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in November 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thambolini Elizabeth Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and her home was burnt down by named IFP supporters in Mtunzini, Natal, in February 1992, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: M Dombi
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Sthembele Fodo
description: An ANC member who was abducted and taken to Vusimuzi hostel by IFP supporters, and shot dead on 7 March 1993 in Tembisa, Transvaal. His colleague also died in the attack.

name: Sibiya Gcina
description: Was forced to lie on the ground and was then killed ‘execution style’ with two others on 19 June 1992 in Umlazi, Durban, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mphahleni Elphas Gumede
description: His home was burnt down by unidentified persons in Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 March 1994, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the first democratic election of April 1994.

name: Mphahleni Elphas Gumede
description: His home was burnt down by unidentified persons in Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 March 1994, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the first democratic election of April 1994.

name: Thulani Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot at by IFP supporters during political conflict at Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 7 August 1993. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Bhekimpi Doncabe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Veronica Kedibone Dube
description: Was abducted, raped and assaulted by named ANC supporters in Kagiso, Transvaal, on 14 May 1992 for allegedly searching dead bodies after the Swanieville massacre of 12 May 1992.

name: Veronica Kedibone Dube
description: Was abducted, raped and assaulted by named ANC supporters in Kagiso, Transvaal, on 14 May 1992 for allegedly searching dead bodies after the Swanieville massacre of 12 May 1992.

name: Queeneth Faku
description: Was constantly harassed and intimidated by ANC supporters. On 15 August 1992, her house was stoned and subsequently burnt down in Paterson, Cape, after she was accused of acting as an informer for the town clerk, who was unpopular with the community at the time.

name: Ellias Omo Doncabe
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death by named IFP supporters in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 8 April 1992.

name: Thomas Mhlawu Phenduka Doncabe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 8 August 1991.

name: Anton Thulani Duzane
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in June 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Mpisi Gumede
description: A community councillor who had his house petrol-bombed by ANC supporters at Ensimbini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in March 1993. Mr Gumede ’s wife was injured and his brother was killed in the same attack.

name: Zeblon Mfana Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named fellow ANC supporter in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 7 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Dube was killed for failing to attend an ANC meeting.

name: Zeblon Mfana Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named fellow ANC supporter in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 7 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Dube was killed for failing to attend an ANC meeting.

name: Mthembeni Gumede
description: Was shot dead at Mtunzini, Natal, on 5 September 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Elizabeth Maserame Folotsi
description: Was shot and burnt to death in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 11 October 1993 while visiting relatives at a hostel during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Her husband was shot and burnt to death in the same incident.

name: Amos Fakude
description: Was stabbed to death in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 17 October 1992, allegedly by an IFP supporter, during tense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Bongani Wonderboy Fakude
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters at his home in Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 July 1992. Mr Fakude is physically disabled as a result of the attack.

name: Rodney Rhodah Fakude
description: His home was destroyed in an arson attack near Eshowe, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sibusiso Fakude
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters on a street in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 18 December 1992 after rescuing two fellow IFP supporters from a burning house. The community is reported to have been particularly tense over the deaths of two IFP supporters a few days earlier.

name: Wonderboy Fakude
description: Was severely injured when he was stabbed in the neck and chest during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 July 1992.

name: Nontshiki Falakhe
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death with three other family members when their shack was set alight in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 18 February 1992. The attack took place during a period of conflict between ANC supporters and persons associated with the Lingelethu West Town Council, who were allegedly aided by the police.

name: Portia Falakhe
description: Was burnt to death with three other family members in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 18 February 1992, during conflict between ANC supporters and persons associated with the Lingelethu West Town Council, who were allegedly aided by the police.

name: Thumeka Falakhe
description: Was burnt to death with three other family members in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 18 February 1992, during conflict between ANC supporters and persons associated with the Lingelethu West Town Council, who were allegedly aided by the police.

name: Nan Fama Mkululi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Germiston, Transvaal, on 16 June 1990.

name: Mphati Douglas Fani
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted by members of AmaAfrika, in Dube, near Klipplaat, Cape, during 1990, in conflict between the ANC and the Black Local Authority.

name: Mzwandile Wilson Fanti
description: An ANC member who was imprisoned for eight years on Robben Island in 1964 for his political activities. After his release, he was placed under a banning order in Stutterheim, Cape. He was detained in 1981, and again in 1982, for his leading role in campaigning against the incorporation of the Mgwali area into the Ciskei. During his detention, he was tortured at the Cambridge police station, East London. Mr Fanti was eventually acquitted of charges of promoting the ANC.

name: Anna Mingi Feni
description: Was shot and killed by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 22 September 1992, because she was thought to be an IFP supporter. The SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0018).

name: Mbophele Petrus Feni
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in Hammanskraal, Transvaal, when it was demolished on 12 January 1993, following an eviction order from the Bophuthatswana government.

name: Solomon Santi Henry Folotsi
description: Was shot and burnt to death in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 11 October 1993 while visiting relatives at a hostel during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. His wife was shot and burnt to death in the same incident.

name: Mthobisi Gumede
description: Was shot dead in an attack on his home in KwaMondi, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 19 November 1993 when IFP supporters attacked several ANC supporters in the areas around Eshowe. One person was killed and more than forty five homes burnt down. Three other family members were injured in the attack. The attack is alleged to have been instigated by a local IFP-supporting chief who wished to drive ANC supporters out of the area.

name: Mtokozo Bhekitshe Gumede
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 July 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Khetiwe Annatoria Gcumisa
description: Her home was burnt down by ANC supporters in Wartburg, Natal, on 26 November 1989, in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Mandlakayise Gcumisa
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Wartburg, Natal, on 26 November 1989, in intensifying political conflict in the area. His home was destroyed through arson during the attack.

name: Zipathe Gcumisa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 29 October 1991.

name: Henry Fortewu
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Hermanus, Cape Town, and severely beaten by named police during anti-pass protests. He was detained for a month and later served three months’ imprisonment.

name: Alzinah Gcwensa
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Nondim Gali
description: A SANCO member who lost her home in an arson attack in Crossroads, Cape Town, in 1993, during attempts by a named Crossroads leader to remove residents in Section 2 by force.

name: Mzonjani Michael Gumede
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in January 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Sydney Gehling
description: Was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) fleeing from a roadblock in Dawn Park, Germiston, Transvaal, on 29 October 1992. Another civilian was shot dead in the incident. Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/197 and AC/2000/139).

name: Nelson Ntethe Gama
description: An ANC supporter who lost an eye after being attacked with a bottle by a named perpetrator on 31 July 1992 during political conflict in Alexandra, Johannesburg.

name: Nellie Gumede
description: Her house was destroyed in an arson attack in Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, during 1993, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Njenani Douglas
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 27 August 1993, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Ngiyaisa Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked and killed by an IFP supporter at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 9 March 1992. The perpetrator allegedly believed Mr Gumede was plotting to attack IFP supporters.

name: Nan Four Youths
description: These four unnamed ANC supporters were stabbed and injured by IFP supporters who stormed their house at Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991.

name: Kanetsi Duduketsang
description: An ANC supporter who was injured when a bomb planted by the AWB exploded at the ANC offices in Letsopa, Ottosdal, Transvaal, on 4 February 1994.

name: Kaizer Nimrod Duku
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured, allegedly by ISU members, in Phola Park, Katlehong, Transvaal, on 15 January 1994.

name: Ngiyaisa Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu’s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Thamasanqa Gama
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 28 June 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Mr Gama’s brother was shot dead, his mother injured and his home burnt down in this attack.

name: Mayvis Sibongile Gema
description: Her home was burnt down by ANC supporters at Ixopo, Natal, on 27 March 1992, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Mkhuthali Buzani Duma-Mtolo
description: Her home was burnt down by ANC supporters in Ixopo, Natal, on 26 June 1993, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Dries Fourie
description: His home in Durban was burnt down by IFP supporters on 25 June 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Bafikile Duma
description: An ANC supporter who suffered injuries when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217). See Richmond attacks.

name: Bakhaleni Mana Duma
description: An ANC member whose home was burnt down by a named IFP supporter at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 3 February 1992. Seven homes were burnt down in the area that month, and one person was killed.

name: Thoko Patricia Doyisa
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by unidentified persons in KwaMashu, Durban, on 1 March 1991 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Duncan Sibongiseni Gambushe
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten and severely injured by an IFP supporter at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in November 1993.

name: Florence Nomzamo Gambushe
description: Was shot dead in her home at Shobashobane, near Port Shepstone, Natal, by an IFP supporter on 13 December 1993. Ms Gambushe had been an IFP local secretary but had resigned because her son was an ANC combatant in hiding.

name: Fana Richard Gamede
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted together with his sister by named IFP supporters in Ladysmith, Natal, on 20 February 1994. He was later shot dead in front of her.

name: Douglas Mahayiko Duma
description: Was one of eight passengers shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Six other passengers were shot dead. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Nompumelelo Gamede
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted along with her brother by named IFP supporters as they were walking to a shop in Ladysmith, Natal, on 20 February 1994. She was then forced to watch as her brother was shot dead.

name: Getrude Duma
description: An ANC supporter who suffered injuries when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217). See Richmond attacks.

name: Ntombizodwa Eunice Gumede
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack at Mahwaqa, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 July 1992, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thembinkosi Tetete Gamede
description: Was shot dead on 28 October 1992 in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Isaac Mzikayifani Gamende
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards at the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Kenneth Dumsani Duma
description: Was shot and stabbed to death by named ANC supporters at Ndaleni, near Richmond, Natal, on 21 December 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Lili Gertrude Duma
description: Was stabbed and injured when her family was attacked by IFP supporters at their home in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in February 1991 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Four of her daughters were also injured, and her two-year-old grandson was killed.

name: Phikiwe Gumede
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Wynand Fourie
description: A security guard who was shot and injured by ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members at the Giwi Breyton Construction compound in Evander, Transvaal, on 6 July 1992. Another security guard was shot dead and two others were tied up. The SDU members, who sought to seize guns at the site, were engaged in clashes with the Black Cats in Ermelo, Transvaal.Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/19998/0121).

name: Nomabulu Princess Gamtela
description: An ANC supporter whose house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack in Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 30 April 1994, in political conflict following the first democratic election.

name: Willem Stephanus Froneman
description: Was shot and killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) who robbed him of his vehicle in Germiston, Transvaal, on 3 February 1993. His companion was shot and wounded. The perpetrators were allegedly seeking a vehicle in which to transport weapons. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1998/0058).

name: Tolo Thobile Fusaza
description: An IFP supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, in March 1992, allegedly because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Ninife Jonas Gaanakgomo
description: Was shot and injured in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Transvaal, on 5 March 1993 as he was returning from the night vigil of an ANC member.

name: Matlakala Aletta Gaarekwe
description: She died in hospital after she was seriously injured when a hand grenade was thrown into a relative’s house in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 28 April 1992 by ANC supporters because one of the family members was an IFP supporter. Her sister was killed in the explosion and her niece was seriously injured.

name: Lazarus Gaba
description: Was burnt to death in Khutsong, Transvaal, on 16 December 1991 by members of an ANC-aligned vigilante group in a revenge attack under the leadership of a well-known perpetrator.

name: Siyakana Gaba
description: An ANC member who was hit by a police van when teargas made it impossible to see on 6 June 1960 at Flagstaff, Transkei. Mr Gaba was involved in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Aaron Gabela
description: Was shot dead on 24 February 1993 in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Betty Gabela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when IFP supporters attacked her home on 2 December 1992 at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal.

name: Jethro Bonginkosi Gabela
description: An ANC supporter who was killed at a bus stop in Richards Bay, Natal, on 28 March 1992, during political conflict in the area. In December 1992, his family home was attacked and burnt by IFP supporters.

name: Jethro Bonginkosi Gabela
description: An ANC supporter who was killed at a bus stop in Richards Bay, Natal, on 28 March 1992, during political conflict in the area. In December 1992, his family home was attacked and burnt by IFP supporters.

name: Khona Gabela
description: An ANC member who was ambushed and killed by Vlakplaas operatives and askaris in Nelspruit, Transvaal, on 19 March 1992. Mr Gabela was one of Ms Winnie Madikezela-Mandela’s bodyguards.

name: Lindiwe Gabela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when IFP supporters attacked her home at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 December 1992.

name: Mantombi Premrose Duma
description: An ANC supporter whose house was petrol-bombed by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 5 April 1991. Eleven people were killed, at least seven injured and twenty homes torched in politically motivated attacks in the area on this day.

name: Sonwabiso Linton Dyarvane
description: An ANC member who was detained, tortured and sentenced to six months’ imprisonment in Bizana, Transkei, during 1960, for his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Moses Gumede
description: Was shot dead while trying to escape his burning home at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during March 1993, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mbalekelwa Richard Duma
description: Was shot dead on 28 February 1992 in Hammarsdale, Natal, in intensified violent conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Pholi Gladness Gumede
description: Her house was burnt down by IFP supporters at KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in November 1992, because her husband had attended the funeral of a suspected ANC supporter.

name: Priscilla Bizeni Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Port Shepstone, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters in July 1993.

name: Mduduzi Watson Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when he was shot and stabbed near Pietermaritzburg by named fellow ANC supporters during an internal feud on 14 March 1990.

name: Pumepi Gumede
description: An IFP supporter who was severely injured when she and her husband were stabbed, hacked and shot in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 September 1990. Her husband was shot dead on 28 January 1993 in political violence in Eston, near Hammarsdale, Natal.

name: Pumepi Gumede
description: An IFP supporter who was severely injured when she and her husband were stabbed, hacked and shot in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 September 1990. Her husband was shot dead on 28 January 1993 in political violence in Eston, near Hammarsdale, Natal.

name: David Dayi Getyesie
description: Was shot and injured in Tembisa, Transvaal, in April 1992 during an attack by IFP supporters. In the early 1990s several Transvaal townships were embroiled in political conflict between the ANC and IFP.

name: Livuyo Getyesie
description: was thrown against a wall and killed by alleged IFP supporters in Vusumuzi hostel, Tembisa, Transvaal, in March 1992, during conflict in the area between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Mncanyalwa Ernest Getyeza
description: An ANC supporter who was injured in a shooting in Umlazi, Durban, on 23 June 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Hloniphile Gewensa
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Ambrose Thulani Gigaba
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992.

name: Vuyisile Victor Gija
description: An ANC supporter who died after being stabbed and shot by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 27 April 1991.

name: Cebile Irine Gina
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack by an IFP supporter in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 25 June 1991.

name: Fikile Gina
description: Was shot on 28 November 1993, when IFP supporters from Ndabayakhe opened fire on ANC supporters attending a cultural ceremony at Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Eight people, including two children, believed to be ANC supporters, were killed.

name: John Gina
description: Was shot dead by an ANC supporter at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 February 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: John Gina
description: Was shot dead by an ANC supporter at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 February 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Johnson Myengeni Gina
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by an ANC supporter in Empangeni, Natal, on 26 April 1994, the day before the April 1994 elections.

name: Johnson Myengeni Gina
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by an ANC supporter in Empangeni, Natal, on 26 April 1994, the day before the April 1994 elections.

name: Mbengeza Gina
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 13 November 1993. About five political killings were recorded at Bhambayi that day in retaliatory attacks by both IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Nomusa Badingile Glaba
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mthokozisi Christopher Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by other ANC supporters at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 10 June 1993, allegedly for refusing to attend ANC self-defence training camps.

name: Mandla Ray Dubazane
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed, shot and burnt to death by ANC supporters on 26 December 1990 in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, in intense conflict in the area.

name: Boneni Grace Dube
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bonisiwe Dorcas Dube
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Dina Doshana Dube
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack on 11 July 1993 in Manzimnyama, Kwa-Mbonambi, near Richards Bay, Natal, in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the region.

name: Duduzile Lucy Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umbogintwini, near Durban, on 8 February 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections

name: Duduzile Lucy Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umbogintwini, near Durban, on 8 February 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections

name: Ellie Mncofeni Dube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 21 April 1992, in political conflict in the area.

name: Florence Ntombizonke Dube
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Qalangani Vitalis Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose home at Umlazi, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Hleziphi Sylvia Dube
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1991.

name: Isaac Dube
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by named ANC supporters on 20 May 1993 in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal.

name: Jephanus (Aka ‘Gobani’) Dube
description: An IFP member who survived two assassination attempts by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU). In early September 1993, he was kidnapped at gunpoint, assaulted and shot at by SDU members in Tokoza, Transvaal. Later, in September 1993, SDU members forcibly entered his residence and attempted to kill him by stabbing and shooting him. Two SDU members were granted amnesty for these incidents (AC/1999/0186). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Jephanus (Aka ‘Gobani’) Dube
description: An IFP member who survived two assassination attempts by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU). In early September 1993, he was kidnapped at gunpoint, assaulted and shot at by SDU members in Tokoza, Transvaal. Later, in September 1993, SDU members forcibly entered his residence and attempted to kill him by stabbing and shooting him. Two SDU members were granted amnesty for these incidents (AC/1999/0186). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Josephine Dube
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured at her home near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 March 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Lucy M Dube
description: Was shot dead on 5 April 1994 in Empangeni, Natal, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her body was reportedly found with her baby still feeding at her breast.

name: Lucy M Dube
description: Was shot dead on 5 April 1994 in Empangeni, Natal, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her body was reportedly found with her baby still feeding at her breast.

name: Musa Agrippa Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 4 December 1991 when a large armed group of IFP hostel-dwellers, supported by the security forces, launched two attacks on ANC supporters in Bruntville, Mooi River, Natal. In all, eighteen ANC supporters were killed in these attacks and at least a hundred homes were burnt or damaged.

name: Nobuhle Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured when her family was attacked by IFP supporters in Ndaleni, near Richmond, Natal, in February 1991, during political violence following a peace meeting in the area. Her mother and three sisters were injured, and a two-year-old child was killed in the attack.

name: Tembelizwe Dywashu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by named members of the African Democratic Movement (ADM) in Whittlesea, Ciskei, on 26 August 1992. The perpetrators admitted to planning his murder during conflict between ANC and ADM supporters.

name: Ntombivelile Princess Dzanibe
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992. See Chimora settlement attacks.

name: De Poutch Elese
description: An ANC branch chairperson who was repeatedly harassed and raided by police in Crossroads, Cape Town, in 1993. He was an opponent of a local Crossroads leader who was removing people from the area by force. Masked gunmen attacked his home on 19 March 1993 leaving three family members and friends dead and two injured. One perpetrator was later jailed for the attack after being refused amnesty.

name: Joyce ‘Ndinisa’ Elese
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by masked gunmen who burst into her home and opened fire on 19 March 1993 in Crossroads, Cape Town. Three family members and friends were shot dead and two injured in the attack. One perpetrator was later convicted and jailed for the attack. He was refused amnesty.

name: Tinie Elese
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by masked gunmen who burst into his home and opened fire on 19 March 1993 in Crossroads, Cape Town. Three family members and friends were shot dead and two injured in the attack. One perpetrator was later convicted and jailed for the attack. He was refused amnesty.

name: Nojise Constance Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters at her home near Ixopo, Natal, in March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nojise Constance Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters at her home near Ixopo, Natal, in March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Vuyiswa Ann Ganta
description: She had her property damaged in 1991 when ANC-aligned members of the Khutsong Youth Congress split into two factions in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal. The ‘Zim-Zim’ faction attacked the home during conflict with the ‘Gaddaffi’ faction.

name: Ntomi Mavis Duma
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 August 1990, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Qondeni Duma
description: An ANC supporter who suffered injuries when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217). See Richmond attacks.

name: Sam Duma
description: Was abducted and later killed and sexually mutilated in Richmond, Natal, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in December 1991. A friend who was with him was also killed and mutilated.

name: Sibongile Promise Duma
description: Her house and possessions were burnt in an arson attack at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1993 during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sikhumbuzo Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by other ANC supporters on 14 March 1990 in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, in a serious internal feud in the organisation.

name: Sithembile Duma
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in April 1991.

name: Siyabonga Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was killed when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217). See Richmond attacks.

name: Stinki Nobuhle Duma
description: An ANC supporter who suffered injuries when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217). See Richmond attacks.

name: Tende Duma
description: He lost his house in an arson attack at Ixopo, Natal, in 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thabisile Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured when her family home at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, was attacked by IFP supporters in February 1991. Ms Duma’s mother and two sisters were injured, and a two year old child was killed in the attack.

name: Thembinkosi Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by other named ANC supporters while attending a meeting in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 28 October 1989, during a serious internal feud within the organisation.

name: Thulani Duma
description: Was shot and partially paralysed in August 1990 when he and other youths were ambushed at KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, by IFP supporters. The victims had been on their way to attend an ANC supporter’s funeral when they were attacked.

name: Zandile Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees attacked ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217). See Richmond attacks.

name: Zanele Florina Duma
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Umkomaas, Natal, on 22 November 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Zephania Hiqi Duma
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by IFP supporters in January 1991. He was later found dead with a broken neck and other wounds in the informal settlement of KwaHaza, near Howick, Natal.

name: Sibongile Happiness Gumede
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters in Gingindlovu, Natal, on 28 December 1992. The attack came the day before the funeral of a prominent induna.

name: Sibusiso Gumede
description: Was shot dead, together with his brother, in KwaNqolothi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 December 1993, in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sidudla Patricia Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose house at Umlazi, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Sindisiwe Gumede
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 11 September 1992 when armed gunmen attacked homes of suspected ANC supporters at Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Six people died, one was injured and several homes were burnt down in this attack. At least four of those killed were from the Gumede family. The family believes it was targeted because a member refused to participate in an IFP night camp.

name: Sunrise Ntombizethu Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters at Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Thabani Gumede
description: Was shot dead in KwaNqolothi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 December 1993, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thabile Gumede
description: Was burnt and severely injured when armed gunmen attacked homes of suspected ANC supporters at Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Six people died, one was injured and several homes were burnt down in this attack. At least four of those killed were from the Gumede family. The family believes it was targeted because a member refused to participate in an IFP night camp.

name: Thami Ronald Gumede
description: His house was destroyed in an arson attack at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 23 July 1993 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thokozani Penelope Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose home and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban in February 1992. Seven homes were burnt down in Bhambayi in this month, and one death was recorded.

name: Tholakele Celiwe Gumede
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by other IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 20 February 1994, allegedly because the Gumede family did not attend an IFP meeting. Both the ANC and the IFP had rallies in the area that day.

name: Tholakele Thulisiwe Gumede
description: An IFP supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 11 August 1992. Ms Gumede was allegedly targeted because her sons were accused of being ANC supporters.

name: Thulisile Gumede
description: Was shot at while her mother, who was shielding her, was shot twice in her back by a named perpetrator at their home at Mandini, Natal, on 16 April 1994. The family was allegedly attacked because Thulisile’s father was thought to be an ANC supporter.

name: Xolani Gumede
description: Was shot dead on 11 September 1992 when armed gunmen attacked homes of suspected ANC supporters at Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Six people died, one was injured and several homes were burnt down in this attack. At least four of those killed were from the Gumede family. The family believes it was targeted because a member refused to participate in an IFP night camp.

name: Zisiwe Virginia Gumede
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 19 September 1993, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Mantanbama Sibongile Gwabe
description: Her house was burnt down and her livestock stolen in Empangeni, Natal, on 17 January 1994 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mantanbama Sibongile Gwabe
description: Her house was burnt down and her livestock stolen in Empangeni, Natal, on 17 January 1994 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Amos Msutu Gwabeng
description: Was severely assaulted, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 24 June 1993 during an escalation of conflict on the East Rand following an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel on May 22 which precipitated clashes leading to more than eighty deaths. His home was also looted by the attackers during the attack. As a result of the intense conflict, his wife was afraid to seek medical assistance for Mr Gwabeng and he died two months later of stomach cancer.

name: Amos Msutu Gwabeng
description: Was severely assaulted, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 24 June 1993 during an escalation of conflict on the East Rand following an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel on May 22 which precipitated clashes leading to more than eighty deaths. His home was also looted by the attackers during the attack. As a result of the intense conflict, his wife was afraid to seek medical assistance for Mr Gwabeng and he died two months later of stomach cancer.

name: Dabukeleni Arosia Gasa
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Pietermaritzburg was burnt down on 28 March 1990 during the Seven Day War.

name: Goodness Delile Gasa
description: Her home was burnt down by ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 May 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Gotiza Annastasia Gasa
description: An ANC supporter whose house was set alight by IFP supporters in Ntuzuma, near Durban, in 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Sweetness Mana Gasa
description: Her house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1992, during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Legina Gasela
description: An IFP supporter whose house in Richmond, Natal, was burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 August 1991, because her son was a prominent member of the IFP.

name: Phoyisa Gasela
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards at the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Thamsanqa Francis Gasela
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 16 August 1991.

name: Mavis Busisiwe Gavu
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters in Kwa-Makhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 1 July 1992.

name: Bannie Anton Gawu
description: An ANC member who disappeared from Port Elizabeth in 1980. He was a student at St Joseph’s Catholic School. He is believed to have been killed in an ANC camp in Luanda, Angola.

name: Silomo Shadrack Gazu
description: Was killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) on patrol in Boipatong, Transvaal, on 28 January 1993. He was assaulted, stabbed, and then set alight after paraffin was poured over him. Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2000/079).

name: Andreas Bhekani Gcaba
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 18 December 1991. Earlier that year, on 6 May 1991, Mr Gcaba lost his home in Okhalweni, Palm Beach, Natal, in an arson attack by IFP supporters.

name: Andreas Bhekani Gcaba
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 18 December 1991. Earlier that year, on 6 May 1991, Mr Gcaba lost his home in Okhalweni, Palm Beach, Natal, in an arson attack by IFP supporters.

name: Evangeline Nokuthemba Jali
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack at Thafamasi, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in May 1990, in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Namajali Ivy Jali
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in March 1994. At least nineteen people were killed and more than fourteen were injured in political violence at Bhambayi that month. Numerous shacks were burnt on both sides of the conflict.

name: Bhunu Muzikayise Ellington Hlela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and had his throat slit on 14 April 1993 in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal. Rival ANC and IFP groupings allegedly burst into the house and attacked him and two friends after they had reported the death of an injured man. Twelve people were killed in Mpophomeni that week.

name: Savumase Jali
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and detained for two years between 1960 and 1961 in Bizana, Transkei, during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Thengela Nicholas Jali
description: His home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 14 May 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Grace Dodile Jalubane
description: An ANC supporter whose house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Mqolombeni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Dudu Mirriam Jama
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 February 1993.

name: Joyce Thoko Jama
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 10 March 1993. At least eighteen people were killed and seventy five homes burnt down in political conflict in Bhambayi that month.

name: Manono Ntombize Jama
