description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1992, in political conflict in the area.

name: Mina Jama
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in 1990.

name: Mkhonjwa Jama
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 27 May 1990 in Edendale, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, shortly after discovering a vehicle full of bodies at a petrol station nearby. Mr Jama’s body was set alight, along with those of two friends who also died in the attack.

name: Nonhlanhla Viola Jama
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and hacked to death by IFP supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 July 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Zibonele Ellias Jama
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in 1990.

name: Frederick Casper 'Fritz' Jansen
description: A building contractor who was attacked by a crowd of protesters as he drove near Crossroads, Cape Town, on 11 August 1980. He was stoned and burnt and died in hospital the following day. Another motorist had been attacked and killed that afternoon, during protests related to a bus boycott. Six people were convicted of the two killings and sentenced to lengthy prison sentences. One of those convicted, an ANC supporter, was granted amnesty for the killing (AC/1999/0298).

name: Thomas Jansen
description: An ANC chairperson who was harassed, assaulted and repeatedly detained during 1992 and 1993 in Villiersdorp, Cape.

name: Welcome Mtutuzeli Jara
description: An ANC member who was shot at and his house was set alight in Flagstaff, Transkei, on 14 November 1992 during a party membership drive that was opposed by the local chief.

name: Daniel Tahleho Jas
description: an ANC supporter who was arrested in Bethulie, Orange Free State, on 8 May 1991, on the pretext that he was in possession of unlicensed firearms. In custody he was severely beaten, subjected to electric shocks and deprived of food.

name: Nokuphila Eunice Jayile
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters in Groutville, near Stanger, Natal, on 6 February 1994, during political conflict in the area.

name: John Harold Jeffery
description: An ANC member who was shot by named IFP supporters when the car in which he and two other ANC officials were travelling was ambushed near Ixopo, Natal, on 27 October 1992. He was part of an ANC delegation attempting to broker peace with the IFP. He was not injured, but an ANC Midlands Exective Committee member was shot dead in the ambush.

name: Nontshizana Mocica Jela
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters in Amaoti, Inanda, near Durban, in January 1991.

name: Bafana Jele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by members of the KZP at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 20 June 1993. The perpetrators claimed they had mistaken Mr Jele for someone who had killed a policeman. Three perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Cyprian Mlungisi Jele
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked with iron bars and knobkieries by IFP supporters in a train near Boksburg, Transvaal, on 7 July 1992. See train violence.

name: Flomencia Jeza
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Umlazi, Durban, burnt down on 11 February 1990 in political conflict in the area following the unbanning of political organisations.

name: Richard Jeza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on 12 April 1994 while distributing IEC pamphlets in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu near Durban. With eight other employees, he was confronted by five IFP supporters, accused of being an ANC supporter and severely tortured. Eight of the nine people were killed. One survived and took three days to crawl back to safety. One IFP member was convicted for the attack.

name: Ningi Promise Hlongwane
description: Was shot dead in an attack on her home at KwaHaza, near Howick, Natal, on 11 April 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Two other family members also died in the attack.

name: Dombi Sizeni Jili
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Richmond, Natal, was burnt down by a named IFP supporter on 12 April 1992.

name: Anthony Hadebe
description: Was abducted from his home, along with a friend, by self-defence unit (SDU) members and ANC supporters, in the Motsoaledi informal settlement, Transvaal, on 29 March 1994. They were taken to a nearby school in Orlando East, Soweto, Johannesburg, where he was shot and injured and his friend killed. They were suspected of participating in an IFP march that day. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0320).

name: Nokiki Hlongwane
description: Was stabbed to death in April 1992 by IFP supporters when she visited the Vusimusi hostel in Tembisa, Transvaal, during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Her three year old son was also killed in the attack.

name: Calungile Paulina Hlela
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down in the Kasthebe area of Bulwer, Natal, on 30 November 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Jerome Thandokuhle Jili
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Nkelabantwana, Bulwer, Natal, on 18 March 1992.

name: Advice Gwala
description: Was killed in 1992 by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) during political conflict between the Black Cats gang and the ANC in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the killing (AC/1998/0121).

name: Bhekithemba Gwala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at Hammarsdale, Natal, by IFP supporters on 21 November 1993.

name: Bonsile Doris Gwala
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 25 August 1991.

name: Dan Gwala
description: Was killed at Empangeni, Natal, on 27 February 1993, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Elizabeth Ntongolozi Gwala
description: An ANC supporter whose house near Empangeni, Natal was burnt down by IFP supporters on 17 January 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Elizabeth Ntongolozi Gwala
description: An ANC supporter whose house near Empangeni, Natal was burnt down by IFP supporters on 17 January 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ellias Gubane Gwala
description: An IFP supporter whose home was set alight by ANC supporters in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 10 August 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Josephina Gwala
description: Was burnt to death in an arson attack on her house by ANC supporters at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1993, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Magaret Gwala
description: Her home was burnt down in Mantunzweni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 13 April 1994, in conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area two weeks before the election on 27 April 1994.

name: Magaret Gwala
description: Her home was burnt down in Mantunzweni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 13 April 1994, in conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area two weeks before the election on 27 April 1994.

name: Manqukela Gwala
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted by ANC supporters in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 5 June 1991, during political conflict. Three days later his body was found with stab wounds.

name: Michael Gwala
description: An ANC supporter whowas shot and killed by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu’s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 Marc h 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Mkhalelwa France Gwala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in January 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Nkosinathi David Gwala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, on 2 December 1991.

name: Nomathenisi Dudweyini Gwala
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Nkwezela, Bulwer, Natal, in 1992.

name: Sulani Gwala
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 February 1993.

name: Vusi Joseph Gwala
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters at Madakane, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 December 1991.

name: Wellton Gwala
description: Was severely burnt when his house was petrol bombed by ANC supporters at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1993, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Zakhiwo Ngabuzi Gwala
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters while the family was in hiding during political violence in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 22 April 1991.

name: Zikhali Gwala
description: Was shot dead in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Golokodo, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 10 January 1993.

name: Lucky Jabulani Gwamanda
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters at New Hanover, near Pietermaritzburg, on 10 April 1993.

name: Robert Langalakhe Gwambi
description: Was shot dead in Umlazi, Durban, on 20 April 1992, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Adolphus Gwayi
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted during his two month detention at Bizana, Transkei, in June 1960, during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Jonas Masoyini Gwayi
description: His home was destroyed in an arson attack by ANC members in Bizana in 1960. Mr Gwayi refused to join the iKongo during the Pondoland revolt and was therefore regarded as an informer. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Vanrooyen Wilson Gwebu
description: An employee of the Manganese Metal Company in Randfontein who was in a bakkie with other passengers when it was ambushed near the company premises on 6 May 1990 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Goodboy Kenneth Gxeyane
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from his home and stabbed to death by a named member of the Amasinyora vigilantes in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 13 January 1994.

name: Nonkoliseko Gxoli
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 15 February 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Nokuthula Hazel Habiya
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bhekithemba Pieterson Hadabe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at his home in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 April 1991. The family was forced to flee the area.

name: Victoria Nombulelo Jwaxa
description: Her home was lost in an arson attack by named ANC members in September 1992 in Alice, Ciskei. Ms Jwaxa had attended the funeral of an ADM member during the feud between the ANC and the ADM.

name: Joe Joseph Jili
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Richmond, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters in 1991.

name: Lina Jili
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 February 1991.

name: Bekwenze Absolom Hadebe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by unidentified attackers while he was washing his car in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 1 October 1991. He was allegedly targeted for refusing to participate in a stayaway.

name: Ncamokwakhe Jili
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Nobantu Jwili
description: An ANCWL member who was shot and killed when an IFP funeral procession passed her house in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Transvaal, on 27 February 1993. The IFP allegedly refused to allow her to be buried in the township because of her ANC affiliation.

name: Ndeke Sylvacia Jili
description: The mother of an ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack perpetrated by named IFP supporters in Nkelabantwana, Bulwer, Natal, on 15 November 1992, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Bettina Hadebe
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters at her neighbour’s home in Emamfemfetheni, near Bergville, Natal, in March 1992, allegedly because she was thought to be an ANC supporter. The perpetrators were arrested, but were acquitted for lack of evidence.

name: Nomoya Jili
description: An ANC supporter whose house near Richmond, Natal, was burnt down in an arson attack in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1992.

name: Khonzeni Petrinah Hlela
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Simon Madimetja Kekae
description: Was shot and seriously injured by IFP supporters in Dobsonville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 24 November 1992 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Nsizwane Johannes Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Bruntville, KwaZulu, near Mooi River, Natal, on 7 June 1991, in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Petros Mzophilayo Jili
description: An ANC supporter whose family home was burnt down and livestock stolen in an arson attack on his home near Richmond, Natal, in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Sydney Mbongeni Kabele (Gabele)
description: An ANC supporter whose house near Empangeni, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 3 December 1992.

name: Ntobeko Patrick Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in April 1991.

name: Selina Jili
description: An ANC supporter whose house near Richmond, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters in 1991.

name: Simon Manyakazisa Jili
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, in August 1992.

name: Sitibitibi Jili
description: An ANC supporter whpse house near Richmond, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters during intensifying violent conflict in the area in 1990.

name: Ntombi Carinah Hlongwane
description: Her house and all belongings were burnt in arson attacks during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1990. See Richmond Farm arson attacks.

name: Eugene Mlungisi Hadebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters at Umkomaas, Natal, in October 1990, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Ncane Alzina Hlela
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack at KwaShange, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 28 March 1990, during the Seven Day War.

name: Malose Reuben Kekana
description: An ANC supporter who was tortured in detention in Zebediela, Transvaal in November 1992 during rent and consumer boycotts in the area.

name: Thembisile Zanele Jili
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 February 1991.

name: Phakamani Joseph Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters while attending an ANC rally near Bergville, Natal, on 6 June 1993. See Bergville attack.

name: Walther Sipho Kabini
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when Bophuthatswana police fired on a crowd gathered to protest against police brutality at City Rocks Stadium, Winterveld, Bophuthatswana on 26 March 1986. See City Rocks shooting. See police brutality.

name: Nkosinathi Emmanuel Hlela
description: Was stabbed and shot dead at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, in January 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nkosinathi Emmanuel Hlela
description: Was stabbed and shot dead at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, in January 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Tholumuzi Erasmus Jili
description: Was tortured to death by named ANC supporters at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 12 September 1991, allegedly because his family supported the IFP.

name: Phillip Smanga Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed in the body and eye by IFP supporters on a train travelling between Phomolong and Phefeni stations in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 15 October 1993. See train violence.

name: Viliza Hsozi
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 17 June 1991, during political conflict in the area.

name: Nomoto Anastelia Hlela
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by a named attacker in Emangwaneni, Bulwer, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the early 1990s. Both her daughter and granddaughter were stabbed in the attack.

name: Winnie Mavis Jili
description: An ANC supporter whose family home in Richmond, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Pretty Elsie Hlongwane
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters in Hosiyana, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in February 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Pretty Elsie Hlongwane
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters in Hosiyana, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in February 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombenhle Hlela
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by a named perpetrator in an attack on her home in Emangwaneni, Bulwer, Natal, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the early 1990s. Another family member was also stabbed, and their home was burnt down.

name: Zwe Jili
description: An ANC supporter whose family home in Richmond, Natal, was burnt down in April 1992 during continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Jabulani Mpikayipheli Hadebe
description: A local chief’s councillor who was assaulted, forced to drink petrol and set alight by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at Bhekezulu, Estcourt, Natal, on 25 December 1993. Mr Hadebe survived the attack. One SDU member was refused amnesty (AC/2000/223). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Joyce Bongumusa Hadebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP members when they attacked her house at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 January 1993. Four perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Khalelwa Jeza Hadebe
description: An IFP supporter who was doused with petrol and burnt to death by named ANC supporters in Alfred, Natal, on 3 January 1990. Ms Hadebe was suspected of practising witchcraft.

name: Khulekani Hadebe
description: His house was burnt down on 11 September 1992 when armed gunmen attacked homes of suspected ANC supporters at Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Six people died, one was injured and several homes were burnt down in this attack.

name: Melisiwe Eunice Hadebe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured and her home burnt down by other named IFP supporters at Emangwaneni, Bulwer, Natal, on 7 December 1991, allegedly because her sons were ANC members.

name: Mongezi Hadebe
description: His home was destroyed in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 21 March 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mqanjelwa Paulos Hadebe
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, in 1993.

name: Musawenkosi Pipi Hadebe
description: Was shot dead on 2 April 1994 when IFP supporters opened fire on a Church congregation in an ANC stronghold in Bhekezulu, Estcourt, Natal. Five other people died in this attack, including Musawenkosi’s brother.

name: Nomfundo Hadebe
description: Was killed in her bedroom in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 5 August 1992, when she was struck with a petrol bomb thrown by IFP supporters. She was niece of ANC supporters. Her brother was also killed, and an aunt was injured in the attack.

name: Nozipho Cynthia Mbabe Hadebe
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and beaten by ANC supporters in her home at Mahwaqa, near Port Shepstone, in 1992.

name: Ntombenhle Veronika Hadebe
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burgled and burnt down by IFP supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 24 October 1992.

name: Patricia Nontuthuzelo Hadebe
description: Her home was burnt down by IFP supporters in a dawn attack on the ANC stronghold of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 16 February 1993. Ten people were killed and thirty five houses were burnt down.

name: Phindile Hadebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 5 May 1991.

name: Promise Philisiwe Hadebe
description: Was severely burnt when IFP supporters threw a petrol bomb into her house in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 5 August 1992. She was the sister of ANC supporters. Her niece and nephew were killed in the attack. The house was destroyed.

name: Prudence Hadebe
description: Was burnt to death in an attack on her home at KwaMondi, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, on 30 November 1993, when IFP supporters carried out several attacks on ANC supporters in the areas around Eshowe. One person was killed and more than forty five homes were burnt down. Three other family members were injured in the attack. The attack was allegedly instigated by a local IFP-supporting chief seeking to drive ANC supporters out of the area.

name: Qinisela Addison Hadebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP members when they attacked his house at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 January 1993. Four perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Reginald Behumuzi Hadebe
description: An ANC Midlands Exective Committee member who was shot dead when the car in which he was travelling was ambushed by named members of the IFP between Richmond and Ixopo, Natal, on 27 October 1992. The occupants of the car were part of an ANC delegation returning from a peace meeting in the area.

name: Sandile Hadebe
description: Was shot dead when IFP supporters opened fire on a church congregation in an ANC stronghold in Bhekezulu, Estcourt, Natal, on 2 April 1994. Five other people died in this attack, including Sandile’s brother.

name: Siphiwe Alson Hadebe
description: A COSATU member who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 29 August 1991, because he was assisting ANC youths in the area.

name: Siyabonga Hadebe
description: Was killed when IFP supporters threw a petrol bomb into a house at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 5 August 1992. He was the nephew of ANC supporters. His sister was also killed and an aunt injured in the attack.

name: Thandokuhle Cyril Hadebe
description: His house in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, was petrol bombed on 15 February 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Zwi Boy Hadebe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Inkanyezi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 October 1992.

name: Alpheus Hajane
description: Was severely assaulted, his family members killed and his home and possessions burnt by IFP supporters in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 10 September 1990 during ongoing clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Gidion Zamiqhinga Hayiya
description: An ANC supporter who was detained and charged with murder on 15 November 1985 in Middelburg, Cape. He was convicted and sentenced to seven years’ imprisonment. He had allegedly refused to act as a police informer.

name: Khabele Heise
description: Was shot dead in Dube, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 8 March 1992 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Richard Hlongwane
description: Was injured in a shooting in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 11 May 1992 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Sithembiso Jiliza
description: Was shot at her aunt’s house in Senaoane, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 9 March 1991 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Two others were killed and Ms Jiliza was reportedly paralysed as a result of her injuries.

name: Philisiwe Hlela
description: Was stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 4 December 1991 in intense political conflict in the area. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Bekabakubo Paulos Jingela
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by the Amavaravara in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, in 1992.

name: Musa Patford Huma
description: Was shot dead in Tembisa, Transvaal on the 23 December 1993, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC-supporting residents.

name: Sebenzile Sabhina Hlongwane
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack in Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, in June 1991 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Hilton Vusumzi Jinikwe
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared in April 1985 in Kirkwood, Cape, together with his friend with whom he was planning to go into exile. He has not been seen since.

name: Sibusiso Erick Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who died instantly when he was stabbed with a spear by IFP supporters in Bruntville, KwaZulu, near Mooi River, Natal, on 16 August 1991, in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Sindisiwe Hlongwane
description: An IFP supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 21 August 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. See Richmond Farm arson attacks.

name: Isaiah Jiyane
description: Was killed by IFP supporters when he was thrown off a moving train near Denver station, Johannesburg, on 28 March 1994. Several people were killed on trains that day in reaction to the shootings that had taken place at the ANC headquarters at Shell House.

name: Basongile Hlengwa
description: An IFP supporter who was forced by ANC supporters to abandon her home near Hammarsdale, Natal, on 28 August 1991.

name: Mzolisi Johannes
description: An ANC supporter who broke his fingers when the door of a police van was slammed shut on his hand. He was detained at Soweto-by-the Sea, Port Elizabeth, on 16 June 1986, during a commemoration for the Soweto uprising. He was beaten and kicked by members of the police.

name: Nancy Sanuse Jones
description: Her house and belongings were burnt in an arson attack at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the early 1990s.

name: Zenele Alsom Josisa
description: His house was burnt down in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, during January 1993, in intensifying political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Anderson Dalagubhe Joyi
description: A committee member of the Bumbane Tribal Authority who was detained several times in 1963 in Umtata, Transkei, because of his involvement in ANC underground meetings.

name: Nomatshawe Amelia Jozi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down on 30 April 1990 in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal, by a group of men carrying traditional weapons and looking for ANC supporters. Nine homes were burnt in the area that day. At the time, ANC supporters were being attacked, and some killed, in an attempt to prevent the ANC from setting up local branches in the area.

name: Mchithwa Jula
description: His house was destroyed in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during 1993, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Wellington Solomon Jula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 March 1994, during political conflict in the area during the run-up to the first democratic election in April 1994.

name: Wellington Solomon Jula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 March 1994, during political conflict in the area during the run-up to the first democratic election in April 1994.

name: Bekisisa Hlengwa
description: Was shot and killed in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 23 June 1991 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Jeffrey Motsamai Ikaneng
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in Pimville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 24 May 1991 in conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Sipho Hlongwane
description: Was stabbed and stoned to death by ANC supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 17 July 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Edmah Lezi Hlengwa
description: An ANC supporter whose home was set on fire by IFP supporters at KwaMnyandu, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 28 March 1990 during the Seven Day War.

name: Methoyi Hlengwa
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters during political conflict at Umlaas Road, Durban, on 8 April 1993. Mr Hlengwa was on his way back from work when he was attacked.

name: Mzayifani Hlengwa
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and stoned to death by IFP supporters outside Pietermaritzburg, on 7 January 1991, in ongoing political conflict. His body was then burnt inside his vehicle.

name: Sipho Emmanuel Hlengwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by fellow IFP supporters at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 January 1994. The perpetrators allegedly believed that he had joined the ANC.

name: Siyazi Hlengwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Hammarsdale, Natal, on 18 October 1991.

name: Zinhle Hlengwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu’s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Vusi Hlomuka
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP members in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in September 1993.

name: Mduzana Hlongo
description: Her cattle was lost and her house destroyed in an arson attack in March 1993 in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her son was killed in the attack.

name: Andries M Hlongwa
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Bennett Mashumpula Hlongwa
description: An IFP supporter who died after he was shot and axed by ANC supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 17 March 1991.

name: Dingisono Hlongwa
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 28 October 1983 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Doris Hlongwa
description: An ANC supporter whose house at Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters in 1990.

name: Gatu Hlongwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death after being abducted from his home by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992, during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Khetheyakhe Hlongwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in May 1991 in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal.

name: Lucky Hlongwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Lucky Hlongwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mantu Agnes Manhlanyeni Hlongwa
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Okhalweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 March 1991, allegedly because she was perceived to be an ANC supporter.

name: Mcupheni Joseph Hlongwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead while he slept in Gamalakhe, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 November 1993. Mr Hlongwa’s son and son-in-law were also killed during the attack.

name: Musawenkosi Richard Hlongwa
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters at Hammarsdale, Natal, in April 1990, in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Thembisile Hlongwa
description: Her house was destroyed in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1994, in violent conflict beween ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zibuyile Norah Hlongwa
description: An ANC supporter whose house was set alight in Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 18 June 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Zwelethemba Hlongwa
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten to death by named ANC supporters in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 July 1993, allegedly because he was thought to be an IFP supporter.

name: Bekindlela Andreas Hlongwana
description: His home was destroyed in an arson attack in Bulwer, Natal, in January 1992, in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Anthony Hlongwane
description: Was shot dead in an attack on his home at KwaHaza, near Howick, Natal, on 11 April 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Two other family members died in the same attack.

name: Bethuel Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in January 1990. He was forced to flee the area.

name: Bongumusa Ndabitheni Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaNxamalala, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 2 October 1993.

name: De Hlongwane
description: An IFP supporter whose home and possessions were burnt in an attack by ANC supporters at Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, in June 1991.

name: Hlengiwe Betty Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured in Bulwer, Natal, on 29 October 1992, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Innocent Mbuso Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by an IFP supporter in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Innocent Mbuzeni Hlongwane
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Jabulani Mondli Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack near Bulwer, Natal, on 30 November 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Magwagwa Elias Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 9 October 1990 when three AWB members opened fire on a bus travelling to Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban. In the attack seven passengers were killed and twenty seven injured. Two AWB members were granted amnesty. One amnesty application was refused.

name: Vusumuzi Richard Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Oliviershoek, near Bergville, Natal, on 17 September 1993. Mr Hlongwane was reportedly killed because he supported the return of banished Chief Hlongwane.

name: Walter Sokesimbone Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP members near Stanger, Natal, on 9 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Walter Sokesimbone Hlongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP members near Stanger, Natal, on 9 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Masuduka Kala
description: An ANC supporter who was killed and mutilated in Flagstaff, Transkei, on 9 March 1994 during the Xopozo massacre of ANC supporters by the followers of Chief Mdutshane.

name: Khetheyakhe Hlongwe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by an IFP supporter at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 May 1991, during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Rodney Goba Eleazor Keswa
description: A commander in the Transkei Defence Force (TDF) who was tortured in detention on 27 May 1981 in Engcobo, Transkei. He had travelled to foreign countries to seek military assistance. On his return he was accused of meeting with the ANC and was branded as a communist.

name: Samuel Rasemoko Kalake
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by members of the IFP-aligned Khetisi Kheswa gang in a drive-by shooting in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 26 June 1993. Another family member was killed in the same attack. See Khetisi Kheswa gang.

name: Khona Gustina Hlabisa
description: Was shot and injured and her house in Hlabisa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, was burnt down in January 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: James Victor Issel
description: An ANC supporter who was held in custody for eleven months from 1 May 1979 in Worcester prison, Cape. He was arrested for alleged involvement in an arson attack in Worcester, but was acquitted. He was detained in June 1980 and again August 1985 for one month.

name: James Victor Issel
description: An ANC supporter who was held in custody for eleven months from 1 May 1979 in Worcester prison, Cape. He was arrested for alleged involvement in an arson attack in Worcester, but was acquitted. He was detained in June 1980 and again August 1985 for one month.

name: James Victor Issel
description: An ANC supporter who was held in custody for eleven months from 1 May 1979 in Worcester prison, Cape. He was arrested for alleged involvement in an arson attack in Worcester, but was acquitted. He was detained in June 1980 and again August 1985 for one month.

name: Thapelo Itumeleng
description: Was beaten to death in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, in June 1990 following a split in the ANC- aligned Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC). The KYC split into two opposing factions, the ‘Gadaffis’ and the ‘Zim-zims’. The split led to a number of deaths in the area.

name: Mantombi Kate Jabulana
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 March 1993.

name: Nkobe Joseph Jaca
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and hacked to death by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 28 February 1993 in intense conflict between the ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions.

name: Andile Jack
description: Was shot and injured in Nyanga, Cape Town, on 19 June 1991, when a group of men opened fire on the vehicle in which he was travelling, killing his uncle, an ANC activist. A member of an ANC self-defence unit applied for and was refused amnesty for the incident (AC/2000/003).

name: Mziwonke Solomon 'Pro ' Jack
description: An ANC member and former Robben Island prisoner who was shot dead in Nyanga, Cape Town, on 19 June 1991 when a  group of men opened fire on the vehicle in which he was travelling. His nephew was wounded in the attack. A member of an ANC self-defence unit applied for and was refused amnesty for the incident (AC/2000/003). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Leah Jakoba
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Bekkersdal, Transvaal was burnt down by IFP supporters on 28 November 1993 after she attended the funeral of Chris Hani.

name: Posho Rogers Kalala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 2 March 1992.

name: Mildred Hlabisa
description: Was shot dead in Empangeni, Natal, on 4 June 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sikhumbuzo Stanley Hlongwe
description: An ANC supporter who died after being shot and stabbed by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 5 July 1992.

name: Alexia Fikelephi Hlope
description: Was beaten and stabbed to death by IFP supporters near Umkomaas, Natal, on 31 December 1992, during political conflict. His sons were ANC supporters.

name: Moeketsi Moses Ketsise
description: Was shot dead by members of the IFP-aligned Khetisi Kheswa Gang in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 15 May 1992 during the gang’s reign of terror. A number of criminal gangs supported the IFP in their conflict with the ANC.

name: Karabo Jonas Kgau
description: An ANC supporter who died when he was hacked with a panga and thrown out of a moving train by IFP supporters in Johannesburg on 29 October 1993. See train violence.

name: Maesela Thomas Sinky Kgobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in Soshanguve, Pretoria, on 4 February 1986 during confrontations between youth and police after the youth set up barricades in the streets.

name: Jerry Majeremane Kgofela
description: An ANC supporter who was detained and beaten in Kagiso, Transvaal on 11 June 1987 during a bus boycott.

name: Doctor Nakale Kgogome
description: Was abducted by ANC supporters and set alight after a brief kangaroo court trial in Munsieville, Krugersdorp, Transvaal, in April 1986 during a period of intense political conflict. He died of his injuries in hospital.

name: Mohlouwa Jonas Kgosietsile
description: An ANC supporter and trade union leader who was beaten to death in police cells in Rustenburg, Transvaal, on 19 January 1992, allegedly because he was seen to be an ‘instigator’ of political activity on the mines.

name: Luvuyo Calvin Kalipa
description: A SAYCO member who was shot and injured by community councillors in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 23 December 1989, during a youth march past the municipal offices. There were numerous deaths and injuries in December 1989 when Jeffrey Nongwe, a subordinate of conservative Crossroads mayor Johnson Ngxobongwana, sought to break away with his supporters and join the ANC.

name: Luvuyo Calvin Kalipa
description: A SAYCO member who was shot and injured by community councillors in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 23 December 1989, during a youth march past the municipal offices. There were numerous deaths and injuries in December 1989 when Jeffrey Nongwe, a subordinate of conservative Crossroads mayor Johnson Ngxobongwana, sought to break away with his supporters and join the ANC.

name: Thabiso Pascali Hlalele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 15 June 1992 when gunmen opened fire on the taxi in which he was travelling. Random drive-by shootings and attacks on taxis were aimed at sowing terror in the Vaal communities.

name: Mjongeni Hlamandana
description: An ANC member who was severely assaulted while in detention in March 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, because of his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Bahlamkile Ottilia Hlangu
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack in Ixopo, Natal, in July 1993 in continuing politcal conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bavelile Florence Hlangu
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters at Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, on 23 April 1992.

name: Joyce Annastasia Hlangulela
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in June 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Sipho Hlangulela
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters at Emachobeni, Richmond, Natal, in June 1991.

name: Thembekile Hlangulela
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters at Ixopo, Natal, on 13 April 1993.

name: Hlophe Hlanguza
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 29 October 1989, in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Thembelihle Nomafa Hlanguza
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 29 October 1989, in intensifying political conflict in the area. Her son was killed in the attack.

name: Lulama Joyce Hlanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named members of a group opposed to consumer boycotts on 26 January 1991 in Barkly East, Cape.

name: Samuel Hlapezulu
description: An ANC supporter who was detained in Cape Town, in 1963. He was charged with furthering the aims of the ANC, but was acquitted.

name: Angelina Hlatshwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 11 September 1991, after boarding a bus which was stopped outside Mshayazafe hostel by a hostel-dweller who threw a hand grenade into the bus. Gunmen then opened fire on the crowded bus. Ms Hlatshwayo attempted to flee the bus and was shot several times from behind. Four people were killed and about sixty injured in the incident. See hostels.

name: Francis Bheki Hlatshwayo
description: Was beaten to death in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 29 June 1993, at a ‘people’s court’ under the command of an officer of a local ANC self-defence unit (SDU). Mr Hlatshwayo was one of two people killed that day, and five others wereseverely beaten, allegedly for crimes committed in the community. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/033). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: John Mpikayipheli Hlatshwayo
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Makhehla Piet Hlatshwayo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and thrown out of a moving train by ANC supporters in Alberton, Transvaal, on 15 July 1993. See train violence.

name: Mt Hlatshwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 5 April 1992.

name: Mzwandile Khehla Hlatshwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and shot dead on 11 May 1993 in KwaMashu, Durban, together with four other ANC supporters, including a pregnant woman. Their bodies were found at a local school, and an IFP chief was implicated in the murders. Mr Hlatshwayo had recently returned from exile.

name: Sipho Hlatshwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death by IFP supporters in Dumbe, Paulpietersburg, Natal, on 25 March 1994 while he was distributing ANC voting pamphlets. Five other people were killed in the area that day while distributing pamphlets.

name: Thokozani Hlatshwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a group of IFP supporters at Woodford, Bergville, Natal, on 27 February 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thokozani Hlatshwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a group of IFP supporters at Woodford, Bergville, Natal, on 27 February 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Freddie Vusi Hlatswayo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death, allegedly by IFP supporters, at his home in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 1 January 1992. His brother was killed in the same attack.

name: Joseph Makhozonke Hlatswayo
description: Was stabbed in the back by IFP supporters returning from a funeral on 9 May 1993 in Tembisa, Transvaal. At the time, IFP supporters reportedly attacked residents of Giyane and Thafeni in Tembisa at random, believing them to be ANC supporters.

name: Puseletso Emily Hlatswayo
description: An ANCWL member who survived a hand grenade attack on her home in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 2 May 1991. Her four year old son was severely injured in the explosion.

name: Setota Agnes Assa Sota Hlatswayo
description: Her home in Vereeniging, Transvaal was destroyed in arson attacks by ANC supporters on 20 September 1990.

name: Sifiso Hlatswayo
description: Was critically injured when a hand grenade exploded in his home in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 2 May 1991. His mother, an ANCWL member, was also injured in the attack.

name: Siphiwe Victor Hlatswayo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters, at his home in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 1 January 1992. His brother was killed in the same attack.

name: Mohanuwa Edith ‘Nani’ Hlauli
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted and raped by IFP supporters at the Lefhiedi household in Sharpeville, Vereeniging, Transvaal, on 19 April 1993. The perpetrators raped three women before killing a total of seven people. Ms Hlauli was the only survivor because she pretended to be dead.

name: Bakhokhisile Hlekwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 December 1993.

name: Cabangile Doris Hlekwayo
description: She had her family home burnt down by IFP supporters in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 December 1993. Ms Hlekwayo’s son was an ANC supporter.

name: Elizabeth Hlekwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 July 1993.

name: Erick Muziwakhe Hlekwayo
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by other IFP supporters in Dondata Reserve, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 April 1991, because he was thought to support the ANC.

name: Mafomu Thembukwazi Hlekwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 27 July 1993, in continuing political conflict in the area. Earlier that month he had been severely assaulted by the same perpetrators.

name: Siphiwe Mpikeni Hlekwayo
description: Was shot dead in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 14 September 1993, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thulani Hlekwayo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Emathunzi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 December 1993.

name: Bhekizitha Hlophe
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured in an attack by IFP supporters in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 January 1991.

name: Wandile Kallipa
description: An ANC member who was injured in an explosion on 5 July 1979 in Maseru, Lesotho, when a parcel containing an explosive device was opened. Five other people were injured in the incident.

name: Dlokwakhe Eugene Hlophe
description: Was shot and injured by members of the ANC breakaway gang known as the Amavaravaras in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 23 November 1989. The perpetrators were allegedly looking for his son, an ANC supporter.

name: Emma Nkehlana ‘Mamsayizi’ Hlophe
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 18 November 1993. Two members of her family were shot dead in the attack.

name: Galus Hlophe
description: Was stabbed to death by members of the ANC breakaway gang known as the Amavaravaras in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 24 September 1989, in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Isaac Hlophe
description: Was stabbed to death by members of the ANC breakaway gang known as the Amavaravaras in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 24 September 1989, in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Lille Ntombizokwenzani Hlophe
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters at Mahehle, Ixopo, Natal, on 13 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Lille Ntombizokwenzani Hlophe
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters at Mahehle, Ixopo, Natal, on 13 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mayvis Hlophe
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Bulwer, Natal, on 29 October 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Mphikeleli Alfred Hlophe
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured by named IFP supporters in a drive-by shooting at Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 22 December 1993, during continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Nhlanhla Fortune Hlophe
description: His family home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, during 1991. He and his ANC-supporting family had gone into hiding following threats on their lives.

name: Nokudiwa Hlophe
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nokuthula Hlophe
description: Her house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1990 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nomasonto Sibongile Hlophe
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Robert Hlophe
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 30 June 1993.

name: Samuel Hlophe
description: Was burnt to death in an arson attack on his home in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 16 August 1993 in conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Savelle Vusumuzi Hlophe
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 18 June 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thembisile Philda Hlophe
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack at Ngonweni, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 15 November 1992, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Toloto Christina Hlophe
description: Her house was destroyed in an arson attack at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 29 August 1992, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Xolani Hlophe
description: Was shot dead by members of the ANC breakaway group known as the Amavaravaras at KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 6 January 1992, in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Bekizizwe Conrad Hlubi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters when a large armed group of IFP hostel-dwellers, supported by the security forces, launched two attacks on ANC supporters in Bruntville, Mooi River, Natal. In all, eighteen ANC supporters were killed in these attacks and at least one hundred homes were burnt or damaged.

name: Bhekizizwe Goodluck Hlubi
description: Was shot dead by an IFP supporter while sleeping at his home in Woodford, Bergville, Natal, on 31 December 1993. He was reportedly suspected of being an ANC supporter.

name: Hombaselo Hobiya
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home at Mbozama, Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, in an arson attack on 24 December 1993 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Lizo Leonard Hoboyi
description: Was shot and injured in the home of his father, an ANC supporter, in Tembisa, Kempton Park, Transvaal, on 1 August 1993, during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Amos Mazizi Kango
description: An ANC leader who lost his home in an arson attack by followers of Chief Mdutshane in Flagstaff, Transkei, on 3 January 1993. At the time, the ANC’s attempt to establish a branch at Xopozo were opposed by the Chief.

name: Petros Balekile Kanunu
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned by named ‘comrades’ who accused him of being an informer in Duduza, Nigel, Transvaal, in April 1985.

name: Mafuza Kasana
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted while defending himself and his family against an attack on his home by members of the A-Team in Thabong, Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS) in 1985. In the attack, he and other family members were sjambokked. One of his brothers was killed.

name: Moffat Mafu Kasana
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten while defending his family against an attack by members of the A-Team in Thabong, Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS) in 1985. Members of his family were sjambokked and one of his brothers was shot dead in the attack.

name: Nomahlubi Veronica Kasana
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten in an attack on her family by members of the A-Team in Thabong, Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS) in 1985.

name: Nomasonto Verelene Sonti Kasana
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten in an attack on her family by members of the A-Team in Thabong, Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS) in 1985.

name: Suzan Kasana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in an attack on her family by members of the A-Team in Thabong, Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS) in 1985.

name: Lindela Katamzi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, during the Folweni massacre on 26 July 1992. See Folweni massacre.

name: Dederick Baleseng Katane
description: Was hacked to death by IFP supporters in Kagiso, Transvaal, on 22 August 1990 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Zamiwonga James Kati
description: An ANC member active in Transkei opposition politics who was detained in 1962 in the Eastern Cape and was severely beaten by police. He then served eight years on Robben Island from 1964. After his release in 1972 he was banned. In 1977 he was detained and tortured in Cape Town. He was detained in 1980 in the Transkei for his ongoing activity in opposition politics. In 1981 he was again detained in the Transkei and severely tortured there and in East London, after which he served an effective six year prison sentence for terrorism.

name: Susan-Anne Keane
description: The Secretary-General of the Johannesburg-North ANC who was killed when AWB members detonated a car bomb in Bree Street, Johannesburg on 24 April 1994 in an effort to disrupt the electoral process. Seven people were killed and thirteen injured in the blast. Two perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342). See right-wing attacks.

name: Zwelifile Khowa
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by IFP supporters while on his way to a bus stop in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 December 1990 and has not been seen again. He is presumed dead.

name: Bhekuyise Khoza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and burnt to death near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 September 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bongani Sylvester Khoza
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in an attack on residents in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 8 November 1990. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Christian Kungumuzi Khoza
description: An ANC supporter whose house in KwaMashu, Durban, was petrol bombed in April 1994 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. More than fifteen people died in KwaMashu over a two-week period. About three thousand residents were forced to flee their homes.

name: Christian Kungumuzi Khoza
description: An ANC supporter whose house in KwaMashu, Durban, was petrol bombed in April 1994 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. More than fifteen people died in KwaMashu over a two-week period. About three thousand residents were forced to flee their homes.

name: Dami Lydia Khoza
description: Her home in Empangeni, Natal was burnt down on 21 August 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mamota Rosy Kumalo
description: Her house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in April 1991 in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bhekuyise Themba Christian Khumalo
description: He survived an attempted killing in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 31 May 1991 when IFP supporters attacked his home. His brother was killed in the attack and his friend was shot and injured. They were targeted because they were suspected of being ANC supporters.

name: Mandlakayise Daniel Khoza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by an IFP supporter in Empangeni, Natal, on 23 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Nine people were killed in the KwaMthethwa and Enseleni areas near Empangeni that month.

name: Mandlakayise Daniel Khoza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by an IFP supporter in Empangeni, Natal, on 23 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Nine people were killed in the KwaMthethwa and Enseleni areas near Empangeni that month.

name: Mdau Zebo Khoza
description: Was shot dead in Mandela Park, Odendaalsrus, Orange Free State (OFS), on 4 November 1990, by unidentified persons, allegedly ANC supporters, who demanded that he help them fight the AmaRussians. See AmaRussians.

name: Mhlabunzima Mfundiseni Khoza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks. See self-defence unit (SDU).

name: Mhlupheki Khoza
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in March 1993. See ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions.

name: Mveli Khoza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, during July 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Thomas Khoza
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and his house was burnt down by ‘comrades’ in Nelspruit, Transvaal, on 10 January 1993.

name: Ti Khoza
description: An IFP supporter who died in Ethethe, Stanger, Natal, on 27 July 1993 after being attacked by unidentified residents of the community in retaliation for stabbing a prominent ANC community representative to death.

name: Zenzele Alpheus Khoza
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from his home and beaten by IFP supporters in Bergville, Natal, on 17 October 1993. He was released after the beating, but was attacked and shot in the leg by a second group of IFP supporters on his way home.

name: Zondani Gretta Khoza
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Okhalweni, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in July 1991.

name: Ntombithini Elizabeth Khubisa
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Siphiwe Khubisa
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Appelsbosch, near Stanger, Natal, on 18 September 1993.

name: Thokozani Khubisa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured, and had his house burnt down, in Gingindlovu, Natal, in intense political conflict in the area in 1990.

name: Nomathamsanqa Priscilla Khubone
description: An ANC supporter who was raped at gunpoint by a named IFP supporter in Edendale, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1993 during an IFP recruitment campaign. Ms Khubone fell pregnant as a result of the rape.

name: Tembekile Mildred Khubone
description: An ANC supporter who was harassed by members of the IFP during an IFP recruitment campaign at Bulwer, Natal, in 1993.

name: Cornelius Bhekamabhele Khuboni
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared from Ixopo, Natal, on 7 January 1994. He was taken from his house by ANC youth alleging that they were on their way to an ANC meeting. Mr Khuboni was never seen again.

name: Sizeni Rithah Khuboni
description: had her house at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down on 30 September 1991 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Her companion was shot dead in this incident.

name: Tswana Khulezweni
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death with a bush knife by IFP supporters in Carletonville, Transvaal, in August 1992, following a meeting on the East Driefontein Mine.

name: Ntombiyesichaka Minah Khulu
description: She lost her possessions when her house was looted in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in March 1993 during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zazi Carol Khulu
description: An IFP supporter who died after he was shot and his throat was cut by ANC supporters at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal on 16 December 1992 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Fikile Jennifer Khuluse
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down in an arson attack in Emakhuliseni, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 30 September 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nikwephi Doris Khuluse
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down in an arson attack in Emakhuliseni, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 30 September 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: (First Name Not Given) Khumalo
description: Was shot and killed by IFP supporters in Dube, Soweto, Johannesburg in 1993 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: (First Name Not Given) Khumalo
description: A leader of the Khumalo gang who suffered damage to property when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) detonated a hand grenade at his home during political conflict in Tokoza, Transvaal, during 1994. Three SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0243). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: (First Name Not Given) Khumalo
description: Was severely beaten and later killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Transvaal in September 1993, allegedly because he was believed to be associated with the Khumalo gang and one member of the KZP. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the assault (AC/1999/186). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Absalom Zwelubanzi Khumalo
description: His house and tuck shop were petrol bombed by IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in July 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Anthony Khumalo
description: Was shot dead and his body was burnt in an arson attack on his home at Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in June 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Babazile Busangani Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was set on fire by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1993.

name: Bangizwe Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 June 1991.

name: Ben Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 11 September 1990 when he and other commuters were attacked on a train. See train violence.

name: Bheki Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks. See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Nokwaliwa Leah Kumalo
description: She lost her house in an arson attack on 23 December 1991 at Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bishop Khumalo
description: A leader of the Khumalo gang who suffered damage to his home and motor vehicle when it was attacked by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Transvaal, during November 1993. Two SDU members were granted amnesty for the incident (AC/1999/0186). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Johanna Aleta Klaasen
description: Was injured when a bomb placed by members of the ANC exploded in Johannesburg on 30 July 1987.

name: Makgabutlane Frans Kgwete
description: An ANC supporter who was injured when thrown from a moving train by IFP supporters in Germiston, Transvaal, on 17 May 1991. See train violence.

name: Kp Khathi
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Ntombizodwa Christina Khaba
description: Was stabbed to death by members of the Black Cats on 12 April 1992 in Wesselton, Transvaal. She was allegedly killed because her son left the IFP for the ANC.

name: Mataku Ernestina Khathi
description: Her house near Ixopo, Natal, was destroyed in an arson attack in February 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. She was forced to flee the area.

name: Hawukile Christinah Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, in May 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Aaron Saki Khabingca
description: An ANC activist who was arrested in Engcobo, Transkei, in 1962, during the ANC’s ‘Mayibuye’ sabotage campaign, and taken to Van Rensburg prison, Cape Town, where he was tortured. Mr Khabingca was later charged with attempted murder and served a six-year sentence on Robben Island.

name: Peseniya Caiphas Kumalo
description: He had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1992. The perpetrators had apparently been looking for Mr Kumalo’s sons, who had resisted IFP attempts to break their allegiance to the ANC.

name: Ntulizwe Robert Khumalo
description: Was initimidated and threatened by ANC supporters at Luganda near Klaarwater, Natal, during 1988. He was forced to leave the area.

name: Boy Simon Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in 1991.

name: Sheqe Albert Kumalo
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Busisiwe Emilly Khumalo
description: Was severely injured when a bomb planted by ANC operatives exploded in a courtroom in Newcastle, Natal, in 1991.

name: Phabantu Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in KwaDabeka, near Durban, in political conflict in the area on 2 February 1993.

name: Cabangani Templeton Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 7 June 1993.

name: Thabi Francisca Khathide
description: An ANC supporter whose house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 14 June 1991.

name: Jerome Thamsanqa Khuzwayo
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 1 August 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area. The perpetrators had accused Mr Khuzwayo of making weapons for the ANC.

name: Phiwayinkosi Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter who lost his house in an arson attack and was shot in the head by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 10 June 1993, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Johnson Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter who died after being severely assaulted by IFP supporters in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 6 January 1991.

name: Chambusile Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Phumzile Khumalo
description: Was shot dead in Empangeni, Natal, on 11 April 1992 during ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Arnold Kotelo
description: An attorney who was abducted from home and shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU), who also stole his vehicle, in Daveyton, Transvaal, in August 1993. Two SDU members were refused amnesty for the incident (AC/2000/227) See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Samson Thabiso Khakhane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 3 November 1993 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bangeni Hermina Khati
description: An ANC supporter whose house at Nokweja, Ixopo, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 28 July 1993.

name: Charlotte Siziwe Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nelson Lala
description: Was injured when a pipe bomb planted by members of the AWB exploded on 25 April 1994 at a taxi rank on the corner of Blood Street and Seventh Avenue in Pretoria. Three people were killed and four injured in the blast. During the pre-election period the AWB targeted taxi ranks, bus stops and railway stations, predominantly used by black people, the majority of whom they believed to be ANC supporters, in order to derail the April 1994 elections. Six perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342).

name: Nelson Lala
description: Was injured when a pipe bomb planted by members of the AWB exploded on 25 April 1994 at a taxi rank on the corner of Blood Street and Seventh Avenue in Pretoria. Three people were killed and four injured in the blast. During the pre-election period the AWB targeted taxi ranks, bus stops and railway stations, predominantly used by black people, the majority of whom they believed to be ANC supporters, in order to derail the April 1994 elections. Six perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342).

name: Lilly Wikha Landingwe
description: Her house and possessions were burnt by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in November 1993. Her son, an ANC supporter, was killed in the attack.

name: Mandla Patrick Landingwe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in an attack on his home in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 7 November 1993.

name: Amon Langa
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 9 March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Amon Langa
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 9 March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bester Langa
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed by ANC supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in November 1990.

name: Bongani Selby Langa
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death when IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers attacked ANC supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, in November 1990. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Bonginkosi Aubrey Langa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Christine Shirley Langa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 December 1992. The attack was allegedly the work of the Esikhawini Hit Squad.

name: Diphapang Marcus Mareka Langa
description: An ANC supporter who was detained and tortured at a Parys police station, Orange Free State (OFS), in June 1984, allegedly because of his involvement in an organised school boycott.

name: Jabulani Nkosenye Langa
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: John Langa
description: An ANC supporter who died from multiple injuries inflicted by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991, in intense political conflict in the area. See Richmond attacks.

name: Lindeni Ivy Langa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed by IFP supporters in an arson attack at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in April 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Magcekeni Herbert Langa
description: An IFP supporter who had his house burnt down by ANC supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in November 1990. His wife was stabbed and severely injured in the attack.

name: Michael Ngamula Langa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Durban on 12 March 1993 during continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Mvakashi Langa
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death, allegedly by ANC supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 14 August 1990.

name: Mzu Caiphas Langa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead on 14 February 1994 in Durban, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mzu Caiphas Langa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead on 14 February 1994 in Durban, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nkosinathi Emmanuel Langa
description: His home and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack on 24 March 1992 in Empangeni, Natal, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Phaphamani Langa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at his home in Umlazi, Durban, on 24 August 1992, by men wearing camouflage uniforms. The men had first thrown teargas into the house. The attack occurred at a time of intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Phumzile Josephina Langa
