description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during February1990, following the unbanning of political organisations on 2 February. Ms Langa’s son was killed in the attack.

name: Sibuku Petros Langa
description: Was shot dead when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Zoleka Rosemary Langa
description: An ANC supporter who was tortured with electric shocks at the Bizana police station, Transkei, in 1989.

name: Petros Kufakwezwe Lata
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in July 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bangizwe Eric Latha
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by fellow ANC supporters in KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, on 11 March 1991 in an internal power struggle.

name: Fakazani Albertina Latha
description: An IFP supporter who had her house and possessions burnt in an arson attack in Umkomaas, near Durban, during 1992 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Pretty Pn Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by named IFP supporters at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 15 August 1992.

name: Makulana Khatshwa
description: An ANC supporter who was detained in 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, and later sentenced to three years’ imprisonment in East London during which he was tortured and forced to do hard labour. He had been part of the Pondoland revolt. Mr Khatshwa died a week after his release. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Khetha Muhlebona Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Alice Fikile Kunene
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 2 February 1992, in intense political conflict in the area. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Delani Selby Khumalo
description: Was shot and injured at Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in May 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Qhoshephi Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Rejoice Dudu Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Kho Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was looted and vandalised by named IFP supporters in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, in September 1992.

name: Den David Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 3 September 1993.

name: Njabulo Khamba
description: Was shot dead on 5 February 1992 at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, when armed men in two minibuses opened fire on ANC supporters, killing three people at a home and three schoolchildren on their way to school.

name: Derrick Bongani Khumalo
description: He died after being shot and burnt in a petrol bomb attack on his home near Empangeni, Natal, on 29 July 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Robert Siphiwe Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Matimatolo, Greytown, Natal. IFP supporters, seeking to drive ANC supporters out of the area, also killed Mr Khumalo’s father and brother, in separate attacks.

name: Sindisiwe Thuleleni Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. Ms Khuzwayo, who was five months pregnant at the time, miscarried when she fled into the mountains in an attempt to escape the violence. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Rodney Bizzah Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and left for dead by a crowd of about two hundred IFP supporters returning from a rally in Woodford, Bergville, Natal on 16 December 1993. Two ANC members were killed and at least two others injured in the same attack. The same group of IFP supporters subsequently attacked mourners attending the funeral of two other ANC supporters. They set fire to a marquee, killed an elderly relative of one of the deceased, and burnt down five homes in the surrounding area.

name: Bhekuyise Godfrey Kunene
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when IFP members opened fire on ANC youth in Paulpietersburg, Natal, on 19 November 1993.

name: Phangiwe Irene Kowa
description: An IFP supporter whose house near Port Shepstone, Natal, was burnt down by ANC supporters on 9 April 1991.

name: Moya Kleinbooi Koaho
description: Was attacked and killed by IFP supporters in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Transvaal, on 2 May 1993 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Bongani Eric Kunene
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in front of his wife in a targeted killing by members of a self-defence unit (SDU) in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 31 October 1993, on suspicion that he had become a police informer. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/027). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Sebenzile Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Elizabeth Khumalo
description: She suffered severe burns when a petrol bomb was thrown into her house near Howick, Natal, on 6 April 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sevi Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters in Estcourt, Natal, April 1992 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Baphindile Florinah Koza
description: She lost her home at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1993.

name: Edward Mvuyo Khambule
description: Was shot dead by a named perpetrator at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 March 1994, when the car he was driving was ambushed during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His employer’s daughter was also killed, and her brother and father were injured in the attack.

name: Duduzile Monica Kunene
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down and her livestock stolen by ANC supporters at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Duduzile Monica Kunene
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down and her livestock stolen by ANC supporters at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Annatoria Ncamisile Khawula
description: Was shot dead when hooded gunmen attacked three homes at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 20 June 1993. See Murchison attacks.

name: Emmanuel Xolani Khumalo
description: an ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 21 March 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the first democratic election of April 1994.

name: Emmanuel Xolani Khumalo
description: an ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 21 March 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the first democratic election of April 1994.

name: Siduduzo Cedric Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by IFP members during political violence at Ireland Township, Mandini, Natal, on 31 October 1992. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Mbuso (Kubheka) Khambule
description: A member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) who was assaulted and killed by fellow SDU members in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 8 October 1993. Mr Khambule had allegedly killed another SDU member, for which the penalty was death. Three SDU members were granted amnesty for the killing (AC/1999/0243).

name: Aubrey Mnguthu Khanla Khawula
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Gamalakhe, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 13 August 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Dumisani Sifiso Kunene
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217). See Richmond attacks.

name: Sihle Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by a named IFP supporter near Ngwelezana Hospital, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 December 1993.

name: Ewert Vusi Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed in Howick, Natal, on 7 April 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sindiswe Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Crawford Sandile Khawula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by Vlakplaas askaris in Chesterville, near Durban, on 21 January 1986, as he was preparing to go into exile. Some of the perpetrators applied for amnesty. See askari.

name: Siphi Phillemon Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Fana Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by ANC supporters in Umkomaas, Natal, on 1 August 1993, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Felani Florence Khawula
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed by other ANC supporters in Mkhazeni, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, during a serious internal feud in the organisation in 1992.

name: Jabulani Kunene
description: Was one of five young ANC supporters shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters during political conflict at KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, on either 14 or 15 July 1991. Residents accused the security forces of involvement, and a top-level police investigation was launched. A prominent IFP chief from Phatheni was charged with these murders.

name: Reginald Nkosana Khambule
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted by IFP supporters in Tsakane, Transvaal, on 5 May 1985, allegedly in an attack targeted at Xhosa-speaking males.

name: Margate Khawula
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down and her possessions stolen by IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 November 1993, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Tswinana Alfred Kratshane
description: Was hacked with a panga and shot by IFP supporters in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 3 September 1990 during a stayaway and ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Johannes Ngxongo Kunene
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack by IFP supporters on 23 June 1991 in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal. See Richmond attacks.

name: Florence Zanyana Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in continuing political conflict in the area during 1991.

name: Fofo Khumalo
description: Was hacked to death by ANC supporters in Umkomaas, Natal, on 1 August 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Sipho Simon Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 6 April 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Thembi Gladys Siso Khambule
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by other IFP supporters at Mdlazi, Port Shepstone, Natal, in May 1992, because her children were ANC supporters.

name: Fundisiwe Khumalo
description: Her house was burnt down in an arson attack in Eshowe, Natal, in November 1993, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mbhekiseni Khawula
description: His family home was destroyed in an arson attack by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, during 1991. His family was allegedly targeted because they were ANC supporters.

name: Gcinizenzo Alpheus Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured on 14 July 1991 when he was shot several times by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal.

name: Sizakele Princess Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 16 October 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Nkampu Timothy Khawula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters, inside his home in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 June 1993. See Murchison attacks.

name: Sizeni Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack at Ngonyameni, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 9 June 1990 in political conflict in the area.

name: Conrad Ncobela Kohla
description: Was shot dead when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Nontle Kohlakali
description: Was shot and injured on 6 October 1992, while asleep in his home in Khayelitsha, Cape Town. Shortly before the attack, his mother’s life had been threatened, because of her prominent role in the ANC Women’s League.

name: Itumeleng Ernest Kojane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by an AWB member while participating in a march to the magistrate’s court in Hertzogville, Orange Free State  (OFS), on 1 March 1994. The AWB had blocked the road in an attempt to prevent ANC supporters from reaching the court.

name: Henry Malapile Kolobe
description: Was shot and injured in Dobsonville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 13 March 1992 by Simphiwe hostel-dwellers during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. Two people died in the attack and another was injured.

name: James Madebe Kolotla
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters from Vusimusi hostel in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 9 June 1992 during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Gladys Nomgcobo Kom
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed by named ADM members on 13 November 1993 in Zwelitsha, Ciskei.

name: Ntombizodwa Matilda Komape
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters at a night vigil in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 26 March 1991 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Bonakabi Komo
description: An IFP supporter who was forced by ANC supporters to flee her home in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 19 August 1991. In her absence, her property was stolen and her home vandalised by ANC supporters.

name: Thembekile Kondlo
description: An ANC member who was severely beaten by ADM members during political conflict in Zwelitsha, Ciskei, on 19 December 1991.

name: Philemon Kopele
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten to death and his body thrown from a train by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 16 August 1990. Mr Kopole had reportedly been singing political songs on the train. See train violence.

name: Sebenza Maria Khawula
description: An IFP supporter whose home was destroyed in an attack by ANC supporters in Kwenkulu, Gamalakhe, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 December 1993, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Gladys Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in intensifying political conflict in the area during 1991.

name: Mildred Kunene
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by alleged IFP supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991, because of her political affiliation and the fact that she lived in an ANC stronghold.

name: Mjwayezeni Kunene
description: Was shot and injured at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in November 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Welkom Khambule
description: An ANC supporter who was detained and tortured at Fisher Street police station in Durban in January 1977.

name: Gombo Engelinah Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Musa Moses Kunene
description: An ANC official who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 26 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Musa Moses Kunene
description: An ANC official who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 26 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zibonele Wilson Khawula
description: His home was burnt down by IFP supporters near Port Shepstone, Natal, in February 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Humphrey Khumalo
description: Was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Vosloorus, Transvaal on 1 January 1993. Mr Khumalo was believed to be a member of the IFP Youth Brigade. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2001/140). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Thembekile Christina Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Umlazi, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 7 April 1992.

name: Thembile Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thobile Khumalo
description: Was shot in the knee by IFP supporters in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her sister and mother were also injured in the attack and the family home was burnt down.

name: Thobile Khumalo
description: Was shot in the knee by IFP supporters in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her sister and mother were also injured in the attack and the family home was burnt down.

name: Tholakele Philisiwe Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thulani Khumalo
description: Was stabbed to death in Ondondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 August 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thulasizwe Clement Khumalo
description: Was one of eight passengers shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Six other passengers were shot dead. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack. See  self-defence units (SDU).

name: Thuthukani Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by named IFP supporters and later found dead at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, during political conflict in the area on 12 April 1994.

name: Velaphi Stanley Khumalo
description: Was shot on 10 November 1992 in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Transvaal, during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Vukani Moses Khumalo
description: Was shot dead in Phumula, Ermelo, Transvaal, on 20 October 1993 during conflict between the IFP-aligned Black Cats and ANC supporters. See Black Cats.

name: Zakhele Simon Khumalo
description: Was hacked and stabbed to death at his home by IFP supporters on 9 June 1991 in Mooi River, Natal, allegedly because he was suspected of being an ANC supporter.

name: Zakhile Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted, stabbed, shot and burnt to death by members of the IFP Youth Brigade at Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 30 April 1994 in political conflict in the area following the April 1994 elections.

name: Zakhile Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted, stabbed, shot and burnt to death by members of the IFP Youth Brigade at Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 30 April 1994 in political conflict in the area following the April 1994 elections.

name: Zantonto Johannes Khumalo
description: Was shot dead when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Zibuyisile Christina Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Zinhle Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt when a petrol bomb was thrown at her home by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, in ongoing political conflict in the area  in February 1992.

name: Zodwa Albertina Khumalo
description: Her home was lost in an arson attack in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, during 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thulebona Khumbule
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by named IFP supporters in Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 6 February 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Thandekile Khumbuza
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Billy Boy Khunong
description: A member of the Eagles Club who was severely beaten when ANC supporters attacked him and five other ‘Eagles Club’ members in Qhoweng, Reddersburg, Orange Free State (OFS) in 1989, allegedly because of their involvement with the club.

name: Ntombi Khusi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombi Khusi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sithembiso Khusi
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in an attack on his neighbour’s house in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 March 1994. The neighbour was also killed and his home burnt down because the family was believed to support the ANC.

name: Beauty Khuzwayo
description: Her house near Richmond, Natal, was burnt down on 23 March 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bhekumuzi Phillip Khuzwayo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 21 February 1994 in intense political conflict in the area. About twenty deaths of both IFP and ANC supporters were recorded that month, along with at least twenty eight incidents of house-burning. Hundreds of people had to flee the area, and schools and shops were forced to close.

name: Bhudluza Peter Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 4 August 1992 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Blessing Sibusiso Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter WHO was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 19 March 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Chithekile Khuzwayo
description: His home was destroyed in an arson attack in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 September 1992, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Duduzile Khuzwayo
description: Was shot on 26 September 1992 and died later in hospital in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Elliot Mkhanyiselwa Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 24 October 1992 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Enny Khonazinhle Ntombi Khuzwayo
description: An IFP supporter who was severely assaulted by ANC supporters at KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, in April 1991 when she went to visit friends in an ANC-dominated area.

name: Fandoda Alpheus Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 13 February 1994, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Ngiqalile Sizeni Kunene
description: Her home and belongings were destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 18 September 1993. Her son, an ANC supporter, was killed in the attack.

name: Innocent Jabulani Khumalo
description: Was shot dead and his body was mutilated by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban in 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ziyaphi Jannet Khawula
description: An IFP supporter who was assaulted, shot and stabbed by ANC supporters in an attack on a bus in Margate, Natal, on 20 April 1992. On 25 June 1993 Ms Khawula’s home in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, was burnt down in continuing political conflict.

name: Ziyaphi Jannet Khawula
description: An IFP supporter who was assaulted, shot and stabbed by ANC supporters in an attack on a bus in Margate, Natal, on 20 April 1992. On 25 June 1993 Ms Khawula’s home in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, was burnt down in continuing political conflict.

name: Nhlangu Kunene
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 18 September 1993. His home was looted and vandalised in the attack.

name: Pius Khena
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters on 8 September 1991 following an IFP rally at Jabulani stadium in White City, Soweto, Johannesburg.

name: Jabile Klara Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt by IFP supporters in Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 7 June 1993.

name: Emma Kheswa
description: Her house was lost in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Boipatong, Transvaal, in December 1990.

name: Nonhlanhla Kunene
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 2 August 1992 when armed men wearing balaclavas attacked several homes in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Jabulisile Grace Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intensifying political conflict in the area in September 1990.

name: Neo Petros Khantsi
description: Was shot dead in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 21 April 1993 by people who accused him of being an informer. Sebokeng was tense following numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Felix Thulani Kheswa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured, allegedly by ANC supporters, in Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: James Hulumeni Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was severely injured when he was stabbed, allegedly by ANC supporters, in Vosloorus, Transvaal on 8 August 1992.

name: Ntombisitni Kunene
description: Her home was burnt down at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Ms Kunene had fled her home at the time of the attack.

name: Fikile Caroline Kheswa
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack in Eshowe, Natal, in June 1993, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Abigail Sibongile Kubeka-Modise
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Orlando, Soweto, Johannesburg, burnt down in 1986 by named perpetrators because of her participation in a peace song that was organised by the apartheid government.

name: Zamokwakhe Kubeka
description: An ANC supporter and a councillor who was shot dead, and his shop was looted, by IFP supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, on 17 November 1990.

name: Gladys Kubheka
description: Her house in Evaton, Transvaal, was attacked by ANC supporters in 1984 during the Vaal uprising in which councillors and their homes were targeted. See Vaal uprisings.

name: Solomon Mandla Kubheka
description: An ANC supporter who was knocked down by an army vehicle patrolling the streets of Alexandra, Johannesburg, in 1992. He died on the way to hospital.

name: Thandi Anna Kubheka
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters while travelling in a train in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 5 April 1991. See train violence.

name: Themba Petros Kubheka
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, on 11 May 1993. Four other ANC supporters were killed with him, including two returnees and a pregnant woman. Their bodies were found at a local school, and a local IFP induna was implicated in their killing.

name: Thoko Tryphina Kubheka
description: Her house in KwaMashu, Durban, was burnt down by ANC supporters on 12 February 1990 in intense political conflict in the area. See Richmond Farm arson attacks.

name: Vusumuzi Joseph Kubheka
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by a named IFP supporter in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 19 October 1992.

name: Bakwenzile Anna Kubone
description: He lost his house in an arson attack near Ixopo, Natal, in June 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thomas Kubone
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 17 April 1992.

name: Makupula Kuebelo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 7 March 1993.

name: Jimmy Kula
description: An ADM member and a headman who was stabbed and stoned to death by named ANC supporters in Alice, Ciskei, on 8 September 1992, in political conflict following the Bisho massacre.

name: Madoda Shackleton Kula
description: He had his home burnt down by named ANC members in Alice, Ciskei, on 8 September 1992, in political conflict following the Bisho massacre. Mr Kula’s father was a headman and an ADM member.

name: Getrude Kumalo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in political conflict between the ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, during 1993.

name: Jabulisile Topsie Kumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was forcibly removed from her house, assaulted and stoned by a named Special Constable in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, in political conflict in the area in early 1990.

name: Philanyenkosi Jouakim Kunene
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters near Vryheid, Natal, on 31 July 1993.

name: Vusi Khanxile
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and his friend injured by a group of IFP supporters near Eshowe, Natal, on 4 January 1991.

name: Japie Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters, at his home in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 23 November 1991. IFP supporters had reportedly made several attempts on Mr Khumalo’s life.

name: Andreas Mboneni Khanyase
description: Was stabbed and permanently disabled by IFP supporters in Umkomaas, Natal, on 7 February 1992, allegedly because he was perceived to be an ANC supporter.

name: Wiseman Kunene
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 June 1991. The perpetrators were reportedly returning from a meeting with a local induna when they met Mr Kunene in the street and stabbed him to death. One of the perpetrators was sentenced to fifteen years’ imprisonment.

name: Mduduzi Paulos Kheswa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by unidentified attackers in Pietermaritzburg on 28 January 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. The attackers allegedly knocked on his door at night and announced themselves as police.

name: Josia Khumalo
description: An ANC activist who was burnt to death by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg on 11 October 1993. His brother had been killed by alleged IFP supporters in 1991.

name: Joyce Ntombifikile Khumalo
description: Her house was destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, in intense political conflict in the area on 12 February 1990.

name: Zonzani Kunene
description: Her house was damaged and livestock was stolen by ANC supporters during political conflict at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in June 1993.

name: Modiehi Annah Kheswa
description: Was severely beaten in Sebokeng, Vereeniging, Transvaal, on 21 April 1993 when three men wearing balaclavas burst into her home. Ms Kheswa believes her home was attacked because she was suspected of being an ANC supporter and had a portrait of Nelson Mandela on her wall. Ms Kheswa’s two sons and three visitors were killed in the attack. The attack took place during a period of intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Lucky Michael Khanyeza
description: An ANC supporter who was badly burnt when his home was petrol-bombed by named IFP supporters near Estcourt, Natal, on 2 April 1992.

name: Khonjisiwe Khumalo
description: Her house was burnt down in an arson attack in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Lameck Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house and tuck shop were destroyed in an arson attack in Stanger, Natal, on 19 December 1993, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Madoda Elphas Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who lost all his belongings when his family was attacked and his home looted by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in 1993, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Mamsie Thandie Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 3 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mamsie Thandie Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 3 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mandla Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 11 September 1990. Mr Khumalo was one of seven people who reportedly died on this day.

name: Mantombi Millicent Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, in continuing political conflict in the area in 1993.

name: Matilda Khumalo
description: She had her home burnt down by a group of IFP supporters as they returned from a rally in Empangeni, Natal, on 3 December 1991. Ms Khumalo was allegedly targeted because of her sons’ association with the ANC.

name: Mbango Empire Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters while driving through Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 25 June 1992. He was targeted allegedly because he was thought to be transporting IFP supporters.

name: Mbhekiseni Allen Nhlanhla Khumalo
description: A member of the KZP who was killed by IFP members at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 November 1992, allegedly because he was thought to be sympathetic to the ANC. Another person in his company at the time was also killed in the attack. Three perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332). See Esikhawini hit squad.

name: Mbuyiseni Aron Khumalo
description: An ANC member who was stabbed to death by named perpetrators in Dobsonville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 16 June 1976. See Soweto uprising.

name: Mdelwa Elphas Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked and had shots fired into his house by named IFP supporters at Nkandla, KwaZulu, near Melmoth, Natal, on 5 May 1994. He fought back and killed his attacker. He was then forced to leave the area.

name: Mfanafuthi Khumalo
description: Was shot dead by a named member of the IFP in Umlazi, Durban, in 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mfunyaniseni Sizuyise Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mjabulelwa Vitus Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 16 July 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Mlando Amon Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death at Nhlalakahle, Greytown, Natal, in 1992 during political conflict in the area. IFP supporters, attempting to drive ANC supporters out of the area, burnt down Mr Khumalo’s home and also killed his father and brother in separate incidents.

name: Mr (First Name Not Given) Khumalo
description: Was shot dead by unidentified gunmen near Pietermaritzburg on 18 August 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Musawenkosi Khumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at a bus stop in Umlazi, Durban, on 23 February 1994 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Mxolisi Caswell Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter and activist in the Soweto Student Congress who disappeared from Soweto, Johannesburg, in September 1986, and was never seen again.

name: Ndindi Johana Khumalo
description: Her home was burnt down in an arson attack in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in November 1992 during continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nelisiwe Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured and the family home burnt down by IFP supporters in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 March 1994. Her mother and sister were also injured in the attack which occurred in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nelisiwe Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured and the family home burnt down by IFP supporters in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 March 1994. Her mother and sister were also injured in the attack which occurred in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nelson Bhekezakhe Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Nyandezulu near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 March 1991 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Nhlanhla Khumalo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 31 May 1991 allegedly because he was suspected of being an ANC supporter.

name: Nhlanhla Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by named IFP supporters in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 25 December 1991.

name: Njabulo Khumalo
description: Was shot by IFP supporters at Mandini, Natal, on 2 February 1994, allegedly because his mother was an ANC supporter. Njabulo died in hospital.

name: Nje Alpheus Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters near Greytown, Natal, on 17 October 1991. Mr Khumalo’s two sons were both killed, in separate incidents, by IFP supporters trying to drive ANC supporters out of the area.

name: Nokulunga Phyllis Khumalo
description: Her house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in September 1990, allegedly because her husband was a member of the ANC.

name: Nompumelelo Jabu Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down in a petrol bomb attack by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, in July 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Norman Khumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in Tsakane, Brakpan, Transvaal, in May 1985 for mobilising the community during conflict between residents and hostel-dwellers.

name: Ntokozo Khumalo
description: He sustained burn wounds when a petrol bomb was thrown into his home in Howick, Natal, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 6 April 1993.

name: Mzwandile Kheswa
description: Was shot and paralysed by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 30 May 1992 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Bangani Simon Khanyile
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Bhekizenzo Khanyile
description: A taxi driver who was abducted, interrogated, and shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Transvaal, during December 1993. Two SDU members were granted amnesty for this incident (AC/1999/0186).

name: Bongani Khanyile
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters at a traffic light in Estcourt, Natal, on 16 December 1992. The perpetrators opened fire at the car he was travelling in together with prominent IFP members.

name: Boyi Khanyile
description: An IFP supporter who died of a head injury inflicted by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 27 May 1992.

name: Emelina Doreen Kuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down and her possessions stolen in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 20 August 1990 in intensified conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Ndoloza Maria Kuzwayo
description: Was severely assaulted and stabbed by IFP supporters in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 October 1992, because she was thought to be an ANC sympathiser.

name: Amon Kwayi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in a station subway in Johannesburg in September 1991.

name: Henry Kotzen
description: A prison warder who was killed when a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) detonated a hand grenade while trying to escape from Leeuwhof Prison, Vereeniging, Transvaal, on 18 December 1993. Three people died and nine were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/2000/145). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Masoga Philemon Kwetepane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 1 May 1992.

name: Ambrose Bekizizwe Kweyama
description: His house was burnt down in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1993.

name: Bernard Kweyama
description: He lost his home in an arson attack in Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1991.

name: Bhekintaba Bernard Kweyama
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 14 November 1991 in ongoing conflict between supporters of the ANC and the IFP in the area.

name: Bhekizitha Johnson Kweyama
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 4 June 1993.

name: Khethukuthula Wiseman Kweyama
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and burnt to death in Umlazi, Durban, on 4 June 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mabhoyi Isaac Kweyama
description: An ANC supporter who had his home looted by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 13 August 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Mthethwawuvumi Kweyama
description: His home at Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, was burnt down in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 18 March 1990.

name: Ntombihleziphi Grace Kweyama
description: Her house was burnt down by ANC supporters in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 18 September 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Richman Zama Kweyama
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 16 October 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: David Mzwelihle Khanyile
description: An ANC supporter who died after being shot by named IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 6 October 1990. The perpetrators attacked a party at Mr Khanyile’s brother’s house, killing six other people.

name: Dlezakhe Wilson Khanyile
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Bruntville, KwaZulu, near Mooi River, Natal, on 20 March 1992, in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Funeka Caroline Khohlakala
description: Was shot and injured and her house was petrol bombed in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 6 August 1992, allegedly because her husband was an ANC activist and chairperson in the area, during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Kenneth Mpho Kholobeng
description: Was shot and hacked to death by IFP supporters in Kliptown, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 18 August 1990 during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Bakhephi Khomo
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 25 August 1991.

name: Bewula Khomo

name: Cashephi Khomo
description: An IFP supporter whose home was destroyed in an attack by ANC supporters in Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Khonzeleni Fikelephi Khomo

name: Nompumelelo Mildred Khomo

name: Ntombazi Adelaide Ntombikayise Khomo

name: Sibonelo Alpheus Khosi Khomo

name: Thulukuphela Khomo

name: Siyabulela Xolani Khondlo
description: An ANC supporter who became physically disabled as a result of being severely beaten by IFP supporters in the street in Johannesburg in June 1992.

name: Thandiwe Khonela
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed with a bush knife and severely beaten with sjamboks by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 15 March 1992.

name: Bongani Khowa
description: Was shot and injured when his family home near Port Shepstone, Natal, was attacked in July 1991 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: David Fanilo Khowa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: David Fanilo Khowa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Myekeni Zakariya Khowa
description: His house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 June 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Phumzile Busisiwe Khowa
description: Was shot and injured in July 1991 near Port Shepstone, Natal, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Tholakele Margaret Khowa
description: An ANC supporter whose house and possessions were burnt by IFP supporters in Gubheza, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 11 December 1990.

name: Ectina Babukeleni Khanyile
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, in March 1992. She was allegedly targeted because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Gonqwane Khanyile
description: Was injured in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 March 1992 in violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Irish Khanyile
description: Was injured in a hand grenade explosion in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 31 July 1992. An ANC self-defence unit (SDU) member threw the grenade during a confrontation with police. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/090). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Japana Robert Khanyile
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992.

name: Mduduzi Sandelaphi Khanyile
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mfanalo Zefried Khanyile
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters at Nhlalakahle, Greytown, Natal, on 30 November 1993.

name: Mfanyana Elias Khanyile
description: Was shot and stabbed to death in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 October 1991, when he went to assist a neighbour whose home was being attacked by ANC supporters.

name: Mziwakhe Jeremiah Khanyile
description: Was shot dead when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Sikhakhane Khanyile
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by named ANC supporters at KwaHlaza, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 19 July 1991. Her boyfriend was injured in this incident.

name: Silungile Alexina Khanyile
description: Her home was burnt down in an arson attack in Empangeni, Natal, on 13 March 1993, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sphaza Khanyile
description: Was beaten to death by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 25 April 1992, because he was thought to be an ANC supporter. His body was mutilated.

name: Wani Kinsele Khanyile
description: Was shot dead by ANC members at Dambuza, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, during 1993 because he was alleged to be collaborating with police. Two members of the ANC security department were granted amnesty (AC/2001/055).

name: Xolani Kenneth Khanyile
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, stabbed and shot to death by IFP supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Xolani Kenneth Khanyile
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, stabbed and shot to death by IFP supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Xolile Khanyile
description: Was shot in the leg while in the arms of her grandmother, a well-known ANC supporter, on 2 August 1992, when armed men wearing balaclavas attacked several homes in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Zenzele Lenos Khanyile
description: A prominent ANC supporter who was stoned to death by named IFP supporters near Estcourt, Natal, on 4 February 1992.

name: Bayephi Khasibe Khasibe
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters in Mkhobeni, Bulwer, Natal, on 24 December 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Elias Zamane Khathaza
description: An ANC supporter who died after being forced to drink petrol before being set alight by fellow ANC supporters in Theunissen, Orange Free State (OFS), on 9 July 1990, allegedly because he was the driver for a businessman who had colluded with the police. A number of ANC supporters were arrested for this killing, but were acquitted.

name: Mazondi Khuzwayo
description: an ANC supporter, was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 4 August 1992.

name: Mgwazenke Joseph Khuzwayo
description: an ANC supporter, had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Musa Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot to death by named IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 4 August 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Ngenzeni Rejoice Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombi Phaqa Bekisephi Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Phendukile Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down, and her son abducted and killed, in an attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Phendukile Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down, and her son abducted and killed, in an attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Pumapi Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Qondeni Tryphina Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Rosemary K Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Salatiel Khuzwayo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and killed by named ANC supporters after an IFP meeting at Empangeni, Natal, on 16 February 1992. The perpetrators burnt his body.

name: Simana Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembisile Agnes Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Tobi Anna Khuzwayo
description: Her home and possessions were burnt in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in April 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Vusumuzi Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and killed, and his home was burnt, in an attack by a named IFP supporter in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 April 1994.

name: Vusumzi Vincent Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down in an arson attack in February 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Welcome Nhlanhla Khuzwayo
description: ANC supporter, was shot dead by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 26 December 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Winnifred Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, stoned and stabbed, and had her her home burnt down, by ANC supporters, some of whom are named, at Lamontville, near Durban, on 14 May 1990. Ms Khuzwayo was allegedly accused by the perpetrators of being an IFP spy and a witch.

name: Xolani Eric Khuzwayo
description: Was found burnt to death after he had been abducted by ANC supporters at KwaMashu, Durban, in September 1992, in political conflict in the area.

name: Ziphi Bongekile Khuzwayo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Balekile Khwela
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 19 March 1990, in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Makhosazana Ethel Khwela
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by named ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 25 December 1992, allegedly because they believed her son-in-law was an IFP supporter.

name: Mandlakayise Barthemius Khwela
description: Was killed on 10 November 1993 while defending his house in Emangabazini, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, against attackers, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Mzwamanka Cyprian Khwela
description: Was shot dead at a night vigil in Emangabazini, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 February 1994 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mzwamanka Cyprian Khwela
description: Was shot dead at a night vigil in Emangabazini, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 February 1994 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Patricia Themba Khwela
description: An ANC supporter who had her shop and house in Port Shepstone, Natal, looted by IFP supporters on 5 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Patricia Themba Khwela
description: An ANC supporter who had her shop and house in Port Shepstone, Natal, looted by IFP supporters on 5 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Richard Mpuvele Khwela
description: An ANC supporter whose house and possessions were burnt by IFP supporters in Pietermaritzburg on 11 August 1993.

name: Thamsanqa Pius Khwela
description: ANC supporter, was burnt to death by IFP supporters at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 14 September 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Dorothy King
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Entshawini, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, in January 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Gerard Quintin King
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Stanger, Natal, in December 1993.

name: Russel King
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Entshawini, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, in June 1992.

name: Nhlanhla Christian Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had his house burnt down by ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991.

name: Douglas Thembi Lila
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Vosloorus, Transvaal, in November 1993.

name: Expeditous Mzolisi Monwabisi Mabophe
description: Was stabbed and severely injured by a named perpetrator when he tried to extinguish the flames of his burning house on 30 April 1990 in Matatiele, Natal. Following Nelson Mandela`s release from prison, local villagers, including leading members of the community, resisted attempts of the ANC to establish branches in the Pholile and KwaMango areas of Matatiele in March and April 1990. Named men carrying traditional weapons attacked ANC supporters, killing them and burning their homes. Attempts to report the incidents revealed that the police were co-operating with the perpetrators.

name: Expeditous Mzolisi Monwabisi Mabophe
description: Was stabbed and severely injured by a named perpetrator when he tried to extinguish the flames of his burning house on 30 April 1990 in Matatiele, Natal. Following Nelson Mandela`s release from prison, local villagers, including leading members of the community, resisted attempts of the ANC to establish branches in the Pholile and KwaMango areas of Matatiele in March and April 1990. Named men carrying traditional weapons attacked ANC supporters, killing them and burning their homes. Attempts to report the incidents revealed that the police were co-operating with the perpetrators.

name: Moeketsi Ben Mabote
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 23 August 1990 during conflict between IFP-supporting Nguni hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents. Approximately 14 bodies were allegedly found around the hostel on that day.

name: Mathebe Willem Mabowa
description: A SANCO member who was detained without trial for seven months in Dennilton, KwaNdebele, in 1987 during political conflict over KwaNdebele independence.

name: Agnes Ouma Mabula
description: An ANCWL member who was killed on a train between Khwezi and Nhlanzani stations, Soweto, Johannesburg, by a group of men armed with pangas, knives and an AK47. Her body was found at Baragwanath Hospital on 23 April 1991. See train violence.

name: Stefanus Mabunda
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Newclare, Johannesburg, on 18 March 1960 and detained under emergency regulations in Pretoria.

name: Bheki Mabuya
description: A civilian travelling in a bread delivery truck, was shot at by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Rockville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 5 February 1993. Mr Mabuya and his three colleagues disrupted an SDU attack on the police. The perpetrators fired at the vehicle intending to scare them off. Three SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2000/119).

name: Bongekile Mabuza
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters during November 1993.

name: Obert Sidala Mabuza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in Germiston, Transvaal, on 5 July 1993.

name: Queen Gladys Mabuza
description: Was stabbed to death by members of the IFP-supporting Black Cats in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, on 9 November 1990 during clashes between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sidney Mabuza
description: Was stabbed and left for dead by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 11 March 1991 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Tahleho Hendrik Machona
description: An ANC supporter who had his house, van and other property burnt and his driver was attacked in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, on 2 February 1990 because ANC suppporters suspected him of collaborating with the police.

name: Mr (First Name Not Given) Madadzhe
description: He died when he was assaulted and burnt to death in his home by a large crowd of the residents on 2 February 1990 in the Tshino Village, Venda. A meeting held by local youth resolved to kill people suspected of engaging in witchcraft and collaborating with the Venda government. Two ANC supporters applied for amnesty which was granted. (AC/2000/094)

name: Nicholus Siphiwe Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had his house destroyed by ANC supporters in April 1994 at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nicholus Siphiwe Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had his house destroyed by ANC supporters in April 1994 at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nkosi Gladys Masikheshe Madlala
description: Her house was burnt down by ANC supporters on 4 May 1991 in Marburg, near Port Shepstone, Natal, allegedly because her husband was an IFP supporter. Her husband had been killed by ANC supporters two weeks earlier. The arson attack took place on the day of his funeral.

name: Nomithi Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters on 19 March 1992 in ongoing political conflict in Port Shepstone, Natal.

name: Mgodleni Mabaso
description: An UWUSA member who was shot and injured by alleged ANC supporters in Ratanda, Heidelberg, Transvaal, on 21 January 1993. Conflict between IFP-supporting UWUSA and ANC-supporting FAWU led to intense conflict on the factory floor which spread to the surrounding community.

name: Qondeni Nomusa Limako
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 27 August 1992.

name: Sagile Mhlakwempi Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu’s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, allegedly because the perpetrators suspected Mr Luthuli of plotting an attack on IFP supporters. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: (First Name Not Given) Linda
description: The son of Dalimbi Simeon Ben Linda, an IFP Youth Brigade supporter, who was shot and injured, allegedly by ANC supporters, in Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Nomusa Goodness Madlala
description: An ANC supporter had her home in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Sibusiso Blessing Luthuli
description: Was severely beaten in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 29 June 1993, at a ‘people’s court’ under the command of an officer of a local ANC self-defence unit (SDU). Mr Luthuli was one of five people who survived the beating, while two others were beaten to death, allegedly for crimes committed in the community. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/033). See self defence units (SDU).

name: Buzani N Linda
description: Her house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Bulwer, Natal, in 1990 in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Nzenzi Lenzi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in Buyafuthi, Katlehong, Transvaal, in August 1990, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Nonhlanhla Daphney Madlala
description: Was shot at and had her house burnt down at Eshowe, Natal, in June 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Michael Thulani Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters on 14 February 1994 in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, allegedly in conflict within the party and between the ANC and SACP in the area.

name: Mabhoyi Thomas Madela
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters on 28 February 1992 in Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal. The attackers set fire to his house and his car.

name: Mnyamana Ludube
description: An ANC supporter who was detained on 1 September 1985 in Kirkwood, Cape.

name: Muzi David Mabaso
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death by ANC supporters who attacked him and petrol-bombed his family home in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 10 June 1993.

name: Sihle Hector Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who died of multiple stab wounds when named IFP supporters attacked him at a mass funeral in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 7 December 1990.

name: Nyusiwe Mamlisani Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her house destroyed by ANC supporters on 4 May 1991 at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal. Political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least 31 people and rendered about 200 people homeless in April and May 1991.

name: Nyusiwe Mamlisani Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her house destroyed by ANC supporters on 4 May 1991 at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal. Political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least 31 people and rendered about 200 people homeless in April and May 1991.

name: Falakhe Alfred Linda
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Simo Simon Nkomemhlophe Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by named IFP supporters in Mangwaneni, Bulwer, Natal, in November 1992, in political conflict in the area.

name: Nan Lukas Michael
description: An ANC member who was executed in Pretoria on 25 March 1988 for his alleged involvement in the killing of a named bus inspector during unrest in Bongolethu, Oudtshoorn, Cape.

name: Phineas Thulebona Madlala

Earlier in the day there had been fighting at Esimozomeni between local ANC supporters and IFP members from Phatheni.

name: Sipho Sikhumbuzo Luthuli
description: Was severely beaten in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 29 June 1993, at a ‘people’s court’ under the command of an officer of a local ANC self-defence unit (SDU). Mr Luthuli was one of five people who survived the beating, while two others were beaten to death, allegedly for crimes committed in the community. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/033). See self defence units (SDU).

name: Margaret Nontombi Linda
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters near Murchison, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 December 1993, during political conflict in the area.

name: Siyabonga Wellington Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Vusumuzi Samuel Madela
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death by ANC supporters on 22 July 1990 in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal. Mr Madela`s father was a local IFP chairperson. His parents` house was petrol-bombed by ANC supporters a week later.

name: Sangozile Gennet Madlala

After killing Ms Madlala, the attackers tried to burn her body. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Mzamo Nelson Luke
description: Was stripped naked, tied up and shot dead by Zulu-speaking inmates of Merafe Hostel, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 9 April 1991 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Nhlanhla Thembinkosi Linda
description: Was shot dead in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters while driving in the Bhubhubhu area, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 10 December 1993. He was allegedly accused of transporting supporters of the rival political party.

name: Sizani Jester Luthuli
description: An IFP supporter who had his home set alight by a named IFP supporter in Bulwer, Natal, on 1 December 1991. Mr Luthuli was staying in an ANC stronghold at the time of a mass attack on the area.

name: Nkosinathi Augustini Mabaso
description: Died after being stabbed by a named ANC supporter in Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 9 March 1991, allegedly because he was seen wearing an IFP T-shirt.

name: Thandi Mayvis Luthuli
description: Was shot dead in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 August 1992, in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sbongile Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sbongile Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Lindiwe Sara Makazibuyile Mafika
description: An ANC supporter who fled her home in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban on 5 July 1992 because of political violence in the area. A week later, she returned to find her home had been destroyed, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Norman Linda
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a member of the AWB in Boipatong, Vanderbijlpark, Transvaal, on 17 April 1993 during a protest march to the local police station.

name: Sifundo Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by IFP supporters at KwaMadlala, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 29 June 1992. His mother`s house was also burnt down during this period.

name: Siphiwe Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in April 1994 in Bulwer, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Siphiwe Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in April 1994 in Bulwer, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sindisiwe Euginia Linda
description: An IFP Youth Brigade supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by ANC supporters in Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Nomsa Mabaso
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Piet Retief, Transvaal, on 3 June 1993 during a commemoration ceremony for an ANC activist killed near the Swaziland border.

name: Sylvia Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, during 1991.

name: Sipho Linda
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters near Murchison, Port Shepstone, Natal, during 1990, in political conflict in the area.

name: Thando Madlala
description: Was stabbed to death, together with her grandmother, when IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers attacked ANC supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 3 December 1991. The Madlala`s home was burnt down. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Thoko Lephinah Linda
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Ogunjini, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 November 1991.

name: Thembikile Luthuli
description: She had her house and possessions burnt in an arson attack near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembikile Luthuli
description: She had her house and possessions burnt in an arson attack near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombikayise Victoria Mabaso
description: She had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Robert Mabaso
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was targeted for killing by an ANC/FAWU member in September 1991, during a period of conflict between ANC and IFP-supporting workers at the Langeberg Foods factory in Boksburg, Transvaal. Mr Mabaso was not at home when the perpetrator arrived to shoot him. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/0080).

name: Thobile Gladness Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her home at Amaoti, Inanda, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thobile Gladness Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her home at Amaoti, Inanda, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sarah Ouma Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured, allegedly by IFP supporters, on 16 August 1993 in Tokoza, Transvaal, reportedly because her family refused to join the IFP. Four people died and three were injured in the attack, including a five year old boy.

name: Thokozile Elsie Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured when the bus in which she was travelling was ambushed by armed IFP supporters at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 8 March 1993. See Table Mountain bus attacks.

name: Sibongile Constance Mabaso
description: She had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Tolani Madlala
description: He had his house at Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters during political conflict on 4 May 1991.

name: Wiseman Nkosinathi Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 15 December 1992 for refusing to change his political affiliation.

name: Ziphi Francisca Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house near Verulam, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 28 February 1991.

name: Zithulele Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and beaten to death by IFP supporters at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 13 February 1991.

name: Fundisile Lutolo
description: Her house was burnt down on 16 February 1993 in a dawn attack on the ANC stronghold of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban. Ten people were killed and thirty five houses were burnt down in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters over access to resources.

name: Alzina Mhlope Lutuli
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Jandazile Otilia Lutuli
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted by named IFP supporters at her home in Amanzimtoti, Natal, on 20 August 1990, during political conflict.

name: Nomajaji Lutuli
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Tili Lutuli
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: (No First Name Given) Lukhosi
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death when her house was set alight by ANC supporters at Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 12 January 1991. Her son was a prominent IFP member.

name: Hlengiwe Luvuno
description: An ANC supporter who was killed when she was beaten and stabbed by named ANC supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, on 24 April 1990. The perpetrators allegedly accused her of having a relationship with a member of the KZP.

name: Mcpherson Lwana
description: He lost his spaza shop in arson attacks by ANC members at Esikhumbeni, near Bizana, Transkei, in March 1960 during the Pondoland revolt.

name: Mapimele Bennett Maakana
description: An ANC supporter who was detained in solitary confinement under unsanitary conditions in Tzaneen, Transvaal, during March 1990. He was hospitalised for two weeks under police guard and then returned to his cell. The incident occurred soon after the unbanning of political parties and the release of  political prisoners. Mr Maakana was allegedly detained because of his involvement in building ANC structures.

name: Baba Mabalane
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in Tembisa, Kempton Park, Transvaal. Tembisa was one of many Vaal townships engulfed in conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Joseph Ndodomzi Master Mabaleka
