description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted by named vigilantes on 17 March 1990 in Matatiele, Natal, when he went to the aid of an ANC member who was being attacked. He was taken to the local headman, where he was further assaulted and required to state that he would join in the campaign against the ANC in the area. When he returned home, his house had been vandalised.

name: Bhekinkosi Moses Mabanga
description: An IFP supporter who had his house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in February 1994. At least twenty eight incidents of house burning were recorded in Ndwedwe during this month.

name: Musa Mabanga
description: Was shot dead in Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thengindawu Mabanga
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down by ANC supporters in February 1994 in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. At least twenty eight incidents of house burning were recorded in the area that month.

name: Matopi Mabasa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1992, when the perpetrators attacked her neighbour`s home, allegedly because the neighbour had left the IFP and started attending ANC meetings. One person was killed in the attack.

name: Nomafuze Mabasa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nan Mabaso Mgodleni
description: An UWUSA member who was shot and injured by alleged ANC supporters in Ratanda, Heidelberg, Transvaal, on 21 January 1993. Conflict between IFP-supporting UWUSA and ANC-supporting FAWU led to intense conflict on the factory floor which spread to the surrounding community.

name: Bafana Leonard Mabaso
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 13 March 1992.

name: Castro Mandla Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when the vehicle in which he and nine other young men were travelling was ambushed at Diepdale, near Ermelo, Transvaal, on 30 September 1993. They were returning from a court appearance in connection with the killing of a local chief when they were attacked, allegedly by the chief`s son and other IFP supporters. Four of the ten were killed and three others injured.

name: Christopher Sipho Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten to death on 19 December 1993 in Chesterville, Durban, by members of the Chesterville A-Team. See A-Team (Chesterville, Durban).

name: Elizabeth N Mabaso
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area during 1993.

name: Ernest Themba Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 3 August 1993, allegedly by IFP supporters. Mr Mabaso had been shot and injured previously in Katlehong, Transvaal, in 1990.

name: Goodman Sibusiso Zwelibanzi Mabaso
description: Was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Estcourt, Natal, on 1 September 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Gugu Goodness Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 24 December 1993.

name: Hluphekile Ntombizonke Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Jabulisile Caroline Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Ngonweni, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 31 December 1992. Ms Mabaso had to flee the area as a result of the attack.

name: Joyful Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by named IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1991. Mr Mabaso lost his sight in both eyes as a result of the shooting.

name: Sibusiso Mabaso
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in May 1992 in Woodyglen, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban. His father had been stabbed to death in 1988 and his brother shot and killed in November 1988, also in political conflict.

name: Sibusiso Mabaso
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in May 1992 in Woodyglen, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban. His father had been stabbed to death in 1988 and his brother shot and killed in November 1988, also in political conflict.

name: Simon Zibani Mabaso
description: An IFP supporter who was seriously injured when two petrol bombs were thrown into his home in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 19 September 1990, allegedly by ANC supporters.

name: Thibi Thobela Madiba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 27 March 1994 following an IFP rally in the area. Residents were assaulted and homes were looted by IFP supporters who had attended a rally in the Sundumbili stadium.

name: Themba Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who was targeted for elimination by IFP members at Hlanganani Hall, Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during 1992. One perpetrator in the conspiracy was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Mandlakayise Singleton Lumbo
description: An ANC member who had his huts and other possessions burnt in an arson attack by a named perpetrator on 15 November 1992 in Flagstaff, Transkei.

name: Thokozani Simon Mabaso
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal  on 7 November 1992.

name: Zibuyisile Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters in her home in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 April 1994 (a few days before the April 1994 elections), allegedly because the attackers believed her husband to be in possession of an AK47. The house was ransacked and burnt down.

name: Zibuyisile Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters in her home in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 April 1994 (a few days before the April 1994 elections), allegedly because the attackers believed her husband to be in possession of an AK47. The house was ransacked and burnt down.

name: Aaron Sibhabhabha Madlavu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Mvumelwano, near Qumbu, Transkei, in 1990, for allegedly collaborating with stock thieves. He was against the alleged ANC policy of assaulting stock thieves once caught, and refused to attend ANC meetings in this regard.

name: Elizabeth Madida
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 5 April 1994, three weeks before the April 1994 elections. Ms Madida`s house was burnt down in the attack. The perpetrators were allegedly looking for her sons, who were active ANC supporters.

name: Elizabeth Madida
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 5 April 1994, three weeks before the April 1994 elections. Ms Madida`s house was burnt down in the attack. The perpetrators were allegedly looking for her sons, who were active ANC supporters.

name: Timothy Madida
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, 9 November 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Musa Mafu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured, allegedly by ANC members, at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Vusi David Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by a named perpetrator in Piet Retief, Transvaal, on 20 August 1993.

name: Carrington Mcoseleli Madikane
description: An ADM member and Ciskei headman who was shot dead in his home by ANC supporters in Zwelitsha, Ciskei, on 22 August 1992 during conflict over the reimposition of the headman system in the Ciskei.

name: Richard Sithembiso Madle
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 7 July 1993, allegedly by Amasinyora vigilantes. See Amasinyora.

name: Georgina Ma-Umfundisi Liwane
description: An ANC supporter and women’s activist who was arrested and detained in Robertson, Cape, on 11 June 1986. She was held for three months under emergency regulations at Pollsmoor prison, Cape Town.

name: Molefi Klaas Lesetho
description: Was hacked to death by members of the ‘Gadaffi’ faction of the ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC)  in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, on 28 June 1990. The split of the KYC into rival factions led to at least seventeen deaths between 1989 and 1991.

name: Sidawa Mafu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 12 February 1993 while riding on a truck on her way to work. The perpetrators allegedly targeted the truck because Ms Mafu and other passengers lived in Phatheni, an IFP stronghold. Three people were shot dead.

name: Nomathemba Sheila Lizani
description: An ANCWL member who was injured in the head when police threw a teargas canister at her during a funeral in KwaZakele, Port Elizabeth, in 1986.

name: Vusumuzi Mabaso
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 19 June 1992. Mr Mabaso and two others, who were with him at the time, were made to lie down on the ground and were then killed `execution style`.

name: Makgala Maria Lesetja
description: Was shot in the back and stomach by IFP supporters in Sebokeng, Vereeniging, Transvaal, on 10 May 1992 during intense conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents. Ms Lesetja was four months pregnant and lost her baby as a result.

name: Nomgidi Martha Madliwa
description: She lost her home in Katlehong, Transvaal, in an arson attack on 25 May 1993. She was later stabbed and injured while seeking shelter elsewhere in Katlehong. Ms Madliwa`s home was reportedly attacked by IFP supporters because she is Xhosa-speaking and was assumed to be an ANC supporter. At least six houses in the vicinity were burnt that day, days after an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel precipitated a dramatic escalation of conflict on the East Rand resulting in at least eighty deaths over the following weeks.

name: Johannes Selekeng Leshabane
description: An ANC supporter whose property was damaged by a group of young men, reportedly on the orders of Chief Masha in Nebo, Lebowa, on 25 January 1986. The chief targeted Mr Leshabane because he had been elected chair of the school committee and the chief wanted someone else in the position.

name: Jamani Samson Lushaba
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 April 1990.

name: Mence Lushaba
description: An IFP supporter who had her home set on fire by ANC supporters at Okhalweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in May 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Bertha Rachel Lesiba
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 9 February 1992. Conflict between IFP and ANC supporters engulfed several Transvaal townships in the early 1990s and led to hundreds of people being killed and scores losing their homes.

name: Vuyane Andreas Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in the IFP stronghold of Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 January 1992. After an IFP meeting, IFP supporters allegedly rounded up youths to join an IFP self-defence training camp. Mr Madlala was shot and killed when he tried to escape on the way to the camp.

name: Njezeni Lushaba
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Palm Beach, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 May 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Gwebityala Madikizela
description: An ANC supporter and a chief in the Bizana area who was assaulted after his arrest in Bizana, Transkei, in 1960 during the Pondoland revolt.

name: Knowlen Luluma Mafuya
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters at Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 17 February 1992.

name: Johannes Leso
description: A policeman who was killed by ANC supporters in Dennilton, KwaNdabele, on 23 March 1986 during conflict over the incorporation into KwaNdebele.

name: Augustin Madolo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Katlehong, Transvaal, in May 1993 during violence after the assassination of SACP general secretary, Chris Hani.

name: Rose Phumzile Lushaba
description: An ANC supporter who had her house set alight in Gamalakhe, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 December 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Sithembiso Oscar Mabele
description: Was beaten and stabbed to death on 10 June 1991 when IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, attacked the mainly ANC-supporting local residents. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Doda Joseph Mabhida
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and burnt to death when the car in which he was travelling was ambushed and petrol-bombed by ANC supporters, some of whom are named, on 30 April 1991 in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban. The perpetrators claimed the attack was in reprisal for the killing of six ANC supporters in the area. Another IFP supporter, who was in the car with Mr Mabhida, also died in the attack.

name: Gabisile Mabhida
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down and her livestock stolen by ANC supporters on 31 December 1991 in Zwelimbomvu, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban.

name: Mandla Jefrey Mabhida
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter on 19 January 1991 in Estcourt, Natal.

name: Joseph Doda Mabida
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 30 April 1991.

name: John Sipho Mabika
description: Was shot dead by members of the Esikhawini hit squad on 28 November 1992 in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. The attack was targeted at Mr Mabika`s companion, a KZP officer thought to be sympathetic to the ANC. This officer was also shot dead. Four perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Kufa Jamesfish Mabila
description: He had his home in Bosfontein, Nelspruit, Transvaal, burnt down by ANC supporters in January 1993. He was suspected of being an informer for the local chief and was subsequently instructed to leave the area.

name: Khedamile Mabinca
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 6 January 1986 in continuing violence following the Umbumbulu massacre.

name: Karabo Jacob Maboane
description: Was shot and injured by members of the AWB in Mmabatho, Bophuthatswana, on 9 March 1994 while participating in an ANC-organised march. The AWB, along with the Mangope government, engaged in a last-minute effort to derail the April 1994 election.

name: Karabo Jacob Maboane
description: Was shot and injured by members of the AWB in Mmabatho, Bophuthatswana, on 9 March 1994 while participating in an ANC-organised march. The AWB, along with the Mangope government, engaged in a last-minute effort to derail the April 1994 election.

name: Lesiba Elias Ledwaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 19 April 1994 when members of the ISU pursuing a group of youths opened fire on Mr Ledwaba and other family members at his home. Two other family members were injured and another friend died later that day. This incident took place in political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 election.

name: Lesiba Elias Ledwaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 19 April 1994 when members of the ISU pursuing a group of youths opened fire on Mr Ledwaba and other family members at his home. Two other family members were injured and another friend died later that day. This incident took place in political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 election.

name: Moffat Marhanana Magangxa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by members of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 1 July 1993. Tembisa was one of many Transvaal townships embroiled in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the early 1990s. See Toaster gang.

name: Mongameli Walter Magaqa
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in  KwaGuga,  Witbank, Transvaal, on 10 October 1991 after violence between IFP and ANC supporters erupted at a hostel.

name: Siyabonga Aaron Magasela
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 8 February 1991.

name: Barnabas Mahlathi Magawana
description: An ANC supporter who was executed at Pretoria Central prison, Pretoria, on 6 July 1962. He had been tried in Kokstad and sentenced to death for his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Vuyelwa Sophie Magawu
description: Was stabbed to death by ANC members in Rweleleyathunya, Rouxville, Orange Free State (OFS), on 23 September 1990, allegedly because she was perceived to be supporting the local school principal during a student boycott. The family home was burnt down in the attack.

name: Elias Bonginkosi Magcaba
description: Was shot dead in KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, on 5 April 1991. Mr Magcaba, a Zionist lay preacher, was on his way home from church when he was killed in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Thirty people died in political violence in the area from January to 5 April 1991.

name: Elias Bonginkosi Magcaba
description: Was shot dead in KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, on 5 April 1991. Mr Magcaba, a Zionist lay preacher, was on his way home from church when he was killed in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Thirty people died in political violence in the area from January to 5 April 1991.

name: Ntombinkulu Lilian Magcaba
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in October 1992.

name: Zisolile Buyelaphi Magcaba
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in August 1991 in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban.

name: Mthenjwa Mago
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in May 1993 in intense political conflict between the `Red` and `Green` factions.

name: Dunga Protas Magoso
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Polela, Bulwer, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 30 November 1991, allegedly because he and his family refused to attend IFP meetings.

name: Khipha Protas Magoso
description: An IFP supporter who was found dead on 5 December 1991 in Masameni, near Greytown, Natal, shortly after he had disappeared. He is believed to have been abducted and killed by ANC supporters in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Makhehla Magoso
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 26 April 1991. Mr Magoso apparently came from an area considered to be an ANC stronghold.

name: Swelekile Annadetta Magoso
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured when IFP supporters attacked her home in Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, in March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Swelekile Annadetta Magoso
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured when IFP supporters attacked her home in Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, in March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mteteleli Anderson Magqo
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and thrown from a moving train by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 27 July 1990. See train violence.

name: Sylvia Noyolo Madikizela
description: An ANC member who had her house burnt down in Bizana, Transkei, in June 1960, during the Pondoland revolt.

name: Thokozile Joshina Lushaba
description: An IFP supporter who lost all her posessions when her house was looted in Ensimbini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 December 1993. She had fled the area because of the ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters; on her return she found that her house had been looted.

name: Wiseman Potiyana Madikizela
description: An ANC supporter who was detained at Bizana, Transkei, in June 1960, during the Pondoland revolt.

name: Lindile Lusiki
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in December 1993. Nine people were killed in several violent incidents in that month in Bhambayi.

name: Molefi Klaas Lesotho
description: Was hacked to death by members of the ‘Gadaffi’ faction of the ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, on 28 June 1990. Mr Lesotho was killed during conflict between the ‘Zim-Zim’ and ‘ Gadaffi’ factions of the KYC.

name: Yoliswa Eurance Lusiki
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in June 1993.

name: Strydom Laga Madiya
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 19 May 1991.

name: Albert Felendlini Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by an IFP supporter at Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1992.

name: Alfred Madlala
description: Was shot and stabbed to death by named ANC supporters on 7 February 1992 at Mjondolo in the Table Mountain area, near Pietermaritzburg. The perpetrators approached Mr Madlala in his home and accused him of being an IFP supporter.

name: Alpheus Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by named perpetrators in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 August 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bakazi Minah Mamtshilotshi Madlala
description: She had her home burnt down by ANC supporters in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 14 April 1991 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Besinia Leanar Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. Ms Madlala resided in an area known to be an IFP stronghold.

name: Bheki Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and fatally wounded by members of the Amavaravara in Clermont, near Durban,  in 1992 in internal conflict within the ANC. See Amavaravara.

name: Bilingi Nhlayenza Madlala
description: A IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters while on his way home from work on 17 April 1991 in Marburg, near Port Shepstone, Natal. On the day of his funeral, his widow had her house burnt down by ANC supporters.

name: Bongani Gracious Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by an IFP supporter in Appelsbosch, near Stanger, Natal, on 23 November 1991.

name: Bongani Michael Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters at Nkwezela, Bulwer, Natal, on 9 January 1993.

name: Celani Aleya Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Estcourt, Natal, on 19 February 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Celani Aleya Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Estcourt, Natal, on 19 February 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: France Madlala
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991 in ongoing political conflict. In April and May 1991, political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people and rendered about two hundred people homeless.

name: France Madlala
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991 in ongoing political conflict. In April and May 1991, political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people and rendered about two hundred people homeless.

name: Ggambi Cecilia Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 26 June 1993 in Port Shepstone, Natal, in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Ms Madlala was visiting a family known to be sympathetic to the ANC when the house was attacked by an unidentified group of people.

name: Jabulile Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down in May 1992 in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: John Nelson Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down by ANC supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991.

name: Kati Masitolo Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991. In April and May 1991 political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people and rendered about two hundred people homeless.

name: Kati Masitolo Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991. In April and May 1991 political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people and rendered about two hundred people homeless.

name: Khohliwe Sholipi Madlala
description: Her room was destroyed in an arson attack by unidentified persons at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in March 1992, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Khona Christina Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters on 4 May 1991 at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal. In April and May 1991 political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people and rendered about two hundred people homeless.

name: Khona Christina Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters on 4 May 1991 at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal. In April and May 1991 political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people and rendered about two hundred people homeless.

name: Khonjwayo Madlala
description: An IFP supporter was abducted and burnt to death by ANC supporters in Port Shepstone during April 1991.

name: Khumbuzile Mildred Madlala
description: She lost her mother and daughter and suffered severe material loss when IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers attacked ANC supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 3 December 1991. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Lahliwe Mahluza Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters on 4 May 1991 at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal. In April and May 1991 political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people and rendered about two hundred people homeless.

name: Lahliwe Mahluza Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters on 4 May 1991 at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal. In April and May 1991 political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people and rendered about two hundred people homeless.

name: Lamlani Donatus Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed, hacked and burnt to death in his car by fellow ANC supporters in Inchanga,  Natal, on 1 December 1989, allegedly because he had refused to help an ANC victim who had been shot by IFP supporters next to his home.

name: Mabandla Andreas Madlala
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 29 August 1991, allegedly because he was thought to be assisting ANC youths in the area.

name: Mbuyelwa Madlala
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured by IFP supporters returning from a rally at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 November 1992.

name: Mdutshwa Madlala
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was shot dead during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond,  Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Mikwami Tryphina Madlala
description: She had her house in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during 1990.

name: Mildred Khumbuzile Madlala
description: She had her house destroyed on 3 December 1991 when IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers attacked ANC supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal. Ms Madlala`s mother and her daughter were killed in the attack. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Mzayifani Jacob Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down by ANC supporters at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991.

name: Ngenzeni Nkaza Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters on 4 May 1991 at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal. In April and May 1991 political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people and rendered about two hundred people homeless.

name: Ngenzeni Nkaza Madlala
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters on 4 May 1991 at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal. In April and May 1991 political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people and rendered about two hundred people homeless.

name: Tholakele Doreen Luthango
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in 1992.

name: Crescentia Zamisile Madonda
description: An ANC supporter who was forced to flee when her parents` home in Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, was burnt down in June 1993 during continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Jabulani Christian Luthayi
description: An ANC supporter whowas shot dead in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 April 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Maxwell Madonda
description: An ANC supporter who was found dead with gunshot wounds in Johannesburg in December 1988, after he had fled Richmond, Natal, in 1986. The Special Branch told his family that he had been a member of the Mandela United Football Club.

name: Phillip Luthili
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, during 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: David Tebello Letsie
description: A self-defence unit (SDU) member who was stabbed to death, allegedly by IFP supporters, while patrolling Radebe section in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 7 August 1993. Conflict on the East Rand escalated after an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel on May 22 1993, precipitating clashes which led to more than eighty deaths. See self-defence units (SDU).

name: David Tebello Letsie
description: A self-defence unit (SDU) member who was stabbed to death, allegedly by IFP supporters, while patrolling Radebe section in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 7 August 1993. Conflict on the East Rand escalated after an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel on May 22 1993, precipitating clashes which led to more than eighty deaths. See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Maqueen Joyce Letsoha-Matshae
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by named perpetrators in Tweespruit, Orange Free State (OFS), on 15 July 1993. She was with an unnamed friend who was shot dead.

name: Fano Marcus Letswalo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in Pinetown, Natal, on 4 February 1985, in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Isaac Monyeke Lihlitle
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 18 April 1993 on the eve of the funeral for assassinated SACP leader Chris Hani.

name: Mthandeni Madonda
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted, together with a friend, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, in December 1991. Both were later found dead, their bodies mutilated.

name: Azariah Luthuli
description: Was shot dead when IFP supporters opened fire on ANC supporters attending a cultural ceremony at Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 November 1993. Eight people, including two children, were killed in the incident.

name: Bekile Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Tshidiso Isaiah Leeuw
description: An ANC supporter and FAWU member who was severely beaten in his home by members of the Bophuthatswana police in Thaba Nchu, Bophuthatswana, on 1 May 1993.

name: Bili Emmanuel Luthuli
description: His house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack near Eshowe, Natal, on 7 November 1993, when IFP supporters attacked several ANC supporters in the KwaKhoza and Nogobhoza areas, KwaZulu. One person was killed. More than forty five homes were burnt down, allegedly under the direction of the local IFP-supporting chief, in an effort to drive ANC supporters from the area.

name: Dlangamandla Dumisani Madondo
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 3 June 1993. An IFP mass meeting had been held that day. Mr Madondo and other ANC supporters had been campaigning for the ANC in the upcoming April 1994 elections when they were attacked by IFP supporters.

name: Dlangamandla Dumisani Madondo
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 3 June 1993. An IFP mass meeting had been held that day. Mr Madondo and other ANC supporters had been campaigning for the ANC in the upcoming April 1994 elections when they were attacked by IFP supporters.

name: Gibson Petros Madondo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 29 March 1991.

name: Gobo William Madondo
description: Was shot and killed by unidentified attackers in Pietermaritzburg on 16 November 1990 during intense conflict betweeen IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Monica Lina Lekalakala
description: Was injured when she was shot in the back by a named member of the right-wing organisation Wit Wolwe in Pretoria, on 15 November 1988. The perpetrator was sentenced to death but later indemnified and released under a deal between the ANC and the National Party government.

name: Tosi Lekgehle
description: A member of the Eagles Club who was severely beaten when ANC supporters attacked him and five other ‘Eagles Club’ members in Qhoweng, Reddersburg, Orange Free State (OFS), in 1989, allegedly because of their involvement with the club.

name: Bishop Victor Lekgothoane
description: Was abducted from Dube hostel, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 12 July 1990. His charred body was found the next day. This incident occurred during escalating conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Samson Mabaki Sami Lekhehle
description: A member of the Eagles Club who was severely beaten when ANC supporters attacked him and five other ‘Eagles Club’ members in Qhoweng, Reddersburg, Orange Free State (OFS), in 1989, allegedly because of their involvement with the club.

name: Saraphina Lembede
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Tobsie Cabangile Lembethe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Emathunzi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in October 1992.

name: Bongokwakhe Norman Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lindela Phillip Madondo
description: An ANC supporter who died after being abducted and shot by named IFP supporters outside Pietermaritzburg on 1 January 1993.

name: Nontombi Madondo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house and belongings destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Nkwezela, Bulwer, Natal, in May 1992.

name: Phumelele Linet Madondo
description: Was pulled from a taxi and stabbed by IFP supporters at Wasbank, near Glencoe, Natal, on 9 July 1993, allegedly because she had failed to give them information about ANC-supporting `comrades`.

name: Fikisewe Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sihle Johan Madondo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters at KwaPata, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1990. IFP supporters were allegedly trying to evict ANC supporters from the area at the time.

name: Henry Vika Luthuli
description: Was shot dead in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 August 1990, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Jabhisile Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: James Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 18 October 1992.

name: Lindiwe Thandi Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter, had her home burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lovejoy Nomusa Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter, had her house burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Madoda James Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter, had his home burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mandla Vincent Luthuli
description: An ANC member returned from exile who was abducted and shot dead by named persons in Umlazi, Durban, on 23 September 1993, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Mathonto Joyce Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mfihleni George Luthuli
description: He had his house burnt down by IFP supporters near Eshowe, Natal, in July 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mthintwa Azaria Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 29 November 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His house was burnt down in the attack.

name: Mtshelwa Pieter Luthuli
description: An IFP supporter who lost his house in an arson attack on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mzikayise Elphord Luthuli
description: Was one of eight passengers shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Six other passengers were shot dead. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Nonhlanhla Sibongile Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house petrol-bombed by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 16 June 1991. Ms Luthuli’s sons were ANC supporters.

name: Ntombi Annah Luthuli
description: She had her house burnt down at Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Olphina Duduzekile Luthuli
description: She had her house and possessions set alight in Eshowe, Natal, in 1992 during ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Penelope Gugulethu Luthuli
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 2 February 1991.

name: Phayiphile Frans Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted with a bush-knife and severely injured by IFP supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, in 1990

name: Phendukile Nomusa Luthuli
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Poza Luthuli
description: Was shot dead on 28 November 1993 when IFP supporters opened fire on ANC supporters attending a cultural ceremony at Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Eight people, including two children, were killed in the incident.

name: Doctor John Maduna
description: Was abducted, along with a friend, from his home at the Motsoaledi informal settlement by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) and ANC supporters, on 29 March 1994. They were taken to a nearby school in Orlando East, Soweto, Johannesburg, where he was shot dead and his friend shot and injured. They were suspected of participating in an IFP march that day. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0320). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Mqinisweni Albert Maduna
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Nomgidi Martha Maduwa
description: A SADTU member who lost her home and was later stabbed by IFP supporters in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 25 May 1993. An ANC march past an IFP-supporting Tokoza hostel on 22 May 1993 sparked violent conflict that led to over 1000 women and children fleeing their homes. About thirty five people were killed and fourteen injured in Katlehong during May 1993.

name: Nomgidi Martha Maduwa
description: A SADTU member who lost her home and was later stabbed by IFP supporters in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 25 May 1993. An ANC march past an IFP-supporting Tokoza hostel on 22 May 1993 sparked violent conflict that led to over 1000 women and children fleeing their homes. About thirty five people were killed and fourteen injured in Katlehong during May 1993.

name: Nomgidi Martha Maduwa
description: A SADTU member who lost her home and was later stabbed by IFP supporters in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 25 May 1993. An ANC march past an IFP-supporting Tokoza hostel on 22 May 1993 sparked violent conflict that led to over 1000 women and children fleeing their homes. About thirty five people were killed and fourteen injured in Katlehong during May 1993.

name: Thembekile Joyce Madwe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Makonza Lokololo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack in Richmond, Natal, during 1991, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nomhle Beauty Lolwane
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, in May 1990 by members of a street committee who accused her of hiring someone to kill two named members of the street committee. They then sold her shack for R400.

name: Tendinjeni Lova
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely assaulted by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, in March 1991.

name: Agnes Phumzile Lubanyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Nkulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 13 April 1991. About twelve people were killed and twelve more were injured in attacks by IFP supporters in the area that month.

name: Mkhosi Isaac Lubanyana
description: An IFP supporter who died after he was shot and then stabbed by ANC supporters in Gamalakhe, near Port Shepstone, on 27 June 1991, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Talitha Kebawetse Mangale
description: Was burnt to death by members of the `Gadaffi` faction in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, in 1991 after the ANC in the area split into two rival groups, the `Gadaffis` and the `Zim-zims`. Conflict between them left at least 20 people dead in the area. See also Khutsong Youth Congress.

name: Abednego Majola
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death on 8 November 1990 when IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers attacked residents at Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, following the killing of an IFP supporter. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Modjadji Florah Maletjane
description: An ANC member who sustained head and back injuries when thrown from a moving train by IFP supporters in Germiston, Transvaal, on 9 September 1991. See train violence.

name: Siphiwe Prince Makhathini
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by members of the Chesterville A-Team in Chesterville, Durban, in June 1982. See A-Team (Chesterville)

name: Bongane Stephen Magubane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 14 April 1994 during political conflict in the area in the run-up to the April 1994 election.

name: Bongane Stephen Magubane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 14 April 1994 during political conflict in the area in the run-up to the April 1994 election.

name: Mbuyiselwa Patrick Mahlaba
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted at Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in May 1993. The attackers allegedly asked him what political organisation he belonged to, and started assaulting him when he responded that he belonged to ANC.

name: Bekisisa Lionel Majola
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by a named perpetrator at Gcilima, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 May 1993. Mr Majola was targeted for attack allegedly because he was a local ANC organiser with responsibility for recruiting members to the party.

name: Mndeni Malunga
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Mndeni Malunga
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Skhumbuzo Makhathini
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at his home in Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 August 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His cousin was also killed in the attack.

name: Ntombi Angelinah Malevu
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Thoko Lizzy Makhathini
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Umlazi, Durban by IFP supporters on 22 June 1992.

name: Nonhlanhla Mahlaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters who attacked her grandmother`s home in Smero, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 30 September 1990. Five other family members, including three children, were shot and injured, and two were shot dead in the attack.

name: Victoria Zanele Malunga
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Qinabout, Port Shepstone, Natal, in May 1991. Ms Malunga was thought to be an ANC supporter.

name: Esther Nokulanga Magubane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured when IFP supporters attacked the car she was driving in Ixopo, Natal, during 1992.

name: Victor Thulani Makhathini
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Ogunjini, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 25 May 1993.

name: Yengiwe Esther Malungu
description: Was attacked and beaten by IFP members in her home at Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, in October 1990. The perpetrators allegedly suspected the family of being sympathetic to the ANC.

name: Simangele Gloria Mahlaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters who attacked her family home in Smero, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 30 September 1990. Six other family members were shot and injured in the attack, and one member was shot dead.

name: Boy Johannes Makola
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by police in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on June 16 1978, the anniversary of the 1976 Soweto uprising. Mr Makola was blindfolded, taken to an unknown destination and severely beaten and stabbed in the stomach. He is blind as a result.

name: David Malusi
description: An ANC member who was stabbed and injured during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Camperdown, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1993. Several family members were shot dead and others injured in the clashes. The family`s home was burnt down in political conflict on 14 February 1994.

name: Dominic Malusi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by other named ANC supporters in Inchanga, Natal, on 14 February 1994 in the course of a serious internal feud within the local party branch. His father and brother had been injured in political clashes in 1993, and his sister had been fatally shot in 1992, also in the course of internal party conflict.

name: Lillian Elinah Malusi
description: Was shot dead by named ANC supporters in Inchanga, Natal, on 25 December 1992 during a serious internal feud in the organisation.

name: Ntloko Serial Malusi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by named ANC supporters at Inchanga, Natal, on 14 February 1994 in the course of a serious internal feud within the local party branch. His son was killed in the attack. Another son had been injured in political clashes in 1993, and a daughter had been fatally shot in 1992, also in the course of internal party conflict.

name: Gemu Bonginkosi Magubane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured when unidentified persons attacked his family home at Assagay, near Hammarsdale, Natal, in June 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Mr Magubane`s wife was shot dead as she was trying to open the window for the family to escape.

name: Bonakalisiwe Maggie Mangazi
description: had her homestead in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down on 2 September 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nombuyiselo Maria Mamkeli
description: She lost her house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in March 1993. Ms Mamkeli lived in an ANC stronghold.

name: Thobeka Elizabeth Mampofu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by men clad in balaclavas on 10 September 1993 while attending a disco in Khayelitsha, Cape Town. Three people were killed and five injured. The alleged perpetrators, some of whom are named, were members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) that attacked other ANC supporters during conflict between ANC groups. See balaclava groups.

name: Julia Khumbuzile Mamzi
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Kholekile Mana
description: An ANC supporter who died when he was `necklaced` by `comrades` on 4 November 1985 in Duncan Village, East London, allegedly because he was thought to be a collaborator.

name: Abel Butana Manana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by members of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang in Tembisa, Transvaal, in February 1992. See Toaster gang.

name: Godfrey Manana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by unidentified perpetrators in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 23 October 1993 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on the East Rand. Mr Manana`s father was shot dead a month before by unidentified perpetrators.

name: John Velaphi Manana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 17 September 1993.

name: Muzikayise Goodwill Manana
description: Was shot dead in an attack on a tavern in Daveyton, Transvaal, on 8 August 1993 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. Seven people were shot dead and five injured in the attack.

name: Sicelo Sidney Manana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 10 April 1993, during a series of arson attacks initiated by a named community leader aimed at removing Section 2 residents by force.

name: Susan Ntozokudla Manana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomgweni Mancanceni
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in May 1993 at Mthinde, Lusikisiki, Transkei, during conflict between supporters of traditional leaders and ANC supporters.

name: Indi David Mancanywa
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared from Kubedi Street, Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 12 September 1990 during political conflict.

name: Zinukile Annatoria Mance
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 12 October 1993.

name: Dimanda Manci
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by named perpetrators in Flagstaff, Transkei, on 13 December 1992 during conflict between ANC supporters and other residents in the area.

name: Gcinephi Saraphina Manci
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Polela, Bulwer, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters in June 1993.

name: Norman Mandlakapheli
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at a traffic light near Nancefield hostel in Soweto, Johannesburg, during an IFP march to Shell House, the ANC headquarters on 28 March 1993.

name: Josephina Makhatini
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Durban destroyed in an arson attack in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1990.

name: Vusimuzi Jeremiah Mahlangu
description: Was stabbed and assaulted by members of the Gadaffi faction of the ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress who attacked his car in Khutsong, Carletonville. Transvaal, in November 1990.

name: Bethwell Malgas
description: A SAYCO member who was shot and injured by community councillors in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 23 December 1989, during a youth march past the municipal offices. There were numerous deaths and injuries in December 1989 when Crossroads residents, under Jeffrey Nongwe, sought to break away from the pro-government Johnson Ngxobongwana and join the ANC.

name: Bethwell Malgas
description: A SAYCO member who was shot and injured by community councillors in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 23 December 1989, during a youth march past the municipal offices. There were numerous deaths and injuries in December 1989 when Crossroads residents, under Jeffrey Nongwe, sought to break away from the pro-government Johnson Ngxobongwana and join the ANC.

name: Derrick Sunnyboy Majola
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on 25 April 1991 in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, allegedly because of his prominent roles in the ANC and the Bruntville Civic Organisation. Mr Majola`s wife was also killed in the attack, their four year old child was shot and injured.

name: Sipho Makhatini
description: Was abducted by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) and taken to a place called `Danger zone` in Unit F, Tokoza, Transvaal, during October 1993. Mr Makhatini was shot and killed there. He was targeted because he was believed to be an IFP supporter. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/139). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Mondli Fano Magwaza
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, in June 1992. Mr Magwaza, expecting an attack on his life, was staying elsewhere at the time. Members of his family who were at home escaped unharmed.

name: Mdelwa Magubane
description: Was fatally shot by an ANC supporter at his home at Mashayazafe, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 5 December 1987, in intensifying political conflict in the area. His home was set alight in the attack.

name: Ntombi Evelyn Makongo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home and shop at Woodford, Bergville, Natal, looted on 16 December 1993 by a crowd of about two hundred IFP supporters returning from a rally. Two ANC members were killed and at least two were injured in clashes. On 20 and 27 February 1993, IFP supporters in Ladysmith destroyed Ms Makongo`s home and remaining property by fire.

name: Ntombi Evelyn Makongo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home and shop at Woodford, Bergville, Natal, looted on 16 December 1993 by a crowd of about two hundred IFP supporters returning from a rally. Two ANC members were killed and at least two were injured in clashes. On 20 and 27 February 1993, IFP supporters in Ladysmith destroyed Ms Makongo`s home and remaining property by fire.

name: Linos Makowani
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and his body set alight, along with those of two friends, in Edendale, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 27 May 1990. It is alleged that the victims, shortly before they were killed, had discovered a minibus full of charred bodies at a garage frequented by ANC supporters.

name: Moses Makua
description: He suffered traumatic losses when his wife was burnt to death and his property destroyed by ANC members and residents of GaMantlhanyane village, Nebo, Lebowa, on 11 April 1994. Three people were killed that day. Local residents believed that a sangoma had identified her as one of the people responsible for the deaths of six youths through witchcraft. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/2000/077).

name: Mphalele Monica Makua
description: Was abducted and killed by ANC supporters and residents, when petrol was poured on her and she was set alight in GaMantlhanyane village, Nebo, Lebowa, on 11 April 1994. The perpetrators accused her of using witchcraft to cause the deaths of six youths. Her own daughter was made to set her alight. Her home was also destroyed and two other people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty for the incidents (AC/2000/077).

name: Tabane Makua
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned and then burnt to death by named youths at GaMolepane Village, Sekhukhuneland, Lebowa, on 9 March 1994 after she was accused of practising witchcraft. The perpetrators were allegedly trying to purge the community of witches.

name: Andrias Makuluve
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by ANC supporters in Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 4 November 1991.

name: Oupa Everest Makume
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 12 September 1990, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Duduzile Makunga
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters, some of whom are named, in Empangeni, Natal, on 30 October 1993.

name: Phumzile Makunga
description: An IFP supporter who was raped and then stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 18 February 1992.

name: Nosilingi Patracia Makupula
description: An ADM supporter who lost her house in an attack by ANC supporters in Alice, Ciskei, on 8 September 1992.

name: Motimedi Gabriel Malaka
description: An ANC supporter who was placed in solitary confinement in Sibasa, Venda, in January 1978.

name: Malusi Ernest Malanga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by men in balaclavas while attending a disco in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 10 September 1993. Three people were killed and five injured. The alleged perpetrators, some of whom are named, were members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) that attacked other ANC supporters during conflict between ANC groups. See balaclava groups.

name: Thulani Albert Malanga
description: Was assaulted and stabbed to death at a bus stop in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, by named IFP supporters on 6 April 1993. Mr Malanga was allegedly thought to be an ANC supporter.

name: Tsidiso Selby Malatsi
description: Was shot dead by members of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang and IFP supporters in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 31 July 1993 during a raid on township residents. The conflict increased when the body of a gang leader was exhumed and allegedly burnt by township residents. Despite a peace pact signed between the IFP and ANC to ensure a second funeral, IFP supporters attacked Tembisa and killed thirty people and injured twenty one others on the day of the funeral. See Toaster gang.

name: Jabu Malaza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Tweefontein, KwaNdebele, in April 1986 when Imbokodo members tried to force him to become a vigilante during violent conflict over incorporation.

name: Sabata Samson Malebese
description: A SANCO member who suffered damage to his home in Ficksburg, Orange Free State (OFS), on 3 August 1993, when it was stoned by ANC supporters. There was conflict between local branches of the ANC and SANCO at the time.

name: Zaba Maledza
description: An ANC member who died while in prison in an ANC camp in Angola in 1984. Although suicide could not be ruled out, negligence due to poor detention facilities also contributed to his death. One ANC camp commander was granted amnesty for negligence in the death (AC/2000/149).

name: Alfred Maleka
description: Was shot and stabbed to death in Pimville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 12 April 1992 when IFP supporters attacked the ANC-supporting Fred Clarke informal settlement.

name: Nonhlanhla Eunice Malembe
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 21 February 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. One person was stabbed and burnt to death in the attack.

name: Mmakgobo Malete
description: She had her home in GaMatlala, Lebowa, burnt down by supporters of chief BK Matlala in February 1980, during conflict between Chief Matlala and residents who supported the ANC-aligned People`s Congress.

name: Mhlanganyelwa Andries Magubane
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down by ANC supporters near Estcourt, Natal, on 10 May 1994, shortly after the April 1994 elections.

name: Mhlanganyelwa Andries Magubane
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down by ANC supporters near Estcourt, Natal, on 10 May 1994, shortly after the April 1994 elections.

name: Msebenzi Wellington Mahlasela
description: An ANC supporter who was killed after he was thrown from a moving train, allegedly by IFP supporters between Katlehong and Wattville train stations, on 14 October 1992. See train violence.

name: Vela Russel Mahlatse
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 June 1993.

name: Esau Pule Mahlatsi
description: A Sebokeng mayor who was shot and his body burnt in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 27 May 1992 by ANC-aligned self-defence unit members. He had been seen as a collaborator since he was a member of the community council in 1984.

name: Martha Tsatsane Mahlatsi
description: Was shot dead in a car in Evaton, Transvaal, on 27 July 1991 with her boyfriend after receiving death threats from a rival grouping within the ANC-aligned civic organisation.

name: Nelson Mandla Mahlentle
description: Was burnt to death with his grandson in his home in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 10 February 1990, in an attack allegedly instigated by a named Crossroads leader opposed to the ANC.

name: Sonwabile Mahlentle
description: Was burnt to death with his grandfather in his home in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 10 February 1990, in an arson attack allegedly instigated by a named Crossroads leader opposed to the ANC.

name: Thabang Samuel Mahloko
description: An ANC supporter who died in police custody in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, on 14 December 1991.

name: Keikanetswe Selina Mahoko
description: Was severely beaten with a sjambok by members of the Bophuthatswana Defence Force in Taung, Bophuthatswana, on 8 January 1994 when she left a sportsfield where an ANC rally had been held.

name: Sekwati David Maimane
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in his home in Boksburg, Transvaal, on 12 September 1990 during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Selinah Nthabiseng Maine
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by ANC members in Tikwana, Hoopstad, Orange Free State (OFS) on 3 September 1992, allegedly for going to work during a stayaway.

name: Sabata Daniel Maisa
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 3 December 1990 after he reportedly refused to point out Xhosa-speaking people`s houses. Mr Maisa was one of nineteen people who died during conflict in Tokoza on that day, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Julia Maki Maitse
description: Was shot dead by members of the ANC-aligned self-defence unit in Moleleki, Katlehong, Germiston, on 7 December 1993. The perpetrators applied for amnesty for the abduction and killing of her husband and son in the same attack. Amnesty was denied.

name: Pogisho Thomas Maitshotlo
description: An ANC supporter who was partially paralysed after he was seriously injured in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Transvaal, on 9 May 1991 when an IFP supporter threw a hand grenade at ANC supporters on a peace march. Peace marches had been organised by both parties on that day.

name: Paul Teboho Maja
description: He died when ANC supporters petrol-bombed the bus in which he was travelling in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, on 6 February 1990. The incident took place during a strike by the employees of a bus company. The ANC, in solidarity with the strikers, had called on people not to use buses.

name: Mthuthuzeli Majalamba
description: An ANC member who was severely beaten while in police custody in March 1993 at Peddie, Ciskei. He was tortured and made to confess to the beating of a member of the ADM.

name: Daludumo Majenge
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by an IFP supporter during political conflict at Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, at on 29 March 1993. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Dumisani Majenge
description: An ANC supporter who died after being stabbed by IFP supporters in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 17 May 1992. Mr Majenge`s brother was killed by IFP supporters in March 1993, also in political conflict.

name: Dumisani Majenge
description: An ANC supporter who died after being stabbed by IFP supporters in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 17 May 1992. Mr Majenge`s brother was killed by IFP supporters in March 1993, also in political conflict.

name: Sbusiso Majiya
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by unidentified ANC supporters at Bulwer, Natal, on 19 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sbusiso Majiya
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by unidentified ANC supporters at Bulwer, Natal, on 19 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dumazile Grace Majiza
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dumazile Grace Majiza
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sinqokwana Ernest Malgas
description: An ANC member who was imprisoned on Robben Island from 1963 to 1977, and was subsequently detained and tortured on several occasions between 1977 and 1989 in Port Elizabeth and Cradock, Cape.

name: Joana Anna Majola
description: An ANC supporter who was the victim of an arson attack on her home when she and her family were attacked, allegedly by IFP supporters in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 9 April 1991. Ms Majola`s husband was abducted and killed during this incident.

name: Ntando Emmanuel Magubane
description: An ANC supporter who survived an attempt on his life when he was shot at by named and other IFP supporters while driving in the region of Ixopo, Natal, in July 1993.

name: Dan Makhaya
description: A local ANC executive member who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters, in a hostel in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 25 May 1993.

name: Konzapi Eunice Majola
description: An IFP supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in November 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ntlukwane Makewu
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten while detained at Bizana prison in Emqeni, Transkei, in 1960, allegedly because of his opposition to the Trust Land Act. It is believed that he later died due to the injuries he sustained while in prison.

name: Nqatyana Mahlala
description: Was stabbed to death at Dobsonville Hostel, Soweto, in 1990, during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Mr Mahlala was suspected of being an ANC supporter.

name: Siboniwe Cyprian Mange
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and killed by named members of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 14 February 1993. Mr Mange was abducted with his girlfriend who was forced to witness his killing before being raped.

name: Lovey Majola
description: He suffered damage to property when his house was burnt down by ANC members in Heidelberg, Transvaal, during 1992 or 1993. Mr. Majola and two other suspected IFP supporters were on an ANC hit list. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/064).

name: Ntuthane Magubane
description: He had his house in the Mpumalanga area, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in political conflict on 18 March 1990.

name: Mayvis Majola
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 25 April 1991, allegedly because of her husband`s prominent roles in the ANC and the Bruntville Civic Organisation. Ms Majola`s husband was also killed in the attack, their four year old child was shot and injured.

name: Bonginkosi Dennis Makhaye
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and beaten, and had his house set on fire by named and other IFP supporters in 1990 at KwaShange, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, in the Seven Day War.

name: Maria Dimakatso Makgajane
description: Was forced from her home by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 16 March 1992 after conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC supporters.

name: Sibuyiselo Sidney Mangele
description: An employee of Rand Water who was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) while he was travelling in a taxi past the informal settlement of Phola Park in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 26 February 1992. Four people died and eight were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack on the taxi (AC/1999/0225).

name: Douglas Mahlamvu
description: An ANC supporter who was detained for seven months at Lusikisiki, Transkei, in 1960, for his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Wellington Msawenkosi Magubane
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in July 1992.

name: Zwelandile Leonard Magubane
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mandla Alfred Magudelela
description: An ANC leader who was shot and killed by IFP members during political conflict at Ethandakukhanya, Piet Retief, Transvaal, on 9 June 1993. One person was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0023).

name: Khulekile Christina Makhaye
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in January 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mncedi Maguga
description: An ANC and SANCO member who lost his house, two minibuses and a car in arson attacks by ADM supporters at Ndakana, near King William`s Town, Cape, on 10 September 1990.

name: Nomusa Margaret Majola
description: An ANC-supporting civic leader and policewoman in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal,  who was forced to resign from her post and flee to Pietermaritzburg for safety when she was intimidated by her colleagues and superiors during political conflict in 1991.

name: Bongekile Mangwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 December 1992.

name: Nonkululeko Majola
description: Was shot and injured in an attack on her home by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 25 April 1991. Both her parents were killed in the attack. Her father played a prominent role in the ANC and Bruntville Civic Organisation.

name: Ngombole Magumbini
description: He had his home burnt down on 16 February 1993 in a dawn arson attack by IFP supporters on the ANC stronghold of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, allegedly in the course of conflict over access to resources. Ten people were killed and thirty five houses were burnt down.

name: Ntombikabani Majola
description: An ANC supporter who had her house petrol-bombed by IFP supporters at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 March 1994, allegedly because she  refused to join an IFP march in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombikabani Majola
description: An ANC supporter who had her house petrol-bombed by IFP supporters at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 March 1994, allegedly because she  refused to join an IFP march in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Pius Majola
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Haza, Howick, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1990. Mr Majola was forced to flee the area, which was considered an IFP stronghold.

name: Zwelethemba Eric (Aka 'Mzwandile Jongile' And 'Mbumbumbulo') Magwa
description: An ANC member from Adelaide, Cape, who was executed in Angola in 1984 following mutinies in the ANC camps of Viana and Pango, in Angola. Two groups of mutineers were tried by military tribunals and seven were executed.

name: Sipamo Hezekia Makhaye
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and burnt to death by another named ANC supporter in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 20 April 1992, allegedly because he was thought to be a `spy` for the IFP.

name: Albert Thanda Magwaza
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bekinkosi Peter Magwaza
description: An IFP supporter who had his home damaged by fire on 10 April 1992 and a month later was shot and injured in Dobsonville, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Bongekile Anna Magwaza
description: An ANC supporter who had her house vandalised by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Caleb Bongumusa Magwaza
description: An IFP branch secretary who was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Sabeka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, on 28 July 1993, allegedly because of his prominent position in the local branch of the organisation.

name: Cijimpi Magwaza
description: He had his house in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, damaged by stoning on 16 February 1992 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Elizabeth Magwaza
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ellington Sigudla Magwaza
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted by IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in late 1990, allegedly because he was in possession of Mandela T-shirts and firearms. Earlier, in September 1990, his wife had been shot dead by IFP supporters in the course of political conflict in the area.

name: Lillian Magwaza
description: She had her house in Ntsingweni, near Gingindlovu, Natal, burnt down on 28 December 1991 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Loneni Thambolini Magwaza
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 February 1992, when IFP supporters returning from a chief`s gathering attacked ANC hostels and homes in the area. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Magqubu Mbongeni Magwaza
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by unidentified assailants at Emathunzi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 21 March 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sibongile Maria Mahlangu
description: Was shot and injured in February 1994 by IFP supporters who came to her house near Ethethe, Stanger, Natal, to look for her sons, who were ANC supporters. The perpetrators demanded her belongings, and shot her when she tried to escape.

name: Ngenalutho Magwaza
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombi Ellen Magwaza
description: She had her house burnt down at Sabeka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, in March 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Ntombizodwa Augustina Magwaza
