description: An ANC supporter who had her house in KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 August 1993. She was forced to flee the area as a result of the attack.

name: Princess Benzie Magwaza
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Shonangaphi Magwaza
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in October 1993 in intense conflict between the `Red` and `Green` factions.

name: Sikhumbuzo Magwaza
description: A member of MAWU who lost his house in Empangeni, Natal, in an arson attack by ANC supporters in December 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Thokozani Patience Magwaza
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Velephi Magwaza
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down on 22 December 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Zabantu Joyce Magwaza
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu,  near Durban  on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Matsidiso Jane Mahasa
description: An ANC supporter who was killed when she was run over, allegedly deliberately, by a police vehicle in Thabong, Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS), on 11 February 1990. The group was celebrating Nelson Mandela`s release from prison. Four other ANC supporters were killed by the vehicle, which ploughed into the crowd. Thirty one were injured.

name: Kholwangifile Mahaye
description: She lost her home in Mtilombo, near Eshowe, Natal, in an arson attack on 23 November 1993 in continuing ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Albertina Thokozile Mahlaba
description: She had her house set alight at Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bafana Mahlaba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Bellina Dolly Mahlaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters who attacked her home in Smero, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 20 September 1990. Five other family members, including three children, were shot and injured, and two were shot dead in the attack.

name: Enoch Sipho Mahlaba
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by alleged members of the ISU in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 14 August 1992.

name: Primrose Thandiwe Majola
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 April 1993 in intense political conflict between the `Red` and `Green` factions.

name: Thabo Makhaye
description: An ANC supporter who was pursued and shot dead by a group of masked men in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 20 September 1993 during escalating conflict in the area following an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel on 22 May 1993 which led to more than eighty deaths.

name: Thabo Makhaye
description: An ANC supporter who was pursued and shot dead by a group of masked men in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 20 September 1993 during escalating conflict in the area following an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel on 22 May 1993 which led to more than eighty deaths.

name: Ruben Manns
description: An ANC member who was assaulted, hacked and burnt to death on 1 August 1993 by members of Khumalo gang, an IFP-aligned vigilante group after being directed with five other ANC supporters to Khumalo Street, Tokoza, Transvaal, where the gang was based.

name: Ntsoaki Rebecca Manqa
description: Was seriously injured when ANC supporters threw a hand grenade into her relative`s house in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 28 April 1992 because a family member was an IFP supporter. One person was killed, another subsequently died, and two others injured in the explosion.

name: Bongani Manqele
description: He had his home at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, set on fire on 23 April 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The family were asleep when their home was attacked. They managed to escape but the rondavels were completely destroyed.

name: Bongani Manqele
description: He had his home at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, set on fire on 23 April 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The family were asleep when their home was attacked. They managed to escape but the rondavels were completely destroyed.

name: Mandlakapheli Hendry Manqele
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 25 February 1994. About 20 deaths of victims from both the IFP and the ANC and at least twenty eight incidents of house burning were recorded that month. Hundreds of people were forced to flee the area, and schools and shops were forced to close.

name: Cebisile Manqele
description: She had her home at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, set on fire on 23 April 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The family were asleep when their home was attacked. They managed to escape, but the rondavels were completely destroyed.

name: Cebisile Manqele
description: She had her home at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, set on fire on 23 April 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The family were asleep when their home was attacked. They managed to escape, but the rondavels were completely destroyed.

name: Mzandile Manqele
description: Was shot dead in Mandini, Natal, on 9 August 1993, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Khetiwe Manqele
description: She had her home at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, set on fire on 23 April 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The family were asleep when their home was attacked. They managed to escape, but the rondavels were completely destroyed.

name: Khetiwe Manqele
description: She had her home at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, set on fire on 23 April 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The family were asleep when their home was attacked. They managed to escape, but the rondavels were completely destroyed.

name: Tandekile Manqele
description: had her homestead burnt down in Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, on 23 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Tandekile Manqele
description: had her homestead burnt down in Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, on 23 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Alfred Mantyi
description: Was shot and killed by ANC/FAWU members during a period of conflict between ANC and IFP-supporting workers at the Langeberg Food factory, in Boksburg, Transvaal, in September 1991. One ANC member was granted amnesty for the killing (AC/1998/0080).

name: Elbin Thandabantu Manyamalala
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters coming back from an IFP rally in White City, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 8 September 1991. Several others were killed by IFP supporters that day.

name: Bhekokwakhe Manyanga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by fellow ANC supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 7 April 1993 in the course of a serious internal feud within the local party branch.

name: Morongwana Snowball Makganye
description: Was severely beaten by named members of the police in Lehurutshe, Bophuthatswana, in April 1993 after a community meeting in Braklaagte. Mr Makganye raised a clenched fist and was accused of being an ANC member.

name: Samsan Bhekifa Majola
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 28 June 1992.

name: Samuel Majola
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted on 9 April 1991, allegedly by IFP supporters, after his room was set on fire and was later found stabbed to death in the street in Vosloorus, Transvaal.

name: Nomusa Maria Makhaza
description: She lost her house and its contents in an arson attack allegedly carried out by ANC supporters in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 13 August 1990 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Jabulile Lina Malindisa
description: Was shot and injured in Ermelo, Transvaal, on 14 September 1992 when he was caught in conflict between the IFP-aligned Black Cats and ANC supporters. See Black Cats.

name: Belesia Malinga
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters in Kwadela, Davel, Transvaal, on 27 July 1991 during tension in the area after a number of houses belonging to councillors were burnt after they joined the IFP.

name: Weh Majola
description: Was shot and injured during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 5 August 1992.

name: Bongani Malinga
description: Was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) during conflict between the Black Cats and the ANC in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, on 22 October 1993. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the killing (AC/98/0120).

name: Albert Mthandeni Makhoba
description: He had his home in Machibini, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, burnt down in August 1993 in conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Jacob Mahlangu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in a drive-by shooting in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 17 April 1994 in political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 election. A young woman was also killed in this incident.

name: Jacob Mahlangu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in a drive-by shooting in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 17 April 1994 in political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 election. A young woman was also killed in this incident.

name: Magdelina Mahlangu
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured after being shot twice in the hip by unidentified perpetrators outside her home opposite Mazibuko hostel in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 9 April 1994 during escalating political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 election.

name: Magdelina Mahlangu
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured after being shot twice in the hip by unidentified perpetrators outside her home opposite Mazibuko hostel in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 9 April 1994 during escalating political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 election.

name: Mpliseni Manqele
description: He had his home at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, set on fire on 23 April 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The family were asleep when their home was attacked. They managed to escape, but the rondavels were completely destroyed.

name: Mpliseni Manqele
description: He had his home at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, set on fire on 23 April 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The family were asleep when their home was attacked. They managed to escape, but the rondavels were completely destroyed.

name: Bongani Malinga
description: An ANC supporter who was hit by a train while fleeing from named IFP supporters who had attacked and burnt down his house at Umkomaas, Natal, on 24 December 1990. He lost a leg as a result of the incident.

name: Bafunani Khalelani Makhoba
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Henry Gordon Makgothi
description: An ANC member from Orlando, Soweto, Johannesburg, who was arrested in Northern Rhodesia (Zambia) by the British colonial authorities in 1962 and handed back to the South African authorities. Mr Makgothi was detained and subjected to torture. He was sentenced to two years` imprisonment for leaving South Africa illegally, and later to a further six years for offences under the Suppression of Communism Act.

name: Zithulele Nicholas Majola
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in July 1992.

name: Dingumbuzi Makhoba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when his home in Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, was attacked in March 1991 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Mr Makhoba`s wife and son were also shot and injured at home. Later that year, another son was axed to death at work in Empangeni.

name: Eunice Zandile Malinga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters at the taxi rank at Ixopo, Natal, on 20 January 1994 in fighting between ANC and IFP supporters. Six bystanders were wounded. Ms Malinga lost her sight in one eye as a result of the shooting.

name: Dolly Makhoba
description: An ANC supporter who had her house stoned and vandalised and her possessions destroyed by IFP supporters in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, in February 1992. Her daughter was injured in the attack. Another daughter was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter seven months later.

name: Faziza Raymond Makhoba
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death at his workplace in Empangeni, Natal, on 8 December 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His parents and brother had been shot and injured in an attack on their home earlier that year.

name: Mbuyiselwa Malinga
description: Was shot dead in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 8 April 1993 during continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Clegyman Mthunzi Majozi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack by IFP supporters on 23 June 1991 at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal. See Richmond attacks.

name: David Mzomuhle Majozi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters at Entembeni, Stanger, Natal, on 10 August 1993. Two other ANC supporters were killed in the attack.

name: Mphikeleli Joseph Malinga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by IFP members during political conflict at Ethandakukhanya, Piet Retief, Transvaal, on 9 June 1993. One perpetrator was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0023).

name: Bhekinkosi Malcom Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 November 1991 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Duma Majozi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by another named ANC supporter at KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 4 June 1993, allegedly in a serious internal feud.

name: Msende Michael Malinga
description: He had his house looted and set alight by IFP supporters at Mandini, Natal, on 29 November 1993. Mr Malinga was allegedly targeted because his son was an ANC supporter.

name: Gudusa Makhoba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in political conflict at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 March 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/2000/054).

name: Nelisiwe Makhoba
description: An ANC supporter who was injured when IFP supporters stoned and vandalised her home in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, in February 1992.

name: Nothando Makhoba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, in September 1992. IFP supporters had stoned and vandalised the Makhoba home in Sundumbili earlier that year.

name: Elizabeth Ntombi Majozi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by a named IFP supporter at Ntuzuma, near Durban, in October 1991.

name: Busisiwe Michal Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Philemon Jabulane Malinga
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Kwadela, Davel, Transvaal, on 5 February 1991.

name: Sipho Erick Makhoba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot in Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 March 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mbizo Majozi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Doris Makhanya
description: She had her house in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down in May 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thembisile Makhoba
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and shop burnt down in an arson attack in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in ongoing political conflict between the `Red` and `Green` factions during 1993.

name: Eric Makhobela
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death with pangas and decapitated by named IFP supporters in Tembisa, Kempton Park, Transvaal, on 1 August 1993.

name: Dumisani Michael Makhanya
description: Was shot dead in KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 3 April 1992 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Five other youths died in the shooting.

name: Mfanizakhe Majozi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Fakazile Khonzephi Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sibusiso Malinga
description: had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Kwadela, Davel, Transvaal, on 27 July 1991 during conflict between IFP supporters and ANC supporters.

name: Mngciki Majozi
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in an arson attack on 16 August 1990 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Fikile Angel Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Wilton Mzonzima Makholwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 17 June 1993. Several other ANC supporters were killed in the attack by hostel-dwellers linked to the IFP-aligned Toaster gang. See Toaster gang.

name: Zibuyile Dumeleni Makhonza
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters during 1991.

name: David Malaisha Makhubedu
description: Was detained by the ANC security department in Angola in 1984 and held in custody until November 1988. During his incarceration he was severely tortured. He was a resident of Meadowlands, Johannesburg. See ANC camps.

name: Joseph Makhubela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers in Swanieville, Krugersdorp, Transvaal, on 12 May 1991. About one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt in retaliation for the expulsion of IFP supporters from Swanieville informal settlement. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Makomorane Aletta Makhubu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in Vrede, Orange Free State (OFS), on 28 April 1993, when police opened fire on a protest march calling for the release of children from custody. Ms Makhubu died later from her wounds.

name: James Mntuwendaba Makhunga
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Pesika Vrey Makinana
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed by IFP supporters in Hlobane, near Vryheid, Natal, in August 1990.

name: Xola Tennyson Makiwane
description: A former ANC member who was shot dead by an unidentified perpetrator at his house in Umtata, Transkei, in 1976. He had returned from exile after his expulsion from the ANC in the 1970s.

name: Thomas Malinga
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested, severely beaten and detained for a month by the police in Worcester, Cape, in September 1985. He later served a five-year prison sentence for public violence.

name: Zacharia Malinga
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Kwadela, Davel, Transvaal, on 27 July 1991.

name: Maferong Jacob Makae
description: A Dikwankwetla National Party (DNP) supporter who had his house set alight in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, on 29 August 1989, allegedly because of his support for the DNP.

name: Nomagubu Daphney Makaphela
description: Was stabbed by members of the `Gadaffi` faction of the ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) in Khutsong, Careletonville, Transvaal, in November 1990 as she returned from the funeral of a member of the `Zim-Zim` faction of the KYC.

name: Sindekile Makaula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed in a dawn attack on the ANC stronghold of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 16 February 1993, allegedly in internal conflict over access to resources and `muti`. Ten people were killed and thirty five houses were burnt down.

name: Anna Makawulo
description: An ANC supporter who lost two houses in an arson attack at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in the conflict between ANC and the IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Anna Makawulo
description: An ANC supporter who lost two houses in an arson attack at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in the conflict between ANC and the IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Margaret Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Tsotetsi Mapule Maliyana
description: had her house burnt down in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Tsotetsi Mapule Maliyana
description: had her house burnt down in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Maxwell Jabulani Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, by a named perpetrator, allegedly an ANC supporter, on 10 June 1992, reportedly because Mr Makhanya was accompanied by an IFP youth at the time of the incident.

name: Felisberto Catine Maluane
description: Was sjambokked  by a named ANC supporter at Shongwe mission, Nelspruit, Transvaal, in May 1987. Mr Maluane was rescued before being burnt alive.

name: Menzi Michael Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 1 September 1992.

name: Mfanufikile Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nakeni Mitta Makhanya
description: She had her house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 1 February 1993 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters over political control of the area. Ms Makhanya`s son had been shot and severely injured the previous year in the course of political conflict.

name: Nkosinathi Christomas Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and stabbed and beaten to death by other named ANC supporters in Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 27 July 1991, allegedly in the course of a serious internal feud. His body was mutilated.

name: Nomhawu Ida Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sipho Manqele
description: had his home at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, set on fire on 23 April 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The family were asleep when their home was attacked. They managed to escape, but the rondavels were completely destroyed.

name: Sipho Manqele
description: had his home at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, set on fire on 23 April 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The family were asleep when their home was attacked. They managed to escape, but the rondavels were completely destroyed.

name: Ntombi Pauline Makhanya
description: She had her house at Ntiyane, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down in October 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sifiso Treasure Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in the eye at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1992 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sipho Siphiwe Makhanya
description: He died when attackers shot him and cut his throat at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 18 October 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Siyabonga Makhanya
description: Was stabbed and injured by IFP supporters while fleeing his burning home in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 7 November 1992. The perpetrators allegedly attacked Siyabonga because of his mother`s support for the ANC.

name: Thandiwe Rose Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in an arson attack on 13 December 1991. Ms Makhanya`s husband had been shot dead in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area two weeks earlier.

name: Themba Christopher Makhanya
description: Was shot dead by named ANC supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 31 December 1993. His wife was also killed and their house burnt down in the  attack. A neighbour was allegedly suspected of being a police informer and the attackers are believed to have targeted the wrong house.

name: Thembani Annastasia Makhanya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 7 November 1992. Ms Makhanya`s son, aged nine, was stabbed and injured in the attack.

name: Cawe Thomas Makhapela
description: He had his shop looted and burnt in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, in April 1990 during violent conflict between two rival groups in the ANC. See Khutsong Youth Congress.

name: Ntozi Jane Makhathine
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 4 December 1991. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Elizabeth Makhathini (Hlekwayo)
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked in her home in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, by IFP supporters on 23 July 1992. Shots were fired at her and members of her family, and their two huts were burnt down. The family was forced to flee the area.

name: Clarice Mhlengi Makhathini
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when IFP supporters attacked homes in the ANC stronghold of Magcino in the Shlazeni Reserve, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 October 1992. Nine ANC supporters were killed and 18 others wounded. More than 36 houses and huts were burnt down.

name: Joseph Bongani Makhathini
description: Was shot dead in Obanjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 February 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mbhekeni Makhathini
description: Was shot dead and had his house burnt down by ANC supporters at Gingindlovu, Natal, on 23 November 1993. The perpetrators allegedly mistook his traditional Nazareth Church attire for IFP dress.

name: Agrippa Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and his body was mutilated by IFP supporters in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 24 September 1993.

name: Bahambephi Maphumulo
description: She lost her house in Mandini, Natal, in an arson attack on 28 December 1991 during political violence between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mantuntu Jackson Maqhashalala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in Flagstaff, Transkei, in June 1960, during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Nomagabiso Greta Maqoma
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Amaoti, Inanda, near Durban, on 15 March 1991.

name: Andrew Mbuiselo Maqwane
description: Was shot dead by members of the IFP-aligned Khetisi Kheswa gang in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 12 January 1991 during the night vigil of an ANC activist killed by the gang. Gang members fired shots and threw hand grenades at mourners, killing a number of people and injuring several others. See Nangalembe night vigil massacre.

name: Thandi Mashinini
description: An ANC supporter who was raped in August 1990 in Katlehong, Transvaal, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Makgaba Jeanette Marakalala
description: An ANC supporter who  was beaten by Vark Squad vigilantes at Oukasie, near Brits, Transvaal, on 30 October 1989.

name: Joseph March
description: Was shot dead in his own front yard in Alexandra, Johannesburg, in June 1993 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Jacob Khomotso Maredi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 1 May 1993 because of his political activities.

name: Thabang Maretloane
description: An ANC supporter who was tortured by attempted suffocation while he was in detention in West Bank prison, East London, in June 1986.

name: Ndoyisile William Mari
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Port Elizabeth in 1964, and sentenced to seven years` imprisonment on Robben Island, Cape Town. After his release, he was placed under restrictions in the King William`s Town area, Cape.

name: Thomi Thomas Maphumulo
description: Was shot dead while returning home from work in Isipingo, Natal, on 9 April 1992, during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Mr Maphumulo had previously fled Umbumbulu to escape the violence.

name: Elizabeth Marks
description: Was shot in Soweto, Johannesburg, in 1990 during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Muzi Mongezi Martin
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters, some of whom are named, in Orlando West, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 2 September 1992 because he was believed to be an IFP supporter.

name: Vuyelwa Joyce Martin
description: An ANC supporter who lost her shop and tavern in an arson attack by named ANC supporters in Orlando West, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 2 September 1992. The family was targeted because they were believed to be IFP supporters.

name: Alfred Toko Marumo
description: Was shot dead by `comrades` in Sharpeville, Vereeniging, Transvaal, in May 1992. Sharpeville, like many other Transvaal townships, was embroiled in conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the early 1990s.

name: Talente Mirriam Marwebu
description: An IFP supporter who had her home at Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 3 July 1990.

name: Bhekithemba Eugene Maphumulo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 30 July 1990, allegedly because his father, in whose house the attack took place, was an ANC supporter. Mr Maphumulo`s wife was also shot dead and his son, aged 4, was shot and injured in the attack.

name: Sibongiseni Mathe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in December 1992 in continuing political violence between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Fakazile Manyathi
description: had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Blood River, near Dundee, Natal, in April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Fakazile Manyathi
description: had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Blood River, near Dundee, Natal, in April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sipho Bethuel Mathe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death, allegedly by IFP supporters in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 13 October 1990.

name: Thabo Benedict Manyathi
description: An ANC supporter who was detained under emergency regulations in Sibongile, Dundee, Natal, in August 1988 and held in custody for three months, allegedly because of his political activities.

name: Thandiswa Beatrice Maseti
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Alice, Ciskei, on 27 September 1992. Her husband was accused of being a Ciskei government collaborator and was killed by `necklacing`.

name: Doto John Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Edward Bonginkosi Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house petrol-bombed by IFP supporters in Bhekulwandle, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 29 October 1992. Shots were fired in the attack, injuring Mr Maphumulo`s mother. His sister, an invalid, died from smoke inhalation.

name: Fanyana Amos Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1991, allegedly because he was associated with CONTRALESA Chief Mhlabunzima Maphumulo. Chief Maphumulo had died in a targeted killing on 25 February 1991.

name: Gcina Geoffrey Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 July 1991 by unidentified people who had urged him to accompany them to an IFP self-defence training camp.

name: Joy Maryjane Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters on 27 July 1992 in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban. A day earlier, eight people had been killed by armed IFP supporters in the Folweni massacre.

name: Justice Nkosingiphile Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death by IFP supporters at Emachobeni, Richmond, Natal, on 5 July 1991. He had allegedly failed to respond to an IFP youth recruitment campaign.

name: Kenneth Nkosinathi Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban on 5 August 1992. His cousin, also an ANC supporter, was also killed in the attack. A COSATU stayaway had been organised for that day, and IFP supporters had allegedly attacked those who had not gone to work.

name: Khathi Nomusa Maphumulo
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house in an arson attack at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, in January 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mandla Erik Maphumulo
description: He lost his house in an arson attack in the Mkhukhuze area, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mandla Ophius Maphumulo
description: Was returning home from a funeral when he was shot dead in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 2 September 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mandlenkosi Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Msawenkosi Maphumulo
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death in August 1993 when ANC supporters attacked and set fire to his mother`s home in Nsuze, Tongaat, Natal. His brother, also an IFP supporter, was also burnt to death in the attack.

name: Mzwamandla Maphumulo
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death in August 1993 when ANC supporters attacked and set fire to his mother`s home in Nsuze, Tongaat, Natal. His brother, an IFP supporter, was also burnt to death in the attack.

name: Nakoti Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who had her homestead destroyed in an arson attack by unidentified persons, at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, Natal, in 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Both her sons were injured in the attack.

name: Nhlanhla Gerald Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured by a named IFP supporter at Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1991. At the time of the attack, Mr Maphumulo was allegedly with a person who was being targeted by local youths and IFP chiefs.

name: Nonkantolo Ganephi Maphumulo
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Nsuze, Tongaat, Natal, in August 1993. Both her sons, who were IFP supporters, were burnt to death in the attack.

name: Penelope Nombuso Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 30 July 1990, allegedly because her father-in-law, in whose house the attack took place, was an ANC supporter. Ms Maphumulo`s husband was also shot dead, and her son, aged 4, was shot and injured in the attack.

name: Primrose Khwezi Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter and an invalid who died of suffocation when her brother`s house was petrol-bombed by IFP supporters in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 29 October 1992.

name: Samukelo Maphumulo
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 30 July 1990, allegedly because his grandfather, in whose house the attack took place, was an ANC supporter. Samukelo`s parents were both shot dead in the attack.

name: Sibusiso Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Sibusiso Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Sihle Cyprian Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at K Section, Umlazi, Durban, on 24 September 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sikhumbuzo Richard Maphumulo
description: Was shot dead in an attack on his family home at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 25 March 1992, during continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Simon Qhimilili Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Vusi Wilson Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was injured when his car overturned after it had been stoned by IFP supporters at Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1991.

name: Zanele Maphumulo
description: Was shot dead at Tongaat, Natal, on 8 August 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Zibuyile Joyce Maphumulo
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1992.

name: Zithulele Gilbert Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters, allegedly assisted by the police, at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 September 1992. A peace initiative to end political violence in the area was underway at the time.

name: Mhleli Michael Mapongwana
description: A chairperson of the Western Cape Civic Association and an ANC supporter  who was pulled from a vehicle and shot dead by named and other members of the Western Cape Black Taxi Association in Philippi, Cape Town, on 8 July 1991. His driver was also shot dead. Mr Mapongwana had played a mediating role in ongoing taxi conflicts, which had acquired a political dimension. He had survived two previous assassination attempts in 1990, one of which had killed his wife. See taxi violence.

name: Bongokwakhe Hebron Mapumulo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Bhekulwandle, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, during 1991.

name: Danisiel Amy Mapumulo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Gilford Katshana Mapumulo
description: He had his house in Qinabout, Port Shepstone, Natal, petrol-bombed in April 1991 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Mr Mapumulo and his family were forced to flee the area.

name: Nomlomo Mapumulo
description: Was severely injured after being stabbed and shot in Katlehong, Transvaal, allegedly by ANC supporters, on 12 September 1992 because her husband was suspected of being an IFP supporter. Ms Mapumulo`s three daughters were also allegedly killed in this incident and her son was reportedly confined to a wheelchair as a result of his injuries. Ms Mapumulo herself lost an eye.

name: Siwoti Mapumulo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Simphiwe Zakariah Mapute
description: Was shot dead by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 2 February 1993. The perpetrator thought Mr Mapute was trying to attack him as he walked along the road at night. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2001/140).

name: Thembi Joyce Maqethuka
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Ntombi Betina Masondo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 4 November 1992. Her husband, aged 74, was stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Robert Muntuyedwa Masondo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters when they attacked and burnt down his home in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 4 November 1992.

name: Zacharia Mhlabunzima Masondo
description: An IFP supporter who was beaten and stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 4 October 1992.

name: Manta Christina Masopa
description: Died after being attacked and burnt by a group of youths at Daveyton, Transvaal, on 2 July 1987. The youths targeted another person who was not present at the time of the attack. Four people died and four suffered injuries as a result of the attack. One perpetrator, who claimed to be an ANC supporter and chairperson of a `people`s court`, was refused amnesty for the attack (AC/2001/282).

name: Moses Godfrey Masopa
description: He suffered injuries when he was attacked and burnt by a group of youths at Daveyton, Transvaal, on 2 July 1987. The youths targeted another person who was not present at the time of the attack. Four people died and four suffered injuries as a result of the attack. One perpetrator, who claimed to be an ANC supporter and chairperson of a `people`s court`, was refused amnesty for the attack (AC/2001/282).

name: Nompi Elinah Masopa
description: She suffered injuries and damage to property when she was attacked and burnt by a group of youths at Daveyton, Transvaal, on 2 July 1987. The youths were targeting someone else, who was not present at the time of the attack. Four people died and four suffered injuries as a result of the attack. One perpetrator, who claimed to be an ANC supporter and chairperson of a `people`s court`, was refused amnesty for the attack (AC/2001/282).

name: Handsome Masuka
description: An ANC supporter who was severely tortured and then arrested by members of the police in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, during 1992. He was convicted on political charges. In 1995 he was released from prison, allegedly because he had been poisoned.

name: Alpheus Zakhele Masuku
description: An ANC executive member who disappeared from Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, in March 1994 and has not been seen since. During the early 1990s, the area was embroiled in conflict between the IFP-aligned Black Cats and the ANC. See Black Cats.

name: Edward Masuku
description: An ANC member who died in an ANC camp prison in Angola in 1985. Negligence due to poor detention facilities contributed to his ill health and death. One ANC camp commander was granted amnesty for negligence in the death (AC/2000/149).

name: Phiwayinkosi Masuku
description: Was stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Somopho, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 July 1992 in continuing political violence in the area. Mr Masuku was allegedly perceived to be an IFP supporter.

name: Samuel Veli Masuku
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 27 April 1994 during an attack on a tavern where he was celebrating the April 1994 election. Mr Masuku died in hospital on 1 May 1994.

name: Samuel Veli Masuku
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 27 April 1994 during an attack on a tavern where he was celebrating the April 1994 election. Mr Masuku died in hospital on 1 May 1994.

name: Samuel Veli Masuku
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 27 April 1994 during an attack on a tavern where he was celebrating the April 1994 election. Mr Masuku died in hospital on 1 May 1994.

name: Thembi Emily Masuku
description: She had her house burnt in an arson attack in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, in 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. She was allegedly targeted because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Thulani Masuku
description: An ANC executive committee member who was shot and stabbed to death on 30 August 1992 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal.

name: Thulani Hansford Masuku
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 23 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thulani Hansford Masuku
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 23 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Moitheki Isaac Mataboge
description: Was tortured and beaten by local civic members in Evaton, Transvaal, in March 1993 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sinko Mtshanyane Mataku
description: An ANC supporter who was tortured by a named perpetrator in November 1961 at Cofimvaba, Transkei.

name: Kedibone Rebecca Matebesi
description: She had her house damaged on 4 February 1994 in Letsopa, Ottosdal, Transvaal, when ANC offices nearby were bombed by AWB supporters wanting to sabotage the April 1994 election. The perpetrators applied for amnesty.

name: Kedibone Rebecca Matebesi
description: She had her house damaged on 4 February 1994 in Letsopa, Ottosdal, Transvaal, when ANC offices nearby were bombed by AWB supporters wanting to sabotage the April 1994 election. The perpetrators applied for amnesty.

name: Maqhikizana Roster Matenjwa
description: She had her house and possessions destroyed in an arson attack near Empangeni, Natal, in February 1994, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ziphozonke Patrick Matenjwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Esikhawini,  KwaZulu,  near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 January 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Elinah Mathaba
description: She had her home burnt down at Bhekizitha, Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sani Leonard Mathaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by named IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 30 November 1992.

name: Xolani Mathaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured when unidentified persons attacked and burnt down his mother`s house at Machibini, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, in November 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Paul Maboyi Mathabatha
description: An ANC supporter who was crippled after a severe beating by IFP supporters in Hillbrow, Johannesburg, on 25 November 1993.

name: Bhekizizwe Daniel Mathabela
description: He had his home in KwaMancinza, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in October 1991 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bhekizitha Mathe
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by a named ANC supporter in Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 4 June 1993.

name: Eunice Shisekile Mathe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured and had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Somopho,  KwaZulu,  near Empangeni, Natal, on 9 May 1994 in ongoing political violence following the April 1994 elections.

name: Eunice Shisekile Mathe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured and had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Somopho,  KwaZulu,  near Empangeni, Natal, on 9 May 1994 in ongoing political violence following the April 1994 elections.

name: Musa Mathews Mathe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by an IFP supporter in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 1 November 1992, while on his way to attend a peace meeting called by the local induna.

name: Sylvia Monica Mashiya
description: Was stabbed in the face by IFP supporters in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Transvaal, on 12 May 1991. IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers were retaliating against a previous attack by ANC-supporting squatters and approximately one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Njabulo Cyril Mashaba
description: An IFP supporter who  was shot and severely injured by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 3 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Njabulo Cyril Mashaba
description: An IFP supporter who  was shot and severely injured by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 3 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: (First Name Not Given) Mathebula
description: He died when he was shot and his body burnt by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Transvaal, during 1993. The victim was thought to be an IFP supporter. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0243). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Nomathemba Amoree Matshoba
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home and all its contents in an atack by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992 in intense political conflict in the area. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Ntombifikile Nesta Masang
description: She had her home at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in June 1993 during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mndawe Elijah Mashiyane
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ratanda, Heidelberg, Transvaal, on 14 November 1992 during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting township residents.

name: Sile Sipho Manyi
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 December 1992 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Lucas Mashumpa
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Transvaal, on 12 May 1991. IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers were retaliating against a previous attack by ANC-supporting squatters and approximately one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Mlungiswa Justice Masiba
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Dannhauser, near Vryheid, Natal on 12 February 1991. The perpetrators, allegedly acting with the support of the Dana Mine management during a wage dispute at this mine, were attempting to expel Xhosa-speaking employees from the mine. Those who did not leave were killed.

name: Batshatile Mqanti Masikane
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mhlonganisa William Masikane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed in a mob attack in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1990. He was blinded as a result of the attack.

name: Sarah Nomajamani Masiko
description: Was burnt to death when her home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, was attacked on 4 August 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Boyana Jan Masilela
description: An ANC activist who was abducted, tortured and assaulted by Imbokodo vigilantes in Siyabuswa, KwaNdebele, on 18 May 1986. The abducted youths were rescued by members of the police. Three of the accused paid R50 admission of guilt fines.

name: Sophy Masilela
description: Was killed on a farm road near Nelspruit, Transvaal, when the car she was travelling in detonated a landmine on 17 August 1986. Planting of landmines aimed at military patrols in rural areas was part of the ANC`s campaign but was called off due to the high civilian casualty rate.

name: Velaphi Masilela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and his body was burnt on 3 August 1992 in Katlehong, Transvaal, allegedly by ANC supporters.

name: Christopher Masinda
description: A security guard who was held up at gunpoint and tied up by ANC self-defence (SDU) members at the Giwi Breyton Construction compound in Evander, Transvaal, on 6 July 1992. One security guard was shot dead and another shot and injured. The SDU members, who sought to seize guns at the site, were engaged in clashes with the Black Cats in Ermelo, Transvaal. Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/19998/0121). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: (First Name Not Given) Masinga
description: An ANC supporter who was targeted for elimination by IFP members at Hlanganani Hall, Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during 1992. One perpetrator in the conspiracy was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Bongiwe Masinga
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by fellow IFP supporters in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 April 1994, allegedly because the perpetrators were looking for her brother who had joined the ANC.

name: Nyamukamadi Masithi
description: Was burnt to death in Thohoyandou, Venda, on 4 February 1990 by named ANC supporters who accused her of being a government leader responsible for ritual murders and reinforcing her position by the use of witchcraft. One of the perpetrators applied for amnesty.

name: Agnes Zanele Manyoni
description: An ANC supporter who fled her home after she was intimidated by IFP supporters in Mkhambathini, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, in November 1991. Her house was then burnt down.

name: Nurse Maria Manyoni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by named IFP supporters in intensifying political conflict in the area in 1987.

name: Nompumelelo Freda Manyonta
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in March 1976 in KwaZakele, Port Elizabeth, and charged with arson. She was convicted and sentenced to 18 months` imprisonment.

name: William Manzana
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named perpetrators outside his house in Cala, Transkei, on 18 August 1960, allegedly because he opposed the installation of KD Matanzima as Chief of the Thembus.

name: Esther Manzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mfuneni Richard Manzi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mkoti Nomusa Manzi
description: An ANC member who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: David Mevane Manzini
description: Was assaulted and killed in his yard by an unidentified perpetrator at Boiphatong, Vanderbijlpark, Transvaal, on 17 June 1991 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Edward Manzini
description: Was killed in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 February 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Elijah Maoba
description: An ANC member who was severely assaulted by ANC-aligned self-defence unit (SDU) members in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Transvaal, on 26 September 1993 because he opposed SDU activity. His shack was looted and sold. Mr Maoba laid a charge against the perpetrators but they were found not guilty.

name: Sifiso Mapalala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at his home at Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 August 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His cousin was also killed in the attack.

name: Alphina Sbuko Maphalala
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and shop destroyed in an arson attack by a named IFP supporter at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in February 1992.

name: Alfred Qanda Maphanga
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Dudu Maphanga
description: and her mother were killed by ANC supporters and residents of Ga Mantlhanyane village, Nebo, Lebowa, on 11 April 1994. The victims were abducted and taken to a mountainous area where petrol was poured over them and they were set alight. Ms Maphanga`s own brother was forced to set them alight. They were accused of using witchcraft to cause the deaths of six youths. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/2000/077).

name: James Maphanga
description: Was abducted from home and burnt to death by named ANC supporters in Kwa-Lugetlhane, KwaNdebele, during September 1986. Mr Maphanga worked for the KwaNdebele chief and was considere a `sell-out` during violent conflict over incorporation into KwaNdebele.

name: Leonard George Maphanga
description: Was shot dead and his body was burnt by IFP-aligned Toaster gang members in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 31 July 1992 during violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mabhalane Maphanga
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Malope Maphanga
description: and her daughter were killed by ANC supporters and residents of Ga Mantlhanyane village, Nebo, Lebowa, on 11 April 1994. The victims were abducted and taken to a mountainous area where petrol was poured over them and they were set alight. Ms Maphanga`s own son was forced to set them alight. They were accused of using witchcraft to cause the deaths of six youths. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/2000/077).

name: Mondli Maphanga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, and his body set alight, along with those of two friends, in Edendale, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 27 May 1990. It is alleged that the victims, shortly before they were killed, had discovered a minibus full of charred bodies at a garage frequented by ANC supporters.

name: Ngazi Albert Maphanga
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack at Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 11 February 1991. See Richmond Farm arson attacks.

name: Okie Maphanga
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Silwayiphi Alfred Maphanga
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Sukumani Vitans Maphanga
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by a named IFP supporter in Ncelebantwana, near Bulwer, Natal, on 10 August 1991. Mr Maphanga had allegedly refused to join the IFP.

name: Nongezile Nomathemba Maphaphu
description: She lost her shack in an arson attack in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, in January 1992, after it caught fire from the burning house of a neighbour who was a SANCO member.

name: Daemane David Maphisa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by members of the AWB in Bethlehem, Orange Free State (OFS), on 6 April 1994, in the run-up to the country`s first democratic elections. See April 1994 elections and right-wing attacks.

name: Daemane David Maphisa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by members of the AWB in Bethlehem, Orange Free State (OFS), on 6 April 1994, in the run-up to the country`s first democratic elections. See April 1994 elections and right-wing attacks.

name: Vincent Maphosa
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and assaulted by members of the `Zim-Zim` faction at Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, on 20 November 1990 during violent conflict between the `Zim-Zim` and `Gadaffi` faction when the local ANC branch in the area split into two rival groups. Mr Maphosa was a `Gadaffi` supporter. See also Khutsong Youth Congress.

name: Africa Mthokozisi Maphumulo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Qinabout, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 28 July 1991. His family was continually harassed by IFP youths.

name: Lizzy Nkiyasi Mathebula
description: Was beaten to death by ANC supporters at her house in Xhelani village, Malamulele, Venda, in May 1991. Ms Nkiyasi was suspected of witchcraft.

name: David Mashalane
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten to death in GaMatlala, Lebowa, on 4 February 1980 by followers of Chief BK Matlala in an attack on residents opposing his rule.

name: Thembekile Virginia Mashaya
description: An ANC supporter was beaten by IFP supporters on her way to a polling station at Paulpietersburg, Natal on 27 April 1994, the first day of the April 1994 elections. Ms Mashaya`s house had been burnt down by IFP supporters the previous month.

name: Thembekile Virginia Mashaya
description: An ANC supporter was beaten by IFP supporters on her way to a polling station at Paulpietersburg, Natal on 27 April 1994, the first day of the April 1994 elections. Ms Mashaya`s house had been burnt down by IFP supporters the previous month.

name: Joseph Mashego
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Transvaal, on 12 May 1991. IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers were retaliating against a previous attack by ANC-supporting squatters and approximately one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Don Sipho (Aka Ben Maseko) Mashela
description: An ANC supporter was interrogated and assaulted by a camp administrator in Angola during September 1981. One ANC camp administrator was granted amnesty (AC/2000/149).

name: Daniel Mashifane
description: Was shot and injured by gunmen driving a red minibus in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 3 May 1992 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Tamati Elias Mashigo
description: He had his house burnt down by ANC supporters in Bushbuckridge, Lebowa, on 3 March 1986. Mr Mashigo was allegedly targeted because he was accused of killing people and selling their body parts.

name: Aledulege Benson Mashile
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by members of the Sofasonke Party while patrolling Greenvale village, near Bushbuckridge, Lebowa, on 29 December 1989. The Sofasonke Party was backed by Lebowa President Nelson Ramodike.

name: Joe Mashile
description: Was seriously injured in a hand grenade attack on a friend`s home in Daveyton, Transvaal, on 17 September 1991 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Thaopi Ethel Mashile
description: She had her home and belongings destroyed by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannes-burg, on 1 January 1992 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Tsietsi Anthony Mashiloane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured in a drive-by shooting in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 17 November 1991. Mr Mashiloane was one of seven killed and seven seriously injured when gunmen opened fire with AK47s on a party in Vosloorus.

name: Lucia Tlou Mashima
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in a drive-by shooting in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 17 April 1994 in political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 election. Another person was also killed in this shooting.

name: Lucia Tlou Mashima
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in a drive-by shooting in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 17 April 1994 in political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 election. Another person was also killed in this shooting.

name: Mandla Mbhekiseni Masango
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Nhlanhla Sanele Mathebula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaNxamalala, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 4 February 1993. Two other ANC supporters were also killed.

name: Doris Thokozani Matthews
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Elufafa, Ixopo, Natal, on 18 July 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. She was allegedly perceived to be an ANC supporter and was living in an IFP area at the time.

name: Nomveliso Matyaleni
description: She lost her home in an arson attack at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area during 1993.

name: Mfundo Matyobeni
description: Was assaulted by named ANC members in 1994 during conflict between ANC and ADM members at Mngqesha, near King William`s Town, Cape.

name: Nothabeli Agnes Matyobeni
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attacks by other ANC supporters at Mngqesha, near King William`s Town, Cape, in April 1994, after the perpetrators accused her of being an ADM member.

name: Tshifihiwa Anthony Maumela
description: An ANC supporter who was detained, tortured and constantly intimidated by police in Sibasa, Venda, from 1977 because he addressed a march against Bantu education and openly criticised apartheid policies.

name: Frans Mavhaudu
description: A member of the headman`s council who was assaulted and burnt to death by youths in Tshiozwi district, Venda, on 6 March 1990, allegedly because he was accused of using witchcraft to hinder the work of youth activists in the area. The perpetrators requested Mr Mavhaudu to leave the area. When he refused, he was stoned and set alight and his hut was burnt. Five ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/2000/094).

name: Alson Mandlenkosi Mavundla
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by a named IFP supporter in Utrecht, Natal, on 26 December 1993.

name: Bangubukhosi George Mavundla
description: He had his house in Port Shepstone, Natal, destroyed by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in July 1992, allegedly because he was thought to be harbouring an ANC leader.

name: Elvis Mphilelwa Prizer Mavundla
description: He lost his possessions when his home in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, was vandalised and his property destroyed by IFP supporters on 4 April 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Emma Bonani Mavundla
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by named IFP supporters in Ngonweni, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 27 January 1993.

name: Gwaziwe Mavundla
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1991.

name: Lucky Wilfred Mavundla
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 4 July 1992 when the minibus in which he was travelling was ambushed by IFP supporters as it left the home of an ANC regional organiser at Bhomela, Port Shepstone, Natal. Seven ANC members were killed. Five IFP members were convicted for the attack.

name: Nonhlanhla Goodness Mavundla
description: She had her home at Nkulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1991 in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Priscilla Khanyisile Mavundla
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 27 October 1992.

name: Siyabonga Mavundla
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when ANC supporters attacked the Nkulu area, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 August 1993. Three people died in this attack and four were seriously injured.

name: Siyabonga Alson Mavundla
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 28 June 1991.

name: Thulisile Purity Mavundla
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by ANC members, at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Derrick Mavuso
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by a named IFP supporter in Umzinto, Natal, in March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Derrick Mavuso
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by a named IFP supporter in Umzinto, Natal, in March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Henry Mandla Mavuso
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and seriously injured in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 22 April 1991, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Johannes Vusumuzi Mavuso
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 5 August 1990.

name: Lokufa Mavuso
description: Was beaten and necklaced by named ANC supporters in Nelspruit, Transvaal, in July 1986 because she was identified as a witch. She died two days later in Shongwe Mission hospital.

name: Nombuzo Mavuso
description: Was abducted and gang-raped by members of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang in Vusumuzi hostel, Tembisa, Transvaal, on 14 February 1993. Ms Nombuzo was abducted with her boyfriend, an ANC supporter, and forced to witness his killing.

name: Saraphina Thandi Mavuso
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed and was shot and injured in an attack by Khumalo gang members in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 15 January 1993. The gang was allegedly involved in the murder of key political leaders in Tokoza.

name: Samuel Mathebula
description: Was shot in the arm in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 7 May 1994 while travelling through `no-man`s land` - a buffer zone between hostels and Katlehong. He was caught in crossfire at the burial of an ANC supporter.

name: Madimetja Matlasulele
description: An ANC member who was arrested while attending a night vigil for assassinated SACP leader Chris Hani in Mookgophog, Naboomspruit, Transvaal, in April 1993. He was detained for three days and beaten daily, suffocated with a rubber tube and denied food and water.

name: Philemon Masehla
description: Was abducted, interrogated and burnt to death by ANC members at Mooihek, Nebo, Lebowa, on 15 August 1990, allegedly because he had been identified by a sangoma as being associated with the killing of an ANC member in taxi-related violence. Four ANC members were granted amnesty (AC/2000/202).

name: Bheki Ernest Maseko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and had his throat cut on 14 April 1993 in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal. Earlier, he and two friends had assisted a youth in reporting a shooting incident. IFP supporters allegedly burst into the house and attacked them. One of his friends was shot dead and the other shot and injured in the attack.

name: Carlton Maseko
description: Was killed by members of the Black Cats in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, in 1991. One perpetrator, who was then a Black Cats member but later defected to the ANC, was granted amnesty for the killing (AC/98/0121).

name: Carnie Alice Maseko
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sharpeville, Vereeniging, Transvaal, on 15 March 1992 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Israel Maseko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Emathunzi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 July 1993.

name: Jabu Dennis Maseko
description: An ANC supporter who died of injuries after being shot and stabbed in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 23 August 1990 during political conflict in the area.

name: John Maseko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 5 September 1993, allegedly by ANC supporters who suspected him of organising an attack on `comrades`.

name: Khosi Maseko
description: An ANC marshall who was stabbed, stoned and set alight by members of the `Gadaffi` faction of the Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, on 15 April 1990 during conflict after the ANC-aligned KYC split into two factions. The `Gadaffis` were younger `comrades` and the `Zim-zims` were older activists.

name: Msonelwa Amos Maseko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and blinded in his right eye when police opened fire on people at a mass funeral in Likazi, KaNgwane on 23 March 1986.

name: Nelson Zuzile Maseko
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named ANC supporters in Knysna, Cape, on 24 March 1990, after he had allegedly opposed certain practices by local ANC youth. His home and vehicle were also burnt in the attack.

name: Ntombizodwa Maria Maseko
description: She had her home burnt down by named ANC supporters at Diepdale, near Nelspruit, Transvaal, on 2 July 1993 during political conflict in the area.

name: Veli Badnock Maseko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death, allegedly by named colleagues who were IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 14 August 1993. Mr Maseko was reportedly killed in retaliation for the alleged necklacking by ANC supporters of one of the perpetrator`s cousins.

name: Samuel Masemola
description: Was killed when a pipe bomb planted by members of the AWB exploded on 25 April 1994 at a taxi rank on the corner of Blood Street and Seventh Avenue in Pretoria. Three people were killed and four injured in the blast. During the pre-election period the AWB targeted taxi ranks, bus stops and railway stations, predominantly used by black people, the majority of whom they believed to be ANC supporters, in order to derail the April 1994 elections. Six perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342).

name: Samuel Masemola
description: Was killed when a pipe bomb planted by members of the AWB exploded on 25 April 1994 at a taxi rank on the corner of Blood Street and Seventh Avenue in Pretoria. Three people were killed and four injured in the blast. During the pre-election period the AWB targeted taxi ranks, bus stops and railway stations, predominantly used by black people, the majority of whom they believed to be ANC supporters, in order to derail the April 1994 elections. Six perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342).

name: Agnes Maseti
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 16 December 1991 by members of a balaclava group, allegedly linked to the Lingelethu West Town Council, in Khayelitsha, Cape Town. The attack was aimed at a local ANC Women`s League activist and left three people dead, three wounded and 40 houses burnt.

name: Julia Sizani Mathenjwa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 27 July 1992.

name: Phyllis Mathenjwa
description: Was shot and injured and had her house burnt down at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, by ANC supporters on 14 January 1992. The perpetrators were allegedly looking for Ms Mathenjwa`s son, an IFP supporter.

name: Thandukwazi Phillip Mathenjwa
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack in Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 December 1992 in continuing violent conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Martha Josephine Matheza
