description: Was shot and killed by IFP supporters in the Entshawini area, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, on 3 January 1993 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Phomolo Samson Mathibela
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured in Empangeni, Natal, in January 1991 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: William Mathibela
description: An ANC activist who was severely beaten by IFP supporters in one of many random attacks on residents in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 28 March 1992. Alexandra was one of several Transvaal townships embroiled in conflict between the ANC and IFP in the early 1990s.

name: Isaac Mkombe Mathonsi
description: He had his home burnt down in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mgolozelwa Sipho Mathonsi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Mandini, Natal, on 29 November 1993.

name: Qondeni Cecilina Mathonsi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed several times by a named IFP supporter at Trust Feeds, New Hanover, near Pietermaritzburg, on 14 September 1991.

name: George Mathuse
description: He suffered damage to his motor vehicle when it was set alight by a crowd of ANC supporters at Phatsima, Rustenburg, Transvaal, on 8 August 1993. One perpetrator was granted amesty for his involvement in the incident (AC/1998/056).

name: Senatlana Thomas Matlhoko
description: An ANC activist who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Transvaal, on 14 May 1993 on his way to make arrangements for a mass funeral the next day. While passing through an IFP-controlled zone with fellow activists, shots were fired from a house and Mr Matlhoko was hit in the head and killed.

name: Thomas Oupa Matlhoko
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Transvaal, on 14 May 1993 during a confrontation between IFP and ANC youths. Mr Matlhoko was reportedly trying to assist a friend targeted by the IFP supporters when he was killed.

name: Ngdakoana Maggie Matlou
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters on a train to Germiston, Transvaal, on 27 January 1991. See train violence.

name: Pumzile Esther Matonsi
description: She had her house burnt down at Machibini, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, in November 1993 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. The attack was targeted at her son, who was an ANC supporter. He was was shot and injured.

name: David Matsembe
description: Was seriously injured when he was stabbed by ANC supporters at a squatter camp on a chicken farm in Kliptown, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 7 July 1991. One ANC supporter was granted amnesty for the attempted killing (AC/1999/0212).

name: Elizabeth Matsemela
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in June 1986 and held at Wilbeken prison in Benoni, Transvaal, following student boycotts and other political protests in the area.

name: Lina Dieketseng Matshatsha
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Kliprivier, Transvaal, on 21 September 1993 when gunmen travelling in two minibuses opened fire on the taxi in which she was travelling. Attacks on taxis were a characteristic of political conflict on the East Rand from 1991.

name: Magdaline Nombulelo Matshaya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down on 30 April 1990 in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal, by a group of men carrying traditional weapons and allegedly looking for ANC supporters. Nine homes were burnt in the area that day. At the time ANC supporters were also killed in an attempt to prevent the setting up of local ANC branches in the area.

name: Quido Mvikeli Matshaya
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten by named perpetrators in Matatiele, Transkei, on 16 March 1990. A group of men associated with the traditional authorities and opposed to the launch of an ANC branch attacked numerous homes and persons associated with the ANC.

name: Thabo Bethuel Matshaya
description: An ANC supporter who lost his home when it was burnt down by named perpetrators in Matatiele, Transkei, on 30 April 1990. A group of men associated with the traditional authorities and opposed to the launch of an ANC branch attacked numerous homes and persons associated with the ANC.

name: Mandlenkosi Alois Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Mandlenkosi Alois Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Meluli Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten to death by members of the A-Team in Parys, Orange Free State (OFS), in November 1985. See A-Team (OFS).

name: Mhlamukile Simon Mawela
description: He had his houses in KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, burnt down in November 1993. More than forty houses were burnt down in the ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area that month.

name: Mhlabunzima Mbhele
description: Was one of three men stabbed to death by ANC supporters and residents of the Bottlebrush informal settlement, Chatsworth, Durban, in ongoing political conflict on 26 December 1993. Three ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/1998/0059).

name: Sakhile Alpheus Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in Umnini, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 January 1993 during political conflict in the area.

name: Monwabisi Kwanda Mbeki
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by unidentified persons in 1981 in Cradock, Cape. He has never been seen again and is presumed dead.

name: Mhlaliseni Bernard Mchunu
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down by ANC supporters in the Cingi area, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 November 1992.

name: Mkhombeni James Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by IFP supporters in Wartburg, Natal, on 25 December 1992.

name: Msizeni Mazwendoda Mbhele
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mxolisi Petros Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP members in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, in 1991.

name: Nomakhwezi Veronica Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, on 27 July 1993.

name: Qondeni Evelinah Mbhele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured by ANC at Polela, Bulwer, Natal, supporters in April 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Qude Anthony Mbhele
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at Mtengwane, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 June 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Rose Philisiwe Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pieter-maritzburg, burnt down by IFP supporters on 3 March 1991.

name: Shuqwana Jessie Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 January 1992, in intense political conflict in the area. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Sibongile Lucket Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 11 July 1993.

name: Simon Mbhele
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Siphiwe Lesley Mbhele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured at Woodford, Bergville, Natal, on 27 February 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His friend was shot dead in the attack.

name: Siphiwe Lesley Mbhele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured at Woodford, Bergville, Natal, on 27 February 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His friend was shot dead in the attack.

name: Sizeni Mbhele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when ANC supporters attacked her neighbour`s home in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993. Seven occupants, including family members and neighbours who had taken shelter at the house because it was fenced, were killed, and three were injured.

name: Synod Simon Mbhele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Thulebona Justice Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in a pre-dawn attack on a home in KwaSithole, Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 April 1993, allegedly in attempt to disrupt the peace process in the area. Ten ANC supporters were killed and two injured.

name: Xolani Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death on 26 July 1992 when armed IFP supporters attacked several homes in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban. See Folweni massacre.

name: Xolani Mbhele
description: Was shot dead in KwaMashu, Durban, on 16 September 1992, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zakhele Elijah Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 August 1992.

name: Zodwa Mbhele
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters returning from a Shaka Day rally in Kwa-Mashu, Durban on 27 September 1992. About ten people were injured in fighting that broke out between ANC and IFP supporters following the rally.

name: Qaphela Anselem Mbhudu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 March 1992.

name: Ntombizanele Annatolia Mbiko
description: She had her home burnt down in a dawn attack on the ANC stronghold of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in ongoing political conflict between the `Red` and `Green` factions on 16 February 1993.

name: Zinhle Yvonne Mazibuko
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured during a student demonstration at Lamontville, Durban, in 1986. Zinhle jumped from the first floor of a building while trying to escape from the police.

name: Bhekani Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who was axed and shot to death by IFP supporters in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 August 1990 in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Bonisile Mavis Mbili
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991. In April and May 1991, political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least 31 people and rendered about 200 people homeless.

name: Bonisile Mavis Mbili
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991. In April and May 1991, political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least 31 people and rendered about 200 people homeless.

name: Charles Meshack Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters at Nomakhanzane, Mtwalume, Natal, on 30 January 1992. His mother was shot dead, and their home was destroyed in the attack.

name: Esther Mamdlonkolo Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Nomakhanzane, Mtwalume, Natal, on 30 January 1992. Her son was also injured, and their home was destroyed in the attack.

name: Isaac Khalesakhe Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in an attack by IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, during continuing political conflict in May 1993. Both his parents were killed in the attack.

name: Jabula Hemington Mbili
description: Was shot dead when hooded gunmen attacked three homes at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 20 June 1993. See Murchison attacks.

name: Kelele Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in May 1993 during continuing political conflict in the area. The perpetrators arrived at her house and caught her trying to run away. Her body was found near a stream two days later. Her husband was also killed, and their house was burnt down. Her son survived the attack.

name: Kufokwakhe Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to  death by IFP supporters at Okhalweni,  Gamalakhe,  KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 July 1991. The family had fled the area because of the political violence and because of pressure on Mr Mbili`s son to join the IFP. When he and his wife returned to their home, they were both killed.

name: Lindeni Eunaistance Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house at Nomakhanzane, Mtwalume, Natal, when it was set alight by IFP supporters on 30 January 1992. Her mother was shot dead and her brother injured in the attack.

name: Mabhovu Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in May 1993. The attackers arrived at his house and killed him when he opened the door. His wife tried to run away, but was caught, and her body was found near a stream two days later. Their house was also burnt down. His son survived the attack.

name: Mabhovu Eggie Mbili
description: Was stabbed and shot dead by named IFP supporters at Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 July 1991, allegedly because her son was an ANC supporter.

name: Mavis Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house and many of her possessions in an attack by alleged IFP supporters at Mangamazini, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1993 during political conflict in the area.

name: Mduduzi Aubrey Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death after being abducted from a taxi by IFP supporters in Mtengwane, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 October 1991. Six IFP supporters and a child were killed in attacks by ANC supporters in the area that day. See Mtengwane attack.

name: Nino Elias Ntontoza Mbili
description: Was abducted and shot dead at Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, by one named and other IFP supporters on 22 April 1991 during ongoing political conflict in the area. Mr Mbili was allegedly targeted because he was thought to be an ANC sympathiser.

name: Nkosiyezwe Zibo Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and his body mutilated by ANC supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 August 1992. Mr Mbili was allegedly killed because his brother was affiliated to the IFP.

name: Phathowubani Phillys Mbili
description: She had her house at Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack on 18 October 1991 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area

name: Richard Mbili
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death and his body was mutilated by ANC supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 August 1992.

name: Richman Zibokwakhe Mbili
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted and stabbed to death, and his body mutilated, by ANC supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 August 1992.

name: Thandekile Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in the forest at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 19 April 1992.

name: Ngwala Mazubane
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by four named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 February 1991, allegedly because he refused to join the IFP. He managed to escape, but his friend was shot dead.

name: Tobhi Beatrice Mbili
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured in a panga attack by IFP supporters in Danganya, Umkomaas, near Durban, on 4 October 1992.

name: Mpumelelo Ashwelli Mbinda
description: He had his house burnt down and was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, in 1991. Soweto and many other Transvaal townships were embroiled in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Mankwekwe Ben Mbiwa
description: Was hacked to death by IFP supporters in Kagiso, Transvaal, on 22 August 1990 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Sibongiseni Simon Mbizana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at KwaMnyandu railway station, Umlazi, Durban, on 14 April 1993. Mr Mbizana was allegedly returning from a prayer meeting after the assassination of Chris Hani when he was shot, allegedly by IFP supporters who opposed the memorial service.

name: Bhanoyi Mbizane
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Polela, Bulwer, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in November 1991. Mr Mbizane was allegedly thought to be harbouring ANC supporters.

name: Dumisani Erick Mbobhozi
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when he was stabbed, shot and beaten by unidentified perpetrators in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 30 January 1994 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Alzinia Mbokazi
description: She had her property destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in January 1989 in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Mfanafuthi Mbokazi
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by an ANC member while walking to the market at Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, with his girlfriend on 1 January 1992. One ANC member was refused amnesty (AC/2000/022).

name: Mlungisi Wellington Mbokazi
description: Was severely beaten by IFP supporters on 25 April 1992 near Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban. Mr Mbokazi and his three companions were confronted and accused of supporting the ANC. His three companions were all beaten to death in the attack.

name: Phiwase Mbokazi
description: She lost her house in Empangeni, Natal, in an arson attack on 21 May 1993, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. She was allegedly targeted because her son was an ANC supporter.

name: Zolani Cyprian Mbokazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at at KwaCele Village, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 July 1993.

name: Peter Bigboy Mawela
description: An ANC supporter who had his house and possessions burnt in an arson attack by IFP supporters in KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in March 1993.

name: Petros Mafika Mbuli
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at KwaMashu, Durban, on 27 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Petros Mafika Mbuli
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at KwaMashu, Durban, on 27 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Alois Sibeko Mbatha
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters, some of whom are named, in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 January 1992.

name: Simon Sibusiso Mbambo
description: Was shot dead in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 25 October 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. He was in a shop when it was attacked by a group of unidentified persons, allegedly because the shop owner was an ANC supporter.

name: Maholwane Mbekile
description: Was stabbed to death with a panga on 16 August 1990 in Soweto, Johannes-burg, by IFP supporters who suspected he was an ANC member.

name: Zita Mbolekwa
description: Was injured when a pipe bomb planted by members of the AWB exploded on 25 April 1994 at a taxi rank on the corner of Blood Street and Seventh Avenue in Pretoria. Three people were killed and four injured in the blast. During the pre-election period the AWB targeted taxi ranks, bus stops and railway stations, predominantly used by black people, the majority of whom they believed to be ANC supporters, in order to derail the April 1994 elections. Six perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342).

name: Zita Mbolekwa
description: Was injured when a pipe bomb planted by members of the AWB exploded on 25 April 1994 at a taxi rank on the corner of Blood Street and Seventh Avenue in Pretoria. Three people were killed and four injured in the blast. During the pre-election period the AWB targeted taxi ranks, bus stops and railway stations, predominantly used by black people, the majority of whom they believed to be ANC supporters, in order to derail the April 1994 elections. Six perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342).

name: Hlakaniphani John Mbeko
description: Was abducted, beaten and stabbed to death by ANC members in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 25 January 1991. Mr Mbeko was suspected of changing his allegiance to the IFP. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0335).

name: Mirriam Bayabulile Mchunu
description: She lost her home in an arson attack in Eshowe, Natal, in early 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Masixole Mboma
description: Was injured when a hand grenade was thrown into his home on 9 August 1992 during political conflict between ADM and ANC supporters in Quzini, King William`s Town, Cape. His grandfather was a member of the ANC.

name: Mfanufikile Mbeko
description: An ANC member who was stabbed several times and then shot dead by IFP supporters in Umkomaas, near Durban, in 6 January 1991.

name: Thoko Alice Mbambo
description: She had her house in Umnini, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, set alight by IFP supporters on 7 January 1993 during political conflict in the area. Her son, an ANC supporter, was shot dead in the attack.

name: Muzokuhle Mbeko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 30 April 1992. His son was killed some nine months earlier, also in the course of political conflict.

name: Xolani Mbeko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 September 1991, while on his way to the night vigil of a fellow activist. His father was killed nine months later, also in the course of political conflict in the area.

name: Aaron Mbele
description: A member of the KwaKwatsi Youth Congress, was shot and severely injured when police opened fire on a crowd of ANC supporters marching to the Koppies court, in KwaKwatsi, Koppies, Orange Free State (OFS), on 30 March 1990. Mr Mbele had 180 pellets removed from his body.

name: Bettie Tomfikile Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down on 10 March 1992 in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her son was shot dead in the attack.

name: David Mbele
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters during an arson attack on his home in Boipatong, Vanderbijlpark, Transvaal, on 13 June 1992. Mr Mbele was suspected of being an IFP supporter.

name: Emily Busi Zini Mbele
description: Was raped and had her possessions stolen in April 1993 in Mathelanjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Happy Frank Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 18 December 1992, allegedly by members of the IFP-aligned Khumalo gang.

name: Lucia Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mazwi Lynos Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters at Umlazi, Durban, on 24 April 1994, three days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Mazwi Lynos Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters at Umlazi, Durban, on 24 April 1994, three days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Millicent Zandile Mbele
description: A member of the IFP Youth Brigade who was shot dead, allegedly by ANC members, at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Mkhohlisi Wellington Mbele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and killed by ANC supporters at KwaDabeka, near Pinetown, Natal, on 4 August 1993.

name: Musa Mbele
description: Was shot and severely injured in an attack by ANC supporters on the Nkulu area, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 August 1993. Three people died in this attack and four were seriously injured.

name: Mzondwase Ivy Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nguzimangabemtu Mbele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead at a hostel in Johannesburg, on 19 March 1993 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Nokuthula Sibibongile Mbele
description: Was shot and killed by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Transvaal, in 1993. It was believed that Ms Mbele was an IFP supporter who provided information to the IFP. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0348).

name: Ntombemhlophe Ritta Ntombekhaladi Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in July 1991.

name: Ntombifikile Elizabeth Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Umkomaas, near Durban, burnt down on 22 July 1990 in intensifying political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ronnie Michael Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 March 1992 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sfiso Mzonjani Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at his home in Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 3 January 1991.

name: Sitoni Clementina Mbele
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, in 1991 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thandeka Cinderella Mbele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when ANC supporters attacked her home at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993. Seven occupants, including family members and neighbours who had taken shelter at the house because it was fenced, were killed, and three were injured.

name: Vukani Mbele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured while travelling with a prominent IFP supporter who was the target of an ANC attack in Estcourt, Natal, on 16 December 1992. Three people died in the attack and several others were injured.

name: Zithulele Solomon Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who had his house, car and livestock destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Ixopo, Natal, on 16 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zithulele Solomon Mbele
description: An ANC supporter who had his house, car and livestock destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Ixopo, Natal, on 16 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mbulelo Archie Mbelekana
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by other ANC supporters on 20 September 1993 in Komga, Cape during a serious internal feud.

name: Nokufuna Vinna Mbembe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 January 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nokufuna Vinna Mbembe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 January 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Eugene Siyabonga Mbense
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by unidentified persons in Clermont, near Durban, during a bus boycott in 1986.

name: Mduduzi Sydney Mbense
description: Was intimidated and threatened in his home in Greytown, Natal, in March 1994. Mr Mbense had been the bodyguard of Solomon Mzolo, who was shot and killed, allegedly by ANC members, in February 1994.

name: Mduduzi Sydney Mbense
description: Was intimidated and threatened in his home in Greytown, Natal, in March 1994. Mr Mbense had been the bodyguard of Solomon Mzolo, who was shot and killed, allegedly by ANC members, in February 1994.

name: Sigodi Mbhamali
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mandini, Natal, on 30 May 1993.

name: Albert Lungisani Mbhele
description: was shot and wounded when ANC  security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House,  Johannesburg,  on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Ben Chunkie Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was thrown out of a train by IFP supporters in Clermont, near Durban, in 1990.

name: Bhekabantu Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who died of smoke inhalation when the house he was in was set alight at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 22 July 1990 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bhekabantu Clement Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who had his home vandalised and destroyed in an attack by IFP supporters in Ntuzuma, near Durban, in March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bhekabantu Clement Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who had his home vandalised and destroyed in an attack by IFP supporters in Ntuzuma, near Durban, in March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dingane Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter at Ncekubane Village in Ixopo, Natal, on 1 May 1994, days after the April 1994 elections.

name: Dingane Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter at Ncekubane Village in Ixopo, Natal, on 1 May 1994, days after the April 1994 elections.

name: Dumisani Henry Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by an IFP supporter in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, in December 1992.

name: Florence Mbhele
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death in an attack by IFP supporters on her home in Nsangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 December 1991. The perpetrators were allegedly conducting house searches for ANC supporters and believed Ms Mbhele to have sympathies with the ANC.

name: Fokozi Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by named IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 11 December 1993.

name: Khayelihle Madlokovu Mbhele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Wartburg, Natal, on 3 January 1991, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mandla Joseph Mbhele
description: Was shot and stabbed to death in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 25 March 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bhekinkosi Mbatha
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 August 1992.

name: Vusumzi Michael Mbona
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters, one of whom is named, while travelling in a vehicle in Estcourt, Natal, on 16 December 1992. The perpetrators were allegedly targeting one of Mr Mbona`s companions to avenge an earlier attack on ANC supporters

name: Bongani Mbatha
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Lumkile Maxiti
description: Was shot dead by members of a balaclava group, allegedly linked to the Lingelethu West Town Council, in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 16 December 1991. The attack was aimed at a local ANC Women`s League activist and left three people dead, three wounded and 40 houses burnt.

name: Nolesini Victoria Mbana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house vandalised by named perpetrators in Zwelitsha, Ciskei, in June 1990, following the overthrow of the Sebe government.

name: Babhekile Mbonambi
description: Was shot dead at a political rally at the King Zwelethini Stadium in Umlazi, Durban, in February 1992 during intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bongani Jeremiah Mbatha
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in Umlazi, Durban, on 2 April 1991.

name: Mcrobert Boy Mazibuko
description: He had his home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 17 November 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nonikile Maxiti
description: Was shot and injured by members of a balaclava group, allegedly linked to the Lingelethu West Town Council, in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 16 December 1991. The attack was aimed at a local ANC Women`s League activist and left three people dead, three wounded and 40 houses burnt.

name: Danile Wilberforce May
description: A Civic Organization member who was the victim of an attempted `necklacing` by ANC supporters in July 1980 in Port Elizabeth. He was allegedly accused of being a collaborator.

name: Nhlanhla Johannes Maya
description: Was shot by named ANC-aligned self-defence unit (SDU) members in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 5 December 1993 when the SDU members opened fire on him, allegedly because he disagreed with some of their policies. See self-defence units (SDU).

name: (First Name Not Given) Mayaba
description: He suffered damage to property when his house was burnt down by ANC members in political conflict in Heidelberg, Transvaal, during 1992 or 1993. Mr Mayaba and two other suspected IFP supporters were on an ANC hit list and were therefore targeted. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/064).

name: Henry Mduduzi Mayaba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when ANC supporters attacked a taxi on 21 January 1993 during a labour dispute between striking COSATU-aligned FAWU workers and non-striking IFP-aligned UWUSA workers which caused violent conflict in Ratanda, Heidelberg, Transvaal,

name: Ntombeningi Albertina Mayaba
description: An IFP supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal,/ on 24 September 1992.

name: Caleb Mayekiso
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested on 16 January 1964 in Graaff-Reinet, Cape, and sentenced to three years` imprisonment under the Terrorism Act. He was rearrested on 1 June 1969 and died while in police custody.

name: Caleb Mayekiso
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested on 16 January 1964 in Graaff-Reinet, Cape, and sentenced to three years` imprisonment under the Terrorism Act. He was rearrested on 1 June 1969 and died while in police custody.

name: Mzwandile Shadrack Mayekiso
description: A prison warder who lost his house and property in an arson attack by ANC supporters on 31 August 1985 during intense public unrest in Duncan Village, East London.

name: Ntombithini Theressa Mayeza
description: Was shot and severely injured when her home in Dokodweni,  KwaZulu,  near Gingindlovu, Natal, was attacked by unidentified persons on 2 June 1993 during continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thakatshana Mayidume
description: An ANC supporter who died in 1965 as a result of being beaten while in detention at the West Bank prison, East London. He had been arrested in March 1960 for his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Ampie Mayisa
description: An ANC supporter who a chief and member of the Leandra Action Committee, was beaten to death and his body and his house were burnt by named vigilantes in Lebohang, Leandra, Transvaal, on 11 January 1986. Chief Mayisa supported a group of young `comrades` who sought refuge in his house on the day of his murder.

name: Deliwe Esther Mayisa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Ondondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. A male relative was killed during the attack on her house.

name: Jabulani Wiseman Mayisa
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by named IFP supporters in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1992.

name: Mnantsheni Daniel Mayisa
description: An ANC supporter who had his home destroyed by IFP supporters at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mnantsheni Daniel Mayisa
description: An ANC supporter who had his home destroyed by IFP supporters at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ndabayakhe Mayisa
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ndabayakhe Mayisa
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ashley Lungile Mayisela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 13 December 1992 at a shebeen in Tokoza, Transvaal, allegedly by Khumalo gang members. Another person was killed and one severely injured in this attack, reportedly carried out in retaliation for the shooting at the shebeen earlier in the day of a gang member, allegedly involved in rape and murder. See Khumalo gang.

name: Mxolisi Ishmael Mayisela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in the leg on 27 November 1990 in Mandela informal settlement, Katlehong, Transvaal, allegedly by an IFP supporter.

name: Luyanda Mazaleni
description: Was shot and injured in the arm as he passed by the home of a named female community councillor in Mfuleni, Cape Town, in October 1992. The community councillor shot into a crowd when her house was attacked during an ANC-organised march.

name: Bhekizenzo Joseph Mazeka
description: Was shot and injured, and had his house burnt down by IFP supporters, allegedly assisted by members of the ISU, in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 13 October 1993 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Menzi Michael Mdumise Mazeka
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Umlazi, Durban, on 15 December 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mfanuswano Mazibane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by AmaButho members in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 27 April 1992. One other person was killed in the attack, and a child aged seven was shot and injured.

name: (First Name Not Given) Mazibuko
description: He suffered damage to property when his house was burnt down by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Transvaal, during 1993 or 1994. The victim was believed to be an IFP supporter. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/139). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Alfred Mabalane Mazibuko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Estcourt, Natal, on 31 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Alfred Mabalane Mazibuko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Estcourt, Natal, on 31 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Anna Mazibuko
description: Was shot and killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at her home in Tokoza, Transvaal, during 1993. Two others were killed in the same attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0243). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Antie Sophia Mazibuko
description: Was injured when a hand grenade, thrown by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU), exploded in her home in Soweto, Johannes-burg, on 2 October 1992. One person was killed and several others were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/090). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Betty Mazibuko
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death in an arson attack on her home on 3 July 1993 in Katlehong, Transvaal, allegedly carried out by IFP supporters. Ms Mazibuko`s father also died in the attack.

name: Elizabeth Titi Mazibuko
description: Was injured when a hand grenade, thrown by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU), exploded in her home in Soweto, Johannes-burg, on 2 October 1992. One person was killed and several others were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/090).

name: Ellie Ntombana Mazibuko
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Katlehong, Transvaal, burnt down on 3 July 1993, allegedly by IFP supporters. Ms Mazibuko`s husband and daughter both died in the attack.

name: Hlakaniphani Wiseman Mazibuko
description: A member of the ANC-supporting `Amaqola` youth group, was found dead in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 13 March 1993. He was believed to have been killed by a named ANC supporter in serious conflict between two factions.

name: Infern Mazibuko
description: Was shot and killed by members of an ANCself-defence unit (SDU) at his brother`s home in Tokoza, Transvaal, during 1993. Two others were killed in the same attack. One SDU was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0243).

name: Isak Mazibuko
description: An ANC supporter who was killed when thrown from a moving train between Katlehong and Wadeville stations in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 20 August 1993. Between 1990 and 1993, five hundred and seventy two people died in train violence.

name: Joseph Mazibuko
description: Was killed when a hand grenade, thrown by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU), exploded in his home in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 2 October 1992. One person was killed and several others were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/090).

name: Lucia Mampi Mazibuko
description: Was forced from her home and displaced by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, in 1992. Hundreds of people had their homes forcibly occupied by IFP supporters in the area following clashes between hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Lukas Mazibuko
description: Was  stabbed in Meadowlands, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 11 April 1993 by unidentified people who boarded his taxi and accused him of being an IFP supporter during conflict between IFP and ANC suporters in the area. Mr Mazibuko died of his injuries eight months later.

name: Zwelitsha Mbuqe
description: Was shot dead in Alexandra, Johannesburg, in March 1991 during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Bongini Besta Mbatha
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 October 1991. The perpetrators were allegedly looking for her nephew, an active IFP supporter.

name: Nowanda Mdikeni
description: An ANC member who was assaulted in 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Beauty Mbonambi
description: She had her home in Esindisweni, Verulam, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 25 June 1993, allegedly because her sons supported the ANC.

name: Gibe Mdima
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Malobola Mbuso
description: Was shot and burnt to death by Imbokodo vigilantes near Pretoria, during July 1986. Mr Mbuso and four `comrades` fled from KwaNdebele to avoid being arrested. Two weeks later his parents were notified of his death. Prior to his killing, members of the security forces visited his home and confiscated ANC T-shirts. They allegedly threatened his family, warning them that the pending funeral of their son would be disrupted.

name: Cyril Sibusiso Mbatha
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by unidentified persons on 26 December 1991 in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal. One other ANC supporter was shot dead and one injured in the attack, which allegedly occurred in the course of serious internal party conflict.

name: Mndwanakazi Mazibuko
description: An ANC supporter who had his property destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mndwanakazi Mazibuko
description: An ANC supporter who had his property destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Khokhiwe Mdima
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Constance Mbutho
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Ms Mbutho`s husband had been killed five days earlier, also in the course of political conflict.

name: Constance Mbutho
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Ms Mbutho`s husband had been killed five days earlier, also in the course of political conflict.

name: Sipokazi Thelma Mbana
description: Was shot dead in her aunt`s arms by members of a balaclava group, allegedly linked to the Lingelethu West Town Council, in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 16 December 1991. The attack was aimed at a local ANC Women`s League activist and left three people dead, three wounded and 40 houses burnt.

name: Mpiyezwe Mazibuko
description: Was shot dead when his house in Emajeni, Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, was attacked on 24 April 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area, days before the April 1994 elections. Another person was killed in the attack.

name: Mpiyezwe Mazibuko
description: Was shot dead when his house in Emajeni, Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, was attacked on 24 April 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area, days before the April 1994 elections. Another person was killed in the attack.

name: Lulu Mdima
description: She had her house burnt down in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 13 February 1994. Around 20 deaths and at least 28 incidents of house burning were recorded that month in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Hundreds of people were forced to flee from the area, and schools and shops were forced to close.

name: Khulile Rejoice Mbutho
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Ehlanzeni, Umkomaas, near Durban, burnt down in 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Siyabonga Lawrence Mbutho
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 19 April 1993. The perpetrators allegedly opened fire on a crowd of demonstrators when the vehicle in which they were travelling was attacked.

name: Florence T Mbuthu
description: She had her home severely damaged in an arson attack at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 February 1992, when IFP supporters returning from a chief`s gathering attacked ANC hostels and homes in the area. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Goodness Nonhlanhla Fikile Mbuthu
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 24 July 1992.

name: Wellington Bafana Mbuthu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by a named ANC supporter at Mphelandaba Store, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 15 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Wellington Bafana Mbuthu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by a named ANC supporter at Mphelandaba Store, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 15 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ruth Zitshu Mbuthuma
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and sexually assaulted by a named IFP supporter at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 March 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her son, aged nine, was also severely beaten in the attack.

name: Ruth Zitshu Mbuthuma
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and sexually assaulted by a named IFP supporter at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 March 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her son, aged nine, was also severely beaten in the attack.

name: Simo Mbuthuma
description: Was severely beaten by a named IFP supporter at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 March 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His mother, an ANC supporter, was also severely assaulted in the attack.

name: Simo Mbuthuma
description: Was severely beaten by a named IFP supporter at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 March 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His mother, an ANC supporter, was also severely assaulted in the attack.

name: Thami Mbuthuma
description: Was shot by members of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang in Tembisa, Transvaal, in April 1992 during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers aided by gang members and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Bandiwe Annie Mandaba Mbutwa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1992.

name: Johannes Michael Mbuyazi
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Durban, on 16 March 1992.

name: Joseph Mbuyazi
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted and shot dead by ANC supporters at Mhlangeni, KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 6 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Joseph Mbuyazi
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted and shot dead by ANC supporters at Mhlangeni, KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 6 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Luntu Mbuyazi
description: He had his house destroyed in an arson attack at KwaSokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 January 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Mr Mbuyazi was forced to flee the area.

name: Madabuli Mbuyazi
description: Was shot dead on 21 January 1992 at Nhlabane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mzondeni Absolom Mbuyazi
description: Was stabbed to death in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Enkonjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 November 1992.

name: Nelisiwe Mbuyazi
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack in Empangeni, Natal, on 24 February 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nelisiwe Mbuyazi
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack in Empangeni, Natal, on 24 February 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thamsanqa Mbuyazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 14 October 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Mr Mbuyazi had fled his home at KwaSokhulu, but was killed while staying at KwaMthethwa.

name: Thembinkosini Lexhur Mbuyazi
description: An IFP supporter who had his home in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembinkosini Lexhur Mbuyazi
description: An IFP supporter who had his home in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Victor Ntando Mbuyazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 12 March 1994 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Victor Ntando Mbuyazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 12 March 1994 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ndodeni Joseph Mbuyisa
description: He lost his house in Eshowe, Natal, in an arson attack during July 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Welcome Mdayi Dumisani Mbuyisa
description: He had his house in Steadville, Ladysmith, Natal, petrol-bombed by ANC supporters on 22 January 1994 in intensifying political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Welcome Mdayi Dumisani Mbuyisa
description: He had his house in Steadville, Ladysmith, Natal, petrol-bombed by ANC supporters on 22 January 1994 in intensifying political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Gibson Sbongiseni Mcambi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed when he was beaten, stabbed and thrown from a moving train in Umlazi, Durban, on 26 November 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Hlaba Anna Mcambi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Ntombenhle Christina Mcanyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 13 March 1991.

name: Vincent Mpho Mcedi
description: Was shot dead by members of the `Zim-Zim` faction of the Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, on 27 November 1990. The ANC-aligned KYC had split into two rival factions, the `Zim-zims` and the `Gaddaffis`. At least seventeen people were killed in Khutsong between 1989 and 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991. Mr Mcedi was a supporter of the `Gadaffi` faction.

name: Vincent Mpho Mcedi
description: Was shot dead by members of the `Zim-Zim` faction of the Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, on 27 November 1990. The ANC-aligned KYC had split into two rival factions, the `Zim-zims` and the `Gaddaffis`. At least seventeen people were killed in Khutsong between 1989 and 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991. Mr Mcedi was a supporter of the `Gadaffi` faction.

name: Mandla Mchunu-Ntinga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu`s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Batembile Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 January 1992 in intense political conflict in the area. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Bhekumuzi Moses Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 27 September 1991.

name: Dumisani Mchunu
description: Was severely stabbed and beaten by named IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 12 March 1991. She was suspected of being an ANC supporter.

name: Elizabeth Ntombifuthi Mchunu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 4 September 1993, when ANC supporters ambushed the taxi in which she was travelling.

name: Elsie Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared when IFP supporters attacked her home in Pieter-maritzburg in March 1990. She has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Funani Maria Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Esimozomeni, Richmond,  Natal,  in 1990.

name: Goodwill Bheki Mchunu
description: Was shot dead in Umlazi, Durban, on 5 September 1992 in ongoing conflict between the ANC and IFP.

name: Joseph Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who was injured when his wife`s shack was burnt down by named perpetrators in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, in November 1993 during conflict between the Shenge vigilante group and the ANC.

name: Khetheni Beauty Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 17 November 1993.

name: Lindiwe Lilian Mchunu
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 18 June 1993 in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Lucky Robert Mchunu
description: Was shot on 29 August 1991 by IFP supporters who attacked the church in which ANC supporters had taken refuge in Mooi River, Natal.

name: Lungi Elizabeth Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 27 April 1993 in political conflict between the `Red` and `Green` factions.

name: Matika Mabel Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1991.

name: Mgenzeni D Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Richmond, Natal, burnt down in an attack by IFP supporters in 1990, allegedly in the course of an IFP membership recruitment campaign.

name: Dinjana Abraham Mbatha
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when ANC supporters attacked a meeting of IFP supporters in Appelsbosch, near Stanger, Natal, on 24 December 1992. One other person was shot and injured in the attack.

name: Bongani Ephraim Mbonambi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death in the Vezunyawo area, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, on 29 June 1991 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. His brother was killed in February 1994, also in political conflict.

name: Bongani Ephraim Mbonambi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death in the Vezunyawo area, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, on 29 June 1991 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. His brother was killed in February 1994, also in political conflict.

name: Mfeleni Mdima
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bonginkosi Vincent Mbonambi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Stanger, Natal, on 25 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Clashes broke out between ANC and IFP supporters following an ANC march in the area.

name: Bonginkosi Vincent Mbonambi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Stanger, Natal, on 25 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Clashes broke out between ANC and IFP supporters following an ANC march in the area.

name: Elizabeth Nombuso Mbatha
description: An IFP supporter who had her home at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters, some of whom are named, in January 1992 during ongoing political violence in the area.

name: Mthozisi Mdima
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Chesterville, Durban, on 11 November 1989 in intensifying political conflict in the area. Mr Mdima`s two brothers were both killed in 1990, one in detention and one in political conflict in the Durban area.

name: Nomtshezi Eliza Mdima
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 26 March 1992, allegedly because she was thought to be harbouring ANC supporters.

name: Nqoba Mdima
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned to death on 12 November 1990 near his home in Kwa-Mashu, Durban, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Mr Mdima`s brothers were both killed, one in detention, and one in political conflict in the Durban area.

name: Sizani Mdima
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Solekhaya Jack Mdima
description: Was shot dead in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 13 February 1994. Around 20 deaths and at least 28 incidents of house burning were recorded that month in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Hundreds of people were forced to flee from the area, and schools and shops were forced to close.

name: Bandile Mdingane
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in 1986 in Umtata, Transkei.

name: Ntombizodwa Gertrude Mdingi
description: An ADM supporter who was killed when a hand grenade was thrown into her bedroom during conflict between ANC and ADM supporters in Mdantsane, Ciskei, on 28 February 1993.

name: Zimisele Mdishwa
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Transvaal, on 12 May 1991. IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers were retaliating against the expulsion of IFP supporters from the area by ANC-supporting squatters. About one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were destroyed. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Hlaleleni Isabel Mdlada
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death when named IFP supporters attacked ANC supporters in Osindisweni, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in February 1991. Her grandson, aged four, was shot and severely injured in the attack.

name: Bhekani Gilbert Mdladla
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 27 January 1991.

name: Felani Elizabeth Mdladla
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 27 January 1991. Her husband was killed in the attack.

name: Mondli Kulana Mdladla
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Mondli Kulana Mdladla
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Ntombizonke Dora Mdladla
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Ntuzuma, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 19 June 1991.

name: Sibonelo Mdladla
description: Was shot and injured when named IFP supporters attacked ANC supporters in Osindisweni, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu,  near Durban,  in February 1991. His grandmother was killed in the attack.

name: Sokesimbane Mdladla
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sokesimbane Mdladla
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Stobi Constance Mdladla
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban in March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Stobi Constance Mdladla
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban in March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Timothy Roy Mdladla
description: An ANC supporter who had his two houses in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1991.

name: Zibuyile Kinini Mdladla
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by unidentified persons from Dambuza, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 14 March 1990, and was found dead in Plessislaer, near Pietermaritz-burg, during intense political conflict following the unbanning of political organisations in February 1990.

name: Zibuyile Kinini Mdladla
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by unidentified persons from Dambuza, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 14 March 1990, and was found dead in Plessislaer, near Pietermaritz-burg, during intense political conflict following the unbanning of political organisations in February 1990.

name: Linda Mdlala
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by unidentified persons in Chesterville, Durban on 1 January 1989 in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Africa Mdlalose
description: Was beaten to death by IFP supporters in Madundube, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 25 April 1992 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Anna Mdlalose
description: Was shot and killed when a large group of ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members stormed her home and opened fire on its occupants in Tokoza, Transvaal, during 1993. The family was believed to be supportive of the IFP. Another person was killed in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0243).

name: Butana Wilmoth Mdlalose
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured, allegedly by IFP supporters, while waiting for a bus to take him to work in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 20 September 1992.

name: Elliot Bhudiza Mdlalose
description: Was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in April 1991. The perpetrators allegedly accused Mr Mdlalose of being an ANC supporter.

name: Ephrem Maswelindoda Mdlalose
description: Was severely beaten and stabbed by IFP supporters in Mandini, Natal, on 27 April 1994, the first day of the April 1994 elections. Mr Mdlalose was wearing an ANC cap when he was assaulted.

name: Ephrem Maswelindoda Mdlalose
description: Was severely beaten and stabbed by IFP supporters in Mandini, Natal, on 27 April 1994, the first day of the April 1994 elections. Mr Mdlalose was wearing an ANC cap when he was assaulted.

name: Fangithini Petros Mdlalose
description: Was killed in Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 9 October 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mashudu Sidumo Mdlalose
description: Was shot and hacked to death, allegedly by ANC supporters, in an attack on Madala, Mshayazafe and Kutuza hostels in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 11 December 1990 during conflict in the area between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Mfana Patric Mdlalose
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted, beaten and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 22 March 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mfana Patric Mdlalose
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted, beaten and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 22 March 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nikeziwe Joyce Mdlalose
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters in Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 March 1994. She had attended an IFP rally in the area shortly beforehand.

name: Sibongile Mdlalose
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 January 1994. One family member was killed in the attack. At least 14 homes were burnt down when IFP supporters attacked ANC homes in the area.

name: Sikhumbuzo Michael Mdlalose
description: A bodyguard who was shot and injured in Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 29 September 1992, when ANC members tried to assassinate a local IFP leader whom he was guarding. The IFP leader and another bodyguard were also injured. One ANC member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/99/0329).

name: Sipho Mzonjani Mdlalose
description: Was killed when IFP supporters attacked his home at Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 January 1994. The family home was one of at least 14 burnt down when IFP supporters attacked ANC homes in the area.

name: Thamsanqa Blessing Mdlalose
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared from KwaMashu, Durban, on 28 April 1990 in intensifying political conflict in the area. He has never been seen again and is presumed dead.

name: Tuku Mdlalose
description: Was shot and killed when a large group of ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members stormed his home and opened fire on its occupants in Tokoza, Transvaal, during 1993. The family was believed to be supportive of the IFP. Another person was killed in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0243).

name: Mbalekelwa Thomas Mdlangathi
description: Was shot dead in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban on 20 December 1991 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thomas Mbalekelwa Mdlangathi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Mpuma-langa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 December 1991.

name: Balindile Mdletshe
description: She had her house near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by a named perpetrator in 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bibiyana Isaac Mdletshe
description: Was shot dead in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 8 January 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His daughter was also killed in the attack.

name: Bonginkosi Siphiwe Mdletshe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Stanger, Natal, on 5 February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bonginkosi Siphiwe Mdletshe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Stanger, Natal, on 5 February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Daniel Mdletshe
description: He had his home burnt down in Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 23 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Daniel Mdletshe
description: He had his home burnt down in Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 23 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dennis Zenzele Mdletshe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 March 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dennis Zenzele Mdletshe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 March 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Derrick Bhekinkosi Mdletshe
description: Was shot dead by unidentified persons in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 19 March 1993 in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Khayelihle Mdletshe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named perpetrator in the Empangeni area, Natal, on 4 August 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Martin Mdoda Mdletshe
description: Was shot and stabbed to death during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 23 March 1994. His home was burnt down in the same incident.

name: Mashiywa Mandlenkosi Mdletshe
description: He lost his house in an arson attack at Odondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 July 1992 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mbuyiseni Mdletshe
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by other IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 20 February 1994, allegedly because he was believed to have sympathies with the ANC.

name: Nkosana Mazibuko
description: Was shot and killed, along with two others, by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at his parents` home in Tokoza, Transvaal, in 1993. One SDU was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/0243).

name: Bungu Simon Mbonambi
description: He had his home at Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack in February 1992, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nkosinathi Joel Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 20 July 1991.

name: Bhekisisa Professor Mbandlwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by other IFP supporters at his home in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 27 July 1991, when he was mistaken for an ANC supporter. His leg was later amputated as a result of the shooting.

name: Nonhlwati 'Elta' Mchunu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and killed by ANC supporters in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993, allegedly in a revenge attack. Her granddaughter and several other family members and neighbours were killed or injured in the attack.

name: Gawetha Mbatha
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Nontobeko Mchunu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993.

name: Gibson Mbatha
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, while attending a night vigil on 26 March 1991 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Nozi Mchunu
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 11 August 1991.

name: Oliver Mongezi Mbanga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and his body subsequently burnt in an attack on his home in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 2 December 1990, allegedly carried out by Zulu-speaking IFP supporters. Mr Mbanga`s wife and two tenants were also shot and seriously injured during this incident.

name: Khisana Mackenzie Mbangeni
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted, tear-gassed and had his house burnt down in June 1993 in Katlehong, Transvaal, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Bangumuzi Mbanjwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when unidentified persons attacked his family at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 14 January 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bheki Mbanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 4 June 1992 when the bus in which he was travelling to work was ambushed and attacked by IFP supporters near Esimozomeni, Richmond,  Natal. The driver of the bus was shot and injured in the attack.

name: Emmanuel Mbonambi
description: He had his property burnt and his bottle store looted and destroyed by a named perpetrator at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 1 January 1991, allegedly because he and his family were branded ANC members. They received death threats and had to close other shops at KwaMbonambi.

name: Bongane Maqhawe Mbanjwa
description: Was shot and fatally wounded in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 10 April 1993. Several other people died in the ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area that day.

name: Foli Mbanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in November 1992 in Polela, Bulwer, Natal.

name: Griffiths Sthembiso Mbanjwa
description: He died soon after being knocked down by a car driven by a white hit-and-run driver near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 14 April 1993. Mr Mbanjwa was returning from an ANC rally when he was run down.

name: Hawulengwe Mandla Mbanjwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 4 December 1992.

name: Lengiswa Roselina Mbanjwa
description: She had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, during 1992. Ms Mbanjwa was allegedly targeted because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Makhawu Johannes Mbanjwa
