description: He had his home burnt down by named ANC supporters in Ixopo, Natal, in April 1994, in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Makhawu Johannes Mbanjwa
description: He had his home burnt down by named ANC supporters in Ixopo, Natal, in April 1994, in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mhlanganyelwa Gideon Mbanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who had his home at Highflats, Ixopo, Natal, severely damaged in an attack by IFP supporters in June 1993.

name: Mkhulunyelwa Mbanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 8 April 1991.

name: Mpiyezwe Isaac Mbanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who suffered injuries when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217).

name: Aaron Mbili
description: He escaped physical injury on 30 April 1991 when the car in which he and five other people were travelling was attacked by ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban. Two of the vehicle occupants were killed and two injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/066).

name: Nelson Jimbephi Mbanjwa
description: An IFP supporter who had his home destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 July 1990.

name: Netiwe Mbanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 16 January 1992. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Nicholus Sbusiso Mbanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and stabbed with spears by IFP supporters at EQumeni, Bulwer, Natal, on 28 November 1992. Several other people were also injured when IFP members stormed and attacked people at an ANC meeting.

name: Nokwazi Emily Mbanjwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured in an attack on her home at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 14 January 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sdindi Hilaria Mbanjwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack at Bulwer, Natal, on 2 February 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Skhumbuzo Mbanjwa
description: Was shot and injured by unidentified persons in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 14 January 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. One family member was killed and two others were shot and injured in the attack.

name: Sokalezwe Sixtus Mbanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Sokalezwe Sixtus Mbanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Stembiso Mbanjwa
description: Was shot and injured by unidentified persons in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 14 January 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. One family member was killed and two others were shot and injured in the attack.

name: Zakhi Milton Mbanjwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a fellow ANC supporter in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 19 September 1992, during an internal dispute within the organisation.

name: Ester Mbata
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Hanyane Anna Mbata
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when a bomb planted by AWB supporters exploded at a supermarket in Germiston, Transvaal, on 25 April 1994. The explosion was part of an attempt by right-wingers to derail South Africa`s first democratic elections on 27 April 1994.

name: Hanyane Anna Mbata
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when a bomb planted by AWB supporters exploded at a supermarket in Germiston, Transvaal, on 25 April 1994. The explosion was part of an attempt by right-wingers to derail South Africa`s first democratic elections on 27 April 1994.

name: John Fakazi Mbata
description: An ANC supporter who went missing from his home in Tokoza, Tansvaal, on 7 August 1993, and was later found dead near Mshayazafe Hostel. The perpetrators were allegedly IFP supporters.

name: Mzameni Jackonia Mbata
description: She had her property destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, in March 1993 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: (First Name Not Given) Mbatha
description: Was shot dead in Dube, Soweto, Johannesburg, in 1993 when a named IFP leader ordered an attack on the shop where Mr Mbatha worked because his employer was an ANC supporter.

name: Abel Mgedi Mbatha
description: Was killed with his father-in-law in Zonkiziswe, Katlehong, Transvaal, on 23 May 1993. Their charred bodies were found in the boot of their car the next day. The incident occurred after an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel on 22 May 1993 led to a dramatic escalation of political violence on the East Rand, leaving at least eighty people dead. Mr Mbatha and his father-in-law were allegedly killed because they were Zulu-speaking and their attackers therefore assumed that they were IFP supporters.

name: Abel Mgedi Mbatha
description: Was killed with his father-in-law in Zonkiziswe, Katlehong, Transvaal, on 23 May 1993. Their charred bodies were found in the boot of their car the next day. The incident occurred after an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel on 22 May 1993 led to a dramatic escalation of political violence on the East Rand, leaving at least eighty people dead. Mr Mbatha and his father-in-law were allegedly killed because they were Zulu-speaking and their attackers therefore assumed that they were IFP supporters.

name: Patricia Jabulile Mazibuko
description: She lost her house in Mandini, Natal, in an arson attack during 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Richard Mazibuko
description: Was shot and seriously wounded when his home was attacked by a group of ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members in Tokoza, Transvaal, during 1993. Three family members were killed in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/0243). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Ntinti Amos Mchunu
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 31 December 1992.

name: Mattheus Mbatha
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Mbuheni (Bongeni) Mbatha
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Melzinah Zibuyizile Mbatha
description: Died after having been attacked and burnt by a group of youths at Daveyton, Transvaal, on 2 July 1987. The youths targeted another person who was not present at the time of the attack. Four persons died and four suffered injuries as a result of the attack. One perpetrator, who claimed to be an ANC supporter and chairperson of a `people`s court`, was refused amnesty for the attack (AC/2001/282).

name: Ndayizana Richard Mbatha
description: He suffered injuries after he was attacked and burnt by a group of youths at Daveyton, Transvaal, on 2 July 1987. The youths targeted another person who was not present at the time of the attack. Four people died and four suffered injuries as a result of the attack. One perpetrator, who claimed to be an ANC supporter and chairperson of a `people`s court`, was refused amnesty for the attack (AC/2001/282).

name: Nonhlanhla Mbatha
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted by ANC supporters during political conflict in Appelsbosch, near Stanger, Natal, on 24 May 1993 and found stabbed to death the following day. Her father, an IFP supporter, had been killed in the course of political conflict five months earlier.

name: Nonhlanhla Beatrice Mbatha
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack on 21 March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nonhlanhla Beatrice Mbatha
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack on 21 March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Petros Muzikayise Mbatha
description: Was shot and injured in the head, leg and buttocks during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Madundube, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 September 1992. He had earlier refused to attend an IFP meeting, after which he was visited by unidentified men who asked to use his car. When he refused he was shot.

name: Phillip Mbatha
description: Was stabbed and severely injured and had his house burnt down by ANC members in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994 in political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Phillip Mbatha
description: Was stabbed and severely injured and had his house burnt down by ANC members in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994 in political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembi Mabel Mbatha
description: She had her house at Ekuphumuleni, Mtunzini, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 18 November 1993. She was allegedly targed because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Thembisile Maria Mbatha
description: An ANC member who was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Klipspruit, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 21 March 1994 during a commemoration of the Sharpeville massacre. See Sharpeville massacre.

name: Vusi Mbatha
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Vusumuzi Norman Mbatha
description: Was shot and severely injured by ANC supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, on 12 January 1992. He is a quadraplegic as a result of the shooting. His house in KwaMashu was burnt down by named ANC supporters on 18 January 1992. There was conflict within the ANC in the area at the time, and, although Mr Mbatha was non-aligned, his family were ANC supporters.

name: Vusumuzi Norman Mbatha
description: Was shot and severely injured by ANC supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, on 12 January 1992. He is a quadraplegic as a result of the shooting. His house in KwaMashu was burnt down by named ANC supporters on 18 January 1992. There was conflict within the ANC in the area at the time, and, although Mr Mbatha was non-aligned, his family were ANC supporters.

name: Nandipa Mbayi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in KwaMashu, Durban, on 6 January 1993. Ms Mbayi was two months pregnant at the time of her death.

name: Phila Percy Mbayi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter in KwaMashu, Durban, on 6 January 1993.

name: Lucas Mdunyiswa Mbebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by alleged members of a taxi association in Nyanga, Cape Town, on 28 February 1992, and died a week later. The perpetrators opened fire on a group of ANC and Civic activists leaving a meeting, injuring several. See taxi violence.

name: Thetephi Mbedu
description: She had her house and possessions destroyed in an arson attack at Nsingweni, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, on 26 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters before the April 1994 elections.

name: Thetephi Mbedu
description: She had her house and possessions destroyed in an arson attack at Nsingweni, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, on 26 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters before the April 1994 elections.

name: Betta Mbeje
description: She disappeared during April 1994. She had left her home in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, to attend her sister`s funeral vigil at the Springfield Mission. There was intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area at the time. Ms Mbeje has not been seen again and is presumed dead.

name: Bhekuyise Mbeje
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 4 August 1991.

name: Nomusa Constance Mbeje
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 11 September 1993.

name: Mbongeni Mbonambi
description: He lost his house at KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in an arson attack on 7 November 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Siphila John Mazibuko
description: An ANC supporter who was detained for two years in Nelspruit, Transvaal, in March 1986. He had been involved in planning a stayaway in the area.

name: Mzo Mbonambi
description: Was everely beaten in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 29 June 1993, at a `people`s court` under the command of an officer of a local ANC self-defence unit (SDU). Mr Mbonambi was one of five people who survived the beating, while two others were beaten to death, allegedly for crimes committed in the community. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/033). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Nokulunga Mbonambi
description: Was shot dead in Lower Illovo, Natal, in 1992 during a violent political confrontation between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sibusiso Patrick Mbonambi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed near Stanger, Natal, on 22 February 1994 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His brother had been killed in June 1991, also in political conflict in the area.

name: Sibusiso Patrick Mbonambi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed near Stanger, Natal, on 22 February 1994 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His brother had been killed in June 1991, also in political conflict in the area.

name: Sibusiso Patrick Mbonambi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed near Stanger, Natal, on 22 February 1994 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His brother had been killed in June 1991, also in political conflict in the area.

name: Sizwe Mbonambi
description: Was severely beaten in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 29 June 1993, at a `people`s court` under the command of an officer of a local ANC self-defence unit (SDU). Mr Mbonambi was one of five people who survived the beating, while two others were beaten to death, allegedly for crimes committed in the community. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/033).

name: Vincent Bonginkosi Mbonambi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Stanger, Natal, on 25 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Vincent Bonginkosi Mbonambi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Stanger, Natal, on 25 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zandile Anna Mbonambi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, burnt down by IFP supporters on 25 May 1993.

name: Mati Mbongeni
description: He had his home burnt down when IFP supporters attacked the ANC stronghold of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1993, allegedly in the course of conflict over access to resources. Ten people were killed and 35 houses burnt down.

name: Mbuyiswa Mbongo
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House,  Johannesburg,  on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Lillian Z Mbongwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 23 October 1992.

name: Ntokozo Joyce Mbongwa
description: She lost her house in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Matikwe, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 22 August 1990. The attack was allegedly motivated by the belief that Ms Mbongwa was a collaborator.

name: Bonisiwe Constance Mbongwe
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Ntabamhlophe, near Estcourt, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 April 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bonisiwe Constance Mbongwe
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Ntabamhlophe, near Estcourt, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 April 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mzwandile Mbongwe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a named ANC supporter and unidentified members of a self-defence unit in Richmond, Natal, in the course of internal conflict in the area during 1994.

name: Thembekile Jemina Mbongwe
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters in December 1992 during continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Bhekazakhe Amos Mbotho
description: An ANC supporter who lost his home at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in an arson attack by alleged ANC supporters on 15 July 1990. His parents and two siblings were stabbed to death in the attack, allegedly because his father was suspected of being an IFP informer.

name: Dudu Princess Mbotho
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by named IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 17 November 1993.

name: Mr (First Name Not Given) Mbotho
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1993 in continuing political conflict in area. His house was also burnt down in the attack.

name: Thobekile Florence Makanomsa Mbotho
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, destroyed by IFP supporters in February 1991. Her husband was severely beaten in the attack.

name: Vunina Tryphinah Mbotho
description: She had her home burnt down by ANC supporters on 30 September 1993 in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Nomajaji Gladys Mbothwe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992 in intense political conflict in the area. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Themba Mboto
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death with three members of the Falakhe family when their home was set alight in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 18 February 1992. The attack took place during conflict between ANC supporters and the Lingelethu West town councillors who were allegedly aided by police.

name: Nomathamsanqa Sylvia Mbovana
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Zolani, Ashton, Cape, on 4 November 1985, and held in custody for many months. She was later convicted of public violence.

name: Xolile Anthony Mbovana
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Zolani, Ashton, Cape, on 4 November 1985, and held in custody for many months. He was later convicted of public violence.

name: Jackson Mbovane
description: An ANC supporter who had his home petrol-bombed by unidentified perpetrators during political conflict between the ANC and ADM supporters at Ndakana, near King William`s Town, Cape, on 10 September 1992.

name: Mncedisi Barrington Mboyana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 15 August 1990, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Nomsa Cecilia Mboza
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992 in intense political conflict in the area. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Sasiwe Mboza
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Kanisile Mbulana
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by named members of the CNIP during political conflict at Mooiplaas, near East London, in April 1986.

name: Khanyisile Mbuli
description: An IFP supporter who was raped and then stabbed to death by ANC supporters on 17 April 1994 at Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, in violent political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Khanyisile Mbuli
description: An IFP supporter who was raped and then stabbed to death by ANC supporters on 17 April 1994 at Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, in violent political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Themba Isaiah Mazibuko
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Vusumzi Mapheshi Mazibuko
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters in Bhekuzulu, Vryheid, Natal, on 8 September 1993.

name: Thokisane Mbili
description: He escaped physical injury on 30 April 1991 when the car in which he and five other people were travelling was attacked by ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban. Two of the vehicle occupants were killed and two injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/066).

name: Lindiwe Maziya
description: A South African National Civic Association (SANCO) member who was shot dead in Vosloorus, Transvaal on 1 June 1990 when a hand grenade was thrown into her house and unidentified gunmen opened fire on the occupants. Ms Maziya`s infant son and her mother-in-law were also killed in the attack. Her husband, a SANCO executive member and well-known ANC member, was injured during the attack.

name: Mokabhe Alpheus Maziya
description: An executive member of the South African National Civic Association and ANC member who was shot and injured in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 1 June 1990 when a hand grenade was thrown into his house and unidentified gunmen opened fire on its occupants. Mr Maziya`s wife, his infant son, and his mother, were killed in the attack.

name: Thandi Elizabeth Maziya
description: Was shot in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 1 June 1990 during an attack on her home in which a hand grenade was thrown into the house and unidentified gunmen opened fire on the occupants. Ms Maziya died of her injuries five days later. Ms Maziya`s son, a member of the ANC and the SANCO executive, was also injured in the attack. Ms Maziya`s daughter-in-law and her infant grandson were also killed in the attack.

name: Zwelakhe Maziya
description: Was shot dead in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 1 June 1990 during an attack on his home in which a hand grenade was thrown into the house and unidentified gunmen opened fire on the occupants. Zwelakhe`s mother died in the attack, and his grandmother died later of injuries sustained in the attack. His father, a SANCO executive member, was also injured in the attack.

name: Lamekhi Mbongiseni Mazubane
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked by named IFP supporters in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on three occasions between February and April 1991.

name: Magubeni Mazubane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 October 1993. Mr Mazubane was an induna for the chief, but was labelled an ANC supporter and sacked from his position. His wife, a nephew and a friend were killed in the attack on their home.

name: Robert Mdlalose
description: Was abducted and severely assaulted by IFP supporters in Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 24 April 1994, allegedly because his late son had been an ANC supporter. He escaped, to find his home had been burnt down.

name: Thokozile Alice Mazubane
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked and shot dead by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 October 1993. Her husband, an induna to the chief, was sacked on suspicion of being an ANC supporter, and their home was attacked. Her son and a friend were also killed in the attack.

name: Thomas Sakhiwe Mazubane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by fellow ANC supporters who attacked taxi passengers in Port Shepstone, Natal, in November 1993. The attackers allegedly believed the taxi to be occupied by IFP supporters.

name: Thulani Goodboy Mazubane
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 October 1993. The family home was attacked because they were thought to be sympathetic to the ANC. His mother and a friend were also killed in the attack.

name: Dumephi Mazubani
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down and his furniture stolen by Amasinyora vigilantes in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dumephi Mazubani
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down and his furniture stolen by Amasinyora vigilantes in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Luke Storie Mazwembe
description: An ANC supporter and trade union organiser who was found hanged in his cell at Caledon Square police station, Cape Town, a few hours after he had been arrested on 4 September 1976. His body had several other injuries. The Commission found that his death was the direct or indirect result of torture.

name: Buziwe Mbali
description: An IFP supporter who died on 6 May 1991 in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, after being necklaced by named ANC supporters who accused her of witchcraft. There was political conflict in the area at the time.

name: Vulindlela Mbaligontsi
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked and killed by supporters of Chief Mdutshane in Flagstaff, Transkei, on 1 March 1994. Prior to his death he had attended a meeting called by Chief Samuel Mdutshane, where ANC supporters were either killed or stabbed. He escaped unharmed and thereafter refused to attend any meetings convened by the chief. Later, while attending to his business, he was shot dead by supporters of the chief.

name: Coster Mbalwa
description: A local chief who lost his house in an arson attack by ANC supporters in May 1960 at Nikiwe, near Bizana, Transkei. Chiefs in the area were allegedly targeted as they were accused of favouring Trust land.

name: Anna Nomusa Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Empangeni, Natal, on 6 May 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bonginkosi Lawrence Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by a named IFP supporter in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 November 1992.

name: Christian Sifiso Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed, shot and then hacked to death by IFP supporters in Ndabayakhe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 July 1992. Nine other people were injured when the perpetrators attacked passengers in a bus.

name: Chwepeshe Khanyile Mbambo
description: An underground ANC supporter preparing to go into exile who was killed at Chesterville, Durban, on 21 June 1986, together with other ANC supporters. The group had been infiltrated by Vlakplaas askaris, and were killed in a planned attack carried out by a Vlakplaas unit.

name: Fana Lucky Mbambo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters during political conflict at Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 May 1993. He was allegedly targeted because he was walking through an ANC-dominated area.

name: Lindiwe Siyathemba Joyce Mbambo
description: An ANC member who was shot dead in an attack on her house in Wattville, Benoni, Transvaal, on 24 November 1991 by IFP supporters looking for her husband, an ANC leader in the area.

name: Manti Doris Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down and looted by IFP supporters in Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 23 November 1989 and again on 26 March 1994. On both occasions she was forced to leave the area.

name: Manti Doris Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down and looted by IFP supporters in Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 23 November 1989 and again on 26 March 1994. On both occasions she was forced to leave the area.

name: Mashifu Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and hacked to death by IFP supporters in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 May 1992.

name: Mathi Mayvis Gunathi Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area during 1992.

name: Mboniseni Alson Mbambo
description: An IFP supporter and headman of Chief Mkhwanazi who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 13 June 1992 during political conflict in the area.

name: Mhlangeni Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot to death by ANC supporters in Durban, in the course of an internal dispute in the organisation. Mr Mbambo was accused of spying for the IFP.

name: Mqetshulwa Themba Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mkhazeni, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 September 1992.

name: Nani Gertie Magumede Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who had her two huts in Mahwaqa, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in early 1990. In the same year, her son was shot dead in political conflict.

name: Patrick Bhekuyise Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a named IFP supporter at Shakaskraal, near Stanger, Natal, on 4 August 1990.

name: Phumzile Patricia Mbambo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Caluza, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 15 April 1991.

name: Phumelele Mchunu
description: Was shot dead during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 16 September 1993. Her home was also set alight and all belongings were destroyed.

name: Samson Mfaniseni Mchunu
description: A SANCO supporter who was shot and injured during political conflict in Pietermaritzburg on 8 June 1992.

name: Shadrack Mechack Mchunu
description: He had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 September 1990. Mr Mchunu, whose tenant was burnt to death in the attack, was allegedly targeted because he was believed to be an ANC supporter.

name: Simphiwe Mchunu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993.

name: Siphiwe Mchunu
description: She had her home damaged in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1992, and was shot and injured by IFP supporters in 1994, allegedly because she was perceived to have sympathies with the ANC.

name: Sithombo Saraphina Mchunu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house destroyed by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 13 January 1994.

name: Sizakele Mchunu
description: Was shot and injured at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 30 October 1993, when she and two other family members were abducted by ANC supporters and taken to a neighbour`s house. The neighbour was killed and Sizakele`s cousin and aunt were stabbed and severely injured. The perpetrators accused them of hiding IFP weapons, because their home was in an IFP stronghold.

name: Thandazo Jumama Mchunu
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Gingindlovu, Natal, on 31 January 1994 during intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thandeka Cynthia Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who died on 25 June 1991, two days after being stabbed by IFP supporters at Thawulendeni, Richmond, Natal. Between 21 and 23 June, IFP supporters, allegedly transported by the police, attacked ANC supporters in the Richmond area, killing at least 16 people from ANC-supporting families.

name: Thandiwe Mchunu
description: She had her house at Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 26 November 1992. Ms Mchunu was accused of helping ANC supporters in the area.

name: Themba Mchunu
description: Suffered injuries when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217).

name: Thembisile Gloria Christi Mchunu
description: Was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters at Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 3 January 1993, while travelling in a taxi headed for a known ANC area. The perpetrators boarded the taxi and opened fire  killing two people and injuring Ms Mchunu.

name: Thenjiwe Maria Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, in 1993 during political violence in the area. The motive for the attack is unknown.

name: Wiseman Sipho Mchunu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 8 March 1992, when IFP supporters attacked a home in Zamani informal settlement, Umlazi, Durban. Mr Mchunu was staying overnight with friends at the house.

name: Zamani Mchunu
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 28 March 1993.

name: Lawrence Linda Mcineka
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on 30 October 1993 at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban.

name: Pungula Mcizwa
description: An ANC supporter who spent five years in prison following his arrest in 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, for his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. Mr Mcizwa died shortly after his release, allegedly as a result of injuries sustained while in detention. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Goodman Sipho Mcoyi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters in Hammarsdale, Natal, on 17 December 1990.

name: Buyanaye Mirriam Mcube
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Hopewell, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in March 1992.

name: Elizabeth Mculwane
description: Was stabbed and injured when IFP supporters attacked her home on 5 December 1991 in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. One family member was killed in the attack and one other was stabbed and injured. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Hluthu Mculwane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 20 June 1992.

name: Doli Stephen Mcunu
description: He had his home in Madakane, Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 26 April 1991 in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Johannes Bigboy Mcunu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 November 1992. Mr Mcunu, who lived in an ANC stronghold, was allegedly throught to have ANC sympathies.

name: Msolwa Mcunu
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Richmond, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack in 1991 during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Makazi Mdabe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt  down by IFP supporters at Mevamhlophe,  KwaZulu,  near Empangeni, Natal, in February 1993.

name: Ndukuzempi Mdabe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Enkunzini, KwaZulu, near Hammarsdale, Natal, on 19 August 1991.

name: Fortune Mthokozisi Mdadane
description: Was shot and injured at KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 30 March 1992, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Jafter Mphangeleni Mdakana
description: Was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 20 August 1990 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Muzokhana Mntukayise Mdamba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 3 July 1993.

name: Alzinah Mdanda
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lilly Mdanda
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khanyisile Brightness Mkhize
description: She had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 23 February 1993 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. About 35 houses were burnt down in Bhambayi that month

name: Marhoborhobo Mkhethwa
description: An ANC member who was detained in 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, because of his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Khehla Desh Mkhize
description: Was shot and injured when IFP supporters attacked ANC supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks.

name: Khehla Lucas Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared from Umlazi, Durban, during intensifying political conflict in the area in 1987. He has not been seen again and is presumed dead.

name: Ndabezinhle Cyril Mgcineka
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in a house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in September 1992 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Three people died in the attack.

name: Vumelani Alvina Mkhize-Phoswa
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters who attacked homes at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992. In the fighting that ensured, nine IFP supporters and one ANC attacker were killed. Sixteen homes were set alight. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/1997/0063).

name: Sidumo Vincent Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and hacked to death by IFP supporters in Pietermaritzburg on 24 December 1990. Both his brothers were also killed, at different times, in the course of political conflict in the area.

name: Nqashiya Mhlongo
description: She had her house at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 24 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters, days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Nqashiya Mhlongo
description: She had her house at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 24 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters, days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Nqenamuzi Muntu Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who had his house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down on 16 March 1994 in intensified political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khethekile Vinah Mkhize
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, during April 1992 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sipho Bheki Mkhize
description: A member of an ANC self-defence unit who was shot and severely injured by a named IFP supporter and others at Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 29 October 1991 during ongoing political conflict in the area. His brother and cousin were killed in the same attack.

name: Sipho Wildrod Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 10 November 1991.

name: Sixtus Fanana Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by a named ANC supporter at Maghabeni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 November 1990.

name: Siyabonga Shadrack Mkhize
description: Was stabbed to death by named ANC supporters during political conflict at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 24 January 1993.

name: Snenhlanhla Mkhize
description: She was the daughter of the local ANC chairperson. She was shot dead when named IFP supporters attacked her father at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 5 May 1991. Her father and another person were injured in the attack.

name: Steven Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 21 February 1994 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Sylvia Ntombenjani Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Esimozomeni,  Richmond,  Natal, in May 1990.

name: (First Name Not Given) Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who lost his home in an arson attack in Kliptown, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 2 May 1991 because he lived in a predominantly ANC area. That day the ANC held a rally at the Orlando stadium and the IFP held one at the George Goch stadium. Supporters of both parties attacked each other after the rallies, resulting in a number of deaths, injuries and damage to property.

name: Thobekile Gladys Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was harassed and threatened by a named IFP supporter at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in October 1991.

name: Thokozani Mkhize
description: Was stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 March 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thulani Simon Mkhize
description: A local IFP leader who was shot and injured by ANC members who were trying to assassinate him at his home in Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 29 September 1992. His two bodyguards were also injured in the attack. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/99/0329).

name: Timothy Thulubheke Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Durban on 3 December 1990.

name: Tiniza Petros Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by a named IFP supporter at Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 September 1993.

name: Zakhele Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was severely burnt when the house he was in was petrol-bombed by IFP supporters at KwaMashu, Durban, in 1991.

name: Zam Petrus Mkhize
description: A councillor who lost his house in Vosloorus, Transvaal, in an arson attack in 1989, allegedly carried out by SANCO supporters after SANCO called for all councillors to resign.

name: Zazi Joseph Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Isipingo, Natal, on 14 November 1991 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zibezwile Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Zifikile Solomon Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who had his house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in October 1990.

name: Zwe Runneth Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 5 August 1992.

name: France Mkholo
description: Was shot dead by named perpetrators at Ngqamzane, Empangeni, Natal, on 30 March 1994 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His home had been burnt down earlier that day.

name: Sifiso R Mkholo
description: He lost his home at Ngqamzane, Empangeni, Natal, in an arson attack by named perpetrators on 30 March 1994 during during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Jabulani Benjamin Mkhonde
description: An ANC supporter who had his home at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Phillip Mkhonta
description: Was burnt to death by ANC supporters who forced him to drink petrol before setting him alight in Shongwe mission, Nelspruit, Transvaal, on 18 May 1986.

name: Mukhehli Edward Mkhonto
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by members of an ANC-aligned self-defence unit at Kagiso, Transvaal, on 26 October 1993 because he instituted disciplinary measures against people implicated in criminal activities.

name: Bafana Andrew Mkhonza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 28 June 1993 in Katlehong, Transvaal, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Bomvana Tryphina Mkhonza
description: An IFP supporter who had her home at KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in February 1991.

name: Joshua David Mkhonza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 13 March 1993 in Katlehong, Transvaal, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Lungisani Justice Mkhonza
description: Died after being stoned, stabbed and burnt by ANC supporters in Mfume, Umkomaas, near Durban, on 23 August 1990. The perpetrators allegedly perceived him to be an IFP supporter, because he lived in a so-called IFP stronghold.

name: Patience Manize Mkhonza
description: She had her home in Mfume, Umkomaas, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in December 1990. The perpetrators allegedly perceived her to be an ANC supporter.

name: Sibusiso Mkhonza
description: Was shot and burnt to death at Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 25 April 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters two days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Sibusiso Mkhonza
description: Was shot and burnt to death at Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 25 April 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters two days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Eugenia Fisani Mkhulise
description: She had her house in Bulwer, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters on 21 November 1991 in ongoing political conflict. Her two children were burnt to death in the attack.

name: Kebi Amos Mkhulise
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 1 October 1991.

name: Mkhehlezi Mthobisi Mkhulise
description: Was burnt to death in an arson attack by ANC supporters on his family`s home in Bulwer, Natal, on 21 November 1991 in ongoing political conflict. His sister was also burnt to death in the attack.

name: Phindile Mkhulise
description: Was burnt to death in an arson attack by ANC supporters on her family`s home in Bulwer, Natal, on 21 November 1991 in ongoing political conflict. Her brother was also burnt to death in the attack.

name: Sbongile Ritta Mkhulisi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Impendle, near Bulwer, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack in October 1993, allegedly because she refused to join the IFP.

name: Aggrippa Themba Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in April 1994, in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Three of his brothers were abducted with him. Only one survived the attack, though with severe injuries.

name: Aggrippa Themba Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in April 1994, in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Three of his brothers were abducted with him. Only one survived the attack, though with severe injuries.

name: Bantu Wellington Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Margate, Natal, on 28 January 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bantu Wellington Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Margate, Natal, on 28 January 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ishmail Fafaza Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and beaten by Special Constables in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 January 1990, as he was returning from work with friends.

name: Mandilakhe Beauk Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters at Thafamasi School, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His brother was also killed in the attack.

name: Mandilakhe Beauk Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters at Thafamasi School, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His brother was also killed in the attack.

name: Mfana Moses Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who had his home at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by named IFP supporters on 19 April 1991. He then sought refuge at the home of an IFP-supporting relative. On his return home on 23 May 1991, he and his two brothers were attacked and stabbed by ANC supporters who considered their staying with an IFP supporter to be a betrayal of the ANC. Mr Mkhungo was severely injured, and his brothers were killed.

name: Mfana Moses Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who had his home at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by named IFP supporters on 19 April 1991. He then sought refuge at the home of an IFP-supporting relative. On his return home on 23 May 1991, he and his two brothers were attacked and stabbed by ANC supporters who considered their staying with an IFP supporter to be a betrayal of the ANC. Mr Mkhungo was severely injured, and his brothers were killed.

name: Mthakathiswa Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when IFP supporters attacked his home in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 September 1993. Two family members were killed in the attack.

name: Muziwendoda Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters at Thafamasi School, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His brother was also killed in the attack.

name: Muziwendoda Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters at Thafamasi School, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His brother was also killed in the attack.

name: Soliwe Catherine Madlamini Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Port Shepstone, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in April 1991.

name: Thembize Agrippa Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by other ANC supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 23 May 1991. When IFP supporters burnt down his family home at Murchison on 19 April 1991, he and his two brothers had sought refuge at the home of an IFP-supporting relative. On their return home on 23 May, they were attacked by ANC supporters who considered their staying with an IFP supporter to be a betrayal of the ANC. One of his brothers was also killed in the attack, the other was severely injured.

name: Thembize Agrippa Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by other ANC supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 23 May 1991. When IFP supporters burnt down his family home at Murchison on 19 April 1991, he and his two brothers had sought refuge at the home of an IFP-supporting relative. On their return home on 23 May, they were attacked by ANC supporters who considered their staying with an IFP supporter to be a betrayal of the ANC. One of his brothers was also killed in the attack, the other was severely injured.

name: Vincent Vela Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 24 May 1991.

name: Vumani Maxwell Mkhungo
description: An IFP supporter whowas shot and injured by ANC supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 July 1992.

name: Zitha Harry Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by other ANC supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 23 May 1991. When IFP supporters burnt down his family home at Murchison on 19 April 1991, he and his two brothers had sought refuge at the home of an IFP-supporting relative. On their return home on 23 May, they were attacked by ANC supporters who considered their staying with an IFP supporter to be a betrayal of the ANC. One of his brothers was also killed in the attack, the other was severely injured.

name: Zitha Harry Mkhungo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by other ANC supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 23 May 1991. When IFP supporters burnt down his family home at Murchison on 19 April 1991, he and his two brothers had sought refuge at the home of an IFP-supporting relative. On their return home on 23 May, they were attacked by ANC supporters who considered their staying with an IFP supporter to be a betrayal of the ANC. One of his brothers was also killed in the attack, the other was severely injured.

name: Amon Bheki Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 8 April 1993.

name: Audrey Zamekile Mkhwanazi
description: She had her home destroyed in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, during 1992.

name: Bancamile Mirriam Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mirriam Edna Mdletshe
description: She had her home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in March 1993, allegedly because she was perceived to be an ANC supporter.

name: Fayedwa Mgenge
description: An IFP chairperson who was shot and injured and lost his home in an arson attack by named ANC supporters on 20 August 1990 in intensiyfing political conflict in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban.

name: Marie Thembisile Mhlanga
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when IFP supporters shot and stabbed her in her home at Ezakheni,  KwaZulu,  near Ladysmith, Natal, on 9 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her house was burnt down in the incident and she was forced to flee the area.

name: Marie Thembisile Mhlanga
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when IFP supporters shot and stabbed her in her home at Ezakheni,  KwaZulu,  near Ladysmith, Natal, on 9 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her house was burnt down in the incident and she was forced to flee the area.

name: Ntombinani Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: (The Family) Mkhize
description: The Mkhize family were ANC supporters, but they were constantly harassed by other ANC supporters in the Durban area during 1991, allegedly because the family was thought to be supportive of the IFP.

name: Nombuyiselo Mabel Mdletshe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters early in 1992, allegedly because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Ntombikayise Doris Mdletshe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Verulam, Natal, on 26 May 1993.

name: Kulumile Teresa Mkhize
description: She had four houses destroyed on 16 March 1994 in an arson attack by IFP supporters on residents of the isolated ANC stronghold in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lindiwe Dorah Mgenge
description: She had her home at Amaoti, Inanda, near Durban, burnt down on 12 November 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ratsebe Jeremiah Mekhoe
description: An ANC supporter who was detained for three days during May 1971 in Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS). He was tortured under police interrogation, and confessed to being a communist. Based on this confession, he was sentenced on 1 December 1971 to four years on Robben Island.

name: Ratsebe Jeremiah Mekhoe
description: An ANC supporter who was detained for three days during May 1971 in Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS). He was tortured under police interrogation, and confessed to being a communist. Based on this confession, he was sentenced on 1 December 1971 to four years on Robben Island.

name: Ntondo Mdletshe
description: An IFP supporter who lost his home in an arson attack in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, in April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntondo Mdletshe
description: An IFP supporter who lost his home in an arson attack in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, in April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Qatisa Alfred Miya
description: An IFP supporter who was injured in a hand grenade attack by ANC supporters on a shop on 23 March 1993, and shot by ANC supporters on 17 April 1994 in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Qatisa Alfred Miya
description: An IFP supporter who was injured in a hand grenade attack by ANC supporters on a shop on 23 March 1993, and shot by ANC supporters on 17 April 1994 in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Qatisa Alfred Miya
description: An IFP supporter who was injured in a hand grenade attack by ANC supporters on a shop on 23 March 1993, and shot by ANC supporters on 17 April 1994 in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Abednigo Mbhekiseni Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who was killed in a limpet-mine attack on the home of a well-known IFP leader in the Umbumbulu area, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 October 1991. The attack, which took place during a wedding ceremony, is thought to have been carried out by an ANC supporter. Six people were killed.

name: Ntomula Mhlongo
description: Was killed by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 February 1992 in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Linus Mkhize
description: Was shot in the chest by IFP supporters in KwaBhidla, near Bulwer, Natal, on 13 January 1993, allegedly because he was thought to be an ANC supporter. Several ANC supporters were attacked in the area that day. Mr Mkhize died in hospital the following day

name: Lucky Nhlanhla Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters near his home in Isithebe,  KwaZulu,  near Mandini, Natal, on 4 July 1993.

name: Makhosonke Solomon Mkhize
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mandlenkosi Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by named IFP supporters at Wembezi, KwaZulu,near Estcourt, Natal, on 5 May 1991. His infant daughter was killed in the same attack.

name: Maxwell Jabulani Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters, two of whom are named, on 13 May 1993 in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban.

name: Mbangomuni Raphael Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters on 25 May 1991 in Bhomela, Port Shepstone, Natal.

name: Mbhekeni Mkhize
description: Was one of five young ANC supporters shot dead by IFP supporters during political conflict at Magoda, Richmond, Natal, on 14 July 1991. Residents accused the security forces of involvement, and a top-level police investigation was launched. The chief of Phatheni was arrested in connection with the massacre.

name: Mbhekeni Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 13 June 1991. Four other ANC supporters were killed in the attack.

name: Mdumazeni Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 December 1991. Two of his brothers were also killed, at different times, in the course of political conflict.

name: Mhlomi Mkhize
description: A COSATU member who died the day after he was shot and injured on 27 June 1993 in Katlehong, Transvaal, allegedly by ANC supporters.

name: Michael Mfungeleni Mkhize
description: Was stabbed and burnt to death at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 21 February 1993 during continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Moses Bonginkosi Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Isipingo, Natal, on 24 December 1991.

name: Msawenkosi Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by unidentified persons at KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 18 May 1993 during continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Muntu Mkhize
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was shot dead during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Muntukayise Mkhize
description: A local ANC chairperson who was shot and stabbed by IFP supporters at Ohlange, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 19 July 1993 during intense political conflict. He died in hospital a week later.

name: Muzikayifani Michael Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and shot dead by IFP supporters at Mophela, KwaZulu, near Hammarsdale, Natal, on 18 March 1992.

name: Mzo Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was killed at Richmond, Natal, on 20 March 1994 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mzo Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was killed at Richmond, Natal, on 20 March 1994 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ndukuzempi Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by ANC supporters who stoned him, poured petrol over him and then set him alight at Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1990. Mr Mkhize was suspected of being a police informer and of causing the deaths of other ANC supporters. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/052).

name: Nobuhle Dorothy Mkhize
description: She lost her house in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Richmond, Natal, on 20 January 1991.

name: Nokuthula Lungile Mkhize
description: Was severely injured when she was shot in the jaw by IFP supporters who attacked her family home in Pietermaritzburg, on 26 October 1991. The family had allegedly been targeted because they supported the ANC.

name: Nomnikelo Thembisile Mkhize
description: She had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack in July 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nomzinto Esther Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was forced to leave her home in Pietermaritzburg and flee with her family after being threatened by IFP supporters at her husband`s funeral in 1991.

name: Norah Mkhize
description: She had her house at KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters during 1991, allegedly because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Ntombenhle Nomthandazo Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombikayise Elizabeth Mkhize
description: She had her house at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down on 2 August 1990 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Ms Mkhize had gone to stay with her brother because of the violence in the area.

name: Nukiwe Marriet Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Bomvini, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters in October 1993.

name: Obed Sibongiseni Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 7 March 1992.

name: Protecia Buyisile Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Rose Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked by IFP supporters at KwaMashu, Durban, during 1991.

name: Samson Mzikayise Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by a named ANC supporter at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 20 May 1993.

name: Sandile Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was run over by IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 May 1994, during celebrations of President Mandela`s inauguration.

name: Sarah Nelisiwe Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, burnt down by IFP supporters on 1 December 1991.

name: Simiso Edmund Miya
description: Was beaten to death in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 29 June 1993, at a `people`s court` under the command of an officer of a local ANC self-defence unit (SDU). Mr Hlatshwayo was one of two people killed that day, and five others were severely beaten, allegedly for crimes committed in the community. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/033).

name: Thembekile Mdletshe
description: She lost her home in an arson attack in KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in November 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zolani Meko
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in 1986 in New Town, Cookhouse, Cape during political conflict between the Cookhouse community and the Kakana family. Five Kanana family members were killed after claims were made that they were collaborating with the state.

name: Thuleleni Nomvula Mdletshe
description: Was shot dead in Eshowe, Natal, on 8 January 1993 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Her father was also killed in the attack.

name: Thembalethu Mhlangenyama
description: He had his house burnt down in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1993 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. More than 300 people died violently in Bhambayi in 1993. Hundreds of homes were burnt down.

name: Ambros B Mkhize
description: He had his house burnt down at KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 June 1992 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nkopodi Joyce Melane
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted in an attack by A-Team members on mourners at a night vigil in Thabong, Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS), on 9 May 1985.

name: Bahlakaniphile Meyiwa
description: She had her home in Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 18 March 1990, in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Zifo Mdletshe
description: Was hacked to death by alleged IFP supporters in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 29 March 1992 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Tunywandi Mhlangu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Nokweja, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 28 July 1993. More than 110 people fled the area after their homes were burnt down.

name: Precious Themba Mhlongo
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, in March 1991 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bezile Meyiwa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1992.

name: Prince Ncuncu Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 October 1992.

name: Bhekisisa Mhlanti
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters at the railway station in Daveyton, Transvaal, on 22 July 1993. The attack took place because the train was transporting mostly Xhosa-speaking commuters presumed to be ANC supporters. Between 1990 and 1993, 572 people died in train violence initiated by groups opposed to a democratic transition.

name: Roseline Bongiwe Mdlinze
description: She had her home in Emqolombeni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down in 1991, allegedly because her children were ANC supporters. She was forced to flee the area.

name: Angelina Khuluza Mkhize
description: An ANC branch secretary who was raped, severely beaten and stabbed to death by named IFP supporters at her home in KwaMashu, Durban, on 27 January 1991.

name: Bhekisizwe Million Meyiwa
description: A founder member of the local ANC branch who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 January 1994 during political conflict in the area.

name: Angeline Ntombeliza Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Mahlabatini, near Ulundi, KwaZulu/Natal, during 1991.

name: Sithembiso Robert Miya
description: An IFP supporter who was attacked by ANC supporters at Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 5 February 1991. He died of his injuries some days later. His mother`s house was burnt down in the attack.

name: Tonny Melato
description: Was shot dead by named perpetrators in Evaton, Transvaal, on 27 July 1991 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters, and within the ANC in the area. Mr Melato received threats from a rival faction within the ANC-aligned civic organisation before his death.

name: Alfred Wilson Jabu Mema
description: Was shot and killed in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 4 September 1992 during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting Vusumuzi hostel-dwellers.

name: Caroline Nanziwe Mambathane Memani
description: An ANC supporter who experienced severe harassment by police after her son was shot dead in Guguletu, Cape Town, on 10 September 1980, during school and bus boycotts. Her home was raided and children arrested, the funeral was placed under restriction orders that she defied, and their home was tear-gassed after the funeral on 20 September 1980.

name: Caroline Nanziwe Mambathane Memani
description: An ANC supporter who experienced severe harassment by police after her son was shot dead in Guguletu, Cape Town, on 10 September 1980, during school and bus boycotts. Her home was raided and children arrested, the funeral was placed under restriction orders that she defied, and their home was tear-gassed after the funeral on 20 September 1980.

name: Bernard Jabulani Memela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in August 1993.

name: Bhekani Nelson Memela
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by a named IFP supporter in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 24 December 1991.

name: Madoti Memela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by IFP supporters in KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, on 28 January 1991.

name: Nomathemba Maria Memela
description: She had her house at Madakane, Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 5 February 1994 in political violence during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomathemba Maria Memela
description: She had her house at Madakane, Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 5 February 1994 in political violence during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombikayise Sylvia Memela
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in fighting between ANC supporters and IFP supporters, allegedly supported by members of the ISU, in June 1993. More than 300 people died violently in Bhambayi during 1993. Hundreds of homes were burnt down.

name: Thabani Patrick Memela
description: Was shot dead in Umlazi, Durban, on 19 June 1992, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Wilson Bambezakhe Memela
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Memela was allegedly mistaken for an IFP supporter.

name: Wilson Bambezakhe Memela
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Memela was allegedly mistaken for an IFP supporter.

name: Zodwa Constance Memela
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 15 January 1991.

name: Zowakhe Mdunyiswa Memela
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Polela, Bulwer, Natal, on 17 May 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area. Two of his friends were killed in the same incident.

name: Mbayiyana Mendu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by other ANC supporters in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 28 April 1990, allegedly because she was thougth to be a witchdoctor, at a time of intense political conflict in the area.

name: Ntombile Margaret Mendu
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Mqolombeni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in September 1993.

name: Xolani Christian Mendu
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by other ANC supporters during May 1990. His mother had been killed the previous week.

name: Robert Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in July 1991 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sokela Miya
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters after he was allegedly intimidated into attending an IFP meeting in Bulwer, Natal, on 20 April 1992.

name: Alvina Mdlolo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 27 October 1992 as she fled her home in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt,  Natal,  during continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Gcinintetho Mgexo
description: She lost his house in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 February 1992 during continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mshiyeni Mdlolo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Estcourt, Natal, on 1 July 1992.

name: Themba Selby Miya
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely wounded by IFP supporters at his home in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in October 1992. He died from his injuries a few months later.

name: Bafunani Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 25 August 1991. The perpetrators allegedly chased Ms Mkhize and her family from their home before setting fire to it.

name: Thulani Miya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters at Umkomaas, near Durban, in October 1990.

name: Khombiseni Ntombikayise Meyiwa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ziyeke Mhletshwa
description: An ANC supporter who lost his home of seven huts in an arson attack in March 1960 in Entsimbini, near Bizana, Transkei, during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Beauty Ntombizodwa Mkhize
description: Was abducted, hacked and then burnt to death by ANC supporters in Mooi River, Natal, on 4 October 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Sibongile Fikisiwe Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in Ntuzuma, near Durban, in an arson attack on 3 October 1991 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Kisslow Mdluli
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, in April 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Margaret Mdluli
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death by ANC supporters at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1992.

name: Mnuken Mdluli
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Nonhlanhla Thandi Mdluli
description: An IFP supporter who had her home set alight by ANC supporters at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1992.

name: Sibusiso Banda Mdluli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named members of the Esikhawini hit squad at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 20 June 1993. Three other ANC supporters were shot dead in the attack. Two perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Sikhumbuzo Mdluli
description: Was shot dead in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 21 August 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sikhumbuzo Msethenzwa Milton Mdluli
description: Was shot dead on a street in Pietermaritzburg on 21 August 1992 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Sthembiso Mdluli
