description: An IFP supporter who disappeared from his home at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, following an attack on his family by ANC supporters in April 1992. He has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Ntombizandile Mdolomba
description: An ANC supporter who was detained on 15 June 1985 in Port Elizabeth, and held for three weeks during which she was tortured and interrogated about the activities of other ANC activists. She was later charged with public violence.

name: Regina Mawina Mduli
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 April 1992.

name: Thabile Millicent Mdumo
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thabile Millicent Mdumo
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Malungelo Mdunge
description: She had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed by IFP supporters in February 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mantombi Pauline Mdunge
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by named IFP supporters in Ngonweni, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 27 January 1993.

name: Thembinkosi Ernest Mdunge
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, on 29 January 1991.

name: Zitusile Thandazile Mdunge
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Empangeni, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in May 1992.

name: Ntombemhlophe Precious Mdungwa
description: She had her home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, set alight in 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Tefa Joseph Mdungwane
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten in Dennilton, KwaNdebele, during conflict over independence in 1986.

name: Nkebe Soswiti Mdutshane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by named perpetrators on 8 March 1994 in Flagstaff, Transkei. At the time, many ANC supporters were apparently harassed by Chief Mdutshane and his followers.

name: Thozamile Edward Mdyesha
description: An ANC supporter and SAYCO member who was detained under emergency regulations on 17 July 1986 in Somerset East, Cape, and held in custody until August 1988. While in detention, he was tortured.

name: Thozamile Edward Mdyesha
description: An ANC supporter and SAYCO member who was detained under emergency regulations on 17 July 1986 in Somerset East, Cape, and held in custody until August 1988. While in detention, he was tortured.

name: Itumeleng James Nango Medupe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by unidentified attackers in Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS),  on 9 May 1992. The killing took place at a time of heightened political tension and boycotts in the area.

name: Bernard Ben Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Engonyameni, near Umlazi, Durban, on 15 August 1992. He and his family had fled from their home in Emagadini, Umbumbulu, a few months before his death, allegedly because of harassment by IFP supporters.

name: Sibongile Ngenisile Mhlongo
description: She had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 21 June 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bhekamakhize Linos Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at the Duduza hostel in Transvaal, on 19 March 1994. At least ten people were killed in the attack, which took place after IFP hostel-dwellers had attacked and evicted ANC hostel-dwellers. Two SDU members were granted amnesty for this killing (AC/2000/054).

name: Leonard Mgidingo
description: An ANC activist who was arrested and tortured in 1960 in East London, allegedly because of his involvement in Nonqulwana. Mr Mgidingo died after his release as a result of injuries he sustained in detention. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Sibusiso Sicelile Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who had his house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 9 March 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sibusiso Sicelile Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who had his house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 9 March 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sheleni Mhlokhulu
description: An ANC member who was executed in Pretoria on 21 March 1962 after he was accused of being an accomplice to murder during the Pondoland Revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Sicelo Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Mehlomnyana, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 September 1990.

name: Soleni Meyiwa
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Busisiwe Mgobhozi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by an IFP supporter at her home in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 27 July 1992, the day after the Folweni massacre

name: Sipho Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who was severely injured when he was beaten by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, in 1991. Mr Mhlongo was allegedly attacked because had refused to side with the ANC in the conflict.

name: Bhekithemba Bridgeman Mkhize
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Madundubala, near Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 5 May 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters accompanying the April 1994 elections. Mr Mkhize was allegedly targeted because his son was an ANC supporter.

name: Bhekithemba Bridgeman Mkhize
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Madundubala, near Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 5 May 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters accompanying the April 1994 elections. Mr Mkhize was allegedly targeted because his son was an ANC supporter.

name: Lindinkosi Happy Mjadu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters while on his way to work in Empangeni, Natal, on 15 July 1992 during continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Bhekizenzo Bongani Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Vezunyawo, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, during a violent confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters in the area on 16 October 1993.

name: Sizani Catherine Mhlongo
description: She had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomakhosi M Mgobhozi
description: An ANC supporter who had his houses at Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, destroyed in an arson attack during 1990 in intensifying conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Nhlanhla Kenneth Mjadu
description: Was stabbed with a spear and had his home burnt down in Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1993 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Nokwethemba Ntombizakhona Mjadu
description: Was shot and injured and had her house in Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Soto Gladys Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down during 1993 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. More than 300 people died violently in Bhambayi during the course of 1993. Hundreds of homes were burnt down.

name: Ashwell Siluva Mfanekiso
description: An ANC supporter who was detained for a month in 1960 at Endlovini in Bizana, Transkei, for his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Themba Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 4 November 1993 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. See `Red` and `Green` factions.

name: Themba Godfrey Mhlongo
description: He had his house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area during 1993. See `Red` and `Green` factions.

name: Thembekile Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Enteneshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 8 December 1993. In the attack, her son, an ANC supporter, was shot and burnt to death. Another son had been killed a year earlier, also in political conflict.

name: Thembisile Joy Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter whowas shot and injured by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 27 July 1992, the day after the Folweni massacre.

name: Thembitshe Khohlwayisu Mhlongo
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Thokoza Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 7 March 1994 at the Ngcamu store, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. One family member was killed in the attack, another was severely injured.

name: Thokoza Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 7 March 1994 at the Ngcamu store, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. One family member was killed in the attack, another was severely injured.

name: Thokozani Richard Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured in KwaDweshula, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 September 1990 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. His father was also killed in the attack. On that day, most people in the area had left their houses and fled into the nearby forest.

name: Tholakele Dorah Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 September 1992.

name: Titi Mhlongo
description: Was shot dead on 28 November 1993 when IFP supporters from Ndabayakhe opened fire on ANC supporters attending a cultural ceremony at Iniwe,  KwaZulu,  near Empangeni, Natal. Eight people, all believed to be ANC supporters, were killed.

name: Vincent Mhlophe Mhlongo
description: He had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 July 1992. Mr Mhlongo was perceived to be an ANC supporter.

name: Vusumuzi Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by unidentified persons in Empangeni, Natal, on 18 January 1993 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. He has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Zakhe Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Enteneshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 November 1992.

name: Zandile Mhlongo
description: Was injured when she was attacked at her home in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 November 1992 during intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zenzeni Doris Mhlongo
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in July 1993 in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Her husband was shot and killed in the attack.

name: Zibuse Eric Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 December 1993.

name: Johannes Omecor Mhlungwana
description: He had his house burnt down by ANC supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, in February 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Johannes Omecor Mhlungwana
description: He had his house burnt down by ANC supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, in February 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Happy Mhongo
description: Was attacked and injured by ANC supporters in July 1991 in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Vuyisile Mini
description: A founder member of SACTU, and an ANC supporter, who was executed in Pretoria, on 6 November 1964 after being sentenced to death in the 1960 treason trial. Mr Mini was allegedly betrayed by `comrades` who turned state witness in the case.

name: Heriet Sisi Mitshali
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by an IFP supporter at Jeppe station, Johannesburg, on 28 October 1993. Ms Mitshali was targeted by co-workers who were members of the IFP-aligned UWUSA, because of political conflict in the workplace.

name: Dibhiliza Gesta Miya
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 5 February 1991. Her son was killed in the attack, and she was forced to flee the area.

name: Mduduzi Aubrey Miya
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Mduduzi Aubrey Miya
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Mlungisi Miya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP members during political conflict at Amahlongwa Reserve, Umkomaas, Natal, on 18 October 1990. Two perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0015).

name: Sifanelo Mgoboza
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by named perpetrators in Matatiele, Transkei, on 27 April 1990. A group of men associated with the traditional authorities and opposed to the launch of an ANC branch attacked numerous homes and persons associated with the ANC.

name: Busisiwe Lethiwe Mgobozi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bhoyi Patrick Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from his home in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 1 January 1993, and taken to a deserted place where he was shot several times in the back and left for dead. He is now paralysed.

name: Bhekinkosi Armstrong Mhlongo
description: Was stabbed to death in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bhekinkosi Armstrong Mhlongo
description: Was stabbed to death in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembinkosi Christopher Mfayela
description: Was one of six passengers shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Eight other passengers were injured. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Khizana Mgobozi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Diliza Mayford Mfazwe
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten in detention in Uitenhage, Cape, on 1 July 1985 during the state of emergency. See police brutality.

name: Bonakele Christina Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bulwer, Natal, burnt down by a named IFP supporter in March 1994 during political conflict in the area.

name: Bhekokwakhe Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in Matimatolo, near Greytown, Natal, in May 1991.

name: Bitsene Amos Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Nelspruit, Transvaal, burnt down on 11 January 1993 by named perpetrators because they suspected him of practising witchcraft.

name: Bongani Zwelethu Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who had his house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bongekile Patience Mhlongo
description: Was shot dead when IFP supporters attacked a house in Inanda, near Kwa-Mashu, Durban, during September 1992 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Three people were killed in the attack.

name: Buyelaphi Prudence Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, severely damaged in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Collen Sfiso Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Wangu Reserve, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Mhlongo was travelling in a car with two others at the time of the attack. His companions were both killed.

name: Collen Sfiso Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Wangu Reserve, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Mhlongo was travelling in a car with two others at the time of the attack. His companions were both killed.

name: Cynthia Nkosingiphile Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and hacked to death in an attack on her home at Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 3 October 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Her brother was injured in the attack, and the house was burnt down.

name: Effie Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Elizabeth Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 19 July 1993, in ongoing political conflict between the `Red` and `Green` factions.

name: Elsie Mhlongo
description: She had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Entoweni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1992 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Emma Mcane Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at the Ngcamu store, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Two other family members were severely injured in the attack.

name: Emma Mcane Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at the Ngcamu store, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Two other family members were severely injured in the attack.

name: Fikile Mirriam Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when IFP supporters attacked a house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in September 1992 during continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Three people were killed in the attack.

name: Filda Mankanaza Mhlongo
description: She lost her home in an arson attack in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 April 1992 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Gazo Amon Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in KwaDweshula, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 September 1990 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His son was also killed in the attack.

name: Happy Mhlongo
description: Was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, in July 1991. In the attack, the leader of the Black Cats was assassinated. Five SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/98/0121).

name: Kege Mandlenkosi Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death on 8 December 1993, when the house he was in was set alight by IFP supporters in Enteneshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal.

name: Mahelane Msawenkosi Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured by other IFP supporters in Sihuzu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during February 1994. Mr Mhlongo`s son allegedly attended a school dominated by ANC supporters.

name: Mamiti Fakazile Mhlongo
description: She lost her houses in an arson attack in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1993 during continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mandla Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Lloyd, Stanger, Natal, in September 1993. He was forced to flee into the forest, and remained in hiding for three months.

name: Mandlenkosi Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Martin Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted, together with four family members, from Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, by IFP supporters on 23 December 1990. He survived unharmed, but two family members were shot and injured. The family home was burnt down the following day.

name: Mbuso Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Lion`s River, near Pieter-maritzburg, on 6 February 1993. The perpetrator was sentenced to five years` imprisonment, suspended for five years.

name: Mdumiseni Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Matimatolo, near Greytown, Natal, in May 1991.

name: Mdumiseni Mhlongo
description: He lost his house in an arson attack in Bhukhanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 January 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April /1994 elections.

name: Mduzana Mhlongo
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her son was killed in the attack.

name: Meshack Mhlongo
description: Was shot dead on 28 November 1993 when IFP supporters from Ndabayakhe opened fire on ANC supporters attending a cultural ceremony at Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Eight people, all believed to be ANC supporters, were killed in the attack.

name: Mkhaliseni Mhlongo
description: Was shot and injured in Empangeni, Natal, on 2 August 1992 and had his house burnt down on 3 March 1994, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mkhaliseni Mhlongo
description: Was shot and injured in Empangeni, Natal, on 2 August 1992 and had his house burnt down on 3 March 1994, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mla Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter and member of a self-defence unit (SDU) who was shot dead in Esigcakeni, Richmond, Natal, on 9 October 1993, soon after he and a friend had been fetched from their homes on the instructions of local ANC leader, Mr Sifiso Nkabinde. The friend was also shot dead. On the previous day, Mr Mhlongo had borrowed a firearm from a friend, who had got it from Mr Nkabinde for SDU purposes. Mr Mhlongo had allegedly used the gun to kill an unidentified person.

name: Moses Blokakhe Mhlongo
description: Was stabbed and shot dead during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1993.

name: Mshayeni Mhlongo
description: He lost his house in an arson attack in Ohlange, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 6 June 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nicholas Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Sbululwane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 February 1992 during political conflict in the area.

name: Nkelezi Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Nhlangakazi, near Stanger, Natal, on 30 April 1994 in the political conflict accompanying the April 1994 elections.

name: Nkelezi Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Nhlangakazi, near Stanger, Natal, on 30 April 1994 in the political conflict accompanying the April 1994 elections.

name: Nokukhanya Brightness Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack at Ngcamu store, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 November 1993. On 7 March 1994 she was shot and injured in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. One other family member was severely injured and another was killed in this attack.

name: Nokukhanya Brightness Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack at Ngcamu store, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 November 1993. On 7 March 1994 she was shot and injured in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. One other family member was severely injured and another was killed in this attack.

name: Nokukhanya Brightness Mhlongo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack at Ngcamu store, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 November 1993. On 7 March 1994 she was shot and injured in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. One other family member was severely injured and another was killed in this attack.

name: Nomnyango Mahwanqa Mhlongo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 26 April 1993.

name: Bongani Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 29 October 1991. His brother and cousin were killed in the same attack, and one other person was severely injured.

name: Thamsanqa Meshack Mfazwe
description: A union shopsteward who was severely assaulted, then detained and tortured in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, on 29 September 1986, on suspicion of belonging to the ANC. The incident occurred during a five day strike. Mr Mfazwe was detained and assaulted on four other occasions between 1987 and 1990, allegedly because of his political activities.

name: July Xwele Mjikelo
description: An ADM supporter who lost his homestead in arson attacks by named ANC members during political conflict at Msobomvu, Alice, Ciskei, in September 1992.

name: Noxolo Lindelwa Mjila
description: Was shot and injured by named and unnamed ANC supporters during political conflict in Mdantsane, Ciskei, on 28 January 1993. She was allegedly targeted because she was the wife of an ADM member.

name: Nonhlanhla Mjola
description: Was shot dead when IFP supporters attacked the home of her grandmother, an ANC supporter, in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 29 October 1993. Three other people were killed in the attack.

name: Nomabisinya Esther Mjoli
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, looted and burnt down by ANC supporters in July 1992.

name: Bazeni Agnecia Mjwara
description: An ANC supporter who had her home at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down in April 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Gertrude Mjwara
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 1 May 1994 in political conflict that accompanied the April 1994 elections.

name: Gertrude Mjwara
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 1 May 1994 in political conflict that accompanied the April 1994 elections.

name: Linda Vivian Mjwara
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared for thirty one days and was found dead at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 8 November 1993. He had allegedly been stabbed and killed by an IFP supporter.

name: Thobile Beauty Mjwara
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, in April 1992 during ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nathi Mkabinde
description: Was shot and injured in crossfire between the police and named ANC operatives at Edendale Hospital, near Pietermaritzburg, on 4 May 1986, when the operatives tried to free a political prisoner held at the hospital.

name: Boby Mkamba
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in December 1990 during intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Thandiwe Primrose Mkamba
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and business premises in Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 6 May 1992.

name: Bukwana Mkatali
description: An ANC member who was severely assaulted by ADM members during political conflict in Peddie, Ciskei, in 1993.

name: Joseph Mkhabela
description: A taxi driver who was shot dead in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 16 March 1994. One ANC self-defence unit (SDU) member, who claimed to believe that Mr Mkhabela was an IFP supporter, was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0017).

name: Thembelihle Constance Mkhabela
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 December 1992.

name: Nontetho Meslinah Mkhalani
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1992 in intense political confict in the area.

name: Petros Sibonelo Mkhasibe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death on 14 February 1993 in Ntuzuma, near Durban, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thomas Muzi Mkhasibe
description: Was shot dead by a named ANC supporter on 23 February 1993 in Sebokeng, Transvaal. The perpetrator was allegedly involved in car hijackings and armed robberies.

name: Adam Mkhatjwa
description: An ANC supporter who was severely tortured and beaten while in police custody on suspicion that he participated in an arson attack on a house at Nelspruit, Transvaal, in May 1986.

name: Veleleni Enoch Mkhatsha
description: An ANC supporter who lost two huts in an arson attack in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal, on 30 April 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Following the unbanning of political organisations, local villagers, including leading members of the community, resisted attempts by the ANC to establish branches in the Pholile and KwaMango areas of Matatiele in March and April 1990. From 27 to 30 April 1990 about 12 homes belonging to ANC supporters were burnt down by known perpetrators carrying traditional weapons.

name: Veleleni Enoch Mkhatsha
description: An ANC supporter who lost two huts in an arson attack in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal, on 30 April 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Following the unbanning of political organisations, local villagers, including leading members of the community, resisted attempts by the ANC to establish branches in the Pholile and KwaMango areas of Matatiele in March and April 1990. From 27 to 30 April 1990 about 12 homes belonging to ANC supporters were burnt down by known perpetrators carrying traditional weapons.

name: Veleleni Enoch Mkhatsha
description: An ANC supporter who lost two huts in an arson attack in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal, on 30 April 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Following the unbanning of political organisations, local villagers, including leading members of the community, resisted attempts by the ANC to establish branches in the Pholile and KwaMango areas of Matatiele in March and April 1990. From 27 to 30 April 1990 about 12 homes belonging to ANC supporters were burnt down by known perpetrators carrying traditional weapons.

name: Bokweni Bethuel Mkhatswa
description: Was tortured, mutilated and burnt by members of the community and named ANC supporters in Nkomazi-West district, Komatipoort, Transvaal, on 6 June 1986 in retaliation for his brother having killed a chief. His two brothers were killed with him in the same manner in full view of the community. Five perpetrators were charged, convicted of murder and sentenced.

name: December Mkhatswa
description: Was tortured, mutilated and burnt by named ANC supporters and members of the community in Nkomazi-West district, Komatipoort, Transvaal, on 6 June 1986 because he was accused of killing a chief. Despite Mr Mkhatswa`s alleged confession, his two brothers were killed with him in the same manner in full view of the community because they were suspected of opposing the new chief. Five perpetrators were charged, convicted of murder and sentenced.

name: Jonathan Mkhatswa
description: Was tortured, mutilated and burnt by named ANC supporters and community members in Nkomazi-West district, Komatipoort, Transvaal, on 6 June 1986 in revenge for his brother having killed the chief. His two brothers were killed with him in the same manner in full view of the community. Five perpetrators were charged, convicted of murder and sentenced.

name: Thabani Robert Mgobozi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP members during political conflict at Amahlongwa Reserve, Umkomaas, Natal, on 18 October 1990. Two perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0015).

name: Vivian Nomhle Mgoduso
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Durban on 22 January 1991. Her husband, an IFP supporter, was also killed in the attack, which allegedly occurred in the course of an internal dispute in the IFP.

name: Ncedo Paul Mgoqi
description: Was shot and injured by named IFP supporters in Tembisa, Transvaal, in August 1990, during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Albert Mgoza
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death by IFP supporters at a bus stop in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 25 August 1993.

name: Fani David Mgqosini
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 5 December 1992 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Peter Mgubane
description: A local ANC leader who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters when the car in which he and two other ANC officials were travelling was ambushed near Ixopo, Natal, on 27 October 1992. He was part of an ANC delegation attempting to broker peace with the IFP. An ANC Midlands Exective Committee member was shot dead in the ambush.

name: Mdudza Raphael Mguze
description: He had his house burnt down at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 24 February 1993 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. About 35 houses were burnt down in Bhambayi in February 1993.

name: Mdudza Raphael Mguze
description: He had his house burnt down at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 24 February 1993 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. About 35 houses were burnt down in Bhambayi in February 1993.

name: Ndoda Mthembiseni Mgwaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Odondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 December 1992.

name: Goodman Nceba Mgweje
description: An ANC member who had her home demolished by named ADM members on 12 November 1993 during political conflict at Mlakalala in Zwelitsha, Ciskei.

name: Alson Bhekisigcino Mhkize
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death with spears and knives by IFP supporters near Gagisa Lower Primary School, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, in March 1991.

name: Sipho Douglas Mhkize
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at his home in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 9 February 1991.

name: Thozama Milliicent Mhlaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot at and had a petrol bomb thrown into her house in Entshawini, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, by IFP supporters on 6 May 1994 in political conflict that accompanied the April 1994 elections.

name: Thozama Milliicent Mhlaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot at and had a petrol bomb thrown into her house in Entshawini, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, by IFP supporters on 6 May 1994 in political conflict that accompanied the April 1994 elections.

name: Fuzile Mhlakaza
description: An ANC self-defence unit (SDU) member who was abducted and severely beaten by members of a balaclava group in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, in 1993, allegedly because they wanted information from him. See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Muziwabantu Prince Mhlambi
description: An ANC supporter and civic leader who was shot dead by named perpetrators in an ambush in Phola Park in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 10 October 1992. Four other people were also shot dead in the attack. The Goldstone Commission later implicated a police informer in a disinformation campaign against the Phola Park Residents Committee which Mr Mhlambi headed.

name: Andries Velaphi Mhlanga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when the vehicle in which he and nine other young men were travelling was ambushed at Diepdale, near Ermelo, Transvaal, on 30 September 1993. The youths were returning from a court appearance in connection with the killing of a local chief when they were attacked, allegedly by the chief`s son and other IFP supporters. Four of the ten were killed and three others injured.

name: Bafana Johannes 'Jwi' Mhlanga
description: He was killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Ermelo, Transvaal, in July 1991, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. He was the leader of the Black Cats. Five SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1998/0121). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Johannes Mfanethu Mhlanga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in train violence at the station in Daveyton, Transvaal, on 15 June 1992. Mr Mhlanga was shot in the head and pelvis, resulting in paralysis of his right leg.

name: Jongilizwe Thanduxolo Mhlanga
description: He had his house burnt down in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. More than 300 people died violently in Bhambayi during 1993. Hundreds of homes were burnt down.

name: Bongani Hermilton Mkhize
description: He had his house burnt down in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in August 1993 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters surrounding the launch of an IFP branch in the area.

name: Busisiwe Mkhize
description: Was killed at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 31 December 1992, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Conrad Mkhize
description: Was killed in a limpet-mine attack on the home of a well-known IFP leader in the Umbumbulu area, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 October 1991. The attack, which took place during a wedding ceremony, is thought to have been carried out by an ANC member. Six people were killed.

name: Dominic Mandlenkosi Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Ntuzuma, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 26 April 1994, the day before start of the April 1994 elections.

name: Dominic Mandlenkosi Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Ntuzuma, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 26 April 1994, the day before start of the April 1994 elections.

name: Dumazile Florah Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 11 August 1991.

name: Ernest Mandlenkosi Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 19 November 1991 in KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Euclide Muzi Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Fanana Sixtus Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) on at Zuba Location, Umkomaas, near Durban, 7 November 1990. The family`s home was burnt down in the attack. Three SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1998/0102).

name: Florence Fisani Mkhize
description: She had her house in Richmond, Natal, burnt down on 2 July 1993 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Peace talks about the return of political refugees had collapsed two weeks previously.

name: Gladness Ganile Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had her home at KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 27 January 1991. Two family members were killed in the attack.

name: Gqizo Ntombeziningi Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Gqokeleni Mpompo Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Henry Nkenke Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was repeatedly stabbed and then fatally struck on the head with a tomahawk by named IFP supporters at KwaMashu, Durban, on 27 January 1991.

name: Hlekisile Paulina Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 13 February 1992, allegedly because her son was a local ANC leader.

name: Irene Nokusuka Mkhize
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters during political conflict at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 June 1993. Ms Mkhize was allegedly targeted because she did not attend weekly IFP meetings and was therefore believed to support the ANC.

name: Jabu Rose Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters at Umkomaas, near Durban, in August 1992.

name: Johannes Makhosemba Mkhize
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Julius Mkhize
description: Was killed by ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, in October 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Kenilworth Solomuzi Ronald Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by two unidentified men in Nkandla, KwaZulu, near Melmoth, Natal, on 23 April 1994, while canvassing for the April 1994 elections in an IFP stronghold. Mr Mkhize is now blind as a result of his injuries.

name: Kenilworth Solomuzi Ronald Mkhize
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by two unidentified men in Nkandla, KwaZulu, near Melmoth, Natal, on 23 April 1994, while canvassing for the April 1994 elections in an IFP stronghold. Mr Mkhize is now blind as a result of his injuries.

name: Kenneth Mthokozisi 'Makhehla' Mkhize
description: Was shot dead by members of an ANC breakaway gang known as the `Cleaners` in his home in J Section, KwaMashu, Durban, on 6 October 1993. One other person was killed and one injured in the attack.

name: Bonisile Dorothy Mfeka
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by a named IFP supporter in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 11 February 1991.

name: Gladys Kathazile Mfeka
description: Was shot dead in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 July 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Gugwelihe Cynthia 'Gugu' Mfeka
description: She had her family home burnt down during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Sinathing, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, at in 1992. Her brother had disappeared during political conflict in 1988.

name: Hlalawazi Alois Mfeka
description: He had his house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down on 16 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the isolated ANC stronghold. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Londiwe Audrey Mfeka
description: She had her house in Amaoti, Inanda, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in May 1988, on the day of her husband`s funeral. Her husband had been killed in the course of political conflict in the area.

name: Nonhlanhla Goodness Mfeka
description: Was severely injured when a named perpetrator attacked her and her daughter, aged four, in their home in Mandini, Natal, on 16 April 1994 in intense political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Ms Mfeka`s husband was reportedly believed to be an ANC supporter.

name: Nonhlanhla Goodness Mfeka
description: Was severely injured when a named perpetrator attacked her and her daughter, aged four, in their home in Mandini, Natal, on 16 April 1994 in intense political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Ms Mfeka`s husband was reportedly believed to be an ANC supporter.

name: Ntombi Yemali Mfeka
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Siyabonga Innocent Mfeka
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked and shot dead by a crowd of about 200 IFP members returning from a rally in Woodford, Bergville, Natal, on 16 December 1993. Two ANC members were killed and at least two others injured.

name: Tembekile Kobozi Mfeka
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down on 16 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the isolated ANC stronghold. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Zandilie Precious Mfeka
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted, raped and shot dead by named IFP supporters in Gamkulu, Stanger, Natal, on 13 March 1993.

name: Thulisile Cynthia Mfene
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in October 1992.

name: Tokozani Elfrieda Mfukeni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mtholeni Msolobhana Mfuywa
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and tortured at Mount Frere police station during the Pondoland Revolt. Mr Mfuywa was later sentenced to death along with five others for his alleged involvement in a killing during the revolt. The six were executed at Pretoria Central prison on 18 September 1962.

name: Sandile Henry Mgabi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 23 September 1992.

name: Golden Mgandela
description: Was shot dead in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 23 May 1991 when IFP-supporting KwaMadala hostel-dwellers attacked a beerhall with AK47s during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Mr Mgandela and eight others were killed.

name: Thulani Christopher Mgandela
description: He had his home destroyed in an arson attack by a named perpetrator in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 March 1993. At least 18 people were killed in political violence in Bhambayi in March 1993, and 75 homes were burnt down.

name: Thulani Christopher Mgandela
description: He had his home destroyed in an arson attack by a named perpetrator in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 March 1993. At least 18 people were killed in political violence in Bhambayi in March 1993, and 75 homes were burnt down.

name: Motsamai Samuel Mgcekwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters on 17 June 1992 in the Boipatong massacre in Boipatong, near Vanderbijlpark, Transvaal, which left forty five people dead and twenty seven seriously injured. Thirteen perpetrators were granted amnesty; a further three applications were refused (AC/2000/209).

name: Jeanette Hluphekile Mnguni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in the right leg in Daveyton, Transvaal, while serving food at a night vigil for an ANC supporter on 30 September 1990. Hostel-dwellers targeted the night vigil as the person being buried was an ANC member.

name: Johannes Bangumuzi Mnguni
description: Was harassed and threatened by ANC-supporting youths at Estcourt, Natal, in August 1992. Mr Mnguni was the chairman of Wembezi High School and defied the youths, who allegedly wanted him to exclude IFP pupils from the school. He was forced to flee his home.

name: John Thulasizwe Mnguni
description: An IFP supporter who had his home petrol-bombed by ANC supporters at Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 1 January 1991.

name: Maria Nomgqibelo Mnguni
description: Was shot and killed by IFP supporters in March 1993 at Alexandra, Johannes-burg during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Mduduzi Mnguni
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured in Mtunzini, Natal, in December 1993 during continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Mr Mnguni was paralysed as a result of the attack.

name: Mpathiseni Skugu Mnguni
description: Was killed and his body burnt by a named perpetrator at his house in Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sibongile Ethel Mlotshwa
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 5 January 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Jerome Mashalaze Mntambo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Isipingo, Natal, on 13 July 1992 during political conflict in the area.

name: Nkumbula Mayvis Mnguni
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Mtunzini, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack in December 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Ntombizodwa Enid Mnguni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992 in intense political conflict in the area. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Sabusile Trace Mnguni
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack in KwaNdelu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 May 1991 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sibongile Mnguni
description: She had her home at Groutville, Stanger, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in October 1991 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sibusiso Mnguni
description: He sustained a head injury when his family was attacked by IFP supporters on 24 June 1992 in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Transvaal, during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nokuthula Khululiwe Mkhwanazi
description: She lost her home in an arson attack at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in January 1991in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in January 1991. Ms Mkhwanazi escaped injury by hiding nearby.

name: Nokuthula Khululiwe Mkhwanazi
description: She lost her home in an arson attack at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in January 1991in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in January 1991. Ms Mkhwanazi escaped injury by hiding nearby.

name: Sizwe Mnguni
description: Was stabbed to death at Gezinsila, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 28 November 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Te Mnguni
description: Was shot and injured in Empangeni, Natal, in January 1991 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thembeni Mnguni
description: She had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Ndabayakhe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 13 April 1994 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembeni Mnguni
description: She had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Ndabayakhe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 13 April 1994 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembi Qhamukile Mnguni
description: Was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 8 September 1992, in an attack on her aunt`s home. One person died and three were injured in the attack. Her aunt was an ANC supporter.

name: Tholakele Melta Mnguni
description: She had her house burnt down in Mathelanjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1993 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Tholakele Melta Mnguni
description: She had her house burnt down in Mathelanjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1993 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Vukaphi Mnguni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at KwaSomopho, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 November 1992 in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Zakhe Abram Mnguni
description: Was injured when he was hacked and stabbed by IFP supporters in his home in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Transvaal, on 24 June 1992. His wife and young son were also injured in the attack. The attack took place following clashes between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sihle Jaby Mngunu
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters at Ndabayakhe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in November 1990.

name: Brightman Mngwengwe
description: Was stabbed to death by named ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 January 1992. He was allegedly targeted because he was perceived to be an IFP supporter.

name: Deli Zokwenzani Mngwengwe
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in January 1991.

name: Mpandlana Mngwengwe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, in March 1991.

name: Nkosenye Mngwengwe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 23 February 1991.

name: Silvester Mngwengwe
description: An IFP supporter who had his house at Richmond, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters on 25 December 1990.

name: Antony Fana Mnikathi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by unidentified persons in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 26 December 1991. One other ANC supporter was shot dead and one injured in the attack, which occured in the course of serious internal party conflict.

name: Jabulani Henry Mnikathi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 14 April 1993. Two friends who were with him at the time were both shot dead in the attack, which allegedly arose from serious internal party conflict.

name: Sipho Mnguni
description: An ANC supporter who sustained head injuries while trying to escape from unidentified attackers during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal,  on 7 May 1991. Between February and May 1991  65 people were killed and 2000 families displaced from their homes in political violence in the area.

name: Sipho Mnguni
description: An ANC supporter who sustained head injuries while trying to escape from unidentified attackers during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal,  on 7 May 1991. Between February and May 1991  65 people were killed and 2000 families displaced from their homes in political violence in the area.

name: Sifiso Mnikathi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, in 1992 during serious internal party conflict.

name: Smanga Felix Mnikathi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot, stabbed and severely injured in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 26 December 1991. Two other ANC supporters were shot dead in the attack, which allegedly arose from serious internal party conflict.

name: Elizabeth Mnikati
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Mshayazafe, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 27 December 1989 in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Lucky Cliford Mnisi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed by members of the IFP-supporting Black Cats in July 1990 in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal.

name: Zacharia Mnisi
description: An ANC activist who  was arrested and sexually assaulted in Nelspruit, Transvaal, on 23 December 1993. He was accused of being in possession of firearms.

name: Qondeni Prizer Mnkonyeni
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Velile Mnomiya
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 2 February 1991 in Bekkersdal, near Westonaria, Transvaal, during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Lindelani Mnqayi
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and shot by IFP supporters in Kwa-Mthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 December 1993 during political conflict. His body, with hands tied, was found on a hill nearby. After the funeral, the perpetrators burnt down his father`s house.

name: Mary-Jane Mnqayi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, in October 1992.

name: Nkolo Mnqayi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, after the funeral of his son who had been killed by IFP supporters on 23 December 1993.

name: Thomas Mpisi Mnqayi
description: An IFP supporter who had his house in Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 12 May 1992 during continuing political conflict violence in the area. The attackers allegedly met at a local school prior to the incident.

name: Nati Mnqosini
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters on 23 February 1994 in Nondweni, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Bongani Patriot Mntaka
description: Was shot dead by named ANC supporters at Ixopo, Natal, on 16 September 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Nontombi Elizabeth Mntaka
description: She had her home destroyed in an arson attack by named ANC supporters in Ixopo, Natal, on 15 June 1993 in continuing political conflict in the area. Ms Mntaka`s husband was killed in the attack.

name: Gabangaye Felokhwakhe Mntambo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Stanger, Natal, on 2 September 1992.

name: Harriet Beatrice Mntambo
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by named IFP supporters in Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 10 August 1992.

name: Bekisiwe Mkhwanazi
description: An IFP supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack in Kwa-Dlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 August 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thandiwe Margaret Mlotshwa
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 25 December 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Her husband was shot dead on the same day.

name: Mbosha Haim Mlaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu`s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Mamothetsi Flora Peggy Mofokeng
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in her flat in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 16 June 1992, the anniversary of the Soweto uprising. Armed attackers, allegedly IFP supporters, broke into the flat and opened fire. At least six people died in this attack.

name: Kabelo Jan Wilfred Moche
description: An ANC supporter who died in an apparent suicide while in police custody at Mabopane, Bophuthatswana, in January 1991. Mr Moche had allegedly been arrested because of his political activities.

name: Tisha Abion Mlotshwa
description: Was shot dead at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 25 December 1991, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Makosi Mzikayise Mntambo
description: An ANC member who had his car set alight by unidentified persons at Nonzwakazi, De Aar, Cape, on 2 August 1990, allegedly because it was believed the car had been used during the petrol-bombing of the mayor`s parents` home.

name: Makazi Ngenzeni Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 during intense political conflict in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: David Mziwakhe Mkhwanazi
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 February 1993. The perpetrators thought him to be an ANC supporter.

name: Makhosi Annacletta Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Wiseman Siyabonga Mntambo
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked and stabbed to death by other ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 October 1992 in a serious internal dispute and leadership struggle.

name: Elizabeth Mkhwanazi
description: Was stabbed and shot, and her house in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, was destroyed in 1992 during a period of political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Her husband was killed some months later.

name: Muziwabantu Edward Mlaba
description: Was shot dead by unidentified persons in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 29 March 1990 during intense political violence in the area. Mr Mlaba was perceived to be an ANC supporter.

name: Mashashadu Goodman Mofokeng
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters during political conflict at Mtunzini, Natal, on 3 September 1993.

name: Edward Mntungwa
description: An ANC branch chairperson who was shot dead in Zola, Soweto, Transvaal, on 17 May 1992. Mr Mntungwa had also experienced periods of detention under emergency regulations during the 1980s. See police brutality.

name: Mkhuzelwa Knowledge Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten, stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 30 April 1992. He was in a group of people on their way to an ANC self-defence training night camp when they were ambushed and attacked by IFP supporters.

name: Mlindelwa Francis Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ixopo, Natal, on 28 July 1990 in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Mzwakhe Petros Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 April 1991.

name: Nikeziwe Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nosifiso Alois Mngadi
description: He had his house burnt down at Enkonjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 April 1992 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. The house was set alight when a group of people chasing another man thought he had fled into Mr Mngadi`s house.

name: Phyllis Phamamile (Maka-Ayo) Mngadi
description: She had her home vandalised, looted and destroyed by a named IFP supporter at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in January 1992, allegedly because her husband was an ANC supporter.

name: Sibusiso Christopher Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nicholas Mphiwa Mlaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 9 June 1993 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Thamsanqa Ephraim Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembani Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Trueman Angelicus Mngadi
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by a named ANC supporter in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 July 1990 in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Velaphi Dlulephi Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in January 1994.

name: Mhlanguleni G Mngama
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed by IFP supporters in Durban on 13 April 1991.

name: Zandile Grace Mnganga
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1993.

name: Charity Nokuthula Mngenela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 29 October 1990 during intensifying political conflict in the area. Ms Mngenela is permanently paralysed as a result of the shooting.

name: Jabulani Reginald Mngenela
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and killed by IFP supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 22 September 1991 during continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Amos Mngoma
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Mfume, Umkomaas, near Durban, on 19 July 1992 during a violent political confrontation between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bonangani Mngoma
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Cindezile Jabhisile Mngoma
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Faith Thembisile Mngoma
description: An IFP supporter who fled her house in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in early 1994, after being intimidated by IFP supporters because her son was an ANC supporter.

name: Khokhani Mngoma
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Majongosi Mngoma
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mzingelwa Alfeus Mngoma
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombizana Mngoma
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thokozile Florance Mngoma
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Durban on 13 April 1991.

name: Thulisile Gladness Mngoma
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Zibuyisile Mngoma
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Tobile Ezekiel Mngomeni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, destroyed by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Bhekuyise Mngomezulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bhekuyise Mngomezulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Jameson Mbaji Mngomezulu
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters in Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Jameson Mbaji Mngomezulu
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters in Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Jostinah Mngomezulu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 12 December 1993.

name: Juli Mackson Mngomezulu
description: An ANC supporter who had his home and workshop at Empangeni, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Khayelihle Mngomezulu
description: Was shot dead at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 March 1994 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. He and several other people were waiting for a bus when they were killed.

name: Khululiwe Mngomezulu
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mary Mngomezulu
description: An ANCWL member who was shot four times in Natalspruit, Vosloorus, Transvaal, while attending the funeral of civic activist Sam Ntuli on 9 October 1991. Twenty people were killed and 26 injured when unidentified gunmen, allegedly IFP supporters, opened fire on mourners from a minibus. See Ntuli funeral.

name: Mavis Thoko Mngomezulu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Sikhupheni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 12 July 1993.

name: Mfanafuthi Mngomezulu
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Chesterville, Durban, on 28 June 1992. His sister, aged 15, was shot dead in the attack.

name: Susana Maureen Mngomezulu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in July 1992.

name: Tholakele Sylvia Mngomezulu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Welekazi Mngongo
description: She lost her home in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1993.

name: Mthombi Jovuka Mngqusho
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Orlando East, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 8 December 1992.

name: Wantuke Khaya Mngqusho
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Orlando East, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 8 December 1992.

name: Ambrose Khohlangifile Mnguni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters at Kwa-Dlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 21 December 1992. His house had been petrol-bombed by the same perpetrators a month earlier.

name: Cynthia Thembeka Mnguni
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by fellow IFP supporters at Mkhomo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 July 1991. There had been rumours before the incident that the IFP was going to inspect all homes in the area that evening and require each person to produce his or her membership card. Members of the Mnguni family did not have membership cards and were accused of being ANC supporters. They fled the area, and their house was torched.

name: Dorris Cingephi Mnguni
description: She had her home burnt down by IFP supporters at KwaSomopho, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 November 1992, allegedly because Ms Mnguni`s nephew was an ANC supporter. Her husband was shot and burnt to death in the attack.

name: Gqabalazi Mnguni
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and burnt to death by IFP supporters at KwaSomopho, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 November 1992, allegedly because his nephew was an ANC supporter. The family`s home was burnt down in the attack.

name: Jabulani Mbulaleni Mnguni
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned and injured by IFP supporters in Dumbe, Paulpietersburg, Natal, on 22 March 1994 during an IFP protest march in the area.

name: Simon Bhekinkosi Mlotswa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named relative of Chief Minister Ntuli in Siyabuswa, KwaNdebele, on 30 July 1986 when youth celebrating the assassination of the Chief Minister marched on Ntuli`s Bar Lounge to set it alight.

name: Mzivukile Anderson Mlotywa
description: An ANC supporter who was `necklaced` to death by `comrades` in 1985 at Port Elizabeth, allegedly because he was suspected of being a collaborator.

name: Emmanuel Mkhwanazi
description: Was stabbed to death at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 April 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Andries Ramapai Mokhathi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 5 July 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl, during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents. Ten other people were also killed in the attack.

name: Isaac Matshidiso Mokhele
description: Was shot and injured, by a named ANC-aligned self-defence unit member in Sebokeng, Tvl, on 8 December 1993. The Mokhele home was targeted because a police vehicle was standing outside at a time when many police officers in the area had been killed by `comrades`. Mr Mokhele`s brother and his police officer friend were killed in the attack.

name: Mokete Francis Mokhele
description: Was shot dead by ANC-aligned self-defence unit members in Sebokeng, Tvl, on 8 December 1993. The Mokhele home was targeted because a police vehicle was outside at a time when many police officers were targeted by `comrades`. Mr Mokhele`s police officer friend was also killed in the attack.

name: Dutson Lungisa Mokheseng
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in a drive-by shooting in Katlehong, Tvl, on 27 November 1993.

name: Paul Mokhoelwa
description: Was killed by IFP supporters in Mzimhlophe, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 18 August 1990 during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Aaron Mokoena
description: An ANC representative who was killed on 29 March 1994 at a hostel in KwaMashu, Durban, where a peace meeting had been scheduled to resolve differences between KwaMashu residents and hostel-dwellers. Seven ANC delegates, including Mr Mokoena, were abducted from the hostel by IFP supporters. Five were killed, two survived. Four IFP supporters, including the chairperson of the IFP hostel branch in KwaMashu, were convicted for the killings.

name: Jan Mojalefa Mokoena
description: Was injured when a hand grenade was thrown at his shack in Daveyton, Tvl, on 17 September 1991 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Joseph Mokoena
description: Was shot and injured when named IFP supporters opened fire on the minibus in which he was travelling on 15 June 1992 in Evaton, Tvl, during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Julia Mamasole Mokoena
description: She had her home damged in a petrol bomb attack on 14 June 1992 in Sebokeng, Tvl, by ANC supporters who believed her son was an IFP supporter.

name: Mathate David Mokoena
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared on 29 August 1993 in Sebokeng, Tvl, while driving to work. His truck was found but police failed to act on information that his body may have been thrown into a specific dam. The dam was drained and a body found but Mr Mokoena`s wife was never contacted by police. Mr Mokoena was wearing an ANC T-shirt during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the Vaal Triangle.

name: Matthews Mokoena
description: An ANC supporter who was doused with petrol and set alight by a named AWB supporter in Petrus Steyn, OFS, in December 1988, allegedly because of his political sympathies. He died in hospital shortly thereafter.

name: Molahleli Joseph Mokoena
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter in Evaton, Tvl, on 23 June 1993.

name: Piccanin Modiane Mokoena
description: Was shot dead during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents in Sebokeng, Tvl. His body was found near the Sebokeng police station on 17 April 1992.

name: Pitso Mokoena
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 20 June 1992.

name: Enock Mkhwanazi
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death when the house in which he was sleeping was set alight at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 December 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thulani Patrick Mlumbi
description: Was one of six passengers shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Eight other passengers were injured. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Mlandeni Mntungwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 16 August 1991.

name: Mmathabang Alinah Mofokeng
description: Was with his family when their home, in Duduza, Nigel, Tvl, was destroyed by a petrol bomb on 13 November 1993 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Fikile Promise Mkhwanazi
