description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Fikile Promise Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntondo Mofokeng
description: An IFP supporter who had his houses set alight by ANC supporters at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in February 1993.

name: Pule James Mofokeng
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Welkom, OFS, on 6 June 1986 and tortured with electric shocks while in detention. He was detained for four days, allegedly because he was thought to be harbouring an arms cache. Mr Mofokeng was detained again on 15 June 1986 and  was held for five days. He was then hospitalised for a year and remains mentally disabled as a result of torture suffered in detention.

name: Pule James Mofokeng
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Welkom, OFS, on 6 June 1986 and tortured with electric shocks while in detention. He was detained for four days, allegedly because he was thought to be harbouring an arms cache. Mr Mofokeng was detained again on 15 June 1986 and  was held for five days. He was then hospitalised for a year and remains mentally disabled as a result of torture suffered in detention.

name: Sebati Mirriam Mofokeng
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ikgomotseng, Bloemfontein, on 19 June 1993, allegedly because her husband was a policeman.

name: Elijah Mogamatha
description: Was injured when he drove over a landmine at Messina, Tvl, on 25 November 1985. The incident was  part of an ANC landmine campaign aimed at military patrols in the rural areas.

name: Jonas Mogapi
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Tvl, on 29 March 1993. He was returning from a court hearing in which he was a witness in a case involving conflict between ANC and IFP supporters when he was attacked.

name: Keikantsemang Annie Mogapi
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and her house was set alight by named ANC supporters in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Tvl, on 26 July 1992. Her father was stabbed to death and her mother was beaten in the attack.

name: Kabai Mogata
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and tortured by named perpetrators in October 1986 in Siyabuswa, KwaNdebele, during conflict over the proposed independence of KwaNdebele.

name: Takadimane Stephen Mogatshani
description: Was abducted by four youths in Sharpeville, Vereeniging, Tvl, and forced into a taxi heading for Boipatong. His body was found later on a rubbish dump on 18 May 1992. He had been stabbed and had a serious head injury. At the time of the incident the area was tense due to ongoing conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Knox Mogeri
description: Was abducted by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, because he was mistaken for an ANC activist. His body was found with multiple gunshot wounds on 11 March 1992.

name: Vusi Alfred Mogethi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in front of his wife and children, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Tvl, on 11 September 1990.

name: Mamotuku Pauline Mogoai
description: An ANC supporter who had her home damaged when it was torched by `comrades` in Ikageng, Potchefstroom, Tvl, in 1986.

name: Thembeka Ethel Mogohlwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and her body was partially burnt on 23 October 1993 during ongoing political conflict in Katlehong, Tvl.

name: Abram Motshikiri Mogopodi
description: He was originally from Soweto, Johannesburg, but he left for exile in 1976. On 19 April 1990 his family was informed by the ANC that he had died in Angola. His name appears on an ANC list of those who died in an ambush in Angola on 26 December 1983.

name: Abram Motshikiri Mogopodi
description: He was originally from Soweto, Johannesburg, but he left for exile in 1976. On 19 April 1990 his family was informed by the ANC that he had died in Angola. His name appears on an ANC list of those who died in an ambush in Angola on 26 December 1983.

name: Sanyboy Alpheus Mogorosi
description: He had his home burnt down and was shot at by IFP supporters on 12 May 1991 in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Tvl, because he was suspected of harbouring ANC supporters. IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers were retaliating against a previous attack by ANC-supporting squatters. Approximately one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Mlungu Bhekamantungwa Mntungwa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in January 1991.

name: Sipho Lindelinjani Mlaba
description: He had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Bhukhanana,  KwaZulu,  near Empangeni, Natal, on 13 January 1994 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Mr Mlaba was allegedly targeted because his mother was an ANC supporter.

name: Grace Mkhwanazi
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death by ANC supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 23 December 1992.

name: Janet Ndala Mkhwanazi
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack at Empangeni, Natal, on 24 August 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Winiswa Esther Winana Mntwana
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house when it was destroyed by ADM supporters during political conflict at Mlakalala in Zwelitsha, Ciskei, on 13 November 1993.

name: John Muzikayise Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 December 1990.

name: Joseph Mcabango Mkhwanazi
description: Was killed near Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area in 1992.

name: Benedict Modikwa
description: Was shot dead by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at his home in Vosloorus, Tvl, on 8 March 1993. Mr Modikwa was believed to be an informer. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the killing (AC/2001/140).

name: Norman Mmitshane
description: An ANC member who was tortured in detention and sentenced to ten years` imprisonment in Pretoria, in April 1964. At the time, he was an ANC squad commander recruiting youth for military training in Tanzania.

name: Velile Phelelaphi Mnawabe
description: An IFP supporter who had her house destroyed in an attack by ANC supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in March 1991 during ongoing political conflict in the area. She was forced to flee the area.

name: David Khotso Mncedi
description: Was shot dead by members of the `Zim-zims` in Khutsong, Transvaal, on 2 February 1991, allegedly because of his association with the `Gadaffis`. The ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress had split into two rival factions, the `Zim-zims` and the `Gaddaffis`. At least seventeen people were killed in Khutsong between 1989 and 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991.

name: David Khotso Mncedi
description: Was shot dead by members of the `Zim-zims` in Khutsong, Transvaal, on 2 February 1991, allegedly because of his association with the `Gadaffis`. The ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress had split into two rival factions, the `Zim-zims` and the `Gaddaffis`. At least seventeen people were killed in Khutsong between 1989 and 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991.

name: Charles Mncibi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death, and his body was burnt, by a named perpetrator at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 August 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Manyathela Mncibi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at KwaDweshula, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 27 November 1992.

name: Abednego Mncube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in an attack on his home at Mahlabatini, near Ulundi, KwaZulu/Natal, on 23 December 1991.

name: Mpheni Emmanuel Mncube
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack in May 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Muzikayise Nicholas Mncube
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Ntelezi Mncube
description: Was killed when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217).

name: Sibongile Nomavangeli Mncube
description: She had her house and possessions destroyed in an arson attack in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, during February 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Matata Gremma Mnculwane
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in June 1992 in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal.

name: Betty Bhekisile Mncwabe
description: She had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 November 1992 during ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Her daughter was shot dead in the attack, one grandaughter, aged 6, was burnt, and another shot and severely injured.

name: Bhekani Mncwabe
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 28 March 1991. Mr Mncwabe was allegedly targeted because his sons were ANC supporters. His brother was killed in the same attack.

name: Clementina Badidile Mncwabe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 April 1991.

name: Delisile Witness Mncwabe
description: Was killed during attacks by IFP supporters on ANC-supporting families at Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks.

name: Fana Mncwabe
description: Was stabbed and shot dead by ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 28 March 1991. Mr Mncwabe was allegedly targeted because his nephews were ANC supporters. His brother was killed in the same attack.

name: Kwenza Ephraim Mncwabe
description: An IFP supporter who had his house destroyed in a petrol bomb attack by ANC supporters at Polela, Bulwer, Natal, on 19 March 1992.

name: Bambaliphi Mncwango
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Hlengiwe Mncwango
description: Was shot dead when IFP supporters from Ndabayakhe opened fire on ANC supporters attending a cultural ceremony at Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 November 1993. Eight people believed to be ANC supporters were killed. Two were children.

name: Ntombi Mncwango
description: Was shot dead on 28 November 1993 when IFP supporters from Ndabayakhe opened fire on ANC supporters attending a cultural ceremony at Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Eight people believed to be ANC supporters were killed. Two were children.

name: Tholake Vothu Mncwango
description: Was raped and her home was burnt down by unidentified persons on 22 August 1993 in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thembuyise Simon Mndawe
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and later found hanged while in the custody of named members of the Special Branch in Nelspruit, Transvaal, in March 1983.

name: Babhekile Rejoice Mndaweni
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Fikile Rejoice Mndaweni
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Zeblon Mzikaifani Mndaweni
description: An IFP supporter who died on 9 September 1993 after being shot by ANC supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal.

name: Walter Mali Mndithi
description: An ANC supporter who survived a shooting in Johannesburg, in September 1991 by named IFP supporters. At the time, Mr Mndithi worked at Egoli Breweries along with the perpetrators. He was on his way home when armed men stopped the taxi they were in and opened fire. Three people were killed in the incident.

name: Nonhlanhla Thandani Mnembe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Anton Mfaulo Mngadi
description: Was shot dead in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Busisiwe Mavis Mngadi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Busisiwe Thembisile Mngadi
description: An IFP supporter who was assaulted by ANC supporters in Engotsheni, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 25 December 1990.

name: Herman Mngadi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by an ANC supporter at KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 31 August 1990.

name: Joseph Ngemane Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 17 November 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nomvuyiso Mlakalaka
description: She had her house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack in March 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Kateleni Irene Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC member who was arrested in 1963 for mobilising people against the Pass Laws and sentenced to eight years` imprisonment. In February 1986, Ms Mkhwanazi was detained by named police members in Piet Retief, Transvaal. She was burnt with a cigarette, assaulted, suffocated and beaten on her knee with a rifle butt. Ms Mkhwanazi also claims she was shot in the knee.

name: Mazaba Mirriet Mnyaka
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaSokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in August 1992.

name: Absolom Mnyakeni
description: Was one of four people abducted from home and severely assaulted with sjamboks  and iron bars by a large crowd of ANC supporters at a sports stadium in Daveyton, Tvl, on 21 March 1992. Mr Mnyakeni and another victim were then burnt to death as they were suspected of collaborating with police. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/048).

name: Andries Lekgowe Modisangane
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Swanieville, Krugersdorp, Tvl, on 12 May 1991. IFP-supporting hostel inmates were retaliating against a previous attack by ANC-supporting squatters and approximately one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt.

name: Mogogwane Dinah Modise
description: She had her home burnt down by ANC supporters in Maboloko, near Brits, Bophuthatswana, during 1975 because of her support for Chief Solomon.

name: Rejoice Modise
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed with a panga in April 1988 in Lekubu, Bophuthatswana, when named members of the Bophuthatswana Democratic Party attacked the funeral of a community leader. Residents were targeted by supporters of President Mangope and the apartheid regime because they resisted the area`s proposed incorporation into Bophuthatswana.

name: Sophia Baratang Modutwane
description: Was severely burnt on her left leg when her home was petrol-bombed by ANC supporters in Kagiso, Tvl, on 13 March 1986. Her home was targeted because her husband was a policeman.

name: Tukunana John Moeketsi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in 1985 in Khayamnandi, Steynsburg, Cape during political conflict over the Black Local Authority.

name: Sengadi Lucas Moepi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed when he was stabbed and shot and his car was burnt by IFP supporters in Zonkizizwe, an IFP-aligned infomal settlement near Katlehong, Tvl, on 7 July 1993. Zonkizizwe was one of many informal settlements that became politically aligned in the early 1990s, resulting in violent political conflict between rival political parties.

name: Mika Bennet Moeti
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and assaulted during interrogations at various police stations in Mmabatho, Bophuthatswana, between 1990 and 1992.

name: Moliat Mofeketa
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and assaulted in police custody between Bophutha-tswana and Botswana, on 26 February 1988. He was also detained several times in Groot Marico police station, Zeerust, where police interrogated and tortured him.

name: Aaron Mofokeng
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned and burnt to death by named perpetrators on 22 November 1990 in Sebokeng, Tvl, during intense political conflict in the area.

name: David Mofokeng
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 1 January 1992 in Alexandra, Johannesburg, by a named IFP supporter.

name: Elizabeth Mofokeng
description: Was severely injured during an organised attack by several hundred IFP supporting residents of the KwaMadala Hostel, on the Boipatong community, near Vanderbijlpark, Transvaal, during a period of escalating violence between the ANC/IFP in the area. This attack became known as the Boipatong massacre, which left forty five people dead and twenty seven seriously injured. Sixteen perpetrators applied for amnesty for these atrocities of which thirteen were granted and three were refused (AC/2000/209).

name: Freddie Mofokeng
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by named right-wingers in Ermelo, Transvaal, in October 1990.

name: Gabali Mlambo
description: He had his house burnt down in Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 21 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Gabali Mlambo
description: He had his house burnt down in Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 21 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Lebohang Emanuel Mohloboli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters in April 1993 in Bekkersdal, near Westonaria, Tvl.

name: Smangele Nomsa Mohlokoane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at the Jeppe Street taxi rank, Johannesburg, on 6 September 1990. At the time IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers attacked residents assuming that they all supported the ANC. Four other people died in this attack.

name: Nompumelelo Mohlokwano
description: She lost her home in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1993, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Motlalepule Martha Gomyame Mohohlo
description: An ANC supporter who was detained from her home at night during the state of emergency, in Sasolburg, OFS, on 22 December 1988. She was tortured in detention. See police brutality.

name: Dokotela James Moholing
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead at Bergville, Natal, on 27 February 1994 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Pontsho Samuel Mojalefa
description: A member of the South African National Civic Association (SANCO) who was shot and injured by a named perpetrator, a chief, at Botha`s Hoek, near Burgersfort, Tvl, on 3 April 1993. Mr Mojalefa was shot after an argument broke out between the SANCO executive and the chief.

name: Bethuel Tlou Mojela
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten with AK47s and seriously injured, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Tokoza, Tvl, on 9 March 1991. The perpetrators accused him of hiding weapons for the ANC in his house. Some of the perpetrators were allegedly dressed in police uniforms.

name: Jacob Mokaleng
description: Was shot dead by a named IFP supporter on 23 June 1993 in Evaton, Tvl, during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Randolf Malefetsane Mokate
description: A policeman who was shot dead by an ANC supporter while on duty in Soweto, on 17 December 1992. The attack took place when increasing numbers of policemen were being killed.

name: M Mokeseng
description: Was injured and suffered damage to property during an organised attack by several hundred IFP supporting residents of the KwaMadala Hostel, on the Boipatong community, near Vanderbijlpark, Tvl, during a period of escalating violence between the ANC/IFP in the area. This attack became known as the Boipatong massacre, which left 45 persons dead and 27 seriously injured. Sixteen perpetrators applied for amnesty for these atrocities of which 13 were granted and three were refused (AC/2000/209)

name: Motsamai Jacob Mokgabi
description: An ANC activist who was arrested on 17 June 1986 and taken to Lebeleng municipal office in Makwassie, Tvl, where he was severely beaten by a named perpetrator for toyi-toying with friends in commemoration of the 1976 Soweto uprising. He was charged with public violence and received a five-year suspended sentence.

name: Glad Mokgathle
description: The chairman of the Bafokeng Tribal Council who was severely assaulted and stabbed to death by members of the ANC-supporting Action Committee of the Bafokeng people, in Bafokeng, Bophuthatswana, on 29 September 1990. Two Action Committee members were granted amnesty for the killing (AC/1996/0001).

name: Gcinokuhle Mlambo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Boshi, near Estcourt, Natal, on 27 September 1993.

name: Molefe Mnyamana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Molefe Mnyamana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Luke Govan Mlambo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP members when they attacked his house at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 January 1993. Four perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Mtunzi Jeffrey Mkhwanazi
description: Was shot and injured at Eshowe, Natal, on 8 January 1993 in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His father and seven-year-old sister were shot dead in the same attack.

name: Nkosana Nowinile Mnyamezeli
description: Was shot from a police helicopter on 9 May 1991 in Tembisa, Tvl, during a period of intense conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Mziwefa Bethwell Mkhwanazi
description: He had his houses in KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, burnt down during November 1993, when IFP supporters carried out several attacks on ANC supporters in the KwaKhoza and Nogobhoza areas. One person was killed and more than 45 homes burnt down, allegedly under the direction of the local IFP-supporting chief, who wished to purge the area of ANC supporters.

name: Mgigiyeni Mlambo
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Ncebo Mkhwanazi
description: Was shot and injured at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 February 1993 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Two people were shot dead in the attack.

name: Ndani Mkhwanazi
description: She had her house at Empangeni, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack on 24 August 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Frans Mohlamme
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from a tavern, together with another ANC supporter, by members of the Three Million Gang in Kroonstad, Orange Free State (OFS), on 27 October 1990. The Three Million gang took Mr Mohlamme and his companion to Troubou, where they assaulted and stabbed them. Mr Mohlamme escaped, but his companion was killed.

name: Nolwazi Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 2 August 1992 when men wearing balaclavas and armed with KZP pump-action shotguns carried out several attacks on homes in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. At least 11 people were killed and three were injured in the incident, which was thought to have been the work of the Esikhawini hit squad.

name: Nombulelo Freida Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by other ANC supporters at her home in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 April 1994, allegedly because her husband attended their IFP-aligned neighbour`s funeral.

name: Princess Lindiwe Mkhwanazi
description: She had her house burnt down at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 December 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Her parents-in-law were both burnt to death in the attack.

name: Qhikiza Joyce Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 March 1992.

name: Sam Simon Mkhwanazi
description: He lost his right eye and sustained serious injuries to his head and leg when he drove a tractor over a landmine on Vlakfontein farm, Breyten, Transvaal, on 21 April 1986. The ANC had launched a landmine campaign aimed at military patrols in rural areas but it was subsequently called off in the light of the high civilian casualty rate.

name: Sbonelo Mkhwanazi
description: Was shot at Empangeni, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters following the April 1994 elections. He was paralysed as a result of the attack.

name: Sindisiwe Reginah Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sipho Bhekinkosi Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 10 March 1993 in intense political conflict in the area. At least 18 people were killed in political violence in Bhambayi that month. Seventy-five homes were burnt down.

name: Thamsanqa Knowledge Mkhwanazi
description: Was shot dead at Emhlathuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 20 November 1992 during intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thokozile Priscilla Mkhwanazi
description: She ad her house at Ntuzuma, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in March 1994 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thokozile Priscilla Mkhwanazi
description: She ad her house at Ntuzuma, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in March 1994 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Tholi Francisca Mkhwanazi
description: She had her house at Eshowe, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack in 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Velenkosini Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when eight armed IFP men stormed his home at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 February 1994.

name: Vincent Mkhwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who was targeted for elimination by IFP members at Hlanganani Hall, Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during 1992. One perpetrator in the conspiracy was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Bajabulisile Beatrice Mkhwane
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 10 December 1990, in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mhlabushitshile Joseph Mkhwani
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Ixopo, Natal, on 8 March 1992.

name: Bongani Mkize
description: An IFP supporter who was severely assaulted by named fellow IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 15 April 1991. They believed him to be sympathetic to the ANC.

name: Fikile Mary-Jane Mkize
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Estcourt, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in September 1993.

name: John Mkize
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted and then shot dead by IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in December 1991.

name: Khumbulani Cyprian Mkize
description: Was shot dead in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 8 November 1991 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nokuhlupeka Mkize
description: She had her house at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, destroyed in an arson attack on 6 April 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nyosi Mkize
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Chibini, Richmond, Natal, on 29 November 1991 during ongoing political conflict in the area. Two of his brothers were also killed in the course of political conflict.

name: Piet Mkize
description: Was shot dead at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 April 1992, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thulani Pani Mkize
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 5 April 1991.

name: Thulasizwe Cyprian Mkize
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured by named ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 3 May 1992.

name: Thulebona Mkize
description: An IFP supporter who was injured when ANC supporters threw explosives and fired shots into his house at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 August 1992. Three people were killed and four seriously injured in the attack.

name: William M Mkize
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 14 April 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Zipate Mkize
description: He had his house at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in September 1991 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Goodman Magenqe Mkonde
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by Amasinyora vigilantes at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 April 1993.

name: Ntofana Elger Mkonyeni
description: She had her home in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down on 16 March 1994 in intensified violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomsibi Elizabeth Mkuusi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Daveyton, Transvaal, petrol-bombed in 1991 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Aslina Mkwanazi
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 February 1994. Her son, an ANC supporter, was shot dead in the attack.

name: Bonginkosi Lucky Mkwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters at Thafamasi School, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His brother was also killed in the attack.

name: Bonginkosi Lucky Mkwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters at Thafamasi School, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His brother was also killed in the attack.

name: Tenjiwe Evelyn Mkwanazi
description: An ANC supporter who was injured when shots were fired at her as she was trying to escape an attack on her home at Mpumuza, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1987. Her home was subsequently destroyed in an arson attack on 27 March 1990 during the seven-day war.

name: Albert Mlaba
description: He suffered damage to his home when it was set alight by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Transvaal, during October 1993. Mr Mlaba was suspected of being an IFP member. Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0186 and AC/2001/060).

name: Buti George Mlaba
description: Was shot and wounded by security guards while playing soccer at the Somhlolo grounds in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 17 March 1993. Two others were injured in the same incident, which occurred during heightened tension in the area between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Dingizwe Absalom Mlaba
description: He had his home at Mtunzini, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 1 January 1993, allegedly because his son was an ANC supporter.

name: Mkulekeleni Mlambo
description: An IFP supporter who had his eight huts at Empangeni, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by named ANC supporters on 4 August 1992.

name: Phiwayinkosi Mlambo
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by ANC supporters at KwaSokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 4 August 1992.

name: John Pipana Mlangeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Greytown, Natal, on 6 November 1990.

name: Mphikeleli Sidney Mlangeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 3 November 1991, allegedly by residents of Buyafuthi hostel in Katlehong, Transvaal, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Themba Mlangeni
description: Was shot dead by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) during political conflict between the Black Cats and ANC supporters in Ethandakukhanya, Piet Retief, Transvaal, in 1992. The SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/98/0121).

name: Mxolisi Mlenzana
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested on 1 September 1985 at Kirkwood, Cape. He was convicted of a `necklacing` killing during political conflict in Burgersdorp and sentenced to 18 years` imprisonment.

name: Themba Reginald Mlitwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Nkwezela, Bulwer, Natal, on 10 January 1993.

name: Bernard Sizathu Mlomo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and hacked to death on 3 December 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Bhekinkosi Mlondo
description: Was shot dead on 27 August 1992 at Ndabayakhe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bokwe Mlondo
description: He lost his house in an arson attack at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 June 1993 in continuing political violence between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Khethokwakhe Mlondo
description: Was shot and injured at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 7 July 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mbekeni Benson Mlondo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and hacked to death at Empangeni, Natal, on 2 February 1993, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Njengabantu Christian Mlondo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 27 January 1993.

name: Ntondo Wilfred Mlondo
description: He had his home burnt down by IFP supporters at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 April 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His son, an ANC supporter, was abducted and stabbed to death by IFP supporters on the same day.

name: Sibonginkosi Khulekani Mlondo
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, 17 April 1992 in continuing political violence in the area. His father`s house was burnt down by IFP supporters on the same day.

name: Zihlathi Mlondo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in December 1993.

name: Mali Mlongo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 26 April 1993.

name: Billy Rammington Mlotshwa
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 29 March 1993.

name: Prince Zamukuthula Mlotshwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter at Lamontville, Durban, on 27 February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Prince Zamukuthula Mlotshwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter at Lamontville, Durban, on 27 February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: (The Family) Mnyandu
description: They had their home burnt down at Umlazi, Durban, on 14 September 1991, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Bajingile Mnyandu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bheki Bernard Mnyandu
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down by ANC supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1993.

name: Cijimpi Mnyandu
description: An ANC supporter who was banished from his home in Umbumbulu, Natal, to a game reserve in the Sibasa area, Tvl, in 1959 because he was accused of being a political activist. He died there in 1964.

name: Fanile Lennox Mnyandu
description: An ANC supporter and an employee of a private company who was killed by IFP supporters while distributing IEC pamphlets in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 April 1994. Seven colleagues were killed with him. One IFP member was convicted for the attack. See Ndwedwe election attack.

name: Fikakubuswa Mnyandu
description: Was run over and killed by a vehicle on Umlazi Road, Durban, on 19 September 1991 during a period of intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. The perpetrators had allegedly burnt down the family home two days earlier.

name: Fikile D Mnyandu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Gloria Zondeleni Mnyandu
description: Was severely beaten by named perpetrators who also attacked and burnt down her home in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 14 December 1990 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her husband and son were shot in the attack.

name: Herman Mnyandu
description: Was shot by named perpetrators who also attacked and burnt down his house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 14 December 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Lungi Mnyandu
description: Was sexually assaulted by named ANC supporters in Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 May 1992. The perpetrators accused her family of belonging to the IFP.

name: Madoda Mnyandu
description: Was shot dead in Umlazi, Durban, on 3 September 1991 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. He was allegedly killed because his family lived between IFP and ANC zones, and both sides demanded their affiliation.

name: Mphikiswa John Mnyandu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 April 1993.

name: Mpumelele Mnyandu
description: Was severely beaten by named perpetrators who also attacked and burnt down his house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 14 December 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Myekeni Simon Mnyandu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 17 July 1993.

name: Ntombi Rose Mnyandu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, destroyed in an arson attack on 30 September 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ntonto Ntozini Mnyandu
description: An ANC supporter who narrowly survived when IFP supporters threw a petrol bomb into her hut in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 April 1992.

name: Sabeni Zondeni Mnyandu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sibusiso Mnyandu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban on 12 April 1993.

name: Siphiwe Mnyandu
description: Was stabbed and injured by ANC supporters during political conflict at Empangeni, Natal, on 17 May 1992.

name: Thandi Nomthandazo Mnyandu
description: She had her house burnt down by named ANC supporters in Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 May 1992. The family was allegedly accused of supporting the IFP. Her daughter, aged 11, was raped and her son, aged 12, stabbed and injured in the attack.

name: Thembinkosi Mnyandu
description: Was shot and injured in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Mtunzini, Natal, on 3 April 1994, three weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembinkosi Mnyandu
description: Was shot and injured in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Mtunzini, Natal, on 3 April 1994, three weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Thulani Mnyandu
description: Was shot dead in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Mtunzini, Natal, on 3 April 1994, three weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Thulani Mnyandu
description: Was shot dead in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Mtunzini, Natal, on 3 April 1994, three weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Victor Mandlakhe Mnyandu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 17 August 1993.

name: Dade Margaret Mnyango
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 4 February 1992.

name: Sibongile Mnyango
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack at Empangeni, Natal, on 27 October 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Amos Mandla Mnyiwambe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in a shebeen in Vosloorus, Tvl, on 16 June 1992, the anniversary of the Soweto uprising, allegedly by IFP supporters. Seven people died in the attack and the shebeen-owner lost an eye.

name: Ndiko John Mnyute
description: An ANC underground member who was injured and had five vehicles destroyed when other ANC members threw a hand grenade at his home in Mdantsane, Ciskei, on 29 March 1990, allegedly because he was suspected of being a sell-out during a dispute between rival ANC-aligned youth organisations.

name: Jeremiah Ntsitsi Moatshe
description: Was assaulted with a brick by a member of the Makabasa gang on 17 April 1986 in Alexandra, Johannesburg. The gang was allegedly working with the police to attack ANC-supporting families in the area.

name: Mohlahluoa Phineas Motete
description: A member of the Moakeng Crisis Committee who had his shop burnt down by a breakaway group of dissident ANC members in Maokeng, Kroonstad, OFS, in 1990. Later his store was again attacked and shots were fired at him by members of the Three Million gang.

name: David Motse
description: An ANC member who was shot dead on 7 August 1992 in Vosloorus, Tvl, allegedly by a named local councillor reputedly linked to the IFP. In 1991, Mr Motse`s mother`s home was petrol-bombed, allegedly by the same perpetrator.

name: Musa Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 June 1993, when he and other members of his family returned to the area because his grandfather`s grave had been desecrated. The Mpanza family had fled from the area after they were attacked and threatened in December 1990. Mr Mpanza`s cousin was also shot dead in the 1993 attack.

name: Musa Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 June 1993, when he and other members of his family returned to the area because his grandfather`s grave had been desecrated. The Mpanza family had fled from the area after they were attacked and threatened in December 1990. Mr Mpanza`s cousin was also shot dead in the 1993 attack.

name: Mantshepiseng Sefora Monareng
description: A Dikwankwetla National Party (DNP) supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Witsieshoek, QwaQwa, on 3 June 1994. DNP members were frequently attacked in this period, allegedly because of the party`s support for the QwaQwa homeland administration.

name: Nsukwana Wilberforce Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Engonyameni, near Umlazi, Durban, on 22 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His house was burnt down by IFP supporters on the same day.

name: Nsukwana Wilberforce Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Engonyameni, near Umlazi, Durban, on 22 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His house was burnt down by IFP supporters on the same day.

name: Piet Makgobathe Mothapo
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted and stoned by named members of the Big Five vigilante group near Pietersburg, Tvl, on 11 October 1992.

name: Frans Monawa Mothoa
description: Was killed in a bomb blast in Roodepoort, Tvl, on 3 June 1988. In a submission to the TRC, the ANC claimed responsibility for the blast explaining that the original target was a nearby police station and not civilians. Five people were killed in the blast.

name: Patricia Mothswene
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was assaulted and shot dead by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Vosloorus, Tvl, on 16 April 1994. Her friend was shot and wounded in the same attack. The SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/1998/0079).

name: (First Name Not Given) Motiane
description: Was shot and injured in the leg by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Mzimhlope, Soweto, Johannesburg, in 1992, after being accused by residents of disruptive behaviour. One SDU member was refused amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/0317).

name: Taylor Malupe Motlatsi
description: An ANC supporter who was detained, severely beaten and tortured by members of the security forces while in custody in Paarl, Cape, during 1960. He later fled the country to Lesotho.

name: Mamaseli M Motleng
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters before the April 1994 elections.

name: Mamaseli M Motleng
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters before the April 1994 elections.

name: Solomon Ramasale Motlohi
description: A rent collector who died after being severely beaten by ANC supporters in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, on 1 August 1988. The incident took place during a rent boycott. Mr Motlohi was allegedly targeted because he encouraged people to pay rent at street committee meetings.

name: Gerald Meshack Motloung
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 10 December 1992.

name: Lydia Mmatieho Motloung
description: Was burnt to death in 1992 in Sharpeville, Vereeniging, Tvl, by `comrades` because of her relationship with an IFP supporter. Sharpeville was one of many townships embroiled in conflict beween IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Makereke Motloung
description: She had her home and business burnt down by ANC supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Makereke Motloung
description: She had her home and business burnt down by ANC supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mamafudi Sauslina Motloung
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters before the April 1994 elections.

name: Mamafudi Sauslina Motloung
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters before the April 1994 elections.

name: Nkhyelema Elizabeth Motloung
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nkhyelema Elizabeth Motloung
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Phillimon Motloung
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe`s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Victoria Penelope Motloung
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Tokoza, Tvl, on 20 May 1992 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Daniel Motsamai Motoai
description: Was shot dead on 24 May 1991 in Pimville, Soweto, Johannesburg, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Gerald Mnyamana Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Emkhonjeni, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 8 November 1992. On the night of Mr Molefe`s killing, five huts were set alight, stock was stolen and property damaged.

name: Octavia Duduzile Mpanza
description: She had her home destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Umlazi, Durban, on 22 February 1994. She was allegedly targeted because her husband was an ANC supporter.

name: Petros Zakhele Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 24 October 1992.

name: Henry Tseko Molefe
description: Was attacked by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 29 October 1990 during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting township residents.

name: Sonnyboy Mokoena
description: Was attacked at his home in Tweefontein, KwaNdebele, on 7 June 1986. `Comrades` attacked the family, killing Mr Mokoena`s father and destroying their home after accusing the victim`s father of informing on the ANC.

name: Goodwill Linda Motsepe
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 4 August 1992 in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Tvl, at a funeral of ANC supporters killed during a labour dispute between striking COSATU-aligned FAWU workers and non-striking IFP-aligned UWUSA workers. A local IFP leader, brandishing a sjambok  , emerged from the hostel followed by 300 armed hostel-dwellers to attack mourners. Three people were killed and several others were injured.

name: Victor Thabo Molewa
description: An ANC peace worker who was shot dead while on his way to officiate at a civic meeting in Tokoza, Tvl, allegedly by IFP supporters. On 11 December 1993, his body was found near a hostel in Mngadi Section, Katlehong, Tvl.

name: Herbet Molefe
description: Was shot dead in Dobsonville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 13 March 1992 by IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers from the Simphiwe hostel during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Two people died and two others were injured in the attack.

name: Pebetse Moshoeshoe
description: An ANC member who was injured in her left hip and knee after ANC-aligned self-defence unit members in Katlehong, Tvl, attacked her on 28 April 1992 during internal political conflict. The attackers then proceeded to her home which they ransacked.

name: Mantahle Junia Mpongo
description: Was shot by members of the `Zim-zims` on 15 December 1990 in Khutsong, Carletonville, Tvl, while attending a night vigil for a `comrade`. The ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress had split into two rival factions, the `Zim-zims` and the `Gaddaffis`. At least 17 people were killed in violence between the factions in Khutsong from 1989 to 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991.

name: Mantahle Junia Mpongo
description: Was shot by members of the `Zim-zims` on 15 December 1990 in Khutsong, Carletonville, Tvl, while attending a night vigil for a `comrade`. The ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress had split into two rival factions, the `Zim-zims` and the `Gaddaffis`. At least 17 people were killed in violence between the factions in Khutsong from 1989 to 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991.

name: Richard Mpanza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Tvl, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Sibongile Mpanza
description: She had her house petrol-bombed and burnt down in political violence at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 July 1992. Four people died and ten houses were burnt down in the fighting between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: M Mpongose
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Salmon Monalane Motshepe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by members of the Three Million gang at Koe-Koe Village, Kroonstad, OFS, on 10 October 1993.

name: Sibosiso Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Nyoni, KwaZulu, near Gingindlovu, Natal, in May 1992.

name: Sihle Makhapheni Mpanza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by an ANC security aide in Empangeni, Natal, who opened fire on people taking down ANC posters near the ANC offices on 22 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The former ANC security aide was granted amnesty (AC/1998/0111).

name: Sihle Makhapheni Mpanza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by an ANC security aide in Empangeni, Natal, who opened fire on people taking down ANC posters near the ANC offices on 22 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The former ANC security aide was granted amnesty (AC/1998/0111).

name: Jele Jerry Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by an IFP supporter in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 8 November 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Phineas Moncho
description: Was stabbed to death by an ANC member in Postmasburg, Cape, on 30 May 1992. Mr Moncho was allegedly targeted because he was believed to be a member of the Eagles club. The ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0311).

name: Sizani Christinah Mpanza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured and had her house burnt down by unidentified attackers in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, on 19 August 1992, in ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her husband was shot dead, and her son was shot and injured in the attack.

name: Sipiwe Mponze
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named perpetrators on 13 July 1991 in Berlin, Cape.

name: Sizani Marry Mpanza
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 12 March 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Kerileng Flora Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by alleged IFP supporters in Lekubu, Bophuthatswana, on 5 January 1991.

name: Nozatu Eleanor Mondi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992 in intense political conflict in the area. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Elias Mathope Motsoaledi
description: An ANC member who was arrested and detained in June 1964 in Johannes-burg, for actively resisting the apartheid state during a clampdown on all black political organisations. He was one of the Rivonia trialists and, after being charged with treason, was sentenced to life imprisonment on Robben Island. He served 27 years and was released after the unbanning of the liberation movements and the release of political prisoners.

name: Bikinyana David Motsoeneng
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters on 15 May 1992 in Sebokeng, Tvl, during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Emma Motsoeneng
description: She had her home destroyed by IFP supporters on 8 September 1991 in Mofolo, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. The IFP supporters were on their way back from a rally at Jabulani stadium when the attack took place. Four women in the household were killed.

name: Esther Motsoeneng
description: Was stabbed and injured on 8 September 1991 in Mofolo, Soweto, Johannes-burg, during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. The IFP supporters were on their way back from  a rally at Jabulani stadium when the attack took place. Three members of Esther`s family were killed in this attack.

name: Jeanette Maletsatsi Motsoeneng
description: Was shot and stabbed to death on 8 September 1991 in Mofolo, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. The IFP supporters were on their way back from a rally at Jabulani stadium when the attack took place. Three members of Ms Motsoening`s family were killed in this attack.

name: Joyce Motsoeneng
description: Was shot and stabbed to death on 8 September 1991 in Mofolo, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. The IFP supporters were on their way back from a rally at Jabulani stadium when the attack took place. Three members of Ms Motsoening`s family were killed in this attack.

name: Sello Motsoeneng
description: Was shot by ANC-aligned self-defence unit (SDU) members and died as a result of his injuries on 30 May 1991 in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Tvl. The alleged perpetrator did not abide by the SDU code of conduct.

name: Virginia Motsoeneng
description: Was shot and stabbed to death on 8 September 1991 in Mofolo, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. The IFP supporters were on their way back from a rally at Jabulani stadium when the attack took place. Three members of Ms Motsoening`s family were killed in this attack.

name: Eunice Motswana
description: Was killed by IFP supporters on 8 September 1990 in Soweto, Johannesburg, during a raid on the ANC-aligned Tladi squatter camp. Three other members of her family died in the attack.

name: Margaret Mapule Motswana
description: Was killed by IFP supporters on 8 September 1990 in Soweto, Johannes-burg, during a raid on the ANC-aligned Tladi squatter camp. Three other members of her family died in attack.

name: Phillis Motswana
description: Was killed by IFP supporters on 8 September 1990 in Soweto, Johannesburg, during a raid on the ANC-aligned Tladi squatter camp. Three other members of her family died in attack.

name: Queen Motswana
description: Was killed by IFP supporters on 8 September 1990 in Soweto, Johannesburg, during a raid on the ANC-aligned Tladi squatter camp. Three other members of her family died in attack.

name: Daisy Nolesson Moyake
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP-aligned Toaster gang members in Tembisa, Tvl, on 9 March 1992. Tembisa was embroiled in political conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Sanangele Getrude Moyana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Sebokeng, Tvl, on 12 July 1993 in a spate of drive-by shootings that killed 14 people.

name: Thembani Moyeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by ADM supporters during political conflict in Peddie, Ciskei, on 9 January 1994.

name: Diyan Moyise
description: An ANC member who was arrested, interrogated and assaulted by fellow ANC members near Lusaka, Zambia, during 1979 to 1982. One ANC member, who later became an askari, was granted amnesty (AC/2000/228).

name: Khanyiswa Mpambane
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992 in intense political conflict in the area. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Maphelo Mpange
description: An ANC activist who was shot dead by unidentified perpetrators in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 25 September 1993.

name: Mahlangulisile Sellina Mpangela
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Sokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1992, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bekapi Netha Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack in Ensimbini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in February 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bekapi Netha Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack in Ensimbini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in February 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dingamandla Aloes Mpanza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 15 January 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dingamandla Aloes Mpanza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 15 January 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Joseph Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 February 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Kwenzokwabo Hezekial Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Jozini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1992.

name: Madoda Mpanza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by unidentified persons who attacked his home in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 19 August 1992, allegedly because one of his sons was an ANC supporter. His wife and son were shot and injured in the attack. The Mpanzas` home and crops were also destroyed by fire.

name: Mpumelelo Mpanza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when his home was attacked by other IFP supporters in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 19 August 1992, allegedly because a member of his family supported the ANC.

name: Thabo Andries (Aka `Samuel Ngaka`) Mokoena
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and killed by members of the EAGLES CLUB in Mamafubedu, Petrus Steyn, OFS, in 1991, allegedly because he discouraged youths from joining the club.

name: Limakatso Virginia Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who had her homestead burnt down by IFP supporters on 8 November 1992 in Emkhonjane, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal.

name: Dumisani Mondo
description: An ANC supporter was shot dead by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 26 May 1992.

name: Thulani Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 June 1993.

name: Lolo Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe`s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Vikangani Evelina Mpanza
description: She had her two houses and her possessions destroyed in an arson attack in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in August 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Molefe Abel Monegi
description: An ANC supporter who was knocked down and deliberately driven over by a police vehicle in Ga-Rankuwa, Bophuthatswana, on 7 February 1990. Mr Molefe was participating in a protest march in the former Bophuthatswana homeland.

name: Vumile Gladys Mpanza
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in KwaSithebe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 December 1993.

name: Mbango Samuel Amos Mpapane
description: Was chased, captured and necklaced to death by a group of ANC supporters in Mbuzini trust, Tvl, on 17 June 1986. One ANC supporter, who had received some military training from the ANC, was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0338).

name: Monde Mpateni
description: Was abducted and interrogated by ANC security personnel near Lobatse, Botswana, on 18 July 1981, because he and his colleague were suspected of having become police informers. Mr Mpateni allegedly produced a firearm, and was shot and killed while travelling in a vehicle with his captors. His body was set alight. Two ANC security members were granted amnesty (AC/2000/236).

name: Vusumuzi Mpele
description: An IFP supporter who died from injuries sustained in an attack by ANC supporters in Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 17 July 1993.

name: Jacob Mpemba
description: An ANC member who was detained and tortured in Paarl and Worcester, Cape, in 1961. He was later forced to go into exile.

name: Tshinakaho Sophie Mpfuni
description: She had her home damaged in an arson attack by named ANC supporters who accused her of witchcraft in Thohoyandou, Venda, on 25 April 1973.

name: Leonard Mphaki
description: An ANC member who was severely injured in August 1976 in a drive-by shooting in Dube, Soweto, Johannesburg, in the wake of the Soweto uprising.

name: Bukiswa Mphambane
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992 in intense political conflict in the area. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Nohambile Mphambani
description: An ADM member who died on 27 April 1993 after she had been severely assaulted with stones, knives and sticks, by a group of about three hundred youth as she was fleeing from her home in Gobozani, Mdantsane, Ciskei. Seven members of the ANC Youth League were granted amnesty for the incident (AC/97/0020).

name: Samuel Bafana Mphuthi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed on 4 October 1992 in Katlehong, Tvl, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Mokhethi Mpiko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot on 28 February 1986 at a taxi rank in Khuma, Stilfontein, Tvl, by a named perpetrator who opened fire on mourners on their way to a funeral of youths shot by police.

name: Samkela Mpind
description: Was shot and severely injured in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 1 November 1993 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Ten Vincent Mpisane
description: An IFP supporter who was beaten, stabbed and strangled to death by named ANC supporters in Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 December 1993.

name: Thembisile Princess Mpisane
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by named ANC supporters in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, on 28 January 1994 in intense political conflict in the area. She was found naked with her skull crushed and stabwounds all over her body. Her husband had been killed in political violence a fortnight earlier.

name: Lincon Sihle Mpisi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot, sustaining severe injuries, by members of an ANC self-defence unit at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 April 1993, allegedly during an internal feud.

name: Sipho Cyprian Mpisi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 1 February 1992.

name: Joseph Mpofu
description: An ANC member who was sentenced to ten years` imprisonment on Robben Island, Cape Town, in 1965, for his political activities. After his release from prison, he was deported to Zimbabwe, where he died.

name: Majalefa Aaron `Mighty` Mpohohle
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by members of the Three Million gang in Seeisoville, Kroonstad, Orange Free State (OFS), on 25 December 1984, allegedly while trying to rescue his cousin from being raped.

name: Andrews Mpondiwa
description: Was burnt to death by a group of named boys claiming to be ANC supporters in Nelspruit, Tvl, on 15 May 1986. Mr Mpondiwa was accused of witchcraft.

name: Lutoape Alfred Molefe
description: Was shot and injured by unidentified perpetrators at Newcastle, Natal, on 10 December 1992 during intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mirriam Tshidi Mosia
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named perpetrator on 23 March 1992 at Mzimhlophe, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. Ms Mosia is paralysed as a result of her injuries.

name: Sifiso Mposula
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 7 June 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. A friend he was visiting at the time was also shot and injured. The house was destroyed with a petrol bomb.

name: Isaac Ike Mosito
description: He disappeared on 14 January 1992 on his way to work during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents in Klipspruit, Soweto, Johannesburg. Mr Mosito has not been seen since.

name: Adolphus Motsemme Mosome
description: Was shot dead on 8 August 1990 by members of the ISU, apparently assisting IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers in Mapetla, Soweto, Johannesburg, during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Alexandra Motang
description: Was shot dead by gunmen who fired at him from a passing car on 12 July 1993 in Sebokeng, Tvl, during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents. See drive-by shootings.

name: Rita Motasi
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested on 4 November 1985 in Zolani, Ashton, Cape, and held in custody for many months. She was later convicted of public violence.

name: Thomas Tommy Motau
description: An ANC supporter who died mysteriously after he was arrested and sentenced to six years for public violence in Bela-Bela, Warmbaths, Tvl, in 1986. He was active in the local organisation which campaigned for a rent boycott.

name: Ephraim Motaung
description: He disappeared in Natalspruit, Vosloorus, Transvaal, in June 1993 during conflict between the ANC and the IFP supporters in the area. He has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Hendrick Oupa Motaung
description: He died three days after he was abducted from his home and set alight, allegedly by ANC supporters, on 27 November 1986 in Katlehong, Tvl, during political conflict in the area.

name: Jacob Moganeliwa Didae Motaung
description: A member of the Eagles Club who was severely beaten when ANC supporters attacked him and five other `Eagles Club` members at Qhoweng, Reddersburg, Orange Free State (OFS), in 1989, allegedly because of their involvement with the club.

name: Sekonyela Gerald Motaung
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Wadeville, Germiston, Transvaal, on 8 September 1993. Twenty five people were shot and killed while waiting at a taxi rank.

name: Sello Paul Motaung
description: Was stabbed and shot by IFP supporters on 7 March 1993 in Sharpeville, Vereeniging, Transvaal, during intense conflict in the area between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Tieho David Motaung
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 15 November 1990.

name: Makabelo Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who died of shock when ANC supporters attacked her family home in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid,  Natal,  on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Makabelo Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who died of shock when ANC supporters attacked her family home in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid,  Natal,  on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Elphus Jacob Motsamai Moloi
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten with rifle butts in July 1992 in Phola Park, Tokoza, Tvl, allegedly by members of the ISU.

name: Makemiso Napie Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 22 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Makemiso Napie Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 22 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Marks Molefe
description: An ANC member who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 29 October 1990.

name: Matsibo Molefe
description: She had her property destroyed in an attack by IFP supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 8 November 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her husband was killed in the attack.

name: Michael Molefe
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 29 October 1990 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Happy Mpulo
description: Was shot and burnt to death by a group of ANC supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 27 August 1991. The perpetrators, who had allegedly been looking for her brother, raped one of the girls in the house before they shot her and set the house alight while she, her three sisters and a cousin were all inside it. They all died in the fire.

name: James George Mpulo
description: An IFP supporter who had his house in Ezibomvini, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, burnt down by other IFP supporters on 28 September 1990. Mr Mpulo was allegedly perceived to be an ANC supporter because he had failed to attend an IFP rally that day.

name: Sifiso Emmanuel Mpulo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 1 February 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mpho Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe`s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Zandile Mpulo
description: Was shot and burnt to death by a group of ANC supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 27 August 1991. The perpetrators, who had allegedly been looking for her brother, raped one of the girls in the house before they shot her and set the house alight while she, her three sisters and a cousin were inside it. They all died in the fire.

name: Nomvula Paula Mokonyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her home damaged in a petrol bomb attack in Kagiso, Tvl, in July 1990.

name: Ndabuka David Gordon Molefe
description: Was shot dead by an IFP supporter in KwaMashu, Durban, on 30 April 1994, as the April 1994 elections were drawing to a close. Although non-partisan, Mr Molefe was allegedly killed because he was thought to support the ANC.

name: Ndabuka David Gordon Molefe
description: Was shot dead by an IFP supporter in KwaMashu, Durban, on 30 April 1994, as the April 1994 elections were drawing to a close. Although non-partisan, Mr Molefe was allegedly killed because he was thought to support the ANC.

name: Zanele Mpulo
description: Was raped, shot and burnt to death by a group of ANC supporters in Imbali, Pieter-maritzburg, on 27 August 1991. The perpetrators, who had allegedly been looking for her brother, set the house alight with her, her three sisters and a cousin inside it. They all died in the fire.

name: Zaneni Mpulo
description: Was shot and burnt to death by a group of ANC supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 27 August 1991. The perpetrators, who had allegedly been looking for her brother, raped one of the girls in the house before they shot her and set the house alight with her, her three sisters and a cousin inside it. They all died in the fire.

name: Neuwe Eunice Molefe
description: She had her house burnt down in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Neuwe Eunice Molefe
description: She had her house burnt down in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomusa Joyce Molefe
description: She had her house in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, burnt down on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomusa Joyce Molefe
description: She had her house in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, burnt down on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntsieng Getrude Molefe
