description: She had her home in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, burnt down in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Peiso Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured by IFP supporters who attacked his home in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Peiso Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured by IFP supporters who attacked his home in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Phala Nelson Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten and had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Phala Nelson Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten and had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Philda Molefe
description: She was the wife of an induna who was killed when a bomb was thrown into her house in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 13 March 1994. The attack was allegedly aimed at her husband, because of his perceived support for the ANC. IFP and the ANC supporters blamed each other for the bombing.

name: Pulelo Jani Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 8 November 1992 in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Richard Oupa Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Richard Oupa Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Salatiela Molefe
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 13 March 1992 at Dobsonville, Soweto, Johannesburg, during clashes between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Several other people died and others were injured in the attack.

name: Shadrack Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe`s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Simaki Victory Molefe
description: She lost her home in an arson attack in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Simaki Victory Molefe
description: She lost her home in an arson attack in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Siphiwe Ephraim Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at Khozini Hostel in Johannesburg, on 8 June 1993.

name: Thabo Jephrey Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 9 June 1991. Four days later, his brother, aged 27, was stabbed to death by IFP supporters. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Tsepo Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe`s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Tsitsana  Elma Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and property destroyed in an attack by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her daughter-in-law died of shock during the attack.

name: Tsitsana  Elma Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and property destroyed in an attack by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her daughter-in-law died of shock during the attack.

name: Jackson Molete
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Tigane, Hartebeesfontein, Tvl, on 23 August 1992.

name: Teboho Patrick Mokopane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by members of the A-Team in Thabong, Welkom, OFS, on 24 February 1985.

name: Anna Mokotedi
description: She had her home damaged in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Tvl, on 12 May 1991. Hostel-dwellers were retaliating against a previous attack by ANC-supporting squatters and about one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Kenewang Ester Morebudi
description: Was shot and killed by named IFP supporters in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Tvl, on 3 May 1993 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Hendrik Motsami Mokotedi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and his body was mutilated on 11 September 1990 in Tokoza, Tvl, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Tumelo Alec Morebudi
description: Was shot in the chest and injured by IFP supporters in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Tvl, on 3 May 1993 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Peter Thabo Moloi
description: Was assaulted with fists and broomsticks at Protea police station, Soweto, Johannesburg, in November 1982. The police were allegedly trying to locate ANC audio cassette tapes.

name: Sefako Johannes Moloi
description: Was shot and injured on 14 August 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl when members of the ISU opened fire on mourners at the funeral of a Katlehong resident reportedly killed by the ISU. This incident occurred during a period of heightened political conflict on the East Rand following an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel on May 22 which resulted in conflict leading to at least 81 deaths the following month.

name: Sefako Johannes Moloi
description: Was shot and injured on 14 August 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl when members of the ISU opened fire on mourners at the funeral of a Katlehong resident reportedly killed by the ISU. This incident occurred during a period of heightened political conflict on the East Rand following an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel on May 22 which resulted in conflict leading to at least 81 deaths the following month.

name: Thabiso Johannes Mokotedi
description: An ANC member who was shot and killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at his home in Katlehong, Tvl, on 25 August 1993. The SDU members suspected him of being a police informer, although Mr Mokotedi`s father denied this. One SDU member was granted amnesty for this killing (AC/1999/0348).

name: Selina Mamakhe Moloi
description: Was injured when a hand grenade, thrown by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU), exploded in her home in Soweto, Johannes-burg, on 2 October 1992. One person was killed and several others were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/090).

name: Solomon Moloi
description: Was injured when a hand grenade, thrown by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU), exploded in her home in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 2 October 1992. One person was killed and several others were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/090).

name: Tsokolo Jonas Mokwenyana
description: An ANC member who was shot dead by IFP-aligned Khetisi Kheswa gang members in Sebokeng, Tvl, on 26 June 1993.

name: Euphemia Dudu Molapo
description: Was shot and stabbed to death by members of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang in Tembisa, Tvl, on 7 June 1992 during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Silas Molapo Molapo
description: An ANC supporter who was injured when he was stabbed and shot by members of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang at his home in Tembisa, Tvl, on 7 June 1992. Tembisa, like many East Rand townships, was embroiled in conflict between the ANC and IFP in the early 1990s.

name: Sootho Macdonald Molebalwa
description: Was severely beaten by named members of the Bophuthatswana Defence Force in Thaba Nchu, Bophuthatswana, on 12 November 1990. There were stayaways and boycotts in the area at the time as the ANC called for the re-incorporation of Bophuthatswana into South Africa, and protested against oppression in the homeland.

name: Botikie Nicholas Molefabangwe
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked with a panga on the hand by named perpetrators in January 1991 at Lekubu, Bophuthatswana, because he resisted the forced incorporation of the village into Bophuthatswana.

name: Alphina Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who lost her houses in an arson attack in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, in intense political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections

name: Alphina Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who lost her houses in an arson attack in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, in intense political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections

name: Andrina Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured when IFP supporters attacked her home in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near

name: Anna Makgawulo Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who lost two houses in an arson attack at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Anna Makgawulo Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who lost two houses in an arson attack at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bokang Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe`s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Dihuputso Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 7 November 1993 in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe`s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Elphas Molefe
description: A Sotho chief and ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe`s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Fanono Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by alleged IFP supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 3 May 1994 in political conflict around the April 1994 elections.

name: Fanono Molefe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by alleged IFP supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 3 May 1994 in political conflict around the April 1994 elections.

name: Thokozile Glenda Yvonne Moloi
description: Was shot and injured on 19 January 1993 in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Tvl, during conflict in the area between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Velisile Mpungose
description: He had his home burnt down during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 17 May 1993.

name: Tstetsi Aaron Moremi
description: Was hacked to death by IFP supporters on 7 Februrary 1993 in Mapetla, Soweto, Johannesburg, during ongoing violence between Merafe hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: (First Name Not Given) Moriane
description: Was shot by alleged ANC supporters in 1992 in Mzimhlope, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Johannes Molatlhegi Moroke
description: Was stabbed to death on 16 February 1994 in Bekkersdal, near Westonaria, Tvl, by IFP supporters who attacked residents who did not join the IFP. Two weeks before, his uncle was shot dead by the same perpetrators who vandalised the house and stole household goods in the presence of police colluding openly with those terrorising ANC-supporting residents.

name: Moshe Moses Mosa
description: An ANC supporter who lost his residence, shebeen, spaza shop and motor vehicles in an arson attack on 3 February 1990 in Khutsong, Carletonville, Tvl, by ANC supporters who suspected him of collaborating with the police. ANC youth claimed that police used his vehicles in attacks on them. Mr Mosa was forced to stay at Khutsong police station for two months for his own protection and eventually had to leave the area.

name: Joe Buti Mosane
description: A taxi driver who left home to take passengers to Tokoza, Transvaal, in August 1993. His body was found on 21 August 1993 behind Tokoza hostel with burn marks and bullet wounds. His minibus and some clothing were missing. This incident occurred during escalating violent conflict on the East Rand in the wake of an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel in May 1993.

name: Joe Buti Mosane
description: A taxi driver who left home to take passengers to Tokoza, Transvaal, in August 1993. His body was found on 21 August 1993 behind Tokoza hostel with burn marks and bullet wounds. His minibus and some clothing were missing. This incident occurred during escalating violent conflict on the East Rand in the wake of an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel in May 1993.

name: Joe Buti Mosane
description: A taxi driver who left home to take passengers to Tokoza, Transvaal, in August 1993. His body was found on 21 August 1993 behind Tokoza hostel with burn marks and bullet wounds. His minibus and some clothing were missing. This incident occurred during escalating violent conflict on the East Rand in the wake of an ANC march past a Tokoza hostel in May 1993.

name: Zoyisile Given Moshane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in the leg in 1992 in Alexandra, Johannesburg, during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Moletshe Mpunzana
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Ivy Zanele Mqadi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sifiso Goodman Mqadi
description: An ANC supporter who died when he was shot, stoned and stabbed by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sifiso Goodman Mqadi
description: An ANC supporter who died when he was shot, stoned and stabbed by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Tolani Eunice Mqadi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Vikinduku Mqadi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter at the Emahlongwa bus stop in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 4 August 1992. Mr Mqadi was perceived to have sympathies with the ANC.

name: Loza Geratina Mqathi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down on 28 July 1993 in intense fighting between IFP and ANC supporters, which allegedly started some two weeks previously when a woman in the IFP-dominated area of Maweni was shot dead by four youths, and several IFP homes were burnt down. More than 110 people fled the area after their homes were burnt down in the fighting.

name: Mzandile Mqikela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and burnt on 15 August 1990 when his home in the informal settlement, Crossroads, in Katlehong, Tvl, was attacked and set alight, allegedly by IFP supporters. Mr Mqikela was one of 24 people who died in a pre-dawn attack by hostel-dwellers on the Crossroads informal settlement on this day.

name: Zoleka Constance Mqikela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot at and her home was burnt down during an attack on 15 August 1990 in the informal settlement, Crossroads, in Katlehong, Tvl, allegedly carried out by IFP supporters. Ms Mqikela`s brother was shot dead during the attack. He was one of 24 people who died in a pre-dawn attack by local hostel-dwellers on the Crossroads informal settlement on this day.

name: Masesi Josephine Mqoma
description: Was hacked and shot by IFP supporters in Ratanda, Heidelberg, Tvl, on 3 December 1992 during tension between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Bongani Mqomi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in Sokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in July 1990. His house caught fire when IFP supporters petrol-bombed a neighbour`s house during the period of continued political conflict in the area.

name: Mzuvuliwe Mqulwana
description: Was shot and injured in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 16 March 1993 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. At least 18 people were killed in political violence in Bhambayi that month. Seventy-five homes were burnt down.

name: Neliswa Mroxisa
description: An ANC supporter and women`s activist who was detained in Worcester, Cape, on 12 June 1986, and held for three months under emergency regulations.

name: Allen Darius Msabala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead near Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 15 November 1990, in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sibusisiwe Lucia Msabala
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in July 1992.

name: Babazile Msane
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house on 16 March 1994 in an arson attack by IFP supporters on residents of Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Esau Bhekuyise Msane
description: He had his home burnt down at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 February 1992, when IFP supporters returning from a chief`s gathering attacked ANC hostels and homes in the area. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Nkosi Christopher Msane
description: Was found dead after he had been abducted by IFP supporters in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, in October 1990 in intensifying political conflict in the area. Mr Msane was perceived by the perpetrators to be an ANC supporter.

name: Nkosinathi Msane
description: He had his home and shop burnt down by IFP supporters at Embabe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nondumiso Clementine Msane
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in the Ngwelezana area, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in August 1992 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Phiwayinkosi Msane
description: Was shot dead in Empangeni, Natal, on 2 February 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Phyllis Msane
description: An ANC supporter who had her home attacked by IFP supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992. The family was displaced as a result of this attack.

name: Zandile Msane
description: An ANC supporter who had her home attacked by IFP supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992. The family was displaced as a result of this attack.

name: (Name Not Given) Msani
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters who attacked her family home in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992. One member of the family was raped in the attack, and one other was killed.

name: Bongumusa Msani
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 2 September 1990, allegedly because of his family`s refusal to join the IFP while living in an IFP stronghold. The three Msani brothers were allegedly all threatened by IFP supporters. Two were killed and the other was tortured in the course of political conflict in the area.

name: Gladys Msani
description: An ANC supporter who was raped by IFP supporters when they attacked her family home in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992. Two members of the family were killed in the attack.

name: Khohliwe Msani
description: She lost her house on 16 March 1994 in an arson attack by IFP supporters on residents of the isolated ANC stronghold in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Abel Tobiase Montoeli
description: An active ANC supporter who died in police custody in Vredefort, OFS, on 5 August 1992, following his arrest on the day of a community protest march in the area. Family members believe he was severely tortured.

name: Papo John Monyakalle
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and thrown into a toilet in April 1985 in Johannesburg, by alleged askaris because of information he possessed.

name: Ishmael Maisa Moobi
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten and stoned by supporters of Chief Mapela in Ellisras, Tvl, on 19 January during a confrontation between this group and supporters of Chief Lerumo.

name: Samuel Albert Moosa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house stoned and petrol-bombed by a named perpetrator at Nelspruit, Tvl, on 6 May 1986. Mr Moosa was suspected of being a police informer during political conflict in the area.

name: Jimmy Molorosi
description: Was severely beaten by members of the `Zim-Zim` faction in Khutsong, Carletonville, Tvl, on 24 June 1990 due to his association with the `Gadaffi` faction. The ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress had split into these two factions and were in violent conflict with each other. At least 17 people were killed in Khutsong between 1989 and 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991.

name: Jimmy Molorosi
description: Was severely beaten by members of the `Zim-Zim` faction in Khutsong, Carletonville, Tvl, on 24 June 1990 due to his association with the `Gadaffi` faction. The ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress had split into these two factions and were in violent conflict with each other. At least 17 people were killed in Khutsong between 1989 and 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991.

name: Mzwabantu Molose
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested on 18 March 1985 in Pearston, Cape, during a consumer boycott. He was sentenced to eight years` imprisonment for public violence and was severely tortured during his detention. Mr Molose died soon after of alleged respiratory distress, in East London prison.

name: Frederick Sefike Molotsi
description: Was severely beaten by IFP supporters in July 1991 in Alexandra, Johannes-burg, for his involvement in civic structures. Alexandra was tense following clashes between IFP- aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting township residents.

name: Ramasoeu Saul Molotsi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home and car damaged in a petrol bomb attack on 24 April 1992 in Sebokeng, Tvl, during intense conflict in the Vaal Triangle between IFP and ANC supporters. Mr Molotsi was targeted because his wife was suspected of being an IFP supporter.

name: Selolo Suzan Molutsi
description: A member of the ANCWL who was detained and tortured in Klerksdorp, Tvl, on 12 February 1991.

name: Josiah Rakwena Monaisa
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 14 March 1992 in Meadowlands, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-aligned residents. Two attackers stopped the taxi in which Mr Monaisa was travelling, boarded it and shot the driver dead. They then drove to Mzimhlophe hostel where they shot Mr Monaisa. The taxi was later recovered by the police.

name: Stephen Lesala Monakale
description: A SANCO supporter who was detained without a charge on 12 June 1986 during protests in East London. He was released in April 1987.

name: Stephen Lesala Monakale
description: A SANCO supporter who was detained without a charge on 12 June 1986 during protests in East London. He was released in April 1987.

name: Obed Monambii
description: Was killed in Empangeni, Natal, on 11 April 1992 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mavis Deliwe Mthiyane
description: Was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Ms Mthiyane was allegedly attacked because her husband was an ANC supporter.

name: Mavis Deliwe Mthiyane
description: Was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Ms Mthiyane was allegedly attacked because her husband was an ANC supporter.

name: Mbabazeni Enoch Mthiyane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Sokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 November 1991. Mr Mthiyane had allegedly refused to join the IFP.

name: Myekeni Enos Mthiyane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 17 July 1992.

name: Nomadabi Patricia Mthiyane
description: An ANC supporter who was living in her grandmother`s home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, when it was petrol-bombed in June 1991, in continuing political violence between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thembi Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Sibusiso Leonard Mthemba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters who attacked his home in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1993.

name: Sibusiso Augustine Mthiyane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Gezinsila, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 1 May 1992. He was taking part in a Workers` Day march when IFP supporters fired at the crowd, killing his brother and injuring two others.

name: Thembi Gladness Mthiyane
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted, shot and injured by IFP supporters on 8 May 1994 in Dobsonville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on her way back from a rally at the FNB stadium. The perpetrator accused her and a friend of being ANC supporters.

name: Toho Mthiyane
description: She had her rondavels in Eshowe, Natal, burnt down on 7 May 1994, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters following the April 1994 elections.

name: Toho Mthiyane
description: She had her rondavels in Eshowe, Natal, burnt down on 7 May 1994, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters following the April 1994 elections.

name: Ezekiel Toyisa Mthombeni
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed by IFP supporters in Tembisa, Tvl, on 28 October 1993. Tembisa was one of many East Rand townships embroiled in conflict between IFP-supporting hostel- dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: James Jabulani Mthombeni
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters at Mafihleni, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1992.

name: Samuel Tani Mthombeni
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters looking for his son on 29 April 1992 in Sebokeng, Tvl, during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Vusi Bongani Mthuli
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death in Odondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 5 April 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Joseph Mthunzi
description: Was assaulted and stabbed to death by ANC supporters at a squatter camp on a chicken farm in Kliptown, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 7 July 1991. One ANC supporter was granted amnesty for this incident (AC/1999/0212).

name: Pololo Ezekiel Mthwa
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 29 December 1991 in Tigane, Hartbees-fontein, Transvaal, during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Fezekile Mtilana
description: An ANC self defence unit (SDU) member who was shot dead by IFP supporters during political conflict in Port St Johns, Transkei, on 21 May 1993.

name: Lifa Alwin Mtimkhulu
description: Was shot dead by IFP members who claimed to have recognised him as an ANC member and pursued him to a wedding in Meadowlands, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 30 May 1992. A second person at the wedding was also shot dead and five were injured in the attack. One IFP member was granted amnesty for the killing of Mr Mtimkhulu, but was refused amnesty for the other offences (AC/1999/0254).

name: Thembinkosi Mtiyane
description: He lost his home in an arson attack in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 October 1992, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Biza Mtjali
description: Was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Orlando West, Transvaal, in 1992, allegedly because he was suspected of providing information to the IFP. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0317).

name: (First Name Not Given) Mtolo
description: Was hunted down and shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Katlehong, Transvaal, in 1993. The self defence unit (SDU) members believed that Mr Mtolo, who had fled to Katlehong, was the cause of fights amongst SDU members in Phola Park, Transvaal. One SDU member was granted amnesty for this incident (AC/1999/0348). See self defence units (SDU).

name: Bongekile Olga Mtolo
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 29 April 1992. Her grandmother was also killed in the attack, and her home, which was in an IFP stronghold in Ndaleni, was burnt down.

name: (First Name Not Given) Msizi
description: A councillor who survived an attempt on his life when his home was petrol-bombed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Tvl, in 1990. The perpetrators believed that he was also an IFP supporter. Mr Msizi managed to escape from the house. Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2000/139).

name: Dumisani Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who suffered injuries when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217). See Richmond attacks.

name: Ellen Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1990.

name: Funizwe Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in July 1992. See Folweni massacre.

name: Gertrude Ntombifikile Mtolo
description: An IFP Youth Brigade supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by ANC members, at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Hlazi Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down in 1990 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area following an IFP membership recruitment drive.

name: Mafunze Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack in Richmond, Natal, on 26 May 1990, in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Welcome Mthimkhulu
description: A member of the Violence Monitoring Group affiliated to the ANC who escaped unscathed when his car was shot at by a named member of the KZP, acting in collaboration with IFP supporters, at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 July 1992. Two of his passengers were injured in the shooting. Three perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332). See Esikhawini hit squad.

name: Ntozini Mtolo
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 29 April 1992. Her granddaughter was also killed in the attack, and her home, which was in an IFP stronghold in Ndaleni, was burnt down.

name: Mbali Mthini
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and severely beaten by ANC supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 14 December 1993. They questioned him about the location of his friends, who had allegedly stolen a handbag. Such internal conflict within the ANC comrades often led to the harassment of people suspected of being spies. Mbali escaped his attackers, but has not been seen since.

name: Thembelihle Lezinah Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Thembisile Mtolo
description: She had her home burnt down by ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 29 April 1992. The home was in an IFP stronghold. Her grandmother and another close relative were shot dead in the attack.

name: Vitus Funeyakhe Mtolo
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters on 7 February 1992, in an attack on a shop in Umlazi, Durban, belonging to Mr Winnington Sabelo, an IFP leader. In the attack, both Mr Mtolo (who was a customer) and Mr Sabelo were shot dead.

name: Vukaphi Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who lost his home in an arson attack in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, in April 1992 in political conflict following an IFP membership recruitment drive.

name: Zilandile Mtolo
description: She had her house at Ncanalo, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down on 28 June 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bhekamatshali Mtshali
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead on 1 November 1991 while on his way home from a funeral in Ntiyane, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Three IFP supporters and two of the perpetrators were killed in the attack.

name: David Mandla Mtshali
description: He had his house destroyed in an arson attack in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area during 1993.

name: Elphas Ntamnfela Mtshali
description: He had his home at Mtshivo, Eshowe, Natal, burnt down in June 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Jim France Mtshali
description: An IFP supporter who was evicted from his home and lost his possessions during a subsequent arson attack in Tokoza, Transvaal, in November 1993, allegedly carried out by ANC supporters.

name: Mudzunga Mulaudzi
description: She died when she was assaulted with stones and forced to remain in her burning hut by a group of youths in Hampofu, Venda, on 20 March 1990. She was accused of practising witchcraft to hinder the anti-homeland political activities of youths in the area. One ANC supporter was granted amnesty (AC/2000/094).

name: Flora Ntombiyakhe Mvuni
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Bhekulwandle, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 13 October 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Three other family members, including two children, were shot and killed in the attack.

name: Mfanafuthi Victor Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten and stabbed to death by IFP supporters on in Mfume, Umkomaas, near Durban, 1 February 1993.

name: Phethekabi Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who had her houses burnt down by IFP supporters in Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, on 24 April 1994, three days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Phethekabi Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who had her houses burnt down by IFP supporters in Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, on 24 April 1994, three days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembisile Mirriam Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Mahwaqa, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down on 1 March 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Ms Msomi`s husband was killed and her son was shot and injured in an attack by IFP supporters on 19 March 1992.

name: Thembisile Mirriam Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Mahwaqa, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down on 1 March 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Ms Msomi`s husband was killed and her son was shot and injured in an attack by IFP supporters on 19 March 1992.

name: Zobi Doris Mthembi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home and business premises in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in October 1993 in violent conflict between the `Red` and `Green` factions in the area.

name: Maduthi Thandi Msani
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Phillip Velaphi Mthembu
description: Was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Soweto, on 25 May 1992. Soweto was one of many Transvaal townships embroiled in conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Phiwayinkosi Michael Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Groutville, Stanger, Natal, on 14 January 1994, allegedly in retaliation for a verbal clash between ANC and IFP supporters earlier that day.

name: Phumzile Nelisiwe Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Qhamukile Mthembu
description: Was burnt to death when IFP supporters attacked her grandmother`s home at Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 November 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. One other family member was shot dead, and her sister shot and injured in the attack.

name: Samuel Smodell Mthembu
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 27 February 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP. Mr Mthembu`s home had been burnt down about three weeks earlier.

name: Sandile Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by other ANC supporters on 29 April 1990 in Sobantu, near Pietermaritzburg, in political conflict between two ANC breakaway factions, the Amavaravara and the Amazimuzimu.

name: Sgidi Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who died after he was shot and axed by ANC supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg on 17 March 1991.

name: Sibongile Virginia Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area during 1992.

name: Sibusiso Joseph Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot, stabbed and hacked to death by IFP supporters at Danganya, Umkomaas, near Durban, on 13 June 1992.

name: Sibusiso Steven Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named perpetrators in Pinetown, Natal, on 4 November 1988. He was allegedly attacked after recommending that the perpetrators be tried in the kangaroo court that had been introduced in the area to punish comrades who involved themselves in criminal activities.

name: Lungile Pretty Mvuni
description: Was shot dead in Bhekulwandle, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 13 October 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Three other family members were shot and killed in the attack. The family supported the IFP.

name: Sicelo Ezrom Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who had his house in Richmond, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters in June 1992. ANC supporters in the area were allegedly trying to force IFP supporters out of the area.

name: Sipho Roldald Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by named IFP supporters in Umkomaas,  near Durban,  on 30 September 1992.

name: Stand Mthembu
description: Was shot dead in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 March 1994. Several other people were killed in this attack, which took place at a bus stop in the area.

name: Thandazile Margaret Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 1 July 1993.

name: Thandeka Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 30 November 1992. Her family home was set alight in the attack.

name: Thembi Victoria Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was interrogated and then stabbed to death by fellow ANC supporters at Nhlalakahle, Greytown, Natal, on 28 September 1991. Ms Mthembu came under suspicion after being seen in an IFP-aligned hostel. Three ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/2000/017).

name: Thembinkosi Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by an ANC supporter in Empangeni, Natal, on 20 May 1993.

name: Thenjwaphi Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, set alight in January 1991 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. One person was shot dead and two were severely injured in the attack.

name: Thoko Elizabeth Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Nkulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, damaged in an attack by IFP supporters in May 1993. The family was forced to flee the area after the attack.

name: Tholakele Mthembu
description: Was shot dead in 1991 at KwaMashu, Durban, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thulani Mzikayifani Mthembu
description: An alleged IFP member who died after being shot and stabbed by ANC members at Cottonlands, Verulam, Natal, on 26 December 1991. Six ANC members were granted amnesty (AC/99/0023).

name: Tsheleni Isabel Mthembu
description: She had her home destroyed by ANC supporters during political conflict between the `Red` and `Green` factions in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1993.

name: Vusi Innocent Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked and severely injured by IFP supporters while getting out of a taxi outside Port Shepstone, Natal, on 29 July 1992.

name: Vuyiswa Charity Mthembu
description: Was abducted in Port Shepstone, Natal, in December 1993 and threatened with death, allegedly because some of her family members were ANC supporters. Vuyiswa`s family home was reportedly burnt down.

name: Wiseman Mkhuphukeli Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 December 1991.

name: Xolani Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named perpetrators, both ANC and IFP supporters, in Empangeni, Natal, on 21 July 1993, during intense local political conflict.

name: Zibuyile Jeannet Mthembu
description: Was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 21 September 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zinhle Norris Mthembu
description: Was injured in an attack on her home in KwaDweshula, Port Shepstone, Natal, by ANC supporters on 2 August 1989. The perpetrators demanded to see her brother, an IFP supporter. When told he was out, they set fire to the home.

name: Clement Manala Mthenjane
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 24 May 1991 in Pimville, Soweto, Johannesburg, during ongoing clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Mavalini Mthetho
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by members of the security forces in 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Monaza Norah Mthetho
description: She had her house burnt down in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 13 July 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Earlier that day, ANC supporters had allegedly come to fetch her husband for a self-defence training nightcamp. He was later found burnt to death.

name: Nomadlangathi Mthetho
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by members of the security forces in 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Aaron Mxosheni Mthethwa
description: An IFP chairman who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Sokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 August 1992. IFP leader Chief Mangosuthu Buthelezi had addressed an IFP rally in the area that day.

name: Adeline Sibong Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her 12 rondawels burnt down by other IFP supporters in KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 17 November 1993. The perpetrators were allegedly targeting her sons, whom they believed to be ANC supporters.

name: Amos Mthethwa
description: Was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Mashana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 18 July 1992. His sons were ANC supporters.

name: Beshwara Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 14 February 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Beshwara Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 14 February 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Betty Mthethwa
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 February 1992, when IFP supporters returning from a chief`s gathering attacked ANC hostels and homes in the area. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Bhekilifa Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in the Mahaqwa area, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 1 January 1991. The perpetrators were allegedly trying to purge the area of ANC supporters.

name: Bheko Phillip Mthethwa
description: He disappeared in August 1991, and his decomposed body was found in a forest in Ntamtengayo, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in November 1991. He was reportedly killed by ANC supporters who accused him of being an IFP supporter.

name: Bheko Phillip Mthethwa
description: He disappeared in August 1991, and his decomposed body was found in a forest in Ntamtengayo, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in November 1991. He was reportedly killed by ANC supporters who accused him of being an IFP supporter.

name: Bhekuyise Mthethwa
description: Was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 16 March 1992. Mr Mthethwa was attacked after leaving home to look for his children, who were ANC supporters and who had been pursued by unidentified people.

name: Bonga Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by unidentified perpetrators in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 January 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bonga Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by unidentified perpetrators in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 January 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bongani Mthethwa
description: He had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 24 March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His two sisters and brother were shot and stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Bongani Mthethwa
description: He had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 24 March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His two sisters and brother were shot and stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Bonginkosi Phanga Mthethwa
description: Was shot dead by unidentified perpetrators at Mangezi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters before the April 1994 elections.

name: Bonginkosi Phanga Mthethwa
description: Was shot dead by unidentified perpetrators at Mangezi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters before the April 1994 elections.

name: Brenda Mbalenhle Mthethwa
description: She lost her home in an arson attack in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 June 1993.

name: Casheleni Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Mtamtengane, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 25 August 1991.

name: Chizelubani Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down in an arson attack by unidentified perpetrators in Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, during intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1989.

name: Dumisani Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 18 July 1992. His father and brother were killed in the same incident.

name: Emmanuel Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared from Entshawini, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, in December 1992, during ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. He has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Emmanuel Bongani Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Mpevu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 December 1993.

name: Felokwakhe Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who was killed in a limpet-mine attack on the home of a well-known IFP leader in the Umbumbulu area, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 October 1991. The attack, which took place during a wedding ceremony, is thought to have been carried out by an ANC member. Six people were killed.

name: Fikile Mthethwa
description: Was shot and stabbed to death when IFP supporters attacked her home at Kwa-Mbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 24 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her sister and brother were also shot and stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Fikile Mthethwa
description: Was shot and stabbed to death when IFP supporters attacked her home at Kwa-Mbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 24 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her sister and brother were also shot and stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Fundaphi Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Ndabayakhe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in September 1993.

name: Hlakaniphile Beatrice Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her family home in Mtamtengane, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 25 August 1991.

name: Jabulani Mthethwa
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at Sokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in November 1991 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. Two of his friends were shot dead with him.

name: Joseph Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Tvl, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Joseph Dumisane Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Joyce Thulisile Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by a named ANC supporter in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 8 July 1991.

name: Kaya Mthethwa
description: A councillor to a local chief who was shot dead on 4 April 1990 when a named perpetratrator attacked his home at Obanjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, allegedly because he was suspected of joining the ANC and planning to overthrow the chief. Mr Mthetwa`s two grandsons, aged eight and seven, were also shot dead in the attack.

name: Kekana Canan Mthethwa
description: Was shot dead on 4 April 1990 when a named perpetrator attacked his grandfather`s home at Obanjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. The attack was allegedly targeted at Kekana`s grandfather, a councillor to a local chief, because he was suspected of joining the ANC and planning to overthrow the chief. Kekana`s grandfather and five-year-old brother were also shot dead in the attack.

name: Khalelani Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban in August 1991.

name: Makhosezwe Elliot Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 June 1992.

name: Mandlenkosi Mthethwa
description: Was shot dead in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1993in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Mandlenkosi Sydwell Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by other ANC supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 3 March 1990 during a serious internal dispute.

name: Mawu Mthethwa
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Mtunzini, Natal, on 24 April 1994 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters shortly before the April 1994 elections.

name: Mawu Mthethwa
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Mtunzini, Natal, on 24 April 1994 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters shortly before the April 1994 elections.

name: Thokozani Goodenough Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and killed by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 7 December 1991.

name: Agnes Elsie Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 4 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Agnes Elsie Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 4 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thamsanqa Norman Mvuni
description: Was shot dead in Bhekulwandle, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 13 October 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Three other family members were shot and killed in the attack. The family supported the IFP.

name: Mxolisi Fortune Msani
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port /Shepstone, Natal, in 1992.

name: Michael Nqwele Mthethwa
description: He lost his house in an arson attack in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in 1993.

name: Tshililo Jackson Mulaudzi
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by alleged `comrades` in Thohoyandou, Venda, in 1990.

name: Thokozile Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt  down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo,  Ndwedwe,  KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembani Jennet Mvunyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mzwandile Msizwane
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC head-quarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mphumuzeni Andreas Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who had his business and four houses at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Olifant Msawuli
description: Was tortured and then burnt to death by named ANC supporters in Koppies, OFS, in November 1992, allegedly because his son was believed to be a policeman. Burning liquid plastic was poured onto his head and his fingernails were removed with a pair of pliers. Four people were sentenced to 25 years` imprisonment for this offence.

name: Makhosazana Muriel Mtshali
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by an ANC supporter on 8 September 1991.

name: Ndlanganyana Mvunyiswa
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared during the Pondoland revolt in 1960 from Bizana, Transkei, and has never been seen again. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Mandlakayise Augustine Mtshali
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 February 1992 in Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, during continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Bayisaphi Mthembu
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Empangeni, Natal, on 29 October 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Gladys Khombisile Msebeni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Beatrice Badingile Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters early in 1994 in the Somopho area, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thuthuka Philemon Joe Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked by IFP supporters, in Mamery, Stanger, Natal, in April 1993. They threatened him and pursued him into a nearby forest.

name: Muntungikhona Leonard Mthethwa
description: He had his house burnt down at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 February 1992, when IFP supporters returning from a chief`s gathering attacked ANC hostels and homes in the area. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Ntombikabani Msebeni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mary-Jane Mtshali
description: She had her house and possessions burnt in an arson attack in Stanger, Natal, on 30 October 1993, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Beauty Mthembu
description: An IFP member who was shot and injured in both legs by named ANC supporters at Umlazi, Durban, on 16 June 1991.

name: (Name Not Given) Msomi
description: She had her house in Stanger, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. She was allegedly targeted because her grandchildren were ANC supporters.

name: Alphina Zamekile Msomi
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ndodwane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Alphina Zamekile Msomi
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ndodwane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bachumile Eunice Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bhacephi Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bhekabantu Elliot Msomi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Tvl, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Bhekezamandla Msomi
description: An IFP supporter who died in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 4 October 1991, four days after being shot by a named ANC supporter.

name: Bongani Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was targeted for elimination by IFP members at Hlanganani Hall, Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during 1992. One perpetrator in the conspiracy was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Bongile Ntombi Msomi
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area in 1993.

name: Clementine Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Gezubuso, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Delisile Jermina Msomi
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Sakhotshe, KwaZulu, near Hammarsdale, Natal, on 20 March 1990 in intense political conflict in the area following the unbanning of political organisations in February.

name: Dingeni Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Fephi Thophi Msomi
description: She had her home in Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 21 August 1991 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Fikelephi Zintombi Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Geslina Ngoane Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Adams Mission, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 25 September 1993. Her sons were stabbed in the attack, and one of them died from his injuries.

name: Hawukile Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khangelani Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994 in an attack on residents of the isolated ANC stronghold in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khumbulani Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by members of the Amavaravara at KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, in February 1990, allegedly because he refused to join them. One other person, also an ANC supporter, was killed in the attack.

name: Linda Edmund Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters on 25 September 1993 in Adams Mission, near Durban.

name: Luke Richard Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Lungisani David Msomi
description: He died of multiple injuries when ANC supporters attacked IFP supporters at an IFP self-defence camp meeting at Nkulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 August 1992. The attackers threw a hand grenade and fired several shots into the hut where the meeting was being held.

name: Makanca Darkie Msomi
description: An IFP supporter who had his home shot at and set alight by ANC supporters in Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991. In April and May 1991, political violence in the Port Shepstone area claimed the lives of at least 31 people and rendered about 200 people homeless.

name: Makanca Darkie Msomi
description: An IFP supporter who had his home shot at and set alight by ANC supporters in Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991. In April and May 1991, political violence in the Port Shepstone area claimed the lives of at least 31 people and rendered about 200 people homeless.

name: Mbuso Holiness Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 27 June 1992. His house was set on fire in the attack. The Msomi family was allegedly attacked because they were well-known ANC supporters living in an IFP stronghold.

name: Mcushwa Nivard Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who suffered injuries when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217).

name: Melta Magumbi Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Mfanafuthi Sydney Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters at Adams Mission, near Durban, on 25 September 1993. His brother was killed and the family home burnt down in the attack.

name: Mfungelwa Msomi
description: He had his home, vehicle and business in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, set alight in May 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area

name: Mgwazeni Msomi
description: Was shot dead on 26 February 1994 when unidentified persons attacked his home at Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His son and daughter were also shot dead in the attack, and his house was burnt down.

name: Mkhanyiselwa Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994 in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Moses Mandla Msomi
description: He had his house in Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 October 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mtiyephi Evelina Msomi
description: She had her house burnt down in Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 26 February 1994 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her husband, son and daughter were all shot dead in the attack.

name: Ndaba Kujwayela Msomi
description: He had his house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack on 24 September 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Ndukuzezwe Msomi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by unidentified persons in Umlazi, Durban, on 10 March 1992 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ngangesandla Msomi
description: She had her house shot at and her possessions destroyed and stolen in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in March 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nivard Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks.

name: Nkosyangithanda Msomi
description: She had her house in Eshowe, Natal, burnt down on 17 May 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nomathekisi Msomi
description: She had her home in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomusa Msomi
description: She had her home in Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in February 1990 in political conflict following the unbanning of political organisations on 2 February 1990.

name: Nomusa Msomi
description: She had her home in Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in February 1990 in political conflict following the unbanning of political organisations on 2 February 1990.

name: Ntombifikile Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Ensimbini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in November 1993.

name: Patrick Msomi
description: Was one of eight passengers shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Six other passengers were shot dead. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Petros Bonginkosi Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at his home in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 14 April 1993. Seven people were killed in fighting in the area that day.

name: Rosebina Msomi
description: She had her house burnt down in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 17 May 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sipho Herbert Msomi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 24 September 1992.

name: Solani Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sweleni Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thandiwe Mayvis Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down in March 1994 in intensified violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thandwayinkosi Msomi
description: Was shot dead on 26 February 1994 when unidentified persons attacked his home in Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His father and sister were also shot dead in the attack, and their house was burnt down.

name: Themane Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 April 1994.

name: Thembeni Msomi
description: Was shot dead on 26 February 1994 when unidentified persons attacked her home in Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her brother and father were also shot dead in the attack, and their house was burnt down.

name: Timothy Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters on 14 November 1991 in KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, after peace talks in the area had induced him to return home.

name: Hi Muller
description: A traffic officer who was shot at and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Alberton, Transvaal, on 27 March 1992. One colleague was killed and another injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0225).

name: Nkosinathi Godfrey Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death at Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 3 December 1991 when IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers attacked ANC supporters in the area. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Ben Mthembu
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters, one of whom is named, in KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 11 September 1993, allegedly because he was suspected of being a `spy`, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Armstrong Mseleku
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters at Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 February 1992, allegedly because he had assisted ANC youth during political conflict in the area. His father was also shot dead in the attack, which took place at the family-owned store.

name: Nomakhimbili Mthethwa
description: Was shot and stabbed to death when IFP supporters attacked her home at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 24 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her sister and brother were shot and stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Nomakhimbili Mthethwa
description: Was shot and stabbed to death when IFP supporters attacked her home at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 24 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her sister and brother were shot and stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Khethubani Isaac Mvuyana
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 21 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Khethubani Isaac Mvuyana
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 21 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomashinga Bazaar Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her house, cars and business destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 25 August 1991.

name: Velephi Msomi
description: She had her home in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Winnie Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 27 June 1992. One of her sons, a well-known ANC activist in the area, was stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Mthokozisi Mtshali
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Mazabekweni, Ixopo, Natal, on 11 June 1993.

name: Nomsombuluko Selina Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters on 26 July 1992 in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban. See Folweni massacre.

name: Zothini Msomi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bhekisisa Mthembu
description: Was shot dead by unidentified persons at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 29 October 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nkosinamandla Mvuyana
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Qhamukile Velelphi Mvuyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Goodman Jabulani Mwali
description: An ANC supporter who was strangled, shot and severely beaten by IFP supporters in Nondweni, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. He survived the attack.

name: Goodman Jabulani Mwali
description: An ANC supporter who was strangled, shot and severely beaten by IFP supporters in Nondweni, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. He survived the attack.

name: Zamisu Mwandla
description: Was severely injured when he was pushed off a moving train by ANC supporters in Johannesburg, on 12 August 1993 because he was assumed to be an IFP supporter.

name: Dennis Mzikayifani Mwelase
description: An ANC supporter who was collected from his home in KwaMashu, Durban, by unidentified persons in June 1978 and has not been seen since. He was a member of the underground movement.

name: Nthabiseng Gladnes Mwelase
description: An IFP supporter who was shot by an ANC supporter in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 16 April 1994 during political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 election. Another person was also killed in the same attack. The perpetrator applied for amnesty.

name: Nthabiseng Gladnes Mwelase
description: An IFP supporter who was shot by an ANC supporter in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 16 April 1994 during political conflict in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 election. Another person was also killed in the same attack. The perpetrator applied for amnesty.

name: Mandla Mweli
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 1 September 1991.

name: Phineus Mthenjwa Mweli
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Estcourt, Natal, on 8 July 1991.

name: Mbangete James Mxakato
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters in Johannesburg, on 19 August 1990.

name: Banele William Mxoli
description: An ANC activist who lost his house and car in an arson attack by named ADM supporters during political conflict in Fort Beaufort, Cape, on 16 September 1992. Four perpetrators were refused amnesty, having denied guilt.

name: Jamane Mxwengxe
description: An ANC supporter who was detained in Pietermaritzburg in March 1960 and held without trial for four years.

name: Arron Myaka
description: Was shot dead, together with two friends, while waiting at a Pietermaritzburg bus stop on 20 August 1991, during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mthiyane Enos Myekeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 17 July 1992.

name: Ambrose Jabulani Myende
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on 4 June 1993 in Umlazi, Durban.

name: Thandamayende Myende
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Bonginkosi Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from his home at Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, by IFP supporters on 6 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. He has not been seen since.

name: Bonginkosi Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from his home at Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, by IFP supporters on 6 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. He has not been seen since.

name: Caiphas Myeni
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters while on duty as a security guard at a shop at KwaSokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 20 July 1992 during continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Cornelius Simphiwe Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and killed by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, in January 1992.

name: Eunice Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her husband and daughter were also killed in the attack.
