name: Eunice Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her husband and daughter were also killed in the attack.

name: Hazel Jabulile Myeni
description: She had her house in Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 5 January 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Her husband was allegedly abducted and forced attend an IFP self-defence training camp, where he was killed.

name: Maria Ncengani Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Maria Ncengani Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nehemia Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His wife and daughter were also killed in the attack.

name: Nehemia Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 February 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His wife and daughter were also killed in the attack.

name: Remicard Myeni
description: A security guard who was held up at gunpoint and tied up by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at the Giwi Breyton Construction compound in Evander, Tvl, on 6 July 1992. One security guard was shot dead and another shot and injured. The SDU members, who sought to seize guns at the site, were engaged in clashes with the Black Cats in Ermelo, Transvaal. Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/19998/0121). See self-defence unit (SDU).

name: Sbongile Jabu Myeni
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed, raped and had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in September 1993.

name: Thandazile Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her parents were also killed in the attack.

name: Thandazile Myeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her parents were also killed in the attack.

name: (The Family) Myeza
description: The Myeza family were ANC supporters who had their home destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, during 1992.

name: Bhekisisa Moonlight Myeza
description: Was shot dead on 26 August 1991 in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Fm Myeza
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC head-quarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mbabazeni Mpipi Myeza
description: He had his home destroyed in an arson attack in Eshowe, Natal, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area in 1993.

name: Moonlight Bhekisisa Myeza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death on 26 July 1992 when IFP supporters attacked several homes in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban. See Folweni massacre.

name: Mtholeni Myeza
description: She lost her house at KwaMashu, Durban, in an arson attack in July 1991, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nicholas Mfanukhona Myeza
description: An ANC supporter who was found dead with a bullet wound in the head in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 April 1994, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters two weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Nicholas Mfanukhona Myeza
description: An ANC supporter who was found dead with a bullet wound in the head in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 April 1994, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters two weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Sibongile Elizabeth Myeza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 4 September 1992.

name: Victor Vuyako Myeza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 23 January 1986, in the aftermath of the Umbumbulu massacre.

name: Mthayini Myezo
description: An ANC supporter who was detained in Bizana, Transkei, in June 1960, because of his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. He died under mysterious circumstances while in custody in 1967 in Umtata, Transkei. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Zilayile Abegale Myiko
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in July 1992.

name: Winniefreda Mzaliya
description: Was abducted, sexually assaulted and then stabbed to death by ANC supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, on 2 March 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. After killing her, the perpetrators set fire to her body.

name: Ntombikayise Mseleku
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 October 1993. IFP supporters had allegedly embarked on a campaign to rid the area of ANC supporters.

name: Madondo Msongelwa
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Ndiya Simon Mtshali
description: Was killed at Mtunzini, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 10 May 1994, the day of Nelson Mandela`s inauguration as President.

name: Edward Msubo
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 17 January 1992 in continuing political violence in the area. The family was allegedly attacked because of its association with a local ANC leader. Five members of the Msubo family and the ANC leader were killed.

name: Anthony Mungwe
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Bonakele Ntombivele Mthembu
description: She had her house burnt down when ANC supporters attacked an IFP stronghold at Mshayazafe, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban.

name: Ntonto Florina `Toto` Mseleku
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 4 February 1992.

name: Nester Mtshali
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Masomonco, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 5 December 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nozipho Rejoice Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and sexually assaulted by a named IFP supporter, in Empangeni, Natal, in November 1993.

name: Elliot Sandile Msubo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death by IFP supporters in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, on 17 January 1992 in continuing political violence in the area. The family was allegedly attacked because of its association with a local with an ANC leader. Four other family members and the ANC leader were also killed, and the house was burnt down in the attack.

name: Emmanuel Tandazani Msubo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death by IFP supporters in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, on 17 January 1992 in continuing political violence in the area. The family was allegedly attacked because of its association with a local with an ANC leader. Four other family members and the ANC leader were also killed, and the house was burnt down in the attack.

name: Ernest Saziso Msubo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death by IFP supporters in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, on 17 January 1992 in continuing political violence in the area. The family was allegedly attacked because of its association with a local with an ANC leader. Four other family members and the ANC leader were also killed, and the house was burnt down in the attack.

name: Evangeline Nomasonto Msubo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death by IFP supporters in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, on 17 January 1992 in continuing political violence in the area. The family was allegedly attacked because of its association with a local with an ANC leader. Four other family members and the ANC leader were also killed, and the house was burnt down in the attack.

name: Yvonnie Nomphumelelo Msubo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death by IFP supporters in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, on 17 January 1992 in continuing political violence in the area. The family was allegedly attacked because of its association with a local with an ANC leader. Four other family members and the ANC leader were also killed, and the house was burnt down in the attack.

name: Derrick Vusumuzi Mswane
description: An IFP supporter who had his house burnt down by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, in June 1992 in political conflict around the launch of IFP branches in the area. Another family member was shot dead in the attack on his home.

name: Isaac Mswane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters who attacked his home in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 25 June 1992 during political conflict around the launch of IFP branches in the area. His home was burnt down in the attack.

name: Falisendlini Msweli
description: He lost his home in an arson attack by named perpetrators in Mangwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Another family member was stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Falisendlini Msweli
description: He lost his home in an arson attack by named perpetrators in Mangwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Another family member was stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Goodness Makhosazane Msweli
description: An IFP supporter who had her home petrol-bombed in Wombane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 29 November 1992 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Her father was shot dead by an ANC supporter three weeks later, in political conflict at Gingindlovu, Natal.

name: Hemilton Bukhosibani Msweli
description: He had his home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 25 February 1993 in intense political conflict between between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. About 35 houses were reportedly burnt down in Bhambayi in February 1993.

name: Hemilton Bukhosibani Msweli
description: He had his home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 25 February 1993 in intense political conflict between between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. About 35 houses were reportedly burnt down in Bhambayi in February 1993.

name: Katshani Msweli
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Sokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area during 1992.

name: Khangekile Thembekile Msweli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lucas Pickup Msweli
description: An IFP supporter and local headman who was shot dead by ANC supporters, one of whom is named, at Gingindlovu, Natal, on 19 December 1992.

name: Princess Gugu Msweli
description: An ANC supporter who was raped and stabbed by IFP supporters who attacked her family home home at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in February 1993 during continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Sbusiso Msweli
description: Was stabbed to death when his family home in Mangwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, was attacked and burnt down by named perpetrators on 23 April 1994, four days before the start of the April 1994 elections, in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Sbusiso Msweli
description: Was stabbed to death when his family home in Mangwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, was attacked and burnt down by named perpetrators on 23 April 1994, four days before the start of the April 1994 elections, in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Amadeus Mtalane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 28 July 1992.

name: Gladness Nomusa Mtalane
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 April 1992.

name: Makhosazane Annatoria Mtalane
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 April 1992.

name: Nobuhle Gloria Mtalane
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 April 1992.

name: Nonhlanhla Mtalane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 April 1992.

name: Thoko Saraphina Mtalane
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 April 1992. Her husband was shot dead in the same incident.

name: Ernest Themba Mtambo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house and business premises at Stanger, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in December 1993.

name: Zondumuntu Ephraim Mtambo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 16 December 1993 by IFP supporters returning from a rally in Woodford, Bergville, Natal. Two ANC members were killed and at least two others injured. Around 15 IFP supporters then attacked mourners at the funeral of the two ANC members, setting fire to the marquee and beating two funeral assistants. That night an elderly relative of one of the deceased was killed and five homes set alight.

name: Mlungisi Mtebese
description: Was shot dead on 23 May 1991 in Sebokeng, Transvaal, when KwaMadala hostel-dwellers attacked a beerhall with AK47s during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Mr Mtebese and eight others were killed in the attack.

name: Constance Sizakele Mtembu
description: An IFP supporter who was raped by IFP supporters in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 July 1992. She was allegedly accused of being sympathetic to the ANC and attacked.

name: Daliwe Mtembu
description: She had her home burnt down at Ntlize, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 20 December 1993 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Frank Mtembu
description: An ANC member who was stabbed to death by supporters and family members of a named local councillor on 7 July 1990 in Graaff-Reinet, Cape, allegedly because he was believed to have been involved in an arson attack on the councillor`s home.

name: Qalokwakhe Mtembu
description: She had her house in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, destroyed during September 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. No one was home at the time of the attack.

name: Thoko Grace Mtembu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1992 in intensifying political conflict in the area. At least seven homes were burnt down in fighting in the area that month.

name: Mandlakayise Mtetwa
description: He was burnt to death when he was forced to drink petrol and was then set alight by ANC supporters on 12 September 1990 in Sebokeng, Tvl, because he was an IFP supporter.

name: Manoni Nelisiwe Mtetwa
description: She had her house burnt down in Mbhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 December 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zikhokhile Grace Celiwe Mtetwa
description: She had her home burnt down in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1991 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zwelini John Mtetwa
description: He had his house burnt down in Entoweni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zwelini John Mtetwa
description: He had his house burnt down in Entoweni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bheki Mthabela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 17 May 1993 during continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Enoch Bongikwazi Mthabela
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Tvl, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Philane Innocent Mthabela
description: Was shot dead in a drive-by shooting, allegedly by hostel-dwellers in Germiston, Transvaal, on 8 September 1993. The perpetrators opened fire at a taxi rank killing 23 people. The taxi ranks were in ANC-controlled areas.

name: Bhekuyise Percy Mthalane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by another named ANC supporter on 12 June 1990 in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in a serious internal dispute. Mr Mthalane was accused of involvement in the murder of a prominent ANC member. His mother`s home was burnt down in the same attack.

name: Bongani Mthalane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Machibisa, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 17 November 1991.

name: Charles Mthokozizi Mthalane
description: Was one of three men stabbed to death by ANC supporters and residents of the Bottlebrush informal settlement, Chatsworth, Durban, in ongoing political conflict on 26 December 1993. Three ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/1998/0059).

name: David Themba Mthalane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in KwaMpevu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 4 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: David Themba Mthalane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in KwaMpevu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 4 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ephina Mthalane
description: An ANC member who had her house in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by other named ANC supporters on 12 June 1990. Her son was killed in the same attack, allegedly on suspicion of having murdered a prominent ANC member.

name: Thembani Dulana Mthalane
description: She lost her home in an arson attack in Ndlovuyangena, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 20 September 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. The attack reportedly followed the launch of an IFP branch in the area.

name: Mvimbela Mungwe
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Nge Mzonjani Mtshali
description: Was killed in a limpet-mine attack on the home of a well-known IFP leader in the Umbumbulu area, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 October 1991. The attack, which took place during a wedding ceremony, is thought to have been carried out by an ANC member. Six people were killed.

name: Olive Bajabulile Mseleku
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Woodyglen, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in February 1990 following the unbanning of political organisations earlier that month.

name: Ntombizethu Tilili Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nkululeko Mtshali
description: Was shot dead by a named perpetrator, allegedly an ANC supporter, in KwaMashu, Durban, on 11 May 1993 during continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Robert Gagu Mseleku
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters at Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 February 1992, allegedly for assisting ANC youth during political conflict in the area. His son, aged 21, was also shot dead in the attack, which took place at the family-owned store.

name: Sandile Richman Mseleku
description: An ANC supporter who was injured in an explosion detonated by IFP supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in September 1992.

name: Themba Alfred Mseleku
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Fakazi, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1991 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Mr Mseleku was forced to flee from the area as a result of the attack.

name: Zamaduma Mseleku
description: Was severely beaten while walking home with her sister from Murchison Hospital, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 January 1993 during intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her sister was killed in the attack.

name: Jingxi Mshayisa
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted in 1960 in Mount Ayliff and Lusikisiki police stations in Transkei, while he was serving a three-year detention for his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Bonginkosi Matshilo Mshengu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 December 1992.

name: Alzina Mshuba
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured and had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 21 February 1994. Her son was killed in the attack.

name: Jabulani Richard Msibe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu`s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Alpheus Msibi
description: Was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU), in Ethandakukhanya, Piet Retief, Tvl, in 1992, during a period of conflict between the Black Cats and the ANC. Mr Msibi, the mayor of Ethandakukhanya, was suspected of being an IFP member. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/98/0121).

name: Jubilia Jabulile Msibi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 January 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Jubilia Jabulile Msibi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 January 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Petros Peta Msibi
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted, stabbed and stoned to death by ANC supporters in Ladysmith, Natal, on 16 December 1992.

name: Sikhalo Msibi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 19 April 1993 in Zonkesizwe informal settlement near Vosloorus, Tvl, when IFP supporters allegedly attacked a group of people returning from the funeral of assassinated SACP secretary general Chris Hani. Two people, including Mr Msibi, were shot dead and three were injured in this attack.

name: Vusi Hymie Msibi
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested, beaten with sjamboks, and held in the boot of a car at the Standerton police station, Tvl, in 1987. He and his friends were accused by the police of killing and burning a person.

name: Noma Barbara Msimang
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Ntuzuma, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on two occasions, first on 7 December 1989 and again on 20 April 1994, in continuing political conflict between in the area.

name: Noma Barbara Msimang
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Ntuzuma, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on two occasions, first on 7 December 1989 and again on 20 April 1994, in continuing political conflict between in the area.

name: Baloni Richard Msimango
description: Was hacked to death by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 31 October 1992. Mr Msimango was thought to be sympathetic to the ANC.

name: Bolawane Loraine Msimango
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead when her house was attacked on 10 September 1990 in Katlehong, Transvaal, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Dress Jack Msimango
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dress Jack Msimango
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994 in intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nombulelo Beauty Mthini
description: She had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in December 1993, allegedly by ANC supporters looking for her son. He had escaped after they had abducted and severely beaten him, but has not been seen since.

name: Philemon Mjanyelwa Msimango
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and killed at his home by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Tvl, on 26 September 1993. The SDU members believed that Mr Msimango was an IFP supporter. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0316).

name: Thabani Terrence Msimango
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 23 December 1993.

name: Guguletu Innocent Msiya
description: Was severely beaten in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 29 June 1993, at a `people`s court` under the command of an officer of a local ANC self-defence unit (SDU). Mr Msiya was one of five people who survived the beating, while two others were beaten to death, allegedly for crimes committed in the community. One SDU member was granted amnesty,  (AC/2000/033).

name: Moses Msiza
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and beaten with sjamboks  and knobkerries by Imbokodo vigilantes in May 1986 at the tribal authority in Leeuwfontein, Tvl, during conflict over KwaNdebele independence.

name: Thoko Msiza
description: Was abducted and threatened with necklacing by ANC supporters in June 1986 in Kwaggafontein, KwaNdebele, during conflict over incorporation into KwaNdebele. The perpetrators wanted to know the whereabouts of Mr Msiza`s brother, suspected of working for the KwaNdebele government.

name: Nyenyezile Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Mtamtengane, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 25 August 1991.

name: Sethu Mtshali
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 16 December 1992.

name: Simon Mandla Mtshali
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 2 October 1992.

name: Sipho Aaron Mtshali
description: Was shot and stabbed to death in Gingindlovu, Natal, on 21 March 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sipho Aaron Mtshali
description: Was shot and stabbed to death in Gingindlovu, Natal, on 21 March 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thokozile Lesiah Mtshali
description: She had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 28 August 1992. The attack was allegedly aimed at her son, an ANC supporter, who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters on 2 October 1992.

name: Thokozile Lesiah Mtshali
description: She had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 28 August 1992. The attack was allegedly aimed at her son, an ANC supporter, who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters on 2 October 1992.

name: Lindela Orsmond Mtshilita
description: An ANC supporter who was detained on 19 September 1986, and assaulted and subjected to electric shocks and other forms of torture at Louis le Grange police station and later St Alban`s prison in Port Elizabeth. The perpetrators included a named member of the Special Branch. He was later arrested and tortured while trying to leave the country.

name: Buti Mathews Mtsweni
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by a named IFP supporter in Kwadela, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 27 January 1991.

name: Emmah Mtsweni
description: Was interrogated and then burnt to death by ANC supporters and local residents on top of a mountain at Pietskraal, KwaNdebele, on 1 January 1991. Ms Mtsweni was believed to be using witchcraft to harm two persons. Five ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/2000/131).

name: Kenneth Mlwayedwa Mtsweni
description: Was shot and burnt to death by Vlakplaas operatives during July 1986. He was lured to KwaNdebele by an askari with promises of joining the ANC in exile but instead he and two other activists were killed.

name: Doris Mano Mtuli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Umkomaas, near Durban, destroyed in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in February 1992.

name: Evelyn Mtuli
description: Was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Danganya, Umkomaas, near Durban, on 12 March 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Hlangabeza Nicholas Mtuli
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by unidentified persons during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 July 1990.

name: Mfiswa Mtuli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters in KwaZuba, Umkomaas, near Durban, on 9 November 1990. He died from his injuries four days later.

name: Joseph Mtundezi
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Worcester, Cape, in April 1960, after a night of intensive demonstrations against the Pass Laws. He was severely beaten while in detention for three months.

name: Frances Fana Mtungwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 27 April 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Hlengiwe Prudence Mtungwa
description: She had her home destroyed on 3 June 1993 in the Forest Inn area, near Mtubatuba, near Empangeni, Natal, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Khongani Mtungwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Richmond, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters in April 1991.

name: Magezana Mtungwa
description: He had his vehicles vandalised and set alight, and was forced to leave his home, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Richmond, Natal, in 1991.

name: Mlindelwa Mtungwa
description: Was one of five young ANC supporters shot dead by IFP supporters during political conflict at Magoda, Richmond, Natal, on 14 July 1991. Residents accused the security forces of involvement, and a top-level police investigation was launched. The chief of Phatheni was arrested in connection with the massacre.

name: Dumisani Vincent Mtusi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in Tokoza, Tvl, in January 1994 during intense conflict in the area between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Mzikayise Sixtus Mtusi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in Tokoza, Tvl, in January 1994 during intense conflict in the area between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Dumisani Mtuzela
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Dumisani Mtuzela
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Jabulani Lucas Mtyali
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sebokeng, Tvl, on 27 June 1993 during ongoing conflict between IFP-supporting hostel- dwellers and ANC-supporting  residents.

name: Mary Julliet Mtyobile
description: An ANC supporter who was detained in Kimberley, Cape, on 12 June 1986, and was held for three months under emergency regulations.

name: Mildred Nomntu Muhlamunyana
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 3 September 1990 during intense political conflict on the East Rand.

name: Dorah Munzana-Masinga
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by named IFP supporters at Ngonweni, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 27 January 1993.

name: Petros Muntu Mthethwa
description: Was shot dead at Empangeni, Natal, on 9 December 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Christobel Thuleleni Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 30 November 1992 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Mzindle Musa
description: Was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters who attacked the home of friends he was visiting at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 31 May 1991, allegedly because his friends were thought to be ANC supporters.

name: Rachel Thulisile Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Clermont,  near Durban,  petrol-bombed by ANC supporters on 1 December 1991.

name: Michael Musaku
description: Was severely beaten by militant ANC youths in Khutsong, Carletonville, Tvl, on 2 February 1990. Mr Musaku`s employer was suspected of collaborating with the police by allowing them to drive his vehicles during attacks on the community. Those perceived as police collaborators were severely punished.

name: Bamu Janet Muthwa
description: She had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 9 December 1989 in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Dinga Joshua Muthwa
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 November 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Elias Sipho Mutwa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1991.

name: Caroline Muwanza
description: Was severely beaten by IFP supporters in August 1990 in Mzimhlope, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Mankuntswana Alfred Mvambi
description: He had his house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 28 June 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: B Mvelase
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Elizabeth Ketty Nomkhosi Mvelase
description: She lost her home in an arson attack in Ntenjana, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, during 1993, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Florence Mvelase
description: She had her house and possessions burnt in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Durban during 1991, allegedly because the family supported the ANC.

name: Joenah Jabulisile Mvelase
description: An ANC supporter who was severely harassed by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in February 1992. Her house was attacked and looted, and she was forced to leave the area.

name: John Vorster Mvelase
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mtembeni Mfanile Mvelase
description: An IFP supporter who had his house burnt down in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 1 January 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nkosikhona Mvelase
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Nthabiseng Gladness Mvelase
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was assaulted and shot by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 16 April 1994. She survived, but her female friend was shot dead in the same attack. The SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/1998/0079). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Sbongile Ntombemhlophe Mvelase
description: An IFP supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 19 June 1992.

name: Buyephi Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 2 July 1993. The attackers, who suspected the family of giving refuge to ANC supporters, barricaded the homestead to prevent any escapes, then hacked and shot family members. Eight people, including two children, died in the massacre.

name: Thulani Siphamandla Mvelase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named perpetrators near Estcourt, Natal, on 14 December 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Aphafaras Hlomela Mvokwe
description: Was shot and killed by IFP supporters in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Transvaal, on 12 May 1991. IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers were retaliating for a previous attack by ANC-supporting squatters and about one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt during this retaliation. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Thembeni Esther Mvubu
description: An IFP supporter who had her home petrol-bombed by ANC supporters in Amanzimtoti, near Durban, in March 1992.

name: Georgina Mvundale
description: Was assaulted and had a knife held at her throat by members of the `Gadaffi` faction of the ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) in Khutsong, Carletonville, Tvl, in June 1990. Ms Mvundale`s sons were members of the rival `Zim-Zim` faction of the KYC. Ms Mvundale was reportedly so frightened during the attack that she subsequently died of a heart attack.

name: Amon Bhekelakhe Mvundla
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead at Nkulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 August 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His son was shot dead a week later, also in the course of political violence.

name: David Sengeni Mvundla
description: Was shot dead in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 August 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His father had been shot dead in similar circumstances a week earlier.

name: Gwaziwe Mvundla
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1991.

name: Katshana Mvundla
description: Was shot dead in Mbayimbayi, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 June 1993, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Lungisile Mvundla
description: Was shot dead in Mbayimbayi, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 June 1993, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mantombi Eslina Mvundla
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in the Goshi area, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in September 1992.

name: Msitho Mvundla
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters at Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 September 1992.

name: Robert Msithwa Mvundla
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP members at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 September 1992.

name: Sylvia Ntuthu Mvundla
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed by IFP supporters at Mjika, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 14 June 1992.

name: Thulisile Purity Mvundla
description: A member of the IFP Youth Brigade who was shot dead, allegedly by ANC members, at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Mthiyonke Mvune
description: An IFP chairperson who had his house in Amanzimtoti, near Durban, petrol-bombed by ANC supporters on 13 October 1992. Mr Mvune`s wife was burnt to death in the attack.

name: Nzanana Linah Mvune
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death when ANC supporters petrol-bombed her home in Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 13 October 1992. Her husband was an IFP chairperson.

name: Rose Makhosi Mthethwa
description: She had her house burnt down by named IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sabatha Irene Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down and her shop looted by IFP supporters in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sabelo Mthethwa
description: Was shot dead when a named perpetratrator attacked his grandfather`s home at Obanjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 4 April 1990. The attack was aimed at Sabelo`s grandfather, a councillor to a local chief, because he was suspected of joining the ANC and planning to overthrow the chief. His grandfather and his brother, aged 7, were also shot dead in the attack.

name: Shonaphi Sindisiwe Mthethwa
description: She had her three houses in Ncekwane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down on 23 October 1991 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sibeko Mthethwa
description: He had his home burnt down in Empangeni, Natal, in 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sibongile Mthethwa
description: She had her house burnt down in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sikelela Mthethwa
description: Was stabbed and injured during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 15 March 1994.

name: Sipho Percy Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a security guard outside the IFP-dominated railway hostel at Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 19 August 1991.

name: Sizeka Busisiwe Mthethwa
description: Was shot and injured when unidentified persons attacked her aunt`s home at Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 13 July 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Hlengiwe Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 2 July 1993. The attackers suspected the family of giving refuge to ANC supporters. They barricaded the homestead to prevent any escapes, then hacked and shot family members. Eight people, including two children, died in the massacre.

name: Thokozile Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Kwa-Mbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 5 November 1993.

name: Thulani Alfred Mthethwa
description: Was shot and injured at Empangeni, Natal, on 21 February 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thuleleni Mthethwa
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 25 August 1991.

name: Vusumzi Vincent Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in KwaMashu, Durban, on 3 December 1993, when a group of IFP supporters from a hostel in Duffs Road allegedly boarded a commuter train and started attacking people.

name: Xolani Mthethwa
description: Was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Clermont, near Durban, on 17 August 1990. Mr Mthethwa was believed to be an IFP supporter.

name: Xolani Mthethwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 18 July 1992. His father and brother were  killed in the same incident.

name: Yithuma Mthethwa
description: She had her house and posssessions destroyed in an arson atack by ANC supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in August 1991, allegedly because she stayed in an IFP stronghold.

name: Zinhle Mthethwa
description: She had her home at Mpuma-langa, KwaZulu, near Durban, destroyed by ANC supporters on 21 August 1991 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Ngenzeni Margaret Mthethwo
description: She had her house in Eshowe, Natal, burnt down in 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Ambrose Mthimkhulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 22 February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ambrose Mthimkhulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 22 February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Billy Caswell Mthimkhulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Evaton, Transvaal, on 26 June 1993.

name: Lefa Mthimkhulu
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters while attending a wedding at Meadowlands, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 30 May 1992. The IFP often attacked ANC supporters at social gatherings to spread fear that the ANC was unable to protect its members.

name: Paul Nkosi Mthimkhulu
description: Was abducted, shot and burnt to death by IFP-aligned Khetisi Kheswa gang members in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 18 April 1992. The IFP often used gangs in their conflict with the ANC.

name: Raymond Mthimkhulu
description: He lost all his possessions when his home and car were set alight by IFP supporters on 11 May 1991 in Tembisa, Transvaal, during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Ntombini Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, 2 July 1993. The attackers, who suspected the family of giving refuge to ANC supporters, barricaded the homestead to prevent any escapes, then hacked and shot family members. Eight people, including two children, died in the massacre.

name: Solekile Mtolo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on 2 July 1993 in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal. The attackers, who suspected the family of giving refuge to ANC supporters, barricaded the homestead to prevent any escapes, then hacked and shot family members. Eight people, including two children, died in the massacre.

name: Sidney Tumisani `Papa` Mvelase
description: An NUM official and ANC supporter from Ditlhake, Koffiefontein, Orange Free State (OFS), died in Kimberley hospital, Cape, on 5 September 1988. Mr Mvelase had left home the previous day wearing a political T-shirt. The family members who identified the body attested to the fact that it bore severe head wounds, bruises and signs of torture to the genitals. There was a strong police presence at his funeral.

name: Thembinkosi Mthinyane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot by ANC supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 25 September 1992. He died in hospital five days later. Mr Mthinyane had been harassed and threatened before the attack.

name: Ambrose Mthiya
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by IFP supporters during a petrol bomb attack on his home in Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 22 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. He has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Ambrose Mthiya
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by IFP supporters during a petrol bomb attack on his home in Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 22 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. He has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Bangiwe Promise Mthiya
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nelisiwe Mthiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nqenwase Gugulabasha Mthiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Vimbephi Mavis Mthiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Alson Mthiyane
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Alson Mthiyane
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bheki Mthiyane
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and hacked to death by ANC supporters in Kwa-Mbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 20 January 1992. His house was burnt down the next day. The perpetrators, two of whom are named, allegedly attacked him because he refused to join the ANC.

name: Edmund Mthiyane
description: He had his house in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, destroyed in continuing political conflict between local IFP and ANC supporters in April 1993.

name: Enock Mbuso Mthiyane
description: He had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Nqolothi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 July 1990 in intense political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Mr Mthiyane had allegedly refused to join the IFP.

name: George Mzwake Mthiyane
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and had his house burnt down in an attack by IFP supporters in Ngonweni, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 27 January 1993.

name: Hlanganisile Florence Mthiyane
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Amaoti, Inanda, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 13 June 1991. Ms Mthinyane`s husband was shot and injured in the attack.

name: Hopewell Mthembeni Mthiyane
description: He had his house burnt down in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in April 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Lindumusa Norman Mthiyane
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 29 September 1992. The perpetrators, two of whom are named, allegedly attacked him because he refused to join the ANC.

name: Dlomoyi Simon Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ogunjini, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 17 August 1990 in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Dumisani Mthembu
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was shot dead during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Fani Caleb Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in KwaSokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 February 1992.

name: Francisca Mthembu
description: She had her rondavels burnt down at Entenjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 27 November 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Gini Mitta Mthembu
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at Estcourt, Natal, on 2 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Ms Mthembu had fled her house when it was petrol-bombed, but the perpetrators pursued her and her son into a church where they had sought refuge, and killed them both.

name: Gini Mitta Mthembu
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at Estcourt, Natal, on 2 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Ms Mthembu had fled her house when it was petrol-bombed, but the perpetrators pursued her and her son into a church where they had sought refuge, and killed them both.

name: Goodness Qondeni Mthembu
description: Was shot dead by a named perpetrator at KwaMashu, Durban, in 1991, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Grace Bambekile Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni,  Natal,  on 2 February 1993.

name: Jabu Zikhokhile Mthembu
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in an attack on her family home at Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 November 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Two children in the family were also severely injured in the attack, and the family home was burnt down.

name: Jabulani Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1993.

name: Jeffrey Dututu Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 4 December 1991.

name: Keli Wiseman Mkhuphukeli Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 December 1991.

name: Khaya John Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and burnt to death when the car in which he was travelling was ambushed and petrol-bombed by ANC supporters, some of whom are named, at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 30 April 1991. The perpetrators claimed the attack was in reprisal for the killing of six ANC supporters in the area. Another IFP supporter, who was in the car with Mr Mthembu, also died in the attack.

name: Khokhi Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1991. She had allegedly left the IFP to join the ANC.

name: Kwazikwakhe Mfana Mthembu
description: He had his house petrol-bombed by IFP supporters in Sundumbili, Kwa-Zulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 6 July 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Lingsay Bhekukwenza Mthembu
description: He had his house at Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, burnt down in April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Lingsay Bhekukwenza Mthembu
description: He had his house at Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, burnt down in April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mabhoyi Elphas Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who had his house burnt down by ANC supporters in Entoweni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 December 1990.

name: Makhanyi Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in Qhibukhowe, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 18 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. She was allegedly killed for failing to attend IFP meetings.

name: Makhanyi Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in Qhibukhowe, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 18 March 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. She was allegedly killed for failing to attend IFP meetings.

name: Makhosi Elakini Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by unnamed IFP supporters at Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 May 1994 in political conflict following the April 1994 elections.

name: Makhosi Elakini Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by unnamed IFP supporters at Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 May 1994 in political conflict following the April 1994 elections.

name: Mano Caleb Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters, at KwaDabeka, near Pinetown, Natal, on 5 May 1992.

name: Mbhekeni Isaac Mthembu
description: He had his home burnt down at Obanjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mbhekeni Isaac Mthembu
description: He had his home burnt down at Obanjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mellina Thembie Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Kwa-Dlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 April 1993. Ms Mthembu was allegedly targeted because her sons had refused to join the IFP.

name: Mhlushwa Samuel Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who had his home at Malagazi, Umlazi, Durban, petrol-bombed by ANC supporters on 16 June 1991.

name: Musawenkosi Amos Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured in, Inkanyezi, Port Shepstone, Natal, when IFP supporters attacked the house in which he was staying on 6 May 1991. Two ANC supporters were killed in the attack, three others were injured. The victims were in hiding, as they had heard of an impending attack.

name: Ndabane Emmanuel Mthembu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured by ANC supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 1 August 1992.

name: Nkosinathi Alpheus Raymond Mthembu
description: An ANC member who was beaten to death in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Eshowe, Natal, on 15 December 1992.

name: Nkosinathi Sonnyboy Mthembu
description: He had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 April 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nomsa Mthembu
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in ongoing political conflict at KwaSokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni,  Natal,  on 4 August 1992.

name: Nomthandazo Confidence Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who had her home set alight by named IFP supporters at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1993. Ms Mthembu`s mother witnessed the attack and gave a statement to the police. The perpetrators returned on 1 May 1993, shot her mother dead and stabbed her niece to death.

name: Nomthandazo Confidence Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who had her home set alight by named IFP supporters at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1993. Ms Mthembu`s mother witnessed the attack and gave a statement to the police. The perpetrators returned on 1 May 1993, shot her mother dead and stabbed her niece to death.

name: Nomusa Margaret Mthembu
description: She had her house and her business destroyed in an arson attack at Ncekwane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomusa Margaret Mthembu
description: She had her house and her business destroyed in an arson attack at Ncekwane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombi Gladys Mthembu
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in an ANC stronghold at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban on 19 April 1992. She was allegedly targeted because she was perceived to have sympathies with the ANC.

name: Petros Thulani Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was injured in an attack by a group of named people, both IFP and ANC supporters, in Empangeni, Natal, on 17 June 1993. On 22 July 1993, he was shot and severely injured by the same perpetrators, who allegedly accused him of recruiting IFP supporters.

name: Petros Thulani Mthembu
description: An ANC supporter who was injured in an attack by a group of named people, both IFP and ANC supporters, in Empangeni, Natal, on 17 June 1993. On 22 July 1993, he was shot and severely injured by the same perpetrators, who allegedly accused him of recruiting IFP supporters.

name: Zapo Michael Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death by IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 July 1991.

name: Zinhle Cecilia Ndlovu
description: She lost her houses in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in December 1992.

name: Zinhle Nomusa Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Samuel Ndlozi
description: An employee of Rand Water who was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) while he was travelling in a taxi past the informal settlement of Phola Park in Tokoza, Tvl, on 26 February 1992. Four people died and eight were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack on the taxi (AC/1999/0225).

name: Obed Mnyaza Ndala
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and held in solitary confinement after an attack in 1982 by supporters of Chief Mahlangu on KwaNdebele villagers who opposed his appointment.

name: Busisiwe Ndlovu
description: She lost the contents of her home and tearoom in an attack by ANC supporters during political conflict in Empangeni, Natal, on 7 June 1992.

name: Abraham Walter Magama Ndo
description: He survived a shooting incident in which a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on Mr Ndo and his friend in Vosloorus, Transvaal, on 2 Febru a ry 1993. Mr Ndo’s friend was shot dead by the SDU member, who believed he was under attack when he opened fire. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2001/140). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Mukhacani Samson Ndobe
description: Was injured in a hand grenade explosion in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 31 July 1992. An ANC self-defence unit (SDU) member threw the grenade while in a confrontation with police. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/090).

name: Nomthandazo Magdaline Ndobe
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 February 1990 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Vukile ‘Pikoko’ Ndongeni
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and severely beaten by named vigilantes, together with police, in Robertson, Cape, on 15 June 1986. He was then detained under emergency regulations for three months. See police brutality.

name: Gladness Bongi Ndovela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at KwaXolo, near Ramsgate, Natal, on 6 March 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Gladness Bongi Ndovela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at KwaXolo, near Ramsgate, Natal, on 6 March 1994 during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Owen Zanini Ndovela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 15 August 1992.

name: Sibodade Ndovela
description: She lost her home and all her possessions in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 April 1994, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sibodade Ndovela
description: She lost her home and all her possessions in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 April 1994, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Simphiwe Cent Ndovela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 September 1992, allegedly because he refused to take part in an IFP self-defence training camp.

name: Phillip Dilikile Mzizi
description: A school principal who lost his home in an arson attack by ANC supporters during intense public unrest in Duncan Village, East London, on 12 August 1985. Mr Mzizi was targeted because he was perceived to be a collaborator.

name: Mongezi Martin Ndudula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by ADM supporters during political conflict in Dimbaza, Ciskei, on 23 December 1993.

name: Terry Ndukwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by gunmen in a red minibus in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 3 May 1992 during political conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Nomusa Nduli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nsimangwana Khipheni Nduli
description: Was shot dead and her house was burnt down by ANC supporters during intense political conflict at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombiyesizwe Nduli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembakuphi Ndulini
description: Was shot and killed in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 8 September 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Doris Ndumo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 3 December 1993.

name: Sipho Wellington Ndumo
description: An IFP supporter who was stoned by ANC supporters on 15 January 1992 during a violent labour dispute in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Transvaal, between members of COSATU-aligned FAW/U and IFP-aligned UWUSA.

name: Tobi Martha Ndumo
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Nkwezela, Bulwer, Natal, in April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Tobi Martha Ndumo
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Nkwezela, Bulwer, Natal, in April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Christopher Fanile Ndwalane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, in December 1990.

name: Irene Love Ndwalane
description: She had her house in Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 25 December 1990 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Ivy Goko Ndwalane
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters during political conflict in Mbayimbayi, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 14 January 1991. She was reportedly killed because she was not attending IFP meetings and because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Liwa Sivyon Ndwalane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 July 1991. Mr Ndwalane, known to be an IFP member, was travelling in an ANC no-go area.

name: Momo Wilton Ndwalane
description: An IFP supporter and induna who was shot dead by unidentified ANC supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 December 1991, allegedly because of his political affiliation and position.

name: Moto Ndwalane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by named ANC supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 20 July 1992.

name: Newone Ndwalane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters in the Mbotsha area near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 27 December 1990.

name: Patrick Wasazi Ndwalane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by fellow ANC supporters during internal political conflict in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 November 1990.

name: Richard Ndwalane
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in the Mgaga area, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 November 1992.

name: Salukazi Patricia Ndwalane
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Bethany Mission, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down on 11 March 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thandazile Gretta Ndwalane
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Marina Beach, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 30 August 1992.

name: Beatrice Ndwandwe
description: She lost her house and possessions in an arson attack in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in early 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Elphas Ndwandwe
description: was killed during an attack by armed ANC members on the house of a school principal in Phola township, Ogies, Transvaal, on 13 October 1991. The principal was regarded as an IFP sympathiser because IFP supporters often visited him at home. One ANC member was granted amnesty for his role in the attack (AC/2000/091).

name: Fikile Betty Ndwandwe
description: She lost her home in an arson attack by named and other ANC supporters during political conflict in Umlazi, Durban, in November 1989. She was allegedly attacked because her son and grandson refused to join the ANC

name: Fundakwezakhe Ndwandwe
description: An employee of Rand Water who was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) while he was travelling in a taxi past the informal settlement of Phola Park in Tokoza, Tvl, on 26 February 1992. Four people died and eight were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack on the taxi (AC/1999/0225). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Mzikayifani Ndwandwe
description: An employee of Rand Water who was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) while he was travelling in a taxi past the informal settlement of Phola Park in Tokoza, Tvl, on 26 February 1992. Four people died and eight were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack on the taxi (AC/1999/0225). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Naniwe Zofonia Ndzimela
description: An ANC activist who was detained for three years in Bizana, Transkei, and tortured for his involvement in the Nonqulwana incident. Mr Ndzimela suffered severe ill-health for the rest of his life. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Saul Ngxamile Ndzimela
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and beaten while in detention in Bizana, Transkei, in June 1960, because of his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Busisiwe Elca Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Woodyglen, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in July 1989. About 1 000 homes were badly damaged or destroyed in political violence in Mpumalanga that year, leaving many dead and thousands homeless.

name: Sandile Mzizi
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted and killed by IFP supporters at KwaMadlala, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 May 1994, shortly after the April 1994 elections.

name: Sandile Mzizi
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted and killed by IFP supporters at KwaMadlala, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 May 1994, shortly after the April 1994 elections.

name: Lena Mashaya Mzelema
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Mahwaqa, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down in 1990 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Muzikayise Charles Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely beaten by members of the Amasinyora gang in KwaMashu, Durban, in 1991. He was presumed to be an ANC supporter because he was in KwaMashu. See Amasinyora.

name: Christopher Mandlakayisa Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu’s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Fano Ncube
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down by ANC supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in April 1993

name: Eunice Badumile Mzelemu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Mdlazi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 16 July 1992. She had fled the area the day before the attack.

name: Hlanganani Stanley Mzelemu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 3 July 1991, and had his house in Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Johannes Mzelemu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and burnt to death at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 14 September 1992 during continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Mhlabunzima Johannes Mzelemu
description: Was forced to flee his home at Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1992 because of ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ndkuzempi Emmanuel Blackstone Mzelemu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed, shot and injured by IFP supporters in Isigedleni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 July 1991.

name: Ndukuzempi William Mzelemu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot at and his house was destroyed by named IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 April 1994. Nine members of his family were killed after he had addressed mourners at the funeral of an ANC supporter. See Mzelemu killings.

name: Patricia Zithobile Mzelemu
description: An IFP supporter who was severely beaten by ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992. The perpetrators were allegedly trying to force young people to join the ANC to fight against the IFP. Ms Mzelemu`s sister was also severely beaten in the attack.

name: Princess Thandiwe Mzelemu
description: An IFP supporter who was severely beaten by ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992. The perpetrators were allegedly trying to force young people to join the ANC to fight against the IFP. Ms Mzelemu`s sister was also severely beaten in the attack.

name: Simon Bhekinkosi Mzelemu
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by ANC supporters, two of whom are named, in Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1993.

name: Siphiwe Simon Mzelemu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 September 1993.

name: Zithulile Mzelemu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 1 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His house was burnt down a week later.

name: Zithulile Mzelemu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 1 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His house was burnt down a week later.

name: Bethuel Thulani Mzibuko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Park Station, Johannesburg, in October 1993. After increasing train violence, unions established train sectors to inform commuters on social and political issues, as attackers allegedly announced that they were looking for `Mandela`s children`. The IFP took responsiblity for some of the attacks, allegedly in retaliation against ANC supporters who refused to allow them to board trains.

name: Bheki Martin Mzila
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Bhekulwandle, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 13 October 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Three other family members, including two children, were shot and killed in the attack.

name: Busisiwe Zanyana Mzila
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 May 1992.

name: Makhosazane Eunice Mzila
description: had her house in Nhlalakahle, Greytown, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mfavela Alpheus Mzila
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters during political conflict in Greytown, Natal, on 5 December 1994.

name: (First Name Not Given) Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters in Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Babhekile Mzimela
description: Was hacked to death by named IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 November 1992. Ms Mzimela was allegedly targeted because her children were ANC supporters.

name: Bheki Kenneth Mzimela
description: An induna and ANC supporter who was shot and killed by IFP members during political violence at Nyoni, KwaZulu, near Gingindlovu, Natal, on 23 March 1993. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Chester Busisiwe Mzimela
