description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Chester Busisiwe Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Cyprian Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 January 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His body was found two days later.

name: Elsie Mzimela
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1993, allegedly because she was believed to be an ANC supporter.

name: Mbhekeni Phumehlehla Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in his home in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 February 1992.

name: Mildred Mzimela
description: She had her home in Mandini, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack on 5 December 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mngunikacandulwa Mzimela
description: He had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in June 1992 in continuing political violence between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mzobanzi Isaac Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack in Mandini, Natal, on 5 December 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nkosingiphile Mhlongo Mzimela
description: Was hacked to death on 22 November 1992, when IFP supporters attacked her family`s home in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Nkuva Mbongeni Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 27 December 1993.

name: Sandile Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and permanently disabled by IFP supporters near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 April 1994, the day of Nelson Mandela`s inauguration as President.

name: Sibani Mbekeni Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who was killed when IFP supporters attacked the bus on which he was travelling in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 February 1994.

name: Sikulute Mzimela
description: She had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down on 20 March 1994 in violent conflict between supporters of the ANC and IFP. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Siphiwe Ntombenzima Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by a named IFP supporter on 12 February 1992.

name: Thandekile Mantombi Mzimela
description: She had her house burnt down in Ndabayakhe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1993. Ms Mzimela and her family had received death threats before the attack.

name: Thembi Mirriam Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack by other ANC supporters at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 25 September 1990, in a serious internal power struggle within the organisation.

name: Thozo Mkhize Mzimela
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 February 1992 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Tokozani Mzimela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in Macekane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 October 1993. Mr Mzimela was paralysed as a result of the shooting.

name: Elias Siqaqa Mzindle
description: An IFP supporter who was stoned to death by ANC supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 18 May 1991. He was on his way to work when he was attacked.

name: Fanile Carphas Mzindle
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 18 February 1992. The perpetrators were allegedly forcing boys to attend an imbizo.

name: Gimbi Lungi Mzindle
description: A member of the IFP Youth Brigade who was shot dead, allegedly by ANC members, at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Mantombi Mzindle
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 17 June 1993. Ms Mzimdle was allegedly targeted because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Maqhawe Michael Gugulakhe Mzindle
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed by ANC supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 18 April 1991.

name: Meslina Duduzile Mzindle
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in KwaXolo, near Ramsgate, Natal, destroyed by IFP supporters in April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. She was forced to leave the area.

name: Meslina Duduzile Mzindle
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in KwaXolo, near Ramsgate, Natal, destroyed by IFP supporters in April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. She was forced to leave the area.

name: Ntombi Ella Mzindle
description: An ANC supporter who had to relocate after her home in KwaXaba, near Port Shepstone, Natal, was burnt down by alleged IFP supporters in July 1991.

name: Ntombinkulu Charity Mzindle
description: A member of the IFP Youth Brigade who was shot dead, allegedly by ANC members, at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Sarah Nukiwe Mzindle
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 18 May 1991.

name: Zenzele Alfred Mzindle
description: Was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 9 March 1991. He was the brother of an ANC supporter.

name: (First Name Not Given) Mzinhle
description: Was shot and severely injured in an attack by IFP supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 31 May 1991. At the time of the attack Mr Mzinhle was visiting a family believed to be ANC supporters.

name: Bizani Clementia Mzizi
description: She lost her home in Umlazi, Durban, in an arson attack on 22 June 1992 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Cosmos Mbonwa Mzizi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 February 1994.

name: Gertrude Mzizi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Tvl, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Mbongeni Mzizi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Polela, Bulwer, Natal, on 4 March 1993. One other ANC supporter was killed in the attack.

name: Mjanyelwa Mzizi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 15 November 1992.

name: Nkosinathi Bhonobhono Mzizi
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed, shot and injured by ANC supporters in Umlazi, Durban, in October 1993.

name: Nokuthula Mzizi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Bulwer, Natal, on 20 February 1993.

name: Nondipentoni Ndamase
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Boyi Zephania Ndawo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 12 March 1993.

name: Johannes Ndawo
description: He had his house burnt down by ANC supporters during ongoing political conflict in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 March 1992.

name: Falaza Alfred Ndawonde
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142)

name: Ntombi Clementina Ndawonde
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 15 January 1991 and again on 19 January 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Ntombi Clementina Ndawonde
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 15 January 1991 and again on 19 January 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thokozani Brian Ndebele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Dumbe, Paulpietersburg, Natal, on 18 November 1993.

name: Khanyisile Ndelu
description: An ANC support who had her home and possessions burnt in an arson attack in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 August 1993.

name: Mbandla Ndelu
description: He disappeared during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 6 January 1991. He has never been seen again.

name: Mhlushekelwa Ndelu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead during political conflict near Hammarsdale, Natal, on 2 January 1993, allegedly because he was wearing an IFP T-shirt.

name: Nellie Nakekile Ndelu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Umkomaas, near Durban, in August 1991.

name: Kaya Sherpard Ndevu
description: An ANC member who was shot and severely injured at his home in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 14 November 1990, by named perpetrators associated with the Lingelethu West Town Council, in a period of heightened conflict between the ANC and the town council. Mr Ndevu’s colleague died in the shooting.

name: Cynthia Ndhela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP members at Lower Illovo, near Durban, on 14 November 1993.

name: Nomadlozi Ndhlazi
description: She lost her home in an arson attack by ANC supporters during political conflict at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 3 January 1990.

name: Annah Mampe Ndhlovu
description: She lost her home in an arson attack by ‘comrades’ in Sebokeng, Transvaal, in April 1992 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Michael Sphiwe Ndhlovu
description: Was shot dead by an IFP supporter in Alexandra, Johannesburg, while attending a night vigil on 26 March 1991. The incident occurred during heightened conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Phumuwakhe Jan Ndhlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 9 July 1991.

name: Busiswe Ndima
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured in Tokoza, Tvl, on 4 November 1993, allegedly by ANC supporters.

name: Mandlenkosi Ndima
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe’s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Bakhethile Thokozile Ndimande
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by named IFP supporters at Mandini, Natal, on 13 January 1994.

name: Duduzile Eunice Ndimande
description: Was shot dead in Mahlabatini, near Ulundi, KwaZulu/Natal, on 12 July 1993 in continuing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Two of her three children sustained serious gunshot injuries in the attack.

name: Gilbert Msongelwa Ndimande
description: Was stabbed to death by ANC members during political conflict at KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 15 January 1991.

name: Jeremiah Ndimande
description: Was shot and killed in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 5 August 1992.

name: Ntombifuthi Precious Ndimande
description: Was burnt to death in an arson attack on her home in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, by alleged IFP supporters on 29 October 1993, because she lived in an ANC stronghold.

name: Thulile Ndimande
description: Was shot and injured in Mahlabatini, near Ulundi, KwaZulu/Natal, on 12 July 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. His mother was shot dead in the attack, and his sister was shot and injured.

name: Thulisile Ndimande
description: Was shot and injured in Mahlabatini, near Ulundi, KwaZulu/Natal, on 12 July 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her mother was shot dead in the attack, and her brother was shot and injured.

name: Ayanda Ndinisa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by masked gunmen who burst into his home and opened fire on the family in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 19 March 1993. Three family members were shot dead and two injured in the attack. One perpetrator, allegedly associated with a local Crossroads leader, was later convicted and jailed for the attack. He was refused amnesty.

name: December Ephraim Ndlovu
description: An ANC member who was shot by IFP members during political conflict between the Black Cats and ANC supporters at Thembisa, Ermelo, Eastern Tvl, on 7 October 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Phillemon Nqaba Nede
description: Was severely beaten by a named farmer in March 1990 in Elliot, Cape, allegedly because he attended an ANC march to register grievances and demands at the magistrate’s office. He later died of the injuries sustained during the beating.

name: Alfred Sybruck Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 November 1992.

name: Delisile Linah Ndlovu
description: Was severely beaten and had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, during May 1990. Ms Ndlovu was nine months pregnant, and allegedly miscarried as a result of the attack.

name: Ambrose Ndiyase
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 11 March 1994. He had been accused of providing IFP supporters with traditional medicine to protect them from bullets.

name: Mzingelwa Elija Ndlovu
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters during political conflict at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 21 March 1993.

name: Johannes Ncube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on 22 March 1994 in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in intense political conflict in the area. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Manukelana George Ncube
description: An IFP supporter who lost his house in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1993.

name: Mary Mamolefe Ncube
description: An ANCWL member who was badly burnt in a petrol bomb attack on her home in Tembisa, Transvaal, by IFP supporters during November 1990. Her activist husband and other family members were injured in the same attack.

name: Masesi Ncube
description: She sustained head injuries when IFP supporters petrol-bombed her parents’ home in Tembisa, Transvaal, in November 1990. Her parents were ANC activists.

name: Mvumeni Ncube
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by ANC supporters at Nqutshini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 30 April 1994, during the April 1994 elections.

name: Mvumeni Ncube
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by ANC supporters at Nqutshini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 30 April 1994, during the April 1994 elections.

name: Nelson Ntelezi Ncube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217).

name: Nomusa Ncube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and burnt to death on 11 September 1992, when armed gunmen attacked a number of houses believed to belong to ANC supporters at Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. Six people were killed, all members of her family, and several homes were burnt down.

name: Ntelezi Ncube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 21 June 1991. See Richmond attacks.

name: Tholithemba Bongani Ncube
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down when armed gunmen attacked a number of homes believed to belong to ANC supporters in Gobandlovu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 September 1992. Six people were killed and several houses burnt down.

name: Ambrose Zibindoda Ncwane
description: An ANC supporter who had his home and crops burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaZuba, Umkomaas, near Durban, in 1992.

name: Menziwa Ezra Ncwane
description: Was severely beaten and left partially paralysed by named perpetrators on 7 September 1992 in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His father was an IFP member.

name: Phyllis Nokuthula Ncwane
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house and property in an attack by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in 1992.

name: Esau Ncwango
description: He had his house and possessions burnt in an arson attack in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Eshowe, Natal, in March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Esau Ncwango
description: He had his house and possessions burnt in an arson attack in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Eshowe, Natal, in March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Amos Ndaba
description: An IFP supporter who was stoned by ANC supporters in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Tvl, on 10 August 1992.

name: Caiphus Ndaba
description: Was shot dead along with a friend. They had their shack burnt down by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) and ANC-supporting residents in the Power Park squatter camp, in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 9 April 1994. The residents suspected them of being IFP supporters. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0319).

name: Emily Ndaba
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1991.

name: Eunice Nozizwe Ndaba
description: She had her house burnt down on 30 April 1990 in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal, by a group of men carrying traditional weapons and allegedly looking for ANC supporters. Nine homes were burnt in the area that day. At the time ANC supporters were also killed in an attempt to prevent the setting up of local ANC branches in the area.

name: Khona David Ndaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 July 1992. Eight people were killed and at least ten seriously injured in IFP attacks in the area.

name: Makhambule Eunice Ndaba
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt by named perpetrators in Matatiele, Transkei, on 30 April 1990. A group of men associated with the traditional authorities and opposed to the launch of an ANC branch attacked numerous homes and persons associated with the ANC.

name: Mbalekelwa Jamblead Ndaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in eThandakukhanya, Piet Retief, Transvaal, on 20 August 1993.

name: Nkanyiso Patrick Ndaba
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 7 July 1991 during conflict in the area between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Nombuyiselo Selina Ndaba
description: An ANCWL supporter who was shot and wounded in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 15 April 1993 in one of many drive-by shootings after the assassination of Chris Hani. Residents barricaded roads to protect themselves from attack. When neighbours rushed out to help Ms Ndaba, the attackers doubled back and shot several of them. Ms Ndaba died seven months later.

name: Ntombentsundu Gladys Ndaba
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down on 30 April 1990 in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal, by a group of men carrying traditional weapons and allegedly looking for ANC supporters. Nine homes were burnt in the area that day. At the time ANC supporters were also killed in an attempt to prevent the setting up of local ANC branches in the area.

name: Ntombizodwa Maureen Ndaba
description: An ANC supporter who had her hose burnt down by named IFP supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, in July 1991.

name: Phetheni Ellen Ndaba
description: She had her house petrol-bombed by ANC supporters in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Tvl, on 10 August 1992 during conflict in the area between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Sibahle Cyprian Ndaba
description: An ANC supporter and member of the Wembezi Crisis Committee at Wembezi, Kwazulu, near Estcourt, Natal, who was threatened and intimidated by named IFP supporters during the course of 1991. Members of the committee were often ill-treated and threatened by IFP supporters, allegedly because the committee was seen as posing a threat to the party.

name: Busisiwe Ndabambi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal, on 30 April 1990, by a group of men carrying traditional weapons and allegedly looking for ANC supporters. Nine homes were burnt in the area that day. At the time ANC supporters were also killed in an attempt to prevent the setting up of local ANC branches in the area.

name: Emelina Ndabandaba
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, in 1993.

name: Vuyiswa Nobongile Ndabayipheli
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters during conflict between the ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, during June 1993.

name: Athenkosi ‘Att’ Makosonke Eric Ndabeni
description: Was killed by ANC supporters in Plettenberg Bay, Cape, on 10 May 1993. He was killed shortly after his release from prison, allegedly because he was suspected by his fellow ‘comrades’ of being a police informer.

name: Joseph Vondo Ndabeni
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1993.

name: Zweledinga Ndadana
description: An ANC member who was assaulted while in detention in May 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Bafana Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mbulelo Boy Nako
description: An ANC supporter who was on his way home when he was abducted by members of the Three Million gang in Kroonstad, OFS, on 3 June 1991. A week later he was found burnt to death.

name: Nester Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by named IFP supporters on 3 March 1994. The attack was allegedly directed against her sons, who were ANC supporters. One son was shot dead in the attack.

name: Bonakele Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bonginkosi Aaron Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked and his home was destroyed by an ANC self-defence unit in KwaMashu, Durban, in March 1991, allegedly in a serious internal dispute.

name: Gretta Jabulisile Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in March 1992.

name: Gudlumkhonto Derrick Mzobe
description: An IFP supporter who was axed and shot dead by ANC supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 17 March 1991.

name: Hlanganisile Christobel Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Joseph Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured in an attack by IFP supporters in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 17 October 1992. His house was burnt down in the attack.

name: Kohlwangifile Elias Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lungile Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mbongeni Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 22 March 1994, days after the Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mphendukelwa Mzobe
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by ANC supporters, who left his body at Izotsha, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 30 September 1991.

name: Neni Mzobe
description: Was stabbed to death by IFP supporters who attacked her home in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 September 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. One other person was killed and one stabbed and severely injured in the attack.

name: Nosipho Mzobe
description: Was stabbed and injured in October 1992 when IFP supporters attacked homes in the ANC stronghold of Magcino in the Shlazeni Reserve, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban. Nine ANC supporters were killed and 18 others wounded. More than 36 houses and huts were burnt down. Nosipho`s brother and father were also injured in the attack.

name: Sibonelo Mzobe
description: He died when he was stabbed and thrown into a burning house in Umkomaas, Natal, on 17 October 1992. His father was an ANC supporter, and the family was attacked by IFP supporters.

name: Sibongiseni Shadrack Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sibongiseni Shadrack Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thulani Wilson Mzobe
description: He died of multiple injuries sustained in an attack on his home on 17 October 1991 in Mtengwane, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. See Mtengwane attack.

name: Zeblon Zibuse Mzobe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in KwaXaba, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 July 1991.

name: Bhekani Simon Mzolo
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, in June 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mthandeni Caiphus Mzolo
description: An ANC supporter who died in hospital after being ambushed and shot in Nhlalakahle, Greytown, Natal, on 15 January 1994. His brother and his father, a prominent ANC leader, were also killed in the course of political violence in the area.

name: Ndoda Mzolo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by a named IFP supporter in New Hanover, near Pietermaritzburg, on 2 November 1991.

name: Solomon Nganencane Mzolo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named ANC supporters at a peace meeting in Nhlalakahle township hall, Greytown, Natal, on 26 February 1994, in internal party conflict. Mr Mzolo was believed to have been associated with the killing of a prominent ANC leader.

name: Augustine Bajabulile Mzulwini
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in October 1992. She was allegedly targeted because her two sons were believed to be ANC supporters.

name: Bhekamakhosi Mzulwini
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 December 1992 in ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His brother was also killed in the attack.

name: Hlekisiwe Liye Mzulwini
description: He had his home in Empangeni, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1993.

name: Mfanazane Robert Mzulwini
description: He lost his home in an arson attack in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, in January 1991 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mzomeli Mzulwini
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 December 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His brother was also killed in the attack.

name: Phylllis Vasendha Ruth Naidoo
description: An ANC member from Durban who was injured in a letter bomb explosion on 5 July 1979 in Maseru, Lesotho. Five other persons were injured in the explosion. Her son, an ANC member, was later killed in Zambia in 1989. Ms Naidoo had previously been detained and house arrested in South Africa in the 1960s.

name: Prema Naidoo
description: An ANC supporter and trade union activist who was detained at John Vorster Square, Johannesburg in 1982 where he was kept in solitary confinement, tortured, severely assaulted and kept awake for six days and nights, allegedly by named members of the security forces. He was later sentenced to eighteen months’ imprisonment for harbouring and assisting a prisoner who escaped from Pretoria Central prison, Pretoria, to leave the country.

name: Pat Ndlala
description: An IFP member who suffered damage to property when his house was burnt down by ANC members during political conflict in Heidelberg, Tvl, in 1992 or 1993. Mr Ndlala and two other suspected IFP members were on an ANC hit list and were therefore targeted. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/064).

name: Nkanyiso Reginald Ndlovu
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 23 March 1994, in political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nkanyiso Reginald Ndlovu
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 23 March 1994, in political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Khantshi Willie Nembidzani
description: Was detained and tortured in Alexandra, Johannesburg, in April 1993 during conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Eugene Senzo Nembula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in the heart by an IFP supporter in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 12 November 1992. The incident followed the killing of a police officer.

name: Thiyabantu Nembula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by an IFP supporter in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 9 December 1992.

name: December Anthony Nene
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Bhekezulu, Estcourt, Natal, on 11 January 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: December Anthony Nene
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Bhekezulu, Estcourt, Natal, on 11 January 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Elizabeth Nobuhle Nene
description: An ANC supporter who had her home at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. Eight people were killed and more than 120 homes were burnt down. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Jabulile Mildred Nene
description: She had her house burnt down in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 November 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Mqanjelwa Mathews Nene
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Pietermaritzburg set alight on 1 March 1990 during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Musawenkosi Frank Nene
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Nomusa Rebecca Nene
description: Was stabbed to death by Special Constables during political conflict in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 December 1989. She was allegedly targeted because she had a relationship with an ANC supporter.

name: Sipho Nene
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 14 April 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Seven people were killed in the fighting.

name: Thandiwe Augustinah Nene
description: She had her home in Eshowe, Natal, burnt down in an arson attack in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in 1993.

name: Thembisile Annie Nene
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Ogunjini, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 25 May 1993.

name: Nomawonga Debrah Nentsa
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten on 18 June 1986 by vigilantes, together with police, and forced to clean the township in Robertson, Cape. She was then detained for three months under emergency regulations at Pollsmoor prison, Cape Town. See police brutality.

name: Mandlakapheli Ngabom
description: Was shot dead in Mandela informal settlement, Katlehong, Transvaal, on 22 May 1993, allegedly by members of the ISU. Mr Ngabom was caught in crossfire when clashes broke out between ANC and IFP supporters and police after a group of unidentified gunmen fired at Tokoza hostel during a march organised by the ANC to present a petition at the Alberton police station. Nine people were killed and 69 were injured during this incident

name: Aaron Ngakane
description: Was stabbed to death in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 9 November 1992 during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Funeka Nobantu Ngange
description: Was ‘necklaced’ to death by named ANC supporters on 4 June 1990 in Komga, Cape. Her mother was accused of practising witchcraft following the death of a community member who had bought liquor from her shebeen. Her mother was also burnt to death in the attack.

name: Nombande Nomriti Ngange
description: Was ‘necklaced’ to death by named ANC supporters on 4 June 1990 in Komga, Cape. She was accused of practising witchcraft following the death of a community member who had bought liquor from her shebeen. Her daughter was also burnt to death in the attack.

name: Dlavini Ngawu
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in Tembisa, Tvl, on 9 June 1992 during a violent confrontation between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Dumisani Victor Ndlovu
description: He died in May 1992 in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, when he was shot and injured, and then run over by a vehicle. He was a former local ANC leader in Umlazi CC Section. His attackers were a group of ANC supporters, including the individual who had replaced him as leader of the branch.

name: Zenze Ndlala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead during an attack by IFP supporters from Nancefield hostel on Power Park, Orlando East, Soweto, Johannes-burg, in February 1991 during ongoing conflict between residents and hostel-dwellers.

name: Andries Nene
description: An ANC supporter who had his home set set alight by IFP supporters in Matshaheni, near Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 14 December 1990. Mr Nene escaped with burn wounds, but his twin brother was burnt to death inside the house.

name: Ellen Myalo Ndlovu
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaShozi, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 October 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nomagesi Ivy Ndlovu
description: Was shot and injured on 8 March 1993 when the bus in which she was travelling was ambused by armed IFP supporters in Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg. The bus was taking 80 ANC supporters to Pietermaritzburg to attend the court appearance of three men implicated in the ambush of a vehicle carrying IFP supporters on 5 March 1993. Three men and a woman were killed and at least sixteen people were injured.

name: Nomagesi Ivy Ndlovu
description: Was shot and injured on 8 March 1993 when the bus in which she was travelling was ambused by armed IFP supporters in Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg. The bus was taking 80 ANC supporters to Pietermaritzburg to attend the court appearance of three men implicated in the ambush of a vehicle carrying IFP supporters on 5 March 1993. Three men and a woman were killed and at least sixteen people were injured.

name: Lindiwe Lucratia Ndlangisa
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home and possessions in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Umlazi, Durban, on 10 November 1993.

name: Zodwa Rachel Nala
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Woodyglen, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 June 1989, in intense political conflict in the area. About 1000 homes were badly damaged or destroyed in political violence in Mpumalanga during 1989, leaving many dead and thousands homeless.

name: Emmanuel Ndlovu
description: Was shot and severely injured by ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1993, allegedly because his family were suspected of being IFP supporters.

name: Ruth Thadzile Ndlangisa
description: An IFP supporter who lost her home at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in an arson attack by ANC supporters on 16 April 1991.

name: Nomakhosi Nohlanhla Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Adam Mochela Naleli
description: Was abducted and stabbed to death by members of the ANC-aligned Lanada Gang in Kroonstad, OFS, on 16 March 1991. Mr Naleli was thought to be a member of the Three Million gang.

name: Michael Ndlanzi
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Michael Ndlanzi
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nombukiso Resina Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in 1992.

name: Nombulelo Florence Ndlovu
description: She had her house burnt down on 16 February 1993 in a dawn attack on the ANC stronghold of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, allegedly in the course of conflict over access to resources. Ten people were killed and 35 houses were burnt down in the attack.

name: Michael Ndlazi
description: Was hacked and burnt to death by IFP supporters at Nancefield hostel in Soweto, Johannesburg, in September 1991 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Evelyn Ndlovu
description: Was shot and injured, and had her house burnt down, in Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 26 September 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Norman Ndlovu
description: Was killed during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 3 June 1992.

name: Ramolipa Namane
description: Was stabbed to death with a spear by an IFP supporter during an IFP march in White City, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 7 March 1992. Soweto was one of several Transvaal townships embroiled in conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the early 1990s.

name: Pakiso David Namanyane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot to death by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 14 February 1994, the day of a stayaway organised by the IFP in support of the Zulu king’s demand for the constitutional independence of the Zulu nation.

name: Gladness Nana
description: An ANC activist who was shot dead during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 November 1993.

name: Hilton Nkosivumile Naphi
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and shot dead by IFP supporters near New Canada station, Johannesburg, on 10 September 1991. He and four other men were travelling in a taxi when they were allegedly taken to a place where the perpetrators shot them.

name: Gilbert John Ncama
description: An IFP supporter who was severely injured in a petrol bomb attack by ANC supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 11 July 1992.

name: Bhekie Ncanana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and possessions destroyed in an attack by IFP supporters in Sigisi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 April 1991.

name: Khishiwe Ncane
description: He had his three huts burnt down by ANC supporters in Ngwemabalala, KwaXolo, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 January 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Khishiwe Ncane
description: He had his three huts burnt down by ANC supporters in Ngwemabalala, KwaXolo, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 January 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mandlakayise Amos Skhova Ncane
description: An IFP supporter who had his house burnt down by ANC supporters at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 July 1991.

name: Meslinah Maje Ncane
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 April 1994, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Meslinah Maje Ncane
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 April 1994, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Msakeni Isaiah Ncane
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 11 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Ncane’s son, an ANC supporter, was stabbed to death on the same day. The Ncane family was forced to flee the area.

name: Msakeni Isaiah Ncane
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 11 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Ncane’s son, an ANC supporter, was stabbed to death on the same day. The Ncane family was forced to flee the area.

name: Nqunu Rose Ncane
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Margate, Natal, on 7 March 1994, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nqunu Rose Ncane
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Margate, Natal, on 7 March 1994, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Palweni Ncane
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ngwemabalala, KwaXolo, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 April 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. On the same day, ANC supporters attacked a homestead in neighbouring Izingolweni, killing five IFP supporters and injuring four.

name: Palweni Ncane
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ngwemabalala, KwaXolo, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 April 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. On the same day, ANC supporters attacked a homestead in neighbouring Izingolweni, killing five IFP supporters and injuring four.

name: Sipho Petros Ncane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 11 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sipho Petros Ncane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 11 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Busisiwe Rose Ncani
description: She had her house and possessions destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 March 1994, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Busisiwe Rose Ncani
description: She had her house and possessions destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 March 1994, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thuleleni Berthina Ncani
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 January 1994.

name: Thozamile Samson Ncaphayi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 27 September 1990.

name: Mawani Elizabeth Ncayiyana
description: An IFP supporter who lost her home and possessions in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1991.

name: King Vuyisile Ncebetshe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in his home in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 11 November 1990.

name: Hawukile Betty Ncengwa
description: She had her house destroyed in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 13 November 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Manthibi Rosy Nche
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by named IFP supporters in Rweleleyathunya, Rouxville, OFS, on 23 September 1990. The attack was carried out by known members of the INKATHA GANG. Her six-year-old grandson suffered burns in the attack.

name: Faslina Ntombiyezwe Ncike
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by unidentified ANC supporters who attacked her home in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 14 December 1993. Another family member was also killed, and the family home burnt down in the attack.

name: Nkosinathi Kenneth Ncobela
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Patrick Mziwakhe Ncobela
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mtobi Sydney Ncoko
description: An assistant policeman who was beaten and stoned to death by named ANC supporters during political unrest in Indwe, Cape, on 16 April 1990.

name: Bongani Ntelezi Ncube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks.

name: David Ncube
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in the hand by IFP supporters in an attack on his home in Tembisa, Transvaal, in November 1990.

name: Gabantu Ndlebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Verulam, Natal, on 23 July 1990.

name: Norman Hlalabelwa Ndlovu
description: Was injured in a petrol bomb attack by ANC supporters while attending a wedding at the home of a well-known IFP leader in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in October 1991. A limpet mine was detonated at the wedding ceremony, killing six people.

name: Jeanett Nomachule Ndlebe
description: An ANC supporter who had her flat and possessions destroyed in an arson attack on 30 April 1990 in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal, by a group of men carrying traditional weapons and allegedly looking for ANC supporters. Nine homes were burnt in the area that day. At the time ANC supporters were also killed in an attempt to prevent the setting up of local ANC branches in the area.

name: Liziwe Victoria Ndleko
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Mansizwana Solomon Ndleko
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Bheki Ndlela
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was killed and pushed off a train by ANC members between Germiston and Kempton Park stations, Transvaal, on 11 November 1993. The perpetrators shot at Mr Ndela and one other person, killing both. See train violence. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/2001/086).

name: Emmanuel Sipho Ndlela
description: Was stabbed to death by named ANC supporters during political conflict in Ashdown, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 23 October 1993.

name: Jabulani Richard Ndlela
description: Was abducted and killed by ‘necklacing’ by alleged IFP members on 30 March 1991 in Wartburg, Natal, during territorial conflict between ANC and IFP to establish a stronghold area.

name: Qedi Ndlela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by other named ANC supporters at Pietermaritzburg on 29 June 1990 during a serious internal dispute.

name: Zandile Rejoice Ndlela
description: She had her home destroyed and looted by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1991, allegedly because her brother was suspected of being an ANC supporter.

name: Zwelakhe Ndlela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 10 November 1991.

name: Luleka Rinnet Ndleleni
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed by IFP supporters in April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Luleka Rinnet Ndleleni
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed by IFP supporters in April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zolo Ndlou
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Absalom Rapelang Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe’s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Absolom Thokozani Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 13 June 1991.

name: Albert Hlukananami Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter and COSATU shopsteward involved in local peace processes who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Bebhusi, KwaNyavu, Pietermaritzburg, on 29 May 1991. As part of the peace effort, a list of killers had formally been handed to a local police station that day. All the names on the list were reportedly IFP supporters.

name: Alice Mamshiqwa Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was harassed, threatened and had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1993. The perpetrators were allegedly searching for ANC youth members.

name: Alphod Ndlovu
description: Was killed in the ‘Battle of the Forest’, an unprecedented violent clash between ANC and IFP supporters in timber plantations at Richmond, Natal, on 29 March 1991. Twenty three IFP supporters were reported killed.

name: Andrias Hata-Botle Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 7 November 1993 in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe’s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal. See Molefe homestead attack.

name: Babekile Ndlovu
description: Was shot and severely injured by named ANC supporters in Stanger, Natal, on 3 March 1993, allegedly for refusing to join the ANC.

name: Basayinile Eunice Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had her home at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1991.

name: Bazothini Ndlovu
description: Was shot dead while asleep in Pietermaritzburg on 21 November 1991, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Bheki Raphael Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 April 1994 while campaigning for the ANC in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bheki Raphael Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 April 1994 while campaigning for the ANC in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bhekisisa Ndlovu
description: Was one of eight passengers shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Six other passengers were shot dead. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Bongamusa Ndlovu
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters during political conflict at Nhlalakahle, Greytown, Natal, on 26 November 1990. His mother was an ANC supporter.

name: Bongani Vusumzi Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by an IFP supporter in Umlazi, Durban, on 6 February 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bongani Vusumzi Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by an IFP supporter in Umlazi, Durban, on 6 February 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bongekile Victoria Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down and possessions stolen when a group of IFP supporters armed with AK 47 rifles attacked several homes in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 26 July 1992. Eight people were killed and at least ten seriously injured. The attackers torched eight homes, burning three people to death.

name: Bonginkosi Innocent Ndlovu
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 4 February 1992. The perpetrators allegedly suspected his family of being ANC supporters

name: Bongizwe Petros Bongi Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who lost his home in Pietermaritzburg in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 28 February 1991.

name: Boniwe Mirriam Ndlovu
description: She had her house inKwaZaba, Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by named IFP members in March 1991, due to her husband ’s political affiliation to the ANC.

name: Givey Cosmos Ndlovu
description: Was killed on 19 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Givey Cosmos Ndlovu
description: Was killed on 19 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Nqobile Mildred Ndlovu
description: A member of the IFP Youth Brigade who was shot dead at the home of a prominent IFP leader at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992, allegedly by ANC members. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Nyawozabantu Ndlovu
description: Was stabbed to death and his body burnt by ANC supporters in Ixopo, Natal, in intense political conflict in the area on 1 May 1990.

name: Paul Ndlovu
description: He had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 23 February 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. About 35 houses were reportedly burnt down in Bhambayi that month.

name: Phikinkani Bongani Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and his body mutilated by a group of IFP supporters in May 1992 in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban.

name: Philisiwe Alzina Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and possessions destroyed in an arson attack by members of the Amasinyora gang in KwaMashu, Durban, in 1991.

name: Pita Julius Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down and his cattle stolen by IFP supporters at Nkwezela, Bulwer, Natal, on 13 June 1992.

name: Robert Dinkebo Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by named ANC members at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 10 September 1990.

name: Sabelo Meshack Ndlovu
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters during political conflict in Estcourt, Natal, on 6 June 1993. Mr Ndlovu was allegedly suspected of being an ANC member.

name: Sarah Obeline Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 23 February 1993. About 35 houses were reportedly burnt down in Bhambayi that month.

name: Sibusiso Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 4 December 1991. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Sibusiso Joseph Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Eziqhazeni, Nqutu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 3 March 1993. Mr Ndlovu was at the home of ANC-aligned Chief Molefe when he was shot by unidentified IFP supporters returning from a funeral.

name: Sifiso Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked and injured by IFP supporters in Ekwandeni, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 9 March 1992.

name: Sifiso Ephraim Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu’s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Sihlangu Mbula Ndlovu
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Sipho Bonginkosi Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had his belongings stolen by named IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in September 1990.

name: Sipho Ellias Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who was stoned to death by named ANC supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 February 1994.

name: Sizeni Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu’s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Suzan Sisinyane Ndlovu
description: She lost her house and all her possessions in an arson attack by a named ANC member in Bloemfontein on 31 August 1990. Ms Ndlovu was suspected of being a ‘spy’ for a councillor. Councillors and their associates were frequent targets for attack during this period.

name: Thandazile Ndlovu
description: Was shot dead by named ANC supporters in Sokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 4 August 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Three other persons, believed to be IFP supporters, also died in the attack

name: Thandiwe Minah Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, in April 1991.

name: Themba Andrews Ndlovu
description: An ANC member who was shot dead by members of a conflicting ANC faction in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 6 July 1991.

name: Thembekile Flora Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembinkosi Charles Ndlovu
description: Was killed in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 3 June 1992.

name: Thembinkosi Patrick Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten, stoned and left for dead by named IFP members at Mpolweni, near Wartburg, Pietermaritzburg, on 5 November 1992.

name: Thenguni M Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Mvutshini, near Hluhluwe, Natal, on 21 March 1994, in political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thenguni M Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Mvutshini, near Hluhluwe, Natal, on 21 March 1994, in political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thoko Norah Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house when it was attacked by a large group of unidentified men during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Entshawini, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, in 1992. The Ndlovu family had been warned of the attack, and fled the house before the attackers arrived. They did not return to the area.

name: Thokozani Goodman Ndlovu
description: Was shot dead during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, in 1991.

name: Thulani Fano Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Tobias Joseph Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who had his house in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down on 13 July 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Tshengisile Eunice Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in March 1991.

name: Velaphi Elman Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters in Mgwagwa, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 13 September 1990.

name: Velaphi Ntombazane Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 22 September 1993.

name: Velaphi William Ndlovu
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Vincent Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 8 February 1992.

name: Vusumuzi Eugene Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and stabbed by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 10 July 1993. About 11 people were killed in political conflict in the area that day.

name: Zakithi Mbongeni Michael Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 25 December 1992.

name: Zandile Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked and injured by IFP supporters in Ekwandeni, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 9 March 1992

name: Zanele Mayvis Ndlovu
description: She had her house destroyed in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Adams Mission, near Durban, during 1992.

name: Gom Thinabantu Eunice Ndlovu
description: She lost her house and all her possessions in an attack by ANC supporters during political conflict in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1993.

name: Hamilton Jabulani Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu’s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Hamilton Vuma Ndlovu
description: An IFP member who lost his home and all his possessions when they were burnt down in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Pietermaritzburg on 21 November 1991.

name: Hezekiah Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, in Manzimnyama, KwaMbonambi, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 15 August 1992.

name: Hlabeyakhe Gcinezakhe Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and killed in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Madakane, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 27 August 1992.

name: Hlaleleni Regina Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Nhlalakahle, Greytown, Natal, petrol-bombed by IFP supporters on 26 November 1990. Her four-year-old grandson was shot and severely injured in the attack.

name: Ida Ndlovu
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, in continuing political conflict in the area in April 1991. Ms Ndlovu’s son, an ANC supporter, was shot dead by IFP supporters that same month.

name: Ngenbeni Minah Makhanyile Nene
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters during political conflict at Matshaheni, near Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 14 December 1990. One of her sons, an ANC supporter, was burnt to death inside the house while the other managed to escape with burn injuries.

name: Jabulani Ndlovu
description: Was one of five young ANC supporters shot dead by IFP supporters during political conflict at Magoda, Richmond, Natal, on 14 July 1991. Residents accused the security forces of involvement, and a top-level police investigation was launched. The chief of Phatheni was arrested in connection with the massacre.

name: Jabulisile Khombisile Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Jameson Felokwakhe Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 4 March 1991.

name: Jerome Dingizwe Ndlovu
description: A local chief and member of the KwaZulu Legislative Assembly who was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Ixopo, Natal, on 16 August 1991 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. His daughter was killed in the same attack.

name: Johan Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Tvl, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Johannes Tani Magebhula Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Ramsgate, Natal, on 10 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Johannes Tani Magebhula Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Ramsgate, Natal, on 10 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Jotham Mbongeni Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by fellow IFP supporters, one of whom is named, in Gingindlovu, Natal, on 29 February 1992. He was reportedly killed because he worked for Alusaf at Richards Bay, and workers there were believed to be ANC supporters.

name: Jotham Zakhele Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten to death by IFP supporters at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 31 August 1990.

name: Khili Alpheus Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot at Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in December 1992.

name: Pius Nene
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death when his home was set alight by IFP supporters in Matshaheni, near Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 14 December 1990. His twin brother managed to escape with burn injuries.

name: Koshosho Amon Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by a named IFP member in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1993.

name: Lungile Fikelephi Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mako Mbuyiselo Ndlovu
description: An ANC operative who was killed in an ambush on 15 May 1988 while in exile in Angola.

name: Malusi Ndlovu
description: Was shot and injured in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, on 16 February 1992.

name: Mandla Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by named IFP supporters in KwaDandala, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 September 1990. Three other ANC supporters were also killed in the incident.

name: Maphola Collin Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death in a bus by IFP supporters at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 July 1991.

name: Matata Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters at Pietermaritzburg on 28 February 1991.

name: Mbongeni J Ndlovu
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mbongiseni Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by other named ANC supporters during an internal feud in Pietermaritzburg, on 29 June 1990.

name: Mdunyiswa Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in the leg by IFP supporters at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in 1992.

name: Mfanelo Landford Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 16 September 1990.

name: Mfanyana Adrius Ndlovu
description: He had his home in Elufafa, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters in May 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Molwana Ndlovu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by named IFP supporters in KwaDandala, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 September 1990. Three other ANC supporters were also killed in the incident.

name: Mpikayipheli Ndlovu
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and burnt to death by ANC supporters at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 5 October 1992.

name: Maria Tozi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Engonyameni, near Umlazi, Durban, on 2 August 1992. The perpetrators burnt ANC flags and houses belonging to ANC supporters, resulting in several deaths and injuries.

name: Sibusiso Josias Ngcamu
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 18 March 1991.

name: Sipho Hlulukwenza Ngcamu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 1 May 1994 in political conflict following the April 1994 elections.

name: Sipho Hlulukwenza Ngcamu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 1 May 1994 in political conflict following the April 1994 elections.

name: Balungile Ngwazi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured, allegedly by ANC members, at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Sibongile Philpinah Ngobese
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 11 February 1990. See Richmond Farm arson attacks.

name: Mbhekiseni Ngidi
description: Was severely beaten during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in 1993.

name: Mloloyi Mavis Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Florence Ngwazi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Durban in February 1993.

name: Nokuthula Jannet Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Elsie Elizabeth Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by named IFP supporters at Emangwaneni, Bulwer, Natal, in November 1991.

name: Sisi Joanah Ngema
description: She had her house burnt down during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Eshowe, Natal, in 1994.

name: Gila Thompson Ngwazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when IFP supporters attacked his mother-in-law’s home in Oshabeni, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 October 1992. His wife was also shot dead in the attack, and his daughter was severely injured.

name: Nokuthula Ntombenzincane Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 23 January 1991. As a result of the attack the family had to flee the area, which was an ANC stronghold.

name: Thoko Sibongile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and possessions destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, in January 1991.

name: Skhosiphi Ngobese
description: Was shot and burnt to death when the house he was in was set alight on 17 March 1994 at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. Numerous houses had been burnt down the previous day by IFP supporters in a sweep through this ANC-dominated part of Ndwedwe. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Gugu Beta Ngwazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when IFP supporters attacked her mother’s home in Oshabeni, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 October 1992. Her husband was also shot dead in the attack, and her daughter was severely injured.

name: Mzikayifani Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mziwenpi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ndabazezwe Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ngenzeni Ngidi
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down during violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban in January 1994. Ms Ngidi broke her leg while running away from her attackers.

name: Ngicuphile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house and some of his livestock in an arson attack by IFP supporters during intense political conflict in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ngiteni Busisilie Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ngitheni Deke Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ngiyekeni Chithiwe Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nkomezikale Siswini Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nkosinathi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nobuqili Thandi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomadiphi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomajacimani Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomatoshi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nombono Gezephi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nonhlanhla Lucy Ngubane
description: She had her house in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, destroyed in June 1993. Having fled the area earlier because of the conflict between the IFP and ANC, the family returned to find their home looted and destroyed.

name: Nomhlangano Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomusa Elizabeth Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombelize Annacleta Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Amatikwe, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1992.

name: Ntombengaka Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombilize Annacleta Ngidi
