description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombizani Elizabeth Ngidi
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house and three rondavels in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Mfume, Umkomaas, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 13 July 1992.

name: Ntombizimbili Nomuza Ngidi
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombizini Ngidi
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters on in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Phansi Ngidi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 10 May 1994, the day of Nelson Mandela’s inauguration as President.

name: Princess Phawulina Ngidi
description: Was beaten to death while walking home from Murchison Hospital, Port Shepstone, Natal, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters on 17 January 1993. Her sister was also seriously injured in the attack.

name: Puputekile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Qhamukile Yaluzile Ngidi
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban on 16 March 1994 in violent conflict between supporters of the ANC and IFP. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sanele Sibusiso Ngidi
description: Was shot and injured in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, in April 1992.

name: Sebenzile Kumbuzile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sibongile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Tebisile Evelyn Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thandekile Irene Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembelihle Nester Sidudla Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thunywephi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Tokozile Margaret Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Tusile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Vusumuzi Ngidi
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters on 16 October 1992 in the Nkanyezini area, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, in ongoing political conflict in the area

name: Zamekile Thulisile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house vandalised by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Zitusile Vezeni Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: William Ngoako
description: He died after being shot in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 10 September 1991 while waiting for a taxi during intense conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Mvula Petrus Ngobeni
description: A SANCO member who was arrested in 1986 and kept in solitary confinement for two years at Siyathemba, near Balfour, Transvaal, because he gave sanctuary to youths wanted by the police

name: Thomas Ngobeni
description: Was shot dead in Kagiso, Transvaal, on 6 May 1990 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Ambrose Elliot Ngobese
description: An IFP member who was shot and injured by named ANC supporters at KwaHlaza, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 19 July 1991. His girlfriend was killed in this incident.

name: Amos Sibusiso Ngobese
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Busisiwe Ngobese
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Jeanet Ngobese
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1991. The family hid in the cane fields during the attack.

name: Kalelani Ngobese
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khethezakhe Fundi Ngobese
description: An IFP supporter who was beaten, stabbed, and shot by ANC supporters at KwaThema hostel in Springs, Transvaal, on 19 August 1990. He died from his injuries.

name: Mamita Ngobese
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mbongwa Aaron Sabelo Ngobese
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead while visiting a friend in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, in March 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nkosinathi Lucas Ngobese
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Phethemuphi Margaret Ngobese
description: An ANC supporter who had her house looted and vandalised by IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 2 August 1992.

name: Nelisile Nhlapo
description: An IFP supporter who was assaulted, allegedly by ANC supporters, in her home in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 17 August 1993 when the perpetrators came to look for her father.

name: Thokozani Iris Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ethel Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by named IFP supporters in Ngonweni, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 15 November 1992.

name: Magqulusela Fisa Ngwazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by unidentified IFP supporters at KwaMnyandu railway station in Umlazi, Durban, on 1 October 1993.

name: Nomathemba Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 13 April 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Ntombizodwa Victoria Ngcana
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from a house in Brandfort, Orange Free State (OFS), on 12 July 1990 by masked men identified by a witness as ‘comrades’. She was later found burnt to death in a house in Brandfort. It was alleged that she had evidence pertaining to the killing of her boyfriend by the same perpetrators.

name: Fanzi Douglas Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Nkwezela, Bulwer, Natal, and his vehicles destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Thembekile Doris Ngema
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed by IFP supporters in Ogunjini, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in June 1993, allegedly because her family had defected from the IFP to join the ANC.

name: Nomkahes Ngcobo
description: Was shot and killed by ANC supporters at Nomhele Reserve, Mapumolo, Natal, on 15 March 1992. Three people were killed and two were severely injured. One ANC member was refused amnesty (AC/1997/0045).

name: Makhosi Ngwazi
description: Was shot and severely injured when IFP supporters attacked her grandmother’s home in Oshabeni, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 October 1992. Her parents were both shot dead in the attack. She was the daughter of ANC supporters.

name: Ntombenkulu Ngubane
description: An ANC activist who was detained under emergency regulations in 1960, and tortured. In 1963, she was served with a five-year banning order confining her to Umlazi. She defied it and went into hiding in Clermont, near Durban. Arrested in 1964, she was tortured in detention and forced to sign a confession. Sentenced to nine years’ imprisonment, she lost her baby, which was delivered in prison.

name: Xolile Edward Ngcana
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from his grandmother’s home, which was set alight by named ANC youth members, in Brandfort , Orange Free State (OFS), on 16 July 1990. He was threatened with death and taken to a local stadium but was saved by the police. Some of the perpetrators involved in this abduction were also involved in the abduction and killing of Ntombizodwa Ngcana in Brandfort four days earlier.

name: Thokozile Elizabeth Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who suffered ongoing harassment and intimidation and eventually had her house burnt by ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1991. Ms Ngcobo and her family were forced to flee this ANC-dominated area.

name: Felokwakhe Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Marosa Rose Nhlebela
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomtandazo Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mbekelwa Ngwazi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Madakane, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 24 October 1991.

name: Nomthandazo Iris Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Felumuzi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Toto Alson Ngwazi
description: An ANC leader who was shot and killed by a named IFP supporter at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 April 1992, allegedly because of his role in the ANC.

name: Nomthandazo Sylvia Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomusa Nokuthula Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, looted and vandalised by IFP supporters on 4 December 1993.

name: Solomon Nkonzo Ngcanu
description: Was shot and injured in an arson attack on his home at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Solomon Nkonzo Ngcanu
description: Was shot and injured in an arson attack on his home at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomusa Teressa Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Mahashini near Estcourt, Natal, burnt down by unidentified persons in November 1993 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thombalane Evelyn Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Makosazana Florence Ngcece
description: She had her house in Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters during political conflict in March 1992. The perpetrators were allegedly looking for her son, an ANC supporter.

name: Nontuthuzelo Ignancia Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Ixopo, Natal, set alight by IFP supporters on 4 July 1993.

name: Hazekia Ngoyoli Nhlebo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 24 October 1992 after he and his brother were abducted by unidentified persons from their home in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His brother was also killed.

name: Ndabayakhe Ngwekazi
description: Was shot dead at KwaMadlala, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 30 May 1992, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. The minibus in which he was travelling was stopped by unidentified gunmen, who opened fire on the passengers.

name: Ntombizanele Eleanor Ngubane
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Frank Ngcobo
description: Was shot and killed and his son wounded by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at his home in Katlehong, Transvaal, in 1993. Mr Ngcobo was believed to be an IFP supporter. The applicant testified that he was instructed, at a meeting of the SDUs and the community, to bring Mr Ngcobo to the meeting, where all IFP members would be ordered to leave the township. If Mr Ngcobo refused, the applicant was instructed to kill him. One SDU member was granted amnesty for this killing (AC/1999/0348).

name: Norah Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Funani Ida Ngcobo
description: Was severely beaten and had her house in Mahlabatini, near Ulundi, KwaZulu Natal burnt down by IFP supporters on 6 January 1992. Ms Ngcobo was attacked while returning from a funeral vigil for her nephew, an active ANC member who had been killed. She was allegedly targeted because of her relationship to the slain activist.

name: Themba Nhlebo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 24 October 1992 after he and his brother were abducted by unidentified persons from their home in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His brother was also killed.

name: Philliphina Beatrice Ngubane
description: She had her house in Richmond, Natal, burnt down by named IFP supporters in May 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Tozi Mgcinsini Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Gabazile Velephi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks

name: Galanti Anna Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Inkanyezi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 November 1991.

name: Graginah Ngcobo
description: Was shot and killed during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Pietermaritzburg on 16 November 1990.

name: Green Maseline Ngcobo
description: She had her house in Ensimbini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 5 May 1993, allegedly because she lived in an IFP stronghold while her son was an active ANC supporter.

name: Henry Mthanzi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 July 1992.

name: Herbert Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who was severely injured when he was assaulted by a group of ANC supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 16 June 1991. He was accused of going to work in defiance of a stayaway call to commemorate the Soweto uprising.

name: Imanuel Gayisani Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 4 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Innocent Sanele Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 8 March 1994, a week before the Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ivy Thembekile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Johannes Khethokuhle Ngcobo
description: Was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 23 February 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Joseph Maqhinga Ngcobo
description: Was shot and injured on 11 April 1992, when unidentified attackers opened fire on his home at KwaHaza, near Howick, Natal, in continuing confict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. One person was shot dead and one other injured in the attack.

name: Khombomunye Phineas Ngcobo
description: Was shot and injured when his home was attacked by ANC supporters during intense political conflict at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khonani Bongiwe Ngcobo
description: Was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in June 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Khonzile Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, set alight by ANC supporters on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lillian Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house and possessions when a group of armed IFP supporters attacked several homes in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 26 July 1992.

name: Lindeni Gladys Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994./ See Sonkombo arson attacks

name: Lindiwe Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who was severely burnt when her home in Esikadaneni, Inchanga, Natal, was set alight by ANC supporters in March 1991.

name: Lungi Lucy Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Ogunjini, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in January 1991.

name: Lynette Badumazile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Magayise Phillip Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 19 July 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mandla Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted by ANC supporters at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 4 January 1991. He was rescued from his abductors by fellow IFP supporters.

name: Mandla Michael Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who had his home in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mandlenkosi Hebron Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was killed and his body mutilated by a named supporter of the IFP in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 January 1991. The attack occurred days after a local chief called on IFP supporters to drive the ANC out of the area.

name: Mantombi Witness Ngcobo
description: She had her house and business burnt down on 16 March 1994 in an arson attack by IFP supporters on the isolated ANC stronghold in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mavis Ngcobo
description: Was shot and killed by ANC supporters at Nomhele Reserve, Mapumolo, Natal, on 15 March 1992. Three people were killed and two were severely injured. One ANC member was refused amnesty (AC/1997/0045).

name: Mazisi Moses Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters near Ramsgate, Natal, on 10 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mazisi Moses Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters near Ramsgate, Natal, on 10 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mboneli Justine Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, badly damaged in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mboniseni Timothy Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who had his house burnt down in February 1994 at Kwa-Mthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mboniseni Timothy Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who had his house burnt down in February 1994 at Kwa-Mthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mbulaleni Tom Ngcobo
description: He had his house in Emabomvini, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down and his livestock stolen by IFP supporters in July 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mbuyiseni Clement Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 10 August 1992.

name: Melisile Barbara Ngcobo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 15 November 1990, in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the are a . Ms Ngcobo was visiting her son’s home at Mahlongwa Mission, near Scottburgh, Natal at the time.

name: Michael Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 October 1992. His brother was also shot dead in the attack.

name: Mkhuliseni Pheneas Ngcobo
description: Was shot and beaten to death by ANC members during political conflict in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 7 January 1993. Four ANC members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/096).

name: Moses Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mpande Moses Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead and his body was burnt by named fellow IFP supporters in Sweetwaters, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 20 April 1991. Mr Ngcobo was allegedly targeted because his nieces were ANC supporters and he was thought to be weakening in his loyalty to the IFP.

name: Mpiyakhe Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 11 September 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mthunzi Sydney Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 13 August 1993.

name: Musa Christian Ngcobo
description: Was stabbed to death by named ANC supporters during political conflict in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 12 March 1992. Other members of his family had already been killed or severely injured in separate incidents of political violence in the area.

name: Mzikayifani Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed by IFP supporters who attacked his home in Nhlalakahle, Greytown, Natal, on 26 June 1991. He died later in hospital. One other person was shot dead and one shot and injured in the attack.

name: Mzoneli Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ndelelo Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nelisiwe Gloria Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in the Zamani informal settlement, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in September 1991.

name: Nhlanhla Godfrey Ngcobo
description: Was injured in a hand grenade explosion in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 31 July 1992. An ANC self-defence unit (SDU) member threw the grenade while in a confrontation with police. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/090).

name: Nhlanhla Mthokozi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared on 19 August 1993 and was found shot dead a week later in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nhlanhla Patrick Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaMadlala, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 May 1994, in ongoing conflict following the April 1994 elections. Mr Ngcobo’s cousin was shot dead in the same incident.

name: Nhlanhla Patrick Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaMadlala, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 May 1994, in ongoing conflict following the April 1994 elections. Mr Ngcobo’s cousin was shot dead in the same incident.

name: Ningi Lawrence Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who suffered injuries when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217).

name: Njiga Goodman Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in Mpuma-langa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 March 1993.

name: Nkonqo Delisile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nkosazana Agnes Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, burnt down on 31 January 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nobuhle Beauty Ngcobo
description: She had her home destroyed in an arson attack by alleged ANC supporters during political conflict at Inchanga, Natal, in March 1991. Members of her family were IFP supporters.

name: Alphius Ngwenya
description: Was attacked by IFP members during political conflict between the Black Cats and the ANC at Wesselton, Eastern Tvl, in 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Ndabayakhe Ngenalisile
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters during political conflict between the ‘Red’ and‘Green’  factions in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in June 1993.

name: Tshelizwe Moses Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his home destroyed in an arson attack during intense political conflict in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Stanley Thulani Ngcece
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, shot and killed by other named ANC supporters in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 7 November 1991, during internal political conflict between ANC supporters and the Amavaravara. Six people were killed and 15 seriously injured in the fighting.

name: Velephi Lephinah Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombeziningi Angelina Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bernard Mahawule Ngcemu
description: An IFP supporter who had his home in Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 26 June 1993.

name: Johannes Ngomane
description: Was shot and injured by named IFP supporters at a night vigil in Alexandra, Johannes-burg, on 26 March 1991. Fifteen people died in this attack, which followed clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Nomvuyo Selinah Ngonjolo
description: She had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 16 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomvuyo Selinah Ngonjolo
description: She had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 16 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Miseka Nancy Ngono
description: An ANC supporter who was making inquiries about the disappearance of her son in Lesotho when she was detained in Port Elizabeth on 25 May 1988 and held until 1990. She was subsequently charged with terrorism and acquitted.

name: Mfano Vitalis Ngonyama
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by a named IFP supporter in Ixopo, Natal, on 7 December 1993. His five-year-old brother was also stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Siboniso Ngonyama
description: Was stabbed to death by a named IFP supporter in Ixopo, Natal, on 7 December 1993. His brother, an ANC supporter, was also stabbed to death in the attack.

name: Lindeka Sylvia Ngqinjana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 26 February 1992.

name: M Ngqulunga
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Siphamandla Ngqulunga
description: Was shot and stabbed to death when IFP supporters attacked his home at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 24 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His two sisters and brother were also shot and stabbed to death in the attack, and the family home was burnt down

name: Siphamandla Ngqulunga
description: Was shot and stabbed to death when IFP supporters attacked his home at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 24 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. His two sisters and brother were also shot and stabbed to death in the attack, and the family home was burnt down

name: Zamikhaya Shadrack Ngqwala
description: Was stabbed and killed by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, in March 1991 after the Alexandra Civic Organisation (ACO) launched a campaign urging town councillors to resign. Many councillors joined the IFP and then informed hostel-dwellers that the ACO intended to demolish hostels sparking conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. During March 1991, seventy people were killed and many others were injured.

name: Zamikhaya Shadrack Ngqwala
description: Was stabbed and killed by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, in March 1991 after the Alexandra Civic Organisation (ACO) launched a campaign urging town councillors to resign. Many councillors joined the IFP and then informed hostel-dwellers that the ACO intended to demolish hostels sparking conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. During March 1991, seventy people were killed and many others were injured.

name: Anna Ngubane
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Emdeni, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 5 April 1991 during intense conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents. Four other people were killed in the incident.

name: Alice Ngcobo
description: Was burnt to death in an arson attack on her home during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 16 January 1993. Her husband and son, both ANC supporters, and her granddaughter were also burnt to death, while her daughter managed to escape with a stab wound.

name: Bhekameva Alfred Ngubane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Bhululu Samuel Ngubane
description: Was shot at and had his house in Umzumbe, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down in 1990, in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. He was allegedly targeted because his sons were ANC supporters.

name: Bizani Ngubane
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaNxamalala, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1990.

name: Busisiwe Francina Ngubane
description: She had her home burnt down during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 21 June 1991.

name: Daniel Mduduzi Ngubane
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 19 August 1993.

name: Ernest Mduduzi Ngubane
description: Was shot, stabbed, and burnt and burnt to death by ANC supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 27 August 1991 in ongoing political conflict in the area. His four young cousins were also burnt to death in the attack, when the perpetrators set fire to their home.

name: Gilbert Ngubane
description: Was stabbed and shot dead by ANC supporters who attacked his house in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 30 October 1993. The perpetrators accused him of storing weapons for the IFP. His wife, their housekeeper and a neighbour were all severely injured in the attack.

name: Hawukile Ngubane
description: She had her house and tuck shop burnt down by unidentified perpetrators in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Ekuphakameni, near Inanda, Durban, on 21 June 1991.

name: Maggie Ngubane
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mcitwa Ngubane
description: An IFP supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Mshayazafe, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 10 July 1991.

name: Msonguthu Ngubane
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Musa Clement Ngubane
description: Was stoned and shot dead by ANC supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 12 January 1992, allegedly because he failed to pay ANC protection fees at a time of ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Muzi Musa Ngubane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 1 May 1992.

name: Mkhuhliseni Isaac Nhlengethwa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot at by IFP members during political violence at Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 22 January 1992. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Vusumuzi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Vusumuzi Jotham Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu’s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Zama Senzi Jonathan Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by a named ANC supporter in Tropika location, Umlazi, Durban, on 1 August 1992

name: Zibuyile Priscilla Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ziningi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 13 April 1991.

name: Zinyezile Busisiwe Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Zj Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down during intense political conflict in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Balibele Ngcongo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters during the Chimora settlement attacks on 16 January 1992.

name: Mfungelwa Ngcongo
description: An IFP member who was fatally shot in a confrontation between IFP and ANC supporters while on his way home from a funeral in Ntiyane, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 November 1991. Three IFP supporters and two of the perpetrators, allegedly ANC supporters, were killed during the attack.

name: Ntombini Velencia Ngcongo
description: An IFP supporter who lost her houses in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Emachobeni, Richmond, Natal, on 7 March 1991.

name: Richard Rhee Ngcongo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in a confrontation between IFP and ANC supporters while on his way home from a funeral in Ntiyane, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 November 1991. Three IFP supporters and two of the perpetrators, allegedly ANC supporters, were killed during the attack.

name: Witness Themba Ngcongo
description: Was abducted and killed on 1 June 1991 in Clermont, near Durban, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sipho Cyprian Ngcongwane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and axed by IFP supporters while on his way to Woodford, Bergville, Natal, to attend an ANC meeting on 1 August 1993. Mr Ngcongwane was treated for severe head injuries, but his mental capacities remain impaired.

name: Khethiwe Ngcoya
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, in 1991.

name: Luvuno Ngele
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared from a Durban hostel in which he was staying in the course of 1990, at a time of intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. He has not been seen since.

name: Alpheus Ngema
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted at gunpoint by four men in a white minibus, allegedly ANC supporters, while working on a construction site in Tokoza, Tvl, on 30 August 1993. The men allegedly took Mr Ngema to Phola Park informal settlement. He has never been seen since.

name: Babongile Winnfrieda Ngema
description: She had her houses burnt down during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in 1993.

name: Blessing Ngema
description: Was attacked and severely beaten by IFP supporters in Ogunjini, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in June 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His father was also severely injured in the attack.

name: Dumoluhle Ngema
description: Was stabbed and injured by IFP supporters in an attack on his family in Empangeni, Natal, on 27 February 1993. Three other members of his family were injured and one person was killed in the attack. The family was believed to support the ANC.

name: Fikile Remember Ngema
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters in Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, in August 1990.

name: Funani Ngema
description: She had her house burnt down in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Nogobhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 14 November 1993.

name: Gladys Ngema
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in ongoing political conflict at KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 14 November 1993. Twenty-one houses belonging to ANC supporters were burnt down in the attack.

name: Jabulile Sizani Ngema
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1993.

name: Mkhulumeleni Ngema
description: She had her house at KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in continuing political conflict on 14 November 1993. Twenty-one houses belonging to ANC supporters were burnt down in the attack.

name: Muzikawubonwa Ngema
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 2 July 1992.

name: Nesta Julie Ngema
description: An ANC supporter and NUMSA worker who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 27 February 1993, allegedly because she worked for a trade union affiliated to COSATU. Her sister and three children were all seriously injured in the attack.

name: Netelina Ngema
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in continuing political conflict on 14 November 1993. Twenty-one houses belonging to ANC supporters were burnt down in the attack.

name: Nkosini Ngema
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in continuing political conflict on 14 November 1993. Twenty-one houses belonging to ANC supporters were burnt down in the attack.

name: Nokwethemba Philile Ngema
description: An ANC supporter who was seriously injured when she was shot and stabbed by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 27 February 1993. Her sister was killed and three children were seriously injured in the attack

name: Nomaweza Elsie Ngema
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and belongings burnt in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1991.

name: Ntombizonke Ntombinkulu Ngema
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed by IFP supporters in the KwaKhoza area, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 10 November 1993.

name: Samson Ngema
description: Was severely beaten and stabbed by IFP supporters in Ogunjini, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in June 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His son was also severely injured in the attack.

name: Sibani Ngema
description: Was shot in the head by IFP supporters in an attack on his family in Empangeni, Natal, on 27 February 1993. Three other members of his family were injured and one person was killed in the attack. His family was believed to support the ANC.

name: Sinda Mzikau Khulewa Ngema
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at the Duduza hostel in Tvl on 19 March 1994. At least ten people were killed in the attack, which took place after IFP hostel-dwellers had attacked and evicted ANC hostel-dwellers. Two SDU members were granted amnesty for this killing (AC/2000/054).

name: Chris Ngwenya
description: A leader of the Black Cats who was killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) during a period of conflict in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, in March 1992. Mr Ngwenya’s wife was killed and his sister-in-law injured in the attack. Five SDU members were granted amnesty for the incident (AC/98/0121).

name: Mthuthuzeli Use Ngeseki
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters at Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, in 1992.

name: Hamvundla Hester Nhlumayo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 March 1994.

name: Sayco Ngubane
description: Was shot dead in Wesselton, Ermelo, Tvl, on 10 August 1991 by IFP supporters on a bus returning from a funeral during intense conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Ntombifuthi Mavis Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed in the face during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 16 January 1993. Her brother, an ANC supporter, her daughter and her parents were burnt to death when the house was set alight. Ms Ngcobo was stabbed while escaping through a window.

name: Hlino Irene Nhlumayo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 March 1994.

name: Low Gladys Ngcemu
description: She lost her home and her shop in an attack by ANC supporters during political conflict in Ixopo, Natal, in 1992.

name: Msawenkosi Ellery Ngesi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 April 1991.

name: Wiseman Zola Ngcemu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters during political conflict in Ixopo, Natal, in 1992.

name: Nontsapho Phillis ‘Manyawuza’ Ngesman
description: Was tied to the bed in her home in Waterkloof settlement, Somerset West, Cape Town, on 26 April 1992, while her husband was shot dead and robbed by men in balaclavas and police uniforms. The perpetrators were allegedly linked to the Western Cape United Squatters Association, who had been threatening local ANC members. See balaclava groups.

name: Sigezenga Desmond Ngesman
description: An ANC member who was shot at his home in Waterkloof settlement, Somerset West, Cape Town, on 26 April 1992, and died two days later. He was shot by men clad in balaclavas and wearing police uniforms, allegedly linked to the Western Cape United Squatters Association, who had been threatening local ANC members. See balaclava groups.

name: Balungile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death in an arson attack on her home during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 16 January 1993. Balungile’s grandparents and her uncle, an ANC supporter, were also burnt to death, while her mother managed to escape with a stab wound.

name: Dumisani Ngiba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP members during political violence at Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 24 September 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: John Ngiba
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khehla Leonard Vusumuzi Ngiba
description: An ANC supporter who was fatally shot during an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Maria Ngiba
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. Her parents were reportedly killed in the attack. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mfaniseni Muntukabani Ngiba
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sibongile Joyce Ngiba
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters at Mbozama, Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 9 January 1994.

name: Cosmos Bona Ngcobo
description: Was burnt to death when his family home was set alight during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 16 January 1993. Three other family members were also burnt to death, while Mr Ngcobo’s sister managed to escape with a stab wound.

name: Abednigo Bhekisisa Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, on 29 October 1993.

name: Bawelile Gwiji Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bhekisile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bonakele Khohliwe Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Boneleni Babazile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bongekile Abegail Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bongephiwe Happiness Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Busisiwe Thobekile Mazondi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Catherine Ngidi
description: She suffered severe material loss when her house was looted during political conflict at U Section, Umlazi, Durban, on 12 November 1992. The perpetrators allegedly came from an IFP stronghold at Unit 17. The family believe they were targeted for housing ANC refugees during political conflict in the area. Her daughter was severely injured in the attack.

name: Cebile Promise Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 14 February 1994.

name: Cimezile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Dangwana Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: David Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Delisile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Duduzile Maureen Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 8 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Duduzile Maureen Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 8 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Duduzile Zamokwakhe Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Dukuza Albert Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 13 December 1993.

name: Emgard Emily Ngidi
description: She lost her house in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Wartburg, Natal, on 9 April 1992

name: Emmanuel Mondli Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who suffered severe material loss when his house and furniture were destroyed by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in February 1992. Six people were killed in Folweni that month by attackers firing at people indiscriminately.

name: Gladys Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 25 January 1993.

name: Gomengani Cynthia Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Gundu Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Hambeleni Tuleleni Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Hilda Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 2 August 1992.

name: Jabulani Ngidi
description: An ANC member who was killed in KwaMashu, Durban, on 29 March 1994. A peace meeting had been scheduled at a hostel in KwaMashu to resolve differences between KwaMashu residents and hostel-dwellers. Mr Ngidi was one of seven ANC delegates abducted from the hostel by IFP supporters. Two survived. Four IFP supporters, including the chairperson of the IFP hostel branch in KwaMashu, were convicted for the killings.

name: Jabulile Petronela Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Jabulisile Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: John Phakathi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 13 December 1993.

name: Kathleen Thendekile Ngidi
description: Was shot and severely wounded at Umlazi U Section, Durban, on 12 November 1992. Her unidentified attackers are believed to have come from Unit 17 of Umlazi, an IFP stronghold. The family was allegedly targeted for housing ANC refugees during the conflict between the IFP and ANC. Ms Ngidi is now partially paralysed.

name: Khanysile Ngenzeni Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khethiwe Joyce Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khonzeni Ngidi
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khulumani John Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Kwekalikho Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 March 1994.

name: Linda John Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, in July 1992. Gunmen attacked several houses that day, injuring three people. Fifteen houses were burnt down during the attack.

name: Lungeleni Agnes Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lungiseni Nozipho Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994 in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Maninginingi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks

name: Manozi Ngidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Kota Nhlumayo
description: Was shot and injured when IFP supporters attacked homes in an ANC stronghold in the Umbumbulu area, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 October 1992. Eight people were killed; six women and eight children were injured in the shooting. Many homes were attacked and destroyed.

name: Sipho Sakhile Ngubane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Ndodwane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The attack took place on the same day as a peace meeting in the area.

name: Sipho Sakhile Ngubane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Ndodwane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 April 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The attack took place on the same day as a peace meeting in the area.

name: Ntombikayise Elizabeth Ngcobo
description: She had her home destroyed in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Eshowe, Natal, in 1993.

name: Sifiso Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters on 5 April 1993 in the Lusaka informal settlement, Umlazi, Durban. Shortly before his death, he and his brother, who was killed on the same day, had allegedly fled the Port Shepstone area to escape IFP attempts on their lives.

name: Sizakele Doreen Ngubane
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thandiwe Florence Ngubane
description: Was shot and severely injured and had her house in Enhlalakahle, Greytown, Natal, destroyed by named ANC supporters in November 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Themba Ngubane
description: An ANC supporter who lost his home in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in arson attack by IFP supporters on 2 August 1992.

name: Thembekile Lillios Ngubane
description: Was stabbed and severely injured by ANC supporters who attacked her home in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 30 October 1993. The perpetrators accused her husband of storing weapons for the IFP, and shot him dead in the attack. Four others were injured, including two children.

name: Thembelihle Wilson Ngubane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death and his body set alight by IFP supporters at Santa in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 July 1993.

name: Xolani Ngubane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed, axed and shot dead by unidentified perpetrators at a taxi rank in Pietermaritzburg during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area on 3 February 1993. Two others were also killed, and one injured.

name: Bukani Beatrice ‘Maluthuli’ Ngubani
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by named IFP supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 April 1991.

name: Nofi Bhekokwakhe Ngubani
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Bafana Ngubeni
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned, burnt to death and his body was then mutilated in Katlehong, Tvl, on 23 July 1993, allegedly by ANC supporters because he was friendly with a Zulu-speaking person assumed to be an IFP supporter.

name: Mlambo Michael Ngubeni
description: Was shot dead by an ANC supporter in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 25 January 1987. The perpetrator applied for amnesty.

name: Flomentia Ngubo
description: An ANC supporter who had to abandon her home in Ixopo, Natal, when her family was severely harassed by IFP supporters in 1993. Ms Ngubo’s son had been shot dead by IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Judith Nosisa Ngubo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in the right thigh and severely injured in Katlehong, Transvaal, while travelling on a train towards Wadeville, on 9 August 1991. Between 1990 and 1993, 572 people died in train violence. The East Rand was a key site of train violence with the track from Katlehong to Kwesine station becoming the line with the highest risk in South Africa.

name: Kennest Ndodo Ngubo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in January 1991.

name: Xolani Ngubo
description: Was one of three men stabbed to death by ANC supporters and residents of the Bottlebrush informal settlement, Chatsworth, Durban, in ongoing political conflict on 26 December 1993. Three ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/1998/0059).

name: Ziyalile Baqiphile Ngubo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by fellow ANC supporters during serious internal conflict at Woodyglen, Mpuma-langa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 January 1987.

name: Kadefunwa Nguzo
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten by police on his arrest in Robertson, Cape, in November 1985. On 18 June 1986 he was again beaten by police and detained for three months.

name: Kadefunwa Nguzo
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten by police on his arrest in Robertson, Cape, in November 1985. On 18 June 1986 he was again beaten by police and detained for three months.

name: Nonhlanzeko Maggie Hlomuka Ngwabe
description: She had her house at Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 11 February 1990. See Richmond Farm arson attacks.

name: Babo Michael Ngwane
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bathobile Ngwane
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters, who also stole her livestock and furniture, in December 1991.

name: Giphet Khulekani Ngwane
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in April 1993.

name: Themninkosi Killer Ngwane
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Gideon Legothi Ngwape
description: An ANC supporter who was threatened with his life, his cattle were stolen and his house was burnt down in Kgomo, near Pietersburg, Tvl, in April 1990 during political conflict in the area.

name: Nomvuyo Sweetness Nhlumayo
description: She had her house in KwaXolo, near Ramsgate, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 5 April 1994 in the conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomvuyo Sweetness Nhlumayo
description: She had her house in KwaXolo, near Ramsgate, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 5 April 1994 in the conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Richard Nomaquiza Nhlumayo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by named IFP supporters in KwaDandala, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 September 1990. Three other ANC supporters were also killed in the incident.

name: Nosizi Annastasia Ngcobo-Shezi
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house in an arson attack in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ixopo, Natal, on 9 September 1992. A petrol bomb was thrown into the house while the family was asleep. Some ANC supporters were arrested in connection with this incident, but were released.

name: Aaron Goli Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Pietermaritzburg on 7 December 1987. He was allegedly targeted because he was a councillor for the local IFP induna .

name: Sigqoko Philip Nhlumayo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot by ANC supporters in Ensimbini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992, and died later of an internal haemorrhage. He was ambushed while raising an alarm to signal an ANC attack.

name: Ntombizodwa Victoria Ngcobo
description: She had her home in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, destroyed in an attack by unidentified persons in October 1993 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Having fled the area because of the political violence, the family found their house destroyed when they returned.

name: Abigail Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in January 1991. She and her family fled and hid in nearby bushes. They saw the perpetrators empty their house of all valuables and then set it alight.

name: Ntulu Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters during intense political conflict in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Christopher Tello Nikelo
description: An ANC supporte r who left with other comrades to attend a funeral in Orkney, Transvaal, in 1986 and was never seen again. Four days after he disappeared, his mother received a call from from an unidentified ‘comrade’ who told her that her son had been arrested and transferred to Stilfontein. At Stilfontein police station the police denied having seen him.

name: Fana Steven Nikwe
description: Was abducted by IFP supporters during ongoing political conflict at Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 January 1992. The perpetrators allegedly forced him and two friends to accompany them in an attack on suspected ANC supporters. He subsequently fled the area.

name: Mboniseni Nikwe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter at a shopping centre in Marburg, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in March 1994. He had witnessed the shooting of his father and brother, and the perpetrators feared that he would identify them.

name: Xolani Lawrence Nikwe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by named IFP supporters in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 March 1994.

name: Margaret Evelina Ninela
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters in February 1991.

name: Buyiswa Lydia Nini
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in an ambush on the road between Ilitha and Berlin, Cape, in April 1993, while travelling in a car with her husband, Mr Lulama Nini.

name: Lulama Nini
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead while opening his business in Ilitha, near Berlin, Cape, on 1 June 1993.

name: Langa Likhanya Njamela
description: An ANC activist who was banished from Port Elizabeth in 1966 and kept under house arrest in Tsomo, Transkei. In March 1963, he had been detained for 180 days at Cala prison, Transkei, where he was beaten, kept in solitary confinement for 90 days, deprived of food, water and blankets for three days, and interrogated by members of the Special Branch about Poqo activities

name: Sibongile Mildred Njapa
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 6 April 1992. She and her children were forced to flee the area.

name: Baphindile Lucy Njapha
description: She had her home burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: David Vamasi Njapha
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 7 August 1992, allegedly because he was an ANC councillor.

name: Hlohlimpi John Njapha
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Patrick Magabhana Njapha
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 April 1991.

name: Nokwendisa Priscilla Njeje
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by a named perpetrator in Flagstaff, Transkei, on 13 December 1992. At the time, there was a meeting in the Xhopozo tribal authority between ANC supporters and followers of the local chief. In a fight that ensued, several people were assaulted and several houses were burnt down.

name: Ernest Muntu Njilo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by IFP members on 11 February 1993.

name: Busani Alex Njoko
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Estcourt, Natal, on 28 March 1994.

name: Khaya Simon Njoko
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Estcourt, Natal, on 28 March 1994.

name: Lucas Thembinkosi Njoko
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142)

name: Thobile Olga Njoko
description: Was assaulted and severely injured by IFP supporters during political conflict at Estcourt, Natal, on 30 October 1993. Three people were killed and three homes set alight in separate incidents of violence between the ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mandla Njokweni
description: An ANC member who was shot and injured by a group of men in balaclavas, including one in a Special Constable uniform, in Site B, Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 2 August 1992. He was patrolling with a community defence unit, established to ward off balaclava group attacks on the community and ANC members. Two people were injured and another was killed in the attack.

name: Princess Nontuthuzelo Norhi Njoli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 25 December 1988 at NU10, Mdantsane, Ciskei.

name: Nzimene Jeffrey Njuza
description: An ANC supporter and NUM unionist who was shot dead by a white co-worker at the Rustenburg Refineries, Transvaal, because he drank from a cup reserved for white workers. Mr Njuza had been campaigning against separate facilities. Afterwards, the perpetrator shot and killed himself.

name: Constance Veliwe Nkabinde
description: She lost her house in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Ntambanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 January 1994.

name: Dedisim Nkabinde
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: James Mbuyiseni Nkabinde
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142)

name: Thembisile Rita Nkabinde
description: An IFP supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, in July 1992.

name: Thoko Nkabinde
description: Was burnt when her home was petrol-bombed in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, in July 1992.

name: Thulisiwe Seddy Ntu Nkabinde
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at KwaMashu, Durban, on 21 June 1992. The perpetrators were allegedly returning from an IFP rally at Princess Magogo stadium in KwaMashu.

name: Olive Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house set alight and badly damaged by IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers from KwaMashu, Durban, in August 1993.

name: Patrick Bonginkosi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Shallcross, Durban, on 14 August 1993.

name: Patrick Nkosinathi Ngcobo
description: Was shot by ANC supporters during political conflict at Umlazi, Durban, on 24 July 1993.

name: Alpheus Bafanyana Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at KwaDweshula, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 September 1990.

name: Andile Ngcobo
description: Was shot and killed by ANC supporters at Nomhele Reserve, Mapumolo, Natal, on 15 March 1992. Three people were killed and two were severely injured. One ANC member was refused amnesty (AC/1997/0045).

name: Bajabulile Doris Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks

name: Baliwe Bertina Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991. Political violence claimed the lives of at least 31 people during April and May 1991, and rendered about 200 people in the area homeless.

name: Baliwe Bertina Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Okhalweni, Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 May 1991. Political violence claimed the lives of at least 31 people during April and May 1991, and rendered about 200 people in the area homeless.

name: Solomon Bhekabantu Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death in an arson attack on his home during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 16 January 1993. Mr Ncobo’s wife, son and granddaughter were also burnt to death, while his daughter managed to escape with a stab wound.

name: Bambekile Qondeni Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Beauty Balekile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house vandalised and looted by IFP supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Beauty Balekile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house vandalised and looted by IFP supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bekisisa Elias Petrus Ngcobo
description: He lost his home in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 27 January 1993.

name: Benjamin Ngcobo
description: An employee of Rand Water who was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) while travelling in a taxi past the informal settlement of Phola Park in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 26 February 1992. Four people died and eight were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0225). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Bheki Zephenia Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 13 November 1991. His family home in Murchison was later burnt down.

name: Bhekithemba Ngcobo
description: He had his two rondavels in the Vekeza Reserve, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 3 February 1994, allegedly because his sister’s children, who lived with his family, were ANC supporters.

name: Bhekizwe Philemon Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bonakele Mavis (Mamsomi) Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bongani Siphiwe Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in May 1992 in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in continuing conflict between supporters of the ANC and the IFP.

name: Bongebani Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bonginkosi Cyrial Ngcoeni Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named perpetrators in Dambuza, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritz-burg, on 27 May 1991, allegedly because he was thought to have sympathies with the IFP. His two brothers were also killed in the same incident. The perpetrators were convicted, sentenced and imprisoned for the killings.

name: Boy Isaac Ngcobo
description: Was stabbed to death by a named IFP supporter in Mazambane, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg on 14 November 1990, during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Busisiwe Vimbephi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Busisiwe Zibuyile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bususiwe Tengisile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Buyaphi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Buyaphi Eddie Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Charles Zenzele Ngcobo
description: Was shot in the back during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in May 1991.

name: Constance Ntombenye Ngcobo
description: She  had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ladysmith, Natal, in April 1994 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her grandson was shot and killed before the perpetrators set fire to the house.

name: Constance Ntombenye Ngcobo
