description: She  had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ladysmith, Natal, in April 1994 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her grandson was shot and killed before the perpetrators set fire to the house.

name: Dlokwakhe Arson Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Dlulephi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Doda Moses Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who was beaten and stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 6 December 1993.

name: Doreen Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Doris Mathombi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, set alight by IFP supporters in January 1991.

name: Dumazile Alescia Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 8 March 1993, when the bus in which she was travelling was ambushed by armed IFP supporters at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg. The bus was taking 80 ANC supporters to attend the court appearance in Pieter-maritzburg of three men implicated in the ambush of a vehicle carrying IFP supporters on 5 March 1993. Three men and a woman were killed, and at least 16 people were injured.

name: Dumazile Alescia Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 8 March 1993, when the bus in which she was travelling was ambushed by armed IFP supporters at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg. The bus was taking 80 ANC supporters to attend the court appearance in Pieter-maritzburg of three men implicated in the ambush of a vehicle carrying IFP supporters on 5 March 1993. Three men and a woman were killed, and at least 16 people were injured.

name: Dumazile Busisiwe Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Dumephi Bertina Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Madakane, Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 9 July 1992.

name: Elinah Behlikile Ngcobo
description: Was shot and severely injured in her home by named ANC supporters during political conflict at KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, in 1991. One of her sons had already been killed and her grandson severely injured in the ongoing political violence in the area.

name: Elizabeth Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Elizabeth Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Elizabeth Jima Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters who attacked her home near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 February 1992. Her husband was also shot dead in the attack.

name: Ellen Nonacala Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her five rondavels in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lolo Ngwenya
description: An ANC supporter who was attacked and injured in Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 24 March 1990, when IFP supporters attacked the house he was visiting. One person was killed in the attack.

name: Peter Ngcobo
description: Was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Nomhele Reserve, Mapumolo, Natal, on 15 March 1992. Three people were killed and two were severely injured. One ANC member was refused amnesty (AC/1997/0045).

name: Mandla Michael Ngwenya
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten to death by unidentified perpetrators in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 17 June 1991.

name: Nhlanhla Bernard Ngwenya
description: Was shot dead during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 8 August 1992.

name: Thembani Doris Ngwenya
description: She had her house at Umlazi, Durban, burnt down during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters on 8 August 1992.

name: Thembeni Rosemary Ngwenya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Emabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 25 December 1992.

name: Masewu Ngxongo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Estcourt, Natal, on 4 August 1993.

name: Obed Friday Nhlabathi
description: Was shot and stabbed to death by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in his hospital bed in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, in August 1992. Mr Nhlabathi was allegedly involved with the Black Cats. Two SDU members were granted amnesty for the attack (AC/98/0121).

name: Thula Alson Nhlabathi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters on 31 October 1992 while attending a funeral of a fellow ANC supporter in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal.

name: Teresa Dudu Nhlangulela
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 29 October 1993. Three of her friends and one family member died in the attack.

name: Nobelungu Sannah Nhlapho
description: An ANC supporter who was raped and shot in Evaton, Transvaal, on 26 June 1993 by named IFP supporters who had earlier shot and killed her boyfriend.

name: Bafana Swartbooi Nhlapo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Transvaal, on 12 May 1991 during conflict in the township between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Buti Samson Nhlapo
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted and shot dead, allegedly by ANC supporters, in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 17 August 1993

name: Petros Dumisani Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by unidentified taxi operators during politicised conflict in the taxi industry in Umtata, Transkei, on 25 July 1990. See taxi violence.

name: Phasha Ngcobo
description: Was assaulted by IFP supporters during political conflict in the Gingindlovu area, Natal, on 24 July 1993, allegedly because he would not join them on campaigns against ANC supporters.

name: Phineas Thulasizwe Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters who attacked his home in the Port Shepstone area, Natal, on 3 February 1992. His wife was also shot dead in the attack.

name: Princess Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 13 April 1991 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Qhatimpi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, looted and burnt down by IFP supporters in January 1991.

name: Qinisela Hezekia Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by named IFP members in Taylors Halt, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 31 January 1993. He died in hospital two weeks later.

name: Qondephi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Rose Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sabukwazi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks

name: Sakhiseni Johnson Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Samuel Mduduzi Ngcobo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 15 May 1993, allegedly because he was thought to be an ANC supporter.

name: Sebengiphile Robert Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sebengiphile Robert Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sekesheni Tembekile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Ekuphakameni, near Inanda, Durban, in 1993. The family was permanently displaced.

name: Sibongile Beauty Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sibongile Euginia Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Ixopo, Natal, on 28 July 1993.

name: Sibongiseni Isaac Shezi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named perpetrators in Dambuza, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 27 May 1991, allegedly because he was thought to have sympathies with the IFP. His two brothers were also killed in the same incident. The perpetrators were convicted and imprisoned for the killings.

name: Siliya Bangiwe Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 13 November 1991. Her son had been killed in political conflict shortly before the attack.

name: Simaku Nesta Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembinkosi Alfred Ngwenya
description: An ANC supporter who escaped injury when he was shot at by hooded gunmen who attacked three homes at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 20 June 1993. See Murchison attacks.

name: Simon Bekisani Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 October 1992. His brother was also shot dead in the attack.

name: Siyabonga Armstrong Ngcobo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 14 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Siyabonga Armstrong Ngcobo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 14 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Siziwe Albertina Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 July 1992.

name: Solomon Ngcobo
description: Was injured when he was stabbed with a bayonet by an ANC/FAWU member at his workplace at Langeberg Foods in Boksburg, Tvl, on 12 June 1992, during a period of conflict between IFP and ANC-supporting workers at the factory. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/0080).

name: Teni Theodosia Ngcobo
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by fellow IFP supporters in Nkwezela, Bulwer, Natal, in 1993. She was allegedly attacked because her children were members of the ANC.

name: Thami Theophilus Ngcobo
description: An ANC member who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in an arson attack on his home at Port Shepstone, Natal, in April 1991. He had refused to join the IFP.

name: Thamsanqa Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters at Imbali, Pieter-maritzburg, in March 1991. His friend was shot dead in the incident.

name: Thandazi Ngcobo
description: Was shot and injured by ANC members and supporters at Nomhele Reserve, Mapumolo, Natal, on 15 March 1992. Three people were killed and two were severely injured. One ANC member was refused amnesty (AC/1997/0045).

name: Thandekile Kathleen Lovel Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured at Umlazi U Section, Durban, by unidentified assailants from an IFP stronghold on 12 November 1992. The family was targeted for allegedly harbouring ANC refugees.

name: Thandephi Mduduzi Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 September 1993. Six people were killed, more than 100 homes were burnt down and hundreds of cattle were stolen in Ndwedwe that month.

name: Thandiwe Thembisile Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Emangwaneni, Bulwer, Natal, on 25 January 1992.

name: Themba Vitus Ngcobo
description: Was shot dead in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 29 March 1992.

name: Thembeni Andrina Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Pietermaritzburg burnt down by IFP supporters on 19 April 1991.

name: Thembeni Lilian Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house and livestock in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembeni Lilian Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house and livestock in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembi Janet Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house and her livestock in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembinkosi Obed Mguyo Ngcobo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named perpetrators in Dambuza, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 27 May 1991, allegedly because he was thought to have sympathies with the IFP. His two brothers were also killed in the same incident. The perpetrators were convicted and imprisoned for the killings

name: Thembinkosi Wellington Mauthi Ngcobo
description: Was shot and killed by an IFP member at Mtateni, Port Alfred, Natal, on 24 March 1991. An amnesty applicant testified that he killed Mr Ngcobo because he believed him to be an ANC supporter. He was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0339).

name: Luka Hlomendlini Ntineza
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in February 1992.

name: Sphiwo Mbongeni Ntineza
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Hloniphile Princess Ntaka
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured when IFP supporters attacked her home in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 November 1993, allegedly because the family was known to support the ANC. Ms Ntaka was blinded as a result of the shooting. One brother was shot dead, and a brother and sister shot and injured in the attack.

name: Ncamsile Nkomo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 18 July 1990.

name: Maginqa Ntinga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in the thigh by IFP supporters at Umkomaas, near Durban, in 1992. He was allegedly targeted because he was residing in an IFP-dominated area.

name: Thembekile Thomas Ntitshane
description: An ANC member who was one of three people shot dead in Lower Crossroads, Cape Town, on 14 May 1993, when a group of men in a vehicle opened fire on them during a period of conflict between residents and a local Crossroads leader.

name: Clifford Nkabini
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters on 4 September 1992 in political conflict at Vulindlela, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritz-burg. His body was discarded near a railway line.

name: Mzwabantu Wellington Ntliziyombi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by ADM supporters during political conflict in Berlin, Cape, on 15 October 1993.

name: Sithembile Richard Ntliziywana
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters during political conflict at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 February 1991. At the time of his death, Mr Ntliziywana, who was an IFP commander, was allegedly leading an attack on ANC supporters at Gamalakhe.

name: Vuyisile Ntlokwana
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured in politicised ethnic conflict between Zulus and Xhosas in Durban on 17 October 1990.

name: Nkosiphi Ntlumayo
description: He had his home destroyed in a dawn attack on the ANC stronghold of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 16 February 1993 in intensifying conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Ten people were killed and 35 houses were burnt down.

name: Mandleko Agnes Ntobela
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1991.

name: David Phathisiwe Ntombana
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and tortured by named supporters of a local Crossroads leader in Crossroads, Cape Town, in September 1986, because of his opposition to the rent system imposed on Crossroads residents.

name: (First Name Not Given) Ntombela
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at the Duduza hostel in Tvl, on 19 March 1994. At least ten people were killed in the attack, which took place after IFP hostel-dwellers had attacked and evicted ANC hostel-dwellers. Two SDU members were granted amnesty for the killing (AC/2000/054).

name: Abednigo Bongani Ntombela
description: Was shot and injured in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Cebekhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 5 April 1994.

name: Amon Sicelo Ntombela
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and stabbed to death by IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers at Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 2 August 1991.

name: Bafo Justice Ntombela
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by fellow ANC supporters in Ashdown, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 23 July 1987. He had allegedly been mistaken for a leader of the IFP youth.

name: Bekithemba Mandlenkosi Ntombela
description: An IFP supporter who lost his home in an attack by ANC supporters at Empangeni, Natal, in June 1993.

name: Busisiwe Prudence Ntombela
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters during political conflict at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 3 August 1991. The perpetrators were allegedly looking for her father, who was an ANC supporter.

name: Duduzile Busisiwe Ntombela
description: She had her home at Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters during ongoing political conflict in September 1992. Ms Ntombela had been accused of being an ANC supporter.

name: Emgard Ntombela
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Uvondlo, Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in October 1990.

name: Joseph Mhlaliseni Ntombela
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Madlenkosi Eric Ntombela
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters, one of whom is named, during political conflict at Umlazi, Durban, on 16 December 1993. Mr Ntombela was allegedly killed because he had earlier tried to protect teachers from the threat of a student attack, and because he had refused to join the ANC.

name: Mlindeli Creswell Ntombela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, at Estcourt, Natal, on 2 October 1993, allegedly for refusing to join the IFP.

name: Mlungisi Pikson Ntombela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, at Estcourt, Natal, on 27 September 1993, allegedly for refusing to join the IFP.

name: Moses Ngede Ntombela
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Mooi River, Natal, on 4 December 1991.

name: Muzikayise Ntombela
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Petrus Bafana Ntombela
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten in Tokoza, Tvl, in 1992, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Sesi Ntombela
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Simeon Thandukwazi Ntombela
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 20 November 1992.

name: Sindisiwe Beatrice Ntombela
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters, one of whom is named, during political conflict at Umlazi, Durban, on 16 December 1993. Ms Ntombela was asleep in her house when she was shot.

name: Sipho Ntombela
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead and his body was set alight, allegedly by ANC supporters, in Tokoza, Tvl, in 1993.

name: Themba Ntombela
description: Was shot when masked gunmen entered the family home in Vosloorus, Tvl, on 12 October 1991 and opened fire. Three family members were killed and eight people were wounded in the attack, which occurred during a period of conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC- supporting residents.

name: Themba Ntombincana Ntombela
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in Boshi near Estcourt, Natal, in an arson attack by alleged IFP supporters, for refusing to join the IFP.

name: Veli Raphael Ntombela
description: Was shot dead when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Vivian Jabulani Ntombela
description: Was one of eight passengers shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Six other passengers were shot dead. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Beauty Tholakele Ntozakhe
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ngangezinye Medrina Nkomo
description: An IFP supporter who had her home set alight by named ANC supporters in Nkelabantwana, Bulwer, Natal, on 18 April 1992.

name: Mfanukile Simon Ntaka
description: Was shot and injured in Isipingo, Natal, on 10 March 1991 during a violent confrontation involving a shoot-out between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sipho Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters at Maqedandaba area, Estcourt, Natal.

name: Dikekile Ignancia Nkabini
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in the Bulwer area, Natal, in November 1992.

name: Sipho Simeon Nkosi
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed, assaulted and shot dead by named fellow IFP supporters at the Ngoje community hall in Louwsburg, Natal, on 24 April 1992, allegedly because he had sympathies with the ANC.

name: Ntombifuthi Gladness Ntaka
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured when IFP supporters attacked her home in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 November 1993, allegedly because the family was known to support the ANC. One brother was shot dead in the attack, and another brother and a sister were also injured.

name: Nhlanhla Emmanuel Ntozakhe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 March 1992.

name: Gertrude Thokozile Nkabini
description: An ANC supporter who had her home set alight by a named IFP supporter in Gwagwa, Vulindlela, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 3 May 1991.

name: Robert Nonqandela
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted in March 1960 at Isikelo, near Bizana, Transkei, because of his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Rebecca Duduzile Nkomo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 November 1992 in intensifying political conflict in the area.

name: Vusumuzi Ntaka
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured when IFP supporters attacked his home in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 November 1993, allegedly because the family was known to support the ANC. His brother was shot dead in the attack, and his two sisters were also injured.

name: Nondumiso Alice Nontamo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 December 1990.

name: Sibusiso Ntozela
description: An ANC supporter who was found dead at Lamontville, Durban, on 27 October 1992, after his family had received an anonymous call to inform them about his death. Shortly before his death, Mr Ntozela had fled his home because of the political violence between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Sandile Nkomo
description: Was severely lashed at a ‘people’s court’ under the command of an officer of the self defence unit (SDU) in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 July 1993. Another young man was beaten to death that day in the same incident. One ANC SDU member was granted amnesty for the assault, but not for the killing (AC/2000/033).

name: Mtwana Ntunja
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Mbayimbayi, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992. It is alleged that IFP supporters were patrolling the area at night, killing ANC supporters and burning their homes.

name: Thabile Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Maqedandaba, Estcourt, Natal, on 3 June 1993.

name: Nokulungisa Gugu Goodness Ntuzela
description: An ANC supporter who was harassed and threatened with death by other ANC supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban in April 1990. Ms Ntuzela was allegedly suspected of being more aligned to the IFP. She eventually fled her area.

name: Abel Mavandla Ntwana
description: An ANC member who fled to Lesotho in 1960. Even though he was in exile, Tembuland Chief Kaiser Matanzima ordered Mr Ntwana and his family to be banished from Calanga district to St Mark’s district, Transkei, in January 1961. The order also authorised the demolition of his home, which was done.

name: Vincent Mzwandile Ntwanambi
description: Was injured in the eye when hit by fragments from a petrol bomb in Tembisa, Tvl, on 13 June 1993 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Trueman Nxasana
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Trueman Nxasana
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 18 February 1994, when four gunmen attacked a house in the rural Mahahle village, near Creighton, Ixopo, Natal, in which he and other ANC youths were sleeping. Fifteen ANC youths were killed in the attack. They had been seen putting up posters announcing a voter education workshop in preparation for the April 1994 elections. Four prominent IFP leaders were acquitted on charges relating to the massacre.

name: Nan Nxele Ms (First Name Not Given)
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down in arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 9 December 1991. Her husband was killed in the attack.

name: Batakile Doreen Nxele
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in 1991.

name: Boniwe Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Empangeni, Natal, in December 1993.

name: Cebisile Hlengiwe Maria Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in the arm in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, on 13 April 1993.

name: David Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death IFP supporters at Esivivaneni, near Hammarsdale, Natal, on 1 February 1989.

name: Dedisile Lucia Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, by IFP supporters on 2 July 1993. Eight people were killed in this attack on the Nxele homestead.

name: Dumazile Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, by IFP supporters on 2 July 1993. Eight people were killed in this attack on the Nxele homestead.

name: Gugu Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death in an arson attack on her house by IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 November 1991.

name: Jabu Annie Laura Nxele
description: She had her house burnt down and her cattle stolen by ANC supporters during political conflict in Ixopo, Natal, in May 1993. She was non-partisan.

name: Jaff Phyllis Nxele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and hacked to death by ANC supporters in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 20 September 1992.

name: Josiah Nxele
description: Was shot and injured at Nhlangenyoka, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, on 13 April 1993. Mr Nxele and his family were allegedly attacked because his son was an ANC supporter and they stayed in an IFP stronghold.

name: Khulumelani Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, destroyed by IFP supporters on 2 July 1993. Eight people were killed in this attack on the Nxele homestead.

name: Lillian Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, destroyed by IFP supporters on 2 July 1993. Eight people were killed in this attack on the Nxele homestead

name: Mbovane Nkosibomvu Nxele
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was shot dead during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Mpetu Dennis Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Xhosheyakhe, Bulwer, Natal, on 16 October 1993.

name: Ms (First Name Not Given) Nxele
description: She had her home in Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down on 9 December 1991 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her husband was killed in the attack.

name: Nora Thembi Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, set alight by IFP supporters in 1991.

name: Phata-Phata Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, by IFP supporters on 2 July 1993. Eight people were killed in this attack on the Nxele homestead.

name: Phetheni Nxele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when ANC supporters attacked her home in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993. Seven occupants, including family members and neighbours who had taken shelter at the house because it was fenced, were killed, and three were injured.

name: Sithembiso Phathezakhe Davidson Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, by IFP supporters during political conflict on 2 July 1993. Eight people were killed in this attack on the Nxele homestead.

name: Ziyekile Nxele
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, set alight by IFP supporters in 1991.

name: Amon Thabiso Nxumalo
description: Survived an attempted killing by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Katlehong, Tvl, on 7 December 1993. Eleven ANC members were killed in conflict with an SDU in Moleleki section that day. Thirteen SDU members were refused amnesty (AC/1998/0013).

name: Bafana Mckenzie Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who died after being severely assaulted by IFP supporters at Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 15 February 1993. The attack was allegedly in retaliation for the killing of an IFP supporter by ANC supporters.

name: Beatrice Thembani Nxumalo
description: Was shot and seriously injured by IFP supporters during political conflict at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 March 1992. The perpetrators suspected her cousin of being an ANC member.

name: Bongani Zamani Nxumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Vryheid, Natal, on 1 August 1993.

name: Da Edwin Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house and possessions in an arson attack in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 March 1994.

name: Doda Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by an IFP member during political conflict at Izingolweni, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 July 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0339).

name: Dora Hlobozani Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 July 1992.

name: Fani Nxumalo
description: He lost his home in an arson attack at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 May 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Fano Petros Nxumalo
description: An ANC member who was shot in the jaw by a named fellow ANC member at his home in Azalea, Plessislaer, Pietermaritzburg, in 1993, allegedly for exposing corruption in the ANC leadership. His close friends in the community were also attacked, and one of them killed.

name: Fortunate Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death in an arson attack by IFP supporters at her boyfriend’s house in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 22 February 1992.

name: Girlie Lindiwe Nxumalo
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 30 March 1993.

name: Jabulani Nxumalo
description: He left for work from KwaMashu, Durban, during January 1992 and was never seen again. His brother, Arron, whose house had allegedly been burnt down twice by a named IFP perpetrator in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters, suspects the same perpetrator of being responsible for Mr Nxumalo’s disappearance.

name: Thembani Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by named IFP supporters, in Maqedandaba, Estcourt, Natal, on 3 June 1993.

name: Nondubela Nabo Nobhalisa
description: She had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 24 February 1993 on ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. About thirty five houses were reportedly burnt down in Bhambayi that month.

name: Snothi Norman Nkabini
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in KwaNxamalala, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 5 March 1992.

name: Thembelihle Dumazile Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 23 August 1993, during ongoing conflict following the launch of an IFP branch in the settlement earlier that month.

name: Brian Nodada
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 April 1994. Mr Nodada and his comrades were canvassing for their organisation in the run-up to the April 1994 elections when they were attacked and killed.

name: Brian Nodada
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 17 April 1994. Mr Nodada and his comrades were canvassing for their organisation in the run-up to the April 1994 elections when they were attacked and killed.

name: Mikayeli Nodipha
description: An ANC member who was arrested in Esikhumbuleni, Bizana, Transkei, in 1961, and charged with membership of the ANC. He was convicted and sentenced to three years’ imprisonment.

name: Zingewathile Nogqum
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 20 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zingewathile Nogqum
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 20 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zingewathile Nogqum
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 20 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zingewathile Nogqum
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 20 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mcholwa Nokwanda
description: She had her home at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Rose Nokwazi
description: She had her house at KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in continuing conflict during November 1993. Twenty-one houses belonging to ANC supporters were burnt down in the attack.

name: Yoliswa Nomajava
description: She lost her house in an arson attack during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in March 1993.

name: Agnes Nomandla
description: An ANCWL member who had her home damaged in an arson attack by named perpetrators in Khutsong, Carletonville, Tvl, on 19 March 1991. Her husband was killed in the attack and petrol was poured on her grandchild in an attempt to set him alight.

name: Wandisile Godfrey Nomaxhai
description: An ANC member who was shot dead in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 25 October 1990. At least eight people were killed that day by police and supporters of the Lingelethu West Town Council, during and after a mass march to express community opposition to the council.

name: Jorge Nessele Nombyana
description: Had his house burnt down in Bhukhanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 January 1994 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Mr Nombyana’s son was an ANC supporter.

name: Julius Spitipiti Nomgojo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house demolished by municipal employees in October 1993 in Maclear, Cape. It is alleged that the local council wanted to remove him from Maclear because he did not belong there.

name: Vuyisina Lilian Nompando
description: An ANC supporter who was detained in June 1986 for six weeks at a time of stayaways and consumer boycotts in Middelburg, Cape. She was released without being charged.

name: Ernest Dingindawo Nondaba (Ngcungama)
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Matsheketsheni, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 February 1994.

name: Boyisi Nondala
description: An ANC activist who disappeared while in police custody in KwaZakele, Port Elizabeth, in June 1987. He has not been seen since.

name: Lennox Nondlala
description: Was killed by IFP supporters at the Vusimuzi hostel in Tembisa, Transvaal , in 1991 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at the hostel. Although the dead were taken to two specific mortuaries, Mr Nondlala’s body was never found.

name: Nomusa Leticia Nondula
description: She had her house at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 5 November 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Four people were burnt to death in their homes in Bhambayi that day.

name: Raesibe Johana Nong
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and livestock burnt on 2 February  1980 in Gamatlala, Lebowa, by supporters of Chief BK Matlala because she resisted Lebowa’s  proposed independence from South Africa.

name: Nomabhele Angelina Nonkonela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Zondi, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 22 February 1992. Her seven month old baby was killed in the attack.

name: Phumeza Nonkonela
description: Was shot and killed by IFP supporters in her home in Zondi, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 22 February 1992. Her mother was an ANC supporter and was injured during the same attack.

name: Zwelihle Derek Nkabini
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten and hacked to death during political conflict at Dindi, Pietermaritzburg, in 1989.

name: Boza Nkontwana
description: She suffered substantial loss when her livestock was stolen and her property destroyed by ANC supporters during political conflict in Ixopo, Natal, in 1992.

name: Aaron Mbuyiselo Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by Special Constables during political conflict at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 October 1988. He was blinded in one eye as a result of the assault.

name: Wani Mhliniva Ntsede
description: An ANC supporter who was detained for five years without trial from March 1960 for his part in the Pondoland revolt. He was held in detention at Idutywa prison, Transkei, and severely tortured. As a result of his detention and torture, he was severely mentally affected. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Sicelo Ntantiso
description: He disappeared after leaving his home in Mdantsane, Ciskei, on 25 December 1988 to join the ANC in Lusaka. Mr Ntantiso did not return with fellow ANC exiles.

name: Tilly Nkosi
description: A prominent member ANCWL member who was shot and injured by IFP members during political conflict near Wesselton, Tvl, in 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Alvina Ntombenkulu Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Samson Themba Nkonyana
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared from his home in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 24 October 1993 and has never been seen since.

name: Bafana Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who was fatally shot by named IFP supporters in Bhomela, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 July 1992.

name: Boneni Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sifiso John Nkonyane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters in Newcastle, Natal, on 6 February 1993.

name: Velelo Alphius Ntseke
description: An ANC member who was shot and injured by a group of men in balaclavas, including one in a Special Constable uniform, in Site B, Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 2 August 1992. He was patrolling with a community defence unit, established to ward off attacks by balaclava group on the community and ANC members. Two others were injured and one was killed in the attack.

name: Mtholeni Hezekia Nkala
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Eshowe, Natal, on 30 April 1994, in political conflict following the April 1994 elections.

name: Mtholeni Hezekia Nkala
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Eshowe, Natal, on 30 April 1994, in political conflict following the April 1994 elections.

name: Bhabhalazi Elton Ntuli
description: An IFP member who lost his furniture and two cars, which were set alight by unidentified ANC supporters at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in October 1990.

name: Bhekabantu Mzowomna Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters on the road near Malagazi, Umlazi, Durban, on 28 February 1991.

name: Bheki Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who survived an attempt on his life by members of the Esikhawini hit squad at Empangeni, Natal, on 26 August 1992. Mr Ntuli, a NUMSA official, had his house riddled by bullets, and his windows smashed during the attack. He survived by returning fire, seriously wounding two of the assailants. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Christina Ntuli
description: She had her home petrol-bombed in June 1992, in Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Derrick Ntuli
description: Was shot and injured by an IFP supporter who attacked his uncle’s home in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in June 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His uncle was stabbed in the attack.

name: Dinga Bonginkosi Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in 1992.

name: Duduzile Doris Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 1 May 1994, during political violence following the April 1994 elections.

name: Duduzile Doris Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 1 May 1994, during political violence following the April 1994 elections.

name: Edward Hlengiwe Ntuli
description: Was shot dead in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 July 1992.

name: Ellen Ntuli
description: She had her house burnt down in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in September 1993

name: Elliot Celani Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter at his place of employment in Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 18 November 1992. One of his co- workers was injured when he chased the attackers. Mr Ntuli and his family had previously fled their home because of IFP harassment.

name: Ernestinah Vuyisiwe Ntuli
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters during political conflict at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in August 1990, allegedly because she was perceived to be an IFP supporter.

name: Fikisiwe Dorah Ntuli
description: She had her house burnt down during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Eshowe, Natal, in 1993.

name: Helen Basizile Ntuli
description: She lost her home in an arson attack in Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 4 September 1993 in conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Her son, an ANC supporter, was killed in the attack.

name: Hleziphi Ntuli
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house in an arson attack carried out by fellow IFP supporters at Bhukhanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 January 1993, allegedly because her children were thought to be ANC supporters.

name: Kufakomuzi Joseph Ntuli
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 December 1992.

name: Makhosi Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, after an IFP rally on 2 August 1992. A toddler being carried by Ms Ntuli was one of at least nine other people killed in the incident. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Mankehli Ntuli
description: She lost her home on 16 February 1993 in a dawn attack on the ANC stronghold of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Ten people were killed and 35 houses were burnt down in this attack.

name: Mbongeni Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead during an arson attack on the family home in Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 4 September 1993, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. The home was destroyed in the attack

name: Michael Mark Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and shot dead at Umlazi, Durban, by IFP members returning from a rally on 8 December 1991.

name: Moses Mhkuzelwa Ntuli
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Tvl, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Keqe Zakhasa Ntuli
description: Was killed and had his home burnt down in Dokodweni, KwaZulu, near Gingindlovu, Natal, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in 1993. His wife and sister-in-law managed to escape from the burning house, but he was pursued and killed. His decomposed body was found two weeks later.

name: Muzikayise Isaac Ntuli
description: He had his home in Mashayazafe, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed on 17 November 1990 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mzilawonke Jacob Ntuli
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down by ANC supporters in Greytown, Natal, in September 1990.

name: Ncamisile Ntuli
description: She had her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, vandalised and destroyed by IFP supporters on 8 August 1993, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. The attackers were returning from a rally at which a local branch of the party was launched.

name: Nelisiwe Ntuli
description: She had her house burnt down in an arson attack in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, in 1993.

name: Ngcebo Shadrack Ntuli
description: He had his house burnt down in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in December 1991. Mr Ntuli was allegedly targeted because his son was an ANC supporter.

name: Nkosana Ndukuzakhe Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted by named IFP supporters at Mooi River, Natal, on 25 September 1991.

name: Nozipho Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at Nyoni, KwaZulu, near Gingindlovu, Natal, on 23 August 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Paulos Ntuli
description: He had his house burnt down in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 5 July 1992. Mr Ntuli was allegedly targeted for not attending an IFP rally.

name: Rosa Khanyisile Mango Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who was forced to flee her home in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 8 April 1990, because of violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters following the unbanning of political organisations in February

name: Sazi Johan Ntuli
description: An SACP supporter who was shot and severely injured by ANC supporters at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 29 November 1990. Mr Ntuli sustained severe head injuries in the attack and now suffers from epilepsy and memory loss.

name: Sibongile Ntuli
description: She lost her home when it was burnt down by IFP supporters in Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in August 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sipho Ntuli
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 3 March 1993. His son had been killed, also in the course of political conflict, three months earlier.

name: Siziwe Cabangile Ntuli
description: He had his home in Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, petrol-bombed in June 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Steven Ntofo Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who died in hospital after being stabbed in the chest by IFP supporters in Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 7 December 1991.

name: Thandekile Ntuli
description: She had her house burnt down in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in 1993.

name: Tholakele Goodness Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed by named IFP supporters in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1990.

name: Thomas Isaac Ntuli
description: Was severely injured in Mhluzi, Middelburg, Tvl, on 7 July 1986 when he was sjambokked by Imbokodo vigilantes looking for his brother, an ANC supporter instrumental in mobilising residents against the incorporation of Moutse into KwaNdebele.

name: Velaphi Ntombiyokwenziwa Ntuli
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Isigisi, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 March 1992. At the time of the attack, Ms Ntuli was in hiding for fear of her life.

name: Xolani Ntuli
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 31 December 1992. His body was recovered near the Msunduzi River

name: Virginia Cabangani Nkosi
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters during political conflict at Dumbe, Paulpietersburg, Natal, on 18 November 1993. At the time of the shooting, Ms Nkosi was standing outside a tavern that was considered to be ANC stronghold.

name: Bheki Patric Nkonyeni
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by named IFP supporters at Tongaat, Natal, in October 1991. His body was found in a pool of water several weeks after his death.

name: Bukani Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters during intense political conflict at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembisile Eldah Nkambule
description: Was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU), during a period of conflict between the Black Cats and ANC members in Wesselton, Ermelo, Tvl, in March 1992. Five SDU members were granted amnesty for the incident (AC/98/0121).

name: Samuel Jomo Nkani
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Transvaal, on 12 May 1991 by IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers retaliating against an attack by ANC-supporting residents. Approximately one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence. See Swanieville attacks.

name: Simon Zolile Nkani
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and burnt in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Tvl, on 12 May 1991 by IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers retaliating against an attack by ANC supporting residents. Approximately one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence. See Swanieville attacks.

name: Sezwesihle Agrippa Nkanini
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Pietermaritzburg on 29 November 1991.

name: Nkosini Nkawule
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and tortured, allegedly by members of the ISU, in Katlehong, Tvl, in August 1991.

name: David Sekgokgo Nkgadima
description: An ANC supporter who was forced to leave his home and possessions at Lebowakgomo, Lebowa, when the local chief ordered his family out of the village on 7 July 1985 during conflict between the family and the chief because of Mr Nkgadima’s open support for the ANC.

name: Maphare Nkgadima
description: An ANC supporter who was forced to leave his home and possessions at Lebowakgomo, Lebowa, when the local chief ordered his family out of the village on 7 July 1985, during conflict between the family and the chief because of the open support Mr Nkgadima’s brother showed for the ANC.

name: Sarah Joseph Nkgweng
description: He had his home when it was burnt down on 2 February 1980 in GaMatlala, Lebowa, during the dispute over the Matlala chieftaincy. Chief BK Matlala, was backed by the Lebowa and South African governments, and Chieftainess Matlou Matlala, had the backing of the ANC-aligned People’s Congress.

name: Darlington Nkosinathi Nkohla
description: An ANC member was wrongfully convicted and sentenced to 12 years’ imprisonment for allegedly being part of a hand grenade attack on the Bophuthatswana consulate building during an ANC protest march in Kimberley, Cape, on 25 May 1993. The grenade bounced back into the crowd, and the explosion killed an ANC member and injured several others. Three ANC members were refused amnesty for the incident.

name: (First Name Not Given; Husband Of Berlina Nkomo) Nkomo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when police opened fire on marchers protesting against the banning of the ANC and the declaration of a state of emergency on 1 April 1960 in Durban.

name: Fikile Nkomo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in November 1990.

name: Gina Patricia Nkomo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt by IFP supporters in political conflict between the "Red" and "Green" Factions in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in March 1993.

name: Hloniphile Winniefrieda Nkomo
description: Was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in political conflict at Emashabeni, Ixopo, Natal, on 8 January 1993, allegedly because she was suspected of being an ANC supporter.

name: Jabu Beauty Nkonyeni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 12 July 1991.

name: Vukani Gilbert Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and thrown from a moving train in Katlehong, Tvl, on 27 July 1993, allegedly by IFP supporters. Between 1990 and 1993, 572 people died in train violence. The East Rand was a key site of train violence with the track from Katlehong to Kwesine station becoming the line with the highest risk in South Africa.

name: Zanele Ellen Ntsele-Dladla
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in KwaDlamu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 February 1994. Her husband was killed in the attack.

name: Bukisile Dubeleni Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomanesi Nkosiyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992. See Chimora Settlement attacks

name: Joseph Harold Nkuna
description: An ANC organiser who was detained without trial in November 1986 at Nelspruit, Tvl, and severely tortured while in police custody. He was also assaulted and severely injured by named perpetrators at Kabokweni, KaNgwane, on 3 October 1991.

name: Joseph Harold Nkuna
description: An ANC organiser who was detained without trial in November 1986 at Nelspruit, Tvl, and severely tortured while in police custody. He was also assaulted and severely injured by named perpetrators at Kabokweni, KaNgwane, on 3 October 1991.

name: Edith Nobafo Nkushubana
description: Had her house burnt down in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 3 December 1990 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Ms Nkushubana’s brother was an IFP supporter.

name: Muntuwempi Ntuli
description: Had his home burnt down in Dokodweni, KwaZulu, near Gingindlovu, Natal, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area in 1993. Mr Ntuli’s wife and sister-in-law managed to escape from the burning house, but his brother was pursued and killed. His decomposed body was found two weeks later.

name: Bahlawulile Nkwanyana
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Manzimnyama, Kwa-Mbonambi, near Richards Bay, Natal, in the conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bongekile Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in November 1993.

name: Dudu Gqoza Nkwanyana
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in November 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Duduzile Doris Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Elizabeth Nkwanyana
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Empangeni, Natal, in 1990.

name: Jabulisile Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who lost her houses in Empangeni, Natal, in an arson attack by IFP supporters in September 1992.

name: Magenge Richard Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house and tuck shop in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 March 1994.

name: Musawenkosi Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who was harassed by IFP supporters at Mtubatuba, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Musawenkosi Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who was harassed by IFP supporters at Mtubatuba, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nkosingiphilile Fano Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in 1992.

name: Nokwazi Josephina Nkwanyana
description: She had her house and possessions destroyed in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nokwazi Josephina Nkwanyana
description: She had her house and possessions destroyed in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombi Wusisi Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombi Wusisi Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Qholobana Bhekinkosi Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 27 February 1991.

name: Tandukwenzelwa Nkwanyana
description: Was shot and severely injured by ANC supporters in political conflict at Eshowe, Natal, on 23 December 1990. Mr Nkwanyana was allegedly attacked because he was taken for an IFP supporter.

name: Teresia Nkwanyana
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in September 1992.

name: Thulisile Lindeni Goodness Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 19 February 1992.

name: Zephania Nkwanyana
description: An ANC supporter who suffered damage to his property in an attack by IFP supporters at Ntuzuma, near Durban, in 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Jamba Nkwanyane
description: An IFP supporter who was severely beaten by ANC supporters at Empangeni, Natal, in 1993.

name: Bongani Ntsele
description: Was shot and severely injured in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 April 1993.

name: Wilson Ndindana Nkonyeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by named IFP supporters at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 13 September 1991.

name: Bongani Emmanuel Ntsele
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested at KwaMashu, Durban, on 5 May 1977 and kept in solitary confinement until he was sentenced to five years’ imprisonment on Robben Island. Mr Ntsele was arrested for allegedly training the youth to overthrow the government. He was forced to make a statement implicating himself.

name: George Yizanemvula Norman
description: Was stabbed to death on 11 August 1991 by IFP supporters returning from a march in Alexandra, Johannesburg, during ongoing conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Cashephi Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: (First Name Not Given) Nkosi
description: He suffered damage to his home in Khubeka Street, Tokoza, Transvaal, when it was burnt by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) during November or December 1993. Mr Nkosi had been forced to flee the area due to IFP attacks, and his home was occupied by IFP supporters, which led to the arson attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/2000/190).

name: Cunumuzi Saladine Ntanzi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Tvl, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Abram Nkosi
description: Was killed by IFP-supporting gang members in Zonkisizwe informal settlement, Katlehong, Transvaal, on 23 May 1993. Mr Mbatha disappeared with his son-in-law and their charred bodies were found in the boot of their car the next day. The incident occurred a day after an ANC march past IFP- supporting hostels in Tokoza, Tvl.

name: Henry Sidney Chris Nortje
description: A policeman who was shot and injured by ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members during April 1992 in Ficksburg, OFS. Three of the SDU members applied for amnesty for the incident that was granted (AC/1999/0229)

name: Ntombizodwa Elizabeth Norushe
description: An ANC supporter who was detained during protests in East London, in June 1980. While in detention, she was tortured.

name: Gcotshi Notyhagi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1993. See ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions.

name: Zilindile Nozakuzaku
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Kishini, Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 12 December 1993.

name: Carius Nqangisa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at Tokoza, Tvl, in March 1991, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Nkanikayipheli Nqgulunga
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Gomopho, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in May 1993.

name: Thembisile Nobuhle Nqidi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Moses Makhetha Nqoi
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted by members of the A-Team in Thabong, Welkom, OFS, on 1 April 1990. Mr Nqoi was returning home from an ANC meeting when he was attacked. As a result, he is mentally disturbed and suffers from epilepsy.

name: Dingiwe Nqoko
description: She lost her house in an arson attack by ANC supporters near Ngwemabalala, KwaXolo, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 24 March 1994, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dingiwe Nqoko
description: She lost her house in an arson attack by ANC supporters near Ngwemabalala, KwaXolo, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 24 March 1994, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mkhethelwa Nqoko
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 21 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mkhethelwa Nqoko
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 21 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Remigia Ntombizini Nqoko
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 2 February 1991.

name: Seshani Eunice Nqoko
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 April 1994, during political violence in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Seshani Eunice Nqoko
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 April 1994, during political violence in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dora Hlobozani Nqumako
description: Was shot dead in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 July 1992. The return of busloads of IFP supporters from a mass funeral in Durban had sparked intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mc Nsele
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in November 1991 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Two other ANC supporters were also shot dead in the attack.

name: Joseph Dumisani Nsibande
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 4 September 1993 at KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Doti Phillip Nsimbi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter in an attack on his home at Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 December 1993. His sister was injured in the attack, and two people were shot dead.

name: Lakobi Phyllis Nsimbi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter in an attack on his home at Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 December 1993. Her brother was injured in the attack, and two people were shot dead

name: Yobayo Nsundu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed with a spear, sjambokked, given petrol to drink and then forced to smoke by IFP supporters in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Tvl, during May 1991. He had warned his neighbour he was about to be attacked by the perpetrators.

name: Manani Matrina Nsuntsha
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 7 November 1992.

name: Bhekizwe Ewart Ntaka
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when IFP supporters attacked his home in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 November 1993, allegedly because the family was known to support the ANC. His brother and two sisters were shot and injured in the attack.

name: Dumisani Mthunzi Shadrack Ntaka
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in KwaMashu, Durban, on 29 March 1994. A peace meeting had been scheduled at a hostel in KwaMashu to resolve differences between KwaMashu residents and hostel-dwellers. Mr Mokoena was one of seven ANC delegates abducted from the hostel by IFP supporters. Two survived. Four IFP supporters, including the chairperson of the IFP hostel branch in KwaMashu, were convicted for the killings.

name: Dokazi Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Absalom Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by State-aligned vigilantes in Leslie, Transvaal, in January 1986. At the funeral of Chief Mayisa, an ANC member killed by a vigilante group, mourners attacked a member of the vigilantes. As a result, ANC supporters were then targeted in retaliation.

name: Ndodakeni Ntsele
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and hacked to death by IFP supporters at Mtunzini, Natal, on 22 December 1992.

name: Dumazile Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Emmerentia Ntanzi
description: Was shot dead by alleged ANC supporters on 22 December 1990 in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, during political conflict in the area.

name: Fakazile Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Gcinekile Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Amos Fani Nkosi
description: A SANCO member who was stabbed to death by a named perpetrator in Tsakane, Brakpan, Transvaal, on 18 October 1987. Mr Fani was organising a rent boycott at the time.

name: Zikoko Ntsele
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an attack by IFP supporters at Mtunzini, Natal, on 22 December 1992.

name: Gideon Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bantu Emelina Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from her home in Siyabuswa, KwaNdebele, on 25 June 1987 and taken to tribal offices where she was severely beaten by named perpetrators, during conflict over the incorporation of Siyabuswa into KwaNdebele

name: Gugu Khonzeni Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bheki Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in the left arm, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Tvl, on 14 June 1992.

name: Velile Ntsepo
description: An ANC operative who was kept in solitary confinement for eight months from August 1988 at John Vorster Square, Johannesburg. Mr Ntsepo was arrested with another ANC operative while trying to cross the border from Swaziland with hand grenades in their possession.

name: Hengani Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Johannes Fusi Ntshako
description: A Dikwankwetla National Party (DNP) supporter who was severely assaulted by ANC supporters in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, in February  1990. Mr Ntshako had attended a rally and was accosted by ‘comrades’ who accused him of being a collaborator.

name: Alfred Mzikayise Ntshanase
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Bhekinkosi Ntshangase
description: Was shot dead by a named assailant in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at KwaSokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 30 December 1992. Mr Ntshangase was driving a truck to work when he was stopped by armed men, and both he and his cousin were killed.

name: Juliet Tu Ntshangase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 8 March 1993, when the bus in which she was travelling was ambushed by armed men at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg. The bus was takign 80 ANC supporters to attend the court appearance in Pietermaritzburg of three men implicated in the ambush of a vehicle carrying IFP supporters on 5 March 1993. Three men and a woman were killed and at least 16 people were injured.

name: Juliet Tu Ntshangase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 8 March 1993, when the bus in which she was travelling was ambushed by armed men at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg. The bus was takign 80 ANC supporters to attend the court appearance in Pietermaritzburg of three men implicated in the ambush of a vehicle carrying IFP supporters on 5 March 1993. Three men and a woman were killed and at least 16 people were injured.

name: Lillian Khethiwe Ntshangase
description: She had her house in the Ntuzuma area, near Durban, burnt down in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 11 December 1991.

name: Makhosi Frida Ntshangase
description: An ANC supporter who was injured when the bus she was travelling in was ambushed by IFP supporters on the way to Pieter-maritzburg on 8 March 1993. Ms Ntshangase broke her leg when the bus overturned during the attack. Three men and a woman were killed and at least 16 were injured in the attack. See Table Mountain bus attacks.

name: Moxosheni Pheneas Ntshangase
description: An IFP supporter and a local induna who was killed by ANC supporters at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 25 February 1993.

name: Muntukathandwa Ntshangase
description: Was shot dead in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 August 1992.

name: Ndendesi Minah Ntshangase
description: An IFP supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by ANC supporters at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, in March 1993.

name: Richard Elfas Ntshangase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters during an attack on Chief Mhlabunzima’ s homestead in Pietermaritzburg on 1 December 1990.

name: Sibusiso Christopher Ntshangase
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Pietermaritzburg on 24 December 1991. Mr Ntshangase was caught by the perpetrators while trying to flee his home in Caluza.

name: Sindisiwe Cynthia Ntshangase
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 4 October 1992.

name: Thokogoni Ntshantsha
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and fatally wounded by members of the ISU during intense political conflict in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 15 May 1993.

name: Doris Mary Ntshapa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. Eight people were killed and more than one hundred and twenty homes were burnt down. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Masipalati Ntshekevana
