description: An ANC supporter who was executed in Pretoria, on 21 March 1962 after his arrest for attending iKongo meetings at Ngqindilili during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Duduzile Ntshingila
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, during political conflict at Ntombini, Mandini, Natal, on 5 February 1994, allegedly because his mother was an ANC member.

name: Mohambi Jeremiah Ntshingila
description: Was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at his home in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 24 March 1994. Mr Ntshingila was called to a community/SDU meeting for questioning about his suspected activities as an informer and IFP supporter. He was then driven to his home and killed. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the killing (AC/1999/0348). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Herbert Mzondeni Ntshiza Ntshiza
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death by IFP supporters at Eplenini, Ixopo, Natal, on 8 April 1993.

name: David Ntsibande
description: Was shot and injured by gunmen in a red minibus in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 3 May 1992 during a period of political conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Jabu Sibongile Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Jordan Sifiso Ntanzi
description: Was shot dead on 25 March 1994 at Eshowe, Natal, during ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Jordan Sifiso Ntanzi
description: Was shot dead on 25 March 1994 at Eshowe, Natal, during ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Carlton Nkosi
description: Was abducted in Katlehong, Tvl, allegedly by ANC supporters, on 12 September 1993, during ongoing political conflict on the East Rand. He not been seen since.

name: Khephansi Charlie Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Catherine Deliwe Nkosi
description: Died after being attacked and burnt by a group of youths at Daveyton, Transvaal, on 2 July 1987. The youths targeted another person who was not present at the time of the attack. Four persons died and four suffered injuries as a result of the attack. One perpetrator, who claimed to be an ANC supporter and chairperson of a ‘people’s court’ was refused amnesty for the attack (AC/2001/282).

name: Khonelani Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Cleopas Mandla Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Stanger, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 14 February 1992.

name: Mkhetheni Sakhephi Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mkholiseni Alpheus Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mlungisi Terence Ntanzi
description: He lost his house in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Mkhukhuze, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 1 February 1994.

name: Moses Ntanzi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot in the leg by ANC supporters at Matimatolo, near Greytown, Natal, in April 1991. His house was burnt down in the same attack.

name: Mphathiseni Thulani Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by two IFP members during political conflict at Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 25 September 1993. Two perpetrators (one being the brother of Mr. Ntanzi) were granted amnesty (AC/2000/087).

name: Mtete Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mxolisi Cornelious Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Nqobheni in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 23 December 1993. He disappeared from his home during intense political conflict in the area, and his body was found four days later, with multiple stab wounds.

name: Ndukwembi Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nkosinathi Emmanuel Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nokubheka Jabulile Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nokuthula Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomakosi Ntanzi
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Verulam, Natal, on 16 March 1994, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomakosi Ntanzi
description: She lost her house in an arson attack at Verulam, Natal, on 16 March 1994, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomzimba Thembani Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombethini Elizabeth Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombiyani Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Qondeni Esther Ntanzi
description: She had her house burnt down during intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Roy Themba Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at his home in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 September 1992.

name: Sebenzeni Thandazile Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sheki Pheneas Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Shongishile Gabazengani Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Siboniseni Lawrence Ntanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Zakhe Maziseni Ntanzi
description: He had his home in Eshowe, Natal, burnt down in April 1994, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zakhe Maziseni Ntanzi
description: He had his home in Eshowe, Natal, burnt down in April 1994, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Catherine Ntebaleng
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down at Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Catherine Ntebaleng
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down at Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Seabata Albert Ntema
description: An alleged leader of the Three Million gang who was killed on 11 February 1991 in Maokeng, Kroonstad, OFS. Two ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members applied for and were granted amnesty for this incident (AC/96/0006 and AC/96/0179).

name: Caleb Mojalefa Ntemane
description: A local ANC chairperson who was shot and injured when police fired on a crowd of protesting students at Ditlhake, Koffiefontein, OFS, in March 1990.

name: David Samdywida Lamani Ntengento
description: A SANCO member who was stabbed to death by named perpetrators on 1 February 1987 in Mooiplaas, near East London. He had spearheaded the removal of the headman system in the Ciskei area. His body was found under a tree with several stab wounds.

name: Mabhunga Wellington Ntengeshe
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Johannesburg, on 22 July 1993 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Mtsheku Ampherval Liter Ntetha
description: A member of the local council who had his house burnt down by named ANC supporters in Tshwaraganang, Dealesville, OFS, on 25 August 1990, during a period of conflict between councillors and activists. Councillors who refused to resign risked attacks on their homes, families and business premises.

name: Simphiwe Rosemary Ntetha
description: She had her house burnt down during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Eshowe, Natal, on 8 September 1993. Ms Ntetha was allegedly targeted because her son was an ANC member.

name: Obed Friday Nthlabathi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured, by named ANC suporters in Dube, Soweto, Johannesburg, during August 1992.

name: Moeketsi Isaac Nthotso
description: A SANCO member who suffered damage to his house when it was stoned and vandalised by members (one of whom is named) of the ANC-supporting Meqheleng Civic Association in Ficksburg, OFS, on 3 August 1993. There was tension and conflict between SANCO and the Maqheleng Civic Association at the time.

name: Siyabonga Nthsangase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by a named IFP supporter at Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 20 August 1993. He was killed while visiting a family of ANC supporters who were regularly harassed and attacked by IFP supporters.

name: Mohau Samuel Sam Nthunya
description: A Dikwankwetla National Party (DNP) supporter, lost his house in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, on 29 August 1989, allegedly because of his support for the DNP.

name: Rufus Mandlekosi Ntikinca
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Tokoza, Tvl, on 12 December 1990 during intense political conflict in the area.

name: Dickson Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from his home and shot dead on 5 September 1991 in Tokoza, Tvl, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Eric Nkosi
description: Was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in an attack on the leader of the Black Cats in Wesselton, Ermelo, Tvl, in July 1991. Five SDU members were granted amnesty for the incident (AC/98/0121).

name: Getrude Velaphi Thoko Nkosi
description: Lost her house in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Lebohang, Leandra, Transvaal, in September 1985. Ms Nkosi’s husband was a policeman at a time when police officers were seen as legitimate targets in the political struggle.

name: Howard Nkosi
description: Was stoned and shot to death opposite Dube men’s hostel, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 2 May 1991 by a named IFP supporter during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. The perpetrator was acquitted because he only admitted to the shooting and not to the stoning of Mr Nkosi. The magistrate ruled that stoning was the cause of death.

name: Lessiah Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in the chest on 14 June 1992 in Katlehong, Tvl, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Lindiwe Nkosi
description: A member of the IFP Women’s League and the wife of a leader of the Black Cats who was killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, in March 1992. Her husband was also killed and her sister injured in the attack. Five SDU members were granted amnesty for the attack (AC/98/0121).

name: Mbuyiseni Nkosi
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mfanafuthi Abel Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Katlehong, Tvl, on 23 July 1993 during ongoing political conflict on the East Rand.

name: Mpojo Friedie Nkosi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 11 February 1992.

name: Msesethi Witkop Nkosi
description: Had his hands and feet tied with wire and was then ‘necklaced’ in the street near Shongwe Mission, Komatipoort, Transvaal, during 1986. Young ANC supporters allegedly held a meeting and then ‘necklaced’ Mr Nkosi after accusing him of witchcraft.

name: Elizabeth Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 February 1993. Ms Nxumalo had fled the area shortly before the attack to escape the violence.

name: Petrus Nkosi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death on 28 July 1991 in Katlehong, Tvl, allegedly by IFP supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Richard Yapie Nkosi
description: Was stabbed to death near Merafe hostel in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 13 October 1991 during conflict between IFP-supporting aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: S’Bulelo Nkosi
description: Was severely burnt in an arson attack by ANC supporters during political conflict in Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 5 May 1993.

name: Samuel Nkosi
description: Was injured when a pipe bomb planted by members of the AWB exploded on 25 April 1994 at a taxi rank on the corner of Blood Street and Seventh Avenue in Pretoria. Three people were killed and four injured in the blast. During the pre-election period the AWB targeted taxi ranks, bus stops and railway stations, predominantly used by black people, the majority of whom they believed to be ANC supporters, in order to derail the April 1994 elections. Six perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342). See right-wing attacks

name: Samuel Nkosi
description: Was injured when a pipe bomb planted by members of the AWB exploded on 25 April 1994 at a taxi rank on the corner of Blood Street and Seventh Avenue in Pretoria. Three people were killed and four injured in the blast. During the pre-election period the AWB targeted taxi ranks, bus stops and railway stations, predominantly used by black people, the majority of whom they believed to be ANC supporters, in order to derail the April 1994 elections. Six perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342). See right-wing attacks

name: Sibusiso Tito Nkosi
description: Was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in an attack on the leader of the Black Cats in Wesselton, Ermelo, Tvl, in July 1991. Five SDU members were granted amnesty for the incident (AC/98/0121).

name: Jabulani Nxumalo
description: Was shot and injured on 8 September 1992 during an attack by IFP supporters on the home of their ANC-supporting aunt at Emakwanyaneni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal.

name: Muziwakhe Alfred Nyawo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 14 October 1993.

name: Jabulani Elias Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house and possessions in an arson attack in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections

name: Jabulani Elias Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house and possessions in an arson attack in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections

name: Mahwidi John Phala
description: Was detained, beaten and tortured in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 9 January 1977 because of his involvement in ANC underground structures.

name: Ronald Themba Phalane
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Tembisa, Transvaal, during a funeral for an IFP member in 1993. Tembisa was tense after clashes between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Thembinkosi Jibilili Phalane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Tembisa, Transvaal, during a funeral for an IFP supporter on 9 June 1993.

name: Maria Phale
description: Was stabbed with a sharp object by ‘Gadaffis’ in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal , on 17 February 1991. The ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress split into two factions, the ‘Zim-zims’ and the ‘Gaddaffis’. Ms Phale was attacked because her brother was suspected to be a ‘Zim-Zim’.

name: Florence Phangane
description: Was shot and injured by named IFP supporters at a night vigil in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 26 March 1991. Fifteen people died in the attack which took place during ongoing political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Hadiyo Adelice Phanyane
description: Was killed when the bus she was travelling in was attacked on 11 September 1991 in Mapetla, Soweto, Johannesburg. The perpetrators threw hand grenades into the bus and shot at passengers during violent conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Herman Motlalentoa Pharasi
description: An ANC cadre who died after being severely beaten at an ANC camp in Angola in 1981. Mr Pharasi was allegedly punished for smoking dagga in the camp, which constituted a 'breach of discipline'.

name: Eric Pharatsi
description: An ANC member who died in August 1981 while he was detained in an underground cell in an ANC camp in Angola. One senior camp officer was granted amnesty for his contribution to Mr Pharatsi’s death (AC/2000/149).

name: Morapedi Pharoe
description: Was shot and injured by security guards while playing soccer at the Somhlolo grounds in Katlehong, Tvl, on 17 March 1993. Two others were shot and injured in the same incident which occurred during heightened tension between IFP- supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents in the area.

name: Tseko Jacob Phathi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Sebokeng, Transvaal, in a drive-by shooting on 22 May 1992. Mr Phathi was killed with two others.

name: Makulana Phato
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted in 1960 in the Bizana police station, Transkei, after participating in meetings held to discuss the introduction of the Trust Land Act.

name: Lephoi Nape Phawe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ipelegeng, Schweizer-Reneke, Transvaal, during clashes between IFP and ANC supporters in 1993.

name: Edward Tshudi Phehlane
description: Was severely injured when he was assaulted and stabbed during an attack on his family by self-defence unit (SDU) members in Brandfort, OFS, on 14 July 1991. His mother was killed in the attack and his younger brother Patrick was injured. The family store was set alight. Mr Phehlane’s father, Morgan, previously an ANC supporter, and his family were accused of  being collaborators due to their participation in the local council. One SDU member applied for amnesty, which was granted for most aspects of the attack, but refused in respect of the stabbing of Patrick Phehlane (AC/1997/0043).

name: Morgan Sebata Phehlane
description: Was the target of an attempt on his life when self-defence unit (SDU) members attacked his home and family in Brandfort, Orange Free State (OFS), on 14 July 1991. His wife was killed, his two sons severely injured, and his home and store were burnt down in the attack. Mr Phehlane, previously an ANC supporter, and his family were accused of being collaborators due to their participation in the local council. One SDU member applied for amnesty, which was granted for most aspects of the attack, but refused in respect of the stabbing of his son, Patrick Phehlane (AC/1997/0043).  See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Patrick Phehlane
description: Was severely injured when he was repeatedly stabbed during an attack on his family by self-defence unit (SDU) members in Brandfort, OFS, on 14 July 1991. His mother was killed in the attack and his older brother Edward was injured. The family store was set alight. Mr Phehlane’s father, Morgan, previously an ANC supporter, and his family were accused of being collaborators due to their participation in the local council. One SDU member applied for amnesty, which was granted for most aspects of the attack, but refused in respect of the stabbing of Patrick (AC/1997/0043).

name: Vusumuzi Phesi
description: He had his home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 24 February 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. About thirty five houses were reportedly burnt down in Bhambayi that month.

name: Anele Moses Pheto
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten, by members of the ‘Zim-Zim’ faction of the Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, on 26 November 1990. The assault took place following a split in the KYC. At least 17 people were killed in Khutsong between 1989 and 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991.

name: Anele Moses Pheto
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten, by members of the ‘Zim-Zim’ faction of the Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, on 26 November 1990. The assault took place following a split in the KYC. At least 17 people were killed in Khutsong between 1989 and 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991.

name: Boitumelo Mantumi Phetoane
description: She lost her house when it was forcibly occupied by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 12 March 1992. Alexandra was tense after numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC-supporting residents.

name: Alfred Nhlanhla Phewa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by named ANC supporters at Ezimbokodweni, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 24 January 1993. His sister was also injured in the incident.

name: Lindelani Happy Phewa
description: She had her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 24 February 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. About 35 houses were reportedly burnt down in Bhambayi that month.

name: Mpumelelo Christopher Phewa
description: A member of the SACP who was shot and fatally wounded by two ANC members at the taxi rank at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 25 March 1994, during violent conflict between the ANC and SACP in the area. Two ANC members were granted amnesty (AC/2000/104).

name: Nomusa Bhabhekile Phewa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sibongile Phewa
description: She had her house destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in political conflict in the area in June 1990. Her husband had been stabbed to death a few days earlier.

name: Thembekile Phewa Phewa
description: Was shot and injured by named ANC members at Ezimbokodweni, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, during political violence on 24 January 1993. Her brother was also injured in the same incident, and her boyfriend stabbed to death.

name: Fikile Phillip
description: An ANC supporter who died after he was run over by a police vehicle near Lingani Store in Lusikisiki, Transkei, on 20 December 1989. Mr Phillip was on his way to an ANC march in the area when he was killed.

name: Clifford Phiri
description: Was killed by IFP supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, during an IFP march on 8 September 1991. Soweto was tense after clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Paulus Oupa Phiri
description: He disappeared in 1993 from Sebokeng, Tvl, and has not been seen since. Sebokeng was tense at the time due to ongoing clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Samson Phiri
description: Was shot dead on 25 June 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl, during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Wilson Mbuselo Phiri
description: An ANC supporter who died while in police custody in Khutsong, Tvl, on 17 February 1990. He had been arrested on suspicion of arson, and tortured with electric shocks. The official cause of death was stated to be an epileptic fit. It is alleged that police coerced his mother into signing a statement saying that he suffered from epilepsy.

name: Zimephi Gladys Nzama
description: An IFP supporter who had her house at Umkomaas, near Durban, burnt down in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 21 May 1991, three days after her boyfriend had been brutally killed. She was pregnant at the time.

name: Mahlathini Jackson Nxumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by fellow IFP supporters in KwaXolo, near Ramsgate, Natal, in March 1994, because he was suspected of having ANC sympathies.

name: Sicelo Pauli
description: An ANC member who was shot dead by masked gunmen who burst into the house and opened fire in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 19 March 1993. Three family members and friends were shot dead and two injured in the attack. One of the perpetrators was later convicted and jailed for the attack. He was refused amnesty.

name: Mangabo Ephraim Nxumalo
description: Was shot dead in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 December 1993. His sister was also shot dead and his home burnt down in the attack.

name: Mawewe Memezi Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a known IFP supporter at Utrecht, Natal, in March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mawewe Memezi Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a known IFP supporter at Utrecht, Natal, in March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mboneni Douglas Nxumalo
description: He had his house burnt down in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 December 1993. His sister and brother were shot dead in the attack.

name: Mbongeni Mathew Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Dumbe, Paulpietersburg, Natal, on 18 November 1993.

name: Mpampu Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house and possessions in an arson attack in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 March 1994, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. He and his family were forced to flee the area and were unable to return.

name: Mpampu Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house and possessions in an arson attack in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 March 1994, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. He and his family were forced to flee the area and were unable to return.

name: Musa Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared from his home in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, in March 1992, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. He has not been seen since, and is presumed dead.

name: Muziwombuso Nxumalo
description: An IFP supporter who lost all his household possessions when his home was petrol-bombed by ANC supporters at Amaoti, Inanda, near Durban, on 11 June 1991.

name: Nkosinathi Emmanuel Nxumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and hacked to death by ANC supporters in Woodyglen, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 December 1991.

name: Nomathemba Adelaide Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who had her livestock stolen and her house stripped of its roof and windows by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 June 1993.

name: Nombango Evelina Nxumalo
description: She had her home burnt down by an induna and his supporters during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Ophindweni, Eshowe, Natal, in 1990, when she told them she had no male children at home.

name: Nomusa Nxumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Mtunzini, Natal, on 12 August 1992.

name: Nondumiso Nxumalo
description: Was severely burnt in an arson attack by ANC supporters on his family home at Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, during political conflict on 5 May 1993.

name: Patrick Nxumalo
description: Was one of four people abducted from his home and severely assaulted with sjamboks and iron bars by a large crowd of ANC supporters at a sports stadium in Daveyton, Tvl, on 21 March 1992. Mr Nxumalo and another victim were then burnt to death. They were suspected of collaborating with the police. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/048).

name: Philisiwe Nxumalo
description: She lost her home in an arson attack at Eshowe, Natal, in March 1994, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Philisiwe Nxumalo
description: She lost her home in an arson attack at Eshowe, Natal, in March 1994, during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ronnie Sihle Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured when members of the Orde Boerevolk opened fire with automatic weapons on a passenger bus in Durban on 9 October 1990. Seven people were killed and 27 injured in the attack. Amnesty was granted to two of the three applicants and refused to the leader of the unit (AC/1997/0053). See PUTCO bus attack.

name: Simon Nxumalo
description: An IFP leader who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 19 May 1992 for allegedly encouraging peace talks with the ANC during intense political conflict.

name: Simon Kufakwezwe Nxumalo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Woodyglen, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 December 1990.

name: Songelwa Josephina Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Mvutshini, Port Sheptsone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 21 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Songelwa Josephina Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Mvutshini, Port Sheptsone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 21 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Tebiya Lucky Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 November 1991.

name: Thangithini Phillipine Nxumalo
description: Was shot dead in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 December 1993. Her brother was also shot dead and her home burnt down in the attack.

name: Vusumuzi Elton Nxumalo
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters during the Chimora settlement attacks on 16 January 1992.

name: Zakhele Nxumalo
description: An IFP supporter who had his house burnt down during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, during 1994.

name: Zanele Rejoice Nxumalo
description: She had her home near Kranskop, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 26 January 1986, allegedly because she was employed by an ANC supporter. Ms Nxumalo was forced to flee from the area.

name: Mtombi Nyakeni
description: An ANC supporter who was raped by IFP supporters in February 1993 in an attack on her family home in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal.

name: Ntombithula Nyakeni
description: An ANC supporter who was raped by an IFP supporter in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in February 1993. Other family members were also raped in the attack.

name: Sikha Philie Nyakeni
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured by IFP supporters in an attack on her home at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in February 1993. Her daughters were raped in the attack.

name: Themba Nzuza
description: He lost his house in an arson attack in November 1993 in intensified violence between ANC and IFP supporters in KwaKhoza and Nogobhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal. One person was killed and 21 houses burnt down that day.

name: Thembinkosi Nyakeni
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten with sticks and sjamboks by IFP supporters at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in February 1993. Her younger sisters were raped in the attack.

name: Frank Nyalunga
description: He died after he was attacked by known ANC supporters at a community meeting in Kabokwane, KaNgwane, on the 24 March 1991. Mr Nyalunga was invited to the meeting but was killed because of his support for a chief to whom ANC supporters were opposed. One of the perpetrators applied for amnesty.

name: Thandi Dorcus Nyandeni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters during political conflict between the ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 6 April 1993.

name: Khongozela Elliot Nyani
description: An ADM supporter who lost his house when it was burnt down by ANC supporters on 12 September 1992 at Tendergate, Queenstown. He was among those accused of killing ANC supporters in the area during conflict between the two organisations.

name: Doris Ntombi Nyathi
description: An IFP supporter who was hit with the butt of a gun by ANC supporters at KwaMavesha, Murchison, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 1 March 1991. The perpetrators were allegedly looking for her husband.

name: Sesinyana Lettie Nyathi
description: Was displaced from her home by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 17 February 1992. The area was tense due after clashes between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Themba Enock Nyathi
description: An ANC supporter and member of the Wembezi Crisis committee who was beaten, stabbed and shot dead at his home in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, by IFP supporters on 7 November 1990. Members of the committee were often attacked by IFP supporters, as they were seen as posing a threat to the party.

name: Bekuyise Wilfred Nyathikazi
description: A school principal who sustained damage to his house in Phola township, Ogies, Tvl, when armed ANC members attacked it with bombs and guns, on 13 October 1991. Mr Nyathikazi was regarded as an IFP sympathiser because IFP supporters often visited his home. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/091).

name: Erick Jojo Nyathikazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters at Entshawini, KwaZulu, near Stanger, Natal, on 10 August 1993. He was hospitalised for nine months as a result of his injuries

name: (First Name Not Given) Nyawane
description: An alleged IFP member who was shot dead by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) at Mzimhlophe, Soweto, Johannesburg, in 1993. IFP supporters, on their way home from a funeral, allegedly killed an elderly resident, and Mr Nyawane was shot dead in retaliation, during a fierce battle that erupted between ANC and IFP supporters. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0317).

name: Badingile Nyawo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban in February 1991.

name: Boni Maxwell Nyawo
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death and had his throat slit by a named ANC supporter at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 February 1993.

name: Constance Siphindile Nyawo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Kwesikwamthetwa, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 12 September 1993.

name: Dumezweni Nyawo
description: Was shot dead on the way to work by a named assailant in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in KwaSokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 30 December 1992. His cousin was also killed in the attack.

name: Falini Jeremiah Nyawo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP members in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 1 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Falini Jeremiah Nyawo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP members in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 1 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Hleziphi Jeslina Nyawo
description: She had her home burnt down by IFP supporters during political conflict at KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1992, allegedly because her daughter and son-in-law were ANC supporters. Her son-in-law was murdered in the same month.

name: Thembekile Nyawo
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed by named IFP supporters at KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 1 April 1994.

name: Thenjiwe Nzuza
description: She had her house burnt down and was forced to leave the Sabokwe area in Ntambanana, Empangeni, Natal, on 21 April 1994 because of political violence between the IFP and ANC in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thenjiwe Nzuza
description: She had her house burnt down and was forced to leave the Sabokwe area in Ntambanana, Empangeni, Natal, on 21 April 1994 because of political violence between the IFP and ANC in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nkosi Bekizizwe Prismon
description: An ANC supporter who was found dead on 3 August 1993 in Tokoza, Tvl, after he had been missing for two days. His death occurred during intense political conflict on the East Rand.

name: Cabangani Nzima
description: She had her house at Richmond, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters during political conflict in September 1992. One of her sons was shot dead and another injured in an attack following this incident. Both were IFP members.

name: Constance Themebekile Nzimakhe
description: She had her home burnt down in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in January 1991.

name: Angeline Nzimande
description: Was strangled to death at KwaMafunza, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1993, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. She was allegedly targeted because of her husband’s political affiliation.

name: Anton Sibongiseni Nzimande
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by a named fellow IFP supporter at Ixopo, Natal, on 2 August 1993. He had allegedly been accused of being an ANC supporter.

name: Bagcinile Victoria Nzimande
description: An ANC supporter who had her home at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. Eight people were killed and more than 120 homes were burnt down. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Beauty Thulile Nzimande
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, while on her way to Chris Hani’s funeral in April 1993. She has not been seen since.

name: Bhezu Annanias Nzimande
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 11 December 1993.

name: Catherine Thembani Nzimande
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters while attending a prayer meeting in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 July 1992.

name: Dudu Gladys Nzimande
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters during political conflict between the ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in June 1993.

name: Fikile Catherine Nzimande
description: Was severely injured when she was stabbed and hacked by members of an IFP patrol group at her house in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 March 1991. Other family members were also severely injured or killed by the perpetrators, who were looking for her brother, an ANC supporter. Ms Nzimande is now partially disabled. The perpetrators were sentenced to 15 years’ imprisonnment.

name: Fisani Nzimande
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in March 1991.

name: Gobile Nzimande
description: Was shot and injured in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters at Inkanyezi, Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992.

name: John Ndakhu Nzimande
description: He had his home burnt down by ANC supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 3 August 1993, during political conflict over the launch of an IFP branch in the settlement. On the day of the launch, nine people were killed, 11 injured and 18 houses burnt down.

name: Khehla Anton Nzimande
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 1 August 1992.

name: Lina Nzimande
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lindela Raphael Nzimande
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead along with his brother in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 23 May 1993.

name: Michael Zokwakhe Nzimande
description: Was stabbed to death by named ANC supporters during political conflict at Richmond, Natal, on 10 September 1992. He was living in an area known to be an IFP stronghold.

name: Mlekeleli Nzimande
description: An IFP member who was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Richmond, Natal, in September 1992. His brother was shot dead in the incident.

name: Moses Nzimande
description: Was shot dead during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 19 July 1992.

name: Ms (First Name Not Given) Nzimande
description: Was shot and injured at Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ndabenzima Nyangembi Nzimande
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by ANC supporters at Ixopo, Natal, in December 1993. He had gone to assess the damage to his house, which had been burnt. His body was found by police.

name: Nokuphiwe Nzimande
description: Was attacked with pangas and knives by named IFP supporters at her home in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 March 1991. The perpetrators were looking for her uncle, an ANC supporter. Other family members were also severely injured and killed. Political conflict led to the introduction of defence patrol groups by both parties, but ultimately these groups were themselves implicated in attacks. The perpetrators were sentenced to fifteen years' imprisonment.

name: Regina Siziwe Nzimande
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters during ongoing political conflict at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1990.

name: Sifiso Nzimande
description: He died after being stabbed, laid on a bag of cement and having his neck chopped with a bushknife at his home in Nyandezulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, by named IFP supporters on 8 March 1991. The perpetrators, who were looking for his uncle, an ANC supporter, also killed and injured other family members. The perpetrators were sentenced to 15 years’ imprisonment.

name: Tabolo Samuel Nzimande
description: An ANC supporter who had his home at Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by alleged IFP supporters on 2 February 1992.

name: Thamsanqa Ernest Nzimande
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by alleged IFP supporters on 6 September 1991 in Umlazi, Durban, for holding an ANC flag.

name: Thembinkosi Nzimande
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in an attack on his home in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991. The Nzimande family was suspected of sympathising with the ANC, because some family members refused to attend IFP meetings. See Richmond attacks.

name: Thikazile Ida Nzimande
description: Was shot and hacked to death with an axe at her home in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in intensifying conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 24 April 1994.

name: Xolani Nzimande
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters during an attack on his home in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991. The Nzimande family was suspected of sympathising with the ANC, because some family members refused to attend IFP meetings. See Richmond attacks.

name: Xosheyake Jerome Nzimande
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 21 March 1994. The perpetrators allegedly burnt down the house when they could not find Mr Nzimande’s son, an ANC leader.

name: Zonzani Christina Nzimande
description: She had her home at Esigcakeni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by alleged ANC supporters during political conflict in March 1991.

name: Zwe Nzimande
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead along with his brother at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 23 May 1993, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Vusumzi Abednego Nzuke
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by alleged IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, in March 1991 and again on 16 March 1993.

name: Vusumzi Abednego Nzuke
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by alleged IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, in March 1991 and again on 16 March 1993.

name: Barbra Julia Nzula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when a known councillor opened fire on a group of ANC supporters protesting against the local council in Rouxville, OFS, on 9 September 1990. One other person was shot dead in the incident.

name: Nkosinathi Emmanuel Nzumalo
description: An IFP supporter who died when he was shot and hacked by alleged ANC supporters at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 December 1991.

name: Nokhuthula Nzunza
description: Was stabbed to death by named ANC supporters during political conflict at Empangeni, Natal, on 13 March 1994, because she did not want to date an ANC member.

name: Bhekisiwe Nzuza
description: He had his house in Eshowe, Natal, burnt down during ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1994.

name: Bhoyi Nzuza
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured in an attack on his home by fellow ANC supporters in KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, in December 1992, in factional conflict arising from a split in the local ANC branch.

name: Buhle Nzuza
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Elinah Nzuza
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and her house in Ntuthuka, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, was set alight by alleged IFP supporters in April 1994.

name: Godfrey Mthokozeleni Nzuza
description: Was hacked to death in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 November 1991, because he was in a house known to be occupied by an ANC youths.

name: Khonzaphi Rejoice Nzuza
description: An IFP supporter who lost her home in an arson attack at Esigisini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, in 1993, allegedly after her husband had pointed out a house in which ANC supporters lived, leading to the burning down of that house. Mr Nzuza was later killed in an apparent revenge attack.

name: Lilian Ntombikayise Nzuza
description: She had her house at Empangeni, Natal, burnt down during clashes between local ANC and IFP members in October 1992.

name: Lucky Mfanu Nzuza
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC head-quarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Moses Nzuza
description: Was killed in Eshowe, Natal, on 26 February 1994, during intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Moses Nzuza
description: Was killed in Eshowe, Natal, on 26 February 1994, during intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mr (First Name Not Given) Nzuza
description: He had his house at Eshowe, Natal, burnt down in an arson attack on 14 November 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Muntukatshingwa Nzuza
description: He had his house petrol-bombed during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 January 1994.

name: Nothando Florah Nzuza
description: She had her rondavels in Eshowe, Natal, burnt down during intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1994.

name: Ntombikayise Patricia Nzuza
description: She fled her home in KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, when it was raided and vandalised by ANC supporters in factional conflict in December 1992 arising from a split in the local ANC branch. Her brother, an ANC supporter, was severely injured in the attack.

name: Ntombili Esther Nzuza
description: She had her home burnt down during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Eshowe, Natal, in 1994.

name: Patricia Babhekile Nzuza
description: She had her house burnt down during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 27 April 1992.

name: Petros Mzwakhe Nzuza
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by unidentified perpetrators at Nsingweni, KwaZulu, near Mtunzini, Natal, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 27 March 1992.

name: Schuman Raymond Nzuza
description: Was shot dead in an attack on his mother’s home in Empangeni, Natal, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 27 June 1993.

name: Sipho Nzuza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead after being abducted into Buyafuthi hostel in Tokoza, Tvl, allegedly by IFP supporters, on 9 July 1993.

name: Philis Ntombekhaya Pukwana
description: An ANC member who had her shack demolished by named ADM members during political conflict at Mlakalala, Zwelitsha, Ciskei, on 13 November 1993.

name: Fana Joshua Nyawose
description: He had his house completely destroyed by ANC supporters during ongoing political conflict at Madakane, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 March 1991.

name: Thulani Bhekingcino Nzuza
description: He had his houses burnt down at Bhukhanana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 17 January 1994.

name: Thokoane John Rabotapi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured in a drive-by shooting on 25 May 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl.

name: Velephi Nzuza
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in November 1993 in intensified violence between ANC and IFP supporters in KwaKhoza and Nogobhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal. One person was killed and 21 houses burnt down that day.

name: Vusi Nzuza
description: Was shot dead in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 August 1992.

name: Sibulelo Gladstone Piliso
description: Was shot dead at the home of a colleague in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 14 November 1990, by named perpetrators associated with the Lingelethu West Town Council, in a period of heightened conflict between the ANC and the council. Mr Piliso’s colleague was wounded in the shooting.

name: Zelpha Nzuza
description: An ANC supporter who was injured while fleeing from an arson attack by IFP supporters at her home in Stanger, Natal, during December 1992.

name: Robert Mbuyiseni Nyawose
description: An ANC supporter and employee of a private company who was killed by IFP supporters while distributing IEC pamphlets in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 April 1994. Seven colleagues were killed with him. One IFP member was convicted for the attack. See Ndwedwe election attack..

name: Sikameko Nyawose
description: An ANC leader who died after being shot and stabbed by IFP supporters at Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 23 March 1991.

name: Eric Thulani Nyawuza
description: A member of the IFP Youth Brigade who was shot dead at the home of a prominent IFP leader at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992, allegedly by ANC members. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Mantomi Nyembe
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters during political conflict at Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, in 1991. She was attacked because she was living in an ANC stronghold.

name: Vumani Nyembe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 28 March 1993.

name: Constance Nokwanela Nyembezi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters at KwaSithole, Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in 1991.

name: Balungile Nyide
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 4 July 1993. More than one hundred and ten people fled the area after a series of arson attacks in June and July 1993.

name: Balungile Nyide
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 4 July 1993. More than one hundred and ten people fled the area after a series of arson attacks in June and July 1993.

name: Ernestinah Nyide Nyide
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house and possessions in an arson attack during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in 1990.

name: Modo Nyingani
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested on 16 October 1986 in King William’s Town, Cape, because he resisted the Ciskei government’s attempts to forcibly remove him from his home at Mgwali Village. He was detained without charge at King William’s Town prison and Fort Glamorgan prison, East London, for a year.

name: Jabulani (Aka ‘Jabulani Dube’) Nyongwane
description: An alleged IFP member who was interrogated, shot and killed by a group of ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members during political conflict in Tokoza, Transvaal, during September 1993. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/1999/0186).

name: Mavis Hlekani Nyuswa
description: Had her house burnt down by IFP supporters during political conflict in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 July 1993. Ms Nyuswa’s house was torched when her brother, an ANC supporter, refused to attend an IFP self-defence training camp.

name: Jabulani Nzala
description: Was shot and fatally wounded by named IFP supporters at his home in Mgulea, an ANC stronghold near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 16 January 1994.

name: Badingile Nzama
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 February 1994. Conflict had broken out after the funeral of an IFP official that day, and many IFP supporters suspected of being pro-ANC lost their homes.

name: Bajabulile Gloria Nzama
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted in Durban on 1 February 1991 and repeatedly gang-raped by ANC supporters, some of whom are named. It is alleged that she was targeted because of her family’s political affiliation, and because they lived in an IFP stronghold.

name: Bengazi George Nzama
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Wosiyana, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 2 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Some weeks earlier, his house had been burnt down in political conflict following the funeral of a prominent IFP official.

name: Bengazi George Nzama
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Wosiyana, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 2 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Some weeks earlier, his house had been burnt down in political conflict following the funeral of a prominent IFP official.

name: Dumezulu Nzama
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 November 1991.

name: Elliot Nzama
description: Was shot dead by unidentified ANC supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 27 January 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Gezekile Prudence Nzama
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Girlie Malitha Nzama
description: had her house in Greytown, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 25 June 1991, allegedly because she lived in a predominantly ANC area.

name: Jabulile Ntombizembi Nzama
description: An IFP supporter who had her home at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by fellow IFP supporters on 12 February 1994. Conflict had broken out after the funeral of an IFP official that day, and many IFP supporters suspected of being pro-ANC lost their homes.

name: Khulani Nzama
description: Was shot in the arm during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 16 January 1991.

name: Madoda Derrick Nzama
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by named and other IFP supporters at Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 27 March 1991. He was released a day later, allegedly because the perpetrators knew his father, who was an IFP supporter.

name: Maphopho Bhekuyise Nzama
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by a named IFP supporter in Hosiyana, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in February 1994, allegedly because he refused to become an IFP member.

name: Maqhinga John Nzama
description: An IFP supporter who fled his home at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, when it was riddled with bullets in an attack by IFP supporters on 12 February 1994. Conflict had broken out after the funeral of an IFP official that day, and many IFP supporters suspected of being pro-ANC lost their homes.

name: Mfaniseni Nzama
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 March 1993.

name: Mhletshwa Nzama
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by other IFP supporters at Emahedi, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in February 1994. Conflict had broken out after the funeral of an IFP official that day, and many IFP supporters suspected of being pro-ANC lost their homes.

name: Micheal Zwelisha Nzama
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down during an IFP attack on the ANC stronghold of Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 November 1993.

name: Ngakephi Judith Nzama
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 27 January 1993.

name: Ngenzeni Florence Nzama
description: An IFP supporter who had her home destroyed and livestock stolen by IFP supporters at Hosiyana, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 February 1994. Conflict had broken out after the funeral of an IFP official that day, and many IFP supporters suspected of being pro-ANC lost their homes.

name: Nondo Petros Nzama
description: Was hacked with bush-knives and shot dead during an IFP attack on the ANC stronghold of Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 18 November 1993.

name: Ntombifuthi Nzama
description: She had her home burnt down by IFP supporters at Hosiyana, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 2 April 1994. Her husband was killed in the attack. Conflict had broken out after the funeral of an IFP official that day, and many IFP supporters suspected of being pro-ANC lost their homes.

name: Shongani Nzama
description: She lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Hosiyana, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 February 1994. Conflict had broken out after the funeral of an IFP official that day, and many IFP supporters suspected of being pro-ANC lost their homes.

name: Sibongile Rose Nzama
description: An IFP supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by fellow IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 February 1994. Conflict had broken out after the funeral of an IFP official that day, and many IFP supporters suspected of being pro-ANC lost their homes.

name: Sicelo Nzama
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 December 1991, allegedly because he refused to join the IFP. His badly mutilated body was discovered a few days later.

name: Sifiso Nzama
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters during political conflict in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1993.

name: Simon Nzama
description: He had his house burnt down at Engonyameni, near Umlazi, Durban, during June 1989, after he had refused to execute orders to attack the homes of ANC supporters.

name: Thuleleni Floreni Nzama
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by fellow IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 February 1994. Conflict had broken out after the funeral of an IFP official that day, and many IFP supporters suspected of being pro-ANC lost their homes.

name: Yona Pilisiwe Nzama
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters during political conflict at Emabhabathini, near Richmond Farm, KwaMashu, Durban, in January 1990.

name: Za Jacolin Nakeni Nzama
description: He lost his home and livestock in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 February 1994. Conflict had broken out after the funeral of an IFP official that day, and many IFP supporters suspected of being pro-ANC lost their homes.

name: Zwelabantu Philemon Nzuza
description: He lost his house in an arson attack on 4 November 1993 in intensified violence between ANC and IFP supporters in KwaKhoza and Nogobhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal. One person was killed and 21 houses burnt down that day.

name: Magdalena Elizabeth Olifant
description: She had her home damaged in an arson attack at Atlantis, Cape, on 29 November 1993. Shortly before the attack, the family had received letters threatening Ms Olifant’s former husband, an ANC and union activist.

name: Tshidiso Paulos Olifant
description: Was shot and severely injured in Evaton, Tvl, on 23 February 1993 by members of a local gang who were also part of an ANC-aligned self-defence unit.

name: Alfred Welile Oliphant
description: An ANC member who was shot dead while running from his burning home in Whittlesea, Ciskei, on 27 August 1992, during political conflict between ADM and ANC supporters. An ADM member was refused amnesty (AC/1999/0265).

name: Ivan Oliphant
description: An ANC supporter who got lost in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 1 August 1993 along with friends. The five found themselves in Khumalo Street where they were attacked by IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. Mr Oliphant and his friends were hacked and burnt to death. Khumalo Street had been declared a ‘no-go’ area following numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Lourens Cornelius Oosthuizen
description: A policeman who was shot and injured by ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members during April 1992 in Ficksburg, OFS. Three of the SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0229).

name: Patrick Edgar Vernon Oosthuizen
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and severely beaten by police in George, Cape, on 13 September 1976, during a period of unrest after the Soweto uprising had spread to the South Cape. He was charged with public violence and later acquitted.

name: John Osmers
description: An Anglican priest from New Zealand and an ANC supporter who was severely injured in an explosion in Maseru, Lesotho, on 5 July 1979, when he opened a parcel containing an explosive device. Five other persons were injured in the incident

name: Andrew Oss
description: Was stabbed and burnt to death by members of the ‘Gaddaffi’ faction of the ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal , in June 1990 while selling ANC T-shirts at the local taxi rank. Violence between two rival factions of the KYC, the ‘Zim-zims’ and the ‘Gaddaffis’, resulted in at least 17 deaths between 1989 and 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991.

name: Andrew Oss
description: Was stabbed and burnt to death by members of the ‘Gaddaffi’ faction of the ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal , in June 1990 while selling ANC T-shirts at the local taxi rank. Violence between two rival factions of the KYC, the ‘Zim-zims’ and the ‘Gaddaffis’, resulted in at least 17 deaths between 1989 and 1991 before a peace pact took effect in May 1991.

name: Phillip Kedibone Pailane
description: A local council employee who lost his house when it was burnt down by SANCO and ANC supporters in Duduza, Nigel, Tvl, in 1991. Members of the community opposed local councils and saw councillors and council employees as legitimate targets in the political struggle of the time.

name: David Sebolai Paleo
description: Was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 21 August 1993 during clashes between hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC-supporting residents. Mr Paleo’s body was found in one of the hostels and was reportedly mutilated.

name: Nkululeko Michael Panyane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, in Katlehong, Tvl, on 29 July 1990, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Nomthandazo Virginia Parkies
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home when the Crossroads settlement in Katlehong, Tvl, was attacked by IFP supporters on 12 September 1990.

name: Tieho Ben Parkies
description: He lost his home when it was burnt down by IFP supporters during an attack on the Chris Hani informal settlement, Daveyton, Tvl, on 25 July 1993 because the area was mainly ANC-supporting.

name: Velephi Patheni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in February 1992.

name: Anna Bakhethile Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, in April 1992.

name: Bheka Phoswa
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Buka Simon Pinzi
description: Was severely injured in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Tvl, on 12 May 1991. IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers were retaliating against a previous attack by ANC-supporting squatters and about one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people killed and twenty five vehicles burnt. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Bhekelakhe Obert Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, set alight and his cattle slaughtered by IFP supporters on 23 April 1992.

name: Mirriam Kalelani Pehlukwayo
description: She had her four huts burnt down by alleged ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 April 1994, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mirriam Kalelani Pehlukwayo
description: She had her four huts burnt down by alleged ANC supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 April 1994, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombekhaya Cinthia Pixie Pitana
description: An ANC supporter who was detained and beaten with a pick-handle on 1 February 1985 in Uitenhage, Cape. Ms Pitana had attended a prayer service for a victim who had been shot by police.

name: Johannes Pitso
description: Was shot dead on 25 June 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Bongani Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Richmond, Natal, burnt down and his livestock stolen by a named IFP supporter on 12 April 1992. His nephew, an ANC supporter, was shot dead on the same day. PHOSWA, Busisiwe, an ANC supporter, had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 12 March 1992.

name: Bongani Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Richmond, Natal, burnt down and his livestock stolen by a named IFP supporter on 12 April 1992. His nephew, an ANC supporter, was shot dead on the same day. PHOSWA, Busisiwe, an ANC supporter, had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 12 March 1992.

name: Gordon Aggrey Putini
description: Was injured when shots were fired at his home by IFP supporters on 24 November 1991 in Wattville, Benoni, Tvl. His home was attacked because his father was an ANC leader in the area.

name: Mengu Elizabeth Pitso
description: Was shot in the hand and leg and severely injured while taking down her washing at home in Bophelong, Vanderbijlpark, Transvaal, on 21 March 1992. Conflict between ANC and IFP supporters resulted in random attacks on homes and people. Ms Pitso’s husband was also injured when he tried to help her. Ms Pitso had her leg amputated as a result of her injuries.

name: (First Names Not Given) Plaaitjie
description: An alleged member of ‘Noksi’s gang’, who was stoned and shot to death in Tumahole, Parys, OFS, on 1 May 1992, by two self-defence unit (SDU) members and a third person. Two ANC SDU members and a third person were granted amnesty (AC/1997/0044).

name: Murugas ‘Mari’ Ponnen
description: Was detained in 1965 and continually harassed by members of the Special Branch in Chatsworth, Durban, with regard to her brother, Mr George Gangen Ponnen, an underground SACP/ANC activist and a leader of the trade union movement in South Africa. Ms Ponnen and her husband were interrogated as to the whereabouts of Gangen Ponnen and questioned about any communication they might have had with him.

name: Tholasi Ponnen
description: Was detained in 1965 and continually harassed by members of the Special Branch in Chatsworth, Durban, in regard to his brother-in-law, Mr George Gangen Ponnen, an underground SACP/ ANC activist and a leader of the trade union movement in South Africa. Mr Ponnen and his wife were interrogated as to the whereabouts of Gangen Ponnen and questioned about any communication they might have had with him.

name: Bizokwakhe Poswa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, in July 1993. His house was burnt down the same day.

name: Tshengisile Grace Poswa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 1 June 1992 in Richmond, Natal, when IFP supporters ambushed a taxi allegedly carrrying ANC supporters. One other person was killed and five shot and injured in the attack.

name: Valumoya Amos Poswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his property stolen and his homestead burnt down by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, in 1992.

name: Vincent Dali Poswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 15 May 1992.

name: (First Name Not Given) Pretorius
description: Was robbed of his vehicle by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Nigel, Transvaal, on 23 December 1991. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/231). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Gladys Pringane
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house, household possessions and a car, in an arson attack by migrant workers from the hostels in Nyanga, Cape Town, on 26 December 1976, during political conflict between Nyanga residents and hostel-dwellers over the Christmas 1976 period.

name: Winifred Segametsi Putini
description: Was injured when shots were fired at her house by a named IFP supporter on 24 November 1991 in Wattville, Benoni, Tvl, because her husband was an ANC leader.

name: Busisiwe Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 12 March 1992.

name: Yergan Putini
description: Was shot and injured by named IFP supporters in Wattville, Benoni, Transvaal, on 24 November 1991. He was the chairperson of the Benoni ANC. The IFP were allegedly targeting ANC leaders in Wattville at the time.

name: David Ziphathele Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter at a taxi rank in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 12 April 1992. His uncle, an ANC supporter, had his home burnt down by IFP supporters that same day.

name: Dinoni Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, set alight by IFP supporters on 23 April 1992.

name: Jabulani Shadrack Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 12 April 1992.

name: Mandlonke Sobantu Qabaka
description: An ANC supporter who was detained and tortured in July 1985 in East London. See Duncan Village.

name: Khilela Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Richmond, Natal, burnt down by named IFP supporters in March 1992.

name: Innocentia Radebe
description: Was shot by IFP supporters on 22 March 1990 in Kagiso, Transvaal, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Makhosazana Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Mamgokwana Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, set alight by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Mhlawulelwa Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Moses Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Mpisi Moses Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, set alight by IFP supporters on 12 February 1992.

name: Mzwenkosi Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Niniza Rose Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Nohlungane Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in late 1991

name: Pickup John Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who was killed when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217).

name: Qhofoza Mzwenkani Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Richmond, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 12 April 1992.

name: Simon Mantuntu Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death by IFP supporters at KwaDabeka, near Pinetown, Natal, on 21 July 1992.

name: Thembekile Busisiwe Phoswa
description: She had her home in Richmond, Natal, burnt down by a named IFP member on 12 April 1992 in political conflict in the area. Her nephew, an ANC supporter, was shot dead on the same day.

name: Thengi Sylvia Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and rondavels in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Tholakele Mkhize Phoswa
description: An alleged IFP supporter who had her home burnt down during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Tholeni Florence Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Thulebona Phoswa
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was injured during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Tutu Johan Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Zakithi Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Zibonele Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home at Richmond, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 24 May 1992.

name: Zondile Phoswa
description: An ANC supporter who had her home at Richmond, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 15 May 1992.

name: Bongani Raphael Phungula
description: Was shot dead in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 6 December 1990 during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents of Phola Park.

name: Cromwell Sizwe Phungula
description: Was continually harassed by ANC supporters in Umlazi, Durban, in the early 1990s, allegedly because he and his family were thought to be IFP supporters.

name: Flora Phungula
description: She had her home in Ncakubane, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters on 12 April 1992 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area

name: Gasta Phungula
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1992.

name: Mbongeni Phungula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 1 December 1991.

name: Paulos Frans Phungula
description: An ANC supporter who died of injuries sustained when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217). See Richmond attacks.

name: Pius Phungula
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted and killed by other ANC supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 23 February 1992, in a serious internal feud within the organisation.

name: Thami Emmanuel Phungula
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, in December 1991.

name: William Phungula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 2 February 1991, while on his way home from the funeral of another victim of political violence.

name: Zakhe Rose Phungula
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Gezubuso, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, burnt down in the seven-day war in March 1990.

name: Zamokhule Sibongiseni Phungula
