description: An ANC supporter and member of a self-defence unit (SDU) who was shot dead by fellow SDU members at Esigcakeni, Richmond, Natal, on 9 October 1993, shortly after he and a friend had been fetched from their homes on the instructions of the local ANC leader, Mr Sifiso Nkabinde. On the previous day, Mr Phungula had lent his friend a firearm given to him by Mr Nkabinde for SDU purposes, and the friend had used the gun to kill an unidentified person. His friend was also shot dead.

name: Jabulani Elvis Radebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Edendale, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 4 January 1992, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zandile Qangwe
description: Was raped during a robbery by IFP-aligned ‘Toaster’ gang members in April 1993 in Tembisa, Transvaal, during conflict in the area between IFPs supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Jabulani Primon Radebe
description: An ANC supporter who  was burnt to death in Denver hostel, Johannesburg, on 1 April 1994, allegedly by IFP supporters in retaliation for the Shell House massacre.

name: Thuli Abram Pete
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Klipspruit, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 12 April 1992. Soweto was tense at the time after numerous clashes between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC-supporting residents.

name: James Radebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when police fired on a student protest march in Viljoenskroon, Orange Free State (OFS), on 19 April 1990. Five people were killed and many others injured in the shooting.

name: Zolisile Harret Peteni
description: An ANC member who lost his house and all its contents in an attack by named ADM supporters on 13 November 1993 in Zwelitsha, Ciskei.

name: Sicelo Qayi
description: An ANC member who was shot dead by a Special Constable in Nyanga, Cape Town, on 16 June 1990.

name: Mandibense Qhesi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by members of the AWB in Bethlehem, OFS, on 6 April 1994, in the run-up to the country’s first democratic elections. A friend who was with him at the time was shot dead. See April 1994 elections and right wing attacks.

name: Mandibense Qhesi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by members of the AWB in Bethlehem, OFS, on 6 April 1994, in the run-up to the country’s first democratic elections. A friend who was with him at the time was shot dead. See April 1994 elections and right wing attacks.

name: Headman Qhezu
description: Was shot and injured on 5 May 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl, when shots were fired at a funeral procession during ongoing clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Phillip Layunina Qhinebe
description: An IFP supporter who was assaulted and stabbed by ANC supporters who attacked his house in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 5 August 1993. He was left for dead when his house was set alight, but managed to crawl to safety.

name: Ndodakayise Qhovana
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Baqondile Qiniselani
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Durban destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 13 April 1991.

name: Selina Qongwana
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Ndakana, near King William’s Town, Cape, in May 1990 while she was a meeting to plan protest against the reimposition of the headman system in Ciskei. She was taken to Stutterheim, Cape, where she was tortured in detention.

name: Nomazizi Elsie Qotywa
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Amaoti, Inanda, near Durban, set alight by IFP supporters in February 1991. Twenty houses are reported to have been burnt down by IFP-supporting vigilantes returning from a rally.

name: Nontokozo Ellen Qulo
description: She had her house in Iniwe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down on 30 April 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Glen Lungile Qulu
description: Was burnt to death leaving Jabulani hostel, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 18 August 1990 because he was seen as an IFP supporter during conflict between mainly IFP-supporting hostel- dwellers and ANC-supporting residents. When the IFP launched itself as a political party, hostel-dwellers were allegedly coerced into IFP membership resulting in the conflict between residents and hostel-dwellers based on ethnicity, residential area and political affiliation.

name: Msetyenzelwa Qwaba
description: He had his home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in March 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. At least 18 people were killed in political violence in Bhambayi that month, and 75 homes were burnt down.

name: Bhekokwakhe Mluka Qwabe
description: He had his house in Vukuyibambe, KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in 1990 in the course of intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Leonard Dumisane Qwabe
description: He had his home burnt down in Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in March 1994 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Leonard Dumisane Qwabe
description: He had his home burnt down in Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in March 1994 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mzonjani Michael Qwabe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Mshayazafe, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1992.

name: Nimrod Qwabe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nimrod Qwabe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 17 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zondeni Qwabe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 30 June 1993. Her father’s adjacent shop was looted and burnt down in the same incident.

name: Rose Bongiwe Qwalela
description: She had her home burnt down on 16 February 1993 in a dawn attack on the ANC stronghold of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. Ten people were killed and 35 houses were burnt down.

name: Andrew Isaac Petrus
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named members of the Three Million gang in Kroonstad, Orange Free State (OFS), on 28 May 1992.

name: Mamaloko Lina Peu
description: She had her home burnt down on 2 February 1980 in GaMatlala, Lebowa, during the dispute over the Matlala chieftaincy between Chief BK Matlala, backed by the Lebowa and South African governments, and Chieftainess Matlou Matlala, backed by the ANC-aligned People’s Congress.

name: Bhekani Phakathi
description: Was shot and injured at Ladysmith, Natal, on 9 October 1993, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bukisisa Magadasi Phakathi
description: An IFP supporter who was assaulted by a named ANC supporter at a funeral in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 October 1992.

name: Gabangani Phakathi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Richmond, Natal, on 28 January 1991, allegedly because he was believed to have been involved in an earlier attack on IFP supporters in the area.

name: Gabisile Doris Phakathi
description: Died after being shot, stabbed and set alight by a named ANC supporter at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 May 1990, during political conflict in the region.

name: Majaji Phakathi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by an IFP member in Hillbrow, Johannesburg, on 23 January 1992. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0285).

name: Norah Hluleleni Phakathi
description: An IFP supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters at Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 28 February 1993.

name: Rebecca Phakathi
description: Was shot and injured in an attack on her home at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 11 April 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thule Phakathi
description: Was shot dead in an attack on her home at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 11 April 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Manana Janet Radebe
description: She had her home at Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by unidentified perpetrators during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in August 1991. Her husband and son had been killed two months earlier, allegedly because they were ANC supporters

name: Manelo Radebe
description: Was shot dead in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 19 November 1993 by members of the ‘Joshua Squad’, a police unit deployed in the area because of conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. The ‘Joshua Squad’ operated on a shoot-to-kill policy because it could not secure convictions against self-defence units. Three people died and one person was wounded in the incident.

name: Mzwandile Radebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 25 August 1993 in Nancefield, Soweto, Johannesburg, during political conflict on the Rand.

name: Nhlanhla Radebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ntuzuma, near Durban, in March 1994 in political violence between hostel-dwellers and township residents.

name: Nomthandazo Maureen Nozibi Radebe
description: She had her house burnt down on 24 July 1992 when IFP supporters carried out attacks on residents in the ANC stronghold of Ondondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal.

name: Philemon Fiki Radebe
description: Was shot and stabbed by IFP supporters at his home in Mapetla, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 27 July 1991 during tension after clashes beween IFP-supporting hostel- dwellers and mainly ANC-supporting residents.

name: Sophy Radebe
description: Was shot by IFP supporters on 22 August 1990 in Kagiso, Tvl, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Stefaan Radebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Katlehong, Tvl, while passing a house in Zuma section where a night vigil for an IFP supporter was taking place on 12 June 1993.

name: Steven Radebe
description: An alleged IFP member who was kidnapped, interrogated, shot and killed by a group of ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members during political conflict in Tokoza, Tvl, in December 1993. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/1999/0186).

name: Sydwell Phehello Radebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters from Mshayasafe hostel, Tokoza on 24 October 1992 in Katlehong, Tvl.

name: Thulani Simon Radebe
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by a named perpetrator on 7 February 1993 in Ratanda, Heidelberg, Transvaal, during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel- dwellers and ANC-supporting residents. Ratanda was tense after conflict between COSATU-aligned FAWU and IFP-aligned UWUSA members in a local factory spilled over into the surrounding community.

name: Victor Thulani Radebe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in train violence in Germiston, Transvaal, on 13 November 1991. Five armed IFP supporters boarded the train and opened fire on the commuters.

name: Zwelinjani Herold Radebe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot, stoned and burnt to death by ANC supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 11 April 1991.

name: Vele Radzilani
description: Was  stoned by named ANC supporters in July 1987 when her house in Mauluma, Makhado, Tvl, was attacked and burnt down because her husband had been accused of witchcraft.

name: Chengiah Rogers Ragaven
description: An ANC supporter who was repeatedly detained under the Suppression of Communism Act, harassed, and placed under restriction orders in Durban between 1960 and 1967.

name: James Butiki Ramokwatedi
description: A member of the ‘Gadaffi’ faction of the ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) who was severely beaten by members of the ‘Zim-Zim’ faction of the KYC, in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, in June 1990. The KYC split when older ‘comrades’ dubbed ‘Zim-zims’ protested against the ‘Gadaffi’ faction’s lack of discipline and involvement in criminal activities.

name: Setlabocha Paulus Ramollo
description: Was killed when a hand grenade thrown by ANC supporters exploded in Sharpeville, Vereeniging, Tvl, on 31 October 1993. Sharpeville was embroiled in conflict between ANC and IFP supporters as well as within the ANC-aligned self-defence unit.

name: Nokhebevu Samson Shange
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area in 1992.

name: (First Name Not Given) Shandu
description: Went missing when the family home at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 13 January 1994 in the conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. He has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: (First Name Not Given) Shandu
description: Went missing when the family home at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 13 January 1994 in the conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. He has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Jacob Gaonakala Seatlholo
description: A veteran ANC member who was arrested in April 1976 in Johannesburg and detained for 90 days at John Vorster Square. While in detention he was repeatedly beaten and subjected to electric shock tort u re. He was later charged under the Terrorism Act and sentenced to 12 rs’ imprisonment on Robben Island.

name: John Moeketsi Sebae
description: Was shot and killed on 15 May 1992 at a playground in Zone 12 Sebokeng, Transvaal, during clashes between ANC- supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Stephen Sebaka
description: Was shot and injured by gunmen in a red minibus on 3 May 1992 in Alexandra, Johannesburg, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents. See drive-by shootings.

name: Moshobotlale Lucas Sebei
description: An ANC supporter who lost his homestead in an arson attack by supporters of a local chief in Sekhukhuneland, Lebowa, in February 1986 during a dispute between Chiefs Nchabeleng and Masha.

name: Sareta Sarah Sedibe
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted and thrown out of her home, in Alexandra, Johannesburg, by IFP supporters on 1 March 1991. Alexandra was tense after numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC-supporting residents.

name: Peter Rantsaila
description: A prison warder who was killed when a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) detonated a hand grenade while trying to escape from Leeuwhof prison, Vereeniging, Tvl, on 18 December 1993. Three people died and nine were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/2000/145).

name: Manare Ramasela Seema
description: He had his home burnt down on 2 Febru a ry 1980 in GaMatlala, Lebowa, during conflict over the Matlala chieftaincy between Chief BK Matlala, backed by the Lebowa and South African governments, and Chieftainess Matlou Matlala, with the backing of the ANC-aligned People’s Congress.

name: Vincent Sefako
description: Was hit by a car and killed in Soweto, Johannesburg, in November 1987, allegedly on the orders of a prominent ANC leader.

name: Kgakgamatso David Segano
description: Was sjambokked, kicked and hit with a rifle butt by members of the Bophuthatswana Defence Force on 8 January 1994 at Mogarong village in Taung, Bophuthatswana, when security forces allegedly disrupted an ANC mass meeting.

name: Elisa Dikeledi Segola
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten by a group of fellow ANC supporters in Tikwana, Hoopstad, OFS, on 3 September 1992, allegedly for defying a stayaway.

name: Ezekiel Mamae Segole
description: Was stabbed to death by IFP supporters on 12 September 1990 in Vosloorus, Tvl. His one son was killed that day and another son was burnt to death the following day during ongoing clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC- supporting residents.

name: Kelo Ignatious Segole
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 12 September 1990 in Vosloorus, Tvl. His father was also killed that day and his brother was burnt to death the following day during ongoing clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC- supporting residents.

name: Bethuel Shandu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters on 20 July 1990, at the Ngqoleni bus stop in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban. Seven members of the Shandu family died in three separate incidents of political violence during 1990.

name: George Segotlong
description: Was shot in the abdomen and died two days later on 2 June 1992 in Dobsonville, Soweto, Johannesburg, allegedly by IFP supporters during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. His wife was also injured in the attack.

name: Busangani Shandu
description: Was killed by an ANC/FAWU member at his workplace at Langeberg Foods in Boksburg, Tvl, on 12 June 1992, during a period of conflict between IFP and ANC-supporting workers at the factory. One ANC member was granted amnesty for the killing (AC/1998/0080).

name: Caroline Richards
description: She had her home destroyed in an arson attack in KwaMondi, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 30 November 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Three family members were killed in the attack.

name: Molatlhegi Samuel Roberts
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by AWB members on 9 March 1994 in Mafikeng, Bophuthatswana. He was returning from an ANC rally at a local stadium when the attack took place.

name: Nyanisile Rolihlahla
description: Was shot by members of the security forces in Whittlesea, Ciskei, in July 1991, while participating in a march organised by ANC-affiliated organisations.

name: Guybon Jomo Rooi
description: An ANC member who was shot and axed with a panga by men wearing balaclavas in Site B, Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 19 July 1991. After his discharge from hospital he lost all his belongings when his residence in Site C was burnt down during an arson and shooting attack that left a friend dead. See balaclava groups.

name: Pieter Ruiters
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when AWB members detonated a car bomb in Bree Street, Johannesburg, on 24 April 1994, in an effort to disrupt the electoral process. Seven people were killed and 13 injured in the blast. Two perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0342). See right-wing attacks.

name: Mpumelelo Vincent Rwarwa
description: An ANC supporter and youth activist who was severely beaten on 8 April 1986 and shot dead by named members of the Riot Unit on 26 October 1986 in KTC, Cape Town.

name: Mpumelelo Vincent Rwarwa
description: An ANC supporter and youth activist who was severely beaten on 8 April 1986 and shot dead by named members of the Riot Unit on 26 October 1986 in KTC, Cape Town.

name: Debra Baphi Sabela
description: She had her home burnt down in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 March 1994 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her brother was severely burnt while trying to save items from the burning house.

name: Debra Baphi Sabela
description: She had her home burnt down in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 27 March 1994 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her brother was severely burnt while trying to save items from the burning house.

name: Lucky Muzikayise Sabela
description: Was severely burnt on 27 March 1994 while trying to save items from a burning house in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Lucky Muzikayise Sabela
description: Was severely burnt on 27 March 1994 while trying to save items from a burning house in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Skhumbuzo Sabela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by IFP supporters who attacked his mother’s home at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1993. Mr Sabela lost his sight in one eye as a result of the attack.

name: Thoko Regina Sabela
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1993. Her son was shot and severely injured in the attack.

name: Thokozile Duduzile Sabela
description: She had her home and possessions destroyed by unidentified persons in KwaShozi, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in May 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Florence Sabelo
description: She had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by unidentified persons on 16 February 1992 in violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. One person was killed and seven homes burnt down in Bhambayi in February 1992.

name: Florence Sabelo
description: She had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by unidentified persons on 16 February 1992 in violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. One person was killed and seven homes burnt down in Bhambayi in February 1992.

name: Jabulani Sabelo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during 1992. He died of his injuries at Ngwelezana Hospital on 9 May 1993.

name: Jabulani Sabelo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters at Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 May 1993.

name: Thuleleni Irene Sabelo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Winnington Sabelo
description: A member of the IFP Central Committee and the Umlazi Dispute Resolution Committee who was shot dead in his shop by ANC supporters on 7 February 1992 in Umlazi, Durban.

name: Regina Segotlong
description: Was shot in the head on 2 June 1992 in Dobsonville, Soweto, Johannesburg, allegedly by IFP supporters, during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. The bullet is still lodged in her head and she is blind as a result of her injuries. Her husband was killed in the attack.

name: Gabriel Phemelo Setlhoke
description: Was repeatedly tortured in October 1985 and January 1986 in Zambia, and at Nova Stella Sao prison and Quatro camp in Angola, by named ANC security members who falsely accused him of being an enemy agent. He was from Meadowlands, Soweto, Johannesburg. See ANC camps.

name: Gabriel Phemelo Setlhoke
description: Was repeatedly tortured in October 1985 and January 1986 in Zambia, and at Nova Stella Sao prison and Quatro camp in Angola, by named ANC security members who falsely accused him of being an enemy agent. He was from Meadowlands, Soweto, Johannesburg. See ANC camps.

name: Phumzile Elizabeth Shange
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Phumzile Elizabeth Shange
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Celani Shandu
description: An IFP supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 April 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters three days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Celani Shandu
description: An IFP supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 April 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters three days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Modise Daniel Setshedi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured when armed men opened fire on a taxi he was travelling in on 15 November 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl. The shooting occurred during a period of taxi violence when conflict between ANC and IFP supporters became linked to competition in the taxi industry.

name: Fikile Shandu
description: Was shot and injured on 28 November 1993 by alleged IFP supporters at Mandini, Natal, during an attack on the home of the ANC-supporting family he was staying with. The house was also burnt down.

name: Hlaselaphi Agnes Shandu
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Ngonweni, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 16 November 1992.

name: Jabulani Emmanuel Shandu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in June 1992, allegedly because of his political activities among the youth.

name: Mpuse Ralebese
description: A member of the Eagles Club who was severely beaten when ANC supporters attacked him and five other ‘Eagles Club’ members in Qhoweng, Reddersburg, OFS, in 1989, allegedly because of their involvement with the club.

name: John Tladi Segwenyane
description: Was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in August 1990 in Mzimhlophe, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between ANC- supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Jabulisiwe Emely Shandu
description: She had her house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 13 January 1994 in the conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her husband disappeared in the same attack, and has not been seen since.

name: Jabulisiwe Emely Shandu
description: She had her house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 13 January 1994 in the conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her husband disappeared in the same attack, and has not been seen since.

name: Anthony Samuel Ralebitso
description: A Lesotho government minister who survived a bomb attack on his home in Borogoaneng, Lesotho, in 1980. Well known as an ANC sympathiser, Mr Ralebitso is believed to have been attacked either by the South African security forces or by LLA members acting at their behest. His daughter was killed by South African Special Forces in a cross-border raid on Maseru in December 1982.

name: Sarah-Jane Shange
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, burnt down by a named IFP supporter on 1 January 1991, allegedly because her sons were ANC supporters. The local chief had reportedly launched a campaign to remove ANC supporters from the area.

name: Johannes Shandu
description: An ANC supporter who had his home at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Mampota Ralebitso
description: The wife of a Lesotho government minister, and ANC sympathiser, who survived a bomb attack on her home in Borogoaneng, Lesotho, in 1980. It is believed that the attack was carried out either by the South African security forces or by LLA members acting at their behest. Ms Ralebitso’s daughter was killed by South African Special Forces in a cross-border raid on Maseru in December 1982.

name: Johannes Shandu
description: He had his home vandalised by IFP supporters in Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, during 1993, allegedly because he was living in an ANC stronghold

name: Goodstuff Moyata Ramothata
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 3 May 1992 in Alexandra, Johannesburg, during ongoing clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Simangele Shange
description: Was severely burnt when her house was set alight by ANC supporters in Mahlabatini, near Ulundi, KwaZulu/Natal, on 5 January 1992 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Siyabonga Seme
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, in Molokohlo, near Verulam, Natal, on 6 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. A week later, his mother’s house was destroyed in an arson attack.

name: Siyabonga Seme
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters, in Molokohlo, near Verulam, Natal, on 6 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. A week later, his mother’s house was destroyed in an arson attack.

name: Thandazile Agnes Seme
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home, in Molokohlo, near Verulam, Natal, in an arson attack in March 1994 in violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her son had been shot dead by IFP supporters a week earlier.

name: Thandazile Agnes Seme
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home, in Molokohlo, near Verulam, Natal, in an arson attack in March 1994 in violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Her son had been shot dead by IFP supporters a week earlier.

name: Oupa Freddy Senabe
description: Was stabbed and shot to death on 25 April 1992 when his home in Orlando West, Soweto, was attacked by IFP-supporters during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. His wife was also killed in the attack and his sister-in-law was seriously injured. od. He was released after being held for a year and acquitted of all charges.

name: Gadio Elias Senokoane
description: Was shot dead in Sebokeng, Tvl, on 15 June 1992 during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Mpho Tsietsi Jacob Senokoane
description: Was shot dead in Evaton, Tvl, on 15 June 1992 when IFP supporters, some of whom are named, opened fire on a taxi he was travelling in between Sasolburg and Evaton. Evaton was tense after clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Lydia Senyane
description: Was stabbed to death by IFP supporters on 11 September 1990 in Katlehong, Tvl, following numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents in the area.

name: Rosina Mokgadi Seolwane
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Kagiso, Tvl, in August 1990 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting Kagiso residents.

name: Thomas Cecil Daniel Sepeng
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 17 November 1991 in Vosloorus, Tvl, during violent conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Malose Samuel Sephesy
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, kicked and burnt with cigarettes during detention in police stations in Naboomspruit and Warmbaths, Tvl, in 1992. Mr Sephesy was also denied food for three days. He was arrested because he had been trying to reconnect electricity and water supplies with other community members.

name: Motuki Richard Sepotokele
description: A government supporter who lost his businesses and house in an attack by ANC supporters in 1986 in Ikageng, Potchefstoom, Tvl, during a consumer boycott aimed at his business.

name: Simon Bushy Seruwe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and died few days later on 27 November 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl, during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Dolly Marry Sesinyi
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in August 1991 in Kagiso, Tvl, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC-supporting residents.

name: Mpho Rosalina Setene
description: Was seriously injured by ANC supporters who attacked her home in Ficksburg, OFS, in August 1993, during local conflictbetween the ANC and SANCO. Ms Setene’s son was a member of SANCO.

name: Lewis Ndolo Sethebe
description: An ANC supporter who was detained in 1964 in Johannesburg, and has not been seen since.

name: Asaph Setlale
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters on 12 September 1/990 in Vosloorus, Tvl

name: Sizani Mama Shange
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, burnt down by a named IFP supporter on 1 January 1991, when the chief in his area reportedly launched a campaign to expel all ANC members from the area.

name: Linda Wilfred Shandu
description: Was shot and fatally burnt when ANC supporters attacked a home in Umnini, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 July 1990. Ms Nomusa Shandu, an IFP supporter, had moved her children and grandchildren to safety when she heard of a possible attack. The attackers then fetched the family from their hiding place and took them back to their home, which they set alight. Five of the Shandu family members died of burns. Thirteen ANC supporters were charged and 11 convicted for the attack.

name: Mafiki Zandele Shandu
description: Was shot and fatally burnt when ANC supporters attacked a home in Umnini, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 July 1990. Ms Nomusa Shandu, an IFP supporter, had moved her children and grandchildren to safety when she heard of a possible attack. The attackers then fetched the family from their hiding place and took them back to their home, which they set alight. Five of the Shandu family members died of burns. Thirteen ANC supporters were charged and 11 convicted for the attack.

name: Thulani Ntu Shange
description: Was shot dead in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 8 June 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zanele Florina Shabalala (Duma)
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Mahaqwa, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 22 November 1991.

name: Alosia Shabalala
description: She had her house at Ofafa, Chibini, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by named IFP supporters on 4 May 1990 because her son, who was also shot in this incident, was a member of the ANC.

name: Kapano Pin-Pin Ramahesa
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was shot and killed by a group of ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members during political conflict in Tokoza, Transvaal, in July 1993. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0186).

name: Matswene Jacob Ramoto
description: He had his home burnt down on 2 February 1980 in GaMatlala, Lebowa, during the dispute over the Matlala chieftaincy between Chief BK Matlala, backed by the Lebowa and South African governments, and Chieftainess Matlou Matlala, backed by the ANC-aligned People’s Congress.

name: Vusumuzi Emmanuel Shange
description: Was stabbed and stoned to death by named ANC supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 17 July 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Mbhekeleni Shandu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 20 March 1994 in the conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mbhekeleni Shandu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 20 March 1994 in the conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zanele Shange
description: She had her home and furniture burnt in an arson attack at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area in 1993.

name: David Bhenguse Shabalala
description: An employee of Rand Water who was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) while he was travelling in a taxi past the informal settlement of Phola Park in Tokoza, Tvl, on 26 February 1992. Four people died and eight were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack on the taxi (/AC/1999/0225)

name: Nokwazi Josephine Shandu
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in 1993.

name: Moraka Johannes Rangongo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 15 March during taxi violence linked to intense political conflict.

name: Mahomola Solomon Rantie
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and hacked to death outside his home by named members of the Three Million gang in Seeisoville, Kroonstad, OFS, on 11 October 1990.

name: Tsietsi Rantie
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by members of the Three Million gang in Troubou, Kroonstad, OFS, on 27 October 1990. Gang members abducted him and another ANC supporter from a tavern, took them to Troubou and killed them both there.

name: Msutukazi Nancy Ranunga
description: She had her shack burnt and her possessions stolen by IFP supporters in Swanieville, Krugersdorp, Tvl, on 12 May 1991. IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers were retaliating against a previous attack by ANC-supporting squatters and approximately one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people killed and twenty five vehicles burnt. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Mabitleng William ‘Los’ Rapetsoa
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted in 1988 at Ga-Dikgale, near Pietersburg, Transvaal. Mr Rapetsoa died the next year. He was allegedly singled out by named soldiers because he was suspected of involvement in a Johannesburg bomb blast.

name: Lucas Thupetsi Raseala
description: She had her home burnt down on 2 Febru a ry 1980 in GaMatlala, Lebowa, during the dispute over the Matlala chieftaincy between Chief BK Matlala, backed by the Lebowa and South African g o v e rnments, and Chieftainess Matlou Matlala, backed by the ANC-aligned People’s Congress.

name: Michael Raselete
description: Was shot and injured by gunmen in a red minibus on 3 May 1992 in Alexandra, Johannesburg, Tvl, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents. See drive-by shootings.

name: William Thabeng Rasentsoere
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by members of the Three Million gang at a tavern in Maokeng, Kroonstad, OFS, on 1 June 1990. At the inquest, two perpetrators were reportedly found responsible for the murder, but no charges were laid.

name: Solomon Mandlenkosi Rasmeni
description: An ANC executive member who had his home bombed in Jouberton, Klerksdorp, Tvl, on 15 February 1991.

name: Nkosini Jonathan Rasona
description: A former ANC community representative who was stabbed to death by an IFP supporter in Stanger, Natal, on 27 July 1993.

name: Remaketse Jim Ratefane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Rweleleyathunya, Rouxville, OFS, on 9 September 1990 by named members of the INKATHA GANG.

name: David Vimba Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who died after being shot by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 26 August 1993.

name: Nozipho Shandu
description: Was shot and fatally burnt when ANC supporters attacked a home in Umnini, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 July 1990. Ms Nomusa Shandu, an IFP supporter, had moved her children and grandchildren to safety when she heard of a possible attack. The attackers then fetched the family from their hiding place and took them back to their home, which they set alight. Five of the Shandu family members died of burns. Thirteen ANC supporters were charged and 11 convicted for the attack.

name: Mzoxolo Leonard Salmani
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by ADM members during political conflict in Zwelitsha, Ciskei, on 2 April 1993.

name: Benjamin Salukazana
description: An ANC supporter who died after being severely assaulted, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, in June 1993. Residents had reportedly been informed by the local IFP leader that all Xhosa-speaking residents would be attacked because they were ANC supporters.

name: Nomathemba Salukazana
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten to death, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, in June 1993. Residents had reportedly been informed by the local IFP leader that all Xhosa-speaking people would be attacked because they were ANC supporters.

name: (First Name Not Given) Sambo
description: Was robbed of his vehicle by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Heidelberg, Tvl, on 10 February 1992. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/231).

name: Franscisa Sambo
description: Was killed when she and her sister were abducted from home, raped and shot by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Tvl, in 1993. Her sister was wounded in the attack. One month earlier, their home was attacked and burnt. The SDU members believed the two sisters were IFP supporters. Three SDU members were granted amnesty for the arson attack. Four SDU members, who had not participated in the rape, were granted amnesty for the killing and attempted killing (AC/2000/139).

name: Sibongile (Aka ‘Doris’) Sambo
description: Was severely injured when she and her sister were abducted from home, raped and shot by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Transvaal , in 1993. Her sister was killed in the attack. One month earlier, their home was attacked and burnt. The SDU members believed the two sisters were IFP supporters. Three SDU members were granted amnesty for the arson attack. Four SDU members, who had not participated in the rape, were granted amnesty for the killing and attempted killing (AC/2000/139).

name: Billy Samuels
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during ongoing conflict between the ANC and the IFP in April 1993. He was also shot and wounded on 20 April 1993.

name: Billy Samuels
description: An IFP supporter who had his home burnt down at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during ongoing conflict between the ANC and the IFP in April 1993. He was also shot and wounded on 20 April 1993.

name: Makhosandile David Sango
description: He had his house and possessions burnt in an arson attack at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1993.

name: Mxolisi Sangotsha
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by ADM members during political conflict at Bhele, near King William’s Town, Cape, on 2 April 1993.

name: Doctor Mbengeni Sangweni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at his home in KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 March 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Eveline Sangweni
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack on 20 March 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Her son was killed in the attack.

name: Mhlengeni Sangweni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 March 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Philemon Sangweni
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC head-quarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Sibongiseni Sangweni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at his home in KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 March 1992, during ongoing poltiical conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bongani Santos
description: A member of a self-defence unit (SDU) who was shot and injured by a member of the ‘Joshua Squad’ police unit on 27 August 1993 in Tokoza, Transvaal , during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. The ‘Joshua Squad’ operated on a shoot- to-kill policy because it could not secure convictions against SDUs. Mr. Santos was shot along with two other SDU members.

name: Muntu Elizabeth Sarage
description: She had her house burnt down by named IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 March 1991 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Abel Latang Satege
description: Was shot in the back by IFP supporters on 3 May 1991 in Pimville, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict in the area following numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Hleziphi Dorah Schakaza
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Pietermaritzburg on 8 September 1990, in intense political conflict in the area.

name: Elijah Shabalala
description: Was shot and injured at his church at Bhekezulu, Estcourt, Natal, on 2 April 1994, when IFP supporters opened fire on the congregation, allegedly because they suspected that members were considering joining the ANC. Six people, including Mr Shabalala’s daughter, were shot and killed in the attack.

name: Mosioa Nephtally Ramakaba
description: An ANC supporter who was killed by ‘comrades’ in Sharpeville, Vereeniging, Transvaal, on 7 March 1994 following in-fighting in the ANC aligned self-defence unit.

name: Emmanuel Abraham Sibusiso Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who died after being shot during continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Mpuma-langa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 2 August 1993.

name: Primrose Ntombifuthi Shandu
description: Was shot and fatally burnt when ANC supporters attacked a home in Umnini, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 July 1990. Ms Nomusa Shandu, an IFP supporter, had moved her children and grandchildren to safety when she heard of a possible attack. The attackers then fetched the family from their hiding place and took them back to their home, which they set alight. Five of the Shandu family members died of burns. Thirteen ANC supporters were charged and 11 convicted for the attack.

name: Matsoso Paulus Ramakau
description: A SANCO member and community leader who was arrested on 3 October 1984 in Vereeniging, Transvaal, and tortured in detention at Krugersdorp. He was accused of promoting a stayaway.

name: Boyce Raman
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP-supporting passengers who hijacked his taxi between Estcourt and Mooi River, Natal, on 27 September 1991. The perpetrators accused Mr Raman of transporting ‘comrades’.

name: Shadrack Matsile Ramasimong
description: A leading member of the Three Million gang who was stabbed to death by a named member of the ANC at a police station in Kroonstad, Orange Free State (OFS), on 3 August 1992. He was reportedly under arrest at the time, and a prison warden allegedly supplied the knife to the perpetrator.

name: Jim Ramasobane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 31 July 1993 in Thafeni, Tembisa, Transvaal, during a raid on residents by alleged Toaster gang vigilantes and IFP supporters. Conflict increased when the body of the Toaster gang leader was exhumed and allegedly burnt by residents. Despite a peace pact signed between the IFP and ANC, IFP supporters allegedly attacked Tembisa and killed a total of thirty and injured twenty one people that day. See Toaster gang.

name: Sizeka Wendy Ramathe
description: Sustained serious burn wounds in a petrol bomb attack by ANC supporters in Port Elizabeth on 29 July 1986

name: David Basie Ramathibela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 15 June 1993, allegedly by a named IFP supporter.

name: Jenifer Ramatlo
description: Was forcibly removed from her home by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 13 March 1992 after numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC-supporting residents.

name: Benjamin Sekoboto Ramatlotlo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Tladi, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 8 September 1990 at an ANC meeting which was attacked by residents from a nearby hostel.

name: Martins David Ramegoe
description: Was stabbed and assaulted by IFP supporters in Tokoza, Tvl, in June 1989. He was attacked because he was suspected of being an ANC supporter. Several others were similarly attacked in the area.

name: Aaron Ramogola
description: Was shot and injured by named IFP supporters at a night vigil in Alexandra, Johannes-burg, on 26 March 1991. Fifteen people died in this incident. Alexandra was tense due to clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Betty Ramogola
description: Was shot and injured by named IFP supporters at a night vigil in Alexandra, Johannes-burg, on 26 March 1991. Fifteen people died in this incident. Alexandra was tense due to conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Timothy Ramogola
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, at a night vigil on 26 March 1991 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. The perpetrators were arrested and charged but later released following police irregularities in the investigation.

name: Paul Ramogolo
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, at a night vigil on 26 March 1991 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. The perpetrators were arrested and charged but released following police irregularities in the investigation.

name: Beauty Ramokgadi
description: Was shot dead in a drive-by shooting in Vosloorus, Tvl, on 17 November 1991 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Jane Foggs Ramokgola
description: She died after being shot by named perpetrators who attacked a night vigil in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 2 March 1991. Five people died in the attack, and 14 others were injured. Alexandra was tense due to clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Solomon Ramokgola
description: Was shot dead by IFP supportersin Alexandra, Johannesburg, at a night vigil on 26 March 1991. Alexandra was tense following numerous clashes between IFP-supporting aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Lejone John Ramokgothoane
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by members of the Three Million gang in Kroonstad, Orange Free State (OFS), on 9 November 1990, allegedly because he was an ANC member

name: Jacob Mzimkhulu Ramokonopi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and wounded in his home in Katlehong, Tvl, on 4 October 1992, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Ndunana Ramokoponi
description: Was shot and permanently crippled by IFP supporters in Katlehong, Tvl, on 4 October 1992 during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Ethel Busisiwe Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was continually harassed by members of the Special Branch in Ladysmith, Natal, in 1960, allegedly because of her husband’s involvement with the ANC.

name: Sibongile Gladness Shandu
description: She had her home set alight in an arson attack at Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 8 October 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Goodness Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely wounded on 5 August 1993, when IFP supporters attacked her home in Ohlange, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban. Her husband was killed in the attack.

name: Jabulani Innocentia Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death when IFP supporters attacked ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 16 July 1991. Four other ANC supporters were killed in the attack.

name: Sizakele Shandu
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Jabulile Victoria Shabalala
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in her father’s church in Bhekezulu, Estcourt, Natal, on 2 April 1994, when IFP supporters opened fire on the congregation, allegedly because they suspected that members were considering joining the ANC. Five other people were shot and killed in the attack.

name: Thokozani Shazi
description: Was shot and injured by an IFP member during political conflict at Izingolweni, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 16 March 1991. An amnesty applicant testified that he killed Mr Shazi because he believed him to be an ANC supporter. He was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0339).

name: Thembeni Agnes Shandu
description: She had her home destroyed in an arson attack in Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 June 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Jackson Nkosinathi Shabalala
description: An ANC member who was shot dead by IFP suporters at Bulwer, Natal, on 30 January 1993.

name: Lwazi Skhumbuzo Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten by ISU members who were conducting searches for weapons in houses in the Steadville area, near Ladysmith, Natal, in 1993.

name: Michael Phaseka Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Hammarsdale, Natal, on 13 October 1991.

name: Ntombifikile Happy Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burgled and vandalised by IFP supporters in Bulwer, Natal, in March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombifikile Happy Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burgled and vandalised by IFP supporters in Bulwer, Natal, in March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sebastian Jabulani Shabalala
description: Was shot dead on 12 September 1993 when his uncle’s home at Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, was attacked by IFP supporters, allegedly because the family was perceived to be sympathetic to the ANC. His uncle was burnt to death in the attack.

name: Sibongile Cynthia Shabalala
description: An IFP supporter who was severely burnt when ANC supporters attacked and burnt her home in Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 5 May 1993. Three other family members, including two children, were severely burnt in the fire.

name: Sibongiseni France Makhehla Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who died after being assaulted by IFP supporters at Xosheyahle, Bulwer, Natal, on 22 February 1992.

name: Smanga Simon Shabalala
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The perpetrators called Mr Shabalala out of his grandmother’s home and shot him dead, then burnt down the house.

name: Smanga Simon Shabalala
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. The perpetrators called Mr Shabalala out of his grandmother’s home and shot him dead, then burnt down the house.

name: Sonto Emily Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Madadeni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 25 May 1991, allegedly because she refused to pay the money demanded by one of the councillors, an IFP supporter.

name: Thesi Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was killed on 5 August 1993 when IFP supporters attacked his home in Ohlange, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban. His wife, also an ANC supporter and allegedly the target of the attack, was stabbed and severely injured in the incident.

name: Thobile Venetia Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thokozani Shabalala
description: Was shot and injured on 2 April 1994 in a church at Bhekezulu, Estcourt, Natal, when IFP supporters opened fire on the congregation, allegedly because they suspected that members were considering joining the ANC. Six people were shot and killed in the attack.

name: Vusi Shabalala
description: An ANC civic leader who was killed by members of the IFP-related ‘Khumalo Gang’ at Tokoza, Transvaal, on 27 October 1992. One perpetrator was refused amnesty (AC/2000/198).

name: Wendelene Mvosho Shabalala
description: Was burnt to death on 12 September 1993 when his home at Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, was set alight by IFP supporters, allegedly because the family was perceived to be sympathetic to the ANC. His nephew was shot and killed in the attack.

name: Xolani Eddie Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and fatally wounded by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 9 July 1993.

name: Yvonne Shabalala
description: An IFP supporter who was severely burnt when ANC supporters attacked and burnt her home in Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 5 May 1993. Three other family members, including two children, were severely burnt in the fire.

name: Zanele Florina Shabalala
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in Umkomaas, near Durban, in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 22 November 1991.

name: Gano Shabane
description: She had her home at Port Shepstone, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters on 9 July 1992 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Nkosikhona Ruben Shabane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 17 December 1993. The Shabane family was the target of systematic harassment from July to December of 1993, allegedly because of their support for the ANC.

name: Nonkanyiso Clemencia Shabane
description: died in political conflict in Durban on 8 February 1994 after being shot by ANC supporters who were allegedly looking for her boyfriend.

name: Oswald Mthethunzima Shabane
description: Was assaulted and then shot dead by a crowd of ANC-supporting residents in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 7 April 1991. He and his wife, who was necklaced to death in the same incident, were suspected of being IFP suporters. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/217).

name: Te Amon Shabane
description: An IFP supporter who died after being shot and stabbed by ANC supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 May 1992.

name: Beauty Mbambo Shabangu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by named and other ANC supporters in Mtunzini, Natal, in February 1992.

name: Ben Luke Shabangu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured and had his home burnt down IFP supporters in Bilanyoni, Paulpietersburg, Natal, on 20 April 1993.

name: Doctor Paulos Shabangu
description: An employee of Rand Water who was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) while he was travelling in a taxi past the informal settlement of Phola Park in Tokoza, Tvl, on 26 February 1992. Four people died and eight were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack on the taxi (AC/1999/0225).

name: Eunice Shabangu
description: Was killed by a group of youths who attacked and burnt her at Daveyton, Transvaal, on 2 July 1987. The youths targeted another person who was not present at the time of the attack. Four persons died and four suffered injuries as a result of the attack. One perpetrator, who claimed to be an ANC supporter and chairperson of a ‘people’s court’, was refused amnesty for the attack (AC/2001/282).

name: Lilimane Simon Shabangu
description: An IFP supporter who had his home petrol-bombed by ANC supporters in Mtunzini, Natal, in February 1992.

name: Mkhulu Exodus Shabangu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by members of the ISU on 19 April 1994 in Tokoza, Tvl, during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Percy Shabangu
description: An IFP-aligned Khumalo gang member who was shot dead by ANC supporters on 13 December 1992 at a shebeen frequented by ANC supporters in Tokoza, Tvl, because of his alleged involvement in the murder and rape of three teenagers the previous day. The Khumalo gang was responsible for killing two ANC supporters and injuring several others in a revenge attack on the tavern later that day.

name: Peter Shabangu
description: Was shot and killed by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Tvl, on 6 October 1993. One SDU member was granted amnesty for this killing (AC/1999/0186).

name: Vincent Muziwenhlanhla Shabangu
description: Was shot dead in Mandini, Natal, on 23 October 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Vusumuzi Emmanuel Shabangu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by named and other ANC members in Mtunzini, Natal, on 4 March 1992.

name: Gofrey Shale
description: Was shot dead on 12 September 1990 in Vosloorus, Tvl, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC-supporting residents.

name: Moeketsi Fahian Shale
description: Was shot dead when police opened fire on a NEHAWU meeting in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, on 15 October 1992. At the time, nationwide NEHAWU strikes formed part of the ANC mass action campaign.

name: Shokwakhe Shamase
description: An ANC supporter who was injured and had his home destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in June 1993.

name: Tholile Shandu
description: Was shot and fatally burnt when ANC supporters attacked a home in Umnini, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 July 1990. Ms Nomusa Shandu, an IFP supporter, had moved her children and grandchildren to safety when she heard of a possible attack. The attackers then fetched the family from their hiding place and took them to their home, which they set alight. Five of the Shandu family members died of burns. Thirteen ANC supporters were charged and 11 convicted for the attack.

name: Wilson Shazi
description: Was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in KwaZuba, Umkomaas, near Durban, on 24 February 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Thulani Joseph Shandu
description: Was shot and stabbed to death on 24 February 1994 in Nkekwane Reserve, Mtunzini, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thulani Joseph Shandu
description: Was shot and stabbed to death on 24 February 1994 in Nkekwane Reserve, Mtunzini, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bonginkosi Berry Shebi
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and stabbed by named IFP supporters in Hibberdene, Natal, on 11 December 1992.

name: Aubrey Mandlakoyise Shangase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 6 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Aubrey Mandlakoyise Shangase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 6 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bhekokwakhe Shangase
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Bongani Shelembe
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death when named IFP supporters attacked a group of ANC supporters in Umkomazi, Richmond, Natal, on 2 May 1992. Three other ANC supporters were killed in the attack.

name: Doris Dumazile Shelembe
description: She had her house in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down in March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Doris Dumazile Shelembe
description: She had her house in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down in March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Busisiwe Gadeni Shangase
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Khanyisile Jeslina Shelembe
description: She had her house in Mandini, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in 1993. She was allegedly targeted because her sons were ANC supporters.

name: Nelisiwe Irene Shelembe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in March 1991. The family had fled this IFP stronghold because they were ANC supporters, but had returned to attend the funeral of a family member. The house was attacked during the funeral vigil, and two family members were killed. Three days later the house was burnt down.

name: Roselina Shelembe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down in 1991 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thalithi Shelembe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 21 March 1991. The family had fled this IFP stronghold because they were ANC supporters, but had returned to attend the funeral of a family member. The house was attacked during the funeral vigil. Ms Shelembe’s son was also killed, and the house was burnt down three days later.

name: Vusumuzi Ezekia Shelembe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 21 March 1991. The family had fled this IFP stronghold because they were ANC supporters, but had re t u rned to attend the funeral of a family member. The house was attacked during the funeral vigil. Mr Shelembe’s mother was also killed, and the house was burnt down three days later.

name: Sikhumbuzo Elphas Shembe
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when he was beaten and shot by IFP supporters in Estcourt, Natal, on 14 September 1992. He died later in hospital. Political conflict had caused him to flee the area, but he was spotted visiting his uncle, and was attacked.

name: Nomfundiso Priscilla Sheyi
description: She had her house burnt down in fighting between ANC and IFP supporters, the latter allegedly supported by members of the ISU, in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in June 1993.

name: (First Name Not Given) Shezi
description: He had his house burnt down at Nkandla, KwaZulu, near Melmoth, Natal, during conflict in the area between the IPF and ANC.

name: Anton Mahawu Shezi
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was shot dead during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Babazane Shezi
description: Was shot an injured by an IFP member during political conflict at Izingolweni, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 16 March 1991. An amnesty applicant testified that he killed Mr Shezi because he believed him to be an ANC supporter. He was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0339).

name: Bheki Bonokwakhe Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Ethembeni, near Stanger, Natal, on 10 August 1993.

name: Bongani Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted, stabbed to death and mutilated by IFP supporters in political conflict at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, following an IFP rally on 10 February 1991.

name: Bongiwe Shezi
description: An IFP supporter who lost her property in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 25 August 1991.

name: Goodness Bongekile Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Khusu Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, burnt down by a named IFP supporter in 1991.

name: Lolo Cornelius Shezi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and burnt to death when the house in which he was sleeping was petrol-bombed by ANC supporters on 9 September 1992 in Ixopo, Natal.

name: Maria Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Richmond, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack in 1991 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Maria Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured on 4 July 1992 when IFP supporters attacked a minibus leaving her home in Bhomela, Port Shepstone, Natal. Ms Shezi was standing in the yard when she was shot. Seven ANC members were killed in the incident. Five IFP members were convicted for the attack.

name: Maria Shezi
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by other IFP supporters at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during 1991. She had been accused of being an ANC supporter because her son was an ANC supporter.

name: Mfanufikile Petros Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Oshabeni, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 18 January 1992.

name: Ncamisile Thokozile Shezi
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 December 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Nomthuswana Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack at Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in 1991.

name: Sibusiso Wiseman Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 1 January 1993, allegedly because he was seen in an area that had been declared a ‘no-go area’ for ANC supporters.

name: Silwayiphi Daniel Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Ntuthuka, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 April 1994, a week before the April 1994 elections. He had been seen in an area declared a ‘no-go area’ for ANC supporters.

name: Silwayiphi Daniel Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Ntuthuka, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 22 April 1994, a week before the April 1994 elections. He had been seen in an area declared a ‘no-go area’ for ANC supporters.

name: Siphiwe Shezi
description: He lost his house in an arson attack in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Fikile Shangase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured in an attack by IFP supporters on residents of the isolated ANC stronghold in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Hawukile Shangase
description: She had her home at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, set alight in an arson attack on 12 February 1994 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Khalangani Shangase
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Mangangeni in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in May 1994, in conflict accompanying the April 1994 elections.

name: Khalangani Shangase
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters at Mangangeni in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in May 1994, in conflict accompanying the April 1994 elections.

name: Mbhekeni Mbhulelwa Shangase
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when other named IFP supporters ambushed him at Thafamasi, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 December 1990. His sons were ANC supporters and had also been killed in the course of political conflict. His wife was injured, and two sisters-in-law were shot dead in the attack.

name: Mkhipheni Ben Shangase
description: Was shot dead in an attack by IFP supporters on residents of the isolated ANC stronghold in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mthandeni Vincent Shangase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and hacked to death by IFP supporters at Ndundumeni, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 23 December 1990. His brother was also killed in the attack. Three days later, three members of his family were killed by IFP supporters who attempted to prevent them from procuring muti for his grave.

name: Nkosikhona Shangase
description: Was shot and severely injured in an attack by IFP supporters on residents of the isolated ANC stronghold in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks

name: Ntombenjani Bonangani Shangase
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured on 26 December 1990, in Thafamasi, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban. She and other family members were ambushed on the road by other named IFP supporters who wanted to prevent her from procuring muti for the gravesof her sons, who sons were ANC supporters and had been killed in political conflict. Her husband and two daughters-in-law were shot dead in the attack.

name: Philisiwe Mpompo Shangase
description: She had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in August 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters over the launch of an IFP branch in the area.

name: Phindile Josephine Shangase
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in September 1991.

name: Phumelephi Sylvia Shangase
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by ANC supporters on 8 February 1994.

name: Yvonne Thembekile Shangase
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 2 March 1992 in continuting conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Zamokuhle Sbongiseni Shangase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and hacked to death by IFP supporters in Ndundumeni, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 23 December 1990. His brother was also killed in the attack. Three days later, three members of his family were killed by IFP supporters who attempted to prevent them from procuring muti for his grave.

name: Alpheus Magwegwe Shange
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared from Lamontville, Durban, in December 1986. It is alleged that he went into exile and, while in Lusaka, was summoned before a disciplinary hearing by his comrades and accused of being an informer. He then allegedly committed suicide.

name: Antony Shange
description: Was shot and injured when unidentified persons attacked his home at Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 30 August 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His wife was shot dead in the attack.

name: Balungile Shange
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Banelile S’Bongile Shange
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Njobokazi, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, during political conflict in the area in June 1980.

name: Basitile Shange
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Bhekinduna Isaac Shange
description: Was one of six passengers shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) attacked a bus at Umkomaas, near Durban, on 27 April 1992. Eight other passengers were injured. Three ANC SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2001/088). See Umkomaas bus attack.

name: Buyisile Precious Shange
description: The room in which she was staying was petrol-bombed in March 1993 in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. At least 18 people were killed in political violence in Bhambayi in March 1993. Seventy-five homes were burnt down.

name: Buyisile Precious Shange
description: The room in which she was staying was petrol-bombed in March 1993 in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. At least 18 people were killed in political violence in Bhambayi in March 1993. Seventy-five homes were burnt down.

name: Fihliwe Emma Mamtolo Shange
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in May 1993.

name: Henry Sphiwe Shange
description: Was shot and injured on 4 May 1986 when named ANC supporters disguised as doctors mounted a rescue of Gordon Webster, who was being held under police guard in Edendale Hospital, near Pietermaritzburg. One person was killed and two were injured in the operation.

name: Khumbuzile Shange
description: Was shot dead by unidentified perpetrators at Mahlabatini, near Ulundi, KwaZulu/Natal, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 5 January 1992. Her family’s home was burnt down during this attack.

name: Mantolwane Shange
description: An ANC supporter who had his livestock stolen and his house in Richmond, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters in April 1992.

name: Mbuyiselwa Shange
description: He had his house in Mtwalume, near Umzinto, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 1 January 1991, when the chief in his area reportedly launched a campaign to expel all ANC members from the area.

name: Mkhe Khethiwe Shange
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, petrol-bombed by ANC supporters in June 1993.

name: Ms (First Name Not Given) Shange
description: Was shot and injured in an attack on her home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in August 1993, during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Musa Raymond Shange
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and his body was severely mutilated by named IFP supporters in Vulindlela, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 13 February 1991.

name: Nelie Teressa Shange
description: Was shot dead when unidentified persons attacked her home in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 30 August 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her husband was shot and injured in the attack.

name: Nelisiwe Maggie Shange
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992.

name: Matshidiso John Tshidi Seitisho
description: Was accused of defacing potraits of homeland leaders and helping inmates escape from prison at Mmabatho, Bophuthatswana, on 28 February 1989. Mr Seitisho was also accused of being an ANC member, was put in solitary confinement for 13 days and deprived of legal counsel.

name: Ishmael Mosala Seitshiro
description: Was shot dead in Evaton, Tvl, on 19 July 1992 during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Mirriam Sekati
