description: She had her house burnt down by unidentified persons in Enkonjeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Sariel Vusimuzi Sekhenjana
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death by Shenge vigilantes in Khutsong, Carletonville, Tvl, on 16 December 1991 during conflict between the SACP and youth in the area.

name: Gladys Keitumetse ‘Bushy’ Sekonyane
description: An ANC supporter who was detained on 12 June 1986, and held for nine months under emergency regulations at Jan Kempdorp and Kimberley, Cape. During her detention she was severely beaten and tortured by named policemen. She was later convicted of public violence and sentenced to an effective three years’ imprisonment. See police brutality.

name: Molahlehi Johannes Selai
description: Was severely assaulted, stabbed and set alight by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Boipatong, Tvl, on 26 July 1992. He was suspected of participating in IFP attacks on Boipatong residents. Mr Selai was rescued by police and survived the attack. Four SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0324).

name: Thomas Selala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in a drive-by shooting by two named perpetrators in September 1990 in Daveyton, Tvl.

name: Isaac Butiki Selebe
description: Was shot dead in September 1990 in Vosloorus, Tvl, during violence between IFP-supporting hostel- dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Bhekumuzi Roman Selembe
description: An ANC supporter who was injured when named IFP supporters attacked ANC supporters at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 9 March 1992. The perpetrators allegedly believed that ANC supporters were about to attack IFP supporters. Eight people died and five others were injured in this attack.

name: Roman Selembe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a group of IFP supporters at Ndlovu’s Kraal, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 7 March 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area. Eight people died and five were injured in the attack. One perpetrator serving a prison sentence was refused amnesty (AC/1998/0010).

name: Cecilia Selepe
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters from the nearby hostel in Kagiso, Tvl, in August 1990. Kagiso was tense following numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Malihloa Pascalina Selepe
description: She had her home burnt down in Nkandla, KwaZulu, near Melmoth, Natal, on 24 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections

name: Malihloa Pascalina Selepe
description: She had her home burnt down in Nkandla, KwaZulu, near Melmoth, Natal, on 24 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections

name: Metseki Ishmael Selepe
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by IFP supporters at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Selepe has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Metseki Ishmael Selepe
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by IFP supporters at Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 20 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Selepe has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Orah Lydia Selepe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Orah Lydia Selepe
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Petrus Selepe
description: He had his home burnt down by members of the ANC-aligned ‘Gadaffi’ faction of the Khutsong Youth Congress (KYC) on 4 March 1990 in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal . The KYC split into rival two factions, the ‘Zim-zims’ and the ‘Gaddaffis’. Mr Selepe’s son was a policeman and was targeted as police were seen to be taking sides in the conflict within the KYC.

name: Vusi Selepe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe’s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. The attack was allegedly motivated by Molefe’s refusal to call up men in his area to defend the IFP. An IFP leader was implicated in the attack. Eleven ANC youths were killed and seven injured.

name: Philisiwe Ellen Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who lost her house in an arson attack on 6 August 1993 in Tokoza, Tvl, during political conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Ruth Sibongile Sithole
description: An ANC member who was shot at during an assassination attempt on a prominent ANC member by IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 July 1992. Two perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Sbongile Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Richmond, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area in 1991.

name: Sbusiso Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 November 1993.

name: Sizani Claudia Shozi
description: An IFP supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, in May 1992.

name: Sengiphelile Petros Sithole
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was injured during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Sentanda Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks

name: Sibusiso Vusumuzi Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 14 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sibusiso Vusumuzi Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 14 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sicelo Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by IFP supporters at Mandini, Natal, on 6 October 1991.

name: Siphiwe Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was injured in an explosion in Maseru, Lesotho, on 5 July 1979, when a parcel bomb was detonated. Five other persons were injured in the incident.

name: Sipho Sithole
description: Was shot dead with a friend, and their shack was burnt down by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) and ANC-supporting residents in the Power Park squatter camp, Soweto, Johannes-burg, on 9 April 1994. The residents suspected them of being IFP supporters. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0319).

name: Buselaphi Xolisile Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Edy Silotile
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, in 1992, by a group of men associated with the local town councillors, in an arson and gunfire attack on D section which was perceived to be ANC-aligned.

name: Qimba Mphikeleli Sibisi
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death by ANC supporters at Estcourt, Natal, on 11 July 1992.

name: Thembisile Merina Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Stanger, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area during October 1993.

name: Thembisile Muriel Sithole
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters, who also stole her belongings, at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 3 March 1991 in ongoing political conflict.

name: Thobelani Sithole
description: Was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 15 May 1993, allegedly because his mother was an ANC supporter.

name: Thokozile Esther Sithole
description: She had her home destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during ongoing political conflict in the area in December 1993.

name: Vinjelweyini Sithole
description: Was shot dead in the bush near at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 29 March 1991 by ANC members who suspected him of being an IFP member.

name: Vusumuzi Clobas Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who lost his house and sustained serious injuries when ANC supporters launched a grenade attack on his home at Loskop, near Estcourt, Natal, on 25 October 1993.

name: Zenze John Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Mooi River, Natal, on 10 August 1991.

name: Zine Sizephi Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Umlazi, Durban, burnt down in May 1992, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Zithulele Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death and his body mutilated by named IFP supporters at Caluza, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 30 November 1990. The perpetrators were arrested, but the case against them was withdrawn.

name: Mzonzo Sipho Sithomo
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when he was hacked with an axe by IFP supporters on 26 November 1992 in Katlehong, Tvl. The incident left him paralysed.

name: Ncedani William Situ
description: He had his home in Matatiele, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in April 1993, allegedly because he was suspected of siding with the local chief.

name: Nomfazwe Nowinile Sivela
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in 1992.

name: Thembisa Siwali
description: Was shot by ANC supporters during conflict between ADM and ANC supporters at NU 3, Mdantsane, Ciskei, on 28 January 1993.

name: Meyile Malcomeso Siwayi
description: He lost his home in an arson attack by ANC youths on 6 October 1991 in Peelton, Ciskei. The attack occurred during the mass occupation of land that took place in the 1991 and 1992 land campaign in the area. The victim was targeted because he supported the local headmen and chiefs’ position regarding the size of sites allocated.

name: Soboyise Siyotywa
description: He had his possessions stolen during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1993.

name: Lucas Sizani
description: An ANC supporter and national organiser of SASM who was detained under the Terrorism Act in July 1976 in John Voster Square, Johannesburg. He was beaten and tortured because he was involved int the Soweto uprising. After his release from prison, he suffered a nervous breakdown as a direct result of his ordeal.

name: Sibongile Lydia Siziba
description: An ANC supporter who was injured by State-aligned vigilantes in a stone-throwing incident in Lebohang, Leandra, Transvaal, in January 1986. The area had been declared a ‘black spot’ by the government and was earmarked for forced removal.

name: Mphathiseni Skewu
description: Was killed and his body burnt at his house in Empangeni, Natal, by a known perpetrator in 1993, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Mpilo Skhakhane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during May 1994, in political conflict following the April 1994 elections.

name: Mpilo Skhakhane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during May 1994, in political conflict following the April 1994 elections.

name: Sibongile Daphney Skhakhane
description: An ANC supporter who  had her home destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1992.

name: Johanna Velie Skhosana
description: She had her home in Vlaklaagte, KwaNdebele, burnt down by members of the Special Branch during an attack on a group of young ANC supporters, on 14 June 1986.

name: Masixole Skiet
description: Was injured when a hand grenade was thrown into his home during intense conflict between ADM and ANC supporters in Quzini, King William’s Town, Cape, on 9 August 1992. His grandfather was an ANC member.

name: Richard Zibonele Sibisi
description: An ANC activist who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Tvl, on 19 December 1993.

name: Thandi Happiness Shozi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot, beaten and stabbed by IFP supporters in Magabheni, Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 1 January 1991.

name: Harold Mvuyo Sifumba
description: Was shot dead by an IFP supporter on 12 September 1991 at Vosloorus, Tvl, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Feni Eveline Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thabile Shezi
description: Was injured during an assassination attempt on a prominent ANC member by IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 July 1992. Two perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Fundisiwe Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntsikelelo Attwell Skolo
description: An ANC activist who lost his home when it was petrol-bombed in Tembisa, Tvl, on 27 January 1991.

name: Gabisile Margaret Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: George Sokhela
description: Was attacked and severely beaten by IFP supporters in May 1991 in Meadowlands, Soweto, Johannesburg, during conflict between ANC-upporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers

name: Tholwapi Mamcunu Shozi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by an IFP supporter on 10 November 1993.

name: Fikile Margaret Sima
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by a named IFP supporter at her home in Ensimbini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 21 December 1991.

name: Gcineni Sima
description: Was beaten, stabbed and had her home in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 22 March 1994, allegedly because her sons were perceived to be ANC supporters. Ms Sima’s son and her neighbour, who was visiting, were shot dead in the attack.

name: Mzuvukile Wiseman Sima
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 March 1994, because he was perceived to be an ANC supporter. His house was burnt down in the attack, and his neighbour, who was visiting, was also killed.

name: Phindiwe Dinah Sima
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at KwaXolo, near Ramsgate, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 10 April 1994, two weeks before the April 1994 elections, allegedly because the family was sympathetic to the ANC.

name: Phindiwe Dinah Sima
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at KwaXolo, near Ramsgate, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 10 April 1994, two weeks before the April 1994 elections, allegedly because the family was sympathetic to the ANC.

name: Vusumuzi Sima
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Nkothaneni, Port Shepstone, Natal, during March 1994, allegedly because he refused to attend IFP self-defence camps.

name: Nomajongosi Mavis Simamane
description: She had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Hosiyana, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 February 1994, during political conflict following the funeral of a prominent IFP official in the area. The perpetrators attacked mourners returning from the funeral, and several homes were set alight.

name: Qondeni Sylvester Simamane
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Velaphi Simamane
description: Was stabbed and shot by IFP supporters in the Mathulini area, near Maphumulo, KwaZulu, near Greytown, Natal, on 16 August 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. She later died of her injuries.

name: Vusumuzi Moses Simamane
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Wildred Poni Simamane
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nan Simelane Sbusiso Carol
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and axed to death by unidentified people at a taxi rank in Pietermaritzburg during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 3 February 1993. Three others were killed; he was the only survivor.

name: Allison Msuvukela Simelane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in an attack on his home in Ondondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 July 1992, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. The attackers reportedly wanted guns, which they believed the family had received from Ulundi. His wife was severely beaten during the attack.

name: Bhekuyise Simon Simelane
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 13 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bhekuyise Simon Simelane
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 13 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Eunice Simelane
description: An IFP supporter who was severely beaten in an attack on her home in Ondondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 July 1992, in ongoing conflict between the ANC and IFP. The attackers reportedly wanted guns, which they believed the family had received from Ulundi. Her husband was killed in the attack.

name: Gcinwayinkosi Petrus Simelane
description: An ANC supporter who was tortured, stabbed and shot dead by members of an ANC-aligned self-defence unit on 30 August 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl, because he refused to patrol with them.

name: Jabulani Kom Simelane
description: He lost his house in an arson attack in Ondondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 August 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Johannes Meleni Simelane
description: An ANC supporter who died after he was stabbed and shot by members of the IFP-aligned Khumalo gang on 4 August 1993 in Tokoza, Alberton, Tvl.

name: Mpembe Amos Simelane
description: An IFP supporter who had his home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters on 19 June 1991.

name: Nonozana Anna Simelane
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks

name: Ntshwenca Sinama
description: An ANC supporter who was executed in Pretoria, on 6 July 1962. He was arrested two years earlier during conflict over the implementation of the Bantu Education and Bantu Authorities Acts in the area. Mr Sinama was held at Bizana, until found guilty and sentenced to death at Kokstad Supreme Court.

name: Zion Jeremiah Sincuba
description: Was injured in a bomb explosion caused by ANC supporters near the Pass office in Durban in 1981. Although he was reportedly a bystander when the blast occurred, Mr Sincuba was accused of planting the bomb, and was tried in Pietermaritzburg Supreme Court.

name: Bhekizitha Jones Sindane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Richmond, Natal, on 24 December 1991.

name: Sidumo Jeffrey Sindane
description: An IFP supporter who had his house destroyed in an arson attack at Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1991.

name: Thomi Joseph Sindane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 30 November 1990.

name: Koki Simon Singonzo
description: A National Party supporter and local councillor who had his home in Mangaung, Bloemfontein, destroyed in a hand grenade attack by ANC supporters in 1991.

name: Thomas Velaphi Singwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by a named perpetrator on 19 February 1992 in Mhluzi, Middelburg, Tvl, in a drive-by shooting.

name: Gladys Mbagem Siphika
description: She had her home destroyed in an attack by IFP supporters in Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1990. She was allegedly targeted because she was believed to be an ANC supporter.

name: Mziwandile Ruben Siphika
description: Was severely beaten by named IFP supporters at Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, in 1990. He was allegedly attacked because he was believed to be an ANC supporter.

name: Mzuzile Honey Siqubetu
description: An ANC supporter who was ‘necklaced’ to death on 2 September 1985 at Ziphunzana stadium, East London. Ms Siqubetu was working as a housekeeper at Cambridge police station, East London, and was therefore perceived to be a collaborator.

name: (First Names Not Given) Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP members during political violence at Nyoni, KwaZulu, near Gingindlovu, Natal, during 1993. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Bongani John Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Sibusiso Alfred Sibisi
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death by IFP supporters at Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 9 April 1994, three weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Sibusiso Alfred Sibisi
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death by IFP supporters at Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 9 April 1994, three weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Victoria Duduzile Shozi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaDweshula, Port Shepstone, Natal, in June 1991.

name: Vuyani Sotsu
description: Was shot and critically injured when a group of named IFP supporters attacked his home in Boiphatong, Vanderbijlpark, Tvl, on 3 July 1991. At the time of this attack there was conflict between IFP and ANC suporters in Tvl. Properties were destroyed and many people were killed and injured.

name: Hlakaniphanio Agrippah Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Viliza Shozi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by Amavaravara vigilantes during political conflict in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 17 June 1991.

name: Jabulani Patrick Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Vimbepi Shozi
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in the Chimora informal settlement at Umlazi, Durban, burnt down in 1992. Several homes were burnt down in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Chimora during the year.

name: Sello Samuel Skosana
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Alberton, Tvl, in June 1993.

name: Virginia Mpontso Skosana
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 27 April 1994, the first day of polling in the April 1994 elections. Forty-eight houses were burnt down in political conflict accompanying the elections.

name: Virginia Mpontso Skosana
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 27 April 1994, the first day of polling in the April 1994 elections. Forty-eight houses were burnt down in political conflict accompanying the elections.

name: Dimitrios Skoularikis
description: Was sentenced to ten years in prison in 1986, in Benoni, Tvl, after having been framed for murder. Before he was imprisoned, he was subjected to electric shock torture, suffocated and had his body held out of a moving car with his head touching the road to force him to confess to the murder. It later emerged that the murder was carried out by members of the CCB and Mr Skoularikis was framed because he was involved in covert support for the ANC.

name: Loyiso Skritshi
description: An ANC supporter who was evicted from his house by ADM supporters, some of whom are named, during political conflict in Ncera, near East London, in 1989. Mr Skritshi had allegedly refused to join the ADM.

name: Ngqondo Skritshi
description: He lost his home in an arson attack on 26 May 1993 at Ncera, near East London. Mr Skritshi, a headman who had been relocated to the Ncera area by a chief, allegedly became unpopular with the leader of SANCO shortly before the attack.

name: Mangaliso Wesley Skweyiya
description: An ANC supporter who was detained in Bloemfontein for 108 days from 6 April 1963, and was tortured in detention.

name: Sthembile Smanga
description: He disappeared on 11 October 1990 from Phola Park, Tokoza, Tvl, after his shack was attacked by IFP supporters during violent clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Jordan Smith
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in May 1992 in Sebokeng, Tvl. Several other family members, including his mother, were killed or injured in attacks at different times by ANC supporters because because one of the family members was an IFP supporter.

name: Nanki Emily Smith
description: Was seriously injured when a hand grenade was thrown into her home in Sebokeng, Tvl, on 28 April 1992 by ANC supporters because one of the family members was an IFP supporter. Her mother was killed in the explosion and her aunt was seriously injured and subsequently died.

name: Ndleleni Thompson Smith
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by fellow ANC supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 15 January 1992, allegedly because he refused to attend an ANC night camp. His three-month-old son was burnt to death in the attack.

name: Ntomboxole Phyllis Smith
description: She had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters in December 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Oupa Abram Smith
description: An IFP supporter who was burnt to death by ANC supporters in July 1992 in Sharpeville, Vereeniging. Tvl. Several other family members including his mother were killed or injured in attacks at different times by ANC supporters because of his political affiliation.

name: Sandile Smith
description: Was burnt to death in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 15 January 1992. The attack was allegedly directed against his father, an ANC supporter, who had refused to attend an ANC night camp.

name: Sanni Alina Smith
description: Was killed when a hand grenade was thrown into her house in Sebokeng, Tvl, on 28 April 1992 by ANC supporters because a family member was an IFP supporter. Her daughter was killed in the explosion and her sister was seriously injured and subsequently died.

name: Xolo Shonaphi
description: She had her house burnt down on 7 April 1994, when gunmen attacked a homestead in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Five people were killed and four injured in the attack. Between 1990 and 1994, about 2000 people in the Port Shepstone area fled their homes to escape the violence.

name: Xolo Shonaphi
description: She had her house burnt down on 7 April 1994, when gunmen attacked a homestead in Izingolweni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Five people were killed and four injured in the attack. Between 1990 and 1994, about 2000 people in the Port Shepstone area fled their homes to escape the violence.

name: Sipho Sodidi
description: He had his house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 12 February 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. One person was killed and seven homes were burnt down in the area in February 1992.

name: Sipho Sodidi
description: He had his house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down on 12 February 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. One person was killed and seven homes were burnt down in the area in February 1992.

name: Timothy Soga
description: An ANC activist who was shot dead by masked gunmen who burst into the house and opened fire in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 19 March 1993. Three family members and friends were shot dead and two injured in the attack. One perpetrator was later convicted and jailed for the attack. He was refused amnesty.

name: Bidekile Sogqiba
description: An ANC supporter who was killed during political conflict in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 28 October 1991.

name: Henry Nduna Sokhabase
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP members in Greytown, Natal, on 7 February 1992.

name: Thembisile Pricilla Shezi
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Amaoti, Inanda, near Durban, on 23 October 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: John Mkakeni Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mpheni Siganga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by alleged IFP supporters in Orlando East, Soweto, Tvl, in April 1992, while coming from an ANC party.

name: Nelson Thulani Sokhela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 15 August 1992 in political conflict between township residents and hostel-dwellers.

name: Lawrence Nqobizwe Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Vusi Innocent Shozi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at his home in Nkanyeni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 6 May 1991.

name: Amos Sam Sigasa
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Transvaal , while attending the funeral of a ‘comrade’ on 4 August 1992. Ratanda was one of several East Rand townships engulfed in political conflict between IFP supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents in the early 1990s.

name: Nomusa Faith Sokhela
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 4 December 1991, when the perpetrators attacked White City residents. Ms Sokhela was killed while attempting to run away. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Mangasa Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Busisiwe Margaret Shude
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Alfred, near Port Shepstone, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 8 March 1993.

name: Mbizwa Shude
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Alfred, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 March 1993.

name: Siyabonga Shude
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Alfred, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 8 March 1993.

name: Bella Thembekile Shuma
description: Was shot dead on 3 November 1993 in Tembisa, Tvl, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Abel Goitsimodimo Shuping
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named ANC supporter in Bloemfontein, on 28 March 1992, in the course of a serious internal dispute in the organisation. His father was also shot dead in the attack; his brother was shot and severely injured

name: Abram Botaeletse Shuping
description: A prominent ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named ANC supporter in Bloemfontein, on 28 March 1992, in the course of a serious internal dispute in the organisation. One of his sons was also killed in the attack. Another was shot and severely injured.

name: Leaooa Paul ‘Daddy’ Shuping
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by a named ANC supporter in Bloemfontein, on 28 March 1992, in the course of a serious internal dispute in the organisation. His father and brother were both killed in the same incident. ‘Daddy’ Shuping was paralysed as a result of the shooting.

name: Silence Shuping
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by alleged ANC supporters in Bloemfontein, in 1992, allegedly for not approving of ANC/SANCO presence in the area.

name: Majola Shusha
description: An ANC member who was executed in Pretoria, on 6 July 1962. Mr Shusha was active in the campaign against forced removals and other apartheid structures.

name: Mantwetwe Eric Shusha
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by named IFP supporters in KwaDandala, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 September 1990. Three other ANC supporters were also killed in the incident.

name: Thembsile Shusha
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Tongaat, Natal, destroyed in an attack by IFP supporters in 1990.

name: Ntombi Sibongile Sibanda
description: Was beaten by ANC supporters at Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, in May 1991, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Her attackers thought she knew something about the killing of one of their ‘comrades’.

name: Jabulani Sibanyoni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Wesselton, Ermelo, Tvl, during the funeral of an ANC supporter on 11 August 1990.

name: Bubu Sibeko
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Daveyton, Tvl, in July 1993 during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Joseph Sibeko
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Tvl, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Mark Glen Sibeko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in a drive-by shooting on 22 June 1993 in Daveyton, Tvl.

name: Bhekinkosi Sibisi
description: Was abducted together with an ANC supporter in Umlazi, Durban, on 5 September 1992. They were taken to Engonyameni, an IFP stronghold, where they were both shot dead.

name: Bhekumuzi Simon Sibisi
description: He had his home in Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 20 March 1993 during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Carter Mngoni Sibisi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named member of the IFP-aligned Khumalo gang on 1 January 1993 in Tokoza, Transvaal . He and four others were attacked in the ‘no-go’ area of Khumalo Street.

name: Dumisani David Sibisi
description: Was shot dead by alleged IFP supporters at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. His family home. located in an ANC-dominated area, was burnt down in the same attack.

name: Jeremia Sibisi
description: She had her house in Empangeni, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in continuing political conflict in February 1993.

name: Jerome Sbongiseni Sibisi
description: An ANC supporter who was seriously injured in an attack by named IFP supporters at Umlazi, Durban, on 10 April 1988. He died of his injuries on 4 October 1988.

name: Jerome Sbongiseni Sibisi
description: An ANC supporter who was seriously injured in an attack by named IFP supporters at Umlazi, Durban, on 10 April 1988. He died of his injuries on 4 October 1988.

name: Louisa Bongiwe Sibisi
description: Was killed in Eshowe, Natal, on 23 March 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Louisa Bongiwe Sibisi
description: Was killed in Eshowe, Natal, on 23 March 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nelson Bheki Sibisi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in the back and paralysed in the street at Mavimbela section, Katlehong, Tvl, on 12 March 1992 during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Mkakeni Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thokozile Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when IFP supporters attacked her house in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 December 1993.

name: Ntombitheni Mamsishi Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Timothy Sipho Sibisi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Inchanga, Natal, on 25 February 1992.

name: Norman Sokhela
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by a named ANC supporter in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 16 December 1992, while travelling in the same car as a prominent IFP member, who was the target of the attack. Three people died and several were injured.

name: Thombo Zibeni Shezi
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, in May 1990, allegedly because her husband was an ANC supporter. The family fled to Pinetown, where Ms Shezi’s husband was stabbed to death at a taxi rank on 7 July 1990. Political violence in the Richmond area had caused many people to flee the area and settle in the Pinetown and Clermont areas, where some were hunted down and attacked.

name: Thombo Zibeni Shezi
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, in May 1990, allegedly because her husband was an ANC supporter. The family fled to Pinetown, where Ms Shezi’s husband was stabbed to death at a taxi rank on 7 July 1990. Political violence in the Richmond area had caused many people to flee the area and settle in the Pinetown and Clermont areas, where some were hunted down and attacked.

name: Motshwa Sigwinta
description: An ANC supporter who was tortured while in detention in April 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Mafika Sihlale
description: Was abducted and severely beaten by vigilantes in Leandra, Tvl, in January 1986 during conflict between police and scholars at Impumelelo Combined School. SIHLALI, Fortunate Jabulile, was stoned by ANC supporters on 25 December 1991 in Vosloorus, Tvl, during ongoing violence between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Mafika Sihlale
description: Was abducted and severely beaten by vigilantes in Leandra, Tvl, in January 1986 during conflict between police and scholars at Impumelelo Combined School. SIHLALI, Fortunate Jabulile, was stoned by ANC supporters on 25 December 1991 in Vosloorus, Tvl, during ongoing violence between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Fortunate Jabulile Sihlali
description: Was stoned by ANC supporters on 25 December 1991 in Vosloorus, Transvaal, during ongoing violence between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Morris Sikenjana
description: Was shot dead on 6 August 1993 in Vosloorus, Tvl, during heightened tension between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Bhekuyise Christopher Sikhakane
description: An ANC youth leader who was shot dead by fellow ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 14 February 1994 in the course of a serious internal feud within the local party branch.

name: Celumuzi Moses Sikhakane
description: Ann IFP supporter who had his home in Clermont, near Durban, demolished by ANC supporters in March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Celumuzi Moses Sikhakane
description: Ann IFP supporter who had his home in Clermont, near Durban, demolished by ANC supporters in March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Joyce Nomafa Sikhakhane-Rankin
description: An ANC member who was arrested and placed in solitary confinement in May 1969 in Soweto, Johannesburg.

name: Andrinah Thokozile Sikhakhane
description: She had her home in Eshowe, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack on 23 November 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Basil Kelly Sikhakhane
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 5 January 1992. Mr Sikhakhane was a stranger in the area. Conflict between the IFP and ANC in the area gave rise to suspicion of those not immediately identifiable either by language or political affiliation.

name: Ben Sikhakhane
description: He had his home fired on by two armed ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members in Tokoza, Tvl, during 1993. The SDU members believed that he was an IFP member. No one was injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0243).

name: Bheki Richard Sikhakhane
description: Was attacked by IFP supporters in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 April 1992. At least 11 people were killed the same day in various incidents of conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Geb Gerbard Sikhakhane
description: An IFP supporter who had his house at Ndonyela, near Bulwer, Natal, destroyed in an arson attack by named ANC supporters in May 1992.

name: Lawrence Themba Sikhakhane
description: Was stabbed to death by a named perpetrator in Qinabout, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 May 1994 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters following the April 1994 elections.

name: Lawrence Themba Sikhakhane
description: Was stabbed to death by a named perpetrator in Qinabout, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 9 May 1994 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters following the April 1994 elections.

name: Mandla Caswell Sikhakhane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 11 August 1990.

name: Mntomuhle Ndukushayizazi Sikhakhane
description: Was shot and stabbed to death in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal in November 1992.

name: Oscar Khulekani Sikhakhane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe’s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. The attack was allegedly motivated by Molefe’s re fusal to call up men in his area to defend the IFP. An IFP leader was implicated in the attack. Eleven ANC youths were killed and seven injured.

name: Skafu Busisiwe Sikhakhane
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 11 August 1990.

name: Msetyenzelwa Sikhephe
description: Was shot by IFP supporters on 3 December 1993 in Bekkersdal, near Westonaria, Tvl, during numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Elliot Sikhosana
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in May 1993 at Mthimde, Lusikisiki, Transkei, after he allowed his ANC ‘comrades’ to hold a meeting in his home.

name: Monono Mavis Sikhosana
description: An IFP supporter who had her home burnt down by ANC supporters in Mawoti, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 14 October 1993.

name: Sipho Sikiti
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 26 May 1993 in Katlehong, Tvl, during ongoing conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers.

name: Mavis Mklazi Sikobi
description: She had her home in Nkothaneni, Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down on 7 April 1994. ANC supporters attacked several IFP supporters’ homes in the area that day, killing five people and injuring four, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mavis Mklazi Sikobi
description: She had her home in Nkothaneni, Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down on 7 April 1994. ANC supporters attacked several IFP supporters’ homes in the area that day, killing five people and injuring four, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Qondeni Irenei Sikobi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home set alight by named and other IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Qondeni Irenei Sikobi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home set alight by named and other IFP supporters in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in February 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Vusi Patrick Sikobi
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked to death by named IFP supporters in Ngwemabalala, KwaXolo, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 2 May 1993.

name: David Sipho Sikonde
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 7 November 1991, when IFP supporters attacked protesters participating in an anti-VAT march.

name: Wenziwe Florence Sikumkani
description: She had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in February 1993. About 35 houses were reportedly burnt down in Bhambayi that month.

name: Merriman Sipho Sikutshwa
description: An ANC member who was imprisoned in February 1960 in Bizana, Transkei, for his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Ntombifikile Anna Silango
description: An IFP supporter who had her home in Hopewell, Ixopo, Natal, burnt down by ANC supporters in February 1992. Political violence in Hopewell at this time claimed about ten lives and forced over 300 people to flee from the area. Most of the victims were IFP supporters.

name: Babongile Florence Silangwe
description: An IFP supporter who lost her home in Hopewell, Ixopo, Natal, when it was burnt down by ANC supporters in February 1992, allegedly because her husband was an induna and an IFP member. Political violence in Hopewell at this time claimed about ten lives and forced over 300 people to flee from the area. Most of the victims were IFP supporters.

name: Wilson Silindza
description: Was severely beaten, allegedly by ANC supporters, because he was visiting the home of someone accused of witchcraft in Mdlankomo, Kabokweni, KaNgwane, in 1986.

name: Colleen Sillands
description: She died on 26 April 1994, a day after she was shot travelling in a minibus in Alberton, Tvl, during tension in the area after numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Margaret Sillands
description: Was shot and injured on 25 April 1994 in Alberton, Tvl, while travelling in a minibus in Alberton, Tvl, during tension in the area after numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Sizakele Anna Sokhela
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house when it was burnt down by IFP supporters in the Nkumba area of Bulwer, Natal, on 8 December 1991. Her son was shot dead in the attack.

name: Skhumbuzo Michael Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thokozani Otrinah Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Zafika Annacetha Sishi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 17 March 1994. See also Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomathemba Patience Sishimane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by an ANC supporter at Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 2 February 1993. The incident occurred soon after the perpetrator had left a local ANC meeting.

name: Zani Selina Sokhela
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Zenzele Sokhela
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in the Nkumba area of Bulwer, Natal, on 24 October 1992. His body was then burnt and thrown over a cliff.

name: Nhloko Sokhele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by a named ANC supporter in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 16 December 1992, while travelling in the same car as a prominent IFP member, who was the target of the attack. Three people died and several were injured.

name: Petros Fannyman Sokhele
description: Was tortured and killed by unidentified perpetrators in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in March 1993.

name: Bongumusa Archiles Sokhulu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured by ANC supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 10 May 1994, in political conflict on the day of Nelson Mandela’s inauguration as President.

name: Ntombiyenkosi Elsie Sokhulu
description: She had her house at Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack on 19 December 1993 in continuing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Silumko Solomon ‘Soks’ Sokupa
description: An ANC member from King William’s Town, Cape, who was injured in an explosion on 5 July 1979 in Maseru, Lesotho, when a parcel containing an explosive device was opened. Five other persons were injured in the incident.

name: Vusumzi Patrick Solani
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by members of AmaAfrika on 28 December 1989 in Uitenhage, Cape. Mr Solani had attended a meeting to promote understanding between the two organisations.

name: Mano Olifile Solly
description: He lost his home in a bomb explosion in Letsopa, Ottosdal, Tvl, on 4 February 1994. The bomb, planted by AWB members and aimed at the local ANC office, was part of an attempt by right-wing parties to derail the first democratic election of 27 April 1994.

name: Mano Olifile Solly
description: He lost his home in a bomb explosion in Letsopa, Ottosdal, Tvl, on 4 February 1994. The bomb, planted by AWB members and aimed at the local ANC office, was part of an attempt by right-wing parties to derail the first democratic election of 27 April 1994.

name: Desmond Robert Solomons
description: A sergeant in the ISU who suffered injuries when he and twelve other policemen were attacked by ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members whilst on foot patrol in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 22 July 1992. Six policemen were injured in the exchange of fire. Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1997/0029).

name: William Zotusile Somana
description: An ANC supporter who lost his home and belongings in an arson attack during political conflict in Crossroads, Cape Town, in March 1992.

name: Maliteke Catherine Sondezi
description: An ANC supporter who was injured in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 30 November 1993, when the vehicle in which she was travelling to a funeral veered out of control after being chased by armed IFP supporters. Many ANC supporters in the area were killed after this funeral.

name: Samson Sondyazi
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten by IFP supporters on 17 September 1990 in Vosloorus, Tvl.

name: David Sono
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and arrested in Temba, Bophuthatswana, on 9 March 1991, allegedly for selling political T-shirts.

name: Lolo Sono
description: Was abducted, tortured and allegedly killed by named members of the ANC and the Mandela United Football Club in Soweto, Johannesburg, in October 1988. He was accused of being a police informer. One of the perpetrators applied for amnesty.

name: Nena Sontundu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and severely injured in her chest and fingers on 13 May 1993 while travelling on a train from Johannesburg to Benrose station, Tvl. See train violence.

name: Philemon Sophiseka
description: Was shot dead in Randfontein, Tvl, on 6 May 1990 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Kagiso, Tvl.

name: Andile Tennison Sopotela
description: A shopsteward who was burnt to death when his house was petrol-bombed in KwaNobuhle, Uitenhage, Cape, on 19 July 1989 following a dispute between employees and employers at Goodyear Tyres where his brother worked. At the time, there was tension between police and the shopstewards’ council, because the council had demanded the unbanning of the ANC and SACP.

name: Albert Sosibo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and beaten to death by IFP supporters in an arson attack on his home near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 November 1991.

name: Nhlanhla Ernest Sosibo
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by IFP supporters from Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in October 1992. Mr Sosibo was last seen being pursued into the Kapopeletsheni Forest in Richmond. He is presumed dead.

name: Nkosinathi Emmanuel Sosibo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Nhlazatshe, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 10 October 1990. His mother’s house was looted in the attack.

name: Sifiso Enoch Sosibo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed on 20 July 1992 while returning from a vigil in L Section, KwaMashu, Durban. Mr Sosibo and his friends, who had recently returned from exile in Lusaka, were singing freedom songs when members of a private security organisation, Combat Force, confronted them and shot and killed Mr Sosibo.

name: Thiyekile Christian Sotondoshe
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 17 August 1990 in Tokoza, Tvl. Tokoza was tense following clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Mamlawu Rhoda Sotshongane
description: An ANC supporter who had her home destroyed by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992. See Chimora Settlement attacks

name: Ernest Ngxokolo Sotsu
description: Sotsu, his wife and two other family members were killed on 3 July 1991 in Boipatong, Vanderbijlpark Transvaal , in an attack on his home by named IFP supporters. Mr Sotsu’s two grandchildren were also injured in the attack. Mr Sotsu was in Durban at the time attending the ANC’s national congress.

name: Xolani Sibisi
description: An IFP supporter who was abducted and stabbed to death by ANC supporters in Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 19 February 1990, during political conflict following the unbanning of political organisations on 2 February.

name: Nthabiseng Speciwe
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by members of the A-Team, who attacked mourners at a night vigil in Thabong, Welkom, OFS, on 9 May 1985. A member of the A-Team was killed in the ensuing conflict.

name: Christian Bhekuyise Sithebe
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from Nongoma, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in October 1978. He was allegedly killed during a shoot-out with a shop owner in Paulpietersburg, Natal.

name: Ziningi Sylvia Shezi
description: She had her home at Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal burnt down by unidentified perpetrators in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Esther Jabhisa Sithebe
description: Was shot by IFP supporters on 13 December 1992 in Vosloorus, Tvl, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC-supporting residents.

name: Ziphelele Vivian Shezi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in Mahwaqa, near Port Shepstone, Natal, by alleged IFP supporters in April 1990, following the unbanning of political organisations in February.

name: Avril Rachewell Steyn
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and tortured by named policemen in Worcester, Cape, on 13 June 1979. He was charged with terrorism and damage to property and held in Worcester prison for nine months. He received a suspended sentence. He was again detained and tortured by the same policemen in 1982.

name: (First Name Not Given) Sulkas
description: An alleged IFP supporter who suffered damage to her home when it was attacked by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Tvl, during 1993. Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0186).

name: Sifiso Stanford Sunduza
description: A SANCO member who was severely beaten by followers of the local headman in Sterkspruit, Transkei, on 14 December 1992 at a meeting between community members and the headman during conflict over the tribal authorities in Sterkspruit.

name: Solomon Mandlenkosi Mazibuko Sunduza
description: A SANCO member who was severely beaten by followers of the local headman in Sterkspruit, Transkei, on 14 December 1992 at a meeting between community members and the headman during conflict over the tribal authorities in Sterkspruit.

name: Bafana Makhenji Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who  was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters at his home in Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 6 February 1993.

name: Jabu Adelaide Shibe
description: She had her house set alight by ANC supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 26 March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Jabu Adelaide Shibe
description: She had her house set alight by ANC supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 26 March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nomzindo Ida Shibe
description: She had her house, which was located in an ANC-dominated area of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters during political conflict in March 1993. At least 18 people were killed in political violence in Bhambayi in March 1993, and 75 homes were burnt down. See ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions.

name: Nomzindo Ida Shibe
description: She had her house, which was located in an ANC-dominated area of Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters during political conflict in March 1993. At least 18 people were killed in political violence in Bhambayi in March 1993, and 75 homes were burnt down. See ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions.

name: Vusi Gunnet Shibe
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 3 April 1990 and held for over a month, allegedly because of his political activities.

name: Fuzile Shikita
description: An ANC member who was tortured while in detention in Bizana, Transkei, in March 1960 during the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Bheki Bethlehem Shinga
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed by IFP supporters at the Glebelands hostel in Umlazi, Durban, on 3 August 1992, allegedly because he did not heed an IFP-organised stayaway. Another person was also killed in the hostel that day.

name: Meshack Shinga
description: He lost his house in an arson attack in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, in April 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Meshack Shinga
description: He lost his house in an arson attack in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, in April 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Billy Shiyani
description: An ANC supporter who was shot during protests in Mdantsane, Ciskei, on 25 December 1988

name: Bafana Michael Shoba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Richmond, Natal, in January 1991 in the ongoing struggle between supporters of the ANC and IFP for political supremacy in the area. He was missing for a week before his bullet-ridden body was found at the Richmond mortuary.

name: Mlandelwa Michael Shoba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and killed by ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in April 1991.

name: Mduduzi Vincent Shobede
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in Mkhukhuze, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 22 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Between January and March 1994, political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters resulted in 47 cases of arson-related violence in Eshowe.

name: Mduduzi Vincent Shobede
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in Mkhukhuze, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 22 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Between January and March 1994, political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters resulted in 47 cases of arson-related violence in Eshowe.

name: Mduduzi Vincent Shobede
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down in Mkhukhuze, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 22 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Between January and March 1994, political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters resulted in 47 cases of arson-related violence in Eshowe.

name: Ntombizethu Clarah Shobede
description: She lost her house and livestock in an arson attack in Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Between January and March 1994, political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters resulted in 47 cases of arson-related violence in Eshowe.

name: Ntombizethu Clarah Shobede
description: She lost her house and livestock in an arson attack in Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Between January and March 1994, political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters resulted in 47 cases of arson-related violence in Eshowe.

name: Ntombizethu Clarah Shobede
description: She lost her house and livestock in an arson attack in Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Between January and March 1994, political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters resulted in 47 cases of arson-related violence in Eshowe.

name: Sonosini Shobede
description: She lost her house in an arson attack in Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in the political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Samson Shobedi
description: Lost two houses in an arson attack in Zindophe, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sephora Sanah Shokwe
description: An ANC supporter and executive member of the Tokoza Civic Association who was severely assaulted in her home by IFP supporters on 9 March 1991. They were looking for guns allegedly hidden in her house and beat her with AK rifles and fired shots at the ceiling and walls. A few days later they returned and destroyed her furniture. Her husband and son were also injured in the attack.

name: Jacobus Swanepoel
description: A prison warder who was killed when a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) detonated a hand grenade while trying to escape from Leeuwhof prison, Vereeniging, Tvl, on 18 December 1993. Three people died and nine were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/145).

name: Madabula Shongwe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by named ANC supporters when they opened fire on his home in KwaMthethwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 20 May 1993. Three other people were shot dead in the incident.

name: Mlamuli Shongwe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead at his home in Tokoza, Alberton, Tvl, on 12 August 1992, during conflict between the ANC and IFP which spilled over into the taxi industry.

name: Ms (First Name Not Given) Shongwe
description: She had her house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, petrol-bombed by ANC suppporters in November 1990. The attack was allegedly intended to instil fear in her sons, who were part of a team investigating political violence in the area.

name: Mtuwelizwe Abram Shongwe
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested, detained and tortured in 1986 in Komatipoort, Tvl, because he allegedly participated in the murder of member of the Kabasa gang.

name: Mxosheni Shongwe
description: He had his house petrol-bombed by ANC supporters in Skhokho, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in November 1990, allegedly because his son was part of an a team investigating the death of a political activist.

name: Thandi Josephine Shongwe
description: An ANC operative who was detained on 7 November 1988 and kept in solitary confinement in Vosloorus, Tvl. Ms Shongwe was accused of harbouring terrorists and hiding illegal ammunition in her house.

name: Thembinkosi Shongwe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in KwaMbonambi, Kwa-Zulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 3 July 1993. He was actively involved in recruiting members for the IFP and therefore targeted by ANC supporters in the area.

name: Zini Shongwe
description: Was shot and killed by members of the Black Cats at her home in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal , in 1991. The attackers sought to kill Ms Shongwe’s son, but could not find him. One perpetrator, then a member of the Black Cats, who later defected to the ANC, was granted amnesty (AC/98/0121).

name: Absolom Boy Shozi
description: Was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Katlehong, Tvl, in July 1993. The SDU members believed he was an IFP leader involved in attacks on residents. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0348).

name: Alfred Shozi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Umkomaas, near Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 7 February 1992. His nephew was shot dead in the attack.

name: Bhekabakubo Samson Shozi
description: Was shot by ANC supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, and died from his wounds on 12 December 1990. The shoting occured during a serious internal feud within the local party branch.

name: Doris Nompumelelo Shozi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, burnt down by IFP supporters on 29 August 1992.

name: Grace Bongiwe Shozi
description: She had her house at Ezimeleni, Umlazi, Durban, set alight by unidentified persons in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Mandlenkosi David Shozi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 28 October 1993

name: Mathosi Busisiwe Shozi
description: A member of the IFP Youth Brigade who was shot and injured, allegedly by ANC members, at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Mbuzeni Shozi
description: An IFP supporter who had his house destroyed in a limpet-mine attack on the home of a well-known IFP leader in the Umbumbulu area, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 26 October 1991. The attack, which took place during a wedding ceremony, is thought to have been carried out by an ANC member. Six people were killed.

name: Qabukwayo Shozi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and fatally wounded at a bus stop in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 September 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Raymond Shozi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by members of the Amavaravara at KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 4 June 1993.

name: Sandile Shozi
description: Was stabbed and hacked to death by a named ANC supporter and others in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 27 September 1992, allegedly because he had distanced himself from ANC activities. His brother was severely injured in the attack.

name: Siboniso Shozi
description: Was severely stabbed and left for dead by a named ANC supporter and others in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 27 September 1992, allegedly because he had distanced himself from ANC activities. His brother was killed in the attack.

name: Bhozo Philisiwe Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in May 1993.

name: Msizi Sithole (Zungu)
description: Was severely injured when IFP supporters attacked his home in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 26 March 1992, and threw boiling water over him. This occurred during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: (First Name Not Given) Sithole
description: He suffered damage to his house and shacks when they were burnt by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Gamede Street, Tokoza, Tvl. He was believed to be an IFP member. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0243).

name: Buyisiwe Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Eshowe, Natal, in March 1993.

name: Dumisani Themba Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death in Empangeni, Natal, on 5 December 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. There had been a previous attempt on his life, and his mother was also harassed.

name: Ernest Michael Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Getrude Boneni Sibiya
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, petrol-bombed on 10 December 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Judith Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 16 August 1993.

name: Marriet Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down and her livestock stolen by IFP supporters in Entoweni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Marriet Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down and her livestock stolen by IFP supporters in Entoweni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mqondiseni Elias Sibiya
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by ANC supporters at Msunduzi river in Empangeni, Natal, on 12 September 1993.

name: Msizi Edward Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 27 March 1991.

name: Mthembeni Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in the eye by IFP supporters at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in 1992.

name: Musa Welcome Sibiya
description: He had his house burnt down in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in May 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Ndwendwe Azaria Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on 23 January 1993 in Wesselton, Ermelo, Tvl. On the day of the shooting, there was a burial of an IFP supporter killed by ANC supporters. Relatives believe Mr Sibiya was shot in retaliation.

name: Nkosinathi Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 April 1992.

name: Nokwenziwa Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombiyomthakathi Ennie Sibiya
description: An IFP supporter who had her house in KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in January 1991.

name: Ntombizodwa Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house at Umlazi, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in January 1992.

name: Petros Nqotho Sibiya
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in Sokhulu, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in November 1991 in continuing violence between ANC and IFP supporters. Mr Sibiya died the following day. Two ANC supporters were shot dead in the fighting.

name: Philisiwe Sibiya
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in November 1993. Twenty-one houses belonging to ANC supporters were burnt down in the attack.

name: Sigqanya Sibusiso Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 22 November 1991.

name: Simion John Sibiya
description: Was shot and hacked to death by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 11 April 1993.

name: Siwehle Sibiya
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mtsheketsheni, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 31 December 1993, allegedly because he was perceived to be an ANC supporter.

name: Sweleni Sibiya
description: Was burnt when her home was set alight by unidentified ANC supporters in Kwa-Mashu, Durban, in January 1991. Sweleni’s mother was accused of being an IFP supporter.

name: Thabitha Sibiya
description: She had her house burnt down in Ondondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 11 July 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thembisile Elentraute Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who had her house destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Malukazi, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, in 1991.

name: Velani Victor Sibiya
description: An ANC supporter who was forced to leave his home in Stanger, Natal, on 21 February 1992 after receiving death threaths from IFP supporters.

name: Magojoman David Sibozo
description: Vice chairperson of the local Civic organisation who had his house petrol-bombed while he and his family were asleep at Colesberg, Cape, on 21 July 1993, during conflict between the ANC and the Civic organisation, because of their different approaches to a rent campaign.

name: Ntshomela Sicanulo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named perpetrator in Flagstaff, Cape, on 13 December 1992. Before the shooting, an Imbizo had been organised by Chief Gcinilifu Mdutshane. It was subsequently called off by Regent-Chief Samuel Mdutshane and his supporters, who were against the AN/C in Xopozo Location, Flagstaff

name: Tabampe Daniel Sicha
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death in Tigane, Hartbeesfontein, Tvl, on 2 May 1993, allegedly by IFP supporters.

name: Nomazulu Enid Sidu
description: An ANC supporter who was arrested and assaulted while in detention on 15 February 1986 at Jouberton police station in the Transvaal. His arrest occurred during consumer and school boycotts and rent protests in the area.

name: Alinah Poppy Sithole
description: Was shot dead travelling in a taxi in Ncala Section in Katlehong, Tvl, on 27 February 1992 during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. Attacks on taxis became an ongoing characteristic of conflict on the East Rand since 1991.

name: Amos Behtemba Sithole
description: Was injured during an attack by armed ANC members on the house of a school principal in Phola township, Ogies, Tvl, on 13 October 1991. The principal was regarded as an IFP sympathiser because IFP supporters often visited him at home. One ANC member was granted amnesty (AC/2000/091).

name: Bakhuzi Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in March 1991.

name: Banda Wellington Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Bonginkosi Sithole
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Bongiwe Olga Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who was slapped and shot by unidentified people outside her home in Durban during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area on 11 February  1990, the day of Nelson Mandela’s release from prison.

name: Boyi Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 6 February 1991. He was returning to his home, which he had fled the previous day because of political conflict.

name: Duduzile Oscar Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters during March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Duduzile Oscar Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who had his house at Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters during March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Fikephi Sithole
description: Was shot when the vehicle she was travelling in was ambushed by ANC supporters at Richmond, Natal, during political conflict in the area in September 1991.

name: Francis Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in his ribs by named perpetrators in his store in Qunu, Umtata, Transkei, on 14 July 1978. On 5 August 1979 he was arrested and detained for three months and while he was in prison his shop was burnt down, allegedly because he opposed the homeland system and Transkei independence.

name: Francis Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was shot in his ribs by named perpetrators in his store in Qunu, Umtata, Transkei, on 14 July 1978. On 5 August 1979 he was arrested and detained for three months and while he was in prison his shop was burnt down, allegedly because he opposed the homeland system and Transkei independence.

name: Frank Sithole
description: A civilian travelling in a bread delivery truck, was shot at by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Rockville, Soweto, Johannes-burg, on 5 February 1993. Mr Mabuya and his three colleagues had disrupted an SDU attack on the police. The perpetrators fired at the vehicle, intending to scare them off. Three SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2000/119).

name: Gloria Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, petrol-bombed by IFP supporters on 15 May 1993. Monitors estimated that as many as 200 Bhambayi residents had died violently between May and July 1993.

name: Gloria Sithole
