description: An ANC supporter who had her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, petrol-bombed by IFP supporters on 15 May 1993. Monitors estimated that as many as 200 Bhambayi residents had died violently between May and July 1993.

name: Jabulani Sithole
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was injured during a confrontation between ANC and IFP supporters at Gengeshe, Richmond, Natal, on 26 September 1992, in which at least nine people were killed. Two ANC supporters were granted amnesty (AC/97/0063).

name: Johannes Mpiyonke Sithole
description: An  IFP supporter who was severely injured when he was stabbed and burnt by ANC supporters in KwaMawula, Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 1 March 1991

name: Joseph Boy Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted with knobkerries and sticks by IFP supporters in Katlehong, Tvl, in August 1993. Clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mostly ANC-supporting residents left thousands of people dead.

name: Lewis Sithole
description: A self-defence unit member who was injured in a drive-by shooting in Katlehong, Tvl, in September 1992 while patrolling the area. Conflict between ANC and IFP supporters was high with residents being attacked by alleged IFP and ISU members.

name: Mamo Alexina Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death on 4 December 1991 when IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers attacked ANC supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal. See Bruntville attacks.

name: Mandla Sithole
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Estcourt, Natal, on 26 October 1993, allegedly because he and a friend had refused to join a group of IFP supporters in burning down the homes of ANC supporters. Mr Sithole’s friend was also killed.

name: Mfaniseni Orbert Sithole
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mphani Andreas Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who had his home destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 22 April 1994, in political conflict five days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Mphani Andreas Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who had his home destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 22 April 1994, in political conflict five days before the April 1994 elections.

name: Mpostolo Petros Sithole
description: Was shot dead while travelling in his car to Eshowe, Natal, on 8 March 1992, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mthunzi Thabani Basil Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned to death by a named perpetrator at Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 15 September 1991 in ongoing political violence between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Five years earlier, in 1986, Mr Sithole was detained in Newcastle and Pietermaritzburgand severely assaulted. He was charged and convicted of involvement in the placing of bombs in businesses in the Newcastle area, and was imprisoned on Robben Island from November 1986 to 1991. He was killed four months after his release.

name: Mthunzi Thabani Basil Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was stoned to death by a named perpetrator at Osizweni, KwaZulu, near Newcastle, Natal, on 15 September 1991 in ongoing political violence between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Five years earlier, in 1986, Mr Sithole was detained in Newcastle and Pietermaritzburgand severely assaulted. He was charged and convicted of involvement in the placing of bombs in businesses in the Newcastle area, and was imprisoned on Robben Island from November 1986 to 1991. He was killed four months after his release.

name: Muntuza Sithole
description: An ANC member who was shot at during an assassination attempt on a prominent ANC member by IFP supporters at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 July 1992. Two perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Muriel Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in Richmond, Natal, during 1991, allegedly because she was suspected of colluding in the death of her neighbour, a fellow ANC supporter

name: Mvelase Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by ANC supporters in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 5 January 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mvelase Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by ANC supporters in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 5 January 1994 during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nataniel Sithole
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in 1990 in Tembisa, Tvl, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and mainly ANC-aligned residents.

name: Ndoda Mfaniseni Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in KwaHlaza, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ndoda Mfaniseni Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by ANC supporters in KwaHlaza, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 1 April 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nombuso Happiness Sithole
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 24 October 1992.

name: Paulos Mtusi Sithole
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 13 September 1993.

name: Saul Andrew Tsotetsi
description: An  ANC member who was killed when a hand grenade allegedly in his possession detonated in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 22 March 1992. Another person was killed in the incident.

name: Siphamandla Vilakazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe’s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. The attack was allegedly motivated by Molefe’s refusal to call up men in his a rea to defend the IFP. An IFP leader was implicated in the attack. Eleven ANC youths were killed and seven injured.

name: Maxwell Thabethe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe’s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. The attack was allegedly motivated by Molefe’s refusal to call up men in his area to defend the IFP. An IFP leader was implicated in the attack. Eleven ANC youths were killed and seven injured.

name: Siphamandla Vilakazi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe’s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. The attack was allegedly motivated by Molefe’s refusal to call up men in his area to defend the IFP. An IFP leader was implicated in the attack. Eleven ANC youths were killed and seven injured.

name: Mduduzi Dennis Thabethe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by named and other IFP supporters at his home in Umkomaas, near Durban, on 18 October 1992.

name: Abel Tsotsotso
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when police opened fire on a student protest march in Rammolotsi, Viljoenskroon, Orange Free State (OFS),  on 19 April 1990. Four other ANC supporters were killed and seven injured in the shooting.

name: Siphiwe Vilakazi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mzimela Absolom Thabethe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by unidentified people in a bus in Pietermaritzburg on 7 May 1992, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Fako Elias Tsotsotso
description: A local councillor who lost his home in Viljoenskroon, Orange Free State (OFS), in an arson attack by ANC supporters on 20 April 1990. Mr Tsotsotso was then forced to resign as councillor.

name: Solani Nokuthula Vilakazi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembizile Ntoyi Vilakazi
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Limakatso Maria Thube
description: Was severely burnt by ANC supporters in Koppies, OFS, on 6 November 1992, during political conflict in the area. Ms Thube and others were taken before a ‘people’s court’ and were tried and sentenced to death by burning. She managed to escape after being set alight, but died three days later. Two of the alleged perpetrators were charged, convicted and sentenced to death. Their sentences were later commuted to life imprisonment.

name: Raul Respeito Vilanculo
description: Was stabbed by IFP supporters in Mayfair, Johannesburg, on 26 August 1990. Tension between IFP and ANC supporters resulted in a number of attacks on civilians including attacks on trains, stations and taxi ranks.

name: Sihlangu Joffrey Vilane
description: Was shot and injured in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 14 April 1990 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters following the unbanning of political organisations in February.

name: Getrude Visagie
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Empangeni, Natal, was destroyed by IFP supporters on 29 March 1992. She had left her house to sleep in the hills after receiving death threats a month earlier. When she returned to her home, she found it destroyed.

name: Dumazi Themba Vundla
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Ntshidi, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 24 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Dumazi Themba Vundla
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Ntshidi, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 24 April 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembinkosi Bonganani Vundla
description: His house was burnt down in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembinkosi Bonganani Vundla
description: His house was burnt down in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in March 1994 in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Jeff Ngxeke Wabena
description: An ANC member who was shot dead while he was addressing a meeting at SK Mqhayi High School in Mdantsane, Ciskei, on 10 October 1990.

name: Glen Pearsall Weakley
description: Was shot dead with his brother when ANC self-defence unit (SDU) members opened fire on the vehicle in which they were travelling while on holiday near Port St Johns, Transkei, on 13 April 1993. Three other passengers survived the attack, which followed the assassination of political leader, Chris Hani. Four SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0249). See self defence units (SDU).

name: Joseph Wekeni
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed by a named IFP supporter in Chicken Farm, Diepkloof, Soweto, Johannesburg, because he stayed at home during an ANC stayaway during 1990. He died later in hospital.

name: Tandiwe Rina Wessels (Ponoana)
description: She survived the petrol bombing of her home by ANC supporters in April 1993, and again in June 1993, in ongoing political conflict in Richmond, Natal.

name: Tandiwe Rina Wessels (Ponoana)
description: She survived the petrol bombing of her home by ANC supporters in April 1993, and again in June 1993, in ongoing political conflict in Richmond, Natal.

name: Tandiwe Rina Wessels
description: She survived the petrol bombing of her home by ANC supporters in April 1993 and again in June 1993 in Richmond, Cape. Ms Wessels was targeted for attack as she had broken a consumer boycott in a period of heightened protest activity following the assassination of Chris Hani.

name: Tandiwe Rina Wessels
description: She survived the petrol bombing of her home by ANC supporters in April 1993 and again in June 1993 in Richmond, Cape. Ms Wessels was targeted for attack as she had broken a consumer boycott in a period of heightened protest activity following the assassination of Chris Hani.

name: Moorosi Samuel Tsotsotso
description: Was shot and injured when police opened fire on a student protest march in Viljoenskroon, Orange Free State (OFS), on 19 April 1990. Five ANC supporters were killed and six others injured in the shooting.

name: Sthembile Thabethe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by fellow IFP supporters who attacked her home in Esigodlweni, Estcourt, Natal, on 28 October 1990. The attackers were allegedly looking for her brothers, whom they believed to be ANC supporters. Ms Thabethe’s mother was also shot and injured in the attack.

name: Thabisile Thabethe
description: Was stabbed and severely injured on 30 October 1993, when her employer’s house, in an IFP stronghold in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, was attacked by ANC supporters who accused them of storing IFP weapons. Her employer was killed in the attack, and two other people were stabbed and severely injured.

name: Vusi Dick Thabethe
description: An ANC supporter who had his home in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, destroyed by IFP supporters on 26 July 1992. See Folweni massacre.

name: Moramang David Thaisi
description: A councilor and a member of the Dikwankwetla National Party (DNP) who was seriously injured when he was stabbed, beaten and burnt by ANC supporters in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, on 29 January 1990. DNP members were frequently attacked at this time, allegedly because of the party’s support for the QwaQwa homeland government.

name: Tello Maria Thaisi
description: A supporter of the Dikwankwetla National Party (DNP) who lost her home in an arson attack and was burnt when petrol  was thrown at her and she was set alight by ANC supporters in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, on 29 January 1990. DNP members were frequently attacked at this time, allegedly because of the party’s support for the QwaQwa homeland government.

name: Monti Sabath Thakanyane
description: He lost his house, bus and car when they were burnt by named ANC supporters in Schweizer-Reneke, Tvl, in February 1990.

name: Jappie Thaledi
description: An ANC civic leader who was shot and injured by IFP members during political conflict at Bushbuckridge, Lebowa, Northern Transvaal, in April 1993. Two perpetrators were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Lesole David Thamae
description: A SANCO member who lost his home in Meqheleng, Ficksburg, Orange Free State (OFS) on 3 August 1993 in an arson attack by ANC supporters. There was tension and conflict between the ANC and SANCO in the Ficksburg area at the time.

name: Moshoni Piet Thangavhuleleo
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by named perpetrators in Louis Trichardt, Transvaal, on 5 February 1990.

name: Dumisani Viviene Thango
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Ladysmith, Natal, on 13 November 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Mthokozisi James Thethwayo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured when IFP supporters opened fire on people at a taxi rank in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 8 December 1991, allegedly in an attempt to drive ANC supporters from the area. Mr Thethwayo lost the sight in one eye as a result of the shooting.

name: Elsie Mantai (Aka ‘Elsie Mokoena’) Thibeli
description: Was one of two women killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Sebokeng, Transvaal , on 15 August 1993. The two women were believed to have been IFP collaborators. Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0346).

name: Zacharia Oshupile Thipe
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by ANC members for breaking a stayaway call in Tikwana, Hoopstad, OFS, on 4 July 1992.

name: Muntuza Sgadlane Thithiza
description: Was shot and killed by an IFP member during political conflict at Izingolweni, Port Shepsone, Natal, on 19 May 1991. An amnesty applicant testified that he killed Mr Thithiza because he believed him to be an ANC supporter. He was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0339).

name: Thenjiwe Patricia Valela
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992. See Chimora Settlement attacks.

name: Lentsoe Raymond Tsehloane
description: An ANC supporter who was severely assaulted and injured by members of the Transkei Defence Force in Pontseng, Matatiele, Natal, on 8 February 1990. They suspected him of involvement in an arson attack in the Transkei.

name: Mzuvukile Thoba
description: Was shot and injured at a night vigil in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 26 March 1991, allegedly by named IFP supporters. Fifteen people died in the attack which took place during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Nan Tsubalala (First Name Not Given)
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead when a known councillor opened fire on a group of ANC supporters protesting against the local council in Rouxville, Orange Free State (OFS), on 9 September 1990. One other person was shot dead in the incident.

name: Witness Tshemese
description: A businessman who was shot and injured by alleged ANC members during the burning of his shop at Khayelitsha, Cape Town, in February 1991, during political conflict.

name: Tondo Tshezi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house burnt down and livestock stolen by IFP supporters in Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, in 1990 in intense political conflict following the unbanning of political organisations in February that year.

name: Bangilize Tshibe
description: An ANC supporter who died after being stabbed by named IFP supporters at the Zamani informal settlement, Umlazi, Durban, in February 1992. Zamani, an ANC stronghold, was under frequent attack by IFP supporters in this period.

name: Daniel Ramankwane Tshieame
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 10 September 1990.

name: Lungelo Ayliff Tshikila
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead during pre-election violence in Mount Frere, Transkei, on 20 April 1994.

name: Mmbangiseni Tshitangano
description: Was detained and held in solitary confinement in Tshalu police station in August 1987 and at the Venda Central prison in Thohoyandou, Venda, in August 1988. Mr Tshitangano was detained for allegedly recruiting people for training under the auspices of the ANC.

name: Mmbangiseni Tshitangano
description: Was detained and held in solitary confinement in Tshalu police station in August 1987 and at the Venda Central prison in Thohoyandou, Venda, in August 1988. Mr Tshitangano was detained for allegedly recruiting people for training under the auspices of the ANC.

name: Mkhize Tsho
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Emdeni, Soweto, Transvaal, on 5 April 1991 during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. Four other people were killed in the attack.

name: Zondi Tsho
description: Was shot dead by named by IFP perpetrators in Emdeni, Soweto, Transvaal, on 5 April 1991 during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. Four other people were killed in the attack.

name: James Tshoko
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters while standing by the side of a road in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 15 May 1992. At the time, there were repeated attacks by unidentified gunmen firing randomly at people in Sebokeng.

name: Meriam Nomase Tshoko
description: An ANC supporter who was aducted by members of the IFP-aligned ‘Khetisa Kheswa’ gang in Sebokeng, Transvaal , in March 1993. Ms Tshoko has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Mncedisi Coulbert Tsholeka
description: Was detained on 8 January 1981 for three months in Butterworth, Transkei, on suspicion of being an ANC member. Mr Tsholeka was replaced in his job immediately upon his detention, and was never reinstated.

name: Abigail Mbimbi Tshuku
description: Was shot dead with her mother and three siblings during a midnight arson and gunfire attack by unidentifed men on their home in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 15 August 1991. Her father was the chairperson of the local ANC branch.

name: Mncedisi Tshuku
description: Was burnt to death with his mother and three siblings during a midnight arson and gunfire attack by unidentified men on their home in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 15 August 1991. His father was the chairperson of the local ANC branch.

name: Nomanqulo Tshuku
description: Was burnt to death with her mother and three siblings during a midnight arson and gunfire attack by unidentified men on their home in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 15 August 1991. Her father was the chairperson of the local ANC branch.

name: Nophumzile Tshuku
description: An ANC member who was burnt to death with her four children during a midnight arson and gunfire attack by unidentifed men on their home in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 15 August 1991. Her husband was the chairperson of the local ANC branch.

name: Solomon Tshuku
description: Chairperson of a local ANC branch who lost his wife and four children in a midnight arson and gunfire attack by unidentifed men on their home in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 15 August 1991. His home was destroyed in the attack.

name: Majola Tshutsha
description: An ANC member who was executed in Pretoria Central prison, Pretoria, on 6 July 1962 for his part in the murder of alleged informer Chief Stanford Mzizi during the 1960 Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Jongumzi Anderson Tshwili
description: Was shot dead by a group of men in balaclavas, including one in a Special Constable uniform, in Site B, Khayelitsha, Cape Town, on 2 August 1992. He was patrolling with a community defence unit, established to deter attacks by balaclava groups on the community and ANC members. Three others were injured in the attack.

name: Ntombizodwa Beauty Tsibani
description: An ANC member who was assaulted with sjamboks while she was attending a meeting at Mngqesha Primary School in Dikidikana, near King William’s Town, Cape, on 6 September 1992.

name: Moses Oupa Tsoaeli
description: An ANC supporter who died after being shot in the head in Evaton, Transvaal, on 27 June 1993 by the Terror Gang vigilante group.

name: Zacharia Tsobane
description: Was shot dead by IFP-supporting Simphiwe hostel-dwellers in Dobsonville, Soweto, Transvaal, on 13 March 1992 during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers. Two people died and two others were injured in the attack.

name: Armstrong Thathi Tsoke
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Vosloorus, Transvaal, in 1990 at a roadblock organised by local youth during political conflict in the area.

name: Thomas Mahlomola Tsokolibane
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten and injured by IFP supporters in Tsakane, Brakpan, Transvaal, on 5 May 1986 during the funeral of ANC supporters.

name: Ingrid Mmaditau Tsoku
description: She lost her house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 17 January 1993 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Patrick Tsolo
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten to death by hostel- dwellers in Soweto, on 2 November 1976 in the aftermath of the Soweto uprising. The state used hostel-dwellers to break up a stayaway called to protest against continued police violence against students.

name: Abel Tsotetsi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 12 June 1992 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Anna Mamokete Tsotetsi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 30 December 1992 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Morero Tsekela
description: Was attacked and killed by IFP supporters in Mzimhlophe, Soweto, Tvl, on 27 April 1991 during conflict between mainly ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Ntsoaki Rosy Vanstaden
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in Emdeni South, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 6 April 1991 after attending a nearby IFP rally. Soweto was tense during this time following violent clashes between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Mbuyiselo Vanto
description: An ANC member who was shot and injured by named perpetrators associated with a local Crossroads leader on 4 July 1991 in Crossroads, Cape Town. He lost his home in an arson attack on 12 April 1993 during attempts by the same local Crossroads leader to remove Section 2 residents by force.

name: Mbuyiselo Vanto
description: An ANC member who was shot and injured by named perpetrators associated with a local Crossroads leader on 4 July 1991 in Crossroads, Cape Town. He lost his home in an arson attack on 12 April 1993 during attempts by the same local Crossroads leader to remove Section 2 residents by force.

name: Fezile Tiyo
description: An ANC supporter who was detained at his home in Mbekweni, Paarl, Cape, on 12 June 1986 and held for at least 18 months under emergency regulations in Victor Verster prison, Paarl. During his detention he was tortured and held for periods in solitary confinement. See police brutality.

name: Thabitha Ramatsobane Tselana
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten with knobkerries by a named perpetrator in Ga-Chipana village near Pietersburg, Tvl, in February 1980.

name: Vusi Richard Thobela
description: An ANC member who was beaten and kept in solitary confinement by police for more than three months from 28 March 1993 at the Hazyview police station in Transvaal . Mr Thobela was arrested while bringing in weapons and ammunition from Mozambique to distribute to East Rand self-defence units (SDU), and he was sentenced to 15 years’ imprisonment.

name: Lulamile Eric Vara
description: An ANC member who was arrested on 13 February 1963 in Cape Town and sentenced to three years’ imprisonment on Robben Island, where he was severely beaten by prison warders and became mentally disturbed. He was served with a banning order upon his release, but he died in hospital three months later.

name: Bhekokwahle Elijah Tsele
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Tvl, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Nombuyiselo Tabalaza
description: An ANC supporter who had her house and shop in Matatiele, Natal, burnt down on 30 April 1990 by a group of men carrying traditional weapons and allegedly looking for ANC supporters. Nine homes were burnt in the area that day, in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters following the unbanning of politial organisations in February. ANC supporters were being killed in an attempt to prevent the setting up of local ANC branches in the area.

name: Minah Thoko
description: Was injured when her home, which belonged to an ANC supporter, was petrol-bombed by named perpetrators in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 June 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Lerotholi Ben Thokoana
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Sharpeville, Vereeniging, Tvl, on 21 February 1992 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Glen Thompson
description: Was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) who were fleeing from a roadblock in Dawn Park, Germiston, Tvl, on 29 October 1992. Another civilian was injured in the incident. Two SDU members were granted amnesty for the incident (AC/2001/197 and AC/2000/0139).

name: Leon Thompson
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217).

name: Nomvula Clara Thopi
description: She had her house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack on 12 June 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ndumiso Timoti Thosholo
description: Was shot in the head and permanently disabled while watching television in a house in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 10 December 1989. There were numerous deaths and injuries that month after members of the pro-government Crossroads committee broke away to support the ANC.

name: Malente Emmerantia Tsotetsi
description: Was shot and severely injured by a named IFP supporter in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 13 November 1993, as she was re turning from the funeral of an ANC-aligned chief’s children. She had to flee from Nqutu hospital to Dundee hospital to escape a second attack by the perpetrators.

name: Eric Moejalifa Thuhlo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured by a named community councillor in De Aar, Cape, on 27 October 1991.

name: Thuleleni Thule
description: An IFP supporter who had her house burnt down by ANC supporters in Emabheceni, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 25 August 1991, allegedly in an attempt to force the family to leave the area.

name: Abraham Lourens Daniel Van Jaarsveld
description: A prison warder who was seriously injured when a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) detonated a hand grenade while trying to escape from Leeuwhof prison, Vereeniging, Transvaal, on 18 December 1993. Three people died and nine were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/2000/145). See ANC self-defence units (SDU).

name: Norah Mpho Thulo
description: Was shot in the hand and thigh in Sebokeng, Tvl, on 10 May 1992 during conflict between ANC-supporting residents and IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers.

name: Babazi Bhekuyise Thungo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Johannesburg, on 6 April 1992 due to his trade union activities.

name: Mhoyi Amon Thusana
description: An ANC supporter who had his home burnt down by a representative of the Lebowa government in Casteel, Tzaneen, Transvaal , in June 1986. Mr Thusana’s name was on a list of people accused of witchcraft.

name: Kehla Thusi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by fellow ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 15 July 1993 in the course of a serious internal feud.

name: Mkeyi Alpheus Thusi
description: Disappeared while travelling from Greytown to visit family in KwaMashu, Durban, during political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in November 1990. He has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Soni Thusi
description: Was shot dead by an IFP supporter in Estcourt, Natal, on 26 October 1993. Mr Thusi had been invited to help the IFP supporters burn houses belonging to ANC supporters.

name: Thembuyise Thusi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 15 July 1993.

name: John Simphiwe Thusini
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards opened fire from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around 100 injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Thokozile Jessie Thutshini
description: An ANC supporter who survived an armed attack on her home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 1 January 1993, during ongoing political conflict between the ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions.

name: Anna Lesia Thwala
description: She lost her house in a petrol bomb attack by ANC supporters in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Tvl, on 24 July 1992 during conflict between rival unions. A labour dispute between striking COSATU-aligned FAWU workers and non-striking IFP-aligned UWUSA workers caused violent conflict in this township from July to December 1992.

name: Anna Lesia Thwala
description: She lost her house in a petrol bomb attack by ANC supporters in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Tvl, on 24 July 1992 during conflict between rival unions. A labour dispute between striking COSATU-aligned FAWU workers and non-striking IFP-aligned UWUSA workers caused violent conflict in this township from July to December 1992.

name: Daphney Nozipho Thwala
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mhlupheki Thwala
description: Was beaten, hacked with axes, shot and his body was set alight by alleged ANC supporters in Nelspruit, Tvl, on 2 March 1985 because he was accused of stealing cattle during political conflict.

name: Mxolisi Thwala
description: A suspected IFP member who was shot and killed by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Tvl, in 1993. Mr Thwala was allegedly given the option of joining the SDU or killing his own father, an IFP member. He refused the latter and was then shot dead. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0348).

name: Zintle Thwala
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten by named perpetrators in Matatiele, Transkei, on 30 March 1990. A group of men associated with the traditional authorities and opposed to the launch of an ANC branch attacked numerous homes and persons associated with the ANC.

name: Ahmed Essop Timol
description: A member of the ANC and SACP who died in a staged suicide after he had been detained and tortured by members of the Special Branch at John Vorster Square, Johannesburg, during October 1971.

name: Siyabonga Gideon Tini
description: An IFP supporter who was declared dead on arrival at Baragwanath hospital, Soweto, Johannesburg, after he was shot by ANC supporters at Westgate in Johannesburg, on 21 November 1991.

name: Thamsanqa Bartholomeu Titoti
description: He lost his home in Rweleleyathunya, Rouxville, OFS, on 23 September 1990, in an arson attack by ANC supporters, allegedly because he supported the school principal during a student boycott. Mr Titoti’s wife, Ms Vuyelwa Magawu, was killed in the same attack.

name: Thanduxolo Vatiwe
description: Her home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Natal, was burnt down during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area in 1993.

name: Tyrone Garfield Vengadasamy
description: An ANC supporter who was found dead in Lenasia, Johannesburg on 11 July 1992 after he been missing for a few days. He had been planning a consumer boycott.

name: Khulekalwe Smallman Vezi
description: An ANC supporter whose house at Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban was burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Sholiphi Rosta Vezi
description: Her house and shop at Eshowe, Natal, were destroyed in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in 1993.

name: Sibusiso Agrippa Vezi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stoned to death in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 December 1993 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: (First Name Not Given) Vilakazi
description: An IFP member who suffered an attempt on his life and damage to his motor vehicle when he was attacked by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Transvaal. SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0243). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: (First Name Not Given) Vilakazi
description: An IFP member who suffered an attempt on his life and damage to his motor vehicle, when he was attacked by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Tokoza, Transvaal. SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/1999/0243). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Bongani Vilakazi
description: Was stabbed to death at Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 20 November 1991, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His family home was attacked repeatedly between 1990 and 1991.

name: Bonginkosi Isaac Vilakazi
description: An IFP supporter who was killed by IFP supporters on 20 June 1993 following the launch of an ANC branch at Woodford Stadium, near Bergville, Natal. Mr Vilakazi had allegedly attended the launch meeting. See Bergville attack.

name: Dali Merika Vilakazi
description: She had her house set alight in 1991 by a gang calling itself the ‘Amakati’ in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Dudu Elsie Vilakazi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters at Kwadimayimane, near Pietermaritzburg, in May 1993.

name: J Van Wyk
description: A prison warder who was seriously injured when a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) detonated a hand grenade while trying to escape from Leeuwhof prison, Vereeniging, Transvaal, on 18 December 1993. Three people died and nine were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/2000/145). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Mandlenkosi Matheus Vilakazi
description: An ANC supporter who was seriously assaulted by IFP supporters in Nondweni, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 23 February 1994. He and other ANC youths were trying to flee the township ahead of a planned IFP rally when they were attacked. After being rescued by two Vryheid policemen, Mandlenkosi spent a month in hospital.

name: Matsheni Julius Vilakazi
description: An IFP supporter whose house in Dumbe, Paulpietersburg, Natal, was burnt down by ANC supporters on 17 February 1994, allegedly in retaliation for an assault by IFP supporters on the local ANC leader the previous day.

name: Ngicuphile Vilakazi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomini Mary Vilakazi
description: Was forced to lie down on the ground and was sjambokked seventeen times by a named ANC supporter and others in Nelspruit, Transvaal, during June 1986. Ms Vilakazi was beaten in the presence of her daughter because she refused to attend a meeting about a consumer boycott in the area.

name: Mahlomola Isaac Tlale
description: An ANC supporter who was detained and beaten in Alexandra, Johannesburg, in September 1963.

name: Charles Ngoti Tlou
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe’s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. The attack was allegedly motivated by Molefe’s refusal to call up men in his area to defend the IFP. An IFP leader was implicated in the attack. Eleven ANC youths were killed and seven injured.

name: Fani Tlou
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters at a night vigil in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 26 March 1991. Alexandra was tense following clashes between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Hilda Tlou
description: Was shot and injured by named IFP supporters at a night vigil in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 26 March 1991. Fifteen people died in the attack after clashes between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Rose Tlou
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, at a night vigil on 26 March 1991 following conflict between IFP-aligned hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Victoria Tofile
description: Was shot and injured in Tokoza, Tvl, on 22 May 1993 by a group of armed attackers, allegedly IFP supporters, who came to her shop and randomly opened fire, killing her brother and seriously injuring her young cousin. Earlier that day nine people were killed and 69 injured in clashes between ANC and IFP supporters and police. Violence erupted after a group of unidentified gunmen fired at Tokoza hostel during an ANC march to present a petition at the Alberton police station.

name: Cornelius Tomotomo
description: Was shot by IFP supporters in Pimville, Soweto, Tvl, on 17 August 1990. Mr Tomotomo was killed after clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Dlayizeka Tonga
description: An ANC member who was stabbed to death on 8 March 1994 in Flagstaff, Transkei, by men who had come from the Great Place of Xopozo. At the time, there was conflict between the chief’s supporters and ANC supporters.

name: Fexie Siphiwo Toto
description: An ANC supporter who disappeared from Grahamstown, Cape, in March 1989. At the time he was awaiting trial on charges of having burnt a body in Steynsburg, Cape. He has not been seen since.

name: Clifford Tototo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured, allegedly by IFP supporters, at his home in Zuma Section, Katlehong, Tvl, on 13 June 1993. His neighbour, an IFP supporter, had been shot earlier and police were removing property from her house when Mr Tototo was shot.

name: Nompumelelo Totwana
description: She had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in fighting between ANC and IFP supporters, the latter allegedly supported by members of the ISU, in June 1993. See Red and Green factions.

name: Nombeko Amelia Toyana
description: A SANCO member who was tied to her bed and beaten in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, in 1992, by men wearing balaclavas. See balaclava groups.

name: Zukiswa Toyana
description: Was severely beaten by men wearing balaclavas in Khayelitsha, Cape Town, in 1992, allegedly because her mother was a SANCO member. See balaclava groups.

name: Lucky Tabu
description: A policeman, one of two who shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in a tavern in Daveyton, Tvl, on 1 August 1993. Two SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2000/227).

name: Mary Turok
description: An SACP member in Johannesburg who served a six month prison sentence in 1963 for putting up banned ANC posters. She was then served with a banning order for five years. Her husband also served a jail term. They experienced ongoing police harassment and intimidation and were forced to leave the country.

name: Jakobus Lukas Van Der Merwe
description: A traffic officer who was shot dead by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Alberton, Transvaal, on 27 March 1992. Two of his colleagues were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0225). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Mbeshe Ephriam Tushini
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by named IFP supporters and later killed in Port Shepstone, Natal, in August 1991.

name: Dumisani Tusi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed while fleeing Clermont, near Durban, allegedly because of internal divisions within the ANC in 1992.

name: Alfred Tshabalala
description: An IFP supporter who was strangled to death, allegedly by ANC-aligned self-defence unit members in Katlehong, Tvl, on 23 July 1992.

name: Boy Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and beaten when his house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 10 June 1993 in ongoing political conflict between the ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions.

name: Christina Nomvula Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by members of the Esikhawini hit squad on 22 April 1994. The family home had also been burnt down by unidentified perpetrators a month earlier.

name: Faith Funeka Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who had her home badly damaged in two petrol bomb attacks, allegedly carried out by IFP supporters, in Tokoza, Transvaal, in June 1993 and on 3 July 1993. Ms Tshbalala alleges she was attacked because she refused to contribute money demanded by hostel-dwellers.

name: Faith Funeka Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who had her home badly damaged in two petrol bomb attacks, allegedly carried out by IFP supporters, in Tokoza, Transvaal, in June 1993 and on 3 July 1993. Ms Tshbalala alleges she was attacked because she refused to contribute money demanded by hostel-dwellers.

name: Frank Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death when his house was petrol-bombed, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 24 May 1993. Three other members of Mr Tshabalala’s family were killed in this attack.

name: Jabulani William Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 3 May 1992 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: James Tshabalala
description: Was injured in an explosion in Daveyton, Transvaal, on 17 September 1991 when the shack he was in was attacked with a hand grenade during ongoing violence in the township between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Jonas Khehla Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 27 June 1992.

name: Kulunyana David Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was tortured and held in solitary confinement for three weeks in Villiers police station, Orange Free State (OFS) in March 1988.

name: Mcedisi Tshabalala
description: Was shot in the chest and killed by IFP supporters in Tokoza, Tvl, in 1991 during ongoing clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Mpumi Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death when her home was petrol-bombed, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 24 May 1993. Three other members of Ms Tshabalala’s family were killed in this attack.

name: Nhlanhla Maria Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death when her home was petrol-bombed, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 24 May 1993. Three other members of Ms Tshabalala’s family were killed in this attack.

name: Nomsa Constance Tshabalala
description: She had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in 1993.

name: Percy Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 27 October 1992.

name: Rachel Moroesi Tshabalala
description: She had her house burnt down in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 25 June 1992 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters after the Boipatong massacre.

name: Samkele Tshabalala
description: He had his home burnt down by IFP supporters in Tokoza, Transvaal, in 1991. His uncle was killed during the same attack. Violence engulfed the area following numerous clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC- supporting residents.

name: Samuel Tshabalala
description: Was shot and injured by unidentified perpetrators on 19 January 1993 in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Transvaal, during clashes between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Ratanda was tense following clashes at a local factory between IFP-aligned UWUSA members and COSATU-affiliated FAWU members over strike action.

name: Sarah Tshabalala
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death when her home was petrol-bombed, allegedly by IFP supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, on 24 May 1993. Three other members of Ms Tshabalala’s family were killed in this attack.

name: Alpheus Samuel Tshangweni
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks.

name: Makutuza Shalestica Tshazi
description: An ANC supporter who had her home burnt down by IFP supporters in Chimora, Umlazi, Durban, on 16 January 1992. See Chimora Settlement attacks

name: Bekisisa Robert Tutshini
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, Port Sheptsone, Natal, on 21 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bekisisa Robert Tutshini
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Mvutshini, Port Sheptsone, Natal, on 21 March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Titus Tantij
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by hostel residents, while taking part in a consumer boycott march in Tokoza, Tvl, on 21 May 1993.

name: Genla Maria Tanzi
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Lucia Taylor
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted and her home was destroyed when IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers attacked ANC supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, in December 1991. See Bruntville attacks.

name: James Mzwandile Tchulu
description: An ANC supporter who was injured in a bomb explosion in the Mangaung Provincial Administration Building in Bloemfontein on 1 February 1983. The bomb had been planted by an ANC sabotage group.

name: Phanuel Tekana
description: A civilian travelling in a bread delivery truck who was shot at by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Rockville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 5 February 1993. Mr Mabuya and his three colleagues disrupted an SDU attack on the police. The perpetrators fired at the vehicle, intending to scare them off. Three SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2000/119).

name: Mafene Ndlazi Tembe
description: He had his house at Empangeni, Natal, burnt down by unidentified perpertrators on 26 July 1993 during clashes between the IFP and ANC members in the area.

name: Thandazile Tembe
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters, some of whom are named, in Empangeni, Natal, on 4 August 1992 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Thulebona Fortune Tenza
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed, axed and shot dead by unidentified people at a taxi rank in Pietermaritzburg on 3 February 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Three other people were also killed and one was injured.

name: Zacharias Taka Thabane
description: Was stabbed to death by IFP supporters who attacked mourners at a night vigil in Klipspruit, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 18 August 1990 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Two others were killed in the same attack.

name: Bongani Petros Thabethe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 9 September 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Bongekile Qondeni Thabethe
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and severely injured by fellow IFP supporters who attacked her home in Esigodlweni, Estcourt, Natal, on 28 October 1990. The attackers were allegedly looking for her sons, whom they believed to be ANC supporters. Ms Thabethe’s daughter was also shot and injured in the attack.

name: Limakatso Elizabeth Tutubala
description: Was shot and injured in Thabong, Welkom, Orange Free State (OFS), on 16 June 1985, when she was caught in crossfire during a clash between ANC members and the A-Team at a commemoration of 16 June. See A-Team (OFS)

name: Johannes Petrus Van Niekerk
description: Was stabbed and burnt to death by named ANC supporters in Odendaalsrus, Orange Free State (OFS), on 29 September 1990. Four ANC supporters were refused amnesty for the attack (AC/97/0007, AC/97/0027). See Kutloanong mob attack.

name: Jan Louis Van Rensburg
description: His home was burnt down by ANC supporters in Witrivier, Transvaal, on 14 March 1986.

name: Edgar Van Wyk
description: An ANC supporter who was tortured in Krugersdorp, Transvaal, on 10 December 1993 by members of the AWB looking for his son who had promised to supply them with AK47s.

name: Jeremiah Shadrack Van Wyk
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by an unidentified person in Botshabelo, near Bloemfontein, on 2 March 1990, while he was going from house to house collecting Dikwankwetla National Party (DNP) members’ identity documents for burning.

name: Johannes Bongizembe Van Wyk
description: Was arrested in Zambia by ANC security in 1988 shortly after going into exile. He was severely beaten and tortured. After eight months, he was transferred to a camp in Angola. During his incarceration, he was allegedly shot and injured. He subsequently appeared before a tribunal in Tanzania where he was cleared of charges that he was a spy.

name: Elizabeth Genekelo Twala
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 29 September 1993 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Mthimkulu Twala
description: A civilian travelling in a bread delivery truck who was shot at by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Rockville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 5 February 1993. Mr Mabuya and his three colleagues had disrupted an SDU attack on the police. The perpetrators fired at the vehicle intending to scare them off. Three SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/2000/119). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Mr (First Name Not Given) Twetha
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991. Two IFP supporters were granted amnesty. See Richmond attacks.

name: Mtobise Lilian Twetha
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, in March 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Her son was killed by IFP supporters three months later.

name: Esther Ntombehle Tyobeka-Nyembe
description: Was shot and injured while travelling in a taxi at Merafe Station in Soweto, Transvaal, on 13 October 1991 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Puleng Lina Wildebees
description: A member of the Eagles who was severely beaten when ANC supporters attacked her and five other ‘Eagles Club’ members in Qhoweng, Reddersburg, OFS, in 1989, allegedly because of their involvement with the club.

name: Lucky Raphael Zungu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by named IFP supporters in Nokweja, Ixopo, Natal, in July 1993. His mother’s home was burnt down and his brother was shot and injured in the attack.

name: Busisiwe Sylvina Zondi
description: Her house at KwaBhidla, near Bulwer, Natal, was burnt down in May 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Shadrack Jongikaya Witbooi
description: Was shot dead by members of the Balaclava group allegedly linked to the Lingelethu West Town Council on 16 December 1991 in Khayelitsha, Cape Town. The attack was aimed at a local ANC Women’s League activist and left three people dead, three wounded and 40 houses burnt.

name: Pauline Elizabeth Wood
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in June 1993.

name: Solomon Wotose Wulana
description: An ANC member in Port Elizabeth who was sentenced to seven years’ imprisonment on Robben Island in 1964, for belonging to a banned organisation. He was severely ill-treated and his health was affected.

name: Absalom Bhekuyise Xaba
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in the Matshana area, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1991.

name: Alice Zodwa Xaba
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in June 1993 in political conflict between the ‘Red’ and  ‘Green’  factions. When Ms Xaba’s husband returned to the house after fleeing the area with his family, he was shot and killed. Monitors estimated that as many as 200 Bhambayi residents had died violently between May and July 1993.

name: Alice Zodwa Xaba
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down in June 1993 in political conflict between the ‘Red’ and  ‘Green’  factions. When Ms Xaba’s husband returned to the house after fleeing the area with his family, he was shot and killed. Monitors estimated that as many as 200 Bhambayi residents had died violently between May and July 1993.

name: Bongiwe Lillian Xaba
description: An IFP supporter who was fatally injured when ANC supporters threw a hand grenade into her home at Loskop, near Estcourt, Natal, on 25 October 1993. Monitors recorded twenty seven deaths and five injuries in Estcourt that month.

name: Buyo Xaba
description: Was shot dead in KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 3 April 1992 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. He was one of six youths killed in the shooting.

name: Dumisani Norman Xaba
description: An ANC supporter who left home in Katlehong, Transvaal, in 1993 to go to work but never returned. Mr Xaba disappeared during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Elloff Xaba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters in Empangeni, Natal, on 2 May 1993.

name: Fana Sifiso Xaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in Trust Feeds, New Hanover, Natal, on 17 April 1992.

name: Khehla Xaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at a bus terminus in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 5 March 1993.

name: Lawrence Xaba
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 4 April 1992 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Mchozo Nathaniel Xaba
description: An IFP supporter whose house and possessions were destroyed by ANC supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in April 1994. This attack was part of an ANC attempt to drive all IFP supporters out of the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mchozo Nathaniel Xaba
description: An IFP supporter whose house and possessions were destroyed by ANC supporters in Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, in April 1994. This attack was part of an ANC attempt to drive all IFP supporters out of the area during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mswaca Ndlelevuthiwe Xaba
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Muzi Watson Xaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, in August 1992. Two of Mr Xaba’s brothers had also been killed in political conflict in Imbali during the previous five years.

name: Mzikayifani Austen Xaba
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Noluthando Xaba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993, allegedly in a revenge attack.

name: Shampiyoni Josiah Xaba
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, in April 1991.

name: Thandeka Xaba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993.

name: Thembani Xaba
description: An ANC supporter whose house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Durban in February 1991.

name: Thembelani Xaba
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993.

name: Thokozile Jenipher Xaba
description: Her home was burnt down by unidentified perpetrators at Mbozama, Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in December 1993. She was politically non-partisan.

name: Mangalisiwe Simangele Zungu
description: Her home in Empangeni, Natal, was lost in an arson attack on 3 June 1993. Her husband was shot dead on the same day, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Shabane Zibokwakhe Zulu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 15 August 1992.

name: Aweni Yaphi
description: An ANC supporter who lost his house when it was burnt down in Crossroads, Cape Town, on 10 January 1994, during ongoing conflict between residents and a named local Crossroads leader.

name: Mbongeni Absalom Zungu
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Shadrack Lindela Zulu
description: Was interrogated, assaulted and stabbed to death by four members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Nokweja, Ixopo, Natal, on 15 July 1993. Mr Zulu had been an ANC supporter but was suspected of joining the IFP. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/0105) See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Thulani Abraham Xaba
description: An ANC member who was shot and killed by an IFP member during political conflict at KwaChappies, Mandini, Natal, on 7 October 1993. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Mfanomncane Zungu
description: Was shot dead on 21 January 1993 in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Datshi Washington Zondi
description: An IFP supporter whose house in Ixopo, Natal, was looted and set alight by ANC supporters on 16 June 1993.

name: Sizani Idah Zondo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Signoria Thembani Zulu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured, allegedly by ANC supporters, in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Sinenhlanhla Zulu
description: His house at Empangeni, Natal, was partially burnt down and his belongings stolen in an attack by ANC supporters on 11 February 1992 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Sipho David Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death in Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 6 September 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sipo Isaac Zulu
description: His house at Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, was set alight and shot at on 24 April 1990. The intense conflict between the ANC and IFP in the area at that time resulted in thousands of people being displaced.

name: Thabane Richard Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured when members of the Orde Boerevolk opened fire with automatic weapons on a passenger bus in Durban on 9 October 1990. Seven people were killed and twenty seven were injured in the attack. Amnesty was granted to two of the three applicants and refused to the leader of the unit (AC/1997/0053). See Putco bus attack.

name: Thandi Henrietah Zulu
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Ekuthuleni, Umlazi, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Thembelihle Zulu
description: Was raped in Empangeni, Natal, in August 1992 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Thembeni Faith Zulu
description: Her house in Eshowe, Natal, was burnt down and her possessions destroyed during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembeni Faith Zulu
description: Her house in Eshowe, Natal, was burnt down and her possessions destroyed during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in March 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembi Zulu
description: Her home in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, was burnt down in October 1993 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Thembinkosi Bafana Zulu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks. See self defence units (SDU).

name: Thulani Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death next to Denver hostel, Johannesburg, on 1 April 1994 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Thulani Manfred Zulu
description: His house in Eshowe, Natal, was lost in an arson attack on 23 March 1994 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thulani Manfred Zulu
description: His house in Eshowe, Natal, was lost in an arson attack on 23 March 1994 during political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Vusumuzi Petros Zulu
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 10 August 1992 in continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Yanizana Bethah Zulu
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Empangeni, Natal was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters on 13 April 1992.

name: Zantombazana Beslina Zulu
description: Her home in Hopewell, Ixopo, Natal, was burnt down in March 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters, allegedly because her son was an active ANC supporter.

name: Albert Mandlenkosi Zuma
description: Was stabbed to death by IFP supporters who attacked his home in KwaNxamalala, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 25 September 1990. Mr Zuma lived in an ANC stronghold. His neighbour was also killed in the attack.

name: Amos Zuma
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Richmond, Natal, was burnt down in April 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Anna Zuma
description: An ANC member whose house in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, was petrol bombed by IFP supporters in 1990.

name: Batsakile Zuma
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when ANC supporters attacked her home in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal on 10 July 1993. Seven occupants, including family members and neighbours who had taken shelter at the house because it was fenced, were killed, and three were injured.

name: Bheki Zuma
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and shot dead by IFP supporters in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 20 April 1991.

name: Bongani Petros Zuma
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters after an IFP rally in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, on 14 April 1991.

name: Busisiwe Catherine Zuma
description: She had her house burnt down when IFP supporters attacked homes in an ANC stronghold in KwaNxamalala, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 25 September 1990. Ms Zuma’s son and a neighbour were stabbed and shot to death in the attack.

name: Christopher Zuma
description: Was stabbed and injured by IFP supporters who attacked the home of his uncle, an ANC supporter, in Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 February 1991. Three family members were killed in the attack.

name: Collin Sqiro Zuma
description: Was injured by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 3 October 1992. One SDU member was granted amnesty (AC/1998/090). See self defence units (SDU).

name: Eric Zuma
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by alleged IFP supporters at Trust Feeds, New Hanover, near Pietermaritzburg, on 20 June 1991.

name: Jacob Maxwell Mthokozisi Zuma
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and fatally wounded in the head by IFP supporters in Howick, Natal, on 11 January 1991.

name: Jeremiah Zuma
description: An ANC supporter who was killed when SACP supporters threw a hand grenade into his home in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 15 March 1994 in the course of a serious internal feud within the local branch of the ANC-SACP alliance.

name: Makholwa Elliot Zuma
description: An ANC supporter whose house in KwaMnyandu, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, was burnt down on 28 March 1990, in the Seven Day War.

name: Maria Nontombi Zuma
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured, allegedly by ANC supporters, in Katlehong, Transvaal, in 1993. Ms Zuma miscarried three months into her pregnancy as a result of the shooting.

name: Mbha Zuma
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when ANC supporters attacked her home in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993. Seven occupants, family members and neighbours who had taken shelter at the house because it was fenced were killed and three injured..

name: Mduduzi Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was severely beaten by IFP supporters in Smero, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 7 October 1992, while trying to escape from his burning house during political violence.

name: Ndabazakhe Zuma
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Gomane, near Impendle, Natal, on 15 April 1994, a fortnight before the April 1994 elections. He was allegedly trying to prevent the perpetrators from abducting his grandson, an ANC supporter.

name: Ndabazakhe Zuma
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Gomane, near Impendle, Natal, on 15 April 1994, a fortnight before the April 1994 elections. He was allegedly trying to prevent the perpetrators from abducting his grandson, an ANC supporter.

name: Ngezeleni Gertrude Zuma
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Nomakhowe Norah Zuma
description: Was shot and injured, and had her house petrol bombed, by IFP supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 7 November 1991. Ms Zuma believed the attack to be an attempt to force her exiled son, an ANC supporter, to return home.

name: Nongilandi Gugu Zuma
description: Was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in an attack on a home of ANC supporters at Ngwelezana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 31 May 1991. Two other family members were killed in the attack, and one was critically injured.

name: Nontethelelo Zuma
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993 during continuing political conflict in the area.

name: Nosihle Viola Zuma
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ntombikayise Gladys Zuma
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Gezubuso, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, in July 1991. One person was injured and eight houses were set alight when IFP supporters launched an attack on ANC supporters in the area

name: Senzo Zuma
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mpophomeni, KwaZulu, near Howick, Natal, on 9 August 1991, shortly after a peace meeting had been held.

name: Siboniso Zuma
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters at Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 10 July 1993 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Sifiso Phillip Zuma
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 24 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sifiso Phillip Zuma
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 24 March 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembani Doris Zuma
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaNxamalala, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, during 1990.

name: Thembekile Annatoria Zuma
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Pietermaritzburg was burnt down by named IFP supporters on 4 January 1994.

name: Tshelubani Zuma
description: Was shot dead by unidentified persons in KwaMakhutha, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 22 December 1990, allegedly because he was staying in a councillor’s house. The house was also set alight in the attack, which occurred during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Andretta Lilly Zungu
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 3 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Andretta Lilly Zungu
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 3 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Angeline Nokuzola Zungu
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Nokweja, Ixopo, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters in July 1993. One of her sons was shot and killed, and another was shot and injured in the attack.

name: Boy Zungu
description: An ANC supporter who lost his home at Mzimhlope Hostel, Soweto, Johannesburg, in an attack by IFP supporters on 19 August 1990. IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers tried to remove all political opponents from their hostel during intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Cynthia Ntombifuthi Zungu
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Molokohlo, near Verulam, Natal, was looted and vandalised by IFP supporters in March 1993.

name: Dankie Makhosonke Zungu
description: Was shot dead in Empangeni, Natal, on 3 June 1993 during continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. The family home was burnt down on the same day.

name: Dumisani Ernest Zungu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in KwaDlangezwa, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 September 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Evens Zikhauleni Zungu
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed and then shot dead by ANC supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, on 22 December 1993.

name: Lucky Nhlanhla Zungu
description: Was shot dead in Empangeni, Natal, on 25 September 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Totoli Xaba
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death and his house set alight by named perpetrators in Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 29 November 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thanduxolo Patrick Zondo
description: A member of an ANC-aligned self-defence unit who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Pioneer Park, near Orlando East, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 26 July 1993 while trying to save people trapped in a burning shack. Many hostel-dwellers who refused to become IFP members sought refuge in nearby informal settlements but they retained their cultural and political links with the IFP which resulted in conflict within these settlements.

name: Walter Dumisani Xaba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by members of the KwaZulu police at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 12 February 1990. Eight people were killed during a march to celebrate Nelson Mandela’s release from prison.

name: Erick Yawa
description: Was shot dead by named IFP supporters while attending a night vigil in Alexandra, Johannesburg, on 26 March 1991. Fifteen people died in the attack which followed conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Jerome Zibane
description: An ANC supporter who was targeted for elimination by IFP members at Hlanganani Hall, Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, during 1992. One perpetrator in the conspiracy was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0332).

name: Stanley Manqolonke Yawa
description: An ANC supporter who was assaulted and stabbed by named perpetrators in Pimville, Soweto, Johannesburg, in August 1990. Hostel-dwellers were coerced into IFP membership when it launched itself as a political party in 1990. As a result, conflict between residents and hostel-dwellers increasingly overlapped political affiliation with ethnic identity.

name: Mtukabongwa Sikhendle Zungu
description: Was shot dead in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area during 1993.

name: Jomo John Zibane
description: His property was destroyed in an arson attack in Empangeni, Natal, on 9 February 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Harriet Nomonde Xabanisa
description: An ANC supporter who was hacked and stabbed to death by IFP supporters from the Nancefield hostel in Pimville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 15 September 1993.

name: Ngitholiwe Zungu
description: Her home in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, was destroyed on 15 March 1991 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. She and her husband were forced to flee the area.

name: Elliot Zondi
description: An ANC councillor who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Maqongqo, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg, on 3 November 1991. Mr Zondi had been involved in the peace process to ease the ongoing political conflict. See councillors.

name: Nicholas Thamsanqa Boyi Zungu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters in Ixopo, Natal, in July 1993, allegedly because he resisted being taken to an IFP training camp.

name: Fanyana Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death when IFP supporters and Caprivi trainees carried out attacks on ANC supporters in Richmond, Natal, between 21 and 23 June 1991. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217). See Richmond attacks.

name: Hloniphizwe Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in KwaMancinza, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 7 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Hloniphizwe Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in KwaMancinza, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 7 April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Isaac Zondi
description: An alleged IFP supporter who was killed and pushed off a train by ANC members between Germiston and Kempton Park station, Transvaal, on 11 November 1993. The perpetrators shot at Mr Zondi and one other person, killing both. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the incident (AC/2001/086). See train violence.

name: Mamo Emily Zondi
description: An ANC supporter whose house in KwaNxamalala, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 1 September 1990.

name: Mangempi Zondi
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 15 August 1991.

name: Mbandeni Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was seriously injured on 8 March 1993 when the bus in which she was travelling was ambushed by armed IFP supporters at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg. Three men and a woman were killed and at least sixteen people were injured. The bus was taking eighty ANC supporters to attend the court appearance in Pietermaritzburg of three men implicated in an earlier ambush of a vehicle carrying IFP supporters on 5 March 1993.

name: Mbandeni Zondi
