description: An ANC supporter who was seriously injured on 8 March 1993 when the bus in which she was travelling was ambushed by armed IFP supporters at Swayimane, Table Mountain, near Pietermaritzburg. Three men and a woman were killed and at least sixteen people were injured. The bus was taking eighty ANC supporters to attend the court appearance in Pietermaritzburg of three men implicated in an earlier ambush of a vehicle carrying IFP supporters on 5 March 1993.

name: Menziwa Alson Voyi Zondi
description: His house at Impendle, near Bulwer, Natal, was burnt down by a named IFP supporter in mid-1992, because he was perceived to be an ANC supporter. At the time, IFP leaders were allegedly coercing community members to join the party or to leave the area. Those who refused had their homes burnt down.

name: Meyi Mayvis Zondi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Mhlophe Micho Zondi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in KwaMnyandu, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, in November 1990.

name: Mzikayifani Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and killed when IFP supporters attacked his home in Ixopo, Natal, on 6 March 1992.

name: Mzikayifani Amon Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Greytown, Natal, on 21 November 1992.

name: Ngiteni Eslina Zondi
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Smero, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 7 October 1992.

name: Nonhlanhla Girlie Zondi
description: Her home in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 21 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nonhlanhla Girlie Zondi
description: Her home in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 21 March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Patricia Zondi
description: An IFP supporter whose house in Ecabazini, Ixopo, Natal, was set alight by ANC supporters on 16 June 1993.

name: Phethile Zondi
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, in 1991.

name: Salathiel Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead and his body was mutilated by named IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 23 June 1991. See Richmond attacks.

name: Sibusiso Emmanuel Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 July 1992.

name: Sipho Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and hacked to death when a named IFP supporter and others attacked his home in Nhlalakahle, Greytown, Natal, on 25 June 1991. Mr Zondi’s brother was also killed and his home was burnt down during the attack.

name: Thembi Zondi
description: An IFP supporter who was beaten by a named fellow IFP supporter in Igobhogobho, near Bulwer, Natal, in 1992, allegedly because she was suspected of being an ANC supporter.

name: Thembisile Annacletta Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten by a named IFP supporter in Gezubuso, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, in 1990.

name: Tholakeke Beatrice Zondi
description: An IFP supporter whose house in Makhholweni, Ixopo, Natal, was burnt down by ANC members in July 1993.

name: Vusumuzi Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters on 4 February 1992 while he was visiting his aunt in Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, allegedly because he was thought to be an ANC supporter. Two other youths were killed in the attack.

name: Wellington Mandlenkosi Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who had his house and property destroyed by IFP supporters in Imbali, Pietermaritzburg, in 1992. Mr Zondi’s three sons had all been killed in the course of political conflict in Imbali in the preceeding three years.

name: Zithulele Reginald Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten and later shot dead by IFP supporters, some of whom are named, at Ezakheni, KwaZulu, near Ladysmith, Natal, on 20 February 1993.

name: Zithulele Sydney Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ntuzuma, near Durban, on 5 August 1992.

name: Mkheshe Cashina Zuma
description: An IFP supporter who escaped a shooting and petrol bomb attack on her house by ANC supporters at Inchanga, Natal, in August 1990.

name: Nan Zondo (No First Name Given)
description: Was shot and injured by unidentified persons at Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, when his neighbour’s house was attacked during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on 5 July 1992.

name: Abeuter Zondo
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by ANC supporters, in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 17 July 1990.

name: Bangifa Zondo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Ida Sizani Zondo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Kuntuza Killer Zondo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by Khumalo gang members, at a shebeen in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 13 December 1992. One other person was killed and another severely injured in this attack. The attack was apparently perpetrated in revenge for the shooting earlier that day at the same tavern of a Khumalo gang member, allegedly involved in rape and murder. See Khumalo gang.

name: Ntombiyecala Zondo
description: Her house in the Ntuze area, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, was petrol bombed on 9 October 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Nkosencane Phineas Zungu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks. See self defence units. (SDU)

name: Lungisile William Yebe
description: An ANC supporter who had his house in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, burnt down by IFP supporters on 10 July 1993. Three people were killed and several houses burnt down on this day in violent conflict between the ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions.

name: Nomsa Zungu
description: Her house at KwaKhoza, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, was burnt down in November 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Mzukisi William (Aka ‘Sicelo’) Yekani
description: Was shot and killed by a member of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Katlehong, Transvaal, in 1993 or 1994. Mr Yekani and the applicant lived in the same house. The applicant testified that he accidentally shot Mr Yekani through the door of their home, believing that it was members of the ISU knocking and kicking on the door. The SDU member was refused amnesty (AC/1999/0348).

name: Bokhethile Zibani
description: Her home at Mtunzini, Natal, was destroyed in an arson attack on 27 November 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Dingeni Zibani
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead at Mtunzini, Natal, on 25 April 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Phaphamile Buselaphi Zungu
description: His home in Lindelani, near KwaMashu, Durban, was destroyed in an arson attack in ongoing local conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1993.

name: Freedom Mkhombiseni Zibani
description: Was shot and injured in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in September 1993, during continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Muzikayise Zibani
description: His house was burnt down in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 23 April 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Prudence Mphiwe Zungu
description: An IFP supporter whose house in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, was vandalised and set alight by ANC supporters on 22 August 1993. The family fled the area in fear of their lives when their home was destroyed.

name: Qinisile Gabazile Zungu
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Muziwenkosi Zibani
description: Was shot dead in Empangeni, Natal, on 11 March 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thandekile Zibani
description: His house and possessions were set alight in Empangeni, Natal, on 27 April 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on the first day of the April 1994 elections.

name: Thandekile Zibani
description: His house and possessions were set alight in Empangeni, Natal, on 27 April 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters on the first day of the April 1994 elections.

name: Qondeni Zungu
description: Was killed in Phatheni, Richmond, Natal, on 18 June 1993, during intense political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Michael Zamokwakhe Zuke
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in U Section in Umlazi, Durban, in 1992, in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Several people died and several houses in the Umlazi and Zamani areas were destroyed during this period.

name: Sabani Jongo Zungu
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Thembani Zibani
description: Her house was burnt down in Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembani Zibani
description: Her house was burnt down in Sowanjane, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in March 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Priscilla Sibongile Zuke
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Congo Section of Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 13 May 1992.

name: Shayizandla Mfaniseni James Zungu
description: His was burnt down at Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area during 1992.

name: Thembinkosi Zibani
description: An IFP supporter whose house at Empangeni, Natal, was burnt down by a named ANC supporter on 18 February 1993.

name: Thuleleni Joseline Zungu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by Amasinyora vigilantes in Bhoboyi, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 5 November 1993. See Amasinyora.

name: Tude Minah Zibani
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Tude Minah Zibani
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Zibambile Zibani
description: Her house was lost in an arson attack in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 3 June 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Agnes Zulu
description: Her house was set alight by ANC supporters in Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in August 1992 during ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Albertine Zulu
description: Her house was burnt down in Ntuze, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in May 1991 in continuing political violence between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Alton Baba Kamiso Zulu
description: Was shot and injured at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 24 March 1994, by IFP supporters who accused him of being an ANC supporter.

name: Amon Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by a named IFP supporter in Mqolombeni, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 25 April 1991. A group of men arrived at his house and asked him to accompany them to an IFP self-defence training camp. Mr Zulu was found dead in an open field the following day. See self defence camps (SDU).

name: Amon Benoli Zulu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead at Mqolombeni Hill, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 26 May 1991, when ANC supporters attacked an IFP camp in the area.

name: Babo Joseph Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by IFP supporters in KwaZuba, Umkomaas, near Durban, on 16 March 1991.

name: Barent Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by members of the security forces in Mhluzi, Middelburg, Transvaal, on 18 July 1985. Mr Zulu was participating in a school boycott in protest against fellow ‘comrades’ being held by police at the time of the shooting.

name: Beatrice Zulu
description: Was shot dead on 9 May 1992 by ANC supporters in Tembisa, Transvaal, because her son was a member of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang. See Toaster gang.

name: Bheki Zulu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks. See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Bheki Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by a named IFP supporter in Sundumbili, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal, on 17 December 1993.

name: Bonakele Zulu
description: His house was burnt down in November 1993 when IFP supporters carried out several attacks on ANC supporters in the KwaKhoza and Nogobhoza areas, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal. One person was killed. More than forty five homes were burnt down, allegedly under the direction of the local IFP-supporting chief who wanted to drive ANC supporters out of the area.

name: Bongekile Vinah Zulu
description: She sustained injuries in an attack on her home by IFP supporters at Ulundi, KwaZulu/Natal, during 1993. Her husband, an ANC member who was the target of the attack, was killed. Her domestic employee was injured. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217).

name: Cebisile Sindisiwe Zulu
description: Her house was burnt down in November 1993 when IFP supporters carried out several attacks on ANC supporters in the KwaKhoza and Nogobhoza areas, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal. One person was killed. More than forty five homes were burnt down, allegedly under the direction of the local IFP-supporting chief who wanted to drive ANC supporters out of the area.

name: Celani Busisiwe Zulu
description: Her home was petrol bombed in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 7 August 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Her mother was severely beaten in the attack.

name: Clemencia Qondeni Zulu
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Ncalu, Ixopo, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 2 February 1993.

name: Dlokwakhe Zulu
description: Was injured when the family house in Ntuzuma, near Durban, was attacked on 3 October 1991 in ongoing local conflict between ANC and IFP supporters.

name: Dumazile Zulu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by ANC members, at Nyangwini, Port Shepstone, Natal, on 4 September 1992. See Nyangwini attack.

name: Dumisani Nyambisa Zulu
description: His home in KwaMfana, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, was burnt down in May 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Elias Zulu
description: His home was petrol bombed in Odondolo, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 7 November 1992 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Emeltrudis Sibongile Zulu
description: Her house at Umgababa, KwaZulu, near Durban, was burnt down by unidentified perpetrators on 6 September 1992, during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. Her husband was an ANC member.

name: Emma Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death when her house at Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, was set alight by IFP supporters on 1 June 1991. Her husband was also burnt to death in the incident.

name: Enock Nhlanhla Zulu
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Fano David Zulu
description: Was shot and injured by IFP supporters in KwaMashu, Durban, on 15 April 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Fikile Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 2 August 1992 when armed men wearing balaclavas attacked several homes in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Herbert Mkononzeni Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed to death by named IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 19 December 1992.

name: Herbert Nhlanhla Solomon Zulu
description: An ANC branch secretary who was shot dead on 29 February 1992 by named IFP supporters who ambushed him while he was driving in the Mahasheni area, near Estcourt, Natal.

name: Jabu Joyce Zulu
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Joyce Zulu
description: Her house was destroyed by IFP supporters in Alexandra, Johannesburg, in January 1991 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Julia Zulu
description: Her house was lost in an arson attack at Eshowe, Natal, on 23 March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Julia Zulu
description: Her house was lost in an arson attack at Eshowe, Natal, on 23 March 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Khumalo Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who died after being stabbed with cultural weapons and then shot by IFP supporters at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 10 May 1992.

name: Madaleni Agnes Zulu
description: Her house was burnt down by ANC supporters in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 12 February 1990 in political conflict in the area.

name: Mankankane Veronica Zulu
description: An ANC supporter whose six rondavels in Ixopo, Natal, were burnt down by IFP supporters in July 1993.

name: Maxwell Zulu
description: Was shot and injured by an IFP member during political conflict at Izingolweni, Port Shepsone, Natal, on 19 May 1991. An amnesty applicant testified that he shot Mr Zulu because he believed him to be an ANC supporter. He was granted amnesty (AC/1999/0339).

name: Mehlakazulu Zulu
description: An employee of Rand Water who was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) while he was a passenger in a taxi travelling past the informal settlement of Phola Park in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 26 February 1992. Four people died and eight were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack on the taxi (AC/1999/0225). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Mthembeni Christopher Zulu
description: Was shot dead by a named IFP supporter at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 24 March 1994, in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Zulu’s father was believed to be an ANC supporter.

name: Mthembeni Christopher Zulu
description: Was shot dead by a named IFP supporter at Port Shepstone, Natal, on 24 March 1994, in political conflict during the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Mr Zulu’s father was believed to be an ANC supporter.

name: Muzi Stephane Zulu
description: His house was burnt down in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Muzi Stephane Zulu
description: His house was burnt down in Nyanini, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in April 1994 in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nhlanhla Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 August 1992. See Esikhawini attacks.

name: Nkosinathi Clifford Zulu
description: Was shot dead in an attack on CONTRALESA Chief Molefe’s homestead at Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 7 November 1993. The attack was allegedly motivated by Molefe’s refusal to call up men in his area to defend the IFP. An IFP leader was implicated in the attack. Eleven ANC youths were killed and seven injured.

name: Nomadinyana Zulu
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Port Shepstone, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 5 May 1991. Political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people in April and May 1991, and rendered approximately two hundred people homeless.

name: Nomadinyana Zulu
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Port Shepstone, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 5 May 1991. Political violence in the area claimed the lives of at least thirty one people in April and May 1991, and rendered approximately two hundred people homeless.

name: Nomnyango Zulu
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP members in Gamalakhe, KwaZulu, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 April 1991.

name: Nomusa Mildred Zulu
description: Her house in Ixopo, Natal, was destroyed in an arson attack during ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in February 1992.

name: Nomusa Pia Zulu
description: Was stabbed and severely injured by unidentified attackers in Sinyabusi, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, in December 1992. Four months earlier, her house had been burnt down by IFP supporters in Dokodweni, KwaZulu, near Gingindlovu, Natal, allegedly because of her husband’s support for the ANC.

name: Nqamulile D Zulu
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down at Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, a week before the April 1994 elections. The homes of several ANC supporters had been burnt down earlier that day.

name: Nqamulile D Zulu
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down at Haladu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, a week before the April 1994 elections. The homes of several ANC supporters had been burnt down earlier that day.

name: Ntombikayise Zulu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 22 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombikayise Zulu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 22 March 1994, during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombo Zulu
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area in 1992.

name: Ntombo Ellen Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Port Shepstone, Natal, in May 1991.

name: Penuel Zulu
description: An employee of Rand Water who was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) while he was a passenger in a taxi travelling past the informal settlement of Phola Park in Tokoza, Transvaal on 26 February 1992. Four people died and eight were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack on the taxi (AC/1999/0225). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Peter Zulu
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in Tembisa, Transvaal, on 13 March 1993 because he was a member of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang. See Toaster gang.

name: Prince Cyril Bonginkosi Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed by IFP supporters in Durban on 15 February 1992.

name: Prince Petros Zulu
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in a targeted attack by IFP suppporters during political conflict at Ulundi, KwaZulu/Natal, during 1993. His wife and domestic employee were injured in the attack. One perpetrator was granted amnesty (AC/1999/217).

name: September Zikhathile Xego
description: An ANC supporter who was hit with an axe by migrant workers from the hostels in Nyanga, Cape Town, and later shot and injured by police during political conflict between Nyanga residents and hostel-dwellers in December 1976.

name: Bongani Zibula
description: An IFP supporter who was stabbed to death by a named ANC supporter in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 19 November 1992.

name: Vokotwaca Zungu
description: Was shot and injured and had her house burnt down on 5 April 1994 in Isithebe, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal. Nine deaths and seven injuries were recorded in the area that month due to local political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters before and during the April 1994 elections.

name: Vokotwaca Zungu
description: Was shot and injured and had her house burnt down on 5 April 1994 in Isithebe, KwaZulu, near Mandini, Natal. Nine deaths and seven injuries were recorded in the area that month due to local political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters before and during the April 1994 elections.

name: Dumisani Zibula
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Edendale, KwaZulu, near Pietermaritzburg, on 8 June 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Mr Zibula was attacked on his way home from a meeting.

name: Eric Xeketwana
description: A taxi owner whose home was attacked and damaged by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) on 27 October 1991 in New Crossroads, Cape Town. Mr Xeketwana survived the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for this incident (AC/1997/0030). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Yawuza Isaac Zungu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Mbabe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 20 May 1993.

name: Zini Zungu
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and at least one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Zwelakhe Zungu
description: His house in Ongoye, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, burnt down on 27 July 1992 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Beauty Busisiwe Zikalala
description: Her home was burnt down in Haludu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, in April 1994 in political violence between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Ms Zikalala fled the area.

name: Beauty Busisiwe Zikalala
description: Her home was burnt down in Haludu, Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, in April 1994 in political violence between ANC and IFP supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections. Ms Zikalala fled the area.

name: Nomhi Eleanor Xhalile
description: An ANC member whose shack was burnt down at Cradock, Cape, on 13 September 1992. Her son, who was also an ANC member, was burnt to death in the incident.

name: Bhekizazi Ernest Yengwa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters at his home in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 20 March 1994. The perpetrators had accused him of being an ANC sympathiser. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Phakokwakhe Fanweli Zikalala
description: An IFP supporter whose house and possessions were set alight by ANC supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, a week before the April 1994 elections.

name: Phakokwakhe Fanweli Zikalala
description: An IFP supporter whose house and possessions were set alight by ANC supporters in Nqutu, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, on 20 April 1994, a week before the April 1994 elections.

name: Wandile Xhalile
description: An ANC supporter who was burnt to death in an arson attack in Cradock, Cape, on 13 September 1992.

name: Felizwe Yengwa
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by fellow IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, in March 1994. Several days before the attack, the perpetrators had visited Yengwa at his home and accused him of harbouring an ANC supporter. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Aubrey Zwane
description: Was teargassed and shot dead in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 4 November 1992 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area. Both his parents, two siblings and a relative were killed in the attack.

name: Bhekizenso Bhekuyise Zwane
description: An IFP supporter whose house was burnt down by ANC supporters in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 19 December 1992.

name: Buti Petro Zwane
description: Was beaten by named perpetrators, allegedly IFP supporters, on 10 October 1993 in Katlehong, Transvaal, while returning from the funeral of an ANC supporter.

name: Dorothy Zwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 4 November 1992 during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. Her husband, three children and a young relative were killed in the attack.

name: Elijah Zwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, in May 1992. The family allege that Mr Zwane’s life support system was tampered with by a named perpetrator at Baragwanath hospital, Johannesburg, in May 1992 and he died as a result of this. Mr Zwane had been detained several times before his death.

name: Elijah Zwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot during conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in Soweto, Johannesburg, in May 1992. The family allege that Mr Zwane’s life support system was tampered with by a named perpetrator at Baragwanath hospital, Johannesburg, in May 1992 and he died as a result of this. Mr Zwane had been detained several times before his death.

name: Elphas Mbongeni Zwane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot by ANC supporters in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, and died in hospital on 5 October 1992. His mother’s home was burnt down in the same attack.

name: Getroed Margarettha Zwane
description: An ANC supporter who lost her house in an arson attack by members of the IFP-aligned Toaster gang in Tembisa, Transvaal, in June 1993.

name: Gun Solomon Zwane
description: His shop was looted and set alight by ANC supporters in Siyathemba, near Balfour, Transvaal, on 1 May 1986. This took place during a stayaway in the area held as a way to commemorate the date and to call for its declaration as a public holiday.

name: Johannes Zwane
description: Was teargassed and shot dead in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 11 November 1992 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters. His wife, three children and a young relative were killed in the attack.

name: Jwi Zwane
description: A leader of the Black Cats who was killed by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, in July 1991. Several other people were injured in the incident. Five SDU members were granted amnesty (AC/98/0121). See self defence units (SDU).

name: Khathazile Ivy Zwane
description: An IFP supporter whose house in Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, was burnt down by ANC supporters on 5 October 1992. Her son was shot and fatally wounded in the same attack.

name: Kutshwa Johanna Zwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot by IFP supporters in Daveyton, Transvaal, on 15 June 1992.

name: Mandlenkosi Zwane
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead, allegedly by ANC supporters, in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 16 August 1990.

name: Maureen Zwane
description: Was shot dead on 4 November 1992 in Sebokeng, Transvaal, during violence between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents. Both her parents, two siblings and a young relative were killed in the attack.

name: May Precious Zwane
description: An ANC supporter and member of the Wembezi Crisis Committee who was stabbed, beaten and had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Mahashini, near Estcourt, Natal, on 2 June 1992. The perpetrators tried to enter the hospital in which Ms Zwane was being treated, allegedly in order to kill her. She was then transferred to another hospital.

name: Ncheteka Stello Zwane
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters on 17 September 1990 in Vosloorus, Transvaal, during clashes between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents.

name: Ntombifikile Pretty Zwane
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 21 February 1991.

name: Obed Zwane
description: Was tear-gassed and shot dead in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 4 November 1992 during conflict between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents. Both his parents, two siblings and a young relative were killed in the attack.

name: Patrick Emmanuel Zwane
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Zola, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 27 February 1990 by members of the Rasta gang, a vigilante group allegedly opposed to the ANC. Mr Zwane was on his way home from an ANC meeting at the time.

name: Patrick Mandlakayise Zwane
description: Was shot dead by ANC supporters in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 3 April 1992, in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Philisiwe Elsie Zwane
description: Her home in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, was burnt down by a named ANC supporter on 25 February 1990 in intense political conflict following the unbanning of political organisations on 2 February. See Richmond Farm arson attacks.

name: Shadrack Zwane
description: An employee of Rand Water who was shot and injured by members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) while he was travelling in a taxi past the informal settlement of Phola Park in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 26 February 1992. Four people died and eight were injured. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack on the taxi (AC/1999/0225). See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Sibongile Esther Zwane
description: An ANC supporter who was allegedly shot by IFP supporters and members of the ISU in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 19 April 1994 in political conflict in the run-up to the first democratic election on 27 April 1994.

name: Sibongile Esther Zwane
description: An ANC supporter who was allegedly shot by IFP supporters and members of the ISU in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 19 April 1994 in political conflict in the run-up to the first democratic election on 27 April 1994.

name: Tony Bongani Zwane
description: Was stabbed to death by a named ANC supporter in Umlazi, Durban, on 24 February 1991, allegedly because he was suspected of being a state collaborator.

name: Willie Samuel Zwane
description: Was severely wounded when he was shot twice in the leg in Tembisa, Transvaal, on the 17 October 1993 by members of an IFP-aligned vigilante group during ongoing political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Zanele Zwane
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from Umlazi, Durban, by fellow ANC supporters in 1991, allegedly on suspicion of being a collaborator. She has not been seen since and is presumed dead.

name: Louis Zweni
description: Was shot dead in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 22 May 1993 by a group of armed attackers, allegedly IFP supporters, who came into his shop and fired at random, seriously injuring his sister and young cousin. Earlier that day nine people were killed and sixty nine injured in clashes between ANC supporters, IFP supporters and police. The violence erupted after a group of unidentified gunmen fired at Tokoza hostel during a march organised by the ANC to present a petition at the Alberton police station.

name: Aubrey Xhoba
description: Was stabbed and severely injured when named persons attacked and burnt down his family’s home at KwaMgodi, Impendle, Natal, on 5 December 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Five other members of the Xhoba family were severely injured in the attack, and one was killed.

name: Bhekumuzi Zikhali
description: Was shot dead in Empangeni, Natal, on 3 September 1993 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Bashintshile Xhoba
description: Was stabbed and severely injured when named persons attacked and burnt down her family’s home at KwaMgodi, Impendle, Natal, on 5 December 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Five other members of the Xhoba family were severely injured in the attack, and one was killed.

name: Daniel Simon Zikhali
description: Was shot dead by IFP supporters in Ratanda, near Heidelberg, Transvaal, on 3 December 1992 during conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Khiphekile Relieth Xhoba
description: Was severely injured when she was stabbed and shot in the arm by named persons who attacked and burnt down her family’s home at KwaMgodi, Impendle, Natal, on 5 December 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Five other members of the Xhoba family were severely injured in the attack, and one was killed.

name: Gugu Phyllis Yeni
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, was destroyed in an arson attack during intensifying conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area in June 1985.

name: Ncishiwe Alvia Xhoba
description: Was stabbed to death by named persons who attacked and burnt down her family’s home at KwaMgodi, Impendle, Natal, on 5 December 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Six members of the Xhoba family were severely injured in the attack.

name: Thabani Almon Yeni
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 12 December 1993.

name: Muzi Zikhali
description: Was shot and injured in KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 30 March 1992 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. He was shot while trying to help his brother, who had been shot in the same incident.

name: Sandile Zikhali
description: Was shot and injured in KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, on 30 March 1992 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. His brother was also shot and injured in the incident.

name: Maradebe Bellina Zikhundla
description: Her home in Port Shepstone, Natal, was destroyed in an arson attack by ANC supporters on 10 April 1991 in ongoing political conflict in the area.

name: Mfaniseni Zikode
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Mzweni Lungisani Zikode
description: Was stabbed and severely injured when the Zikode family home in Ixopo, Natal, was attacked by IFP supporters in September 1993 during ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. One family member was killed in the attack and two were injured.

name: Emmerenica Benzani Zima
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Umlazi, Durban, on 2 February 1992. See Ekuthuleni attacks.

name: Cyprian Zimande
description: An IFP member who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Richmond, Natal, in September 1992. His brother was shot and injured in the incident.

name: Bhekinkosi Godfrey Zimu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured by ANC supporters in Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 5 June 1991.

name: Mduduzi Zimu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 27 February 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Mduduzi Zimu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Murchison, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 27 February 1994, in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Phondo Nellie Zimu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and severely injured in Tokoza, Transvaal , on 2 December 1990. Ms Zimu was shot four times, allegedly by Zulu-speaking IFP supporters. Ms Zimu’s husband was shot dead and two of her tenants were shot and injured during this incident. Her house was also set alight and damaged. While Ms Zimu was in hospital her possessions were looted from her home. Ms Zimu suffered permanent damage to her hearing as a result of her injuries.

name: Thulane Petrus Zimu
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Esimbini, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban was burnt down by IFP supporters in 1991.

name: Vukani Rodgers Zimu
description: Was beaten and stabbed to death by IFP supporters in Pietermaritzburg on 12 November 1990 during intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Gwentu Zindela
description: An ANC supporter who was imprisoned for two weeks in 1960 and then transferred to Maseru, Lesotho, where he was detained for three years, during which time he was repeatedly assaulted for his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Janet Poni Zindela
description: An ANC supporter whose home and two rondavels at Port Shepstone, Natal, were burnt down by IFP supporters in 1991. Ms Zindela and her family were forced to flee the area.

name: Emmanuel Ziqubu
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in a drive-by shooting in Tokoza, Transvaal, on 13 June 1993, allegedly carried out by ANC supporters.

name: Ethel Thokozile Ziqubu
description: An ANC supporter who survived being shot and stabbed by named IFP supporters during an arson attack on her home in Bruntville, near Mooi River, Natal, on 3 December 1993. Four people died in the attack.

name: Nonhlanhla Linah Ziqubu
description: Her house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 4 January 1994 in continuing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Simphiwe Bhekani Ziqubu
description: Was shot dead when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Buyelem Florence Zitha
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Nkwezela, Bulwer, Natal, was burnt down by IFP supporters on 30 May 1993, allegedly because she helped her ANC-supporting relatives who were hiding in the area, and gave them food.

name: Fani Johannes Zitha
description: His house was burnt down at Enseleni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 18 July 1990 in intense conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Jujwa Alfred Zitha
description: His house was burnt down by ANC supporters, one of whom is named, in Nelspruit, Transvaal, in June 1986. He was accused of practising witchcraft.

name: Mbukeni Zitha
description: An IFP supporter who was shot and injured when members of an ANC self-defence unit (SDU) opened fire on IFP supporters on their way to a meeting at the Tokoza stadium on the East Rand, Transvaal, on 8 September 1991. Sixteen people were killed and ten were injured in the attack. One SDU member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/1999/00225). See Tokoza attacks. See self-defence units (SDU).

name: Israel Ziyaya
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead on 18 August 1988 in KwaNdengezi, Kwazulu, near Pinetown, Natal, in conflict between the Amavaravara and other ANC supporters. See Amavaravara.

name: Sendikho Zokufa
description: An ANC supporter who lost his home and vehicles in an arson attack by vigilantes associated with the local town councillors in January 1991 in Khayelitsha, Cape Town. At the time the ANC was campaigning against the councillors. See councillors.

name: Ensarah Ndabakazi Mamajola Zokwe
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down on 30 April 1990 in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal, by a group of men carrying traditional weapons and allegedly looking for ANC supporters. Nine homes were burnt in the area that day. At the time ANC supporters were also killed in an attempt to prevent the setting up of local ANC/ branches in the area.

name: Obett Makhwenkwe Zokwe
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and beaten to death by a named perpetrator who formed part of a group of men carrying traditional weapons and allegedly looking for ANC supporters on 30 April 1990 in Pholile, Matatiele, Natal. Nine homes were burnt in the area that day. At the time ANC supporters were also killed in an attempt to prevent the setting up of local ANC branches in the area.

name: Silberbeaver Sibhabhalala Zokwe
description: An ANC member who died from poisoning while in custody in Nqamakwe, Transkei, during 1964.

name: Mavis Lolo Zoleka
description: An ANC supporter who lost her home in an arson attack by IFP supporters in Swanieville, near Krugersdorp, Transvaal on 12 May 1991. About one hundred and fifteen shacks were set alight, twenty seven people were killed and twenty five vehicles were burnt in retaliation for the expulsion of IFP supporters from Swanieville. Twelve people were charged with crimes ranging from murder to arson but were acquitted due to lack of evidence.

name: Bernard Zo Zondi
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Mkhazeni, Umbumbulu, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 4 September 1992.

name: Bongi Mary-Jane Zondi
description: An ANC supporter whose home was burnt down by IFP supporters in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, in February 1992. One person was killed and seven homes were burnt down in Bhambayi that month.

name: Nonhlanhla Xhoba
description: Was assaulted and severely injured by named persons who attacked and burnt down her family’s home at KwaMgodi, Impendle, Natal, on 5 December 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Five other members of the Xhoba family were severely injured in the attack, and one was killed.

name: Maxwel Nick Yika
description: An ANC supporter who was beaten, stabbed and shot by IFP supporters before being thrown off a train near Dube station, Transvaal, on 13 June 1992. See train violence.

name: Sinqobile Xhoba
description: Was was shot and severely injured by named persons who attacked and burnt down her family’s home at KwaMgodi, Impendle, Natal, on 5 December 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Five other members of the Xhoba family were severely injured in the attack, and one was killed.

name: Winile Xhoba
description: Was shot and severely injured by named persons who attacked and burnt down her family’s home at KwaMgodi, Impendle, Natal, on 5 December 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area. Five other members of the Xhoba family were severely injured in the attack, and one was killed.

name: Qoshiwe Roselina Norah Yika
description: Her home was burnt down by unidentified perpetrators in Katlehong, Transvaal, in 1992. Her husband was shot dead outside his supermarket in a separate incident. Both incidents occurred at a time of heightened tension between IFP-supporting hostel-dwellers and ANC-supporting residents in the area.

name: Saule Zilelo Yika
description: Was abducted and then burnt to death by members of the IFP-aligned Khetisi Kheswa gang in Sebokeng, Transvaal, on 18 April 1992 during conflict in the area between IFP supporters from KwaMadala hostel and ANC- supporting residents. See Khetisi Kheswa gang.

name: Winnie Yimba
description: Was abducted, shot and injured by IFP supporters in Dobsonville, Soweto, Johannesburg, on 8 May 1994 while on her way back from a rally at the FNB stadium. The perpetrators allegedly accused her and a friend of being ANC supporters.

name: Joli Bonisile Zaca
description: An ANC supporter whose house at KwaMagoda, Richmond, Natal, was burnt down by alleged IFP supporters on 4 March 1991.

name: Mandla Bethwell Zaca
description: An ANC supporter who was stabbed and injured by named and other IFP supporters in Mooi River, Natal, in August 1992.

name: Mlothi Solomon Zaca
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on 29 August 1991 in Mooi River, Natal. The Zaca family had sought refuge at a local college because of political conflict between residents and hostel-dwellers in Bruntville, near Mooi River, but they were attacked at the college. His brother was also killed in the attack. Three other family members were shot and injured.

name: Muhle Elijah Zaca
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters on 29 August 1991 in Mooi River, Natal. The Zaca family had sought refuge at a local college because of political conflict between residents and hostel-dwellers in Bruntville, near Mooi River, but they were attacked at the college. His brother was also killed in the attack. Three other family members were shot and injured.

name: Nhlomla Zaca
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by IFP supporters at Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 25 March 1991.

name: Nozihlwele Nella Zaca
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by alleged IFP supporters at Esimozomeni, Richmond, Natal, during political conflict in 1990.

name: Ntombilezi Ireene Zaca
description: An ANC supporter who had her house burnt down by IFP supporters in Ndaleni, Richmond, Natal, on 15 March 1991.

name: Sonnyboy Ernest Zaca
description: An ANC supporter who was severely injured when he was stabbed and beaten by IFP supporters in Mooi River, Natal, in February 1991.

name: Gavu Mkhize Zadunge
description: An ANC member who was executed in Pretoria Central prison, Pretoria, in June 1960 for his involvement in the Pondoland revolt. See Pondoland revolt.

name: Dumisani Zakwe
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in Richards Bay, Natal, on 4 November 1992.

name: Ntombithini Patience Zakwe
description: An IFP supporter whose home in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, was petrol bombed by ANC supporters in March 1992. The attack occurred during conflict between residents of Richmond Farm, an IFP stronghold, and neighbouring KwaMashu, an ANC area.

name: Nan Zama Zwelakhe Albert Mgqashiyo
description: An ANC supporter whose house in Umkomaas, near Durban, was destroyed in an arson attack by IFP supporters in 1992.

name: Ivan Bhekizitha Zama
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters in Bhekulwandle, Amanzimtoti, near Durban, on 6 November 1992.

name: Lindiwe Ngabuza Zameko
description: An ANC member whose house at Umlazi, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters in January 1992.

name: Bongani Phinkingkani Zamisa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Estcourt, Natal, on 9 February 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Bongani Phinkingkani Zamisa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead in Estcourt, Natal, on 9 February 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters during the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ethel Busisiwe Zamisa
description: An IFP supporter who was shot dead by ANC supporters at Wembezi, KwaZulu, near Estcourt, Natal, on 4 September 1993.

name: Mandla Lucas Zamisa
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted from his home in Estcourt, Natal, by AmaButho members, and was found dead in the veld on 8 May 1992.

name: Mathiya Albert Zamisa
description: An ANC supporter whose home was damaged in an attack by IFP supporters at Folweni, KwaZulu, near Umlazi, Durban, on 13 August 1992.

name: Victor Dumisa Zamisa
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Vusi Nelson Zamisa
description: An ANC supporter whose house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Sonkombo, Ndwedwe, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 16 March 1994. See Sonkombo arson attacks.

name: Zandile Benedicta Zamisa
description: Her house in Emangwaneni, Bulwer, Natal, was burnt down by named IFP members on 1 December 1991 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Msongelwa Michael Zanelo
description: An ANC supporter who was shot several times when members of the IFP-aligned Black Cats attacked residents in Wesselton, Ermelo, Transvaal, on 10 August 1992. See Black Cats.

name: Hlohlo Zanqinqi
description: An IFP supporter whose home was burnt down by ANC supporters in Mpumalanga, KwaZulu, near Durban, on 12 December 1990.

name: Moses Mnyamezeli Zengetwa
description: His house and vehicle were destroyed by named ANC supporters at Cala, Transkei, on 19 November 1993, after he was accused of collaborating with the police.

name: Muzi Ximba
description: An ANC supporter who was killed in Richmond, Natal, on 20 March 1993 in continuing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Ndondile Ximba
description: Was shot dead in Pietermaritzburg on 20 August 1991 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Ntombhenhle Ximba
description: Was shot dead when an unidentified group attacked and burnt down her family home in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 March 1993, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. The family was perceived to be supporting the ANC.

name: Phala Rose Ximba
description: Her house was burnt down in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 2 March 1993, in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters. The family was perceived to be supporting the ANC. Her twenty nine year old daughter was shot dead in the same incident.

name: Sonny Mduduzeni Ximba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead by IFP supporters in KwaMbonambi, KwaZulu, near Richards Bay, Natal, on 12 July 1992.

name: Sphamandla Moses Ximba
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and injured by IFP supporters in Greytown, Natal, on 26 June 1991.

name: Cliffton Xolisile
description: Was shot dead in Bekkersdal, near Westonaria, Transvaal, in November 1990 during conflict between residents and residents in the ANC-aligned informal settlement.

name: Elizabeth Nano Xolo
description: Her home was burnt down by unidentified perpetrators at Nkothaneni, Port Shepstone, Natal, during ongoing conflict between local ANC and IFP supporters on 3 March 1994.

name: Landiwe Mambhele Xolo
description: An ANC supporter whose house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack at KwaXolo, near Ramsgate, Natal, during political conflict in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nyani Xolo
description: Was hacked to death with a panga at Thelawayeka Wa rd, Paddock, near Port Shepstone, Natal, on 26 October 1990, by an ANC member who believed that Mr Xolo was a gangster aiding the IFP. This was denied by Mr Xolo’s family. One ANC member was granted amnesty for the attack (AC/2000/103).

name: Tembisile Esther Makubheka Xolo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attck by IFP supporters in Ramsgate, Natal, on 10 April 1994, two weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Tembisile Esther Makubheka Xolo
description: An ANC supporter whose house was destroyed in an arson attck by IFP supporters in Ramsgate, Natal, on 10 April 1994, two weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Thembisile Sabaphi Xolo
description: An ANC supporter who was forced to leave her home in Mvutshini, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in May 1993, following sustained harassment and intimidation by IFP supporters in their attempt to drive ANC supporters from the area.

name: Thumani Eunice Mamdleko Xolo
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack by named IFP supporters in Alfred, near Port Shepstone, Natal, in August 1992.

name: Ntombizanele Princess Xongo
description: An ANC supporter who had her house in Bhambayi, near Kwa-Mashu, Durban, destroyed in an arson attack in April 1993 in ongoing political conflict between the ‘Red’ and ‘Green’ factions.

name: Agnes Xulu
description: Her house in Gezinsila, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, was burnt down in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in 1991.

name: Bella Xulu
description: Her home and possessions were set alight in an arson attack in Eshowe, Natal, in November 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Busisiwe Thombe Xulu
description: Her house was burnt down by IFP supporters in Mevamhlophe, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, in July 1993 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters.

name: Dingindawo Xulu
description: An alleged IFP supporter whose house in Mahlabatini, near Ulundi, KwaZulu/Natal, was destroyed by ANC supporters during a funeral vigil on 12 January 1990. Thirteen people died in the attack. One ANC supporter applied for amnesty, which was refused (AC/1999/0353). See Xulu vigil attack.

name: Dumisani Xulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot dead in Gezinsila, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal, on 1 May 1992. He was carrying an ANC flag in a Workers’ Day march when IFP supporters opened fire, killing him and injuring his brother and two others.

name: Gcinekile G Xulu
description: An ANC supporter whose home was destroyed in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, on 13 April 1991 in ongoing conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the area.

name: Halalisani Samuel Xulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and fatally injured by IFP supporters in Matshana, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 30 June 1991, allegedly because he was not known in the area and was wearing a jersey resembling the ANC flag. He died the following day.

name: Joel Msizi Xulu
description: An ANC supporter who was abducted by IFP supporters while on his way to work in Tongaat, Natal, on 5 December 1993.

name: Josephina Xulu
description: An IFP supporter who had three rondavels burnt down and the fourth looted at Mabhuyeni, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, on 25 and 26 December 1993 respectively. The attack was carried out by IFP supporters, allegedly because Ms Xulu’s grandchildren were ANC supporters. No one was injured in the attack, as the family had abandoned their home at night and were sleeping in the open because of the violence in the area.

name: Mbongeleni Xulu
description: Was shot and seriously injured by IFP supporters in Nhlabane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 May 1994, shortly after the April 1994 elections, because he was suspected of being an ANC supporter.

name: Mbongeleni Xulu
description: Was shot and seriously injured by IFP supporters in Nhlabane, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 6 May 1994, shortly after the April 1994 elections, because he was suspected of being an ANC supporter.

name: Mkhosi Lorraine Xulu
description: Her house was burnt down during November 1993 when IFP supporters carried out several attacks on ANC supporters in the KwaKhoza and Nogobhoza areas, KwaZulu, near Eshowe, Natal. One person was killed and over forty homes burnt down in these attacks, which were allegedly carried out under the direction of the local chief, an IFP supporter, who wanted to drive ANC supporters out of the area.

name: Muzi Thulani Xulu
description: Was shot and wounded when ANC security guards from the ANC headquarters at Shell House, Johannesburg, opened fire on a crowd of IFP marchers, on 28 March 1994. At least nine marchers were killed and around one hundred were injured. Ten ANC security guards were granted amnesty (AC/2000/142).

name: Nqobizwe Anderson Xulu
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, was set alight by IFP supporters on 28 February 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Nqobizwe Anderson Xulu
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, was set alight by IFP supporters on 28 February 1994 in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Ntombifikile Nora Xulu
description: Her home in Richmond Farm, near KwaMashu, Durban, was looted and burnt by ANC supporters in November 1990 in intense conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Sibongile Constance Thandeka Xulu
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack in Eshowe, Natal, on 2 April 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sibongile Constance Thandeka Xulu
description: Her home was destroyed in an arson attack in Eshowe, Natal, on 2 April 1994, in political conflict between IFP and ANC supporters in the run-up to the April 1994 elections.

name: Sipho Aubrey Xulu
description: An ANC supporter who was shot and fatally wounded in the chest by IFP supporters in Esikhawini, KwaZulu, near Empangeni, Natal, on 24 May 1992.

name: Thabani Percival Xulu
description: Was beaten and stabbed to death by a named ANC supporter at the Zamani informal settlement, Umlazi, Durban, on 7 December 1993, because he was perceived to be an IFP supporter.

name: Thandiwe Pretty Xulu
description: An ANC supporter whose home in Bhambayi, near KwaMashu, Durban, was burnt down by IFP supporters in February 1992.

name: Thengiswa Victoria Xulu
description: Her house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack in Inanda, near KwaMashu, Durban, during 1992 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Thokozani Xulu
description: His house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack in Empangeni, Natal, on 17 January 1994 in ongoing conflict between ANC and IFP supporters in the area.

name: Zulukabongi Meriga Xulu
description: An IFP supporter whose house at Mondlo, KwaZulu, near Vryheid, Natal, was burnt down by named perpetrators, allegedly ANC supporters, in July 1992.

name: Mandla Xuza
description: Was severely injured when he was stoned by a faction within the ANC-aligned Khutsong Youth Congress in Khutsong, Carletonville, Transvaal, on 16 December 1991. Mr Xuza was on his way to a meeting to discuss ANC structures in the area at the time of the attack. See Khutsong Youth Congress.

name: Bikiwe Yalo
description: An IFP supporter whose house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 April 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters three weeks before the April 1994 elections.

name: Bikiwe Yalo
description: An IFP supporter whose house and possessions were destroyed in an arson attack in Port Shepstone, Natal, on 7 April 1994, in political conflict between ANC and IFP supporters three weeks before the April 1994 elections.
